words: OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW

[Lorelai walks down the sidewalk. She passes a sign that says "Stars Hollow Founded 1779" and crosses the street. She goes into Luke's Diner. Inside, she takes off her coat and picks up an empty mug from a table, then walks up to the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please, Luke. Please, please, please.

speaker: LUKE
words: How many cups have you had this morning?

speaker: LORELAI
words: None.

speaker: LUKE
words: Plus...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Five, but yours is better.

speaker: LUKE
words: You have a problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I do.
[Luke fills her cup]

speaker: LUKE
words: Junkie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Angel. You've got wings, baby.
[The phone rings as Lorelai goes back to her table. Luke answers it.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Luke's. [pause] Yeah.
[A young guy seated at the counter turns and watches Lorelai sip her coffee, then gets up and approaches her.]

speaker: JOEY
words: You make that look really good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it is really good. It's the best coffee in town.

speaker: JOEY
words: Oh yeah? I'll have to get a cup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good plan.

speaker: JOEY
words: Yeah, I've never been here before. Just, uh, passing through on my way to Hartford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're a regular Jack Kerouac.

speaker: JOEY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: JOEY
words: Hey, you mind if I sit down?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you know what? Actually, I'm meeting someone so I. . .
[Joey sits down at her table]

speaker: JOEY
words: I'm Joey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: JOEY
words: What, you don't have a name?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I do have a name. I just, I'm really meeting someone, so. . .

speaker: JOEY
words: So I guess I should get going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So soon?

speaker: JOEY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just screwing with your mind, Joey. It's nice to meet you. Enjoy Hartford.

speaker: JOEY
words: Enjoy your coffee, mystery woman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. I like that.
[As Joey goes back to the counter, Rory walks in and sits across from Lorelai.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey. It's freezing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, what do you need? Hot tea, coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Lip gloss.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aha.
[Lorelai pulls a makeup bag out of her purse.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, and toasted marshmallow.

speaker: RORY
words: Anything in there not resembling a breakfast cereal?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.
[Lorelai pulls out another bag.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It has no smell but it changes colors with your mood.

speaker: RORY
words: God, RuPaul doesn't need this much makeup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you're crabby.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. I lost my Macy Gray CD and I need caffeine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I have your CD. [pulls the CD out of her purse]

speaker: RORY
words: Thief.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, and I will get you some coffee.
[Lorelai picks up another coffee cup and goes back to the counter. Luke gives her a look.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? It's not for me. It's for Rory, I swear.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're shameless.
[Behind Lorelai, Joey approaches Rory's table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, Officer Krupke. She's right at that table, right over there.
[Lorelai turns to point to Rory and sees Joey talking to her. Luke fills the coffee cup.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah. He's got quite a pair, this guy. [Lorelai takes the cup.] Thanks.
[Lorelai goes back to the table.]

speaker: JOEY
words: [to Rory] Yeah, I've never been through here before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you have, too.

speaker: JOEY
words: Oh, hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hi. You really like my table, don't you?

speaker: JOEY
words: I was just, uh. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Getting to know my daughter.

speaker: JOEY
words: Your. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Are you my new daddy?

speaker: JOEY
words: Wow. You do not look old enough to have a daughter. No, I mean it. And you do not look like a daughter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's possibly very sweet of you. Thanks.

speaker: JOEY
words: So. . .daughter. You know, I am traveling with a friend.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's sixteen.

speaker: JOEY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drive safe.
[Joey and his friend exit the diner.]
[opening credits]
CUT TO THE INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai walks into the lobby and hands a key to a bellboy.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, here you go.

speaker: BELLBOY
words: Thanks.
[Lorelai walks to the front desk, where Michel is on the phone and sorting mail]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn, Michel speaking. [pause] No, I'm sorry, we're completely booked. [pause] We have a wedding party here. [pause] No, there is really nothing I can do. [pause] Yes, I'm sure. [pause] Positive. [pause] No, I don't have to look ma'am, I -- [pause] Yes, of course I'll look.
[Michel puts the phone down, continues to sort the mail, then picks the phone back up.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, I'm sorry, we're completely booked.
[Drella pushes her harp through the crowded lobby.]

speaker: DRELLA
words: Oh, no, don't move. Just ignore the tiny woman pushing the 200-pound instrument around. No, this is good, I like this. After this I'll, uh, bench press a piano, huh? [Drella stops behind a woman bent over tying her shoe.] Oh, that's it, lady, tie your shoe now. Yeah, don't worry, I'll wait.
[Lorelai walks over to her]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, Drella, hi. I was just wondering, um, could you be, uh, nicer to the guests?

speaker: DRELLA
words: I'm sorry. Did you not want a harp player?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I did.

speaker: DRELLA
words: And did you not want a great harp player?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I did.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Okay. I am a great harp player, and this is my great harp, okay. So if you're looking for someone to just be nice to the guests, get a harmonica player, or maybe some guy who whistles through his nose. Okay? Capisce?
[Lorelai backs off and walks away. Drella goes back to pushing her harp into its place.]

speaker: DRELLA
words: Oh, that is a great spot for a table. Decorator's a genius.
[Lorelai walks back to the front desk where Michel is still on the phone]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Madame, you have no idea how desperately I'd like to help, but see, I'd have to build a room for you myself, and I am not a man who works with his hands, so the best I can do is suggest that you please, please try for another weekend. Any weekend. [pause] Ah, good, fine, the twenty-first. Hold on, I'll look. [Michel leafs through the reservation book] No, I'm sorry, we're completely booked. [Michel looks at the phone, as apparently the woman has hung up on him]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Has the plumber attended to room four yet?

speaker: MICHEL
words: He was here, he did nothing, it's a hundred dollars.
[Lorelai picks up the phone and dials a number.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Marco, Lorelai. Talk to me about room four. What was wrong with it?
[Rory comes in. Lorelai kisses her hello.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [on phone] Uh huh. I thought you replaced that already. [pause] Well, because you told me you did and I never forget anything, so this one's on you, right? [pause] Pleasure doing business with you. [hangs up]

speaker: MICHEL
words: What is your offspring doing?

speaker: RORY
words: I need stamps. Can I have these?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take them. What's with the muumuu? [gestures to Rory's baggy sweater.]

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm just saying, you couldn't find one made of metal in case anyone has X-ray eyes?

speaker: RORY
words: And now we say goodbye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, hey, have Michel look at your French paper before you go.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: That'd be great.

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Come on, Michel. I'll tell all the ladies what a stud you are.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Hm. I believe that memo has already been sent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [in a French accent] Oh, please, Michel. Pretty please with sucre on top. I will stop talking like this.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Leave it. I'll look at it if I get a chance.

speaker: RORY
words: It's due tomorrow. And pay special attention to the grammar.
[Rory leaves. Lorelai stares at Michel.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: I despise you.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory and Lane are walking to school. Lane puts a Woodstock '99 shirt on over the shirt she left home in.]

speaker: RORY
words: When are you going to let your parents know that you listen to the evil rock music? You're an American teenager, for God's sake.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory, if my parents still get upset over the obscene portion size of American food, I seriously doubt I'm gonna make any inroads with Eminem.
[The girls stop by a sign that says "Teen Hayride" so Lane can put on her jacket.]

speaker: LANE
words: [points to sign] I have to go to that.

speaker: RORY
words: The hayride? You're kidding.

speaker: LANE
words: My parents set me up with the son of a business associate. He's gonna be a doctor.

speaker: RORY
words: How old is he?

speaker: LANE
words: Sixteen.

speaker: RORY
words: So he's gonna be a doctor in a hundred years.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, my parents like to plan ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: God, you have to go to the hayride with him?

speaker: LANE
words: And his older brother.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, now you're kidding.

speaker: LANE
words: Koreans never joke about future doctors. So, I guess you're not going, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'm still fuzzy on what's fun about sitting in the cold for two hours with a bundle of sticks up your butt.

speaker: LANE
words: Don't expect me to clear it up for you.
[Lane and Rory have arrived at school. They walk inside as a guy standing on the steps watches them.]
CUT TO CLASSROOM

speaker: MRS. TRAISTER
words: For those of you who have not finished the final chapters of Huckleberry Finn you may use this time to do so. For those of you who have, you can start on your essay now. Whichever task you choose, do it silently.
[The girls around Rory pass a bottle of nail polish back and forth as Rory concentrates on writing in her notebook.]

speaker: GIRL #1
words: Maybe it's a love letter.

speaker: GIRL #2
words: Or her diary.

speaker: GIRL #3
words: Could be a slam book.
[Girl #4 peers over Rory's shoulder.]

speaker: GIRL #4
words: It's the assignment.
[The girls turn away, Rory smiles to herself.]
CUT TO THE INDEPENDENCE INN
[Drella is playing the harp. A woman stands nearby and listens.]

speaker: DRELLA
words: Nice, huh?

speaker: WOMAN
words: Beautiful.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Yeah, well, tell it to the tip jar.
[Lorelai and a bellboy are crossing the lobby.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take Mrs. Langworthy's bags up to 314. Make sure the drapes are closed and there's extra soap and she wants her pillow mints now.
[There's a crash from the kitchen. Lorelai rushes in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!
[Sookie is on the floor near the stove.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm okay, I'm okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What did you do now? [to Salvador] Oh, why aren't you watching her? No estabas cuidandola?

speaker: SALVADOR
words: Eh, no, she's this - bad food in the head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. [to Sookie] I need you to be more careful.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know, I'm sorry. Hey, I fixed the peach sauce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's blood, you're bleeding. Why are you bleeding?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, my stitches opened. I was using too much maple syrup. It strangled the fruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When did you get stitches?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Friday night. Radish roses.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, stop moving.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You gotta taste the sauce. You have to try it while it's still warm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Oh, Sookie, I need you to be more careful. I need there to be fewer accidents.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
[Sookie feeds Lorelai a spoonful of the sauce.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, dear God Almighty. That's incredible!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I want to put it on the waffles tomorrow morning for breakfast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want to take a bath in that sauce!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I will make more!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Someday when we open our own inn, diabetics will line up to eat this sauce.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Won't that be great?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. But the key to someday achieving that dream is for you to stay alive long enough so we can actually open an inn, you understand?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, I understand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. So, now, let's get you up and to the doctor, on three. One-two-three.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ow!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Stepped on my thumb. I'm fine. On three. Okay.
[Lorelai and Salvador help Sookie up.]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lane and Rory are walking home from school.]

speaker: LANE
words: Well, was it a good color at least?

speaker: RORY
words: It had sparkles in it.

speaker: LANE
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: And it smelled like bubble gum when it dried.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, well, there's no way Mark Twain can compete with that.
[Lane and Rory walk into Kim's Antiques.]

speaker: LANE
words: [calls] Mom, we're home. [to Rory] Did you hear something?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sure.

speaker: LANE
words: [calls] Mom? Are you here?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [from another room] We're open! Everything's half off!

speaker: RORY
words: We have contact.

speaker: LANE
words: [calls] Mom?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Mom?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane?
[Lane and Mrs. Kim call to each other as Lane and Rory walk around the cluttered store trying to follow the sound of Mrs. Kim's voice.]

speaker: LANE
words: Mom, where are you?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane, where are you?

speaker: LANE
words: Back here!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Over here!

speaker: RORY
words: I think she's that way.

speaker: LANE
words: Are we closer?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I'm by the table!

speaker: RORY
words: She's kidding, right?

speaker: LANE
words: Look, we'll meet you in the kitchen!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: The kitchen!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Who's that?

speaker: LANE
words: It's Rory, Mom.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, I can hear the disappointment from here.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, come on. Stop it.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, it sucks that after all these years your mom still hates me.

speaker: LANE
words: She doesn't hate you.

speaker: RORY
words: She hates my mother.

speaker: LANE
words: She doesn't trust unmarried women.

speaker: RORY
words: You're unmarried.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm hayriding with a future proctologist. I have potential.
[Lane and Rory wind their way through the antique furniture and come out in the kitchen where Mrs. Kim is waiting.]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Go upstairs. Tea is ready. I have muffins - no dairy, no sugar, no wheat. You have to soak them in tea to make them soft enough to bite but they're very healthy. So, how was school? None of the girls get pregnant, drop out?

speaker: LANE
words: Not that we know of.

speaker: RORY
words: Though come to think of it, Joanna Posner was glowing a little.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: Nothing, Mama. She's just kidding.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [very seriously] Boys don't like funny girls.

speaker: RORY
words: Noted.
[A bell rings, signaling that someone has just opened the shop door.]

speaker: MAN
words: [calls] Hello? Anybody here?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] We're here! We're coming! [to the girls] Have the muffins. Made from sprouted wheat. Only good 24 hours. [calls] Everything's half off!

speaker: MAN
words: [calls] Where are you?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] Over here!

speaker: MAN
words: [calls] Where?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] By the chair!

speaker: MAN
words: [calls] What chair?
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Sookie is chopping vegetables. Salvador pulls Sookie's hand away from the cutting board]

speaker: SALVADOR
words: Careful!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm okay. Peppers, peppers, peppers.

speaker: SALVADOR
words: Mike!
[As Sookie moves around the kitchen the other cooks move things out of her way and prevent disasters.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, hello little vegetables, come with me. I got it. Okay, where's my glaze.

speaker: SALVADOR
words: In the counter.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: On the counter. On, not in, not in the counter. Okay, good, all right. My sauce. Whoo, that's pretty good. Hello, a little bit of greens. Okay, okay. Hello, my little babies. You like that? A little bit of juice. Okay. You're very pretty. Okay.

speaker: SALVADOR
words: Mike, Mike!
[Mike helps Sookie reach an iron skillet; Lorelai rushes into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!
[Sookie turns around and lifts the hand with the skillet. She hits Salvador in the face with it and knocks him over. ]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh. It's here! It happened! She did it!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, I'm gonna need a little bit longer sentence.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Chilton school. Rory got in.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Look. [reads from a letter] "Dear Ms. Gilmore, We are happy to inform you that we have a vacancy at Chilton Preparatory starting immediately. Due to your daughter's excellent credentials and your enthusiastic pursuit of her enrollment" - I offered to do the principal to get her in - "we would be happy to accept her as soon as the first semester's tuition has been received."

speaker: SOOKIE
words: This is very exciting!
[They both giggle and hug]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is something burning?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: My bangs, earlier. Go on, go on, go on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is it. She can finally go to Harvard like she's always wanted and get the education that I never got and get to do all the things that I never got to do and then I can resent her for it and we can finally have a normal mother-daughter relationship.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, good.
[They giggle again. Rory walks in]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh!

speaker: RORY
words: You're happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you do something slutty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not that happy.
[Lorelai and Sookie giggle.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here. [hands Rory a gift bag.]

speaker: RORY
words: What's going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Open it.
[Rory pulls out a plaid skirt.]

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna be in a Britney Spears video?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're going to Chilton! Oh, sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did it, babe. You got in.

speaker: RORY
words: How did this happen? You didn't. . .with the principal, did you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, honey, that was a joke. They have an open spot. You're gonna start on Monday.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't believe this! Oh my God, I'm going to Chilton!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.
[Lorelai and Rory hug.]

speaker: RORY
words: Sookie, I'm going to Chilton!
[Sookie and Rory hug.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'll make cookies. Protestants love oatmeal.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to call Lane.
[Rory starts to leave then hugs Lorelai again.]

speaker: RORY
words: I love you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I love you.
[Rory leaves.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: My girl's going to Chilton

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. Rory's going to Chilton!
[As Lorelai leaves, Sookie starts a little dance and begins to sing.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Rory's going to Chilton! Rory's going to Chilton! Rory's going to Chilton!
[Sookie tosses a dish towel over her shoulder. It lands on the stove and catches fire. Salvador covers it with a lid.]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN LOBBY
[The phone is ringing, Michel is ignoring it.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, the phone.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Mmhmm. It rings.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can you answer it?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No. People are particularly stupid today. I can't talk to any more of them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know who's really nice to talk to? The people at the unemployment agency.
[Michel answers the phone.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn, Michel speaking. [pause] No, I'm sorry, we're completely booked.
[Lorelai opens an envelope and pulls out a letter. She reads it and gasps]
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai is walking around while on the phone.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm holding for Miss Bell. I've been trying to get a hold of her all day. [pause] Lorelai Gilmore. [pause] Hi! Oh, hi, hi. Yeah, uh, my daughter Rory has just been accepted - yay. [pause] Thank you, and, um, I got the invoice for your enrollment fee. Wow, that is a lot of zeros behind that five. [pause] Uh huh. Okay, well, I guess what I'm wondering is if you couldn't take, say, part of it now, just to get her going? [pause] Well, but she's supposed to start Monday. It just doesn't give me a lot of time to pull a bank job. [pause] Well, never mind, I was just kidding. [pause] No, a bank job is robbing a bank but -- [pause] Uh-huh. Oh, no. No, no, no. I don't want you to give up her space. I'll just -- I'll have to figure it out. [pause] Okay. No, thank you. It's been a real treat talking to you. [pause] Yeah. Bye-bye.
CUT TO LORELAI'S FRONT PORCH
[It's nighttime. Lorelai and Sookie are talking on the porch.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do I do? What do I do? What do I do?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You can have anything I own. My car! Sell my car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, sweetie, no one wants your car.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's something I haven't thought of, I know there is. There's something out there staring me right in the face. I just. . .I haven't seen it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You know, you might consider calling your par--

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But I don't think you have a --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You can at least go and --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, can I say one more thing? I think it's your only option.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, there are several chapters from a Stephen King novel I'd reenact before I'd resort to that option.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, dropped. Dropped.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Rory comes outside in her Chilton skirt, which is too big on her.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom? So what do you think?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [enthusiastically] Wow, it makes you look smart!

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, no more wine for you. Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You look like you were swallowed by a kilt.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, you can hem it. A little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh.

speaker: RORY
words: Only a little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Or I could hem it a lot.

speaker: RORY
words: No, you're not. I don't want it to be too short.
[They all walk inside.]

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe tomorrow's my last day at Stars Hollow High.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: Today I was so excited I dressed for gym.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding!

speaker: RORY
words: And I played volleyball.

speaker: LORELAI
words: With other people?

speaker: RORY
words: And I learned that all this time I was avoiding group sports?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Was very smart because I suck at them.
[Lorelai begins to pin up the skirt.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, yeah, you got that from me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Where's your paté?

speaker: LORELAI
words: At Zsa Zsa Gabor's house.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Right. I'm going to the store because you have nothing. You feel like duck?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, if it's made with chicken, absolutely.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'll be back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Sookie leaves.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. This will give you an idea. Go see how you like it.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. I love being a private school girl.
[Rory heads to her bedroom to check her skirt. Lorelai stares at pictures on the mantle.]
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai sits on the runner of her Jeep outside a large, imposing house]
[Cut to the door opening from the inside of the house. Lorelai is standing on the porch.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, my goodness, this is a surprise. Is it Easter already?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughs nervously] No, I just, uh, finished up my business class and I thought I would stop by.

speaker: EMILY
words: To see me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, isn't that nice. Come in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.
[She walks inside and they walk to the living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: The place looks great.

speaker: EMILY
words: It hasn't changed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, there you go. How are the girls at the bridge club?

speaker: EMILY
words: Old.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well...good.
[Emily and Lorelai take seats opposite each other.]

speaker: EMILY
words: You said you were taking a business class?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, mmhmm, yeah. I'm taking a business class at the college twice a week. I'm sure I told you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, if you're sure then you must have. [long silence] Would you like some tea?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I would love some coffee.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [calls from another room] Emily? I'm home.

speaker: EMILY
words: We're in here.
[Richard enters the room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What is it, Christmas already?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai was taking a business class at the college today and decided to drop in to see us.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What business class?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she told us about it, dear, remember?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, actually, I came here for a reason. Dad, would you mind sitting down for a minute?

speaker: RICHARD
words: You need money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a situation.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You need money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, will you just please let me get this out, okay? Um, Rory has been accepted to Chilton.

speaker: EMILY
words: Chilton? Oh, that's a wonderful school. It's only five minutes from here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right, it is. She can start as early as Monday. Um, the problem is that they want me to put down an enrollment fee plus the first semester's tuition, and I have to do that immediately or she loses her spot.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So, you need money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. But it's not for me, it's for Rory. And I fully intend to pay you back every cent. I don't ask for favors, you know that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, yes, we know.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'll get the checkbook.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. You have no idea. Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: On one condition.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [mumbles to herself] So close.

speaker: EMILY
words: Since we are now financially involved in your life, I want to be actively involved in your life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What does that mean, Mother?

speaker: EMILY
words: I want a weekly dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Friday nights, you and Rory will have dinner here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom...

speaker: EMILY
words: And you have to call us once a week to give us an update on her schooling and your life. That's it. That's the condition. If you agree, you'll come to dinner tomorrow night and leave here with a check. Otherwise, I'm sorry, we can't help you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't want her to know that I borrowed money from you. Can that just be between us?

speaker: EMILY
words: Does seven o'clock work for you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [with a forced smile] Perfect.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW HIGH
[Rory is cleaning out her locker with Lane.]

speaker: RORY
words: And we get to wear uniforms. No more having people check you out to see what jeans you're wearing 'cause everyone's dressed alike in boring clothes and just there to learn.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, there's academic-minded and then there's Amish.
[They start walking down the hallway. Rory is carrying a box full of books and papers.]

speaker: RORY
words: Funny.

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you! So I told my mom you're changing schools.

speaker: RORY
words: Was she thrilled?

speaker: LANE
words: The party's on Friday. I gotta go. I have to have a pre-hayride cup of tea with a future doctor. How do I look? Korean?

speaker: RORY
words: Spitting image.

speaker: LANE
words: Good. Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

[Lane leaves. Rory drops a book and some papers. As she bends down to pick them up, she turns and sees a guy standing right beside her. It's the same guy who watched her and Lane walk into the school a few days earlier.]

speaker: RORY
words: God! You're like Ruth Gordon just standing there with a tannis root. Make a noise.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rosemary's Baby.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, that's a great movie. You've got good taste. [silence] Are you moving?

speaker: RORY
words: No, just my books are.

speaker: DEAN
words: My family just moved here from Chicago.

speaker: RORY
words: Chicago. Windy. Oprah.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. Yeah, that's the place. I'm Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi. [silence] Oh, Rory. Me. That's -- that's me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, Lorelai technically.

speaker: DEAN
words: Lorelai. I like that.

speaker: RORY
words: It's my mother's name, too. She named me after herself. She was lying in the hospital thinking about how men name boys after themselves all the time, you know, so why couldn't women? She says her feminism just kind of took over. Though personally I think a lot of Demerol also went into that decision. I never talk this much.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I better go.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, sure.

speaker: DEAN
words: I have to go look for a job.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, good.
[Dean starts to leave.]

speaker: RORY
words: You should check with Miss Patty.

speaker: DEAN
words: [turns back] What?

speaker: RORY
words: About the job. You should check with Miss Patty. She teaches dance. She was actually on Broadway once.

speaker: DEAN
words: I. . .I don't really dance much.

speaker: RORY
words: No, no, she just kind of knows everything that's going on in town. She'll know if someone's looking.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, great. Uh, thanks. Hey, what are you doing now?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing...much. I should throw this away at some point.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, maybe you could show me where this Miss Patty's place is.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I guess so. I really don't have anything important to. . .let's go.
[They walk out of the school and down the street. Dean carries Rory's box of books for her.]

speaker: DEAN
words: So, have you lived here all your life?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. Well, pretty much. I was actually born in Hartford.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, that's not far.

speaker: RORY
words: Thirty minutes with no traffic.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: I timed it.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, then.
[They walk past the bakery]

speaker: RORY
words: So, do you like cake?

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: They make really good cakes here. They're very...round.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, I'll remember that.

speaker: RORY
words: Good. Make a note. You wouldn't want to forget where the round cakes are.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, how are you liking Moby Dick?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, it's really good.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it's my first Melville.

speaker: DEAN
words: Cool.

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, I know it's kind of cliché to pick Moby Dick as your first Melville but. . .hey, how did you know I was reading Moby Dick?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, well, I've been watching you.

speaker: RORY
words: Watching me?

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, not in a creepy, like, "I'm watching you" sort of way. I just -- I've noticed you.

speaker: RORY
words: Me?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: When?

speaker: DEAN
words: Every day. After school you come out and you sit under that tree there and you read. Last week it was Madame Bovary. This week it's Moby Dick.

speaker: RORY
words: But why would you --

speaker: DEAN
words: Because you're nice to look at, and because you've got unbelievable concentration.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Last Friday these two guys were tossing around a ball and one guy nailed the other right in the face. I mean, it was a mess, blood everywhere, the nurse came out, the place was in chaos, his girlfriend was all freaking out, and you just sat there and read. I mean, you never even looked up. I thought, "I have never seen anyone read so intensely before in my entire life. I have to meet that girl."

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I just didn't look up because I'm unbelievably self-centered.

speaker: DEAN
words: Maybe, but I doubt it.
[They smile at each other.]

speaker: RORY
words: So, did I ask if you like cake?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, you did.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. 'Cause they have really good cake back there.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Rory and Lorelai are sitting quietly at a table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you were late getting home tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I went to the library.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Oh, I forgot to tell you, we're having dinner with your grandparents tomorrow night.

speaker: RORY
words: We are?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmhmm.

speaker: RORY
words: But it's September.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: So what holiday's in September?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, it's not a holiday thing. It's just dinner, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, sorry.
[Luke brings their main courses to the table.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Red meat can kill you. Enjoy. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, I finished hemming your skirt today. [no answer] A grunt of acknowledgment might be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't understand why we're going to dinner tomorrow night. I mean, what if I had plans? You didn't even ask me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, if you had plans I would have known.

speaker: RORY
words: How?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you would have told me.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't tell you everything. I have my own things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, you have things.

speaker: RORY
words: That's right. I have things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I had dibs on being the bitch tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Just tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What the hell is wrong with you?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sure I want to go to Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: The timing is just really bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The timing is bad?

speaker: RORY
words: And the bus ride to and from Hartford, it's like thirty minutes each way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe what I'm hearing.

speaker: RORY
words: Plus, I don't think we should be spending that money right now. I mean, I know Chilton's got to be costing you a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you have no idea.

speaker: RORY
words: All of your money should be going toward buying an inn with Sookie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about college? What about Harvard?

speaker: RORY
words: We don't know that I can't get into Harvard if I stay where I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, enough. Enough of the crazy talk, okay? I appreciate your concern but I have this covered.

speaker: RORY
words: I still don't want to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have to get out of here.
[Lorelai stands up and starts to leave.]

speaker: RORY
words: We have to pay first.

[Lorelai drops some money on the table. They walk out of the diner and start walking down the street. The hayride wagon passes by them, with a glum Lane sandwiched between two Korean boys on the back. Miss Patty stands in the doorway of her dance studio watching over a class of little girls.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: One-two-three. One-two-three. One-two-three. It's a waltz, ladies. Susie, do you have to tinkle? Then uncross your legs, darling. [sees Rory] Oh, Rory, good. I think I found a job for your male friend.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What male friend?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: They need a stock boy at the supermarket. I already talked to Taylor Doose about him. You just send him around tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What male friend?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh ,he's very cute. You have good taste.
[Miss Patty turns back to her dance class.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Hands in the air, not in the nose.
[Rory starts walking quickly down the street, and Lorelai follows her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you're gonna have to walk faster than that. You're gonna have to turn into friggin' Flo Jo to get away from me.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Rory enters and slams the front door. Lorelai follows her inside.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is about a boy, of course. I can't believe I didn't see it. All this talk about money and bus rides. You got a thing going with a guy and you don't want to leave school.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going to bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I'm so dense. That should have been my first thought. After all, you're me.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Someone willing to throw important life experiences out the window to be with a guy. It sounds like me to me.

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So who is he?

speaker: RORY
words: There's no guy!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dark hair, romantic eyes? Looks a little dangerous?

speaker: RORY
words: This conversation is over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tattoos are good, too!

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want to change schools because of all the reasons I've already told you a thousand times. If you don't want to believe me, that's fine. Goodnight. [goes to her bedroom]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does he have a motorcycle? 'Cause if you're gonna throw your life away, he better have a motorcycle!
[Lorelai walks into Rory's bedroom]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I think that went pretty well, don't you?

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for the knock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, can we just start all over, okay? You tell me all about the guy and I promise not to let my head explode, huh? Rory, please talk to me. [silence] Okay, I'll talk. Don't get me wrong. Guys are great. I am a huge fan of guys. You don't get knocked up at sixteen being indifferent to guys. But, babe, guys are always going to be there. This school isn't. It's more important. It has to be more important.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going to sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory. You've always been the sensible one in this house, huh? I need you to remember that feeling now. You will kick your own butt later if you blow this.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it's my butt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good comeback.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome. Rory, come on.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want to talk about this. Could you please, please just leave me alone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, fine. We always had a democracy in this house. We never did anything unless we both agreed. But now I guess I'm going to have to play the mom card. You are going to Chilton whether you want to or not. Monday morning, you will be there, end of story.

speaker: RORY
words: We'll see.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we will.
[Lorelai slams the door on her way out. Rory turns on her CD player. Macy Gray's I Try plays. Lorelai goes to the living room and turns on the same song.]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[There is smoke coming out of the broken stove as some workers start to remove it. Sookie sits sadly at the counter.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I swear I don't know what happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not important.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I made that dish a hundred times. It never exploded.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please, forget it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, God, I killed a Viking. Oh, you should fire me, or make me pay the cost of a new stove out of my paycheck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, whatever you want.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can't afford a new stove! Those things are expensive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, please, I am begging you, pull yourself together, okay? I got no sleep last night and I think I put my contacts in backwards.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Rory's still mad at you, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I'm not so crazy about her either.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It was a fight. Mothers and daughters fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, we don't fight. We never fight.
[Michel walks in]

speaker: MICHEL
words: You told me to tell you when your daughter arrived. Well, she's here and she's sitting in my chair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Sookie] Hold on just a minute.
[Lorelai leaves]

speaker: MICHEL
words: And you are the one left standing. That is a funny, funny thing, no?
[In the lobby, Lorelai walks up to Rory at the front desk]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, no muumuu today. You know what's weird, I kind of miss it.

speaker: RORY
words: You left me a note to meet you here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I thought you might want to work a couple hours, make a little extra cash.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, you're not gonna give me the "Mommy Dearest" treatment forever, are ya?

speaker: RORY
words: You wanted me here, I'm here. Should I do something or what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, go home. Dinner's at seven. Be ready to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.
[Rory leaves. Michel walks over and sits in his chair.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Ah, my chair.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory stand on the front porch staring at the door]

speaker: RORY
words: So, do we go in or do we just stand here reenacting The Little Match Girl?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, look, I know you and me are having a thing here and I know you hate me but I need you to be civil, at least through dinner and then on the way home you can pull a Menendez. Deal?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.
[Lorelai rings the doorbell. Emily opens the door.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, you're right on time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah, no traffic at all.
[they walk inside]

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't tell you what a treat it is to have you girls here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, we're excited, too.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is that a collector's cup or can I throw it away for you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.
[Lorelai starts to toss her empty coffee cup into a nearby wastebasket.]

speaker: EMILY
words: In the kitchen, please. [to Rory] So, I want to hear all about Chilton.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I haven't actually started yet.
[As Rory and Emily walk away, Lorelai drops the cup into the wastebasket. Cut to the living room, where Richard is reading a newspaper. Rory and Emily walk in]

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, look who's here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory. You're tall.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, what's your height?

speaker: RICHARD
words: That's tall. She's tall.
[Lorelai enters]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, your daughter's tall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I know. It's freakish. We're thinking of having her studied at M.I.T.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah. [he returns to reading his paper.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Champagne, anyone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's fancy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, it's not every day that I have my girls here for dinner on a day the banks are open. A toast - to Rory entering Chilton and an exciting new phase in her life.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Here, here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Mmm. Well, let's sit everyone. This is just wonderful. An education is the most important thing in the world, next to family.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And pie. [silence] Joke, joke.

speaker: EMILY
words: Ah.
[There is a long silence. Richard hands Rory a section of the newspaper.]
CUT TO THE DINING ROOM
[Later that night, they're all sitting at the table eating dinner]

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, how do you like the lamb?

speaker: RORY
words: It's good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Too dry?

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's perfect.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Potatoes could use a little salt, though.

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: So, Grandpa, how's the insurance biz?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, people die, we pay. People crash cars, we pay. People lose a foot, we pay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, at least you have your new slogan.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And how are things at the motel?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The inn? They're great.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai's the executive manager now. Isn't that wonderful?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Speaking of which, Christopher called yesterday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Speaking of which? How is that a speaking of which?

speaker: RICHARD
words: He's doing very well in California. His Internet start-up goes public next month. This could mean big things for him. [to Rory] Very talented man, your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She knows.

speaker: RICHARD
words: He always was a smart one, that boy. [to Rory] You must take after him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Speaking of which, I'm gonna get a Coke. Or a knife.
[Lorelai storms out of the room. She goes into the kitchen and starts scrubbing a dish in the sink. The maid comes in and looks at her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, how are you doing?
[Back at the dinner table, Rory starts to get up.]

speaker: RORY
words: I think I'm gonna go talk to her -

speaker: EMILY
words: No, I'll go. You stay and keep your grandfather company.
[Emily enters the kitchen.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, come back to the table.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is this what it's gonna be like every Friday night? I come over and let the two of you attack me?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're being very dramatic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dramatic? Were you at that table just now?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, I was, and I think you took what your father said the wrong way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The wrong way? How could I have taken it the wrong way? What was open to interpretation?
[Richard and Rory are able to overhear Lorelai and Emily arguing.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Keep your voice down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mother. I can't take it anymore. Tonight just seems like a nightmare.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're dripping all over the floor.

speaker: LORLEAI
words: Why do you pounce on every single thing I say?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's absurd. You barely uttered a word all night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not true.

speaker: EMILY
words: You said pie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, come on.

speaker: EMILY
words: You did. All I heard you say was pie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why would he bring up Christopher? Was that really necessary?

speaker: EMILY
words: He likes Christopher.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Isn't that interesting? Because, as I remember, when Christopher got me pregnant, Dad didn't like him so much.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, well, please, you were sixteen. What were we supposed to do - throw you a party? We were disappointed. The two of you had such bright futures.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. And by not getting married we got to keep those bright futures.

speaker: EMILY
words: When you get pregnant, you get married. A child needs a mother and a father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Mom. Do you think that Christopher would have his own company right now if we'd gotten married? Do you think he would be anything at all?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, I do. Your father would have put him in the insurance business and you'd be living a lovely life right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He didn't want to be in the insurance business and I am living a lovely life right now.

speaker: EMILY
words: That's right, far away from us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, here we go.

speaker: EMILY
words: You took that girl and completely shut us out of your life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You wanted to control me.

speaker: EMILY
words: You were still a child.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I stopped being a child the minute the strip turned pink, okay? I had to figure out how to live. I found a good job.

speaker: EMILY
words: As a maid. With all your brains and talent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I worked my way up. I run the place now. I built a life on my own with no help from anyone.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, and think of where you would have been if you'd accepted a little help, hmm? And where Rory would have been. But no, you were always too proud to accept anything from anyone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I wasn't too proud to come here to you two begging for money for my kid's school, was I?
[Rory overhears this]

speaker: EMILY
words: No, you certainly weren't. But you're too proud to let her know where you got it from, aren't you? Well, fine, you have your precious pride and I have my weekly dinners. Isn't that nice? We both win.
[Back at the table, Richard is asleep in his chair.]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Rory walk out of the house. Lorelai sighs and leans against the outside wall.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm okay. I just. . .do I look shorter? 'Cause I feel shorter.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, how 'bout I buy you a cup of coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. You drive, though, okay, 'cause I don't think my feet will reach the pedals.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory walk toward Luke's Diner]

speaker: RORY
words: So, nice dinner at the grandparents' house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, her dishes have never been cleaner.

speaker: RORY
words: You and Grandma seemed to have a nice talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How much did you hear?

speaker: RORY
words: Not much. You know, snippets.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Snippets?

speaker: RORY
words: Little snippets.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So basically everything?

speaker: RORY
words: Basically, yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, the best laid plans.
[They walk into the diner and sit at a table]

speaker: RORY
words: I think it was really brave of you to ask them for money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I so do not want to talk about it.

speaker: RORY
words: How many meals is it gonna take 'til we're off the hook?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think the deli spread at my funeral will be the last one. Hey, wait, does that mean…

speaker: RORY
words: Can't let a perfectly good plaid skirt go to waste.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, you won't be sorry.
[Luke walks up to the table dressed in a button-down shirt]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you look nice. Really nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: I had a meeting earlier at the bank. They like collars. You look nice, too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had a flagellation to go to.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, what'll you have?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coffee, in a vat.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll have coffee also. And chili fries.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's quite a refined palate you got there.
[Luke walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Behold the healing powers of a bath. So, tell me about the guy.

speaker: RORY
words: You know what's really special about our relationship? The total understanding about the need for one's privacy. I mean, you really understand boundaries.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So tell me about the guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is he dreamy?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that's so Nick at Night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm gonna find out anyway.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? How?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll spy.
[Luke returns with their order]

speaker: LUKE
words: Coffee. . .fries. I can't stand it. This is so unhealthy. Rory, please, put down that cup of coffee. You do not want to grow up to be like your mom.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, too late.
[Rory and Lorelai smile at each other. Luke walks away.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So tell me about the guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Check, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, really, are you embarrassed to bring him home?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not embarrassed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does he talk at all?

speaker: RORY
words: No, Mom, he's a mime.
THE END
OPEN AT LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting on the front porch. Lorelai is painting Rory's toenails. Rory squirts some whipped cream into her mouth.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sarcastically] That's nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't move, please.

speaker: RORY
words: So, why are you insisting on doing this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, because you're starting private school tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, but I'm going to be wearing shoes. Nobody's gonna see my feet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, but everybody knows that private school girls are bad, and bad girls always wear red nail polish.
[There is a lull in the conversation.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you nervous?

speaker: RORY
words: About what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: About starting Chilton.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I wasn't until I heard about all those bad girls.
[Lane runs up waving a CD.]

speaker: LANE
words: Guys, guys! New CD - XTC, Apple Venus Volume 2.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, woo, nails done!
[Lorelai and Lane run toward the front door.]

speaker: RORY
words: But you only finished half my toes!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who cares? You're gonna be wearing shoes anyway!
[Rory follows them into the house]
CUT TO LORELAI'S BEDROOM
[Lorelai is asleep in bed. Rory, dressed in her Chilton uniform, opens the door to the room and sees that she's still sleeping.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: [wakes up startled] What? God! Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Having a heart attack.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [grabs the pillow back] Stop it! It's a quarter to six.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's not!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it is! I set the clock for a quarter to six so it's. . .
[Rory grabs the clock and shows her the time.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: 10! Dammit.
[Lorelai climbs out of bed and looks around for her robe]

speaker: RORY
words: I can't be late on my first day of school. Do you know what happens to people when they're late on their first day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's shorter?

speaker: RORY
words: For the rest of the year, they're labeled 'The late girl'.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so dramatic. Where's the bathroom?
[Rory takes her by the shoulders and leads her down the hall.]

speaker: RORY
words: We have to go! What if there's traffic? Mom!
[Lorelai goes into the bathroom and shuts the door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, I had this all planned, you know. I was gonna get up early. I was gonna get coffee. I was gonna take a shower. I was gonna pick up my clothes from the dry cleaners.
[Lorelai opens the door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God. My clothes.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't have any clean clothes.
[Lorelai walks back to her bedroom. Rory follows.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: All my nice things were dirty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, I was gonna wear my blue suit with the flippy skirt. I look so great in the flippy skirt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you know what, time lady? Why don't you go downstairs and warm up the car? That would be really super. Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: Just hurry!
[Rory goes downstairs, Lorelai rummages through a drawer.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This sucks! This sucks! This sucks!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, for the love of God! [she sits on the bed and puts on her socks. She glances at her fuzzy clock] This is the last time I buy anything just because it's furry.
CUT TO LORELAI'S LIVING ROOM
[Rory is waiting at the foot of the stairs. Lorelai runs down the steps in cowboy boots, really short frayed shorts, and a bright pink tie-dyed T-shirt.]

speaker: RORY
words: It's 7--

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't even think of finishing that sentence! [sees Rory looking at her outfit] What?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing. I just didn't know the rodeo was in town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, that's it. [grabs a picture from the desk] I'm bringing the baby pictures.

speaker: RORY
words: No! I'm sorry! I love the rodeo, the rodeo rules!
CUT TO INSIDE THE JEEP
[Lorelai and Rory are driving through the town square]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am so done with plans. I am never ever making one again. It never works. I spend the day obsessing over why it didn't work and what I could've done differently. I'm analyzing all my shortcomings when all I really need to be doing is vowing to never ever make a plan ever again, which I'm doing now. Having, once again, been the innocent victim of my own stupid plans. God, I need some coffee.
[cut to the Jeep driving down the highway toward Hartford]

speaker: Note - The speech in this scene was cut from the audio after the original airing and can still be seen but not heard.
words: Note - The speech in this scene was cut from the audio after the original airing and can still be seen but not heard.
CUT TO OUTSIDE OF CHILTON
[Lorelai and Rory sit in the Jeep staring at the school]

speaker: RORY
words: I remember it being smaller.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. And less. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Off with their heads.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. [tilts her head and peers up at the building]

speaker: RORY
words: What are you looking at?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just trying to see if there's a hunchback up in that bell tower.

speaker: RORY
words: So, how do I look?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [smiles proudly] You look great.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really. You are an amazing kid. You have earned this. You just go in there and show them what smart really is. I love you. Just call me if you need me.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Call me if you need anything. I'm great at making up dirty cheers.

speaker: RORY
words: You have to go in with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, come on.

speaker: RORY
words: You have to meet the headmaster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, look at me, Rory. I can't meet anybody who does anything in there.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I look like that chick from the Dukes of Hazzard.

speaker: RORY
words: This is my first day. You are not getting out of going in there with me. Period.
[They get out of the Jeep. Two women walking by stop and stare at Lorelai's outfit]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good morning.
[The women share a look, then walk away.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Rory] Oh, well, we're gonna be best friends.
[Lorelai pulls on her coat as they walk toward the school]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, where do we go?
[Rory checks a piece of paper]

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, the Ambroise building.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is?

speaker: RORY
words: The big, scary one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, great. Thanks for the input.
[A man notices that they look confused]

speaker: IAN
words: Lost?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. Uh, we're looking for the headmaster's office, the Ambroise building.

speaker: IAN
words: Ah, okay. Well, this is it right here. You just go inside, down the stairs, make a left, and the headmaster's office is at the end of the hall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great. Thank you.

speaker: IAN
words: You're welcome.
[Rory grabs Lorelai's arm to go, but the man extends a hand.]

speaker: IAN
words: Um, I'm Ian Jack. My daughter Julia goes to school here.
[Lorelai shakes his hand]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. I'm Lorelai Gilmore. Um, this is my daughter, Rory.

speaker: IAN
words: Your daughter? Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yup.

speaker: IAN
words: Wow, that's great. Uh, I mean, daughters are a great thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're big fans.

speaker: IAN
words: Yeah. Uh, yeah. So, is your husband here? I'd love to meet him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not married.

speaker: IAN
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'd love to meet your wife, though.

speaker: IAN
words: I'm divorced.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shame.

speaker: IAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me. I really gotta. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right! We gotta go meet the big guy, and I gotta, uh, get back to work.
[Lorelai and Rory start to walk away]

speaker: IAN
words: Oh, where do you work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [walks back to him] At an inn. The Independence Inn. I run it.

speaker: IAN
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In a different outfit, of course.

speaker: IAN
words: [laughs] Well, it was nice to meet you, Lorelai. Good luck in school, Rory. I'll tell Julia to look out for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Great, thanks.

speaker: IAN
words: See you.
[He walks away. Lorelai stares after him, smiling to herself]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What a nice, nice man.

speaker: RORY
words: You're feeling pretty good about yourself right now, aren't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want me to get you a mirror?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [her smile fades] I'm back. Let's go.
CUT TO INSIDE OF CHILTON
[Lorelai and Rory walk into the Ambroise building]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good, more big stuff.
[They walk down a staircase]

speaker: RORY
words: Turn left.
[As Rory and Lorelai walk off the screen, three girls on the staircase stare after them.]
[Lorelai and Rory walk down a hallway toward the headmaster's office. They reach the double doors and stand in front of them]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You ready?

speaker: RORY
words: No.
[pause]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You ready?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.
[They push open the doors and walk into the room. They walk up to the secretary working at a desk]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [clears throat] Um, excuse me.
[the secretary suddenly looks up, Lorelai jumps back slightly]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! How. . .wow, hi. I'm Lorelai Gilmore. This is my daughter, Lorelai Gilmore. . .'cause I named her after me. I was in the hospital all whacked out on Demerol. Never mind. Um, but we call her Rory. It's short for Lorelai, but she'll answer to either one, or even 'Hey, you' depending on the. . . [Rory nudges her] Uh, is the headmaster here?

speaker: SECRETARY
words: [stands up] One moment. [Walks through a door behind them]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] See, that's what happens when you go to bed with your makeup on.
[A moment later, the door opens]

speaker: SECRETARY
words: Headmaster Charleston will see you now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great, great. Thanks.
[They walk into the headmaster's office]

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Ms. Gilmore, I'm Headmaster Charleston.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. Wow, it's really nice to meet. . .[looks around and sees her mother on the sofa] Mom. Um, excuse me. What are you doing here?

speaker: EMILY
words: [walks over] I came to wish my granddaughter luck on her first day of school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But -

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, you look wonderful in that uniform!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you didn't have to come all the way out here, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, this gave me a chance to make sure that Hanlin here takes good care of Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Headmaster] You're Hanlin.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Hanlin Charleston.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hanlin's wife and I are on the symphony fundraising committee together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, that's great.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Your father and I are golf rivals. We're still fighting it out to see which one is worse.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, yes. We're all old friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, there's nothing like friends. Especially if they're old. . .ones.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Well, would you like to take off your coat and have a seat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no. No, I'm fine.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I'm afraid they were a little overzealous with the furnace this morning. It's quite warm in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like it warm.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, take off your coat and sit down. You don't want Hanlin to think you're rude.
[Lorelai reluctantly takes off her coat. She gives an embarrassed smile about her outfit]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Laundry day.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hanlin, did you know that Rory has a 4.0 grade average?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sure he does, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is a very special girl. You take good care of her.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: We'll do our best, Emily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, God. Rory is not gonna be a problem. She's totally low maintenance, you know, like a Honda. You know, they're just easy, just. . . nice office.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I don't think we should take up anymore of your precious time. Hanlin, it was lovely to see you. Give Bitty our love.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Tell Richard I'll see him at the club Sunday.

speaker: EMILY
words: Have a wonderful day, Rory. I want to hear all about it. [to Lorelai] Do you need a ride or is your horse parked outside?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to headmaster] It's so nice to meet you. [to Rory] Have a great day. [she kisses Rory's forehead, then starts to leave]

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Oh, you don't want to forget your coat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [turns back] Oh, no, 'cause that would be embarrassing.
[She retrieves the coat, then walks out of the office.]
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Lorelai and Emily are walking down the hall.]

speaker: EMILY
words: How do you leave the house looking like that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was not planned, believe me.

speaker: EMILY
words: And on Rory's first day of school. What kind of an impression did you think you were gonna make?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] What are you doing here, Mother?

speaker: EMILY
words: I told you, I came to put in a good word for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she didn't need a good word.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not allowed here, is that it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't say that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm allowed to pay for it, but I can't actually set foot on the premises. I just want to get the rules straight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh boy.

speaker: EMILY
words: How about the street? Can I drive down the street?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forget it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe I should just avoid this neighborhood altogether. Though my doctor's just down the block. Maybe I can get special permission if I'm bleeding from the head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. I was just surprised to see you here.

speaker: EMILY
words: I just thought it was important for this school to know they had a Gilmore amongst them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A very good thought.

speaker: EMILY
words: And that some of the Gilmores actually own clothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And on that note, I have to get to work. I'll see you later.

speaker: EMILY
words: Dinner, Friday night. No spurs, please.
[Lorelai groans and thrusts out her arms in annoyance as she walks to the Jeep.]
CUT TO HEADMASTER'S OFFICE
[The headmaster and Rory are sitting in his office. He is looking through her transcript folder.]

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You're obviously a bright girl, Miss. Gilmore.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Good grades, the teachers like you. Not a lot of social activities, though.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, just living in Stars Hollow is kind of a social activity, actually.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Nothing in your school appealed to you?

speaker: RORY
words: I work at my mother's inn after school sometimes. And I was in the German Club for a while, but there were only three of us, and then two left for the French Club after seeing Schindler's List, so. . .

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: What are your aspirations?

speaker: RORY
words: I want to go to Harvard and study Journalism and Political Science.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: On your way to being. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Christiane Amanpour.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Not Cokie Roberts?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Not Oprah, Rosie, or one of the women from The View?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Why do you wish to be Christiane Amanpour?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I don't wish to be her, exactly. I just want to do what she does.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Which is?

speaker: RORY
words: Travel, uh, see the world up close, report on what's really going on, be apart of something big.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: And to be part of something big you have to be on TV? Why not lead the police on a high-speed chase? That's a quicker way to achieve this goal.

speaker: RORY
words: Being on TV has nothing to do with it. Maybe I'll be a journalist and write books or articles about what I see. I just want to be sure that I see. . .something. [he glances down at her papers] You'll notice the debating team's also missing from my resume.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I've known your grandparents for quite some time.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: In fact, I was at a party at their house just last week where I had the most delicious lobster puffs I've ever eaten. I'm very fond of them.

speaker: RORY
words: That's nice.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: None of this, however, will be of any benefit to you. Chilton has one of the highest academic standards of any school in America. You may have been the smartest girl at Stars Hollow, but this is a different place. The pressures are greater, the rules are stricter, and the expectations are higher. If you make it through, you will have received one of the finest educations one can get, and there should be no reason why you should not achieve all your goals. However, since you are starting late and are not used to this highly competitive atmosphere, there is a good chance you will fail. That is fine. Failure is a part of life, but not a part of Chilton. Understand?

speaker: RORY
words: So, you liked the lobster puffs, huh?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Take this to Miss James in the administration office across the hall.
[He hands her a folder. She takes it and leaves the room]
CUT TO THE ADMINISTRATION OFFICE
[Rory walks up to a woman at the desk and sets down her folder]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, I'm looking for Miss James.

speaker: MISS JAMES
words: Name?

speaker: RORY
words: Lorelai Gilmore. But I go by Rory.

speaker: MISS JAMES
words: Fill this out, please.

[Miss James gives Rory a piece of paper. She takes Rory's folder and walks it over to another desk. The student at the desk looks around, then takes the folder and passes it out the window to someone.]
CUT TO OUTSIDE THE WINDOW
[The three girls who were on the staircase earlier are sitting in the bushes. They go through Rory's folder.]

speaker: LOUISE
words: Well?

speaker: PARIS
words: Shut up.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hurry, please. Spiders.

speaker: PARIS
words: Lorelai Gilmore.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Nice stripper name.

speaker: PARIS
words: Formerly of Stars Hollow High School.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Where's that?

speaker: PARIS
words: Drive west, make a left at the haystacks and follow the cows.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ooh, a dixie chick.

speaker: PARIS
words: Perfect attendance, 4.0 grade point average.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Bugs, dirt, twigs.

speaker: PARIS
words: She's a Journalism major.

speaker: LOUISE
words: That means she's gonna go out for the school paper.

speaker: PARIS
words: Not necessarily. She's got like a thousand recommendations in here.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Popular with the adults and going out for the school paper.

speaker: PARIS
words: Would you stop? You don't know she's going out for the paper.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Ow, something's biting me!

speaker: PARIS
words: Quiet down.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I hate nature.

speaker: PARIS
words: She'll never catch up. She's a month behind already.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You can tutor her. Be like a big sister.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're funny.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Okay, lizard, goodbye.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why are they letting all these extra people in? They just take up space and screw up the curve. We don't need any new kids here.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Too late.

speaker: PARIS
words: Psst. [she hands the folder back through the window.]
CUT TO ADMINISTRATION OFFICE
[Miss James is handing some papers to Rory.]

speaker: MISS JAMES
words: Here's the dining room, the science hall, and the theater. Here's your locker number, here's your schedule, take this map. Here's the rules of the school and the Chilton Honor Code. Here are the words to the school song, which must be recited upon demand. This can happen any place, any time. If you do it in Latin you get extra credit. Do you have any questions?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, not at the moment.

speaker: MISS JAMES
words: If you do, you can make an appointment to see your guidance counselor, Mr. Winters. He handles everything but bulimia and pregnancy. For that, you'll have to go to the nurse or Coach Rubens. Welcome to Chilton.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai walks into Luke's Diner and sits down at the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] I already had the longest day of my life and, oh, look, it's only ten. How nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's no coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not funny.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can give you herbal tea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is not an herbal tea morning. This is a coffee morning.

speaker: LUKE
words: Every morning for you is a coffee morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is a jumbo coffee morning. I need coffee in an IV.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can give you tea and a Balance bar.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please, please, please tell me you're kidding.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm kidding. [goes to retrieve the coffee pot.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're sick.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're a sadist, you're a fiend!
[he walks back over with the coffee pot]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're pretty.

speaker: LUKE
words: For here or to go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To go, please.

speaker: LUKE
words: You wanna know what this stuff does to your central nervous system?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, do you have a chart? 'Cause I love charts.

speaker: LUKE
words: Forget it, kill yourself. So what happened this morning that was so awful?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory started Chilton.

speaker: LUKE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. [sees him looking at her strangely] What?

speaker: LUKE
words: That's how you dress to take Rory to Chilton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but -

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, that's a fancy school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My clothes were at the cleaners, and I had the fuzzy clock and it didn't purr on time.

speaker: LUKE
words: It didn't purr?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's fuzzy. It purrs. You know what, never mind. I gotta go. I had a plan, damn it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Me, too. Next time you're getting tea.
[Lorelai leaves]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Miss Patty is standing at the doorway of her dance studio. Inside, several little girls are twirling batons]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Visualize, ladies. It's a Thanksgiving Day parade. You're standing on Fifth Avenue. There's a hundred beautiful boys marching in place behind you. And there you are. You are out in front with your fabulous legs and your perfect tush. Your baton is on fire and the crowd goes nuts! Okay, cookie time. [sees Lorelai walking by] Lorelai, hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Isn't today Rory's first day at Chilton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, she's there right now. I just got through dropping her off.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Is that what you wore?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look at the time. See ya, Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Bye.
[Lorelai gets in her Jeep. Miss Patty walks back into the studio.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, ladies, what do I see? Naked girls. No, no, keep those leotards on. This is not Brazil.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE

[Lorelai pulls into the driveway. She gets out of the car and walks into the house juggling her coffee, her dry cleaning and her coat. The phone is ringing, she searches for the cordless. She finally finds it and falls onto the couch.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, good. I'm going shopping this afternoon and I'd thought I'd pick up a few things for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, you know, a couple of extra skirts and tops for school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmkay, I already took care of all that, Mom. I got her two skirts and a bunch of tops.

speaker: EMILY
words: But there are five days in a school week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Are you sure? Because my days of the week underwear only go to Thursday.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is that a joke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, two skirts are fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: I never know with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really, don't bother.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, what if she gets one dirty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then, she'll wear the other one.

speaker: EMILY
words: What if she gets them both dirty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then we'll use this newfangled thing called a washing machine. The town just chipped in and bought one. My turn's Tuesday.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, then, what about socks? Chilton has these special logo socks. Rory should have them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: And what about the school sweater? She might like that. And there's the sweater vest and the bookbag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you getting a cut of the merchandising?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory should have these things. She'll be the only one who doesn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She'll live.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I'm at least getting her the Chilton coat. Is she a size six?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is a simple question, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's a six, but I'd get an eight in case she grows.

speaker: EMILY
words: If she grows, I'll buy another.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well then, a six is great. I gotta go, Mom. Bye.
CUT TO CHILTON CLASSROOM
[A teacher is lecturing a class]

speaker: TEACHER
words: And while French culture was the dominant outside cultural influence, especially for Russia's monied class, English culture also had its impact. Tolstoy's favorite author, for instance, was. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: [raises her hand] Dickens.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Yes. And of course, last week we discovered Dostoevski's main authorial influences. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: [raises her hand] George Sand and Balzac.

speaker: TEACHER
