words: Good. As Tolstoy commenced writing both War and Peace and Anna Karenina, Count Leo would turn to. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: David Copperfield.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Correct. He would turn to David Copperfield for inspiration.
[the door opens and a student walks in]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Ah, Mr. Dugray.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Sir. [hands the teacher a note]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Nice to have you back. I hope your Grandfather's better.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Much better, sir.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Good. Take your seat, please.
[TRISTIN walks over to his seat while staring at Rory. She shifts uncomfortably]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Great Expectations, A Tale of Two Cities, Little Dorrit, all major influences on Leo Tolstoy. Tomorrow we will focus on. . .

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [whispers to kid in front of him] Who's that?

speaker: STUDENT
words: New girl.

speaker: TEACHER
words: . . .writing styles of these two literary masters, Tolstoy and Dickens. [bell rings] Class dismissed.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [to his friend] Looks like we got ourselves a Mary.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Miss, um, Gilmore, could you come up here please? [Rory walks up to him] Here are last week's study materials. [he hands her a huge binder] There'll be a test on them tomorrow, but since you're new, you can take a makeup on Monday. Will that be sufficient time?

speaker: RORY
words: Monday? Sure, that's fine.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Good. That's just an overview. It would be very helpful to you to borrow one of the other student's personal notes. They tend to be more detailed.

speaker: RORY
words: More detailed than this?

speaker: TEACHER
words: It seems daunting right now, I know.

speaker: RORY
words: No, no. It's okay. It'll be fine.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Remember to get those notes. They'll be a lifesaver.
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Rory walks out of the classroom and almost bumps into a girl]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't see you there. Where'd you come from?

speaker: PARIS
words: I know who you are, too. Lorelai Gilmore from Stars Hollow.

speaker: RORY
words: You can call me Rory.

speaker: PARIS
words: Are you going out for the Franklin?

speaker: RORY
words: The what?

speaker: PARIS
words: Nice innocent act. At least I know you're not going out for drama club.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm confused.

speaker: PARIS
words: The Franklin, the school paper, are you going out for it?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know, I have to find my locker first.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm gonna be editor next year.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, good for you.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm also the top of the class, and I intend to be valedictorian when I graduate.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I'm going now.

speaker: PARIS
words: You'll never catch up. You'll never beat me. This school is my domain and the Franklin is my domain. And don't you ever forget that. [she walks off]

speaker: RORY
words: Guess you're not gonna let me borrow your notes, huh?
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Sookie is going through a crate of peaches while Jackson the produce man looks on]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: They're smaller than the last batch.

speaker: JACKSON
words: No, they're not.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Smaller means watery. No good peach taste.

speaker: JACKSON
words: No, there's plenty of peach taste being as they're, you know, peaches.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What about the ones on the bottom?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, great. No, be sure to check 'em all. That's it. Give every last one of them a nice good squeeze. You wouldn't wanna actually leave me one that I could sell somebody else. Oh, wait a minute, you missed one. Now I'm not gonna tell you which one it is. I'm just gonna let your impeccably good radar. . .[she pulls out a peach] There it is! You got it!
[Lorelai walks into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. . .I look great, right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, see. This is how I was supposed to look this morning. Good morning, Jackson.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God, today was Rory's first day!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and I was supposed to look together and fabulous, and not like I'd been up all night playing quarters.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, nobody cares how you looked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Everybody cared.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, the other moms, the headmaster, my mom, Luke, Miss Patty, the new fire chief with the tiny little head.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [holds out a peach] Taste this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [bites peach] Hm, a little watery.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, now, you planned this!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Did you say something about your mother?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. I walked into the headmaster's office and there she was.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really? Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because she knew I'd wake up late and dress like a cowgirl and humiliate myself.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow, she's good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The best.
[Sookie rolls a peach along the floor.]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, I would love to know what you're doing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: They're rolling differently, too.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, because of the extra water.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Exactly.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Makes perfect sense.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I would ignore those women because the only thing that matters is that Rory got into that great school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. She looked so amazing in her uniform, and she was so excited. And I just admire her so much jumping into a new school. She's my hero.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mine, too.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, yeah, sign me up. Sookie, the peaches, please.
[Michel walks in]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Excuse me. There's a phone call for you, and if I'm to fetch you like a dog, I'd like a cookie and a raise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Jackson] Thanks for the peach. [hands the peach to him, then walks away]
[Cut to the lobby; a few older women are looking at a guide book as Lorelai and Michel walk by]

speaker: WOMAN
words: This will be absolutely wonderful. There are supposed to be darling shops all up and down this street. [to Michel] Oh, excuse me sir. Can you tell me where we can find the best antiques?

speaker: MICHEL
words: At your house, I'd guess. [walks off]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [on phone at the front desk] Mom, did I give you this number, 'cause I don't remember giving you this number. Yeah, well, I must be losing my mind. What can I, uh. . . I'm sorry Mom, can you hold on one second? [covers phone] Um, Drella, could you just, uh, take it down just a notch? Thanks. [on phone] Okay, I'm back.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wanted you to know that I just bought a parking space for Rory at Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You what?

speaker: EMILY
words: They are very hard to come by, but I pulled a few strings and it's all hers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, uh, Rory doesn't have a car.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, but she's got a birthday coming up soon.
[Drella is still playing loudly]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, hold on a second. [to Drella] Um, Drella? Drella! Please, a little softer.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Hey, do I look like I got Panasonic stamped on my ass?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [on phone] Mom, you are not buying Rory a car.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why not? She's a smart girl, she's responsible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she doesn't need one.

speaker: EMILY
words: She needs to have a way to get around, to get to school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She'll be taking the bus.

speaker: EMILY
words: I know. I hate that she takes the bus. Drug dealers take the bus.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what, Mom? I gotta go.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine. We'll discuss this at a later date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Bye. [hangs up]
[Drella plays much softer now that Lorelai is off the phone. They exchange a look.]
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory is walking down a hallway, TRISTIN comes up behind her.]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey, Mary. Hey, Mary.

speaker: RORY
words: Me?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, you.

speaker: RORY
words: My name is Rory.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I'm TRISTIN.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So, you're new?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, first day.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, Remmy's class is rough.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it seemed very intense.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know, I could loan you my notes if that would help.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? That'd be great.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah? How great?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Mr. Remmy said that getting someone's notes would be. . .

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I could even help you study if you want.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I kind of view studying as a solitary activity, but thanks.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Bye, Mary. [walks off]

speaker: RORY
words: It's Rory.
CUT TO THE INDEPENDENCE INN LOBBY
[Lorelai is talking to the valet and a guest]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I completely understand.

speaker: MAN
words: Oh, do you? Because this is a brand-new car.

speaker: DEREK
words: But I swear -

speaker: MAN
words: He brings the car up and it's scratched!

speaker: DEREK
words: I just backed the car up and then -

speaker: MAN
words: I'd know if my car was scratched before I parked it or not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, okay, let's - let's calm down. Sir, why don't I have your car looked at tomorrow, and I'm sure we can find a way to resolve this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: In the meantime, I would love for you to have lunch here, on me. Dessert is a must. Anything with our homemade ice cream is absolutely delicious. I promise you life as you know it will never be the same. What do you say?

speaker: MAN
words: Well, all right, I think I will. Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. [the man walks off]

speaker: DEREK
words: Lorelai, I swear, I didn't scratch his car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Derek. . .

speaker: DEREK
words: I mean, if you thought I was unreliable or a bad driver, I just. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay.

speaker: DEREK
words: 'Cause I can drive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, sweetie, I am sure you can. Listen, we'll just take it over to Musky's tomorrow and have the guys look at it. I'm sure they can buff it out for nothing, okay?

speaker: DEREK
words: Okay. That's a real nice outfit you're wearing today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you, Derek.
[Derek walks off, Michel walks over]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Once again, your faithful pooch is here to say, please come back to the desk, someone needs to talk with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not my mother, is it?

speaker: MICHEL
words: It's possible.
[Lorelai looks over at the front desk, where Ian Jack, the man from Chilton, is waiting]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's possible?

speaker: MICHEL
words: There's a resemblance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.
[Lorelai walks to the front desk]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: IAN
words: Hi. Is this a bad time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not at all. What are you doing here?

speaker: IAN
words: Well, I had to meet an associate for lunch and he was coming up from New York, so I thought, why not meet him at a beautiful inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good. Enjoy your lunch.

speaker: IAN
words: Thanks, I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: IAN
words: And I was also wondering if maybe I could take you out to dinner sometime.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're a little food-obsessed, aren't we?

speaker: IAN
words: Well, it's the company more than the food that interests me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm flattered.

speaker: IAN
words: Is that a yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a. . .you're a dad.

speaker: IAN
words: And you're a mom. Although I'm still finding that really hard to believe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean, you're a Chilton dad.

speaker: IAN
words: Ooh, that sounds bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not bad, just tricky. You know, Rory just started there, and I think I should let her fall in with the bad crowd before I start hooking up with the P.T.A.

speaker: IAN
words: Well, I'm not on the P.T.A.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, see, there you go, I can't date anybody not on the P.T.A.

speaker: IAN
words: Look, it's just a casual dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry. [she walks around to the other side of the desk]

speaker: IAN
words: Okay, I'll tell you what. I'm going to China for a week on business, and when I get back, I'm gonna try again

speaker: LORELAI
words: China, wow.

speaker: IAN
words: Impressed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Rome, I'd be impressed. China, I'm just "China, wow".

speaker: IAN
words: [laughs. he picks up a business card from the desk] Okay, Lorelai Gilmore, General Manager, I'll talk to you soon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have a safe trip.

speaker: IAN
words: I will. [walks off]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [watching him walk off] He does that so well.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You are making me sick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, now, honey, you try it. I'll watch you walk away, too.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Stop it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go on now, walk. It can't be that bad.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Leave me alone. [he walks away, she follows him]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, no. You have to do it with a little more attitude. Make me think you mean it!
[Several people are listening to Drella play the harp. She suddenly stops]

speaker: DRELLA
words: That's lunch. [she walks away, people look around surprised]
CUT TO CHILTON HALLWAY
[Rory finds her locker and tries to open it, but it's stuck]

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, but you're going to open.
[She pulls hard on the handle and the locker opens. She stumbles backwards right into Paris, who was carrying a large class project of an intricately sculpted castle. The project falls and breaks]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no! I am so sorry. Paris, please, I'm so sorry. It was an accident. My locker, it just slipped. I pulled too hard. I didn't mean to. . .is there water in that moat?

speaker: PARIS
words: Get away from me. [she stalks off into a classroom]
[Rory puts her book away in her locker]

speaker: RORY
words: [to boy walking by] Excuse me, I need Mrs. Ness, History?

speaker: BOY
words: It's behind you. [points to the classroom that Paris just walked into]

speaker: RORY
words: Of course it is. [she slams the locker shut and walks into the classroom]

speaker: PARIS
words: [sees Rory enter] Oh, you've got to be kidding me.
[the bell rings]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Seats now, please.
[Rory sits down in a seat, TRISTIN sits near her.]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey, Mary.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Okay, we left our projects off on Friday with Mr. Gaynor, so today we will pick up with Miss Gellar.

speaker: PARIS
words: [stands up] I don't have my project.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Miss Gellar, did you have sufficient time to complete your project?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: TEACHER
words: And yet you don't have it done?

speaker: PARIS
words: Nope.

speaker: TEACHER
words: All right, you will receive an incomplete for this project.

speaker: RORY
words: [stands up] It's my fault.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Who are you?

speaker: RORY
words: Rory Gilmore. I wrecked her project.

speaker: PARIS
words: Shut up.

speaker: TEACHER
words: I don't have a Rory Gilmore. I have a Lorelai Gilmore.

speaker: RORY
words: That's me.

speaker: TEACHER
words: You are Rory and Lorelai Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. And I wrecked her project. My locker got stuck.

speaker: PARIS
words: Just stay out of this.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Do you go by Rory or Lorelai?

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever. It's not her fault.

speaker: TEACHER
words: I need you to pick one.

speaker: RORY
words: One what?

speaker: TEACHER
words: One name.

speaker: RORY
words: Rory.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Fine, thank you. Rory, you wrecked Paris' project when?

speaker: RORY
words: Just before class.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Very convenient.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I did. My locker got stuck and when I opened it. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: Stop it!

speaker: TEACHER
words: Miss Gilmore, since you say you wrecked Miss Gellar's project, then you may help her fix it. You have until tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not?

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't want your help!

speaker: RORY
words: But I don't mind doing it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Just stay out of this.

speaker: RORY
words: What is wrong with you? I'm trying to help you.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, don't!

speaker: TEACHER
words: Ladies, enough. Miss Gellar, if you don't want Miss Gilmore's help, then you may have until tomorrow. If it's not done, you will receive an incomplete. Is that understood?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes. [sits down]

speaker: TEACHER
words: As long as you're standing. . .class, we have a new student. Say hello to Rory Gilmore.

speaker: CLASS
words: Hi, Rory.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hello, Mary.
[Rory sits down]
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Miss Patty is standing at the doorway of her dance studio. Inside, a class of girls walks around with books on their heads.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Now, walk smooth. That's the new Harry Potter on your heads. If they should drop, Harry will die, and there won't be anymore books. [sees Lorelai walking by] Now that's how you should've dressed this morning, Missy.
[Lorelai ignores her and walks to Luke's. As she enters, Luke is walking past the door]

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: See, now, that's why you were voted Mr. Personality of the New Millennium. Where's your crown?

speaker: LUKE
words: I just mean you don't usually come in at this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I have to pick up Rory from school. [Luke pours her some coffee] Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No lectures?

speaker: LUKE
words: My blood sugar's low. I'll eat an apple and get back to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. God, this has been one hectic, bizarro day for me.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. This morning with the being late, and my mother with her existing. Oh, and this father, this father from Chilton, he, uh, drove out to the inn all the way from Hartford just to ask me out.

speaker: LUKE
words: Really? You going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. He's got a kid in school with Rory, and the whole thing just seemed a little weird.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I think it's good that you turned him down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, he's probably old, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Old?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. I mean, he's got a kid in high school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so do I.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, but you were young when you had Rory. Most people aren't that young. Most people are, uh. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Old.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like this guy who asked me out.

speaker: LUKE
words: But you're not going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not going.
[Luke nods and looks down. Lorelai smiles to herself. Her cell phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's me.
[Luke points to the 'No Cell Phones' sign]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. [answers phone] Hello? Hi Babette. What? Okay. No. No, I'll be right there. Thanks. [hangs up] Um, I have to go. [pulls out her wallet]

speaker: LUKE
words: Keep it. I gave you decaf.
[she frowns and walks out the door]
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Babette and Morey, Lorelai's next door neighbors, are sitting in their front yard. Lorelai pulls up and gets out of her Jeep.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, Lorelai, I'm so sorry I had to call you like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's okay, Babette. I appreciate it.

speaker: BABETTE
words: All of a sudden, they pull up, get out of the truck, and start sniffing around. It's very strange.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, let me go talk to them.

speaker: MOREY
words: Tell her about the gnome, baby.

speaker: BABETTE
words: They kicked the gnome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Right in the head.

speaker: MOREY
words: That's just not cool.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm very sorry. Is the gnome okay?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, he's fine, sugar, thanks for asking. But I wouldn't trust these boys. Gnome kicking says a lot about a man's character.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, I'm gonna go take care of this. Thanks.
[She walks over to her house where two men are walking around on the porch]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Um, what are you doing?

speaker: MICK
words: You live here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I do.

speaker: MICK
words: I'm supposed to install a DSL for a Lorelai Gilmore. Is that you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, that's me.

speaker: MICK
words: I'm Mick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Mick, nice to meet you. Could you get off my porch?

speaker: MICK
words: I was told that you wouldn't be here, but to look for a ceramic frog with a key in it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't understand.

speaker: MICK
words: We can't find the frog.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't order a DSL.

speaker: MICK
words: [checks clipboard] Uh, the order was placed by an. . .Emily Gilmore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, no!

speaker: MICK
words: We would've been done by now, but the frog search has put us way behind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, look. . .
[the other man walks over]

speaker: MAN
words: Hey, Mick, I found it.

speaker: MICK
words: You found the frog?

speaker: MAN
words: It wasn't a frog, it was a turtle.

speaker: MICK
words: It says here it's a frog.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a turtle.

speaker: MICK
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Trust me. Listen Mick, I'm afraid I'm gonna have to cancel that DSL order.

speaker: MICK
words: You sure? It's already paid for.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I know, but, uh, we don't need a DSL, so thanks for coming, and, uh, you guys can just go.
[Lorelai walks back over to her Jeep]

speaker: BABETTE
words: Is there a problem?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, nothing Shakespeare couldn't turn into a really good play.
CUT TO CHILTON CLASSROOM
[Rory is sitting at her desk writing a note that says "Paris -- I am so sorry. Please let me help you." She passes the note to Paris, who crumples it up and throws it on the floor without reading it]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Let's try another passage. "The Romanists have, with great adroitness, drawn three walls round themselves, with which they have hitherto protected themselves, so that no one could reform them, whereby Christendom has fallen terribly." Who said this?

speaker: RORY
words: [sees Paris about to give the answer] Martin Luther.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Very good, Miss Gilmore. And what year did Martin Luther address the Christian nobility?

speaker: RORY
words: [again sees Paris lean forward to answer] 1520.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Very good, Miss Gilmore. [bell rings] Until next time, class.
[Paris walks up to Rory's desk]

speaker: PARIS
words: Stay out of my way. I will make this school a living hell for you. [leaves]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: See you tomorrow, Mary. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: The name is Rory.
CUT TO HAIR SALON
[Lorelai walks past the front desk]

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
words: Can I help you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I wish.
[Lorelai walks over to the hairdryer chairs and knocks on her mother's hairdryer]

speaker: EMILY
words: What on earth. . . [lifts up the hairdryer]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're not buying us a DSL.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, this is hardly the place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I canceled the order, and it's not happening.

speaker: EMILY
words: But Rory needs the Internet for her school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We have the Internet.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, this is faster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we like our Internet slow, okay? We can turn it on, walk around, do a little dance, make a sandwich. With DSL, there's no dancing, no walking, and we'd starve. It'd be all work and no play. Have you not seen The Shining, Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: What on earth are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Also, there will be no cars, no parking spaces, and all the uniforms will be supplied by me, the mother. That's final. There will be no discussion.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're being stubborn, as usual.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom, I'm not being stubborn as usual, I'm being me! The same person who always needed to work out her own problems and take care of herself because that's the way I was born. That's how I am!

speaker: EMILY
words: Florence, I'm dripping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I appreciate what you have done for Rory in paying for her school, That will not be forgotten. You won't let it. But she is my daughter, and I decide how we live, not you. Now then, do they validate parking here?

speaker: EMILY
words: There's a stamp at the desk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Lorelai walks out. Emily looks around, embarrassed]
CUT TO FRONT OF CHILTON
[Lorelai is drinking coffee by the Jeep as she waits for Rory. Rory emerges from the school]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm. Hey, you.
[Rory walks over, drops her backpack and hugs Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: So, this whole plaid-skirt thing. . .my idea?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My day sucked, too.

speaker: RORY
words: Promise?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Swear on my mother's life. [starts to pull back]

speaker: RORY
words: Not yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, still hugging, still hugging. [they pull apart] So, I brought us some coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: Why, I'm shocked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Triple caps, easy foam.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And if that doesn't work, we'll stick our fingers in a light socket. Come here. [picks up Rory's backpack and staggers under the weight] Wow. What, do they expect you to get smart all in one day?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, they expect a lot of things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so tell me.
[they get into the Jeep]

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. It was just one big, long, scary, tweedy, bad eight hours.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Add some hair spray, and you've got my day.

speaker: RORY
words: One of the girls already hates me, the guys are weird.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Weirder than other guys?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, they kept calling me Mary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding me. Wow, I can't believe they still say that.

speaker: RORY
words: Why? What does it mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mary, like Virgin Mary. It means they think you look like a goody-goody.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what would they have called me if they thought I looked like a slut?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, they might have added a Magdalene to it.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, biblical insults. This is an advanced school.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[It's nighttime. Lorelai, Rory, and Lane are walking down the sidewalk eating slices of pizza.]

speaker: LANE
words: It was so weird not having you in school today. I mean, I finally noticed some of the other kids, and let me just say, they are a sad lot.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, well, add a couple of plaid skirts, and you've got the Chilton freaks.

speaker: LANE
words: I totally miss you.

speaker: RORY
words: I miss you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey guys, I have an idea. What about, on Tuesdays and Thursdays, you know, when I go into Hartford for my business class, what if Lane comes along, and you guys can shop and study and join a cult and shave your heads.

speaker: LANE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: All except the shaving your heads part.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, no. What time is it?

speaker: LANE
words: I'm late for dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Again? Lane, your mother is gonna kill me if I keep sending you home fed and happy.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm sorry, but she found a web site that sells Tofu in bulk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you're kidding, right?

speaker: LANE
words: Yesterday, she went out and bought a bigger fridge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Boy, now, your life is scary.

speaker: LANE
words: [to Rory] Can I have your crust?

speaker: RORY
words: [hands her the pizza crust] It's the least I can do.

speaker: LANE
words: Thanks. Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Lane leaves. Lorelai and Rory continue walking down the sidewalk]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pizza for your thoughts.

speaker: RORY
words: I wish I could figure out a way to get Paris off my back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, angry chicks are the worst. When I was in high school I had a Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, she was horrible.

speaker: RORY
words: How'd you get rid of her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got pregnant and dropped out.

speaker: RORY
words: What if I just learn to French braid her hair?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Even better. Sweetie, you can't let those kids get you down.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want me to talk to anybody? A parent, a teacher, a big guy named Moose?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll just figure it out for myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.
[Rory laughs a little]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I was just thinking about the way Paris' face looked when I beat her to that Martin Luther question.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Fourteen shades of purple.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Tomorrow I'm shooting for 15.
[they stop in front of Luke's Diner and see Luke inside]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, what do you think of Luke?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, do you think he's cute?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. No way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No way what?

speaker: RORY
words: You cannot date Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said nothing about dating Luke.

speaker: RORY
words: If you date him, you'll break up, and we'll never be able to eat there again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I repeat, I said nothing about dating Luke.

speaker: RORY
words: Date Al from Pancake World, his food stinks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I cannot believe what I'm hearing. Al's food does not stink, Al stinks.
[Luke comes out of the diner and watches them walk away, then puts up the "Closed" sign and goes back inside.]
THE END
(The scene opens at the Gilmores' weekly dinner.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Dinner was lovely, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Mira does make a perfect cassoulet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who's Mira?

speaker: EMILY
words: Our cook.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought the cook was Heidi.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, no, we let Heidi go months ago. She had a problem closing things -- the door, the refrigerator --

speaker: RICHARD
words: The liquor bottle.

speaker: EMILY
words: Then it was Trina, then Sophia.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I liked Sophia.

speaker: EMILY
words: You did not.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I didn't?

speaker: EMILY
words: She was the one who sang.

speaker: RICHARD
words: That's right -- terrible woman.

speaker: EMILY
words: And after Sophia we had Anton.

speaker: RICHARD
words: That's right. Anton was the one that I liked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry, Dad, how do you mix up Anton and Sophia?

speaker: RICHARD
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, one is a man and one is a woman.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And your point being?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That one is a man and one is a woman.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have a lot to do in a day, Lorelai, I don't have time to keep up with a multitude of people that your mother employs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But one is a man and one is a woman.
(The cook brings in a cake.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: The dinner was so wonderful, Mira.

speaker: SARAH
words: It's Sarah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm sorry.
(Sarah leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom! Her name is Sarah!

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought she said Mira.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh!

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, Grandma, these plates are really pretty.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you, Rory. They were your great-grandmother's.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai the first.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought Mom was the first.

speaker: EMILY
words: Not in the name.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but in so many other things I was a regular trailblazer. Just finishing your thought, Mom.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai the first was my mother. She was an extremely accomplished equestrian, a distinguished patron of the arts, and she was also world-famous for her masquerade balls. She was quite a woman, my mother.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes she was. Mira, come cut the cake please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and why don't you bring Sarah out here with you?

speaker: EMILY
words: So, Lorelai, how are things at that charming little inn of yours?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm -- they're still charming and little. We're just crossing our fingers it doesn't assert itself and become rude and large.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom's having a huge wedding there this week.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, actually there's people coming from all over the country.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, isn't that nice?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, how's Chilton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, done with me now.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm sorry, was there more to the story?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Rory has to pick a team sport to play.

speaker: RORY
words: It's a requirement.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Physical fitness is as important as intellectual fitness. So says Plato and so say I.

speaker: EMILY
words: What sport are you going to pick?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sure. I'm not really the athletic type.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told her she should go out for the debating team.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not a sport.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is the way the Gilmores play.

speaker: EMILY
words: So, what are your choices?

speaker: RORY
words: basketball, lacrosse, swimming, track, golf --

speaker: EMILY
words: Golf?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well your grandfather is a golf player.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oops.

speaker: EMILY
words: He plays every week at the club. He could teach you to play like a pro.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, he could take you there on Sunday. It's perfect.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's not something you can teach in an afternoon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's OK. Rory can pick something else.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why should she pick something else? She needs to learn a sport and Richard can teach her a sport. (to Rory) You can use your mother's old golf clubs. They're upstairs gathering dust along with the rest of her potential.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, Mom, can I maybe talk to you for a minute?

speaker: EMILY
words: We're having dessert.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know but I'd like to talk to you fast before the sugar sets in and makes me crazy.

speaker: EMILY
words: You are the oddest person.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Too easy.
(Lorelai and Emily get up from the table and go into another room to talk.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What is so important it can't wait for cake?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Keep moving.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is as far as I can go unless you'd like me to bore my way through the wall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't do this, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Force Rory and Dad to go golfing.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not forcing anybody.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you're manipulating the situation in a way that gives no one a way out. That's force. Look it up.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm just trying to help your daughter get an education.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. She'll find another sport.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why should she?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because she doesn't want to go and Dad doesn't want to take her.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, your father doesn't know what he wants. He'd get his hair cut at the butcher if I let him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let it go please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, isn't this interesting? You're afraid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of what?

speaker: EMILY
words: That Rory will enjoy the club and have a good time without you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's crazy.

speaker: EMILY
words: I agree.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not afraid.

speaker: EMILY
words: Then let her go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She won't enjoy it, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well why don't you just let Rory decide?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because Rory is the sweetest kid in the whole world and she won't tell you that she doesn't want to go becasue she's too afraid of hurting your feelings.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh I'm sure you can give her some coaching to help her get over that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not trying to hurt your feelings, Mom. Believe it or not, this is not about you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course it's about me. If Rory goes and has a good time without you, then I win.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, Bob Barker. Listen, Rory knocks herself out all week at Chilton. Weekends are the only time she has to unwind and have fun.

speaker: EMILY
words: With you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm there.

speaker: EMILY
words: So let me get this straight. There's no way that Rory can possibly enjoy a weekend day with her grandfather.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're just going to twist it all around, aren't you?

speaker: EMILY
words: And you know your daughter so well that you don't even have to ask her opinion on this. She'd be miserable and you know it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am so setting myself up here, but yes, she would be miserable.

speaker: EMILY
words: That sounds a little controlling to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah I walked right into that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Interesting, isn't it, you being the one who's controlling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not being --

speaker: EMILY
words: According to you I was the only one in the family with that particular gift.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom I never said that!

speaker: EMILY
words: I guess you and I are more alike that you thought, aren't we?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You win.
(Later, Lorelai and Rory are leaving for home.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (sighs) Oh, man, did you get blindsided? I'm so sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: That's OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I tried to stop it, I swear.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. Maybe it won't be that bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe it won't.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I'll like it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe you will.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe you could come with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, is there a "you're crazy" team? 'Cause I think they'd make you captain.

speaker: RORY
words: Please?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I love you. I would take a bullet for you. But I'd rather stick something sharp in my ear than go to the club with you.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'd rather slide down a banister of razor blades and land in a pool of alcohol than go to the club with you.

speaker: RORY
words: I got it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't stop me, I'm on a roll. I'd rather eat my own hand than go to the club with you. Ooh, I'd rather get my face surgically altered to look like that lunatic rich lady with the lion head than go to the club with you.

speaker: RORY
words: Would you like me to drive so you can continue your diatribe?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Would ya? Thanks. I'd rather cut off my head and use it as a punch bowl than go to the club with you.
(Cut to the inn. Lorelai escorts the brides, Jackie and Jessica, and their mother around the grounds.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You'll walk down here over the bridge with the swans floating by and the music playing --

speaker: JACKIE
words: What are they doing with those purple flowers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just decorating the bridge.

speaker: JACKIE
words: I didn't want purple flowers. I wanted pink.

speaker: JESSICA
words: And I wanted blue.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I thought violet would be a nice compromise.

speaker: JACKIE
words: But we paid for pink flowers.

speaker: JESSICA
words: And blue flowers.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: You did not pay for anything. I told her to decorate with violet flowers and while it's very nice of her to try to take the heat for me it's certainly not necessary. If you don't like it, buy your own flowers. (silence) Yes, I thought so. Now go away. My Advil is wearing off.
(The twins walk away.)

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Their father spoiled them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, they're just excited.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: They're spoiled. And they won't move away.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Now, disaster list. What if it rains?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll put up tents.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: What if it's too windy?

speaker: LOREAI
words: Well, then we'll secure everything and put extra hair spray in everybody's hair.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Too hot?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll use umbrellas and fans that won't cause any damage because of the things that have been secured and the hair that has been sprayed.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: So I have nothing to worry about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nope.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Well there must be something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, I have everything under control. Why don't you go up to your room and have a fabulous bubble bath and I'll send up some wine and a masseuse who bears a remarkable resemblance to Antonio Banderas.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: How remarkable?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get ready to applaud.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: This is my favorite place in the whole world.
(Inside the inn Michel is handling gift baskets.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to an employee) Could you send Maury up to room twelve in about twenty minutes? Thanks. (to Michel) So, any problems?

speaker: MICHEL
words: With the wedding or my life?

speaker: LORELAI
words: it's not your life.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Do you stage these events to torture me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Job well done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, let's start again. Any problems?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Guests are checked in, baskets are given out, and 200,000 tons of Jordan almonds have been delivered.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, good. Did Rory call?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. She's golfing all day with my father and I'm half expecting this big "save me" call to come in -- you don't care at all do you?

speaker: MICHEL
words: To me you are the teacher in the Charlie Brown cartoon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, forget it. So, have the grooms arrived? Their plane was supposed to get in a 7 so I'm surprised they're not here by now.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well maybe they made a run for it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, somebody got stood up at the prom.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh. Dear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?
(Male twins have just walked in the front door.)

speaker: MICHEL
words: Are those -- ?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. It would be too --
(The brides rush into the grooms' arms.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: -- weird.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You kept this from me on purpose.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's like a really snooty Doublemint commercial.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Just let me know when the midgets and clowns arrive.
(Michel tries to leave.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no, no, no. You have to get them all settled in.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I'm not talking to them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you are.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well I'm not talking to them nicely.
(Cut to Emily and Richard's house.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: 00. She should be here already.

speaker: EMILY
words: She'll be here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You're supposed to tee off at your designated time.

speaker: EMILY
words: You pay good money to that place. You'll tee off when you tee off. Is that what you're wearing?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hmm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What's wrong with what I'm wearing?

speaker: EMILY
words: Nothing. It's fine.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This whole thing is absurd.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's your granddaughter.

speaker: RICHARD
words: She's a sixteen year old who would rather be at the mall.

speaker: EMILY
words: Make sure you show her all around the club, especially the rose garden.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am not a guide.

speaker: EMILY
words: And make sure you take her to lunch and have her get dessert.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No one said anything about lunch.

speaker: EMILY
words: I hope Lorelai's clubs are still in good shape.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily you are not listening to me. I will teach her to play golf, as promised by you, but lunch is out of the question.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to eat.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, but --

speaker: EMILY
words: So you'll eat together. Do you ahve sunscreen?
(The doorbell rings.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily.
(The doorbell rings again.)

speaker: EMILY
words: She's here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: 30. We must remember to buy her a watch.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, so help me God, you will be sweet to this girl and make this a memorable day for her. This is the first time we've gotten to show our granddaughter off at the club and it means a great deal to my happiness -- and yours -- that this day go well. Are we clear?
(Silence. Emily opens the door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, hello.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry I'm late.

speaker: EMILY
words: Nonsense. You're right on time.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, nice to see you.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is a perfect day for golfing, isn't it Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: It was cooler at 8.

speaker: RORY
words: Am I dressed OK? I didn't have any of those short pant things.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, actually there is something missing. Oh, wait a minute...
(She puts a hat on Rory's head.)

speaker: EMILY Here you go. Now you look just like Tiger Woods.
words: EMILY Here you go. Now you look just like Tiger Woods.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, that's some hat.

speaker: EMILY OK, off you go, you two. Have a wonderful time.
words: EMILY OK, off you go, you two. Have a wonderful time.

speaker: RORY
words: We will.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You bet.
(Cut to Richard and Rory walking along the golf course.)

speaker: RORY
words: Is it hard to become a member here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Everyone has to go through a thorough screening process.

speaker: RORY
words: Kind of like the FBI?

speaker: RICHARD
words: We're much more thorough than that.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes. Did you know the merger of Forscape and D.S.S.

speaker: RORY
words: Really.

speaker: RICHARD
words: International finance will never be the same and all because of a lost golfing bet.

speaker: RORY
words: That's crazy.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well that's high finance. Well, here we are. Now, what do you know about golf?

speaker: RORY
words: That it's a good walk spoiled?

speaker: RICHARD
words: (sighs) Well, your driver is the most powerful club in your bag, and as such, it can be your most valuable asset or your greatest liability. To wield it properly requires a precise combination of confidence and humility.

speaker: RORY
words: Confidence and humility. Got it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There you are. That's a pretty good natural grip. Now, line the toe of your left foot up with the ball. That's right. Now, drop this shoulder a little bit. Now, keeping your left arm firm, draw the club back, swing it cleanly through the ball.
(Rory takes a swing and hits the grass.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'm betting that was wrong.

speaker: RICHARD
words: (wearily) There are no rights and wrongs to the learning process. Try that again.
(Rory does the same thing.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'm betting that was wrong.
(Cut to the kitchen at the inn.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: These are blueberries. I think ordered strawberries.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I know but --

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, no, I did. I wrote it down. I got a copy. (reading) Yeah, mushrooms, melon, endive, peaches, kiwi.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Excuse me, crazy lady --

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh I should make some kiwi ice cream. That would be good sometime.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Listen. I know you ordered strawberries but they weren't any good so instead of selling you sub-standard strawberries, I brought blueberries.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I've got to make strawberry shortcake for 200 people. I think I'm gonna need strawberries.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Use the blueberries.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: To make what?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Blueberry shortcake.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: There's no such thing.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hey, the world was flat until someone took a boat trip.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Can I see these strawberries?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just one?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How about a Polaroid?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coffee, coffee, coffee. Ooh, Sookie, can I take some of this cake home to Rory? She's going to need a special treat tonight. She's spending the entire day with my father golfing at the club.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Take the blueberries!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ugh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Golfing was masterminded by my mother, of course. One minute we're having an excrutiating family dinner and the next she's manipulating my kid into spending her Sunday with my father at the country club. Oh, I can't talk about it anymore. It's making me too upset. Tell me something happy.
(Sookie is about to cry.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can't make the strawberry shortcake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. You suck at this game.

speaker: MICHEL
words: The battle for soup versus salad is waging in the other room. Come quick and settle it, please, as I'm running out of French curse words that they won't understand.
(Lorelai and Michel go into the lobby where the twin brides are in each others' faces arguing between soup and salad.)

speaker: JESSICA
words: Soup --

speaker: JACKIE
words: Salad...why are you making such a scene, Jessica? Jessica you are making a --
(Mrs. Shales walks over to Lorelai and Michel.)

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: It's been 45 minutes of soup or salad. Soup or salad -- I can't do it anymore. Get me a cab. I'm going to go far away now and never come back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about if the guests get a choice of soup or salad?

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: That -- that will work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Choice of soup or salad.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Got it.
(The grooms join the brides.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's so weird.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Which one is which?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. I think the one on the right is Matt.

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, the one on the left is Matt. The one on the right is Mark.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's very impressive.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, well, I'm very good at observing people, you know, learning the tics and traits, sound of their voices. It's a gift.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That one has a Post-It on its back.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, well, then that's Mark. The one on the right is Matt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You will go and take that off of him.

speaker: MICHE
words: I will not. We can't all just call everyone 'sweetie' and get away with it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Now, go with me, here. Let's say Mark walks into a hotel room and he sees his wife naked, but it's not his wife, it's his naked sister-in-law, and he has sex with her. Would that be cheating?

speaker: MICHEL
words: My head hurts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughing) I think no.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really? Lucky.

speaker: MICHEL
words: If you ask me this union belongs on a public access station. It's against the laws of nature and just this short of completely obscene.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you won't be giving the wedding toast.
(Lorelai is walking Mrs. Shales to the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did everything work out?

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Do you have children?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A daughter.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Do you hate her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Not ever?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I wasn't wildly fond of her during labor.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: That was the high point for me.
(Cut to Rory and Richard walking on the golf course.)

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe I hit the ball!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well it was quite impressive.

speaker: RORY
words: It landed in the water.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, but the splash was quite impressive.

speaker: RORY
words: This place is so beautiful. I could see just coming here to think or read. But that probably defeats the purpose of the holes with the flag thing.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There is something rather serene about walking around here.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you come here every week?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No. When I can. I'm often working on the weekends.

speaker: RORY
words: Bummer.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Isn't it.
(Men in a golf cart pass by.)

speaker: MAN
words: Hi Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I ask you a question?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Go ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you do?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm the executive vice-president of the Gehrman-Driscoll Insurance Corporation.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: And as executive vice-president, what do you do?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, it's a very big company -- one of the largest in the United States as a matter of fact -- I have a myriad of duties which would bore you greatly to hear about.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, OK.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I oversee our international division.

speaker: RORY
words: That sounds important.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, it rates a parking spot.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you get to travel a lot?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Quite a bit.

speaker: RORY
words: Lucky.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I suspect you have a yen for travelling.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm up to my ears in yens.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Any particular place you'd like to go?

speaker: RORY
words: Hundreds of places. Paris, Rome, London, Prague, Istanbul, Fez -- Have you ever been to Fez?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can't say that I have.

speaker: RORY
words: I want to go to Fez.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I think travelling for a young girl is a very important thing. Your mother never got a chance to travel much.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. She talks about that all the time.

speaker: RICHARD
words: She does?

speaker: RORY
words: We've got a deal. When I graduate from high school we're going to go backpacking through Europe together. You know, do the whole hostel thing. I just hope it really happens.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well we'll just have to make sure that it does.
(A golf cart pulls up beside them.)

speaker: GLORIA
words: Richard!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Gloria! You look wonderful.

speaker: GLORIA
words: Aren't you sweet? Is Emily here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I'm taking my granddaughter for a round of golf.

speaker: GLORIA
words: Well, we must get together.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Absolutely.
(Gloria pulls away.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: The most odious woman alive.
(Time lapse.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now, we'll meet back here in forty minutes?

speaker: RORY
words: OK.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And then, if you like, we can get some lunch.

speaker: RORY
words: That would be great.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes.
(Cut to the men's steam room.)

speaker: MAN #1
words: And I'm telling him I've been coming here for twenty years my young friend, and for twenty years that cart, number 43, has been my golf cart.

speaker: MAN #2
words: He should have known that.

speaker: MAN #1
words: Everybody knows that.

speaker: MAN #3
words: Did he give you the cart?

speaker: MAN #1
words: Damn right he gave me the cart.

speaker: MAN #2
words: You should have never had to ask because he should have known that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello, gentlemen.

speaker: MAN #1
words: Richard, good to see you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Heard about your golf cart. Too bad.

speaker: MAN #1
words: Yeah, well, I'm still angry about it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, yes.

speaker: MAN #3
words: Richard, who was that young lady I saw you on the golf course with?

speaker: RICHARD
words: That is my granddaughter.

speaker: MAN #2
words: Really? She's lovely.

speaker: MAN
words: Lorelai's girl.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: MAN #3
words: You're lucky. My granddaughter looks like she just fell off a potato truck.

speaker: MAN #2
words: My granddaughter would never be caught here. Might get in the way of the time spent at the tattoo parlor or getting something pierced or doing whatever she does while she runs wild through the streets like a rabid dog.

speaker: MAN #1
words: Cut her off! That would get her attention!

speaker: MAN #3
words: I can help you with the litigation.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Actually, Rory just started Chilton.

speaker: MAN #2
words: (impressed) Really?

speaker: MAN #1
words: Damn fine school.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Said she wanted to learn golf. I think she's taken to it quite well.

speaker: MAN #1
words: Yeah, well, just as long as isn't taken with a certain golf cart.

speaker: MAN #2
words: I'm writing a letter to the board.

speaker: MAN #1
words: I wish you would. If they would take --
(The men go back to their golf cart discussion. Cut to the women's steam room. Rory listens to the gossip.)

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: And you know she took the house.

speaker: WOMAN #2
words: She deserved it -- putting up with that tramp all those years.

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: Last year, Christmas, he bough them both the same bracelet.

speaker: WOMAN #2
words: She should have just shot him like his first wife did.

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: Oh I love Janie. Is she out yet?
(Gloria enters.)

speaker: GLORIA
words: Nanette, Peg.

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: Gloria, hi. Good game?

speaker: GLORIA
words: Not bad, you?

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: Oh, I just came for the steam. We must get together and play sometime soon.

speaker: GLORIA
words: Next week?

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: I'll call you.
(Gloria moves to a different area.)

speaker: WOMAN #1
words: (whispering) The most odious woman alive.
(Cut to the inn. The staff is still decorating for the wedding.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, I need more tulle here. I need the feeling of a major tutu, OK? Oh, uh, hey, Gary, Gary! The ribbons go on the chairs, OK, not on the trees. Oh, great!
(Lorelai hears swans and goes down to meet the truck.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey!

speaker: SWAN GUY
words: Where do you want the swans?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well do you know where the pond is?

speaker: SWAN GUY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know that little road you came up?

speaker: SWAN GUY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Do you know how to say 'big help' in Chinese?

speaker: SWAN GUY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel! (to Swan Guy) This is twenty swans?

speaker: SWAN GUY
words: Sure. Why not?

speaker: MICHEL
words: You screeched?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I need you to show this guy where to put the swans.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Absolutely not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I can't leave, OK? I've got a major tulle festival going on out here.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I will never go near those filthy birds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I hate the swans.

speaker: LORELAI
words: These particular swans?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, all swans. I was attacked by a band of swans in the Luxembourg Gardens when I was a boy. No one forgets that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughing) Oh no -- not being attacked by a band of swans. Was it an all-boy band? Kind of a scary, feathery 'N Sync kind of fiasco?

speaker: MICHEL
words: This is not funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm sorry, it's not. It's not funny at all.
(The swans honk and Michel jumps.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughing) Oh my God! Come on, you have to admit, that's a little funny.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Hey, Pepe le Pew, you wanna give me a hand with this?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, it's Drella or the swans.

speaker: MICHEL
words: So either one beast of terror or another?

speaker: DRELLA
words: What the hell is he babbling about?

speaker: MICHEL
words: (quietly, to Lorelai) Don't --

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's afraid of the swans.

speaker: MICHEL
words: (quietly) Thank you.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Of course he is. He's French.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.

speaker: MICHEL
words: (to Swan Guy) OK, I'll take you to the pond.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: MICHEL
words: But stay far away from me.
(Drella watches as Michel leads Swan Guy away.)

speaker: DRELLA
words: Can't stand the talk -- love to watch the walk.
(Cut to the dining room at the country club.)

speaker: RORY
words: She caught him in the pool house with the tennis pro, not the riding instructor.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I had no idea.

speaker: RORY
words: That committee of yours is not looking at people as much as you think.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why would they? From what you've told me they're all involved in one nefarious activity after another.

speaker: RORY
words: It's a conspiracy.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's Peyton Place. Is there more?

speaker: RORY
words: Can you handle it?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'll steel myself.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, Mr. Neville likes all things frilly.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good God. He's my broker.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think one will affect the other.
(Man #1 and Man #2 or 3 approach the table.)

speaker: MAN #1
words: Mind if we barge in?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Look who's here. Ah, Rory, this is Julian Johnson (MAN #1) and Edward James (MAN #2 or 3)

speaker: EDWARD
words: Call me "Ed".

speaker: JULIAN
words: You can call me "Ed" too.
(The two men laugh.)

speaker: RORY
words: It's nice to meet you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Would you like to join us?

speaker: EDWARD
words: If Rory doesn't mind us intruding on her time with her grandfather.

speaker: RORY
words: No, that's fine.

speaker: JULIAN
words: Oh that's good. So, we hear you're attending Chilton.

speaker: RORY
words: I just started.

speaker: JULIAN
words: That's a hard school.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes sir.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory is an excellent student.

speaker: JULIAN
words: Really?

speaker: RICHARD
words: 4.0 grade point average.

speaker: JULIAN
words: Whoa! That's got me beat.
(Edward and Julian laugh.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: She's going to Fez someday.

speaker: JULIAN
words: Fez? What the hell is in Fez?

speaker: RICHARD
words: That's for her to find out.
(Cut to Luke's. Rory is waiting for Luke.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Interesting hat.

speaker: RORY
words: I went golfing with my grandfather today.

speaker: LUKE
words: Did you know that golf courses are an environmental blight because of the chemicals they use to keep the grass green?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually I did. (silence) Bad joke, sorry.
(Luke walks away just before Lorelai comes in the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: My God -- this day. The swans, the tulle, my head...Luke, I need the largest cheeseburger in the world. Let's break a record here, mister. (to Rory) So, the wedding is a nightmare. We got these ten boxes of creepy larvae that are supposed to swarm into beautiful butterflies on the wedding day. They swarmed a little early! What's with the hat?

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma gave it to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now, that's just mean.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not that bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want a mirror?
(Rory takes off the hat.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Rory's golfing adventure. Tell me!

speaker: RORY
words: It was fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, I brought you some of Sookie's chocolate cake to make you feel better.

speaker: RORY
words: It really wasnt't that bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are the sweetest kid in the whole world. Where on earth did you get that from? Luke, am I mistaken or did that sign on the door say "open"? (to Rory) So, where were we?

speaker: RORY
words: Me golfing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right -- go.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, well, uh, by the end of the day I could even hit the ball. Sometimes it wasn't my ball but the intentions were good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well good intentions and no physical exertion whatsoever is what the game of golf was built on. So, um, did you order?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not hungry. I had a big lunch at the club.

speaker: LUKE
words: With all the other devastators of our land.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You had a big lunch at the club?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, it was quite good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Quite? What's with the quite?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't ever say quite.

speaker: RORY
words: I've said quite plenty of times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whatever. So besides the "quite good" lunch you had, what else happened?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing. We played, I met his friends, I took a steam.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You took a steam?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I sweated out all my toxins and I stole a towel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! Sounds like you really had a good time.

speaker: RORY
words: I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, new word now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry -- I just -- I'm surprised. I thought you were gonna be bored.

speaker: RORY
words: I was kind of surprised too. I don't know -- it was pretty there and Grandpa and I talked a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You talked? Really?

speaker: RORY
words: You're doing it again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry. You talked?

speaker: RORY
words: We talked about Fez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And he thought it was a hat.

speaker: RORY
words: I told him about our backpacking trip. He thought it was a great idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. So you really had fun.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's great.
(Luke serves Lorelai's cheeseburger.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is really, really great.

speaker: LUKE
words: I thought you were starving.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Things change. Move on.

speaker: RORY
words: Does this hat really look bad on me?
(Rory puts the hat back on.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. I think it looks kind of cute.
(Cut to the lawn at the inn. Miss Patty is teaching the twin couples to dance.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: It's your wedding day. Feel each other. Use the thumping of your heart as a metronome. Let passion be your coreographer. Be as light on your toes as you are in your hearts. No, no, no, no darling. Let me show you.
(Miss Patty pulls one couple apart and begins dancing with the groom.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: You know, in some countries if you dance this close you're cheating on your wife.

speaker: MATT
words: You're next.

speaker: MARK
words: Take your time.
(Lorelai goes inside the inn to where Rory is working. The phone is ringing.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Oh my God, you have good handwriting.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did not get that from me. You got your fabulous flair from me.

speaker: RORY
words: I also got my deviated septum from you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, focus on the flair.

speaker: MICHEL
words: It's for you. He says he's your father although why he'd volunteer that freely, I do not know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My father?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Please just take the phone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (takes phone) Dad? (pause) Yeah it's Lorelai -- who else calls you "Dad"? (pause) Yeah she's right here. Hold on. (to Rory) It's for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. (takes phone) Hello? (pause) Hey Grandpa...
(Lorelai watches as Rory moves away.)

speaker: RORY
words: That's great.
(Mrs. Shales and Drella come into the room.)

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Jackie wants Samuel Barber, John Cage, and Philip Glass and Jessica wants Shania Twain's "I Feel Like a Woman."

speaker: DRELLA
words: I'm not a jukebox.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Oh please.

speaker: DRELLA
words: Hey, you think I started playing the harp 'cause I thought it would make me cool? You know, finally get me in with the in-crowd? Maybe I'd make for some great happy hour conversation. No, alright. The music drives me, lady. I will play what I feel and you will love it.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: I'll give you an extra $100.

speaker: DRELLA
words: You just got yourself a jukebox.
(They walk away. Lorelai is still watching Rory talk on the phone.)

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, yeah, I'd love to see it. (pause) No, if you want to. (pause) Sure. That sounds good. (pause) Yeah.
(Cut to Lorelai's house. She and Rory are sitting outside. Rory is looking in a handheld mirror while Lorelai reads.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Should I leave you two alone?

speaker: RORY
words: I think I want to change my hair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? I think it looks quite good.

speaker: RORY
words: You're funny. Do you want something to drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, water.
(Rory goes inside.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you talk to Grandpa today?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Grandpa -- he called?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything wrong?
(Rory returns to the porch.)

speaker: RORY
words: No. He just found this book we were talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. And he just called to tell you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. It's just weird. He doesn't call the inn that much. Or ever, actually.

speaker: RORY
words: Well he knew that I was looking for it, so --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, sure. What book was it?

speaker: RORY
words: Mencken's "Chrestomathy"

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that one.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.
(Babette comes running up on the porch.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Hey! Cinnamon is stuck under the front porch again. Can I borrow some vegetable oil and a shoehorn?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get it. (leaves)

speaker: BABETTE
words: I'm callin' him and I'm callin' him and I go around the porch and this big orange tush is just starin' me in the face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hate when that happens.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Yeah. He must've been meowin' for an hour but Morey was playing some Thelonious on the Steinway and when Morey plays I go into this trance where all I can see is blue and moon and stars --
(They hear a loud angry meow.)

speaker: MOREY
words: He's out Babs!

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh! Never mind, Sugar. (calls to Morey) Play me home, baby!
(Piano music starts. Babette gets up to go home.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh God! It's killing me!
(Rory comes back out with vegetable oil.)

speaker: RORY
words: Babette didn't take her oil.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, keep it. Christmas is early this year. So you know what I was thinking?

speaker: RORY
words: That Madonna and Sean Penn should get remarried?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Besides that. I was thinking that your golfing expedition should totally count as a dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean I think I can get us out of dinner at the grandparents' on Friday. Maybe we could grab a movie.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, that's OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's no big deal, really.

speaker: RORY
words: No. It's just gonna get Grandma all freaked out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah but I can handle those freakouts. I've done that.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, I have to get the book from Grandpa anyway. Let's just go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. All right. If you really want to.

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, fine. Is that my sweater?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're wearing my sweater.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's OK. It's just I thought I asked you to at least ask, you know, before you borrow my stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's OK. It's just not too much for a simple "Can I borrow it, Mom?" is it?

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's not. Jeez, lighten up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's my favorite sweater too.

speaker: RORY
words: Since when?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since always.

speaker: RORY
words: This is not your favorite sweater.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is and now it's going to be all stretched out just like everything else you borrow.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm talking about that you take my sweaters and you wear them and you stretch them out.

speaker: RORY
words: I couldn't possibly stretch them out! Your boobs are way bigger than mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is not true.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your boobs are totally bigger than mine!

speaker: RORY
words: You're crazy!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want to measure?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm serious. Why don't you get the measuring tape right now?

speaker: RORY
words: I am not going to measure my boobs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you know that you are totally bigger.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going inside.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, don't measure. We'll just compare bras.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll stop when you quit stealing my stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: You're cracked!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're...bigger.
(Rory takes her books and slams the door as she goes inside.)
(Cut to Lorelai and Sookie walking down the street.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: "Your boobs are bigger than mine"? I'm a mental case.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So apologize.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was too mad and stupid to apologize last night and she was gone before I got up this morning. What is wrong with me?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're very possessive of your sweaters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, I understand. I'm the same way. If somebody breathes too hard on my paring knife I'm like a crazy spider monkey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not about the sweater. It's about the golfing thing and the liking it thing. She had fun, Sookie. Just like my mother said she would.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, that's got to hurt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She should have fun. I mean, I want her to have a good relationship with her grandparents. Just because I don't doesn't mean she shouldn't, right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. So then why was I trying to get her out of Friday night dinner? I mean, what am I trying to do -- undermine their relationship?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No you weren't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I was.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes you were.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes! I'm four years old!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're jealous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I'm not jealous.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, you are. You're jealous 'cause they like Rory better than you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh thank you for the hug.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: See, I'm bad at advice talks. Could we talk about soup? 'Cause I'm good with soup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I'm sorry. You're fine. I'm all mixed up. I left that life, you know, the club, my parents. I ran from it as soon as I could. It just -- it never occurred to me that she might want it. It occurred to my mother though. God, I hate that she was right.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You don't know that she -- ooh! Oh my God!
(Sookie spots something across the street. Without looking to see if any cars are coming she crosses the street, causing a guy to fall off his bike to avoid hitting her.)

speaker: BIKE GUY
words: Hey, watch it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! Aah! (to Bike Guy) Are you OK? OK.
(Lorelai looks both ways before crossing the street to catch up to Sookie.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (to strawberries) Look at you! You're beautiful!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have to be more adult about this. I mean, if the country club life is what she wants, more power to her, right? You know, little white gloves and coming-out parties. That makes some girls happy, right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (while admiring the strawberries) Sure, yeah. If they're on Prozac, absolutely.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just never thought that I'd raise that kind of kid, you know? I mean, not that there's anything wrong with that kind of kid. I just never thought that was Rory. Maybe it's not. I don't know. Am I obsessing? Sookie? Hello? Do I have to put on my strawberry costume to get your full attention?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, I'm sorry. You have a strawberry costume?
(Jackson walks by and sees Sookie)

speaker: JACKSON
words: Unbelievable!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson!

speaker: JACKSON
words: So this is what we've come to? You sneaking around behind my back buying somebody else's strawberries?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I was desperate!

speaker: JACKSON
words: You disgust me!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I needed the strawberries!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well now you have 'em. I hope you're happy together.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson -- wait!

speaker: JACKSON
words: No!
(Jackson walks away. Sookie follows him.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Come on Jackson.

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, we can talk about it.

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, get back here!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Get away from me!
(Sookie chases him down the middle of the street where they almost get hit by a car.)
(Cut to the wedding reception at the inn. Everyone is dancing. Mrs. Shales hugs Lorelai.)

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: We did it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: We sure did.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: God, I feel wonderful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm so glad it turned out the way you wanted it.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Oh, you have no idea. They just told me they're going to share a condo in Tuscon. Arizona! That's hundreds of miles away!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Congratulations.

speaker: MRS. SHALES
words: Oh, thank you. Sister Sledge! Excuse me.
(Mrs. Shales runs off to dance. Lorelai walks over to where Rory is sitting with the guestbook.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, stranger.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good turnout?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want something to drink?

speaker: RORY
words: Are you trying to make up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm trying to hydrate you.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm fine, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: RORY
