speaker: LORELAI
words: I got your Good Ship Lollipop right here, mister. So do you want something to eat?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything smells funny.

speaker: EMILY
words: There you are. Come, there's some people I want you to meet.
(Rory goes with Emily.)

speaker: MITZI
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Oh my God! Oh, Mitzie, wow, I haven't seen you since --

speaker: MITZI
words: Your seventh month.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was going to say high school, but OK.

speaker: MITZI
words: Oh, no, did I say something rude?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no.

speaker: MITZI
words: No, I did. I said something rude. I've been trying to work on that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, a noble goal.

speaker: MITZI
words: Ever since my divorce, I've been really trying to work on myself. You know, I just -- I want to grow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: MITZI
words: Lorelai Gilmore, the scandal girl! Now, tell me, what ever happened with Christopher?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher is in California.

speaker: MITZI
words: Oh, do you hear from him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh --

speaker: MITZI
words: I'm sorry, is this painful for you to talk about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well --

speaker: MITZI
words: When did he last call you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, you're making progress with that rude thing, huh, Mitz?

speaker: MITZI
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's OK. He calls like once a week and we see him at Christmas, sometimes Easter. It's all very civil.

speaker: MITZI
words: So are you married now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's just me and Rory.

speaker: MITZI
words: Your cat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My kid! She's right over there.

speaker: MITZI
words: Oh. (turns to look) Wow! You can really see Christopher in her, can't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, you can.

speaker: MITZI
words: Does that kill you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, what? I see...someone...else...and it's been great.
(Cut to Richard standing with some business associates.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, no, those aren't the terms we agreed on.

speaker: LARS
words: They most certainly are.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lars, you were at the same meeting I was. We specifically spelled out a five year extention, not a three year one.

speaker: LARS
words: I heard three.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandpa!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory. Gentlemen, this is my granddaughter, Rory.

speaker: LARS
words: Happy birthday, Rory.
(The men all hand envelopes to Rory.)

speaker: LARS
words: I think we should Dennis on the phone right now.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Fine, I've got a phone in my office.
(The men leave.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, there's a whole group of your school friends in the library. Let's go say hello to them.
(Emily and Rory go into the library where kids from Chilton are standing around looking bored.)

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go to the bathroom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just say hello first. Come on, I'll hold those for you.

speaker: KID #3
words: Who's that?

speaker: KID #4
words: I think it's her party.

speaker: KID #3
words: Oh.
(Rory looks around the room and turns to leave.)

speaker: RORY
words: Paris?

speaker: PARIS
words: My parents made me come.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh God!

speaker: PARIS
words: Otherwise I wouldn't be here. You believe me, don't you?

speaker: (Rory walks away from Paris and sees Tristin coming in the front door.
words: (Rory walks away from Paris and sees Tristin coming in the front door.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, coming to greet me?

speaker: RORY
words: Hello, Tristin.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So where's my birthday kiss?

speaker: RORY
words: It's my birthday.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So I'll give you a birthday kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: What is wrong with you?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Ok, I gotta tell you something. I'm madly in love with you.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, good luck with that.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I can't eat, I can't sleep...I wake up in the middle of the night calling your name. Rory, Rory!

speaker: RORY
words: Would you shut up please?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, who's your friend?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know but this is Tristin.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Excuse me?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Tristin Dugray, sir.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Dugray? Are you any relation to Janlen Dugray?

speaker: RICHARD
words: That's my grandfather, sir.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I've done business with Janlen for years. He's a fine man.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: That he is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, you've got very good taste in friends. I approve.

speaker: LARS
words: Richard, I've got Dennis on the phone and he heard the same thing I heard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, one wrong man can always find a friend.
(Richard and Lars leave.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: He likes me.

speaker: RORY
words: He's drunk.

speaker: TRISTIN Let's take a walk.
words: TRISTIN Let's take a walk.

speaker: RORY
words: This is stuipd. you don't even like me! You just have this weird need to prove that I'll go out with you. That's not liking someone.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why are you fighting this? You're gonna give in eventually.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going to go find my mother.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Wow, meeting your mom. It's a bit sudden, but OK.
(Paris leans against a door and watches Tristin.)
(Rory walks up to Lorelai and Emily.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh there you are! I think it's time that you said a few words to your guests.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Just a little speech to say thank you and tell everyone how it feels to be one year older.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I don't she wants--

speaker: EMILY
words: She's the hostess, Lorelai. This is her responsibility.

speaker: RORY
words: I am not the hostess! You are!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, honey, hold on...

speaker: RORY
words: This is your party and these are your guests and I don't have anything to say to them, so you give the speech.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory!

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What was that all about?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, your daughter has no manners whatsoever. You should be ashamed of yourself.
(Emily walks away.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, how did this become my fault?
(Cut to Rory lying on the bed in Lorelai's old room.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Can I come in?

speaker: RORY
words: It's your room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry I snapped at Grandma.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, hugh? That was a pretty 'Freaky Friday' moment we had back there.

speaker: RORY
words: She just went ahead and invited all these kids from Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding. I thought she checked on that with you.

speaker: RORY
words: She didn't ask me or tell me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, man, I'm so sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: It just -- I don't know but it really made me mad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, why didn't you tell me?

speaker: RORY
words: Because you were happy. I mean, it's not very often that there's peace between the two of you. I didn't want to screw everything up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I appreciate you wanting you wanting Mom and I to get along but you shouldn't keep stuff like that from me.

speaker: RORY
words: I feel terrible. I mean, I've never yelled at her before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, you'll apologize, all will be forgotten. You'll see. Man. It's like time has stood still in this room.

speaker: RORY
words: It must be weird for you to be in this room now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it was weird for me to be in this room then. (points to a dollhouse) You know, they gave this to me with the glass on.

speaker: RORY
words: I now officially know what it feels like to have grown up here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not official until you're huddled in the corner eating your hair.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you remember your last birthday here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. We had just had a fight and I was lying on the bed just like you are now.

speaker: RORY
words: What did you fight about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I was pregnant.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I said something at the table about the pate smelling like Clorox and one thing led to another and I wound up here. I hadn't told anybody yet about me. And you.

speaker: RORY
words: That must have been really hard on you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I remember when I finally told them, it was the only time they ever looked small to me.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess I'd better go find Grandma.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm. Give her a minute.

speaker: EMILY
words: There you are!

speaker: LORELAI
words: She'll find us.

speaker: EMILY You are both being very rude. This isn't my birthday party, you know.
words: EMILY You are both being very rude. This isn't my birthday party, you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Honestly, the way the two of you act.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, I just want to --

speaker: EMILY
words: We'll talk about this later. Now go.
(Cut to Emily saying goodnight to the last of the guests.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you, good to see you. Lovely as always, Leeza. My best to Darren.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Mom. Great party. One of your best. I even liked those brown mushroom things.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, can I talk to you for a sec?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, the girls are leaving.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, Rory, I hope you had a good time.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I did.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now, I know that your grandmother has already bought you a gift and signed my name to it. That was part of our agreement when we got married. However, I feel this occasion calls for something a little extra. (hands her a check) Put that towards your trip to Fez.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Grandpa!

speaker: RICHARD
words: You're a good girl, Rory. Happy birthday.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't deserve this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, hand it over.

speaker: EMILY
words: You girls should get going. You've got quite a drive ahead of you.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, we're having a party tomorrow at our house and -- I mean, it won't be anything like this but it will be fun and maybe you and Grandpa can come?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's very sweet, dear, but I'm afraid we already have plans.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Ok.

speaker: EMILY
words: Have a safe trip. Lock the door behind you, OK?
(Emily walks away.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, um, why don't you go help that guy out there put all the presents in the car.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.

speaker: EMILY
words: (to catering staff) All this can go in the dishwasher.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, come to the party tomorrow.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't. I'm busy. (to catering staff) Throw those out, we won't need them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, your granddaughter invited you to her birthday party. Please, come.

speaker: EMILY
words: I've already been to a party for my granddaughter and she humilitated me in front of all of my friends. I have no desire to relive that experience. (to catering staff) The cheeses must be put in individual bags, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh come on, give her a break. You invited all these Chilton kids without even asking her.

speaker: EMILY
words: They're her schoolmates. I assumed they were her friends

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what they say when people assume things.

speaker: EMILY No, what do they say?
words: EMILY No, what do they say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That -- you shouldn't.

speaker: EMILY
words: Very clever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, she didn't want them here. She doesn't like them.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I had to invite them. That's just good manners, something that your daughter is sorely lacking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, you know, you're doing the same thing to her that you always did to me. You're trying to control her and when that doesn't work you just shut her out.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm too tired for your accusations right now. Can we do this tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just --

speaker: EMILY
words: Here, I'll find you a pen so you can write down all your insults so that you won't forget them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, this is not funny. I have a crushed kid out in the car.

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you want me to say? Everything's fine, it's forgotten. There, I'll see you next week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I guess the whole pudding thing was just a fluke, huh? Trying to get to know us, easing up on the rules, smuding that bottom line of yours. It was just some weird phase. What, you were on cold medicine last week or something?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, so I'm a villan now, is that it? I spent a fortune on this party. I spent days planning it, making sure that every little detail was perfect -- the food, the linen, the music. And I did all this for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that's not what she needs. She needs you to accept her apology and come to her party. That's what she needs. You don't care what she needs.

speaker: EMILY
words: How dare you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't even know what she needs because you don't know her. You've never tried to know her just like you never knew me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh I know you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, please. You don't know anything about me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, you'd like to think that, wouldn't you? That you're just some huge mystery to me. 'Why does Lorelai do that?' 'I don't know, she's a mystery to me.' Well you're not so mysterious, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! No! What am I then?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well right now you're very loud and disruptive to the entire cleaning process. (to catering staff) For God's sake! What do I have to do to get you to put the damn cheese in individual bags?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, I give up

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, you give up? If I had a dollar for every time you gave up --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then you could pay for this party, couldn't you?
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Sookie is unpacking groceries when Lorelai walks into the kitchen.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I made coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hangover?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Emily.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh. Got it. Moving on...

speaker: RORY
words: Good morning.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Morning, Popcorn. You want some pancakes?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I've gotta get going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where?

speaker: RORY
words: The college fair is this morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you're going to get yet another Harvard brochure?

speaker: RORY
words: I just want to see if they've changed the pictures.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Weirdo.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll be back in plenty of time to help you decorate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, this is your party. You do not work. You lounge and mock those who are. Have I taught you nothing?

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry. I'll try to be better. Bye.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK, bye-bye.
(Cut to the college fair. Rory stops at the Harvard table.)

speaker: RORY
words: New brochure?

speaker: HARVARD REP
words: Yes.

speaker: PARIS
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: There's a college fair going on.

speaker: PARIS
words: No, I mean, what are you doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm getting a new brochure.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because they're not selling pizza. (pause) Oh no.

speaker: PARIS
words: You can't.

speaker: RORY
words: You're applying to Harvard?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: PARIS
words: Ten generations of Gellers have gone to Harvard. I have to go to Harvard.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe this.

speaker: PARIS
words: You can go somewhere else. Go to Brandeis. Brandeis is nice.

speaker: RORY
words: I've only ever wanted to go to Harvard. That's it. Nowhere else. (pause) It's a big school.

speaker: PARIS
words: I guess.

speaker: RORY
words: We'll probably never see each other.

speaker: PARIS
words: You think?

speaker: RORY
words: And if we do, we duck.

speaker: PARIS
words: OK. So...
(Paris starts to walk away then stops.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey...Are you dating Tristin?

speaker: RORY
words: What? No. No way.

speaker: PARIS
words: Do you like him?

speaker: RORY
words: Not even a little.

speaker: PARIS
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Really.

speaker: PARIS
words: OK.
(Paris turns away thens stops again.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey...Nice party.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.
(Cut to Rory's second party.The house is filled with loud music and the people of Stars Hollow.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Happy birthday Rory!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Open it, open it, open it!
(Rory is opening her presents. She gets an iBook from Lorelai.)

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You like it? You can take it back.

speaker: RORY
words: No! I love it! It's perfect.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's blue and it has a handle.

speaker: RORY
words: It's way too expensive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, that's what I told the guy at the store.
(Sookie brings in a cake with Rory's face on it.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK! On three 'cause I'm gonna drop it. OK, One, two --
(Everyone sings "Happy Birthday.")

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make a wish.
(Rory blows out the candles.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, everybody, I need your attention, your attention please. This is a very serious moment. Two priests, a rabbi and a duck --

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, I'm kidding. Um, I would like to propose a toast to the one thing in my life that is always good, always sweet, and without whom I would have no reason to get up in the morning. My pal Rory. Cheers.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Happy birthday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And in honor of this very special girl I now invite you all to help me eat her face.
(Doorbell rings. Sookie hands Rory a knife.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you may have the first cut.

speaker: RORY
words: There's something very strange about hacking into my own head.
(Doorbell rings again.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jeez, who the hell's ringing the bell? It's a party! Get your ass in here!
(Emily and Richard walk in the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or asses I guess.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma! Grandpa! I can't believe you're here. I'm so glad you came. Hey, no tie?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I thought I'd mix it up a little.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, look.
(Rory shows Emily that she's wearing the bracelet.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, it looks lovely.

speaker: RORY
words: I want you to meet everyone. Everyone, these are my grandparents.

speaker: EVERYONE
words: Hi.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Emily, Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, you look well.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I'm Patricia LaCosta. We just love your daughter and granddaughter.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: My God, you're a tall speciman of a man. Must be all that good air in Hartford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Dad, can I get you a drink?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no, Mom, you're going to need one and I have wine glasses that say "Holiday Inn" on them.

speaker: EMILY
words: Stoli on the rocks with a twist.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.
(Lorelai goes into the kitchen.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, OK, uh, my parents are here.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I've cursed in front of them twice and Miss Patty already tried to hit on my dad, and I'm sure my mom is going to call Child Protective Services

speaker: SOOKIE
words: God, when was the last time they were here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not once?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not since we moved here. I mean, they'd come down and visit is occasionally when Rory was a baby and we lived at the inn, but they have never been here.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow. That's big stuff. Is Rory thrilled?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Through the roof.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, that's great.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I just tried some of thse hors d'ouevres. They're unbelievable. Who is your caterer?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: EMILY
words: What's a Sookie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi. Sookie St. James.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie's the chef at the inn, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: My dear, you are very talented.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, you must cater my next party. When my friends get wind of you you're going to have so much business you won't know what to do with yourself. But remember -- I discovered you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Sookie has a job. She's the chef at the inn. The inn where we work -- my inn. Six days a week, Mom. (to Sookie) Just give her your number or we'll never get out of here.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK.
(Cut to Richard looking up the fireplace.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, how does it look?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, it doesn't look structurally sound.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drink up, Dad.
(Richard walks away and Sookie runs into the living room.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK, don't panic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good opening line. What's wrong?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We're out of ice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How could we be out of ice? We had a ton of ice. It was like a penguin habitat in there.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don't know how it happened, I just know it happened and somehow we have to deal with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will go and get some then.
(Lorelai starts out the door. Luke comes in carrying ice.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! Oh my God! You're a vision! Sookie, we have ice!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hallelujah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did you know?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, a good rule of thumb is you can never have too much ice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you're the best.
(Lorelai hugs Luke just as Emily comes out of the kitchen.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's -- Oh, hi, Mom. This is my friend Luke

speaker: LUKE
words: How are you doing?

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine, thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I'd better get these in the freezer before they melts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, not very likely in here.
(Rory finds Richard on the porch.)

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, what a lovely party.

speaker: RORY
words: I brought you something to read.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not the Wall Street Journal, but there's a quiz in there that determines whether you're a summer or a fall.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I appreciate this, thank you.
(Back inside, everyone is in the living room.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, Morey, you remember the time that Rory decided that our old tree stump was a fairy ring?

speaker: MOREY
words: I sure do.

speaker: BABETTE
words: How old was she then, sugar?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think she was about 10.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, all I know is that it matched the description .

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, God, she was cute. She used to sit out there with a peanut butter sandwich just waiting for the fairy to get hungry.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, new story.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I'm still crushed beyond belief that she quit her ballet lessons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, not me. Miss Perfect Work Ethic would prance around this room 24 hours a day.

speaker: RORY
words: And I still stunk.

speaker: LANE
words: I can vouch for that.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: That's not true!

speaker: MOREY
words: She was pretty bad.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: No, don't you listen to them. You had a true gift.

speaker: (Everyone laughs.
words: (Everyone laughs.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: What? She did. She was talented.
(Everyone laughs. Emily gets up and goes up to Lorelai's bedroom. Lorelai follows her. Emily picks up a quilt.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I made that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: From Rory's old baby clothes

speaker: EMILY
words: How nice. Hope you washed them first.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, rats. I knew I forgot something.

speaker: EMILY
words: That's quite an assortment of characters you've assembled down there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're great people.

speaker: EMILY
words: This Patricia --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Miss Patty.

speaker: EMILY
words: She teaches dance?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Among other things.

speaker: EMILY
words: And this man with the ice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: EMILY
words: How long have you been seeing him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke? I'm not seeing Luke. He's just a friend.

speaker: EMILY
words: Mm-hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I swear. Luke keeps me in coffee, nothing else.

speaker: EMILY
words: He seems to like you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you're judging this by what?

speaker: EMILY
words: By they way he looked at you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is how?

speaker: EMILY
words: Like you were about to give him a lap dance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, he did not look at me like that.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're pleased.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: You smiled. You're pleased that the ice man looked at you like a Porterhouse steak.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm smiling because you're crazy and that's what you do to crazy people to keep them calm.
(Emily picks up a picture of Lorelai on crutches.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What's this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that's me, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I know that's you. You're wearing a cast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, that's when I broke my leg.

speaker: EMILY
words: You broke your leg?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, three years ago during a yoga class. The headstand portion took a very ugly turn. The good thing was I brought the smug, blonde, pretzel chick down with me. I've since learned that I'm a bit too comptetitive for yoga.

speaker: EMILY
words: I never knew that you broke your leg.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was no big deal, Mom. If I'd been really sick you would have known.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yeah, well...You know, could get a maid in here once a week to at least tidy the place up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like it cluttered.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can't even find the bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I can. It's the thing that I crash into on the way to the closet.

speaker: EMILY
words: I should go check on your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was nice that you came tonight, Mom. It meant a lot. To Rory. Really.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she is my granddaughter, after all. I should be here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I totally agree.
(Emily starts to fold up the quilt.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Leave it.
(Emily walks onto the porch. Richard is reading Rory's magazine.)

speaker: EMILY
words: It's time to go now.

speaker: RICHARD
words: In a minute, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, we're going to get going now.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you for coming.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thanks for asking me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, lovely party. I enjoyed the reading material immensely.

speaker: RORY
words: So what's the verdict?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am an autumn.

speaker: RORY
words: Interesting.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Isn't it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, so you guys leaving? The mud wrestling starts in ten minutes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good night, Lorelai. We had a lovely time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And with a straight face you said that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'd have that chimney inspected if I were you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get right on that, Dad.
(Richard hands Rory a check.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: For Fez.

speaker: RORY
words: But Grandpa, you already took care of that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Fez is a very large city.
(Rory and Lorelai watch Emily and Richard walk to their car.)

speaker: RORY
words: So...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Food fight?

speaker: RORY
words: Absolutely.
(They run back inside.)
(Emily is silent in the car.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily?

speaker: EMILY
words: She's right. I don't know my daughter at all. We should go. Traffic.
(Cut to the kitchen. Lorelai and Sookie are cleaning up.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Next year, we are going to a McDonald's with one of those slides and that's it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The party was a hit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And we'll be eating onion dip for breakfast for a week.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You know, you mix that dip with some groud turkey and some garlic and it's really not too bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I'm not looking for a recipe.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, reflex, sorry. OK, I'm gonna go check the living room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.
(Standing at the sink, Lorelai looks up and sees Rory in the yard with Dean.)

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't have to get me anything.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sorry, that's the rules. You get older, you get a gift.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry about this sort of sneaky thing. I just haven't told my mother yet about you. I mean, not that there's to tell. I just --

speaker: DEAN
words: That's OK. This is better.
(Rory unwraps the gift.)

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God. It's beautiful.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I bought the medallion and I just cut some leather straps and drilled a hole, and well, you like it?

speaker: RORY
words: I -- it's amazing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Here.
(Dean ties it around Rory's wrist. They smile at each other. Lorelai is still watching from the window.)
(Lorelai and Rory are walking across the town center. The town is decorated for fall.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: One of us has to do laundry tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I haven't had any clean underwear for three days.

speaker: RORY
words: So right now under your skirt you're wearing...?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not underwear.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's kinda nice, actually -- breezy.

speaker: RORY
words: My role model, ladies and gentlemen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come you haven't run out yet?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. I guess I have more underwear than you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not true. You have less. Have you been doing laundry without me?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: OK, one load.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you didn't even ask if I had stuff to throw in?

speaker: RORY
words: It was a big load. There wasn't any room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm crushed. I'm bleeding. Get me a tourniquet. Oh, no, they're dirty 'cause Rory wouldn't wash them with her stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. I'll do another load tonight, I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never mind. I'll do my own laundry.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, even better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hate doing laundry. Maybe I'll just buy new underwear.
(They walk by Miss Patty's dance class having a dress rehearsal for a Thanksgiving dance outside.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: And flutter, flutter, flutter, flutter, flutter...and leaves. Where are my leaves? I got pumpkins, I got Pilgrims, I got no leaves.
(Rory and Lorelai enter Luke's cafe.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Every other store in town has fall decorations.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hoorah for the mob mentality.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: We're talking a few streamers and a paper turkey. How's it gonna hurt to have a paper turkey?

speaker: LUKE
words: No turkey, no squash, no pumpkins. Nothing colored orange.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: OK, you don't like orange. That's fine. Autumn has many varied hues to toy with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me, can we get some coffee please?

speaker: RORY
words: And a muffin?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Warmed?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This is the Autumn Festival. Your show is right across the street from the Horn of Plenty! You're right smack dab in the middle of everything. You have to decorate.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't have to do anything but serve food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And coffee!

speaker: RORY
words: And muffins!

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylor, I'm tired of having this conversation with you every year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yoo-hoo!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You have lived in Stars Hollow for a long time, young man. It's time you became one of us.
(Lorelai waves money to get Luke's attention.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoo!

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry, I guess my pod's defective.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey. My mom's not wearing any underwear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh!

speaker: RORY
words: Well you aren't.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You're just being selfish, Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Still they don't notice. I can't take it anymore.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: We're talking about the spirit of fall.

speaker: (Lorelai gets the coffee herself and lifts the cover off the muffins.
words: (Lorelai gets the coffee herself and lifts the cover off the muffins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What kind of muffin do you want?

speaker: RORY
words: Blueberry.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know where you can stick the spirit of fall?
(Luke hands Lorelai a utensil to pick up the muffins.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Here, don't use your hands.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I don't think you're taking me seriously.

speaker: LUKE
words: What gave you that idea? (to Lorelai, who is leaving) No tip?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, here's a tip -- serve your customers.

speaker: LUKE
words: Here's another -- don't sit on any cold benches.
(Lorelai and Rory walk out the door.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylore, I swear to God, if you pull those Pilgrims out of your pocket one more time...

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I'm just doing it --

speaker: LUKE No.
words: LUKE No.
(Cut to the street. Rory is geting off the bus from Hartford. She walks into the grocery store. Taylor and Dean are looking at a stack of canned goods.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I don't know. It doesn't really look like the Mayflower.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well we could put a sign on it or something.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I don't know.

speaker: DEAN
words: So do you want to go back to the Plymouth Rock idea?
(Taylor sighs. Dean looks around and sees Rory.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: We'll just live with it that way for a day.
(Dean walks over to Rory, who is pretending to be interested in cornstarch.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You know, you can get two for three bucks.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh really? Excellent deal.

speaker: DEAN
words: You just had a desperate need for some cornstarch?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. I have very important thickening needs, thank you. Nice apron.

speaker: DEAN
words: Nice uniform.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you know, I sewed the buttons on with silver thread so that sets me apart from the crowd. (pause) I guess I should get home.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait a sec. You want a pop or something?

speaker: RORY
words: A pop?

speaker: DEAN
words: Give me a break. In Chicago they call it pop.

speaker: RORY
words: Well in Connecticut we call it free soda. And yes, thank you.
(They walk over to the soda. Dean hides two cans behind his back.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Alright, guess which is in each hand and you get the soda.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, the whole concept a free soda is that it's free, you don't have to work for it.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sorry you gotta sing for your supper.

speaker: RORY
words: Or your soda.

speaker: DEAN
words: Guess.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, in this hand you have --
(As Rory reaches for the soda behind Dean's back, Dean leans down and kisses her. When he pulls back, Rory is stunned.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
(Rory runs out of the store, down the street, and into Mrs. Kim's antique store.)

speaker: RORY
words: Lane? Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: What's wrong?

speaker: RORY
words: I got kissed! And I shoplifted. (Rory is still holding the box of cornstarch.)

speaker: LANE
words: Are you serious? Who kissed you?

speaker: RORY
words: Dean.

speaker: LANE
words: The new kid?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LANE
words: You got the new kid? Oh my God!

speaker: RORY
words: It happened so fast. I was just standing there --

speaker: LANE
words: Where?

speaker: RORY
words: Doose's Market.

speaker: LANE
words: He kissed you in the market?

speaker: RORY
words: On aisle three.

speaker: LANE
words: By the pest spray?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, that's a good aisle.

speaker: RORY
words: What defines a good aisle?

speaker: LANE
words: An aisle where you get kissed by the new kid is a good aisle.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God. I can't breathe.

speaker: LANE
words: OK, sit down.

speaker: RORY
words: No I can't sit down. I'm too -- Oh my God, He kissed me!
(Mrs. Kim comes up to the girls.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Who kissed you?

speaker: LANE
words: The Lord, Mama.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Oh, OK then.
(Mrs. Kim moves away from the girls.)

speaker: LANE
words: So? Tell me everything.

speaker: RORY
words: So I go into the store and he offers me a soda. And then he puts two behind his back and he asks me to pick one and then he kissed me.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm so jealous! That's it, I've got to get some dumb, ugly friends.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go tell my mom.

speaker: LANE
words: Call me later.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.
(Rory starts to leave then stops.)

speaker: LANE
words: What's wrong?

speaker: RORY
words: I can't.

speaker: LANE
words: You can't leave? It's sing your favorite hymn night at the Kim house. Make a run for it.

speaker: RORY
words: My mom doesn't know about Dean.

speaker: LANE
words: So tell her.

speaker: RORY
words: The last time the subject of boys came up it got very ugly.

speaker: LANE
words: Well that was different. She thought you were gonna to quit school over a guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, over Dean.

speaker: LANE
words: OK, fine, but she doesn't have to know it was him.

speaker: RORY
words: She'll know.

speaker: LANE
words: How?

speaker: RORY
words: She's Lorelai, she'll know. What do I do?

speaker: LANE
words: Well maybe she'll be more open to the concept now that you're in school and doing so well and everything.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe.

speaker: LANE
words: Try it.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. I gotta go.

speaker: LANE
words: Hey, was it great?

speaker: RORY
words: It was perfect.

speaker: LANE
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.
(Rory leaves.)
(Cut to Lorelai's kitchen. She's lying half on the floor, half in the empty refrigerator, talking on the phone.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, can you hear that? (pause) No, no, it's higher, it's like a high-pitched kind of an "EEEEEE!" sound. It started last week but it was lower and it only happened when we opened the door and now it's higher and it's on all the time so I think it's really, uh, growing in confidence. (pause) OK, look, I've already told this to three other people so could you just please tell me what is wrong with this fridge? (pause) I'm not going to make the noise again. (pause) I'm not --- EEEEEE! (pause) Look, Jerry, I don't have a lot of pride but I do have enough that I do not want to make that noise again, so could you please, tell me what is wrong with the fridge or connect me with someone who can? (pause) Thank you. Hello...Rusty, great. Listen, my fridge is making this weird sound. It's like a high-pitched -- you know what -- actually, is Jerry still there? (pause) OK, have him make the sound. He knows it. I'll wait. (pause) I know! It does sound bad. (pause) OK,here is the deal. You will send som
(While Lorelai is on the phone, Rory goes into her room and places the box of cornstarch on her dresser where she can see it then returns to the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: So are they coming tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nope. Monday, between three and eight. I am completely useless.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God! Look at this place. It's a sty! Now I'm crabby. I'm crabby and useless. Stupid fridge! Stupid fridge guys! I hate my life.
(Cut to the antique store. Lorelai enters.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello! Hello!
(Mrs. Kim stands up from behind the counter.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God! Quite an entrance. Jeez, my heart.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Rory's not here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I know. I came to pick up that rocker that I bought a couple weeks ago.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Six weeks ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, OK. Well, that's a couple times three. That's six. (no response) Math humor. Not big with a lot of people. Don't feel bad. (Mrs. Kim walks around the store looking for the chair. Lorelai follows.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: This is not a storage facility.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I'm sorry.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: This is a furniture store. Furniture comes in, people buy, then it goes out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Except when Lorelai Gilmore buys. Then furniture stays here for six weeks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about I pay you extra?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I don't want you to pay me extra. I want you to pick up the thing you paid for in the first place.
(Mrs. Kim finds the rocker.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, I remember it smaller.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: It's been six weeks. Maybe it grew.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, well, once again, I'm very sorry. I've just been very busy.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Maybe you should be less busy. Then you can remember to pick up chairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. Absolutely. Smell a rose, got it.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: And then you could keep your daughter from running around kissing boys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane is a young, impressionable girl. She doesn't need to hear about your daughter's kissing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are the lids tight on the paint remover -- because you're sounding a little loopy to me.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Loopy? What's loopy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory's not kissing anybody.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes she is. She came in here and told Lane she kissed a boy in the grocery store. The grocery store! Where we buy our food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This does not make any -- she kissed a boy in the grocery store?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes, yes, yes. The boy in the grocery store. Kiss, kiss, kiss.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. I didn't know. (sadly) She didn't tell me. (pause) I have to go.
(Lorelai quickly leaves the store.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You left your chair! (sighs)
(Cut to the town center. Rory and Lane are dressed like Pilgrim women and are working at the canned goods drive.)

speaker: LANE
words: OK, just one more time.

speaker: RORY
words: I've been telling you this story for an hour. It doesn't get dirty.

speaker: LANE
words: I can't help it. I'm obsessed. I'm totally living vicariously through you.

speaker: RORY
words: Why? You got kissed last weekend. Remember? You told me. That guy your parents set you up with. The one with the Lincoln Continental. What's his name? Patrick Cho!

speaker: LANE
words: OK, let's do a little compare and contrast here. You get kissed on the mouth by a cute, cool, sexy guy you really like. And I get kissed on the forehead by a theology major in a Members-Only jacket who truly believes that rock music leads to hard drugs.

speaker: RORY
words: Fair enough. You can live through me. But just remember that I have no idea what I'm doing.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm well aware of that. That's why I've been diligently gathering information for us.

speaker: RORY
words: What kind of information?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, let's see. Dean's from Chicago, which you know.

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: LANE
words: He likes Nick Drake and Liz Phair and the Sugarplastic and he's deathly allergic to walnuts.

speaker: RORY
words: Walnuts -- bad. Got it.

speaker: LANE
words: Now, he had a girlfriend in Chicago.

speaker: RORY
words: A girlfriend?

speaker: LANE
words: Her name's Beth and they went out for about a year but they split amicably before he left and now she's dating his cousin. Which he doesn't feel too weird about because he doesn't think they were really in love.

speaker: RORY
words: Beth.

speaker: LANE
words: I wouldn't worry about it.

speaker: RORY
words: How'd you get all this information?

speaker: LANE
words: Through his best friend, who, by the way, is really cool. So once you get settled with Dean do you think you could ask him about Todd?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, absolutely. So, Beth, huh? I hate the name Beth. It's so...Beth.

speaker: LANE
words: Now, Todd also said that Dean hasn't been able to talk about anything but you for weeks!
(They giggle and Rory kisses Lane's forehead.)

speaker: LANE
words: Stop it, you're giving me Patrick Cho flashbacks.
(They laugh.)
(Cut to Luke's. Luke is serving Miss Patty and a female customer seated with her.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, Luke, the food here is lovely but you know what would make it even better?

speaker: LUKE
words: some autumn festival decorations?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well food without ambience isn't really food, is it?

speaker: LUKE
words: More iced tea, Patty?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, no, thank you. It's much too depressing in here for tea.

speaker: LUKE
words: You realize Taylor's a head case, right?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes, but at least he's a festive one.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just eat.
(Lorelai is sitting at a table watching Rory and Lane out the window.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Coffee? (no answer) Aw, come on. Are you mad at me too? I mean, a man can't choose whether or not he wants a picture of a fat, stupid bird on his wall? My God, that's the reason the damn Pilgrims came here in the first place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, I wasn't snubbing you. I didn't hear you and now I'm concerned about you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry, just feeling a little persecuted lately. Coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please.

speaker: LUKE
words: You OK?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I'm fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: You don't look fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: I just meant you look concerned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm preoccupied.

speaker: LUKE
words: You look concerned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I'm not.

speaker: LUKE
words: Fine, you just look it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you know some streamers would look so great in here.

speaker: LUKE
words: OK, I'm done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
(Luke walks away. Rory rushes in and sits down.)

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, sorry, sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey. Save your apologies for the Indians, missy.

speaker: RORY
words: People are really in a giving mood today. The horn of plenty is packed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's great. Do you want some coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no, I'll just have a sip of yours. I have to get right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, really? I thought we were having lunch today.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't. We're one Pilgrim short. I only have a couple minutes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. You've been really busy lately.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I guess it's that end-of-the-year rush

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, we haven't even really talked in a couple of days.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you want to talk about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Anything.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Did you read that article in the newspaper about the polar ice caps melting?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. Ooh big deal.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine. You pick the subject.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, OK, great. I was watching General Hospital the other day and you know, they have a new Lucky 'cause the old Lucky went to play something where he could have a real name. So the old Lucky had this girlfriend, Liz, who thought that he died in a fire. So then they bring on this new Lucky and you're all like "OK, I know that's not the old Lucky because the new Lucky has way more hair gel issues" but still, Liz was so upset about his supposed death that you could not wait to see them kiss, you know?

speaker: RORY
words: When do you have time to watch General Hospital?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, let's get back to the point. What do you think about the whole Liz/Lucky kissing thing?

speaker: RORY
words: I think they're actors being paid to play a part so it's nice that they're living up to their obligations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Rory --

speaker: RORY
words: Look, can we finish this very meaningful conversation later? I promised Lane I'd get right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, I'll see you later.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
(Rory leaves quickly. Luke comes back to the table.)

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not gonna say you look concerned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not gonna talk about how good you'd look dressed like one of the guys from 'The Crucible.'

speaker: LUKE
words: Fair enough.
(Lorelai goes to the market and sees Dean working. She hides in an aisle and watches him bag groceries. Luke comes in, spots Lorelai, and walks up behind her.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (startled) Oh, God! What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I asked you first.

speaker: LUKE
words: I ran out of cream.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah me too.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you starin' at?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Don't look, don't look.

speaker: LUKE
words: What is wrong with you today?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory got kissed.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory had her first kiss and that guy did it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: The new kid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yep.
(Luke laughs.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh look at him. Look how smug he is.

speaker: LUKE
words: He's bagging groceries. It's hard to be smug bagging groceries.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh look how he just handled those lemons.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He threw them in the bag. Not tossed them or placed them but threw them like they were nothing to him.

speaker: LUKE
words: They're lemons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're symbolic.

speaker: LUKE
words: OK. We need to get you out of here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. That' Lothario over there has wormed his way into my daughter's heart and mouth and for that he must die!

speaker: LUKE
words: That's it, let's go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're not going to kill the bag boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's double coupon day. You'll bring down the town.
(Luke drags Lorelai out of the store.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, OK. I'm out. Stop pushing me.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you thinking spying on that kid like that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. I just wanted to see him. I mean I've seen him already but that was before he was --

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory's boyfriend?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shush, you.

speaker: LUKE
words: She's growing up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's nothing you can do about that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, Mr. Reality, break into somebody's else's house.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why didn't she tell me?

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why didn't Rory tell me about the kiss?

speaker: LUKE
words: Maybe she didn't know you'd take it so well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Want to hear something crazy?

speaker: LUKE
words: 'Cause all the talk up until now has been so normal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He kind of looks like Christopher.

speaker: LUKE
words: The grocery kid?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. He looks like Christopher.

speaker: LUKE
words: And Christopher is Rory's dad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The hair, the build, something about the eyes. He reminds me of Christopher.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well that's not too surprising.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're going to quote Freud to me? 'Cause I'll push you in front of a moving car. This talk was going so well.

speaker: LUKE
words: You and Rory are a lot alike. It's not surprising you would have similar tastes in men.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I guess. But why? Why didn't she tell me? We tell each other everything.

speaker: LUKE
words: This is different

speaker: LORELAI
words: But we tell each other everything else. But this she keeps a secret. It's 'cause it's a guy thing.

speaker: LUKE
words: Probably.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that's not good. I have to make her understand that I'm OK with the guy thing. 'Cause not talking about guys and our personal lives -- that's me and my mom. That is not me and Rory.

speaker: LUKE
words: Are you OK with the guy thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK...ish.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's not OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it's OK with an -ish.

speaker: LUKE
words: Whatever you say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She just -- she thinks I'll disapprove, right? Well I won't. I will show her that I think this is great. Once she sees that I think this is great, everything will be back to normal between us, right? Right -- OK, good.

speaker: LUK
words: E So you passed the need for an actual person to talk to several minutes ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. Before the gelato stand.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're an amazing woman.

speaker: LOREALI
words: Thank you for noticing.
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Lorelai is sitting on the couch. She gets up and looks out the window then runs back to the couch when she sees Rory is home.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, sorry I'm late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey, no big deal. There's Chinese in the fridge.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.
(Lorelai follows Rory into the kitchen and stands behind her as Rory opens the fridge.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So...kissed any good boys lately?

speaker: RORY
words: Who...?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mrs. Kim.

speaker: RORY
words: (mumbling) Of course.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, he's cute.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, he is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can he spell?

speaker: RORY
words: He can spell and read. How long have you known?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since this morning. You didn't think you were gonna be able to keep it a secret did you? You were making out in the market.

speaker: RORY
words: We weren't making out. It was just one kiss.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well by the time that gets to Miss Patty's it's a scene from 9 1/2 Weeks.

speaker: RORY
words: You've known all this time? At Luke's? Here?

speaker: LORLELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: You could have said something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, funny, I was going to say the same thing to you.

speaker: RORY
words: So...

speaker: LORELAI
words: So...

speaker: RORY
words: What now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now? Nothing?

speaker: RORY
words: No? No lecture about kissing a boy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? Did you do it wrong?

speaker: RORY
words: No...I don't think.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't love the way I found out, but you're getting older. These things are bound to happen occasionally. Actually I think it's great.

speaker: RORY
words: No you don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I do. I'm thrilled.

speaker: RORY
words: Thrilled?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: You're completely weirded out by this aren't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. You're crazy. I'm perfectly fine with it.

speaker: RORY
words: You don't seem fine. You seem the complete opposite of fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you're projecting that on me because you don't want to think that I'm fine when I am, as I have said, fine.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never been finer.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it. You want some?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, thanks. I'm fine.
(Cut to Lorelai and Rory walking down the street.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, we have to be really quick, 'cause the video store's gonna close, so stick to our list. No impulse buying like toothpaste or soap.
(Lorelai starts to go into the market. Rory stops at the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I think we have enough stuff to eat at home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really...where do you live? 'Cause the home I left this morning had nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Well we're ordering pizza. That's enough.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you crazy? You can't watch Willy Wonka without massive amounts of junk food! It's not right. I won't allow it. We're going in.
(Rory hesitates.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, it's fine.

speaker: RORY
words: It's too weird.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna have to meet him eventually.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. How about next year?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm going to be so cool in there you will mistake me for Shaft.

speaker: RORY
words: There will be no interrogation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear.

speaker: RORY
words: No kissing noises. No stories from my childhood. No referring to Chicago as Chitown. No James Dean jokes. No father with a shotgun stares. No Nancy Walker impressions.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh come on!

speaker: RORY
words: Promise me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I really and truly promise. Now can we please go to the market?

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Let's go.
(They go in.)

speaker: RORY
words: I don't see him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. Well maybe he's on a break.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Yeah, maybe he's on a break.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, good. So we can shop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yep.

speaker: RORY
words: Do we want marshmallows?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm...and jelly beans and chocolate kisses. Cookie dough we have at home. Peanut butter. Ooh, do you think they have that thing that's like a sugar stick on one side but then you dip it in the sugar on the other side then you eat it?

speaker: RORY
words: We are going to be so sick. It's amazing that we still function. There he is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Boy, he's tall. That must have been some back-bender, that kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make sure you warm up next time.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, we are leaving now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry. Done now. He's got great eyes! You got to love a guy with great eyes.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And a nice smile.

speaker: RORY
words: Very nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Think we can get him to turn around?

speaker: RORY
words: It's nice too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Trust me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to cashier) Hey.

speaker: CASHIER
words: Oh, you girls having another movie night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah...It's Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

speaker: CASHIER
words: Oh, that's nice. Isn't that the one with Gene Hackman?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, Gene Wilder.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're a Wonka fan?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, Dean, this is my mom, Lorelai. Mom, this is Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice to meet you, Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, you too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice apron.

speaker: DEAN
words: Um...thanks.

speaker: CASHIER
words: Forty-one eighty-three.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wow. It's expensive to slowly rot your insides isn't it? Here you go.

speaker: RORY
words: (taking the bag from Dean) Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Dean, nice meeting you. Hope to see you again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.
(Another employee calls Dean away.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: See that wasn't so bad.

speaker: RORY
words: You're right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said nothing embarrassing, nothing stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: I appreciate that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So chill out, Supermarket Slut.

speaker: RORY
words: See, even a little information in your hands is dangerous.
(They leave.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, the video store closes in ten minutes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you run to the video store and I'll go get coffe.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go, go, go. I'll meet you at Luke's.
(Rory runs off. Dean comes out of the market.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, you forgot your Red Vines.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wow! You totally saved the night. Thanks.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, what are you doing tonight?

speaker: DEAN
words: Me? Uh, well, I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, do you want to come over? We're ordering pizza. We've got a movie. The neighborhood's got a pool going to see who falls into a sugar coma first. I'm the favorite. It might be fun.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, well, um...uh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it's totally casual. I'm sure Rory would love it.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, what time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seven sound good?

speaker: DEAN
words: Sounds fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let me give you our address.

speaker: DEAN
words: That's OK. I know where you live.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course you do. So see you tonight.

speaker: DEAN
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
(Dean goes back in. Rory walks back to Lorelai.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: Got it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Score! You know, on the one hand I'm glad it was in but on the other hand what kind of world do we live in where no one has rented Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory?

speaker: RORY
words: Well we rented it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well thank God for us. Oh, hey, I invited your friend.

speaker: RORY
words: What friend?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: (upset) What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I told him what we were doing tonight and he was totally into it so -- Why are you looking at me like that?

speaker: RORY
words: You invited Dean? To our house?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you crazy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you mad?

speaker: RORY
words: Because we haven't even been out on a date by ourselves yet. My first date with Dean is going to be with my mother? Are -- What is wrong with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. I thought you would be happy about this.

speaker: RORY
words: In what universe would I be happy? This isn't Amish country. Girls and boys usually date alone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't think of it as a date. I thought of it more as a hanging out kind of session.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I don't want our first hanging out session to be with my mother either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop saying mother like that.

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like there's supposed to be another word after it.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe you did this. I'm so humiliated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're totally overreacting. I invited him to a movie and pizza, not to Niagra Falls.

speaker: RORY
words: He's the boy that I like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I looked for one that you hated but it was really short notice.

speaker: RORY
words: And now he's forced to come over and sit with me and my mother and eat crap and watch a movie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I just invited a friend of yours to hang out. What's the big deal? I mean what if Lane had done it?

speaker: RORY
words: You're not Lane. You're my mother. You inviting him over is like Grandma inviting a guy you liked over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're comparing me to my mother?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I just --

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm Emily Gilmore? My, how the mighty have fallen.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't mean that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wasn't trying to humiliate you.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If I was Emily Gilmore I'd be trying to humiliate you.

speaker: RORY
words: I just --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, I'm sorry, OK? I screwed up. I was trying to -- Look, I'll go, I'll uninvite him. I'll tell him that it's cancelled on account of I just found out I'm my mother and I have to go into intensive therapy right now.

speaker: RORY
words: No, you can't uninvite him. He'll think I totally wigged out or something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then I'll just disappear and you guys can be alone.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, and have it look like my mom arranged a date for me? No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do we do?

speaker: RORY
words: He has to come.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It won't be so bad, OK? Just pizza and a movie and hanging out. I promise you won't feel like your mother is there.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. You might, however, feel like my mother is there.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well...
(Cut to Rory's bedroom. Rory is wearing a bathrobe and has clothes spread out all over the bed. Lorelai comes in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. This is good. Add some cold cream and some curlers and let him know what he'll be coming home to every night.

speaker: RORY
words: This was supposed to be a simple night. Watch movie, eat junk, go to bed feeling sick. End of story. Now I'm supposed to look pretty and girly, which is completely impossible because I'm gross and I have nothing to wear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want some help?

speaker: RORY
words: No...yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Uh...let's see. We'll do this and...
(Lorelai looks over the clothes for a minute.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right This says 'hello, I'm hip and cute but also relaxed since this is something I just threw on even though it looks fantastic on me.'

speaker: RORY
words: How'd you do that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I've been staring at that top for twenty minutes. It was just a top. You walked in and in three seconds, it's an outfit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It comes from years of experiencing fashion brain freeze like the one you just had.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you do it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: This whole guy thing. I mean I've watched you when you talk to a man. You have a comeback for everything, you make him laugh, you smile right --

speaker: LORELAI
words: I smile right?

speaker: RORY
words: And then you do the little hair flip.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, twirl. It's a hair twirl.

speaker: RORY
words: And then you walk away and he just stands there, amazed, like he can't believe what just happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because I just stole his wallet.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll never be able to do that. Trig, I can do. But boys and dating? Forget it. I'm a total spaz.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, the talking part, you just get used to. The hair twirl I can teach you. And the leaving him amazed part -- with your brain and killer blue eyes I'm not worried. You'll do fine. Just give yourself a little time to get there.

speaker: RORY
words: Is half an hour enough?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Plenty. Come on. Dab on some lip gloss, clear but fruity. Maybe a little mascara. Wear your hair down and your attitude high.

speaker: RORY
words: You're like a crazy Elsa Klensch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thank you! Come on now, hustle. We got a man coming over.
(Cut to the living room. The table is full of junk food. Lorelai and Rory are sitting on the couch.)

speaker: RORY
words: What time did you tell him to get here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seven.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe something happened. Maybe he's not coming.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe he's just late, Miss German train.
(Lorelai goes to the window and looks out.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oops.

speaker: RORY
words: What?
(Rory joins Lorelai at the window. Dean is standing in the yard next door talking to Babette. Morey is leaning out the window.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: There used be a great club there called -- what was it called baby?

speaker: MOREY
words: Uh...Mr. Kelly's.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, yeah--Mr. Kelly's. You ever go there?

speaker: RORY
words: They've got Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait here.

speaker: BABETTE
words: So, Dean, you like jazz?

speaker: DEAN
words: Sure, yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, he sure does. That's all we ever hear about, right?. Jazz, jazz. Jazz, jazz, jazz. Hey.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Hey, sugar. We were just getting to know your young man, here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I see that. So, Dean, um, would you mind going inside and helping Rory out? There's a struggle with a pickle jar lid that I think she's about to lose.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, sure, yeah.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh it was nice talking to you, Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, you too.

speaker: MOREY
words: Stay cool, kid.

speaker: DEAN
words: I will.
(Dean goes in.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, he's so cute.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: BABETTE
words: And that Chuck Heston chin of his. Is he Rory's boyfriend?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, they're just friends.

speaker: BABETTE
words: That's not what I heard. Kissing at the market. Gives a whole new meaning to tasting day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. I got to get back inside and shower. So I'll talk to you guys later.

speaker: BABETE
words: Yeah, have a good evening. And don't forget to invite us to the wedding. Oh won't their kids be gorgeous!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. God I hope not.
(Cut to the living room.)

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm sorry I'm late. I got here like a half hour ago.

speaker: RORY
words: We believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'd believe you if you said you got here three hours ago.
(They all stand there for a minute.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Dean, how do you like it here in Stars Hollow?

speaker: DEAN
words: I like it. It's quiet, but nice. I like all the trees everywhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, the trees are something. When Rory was little, she found out that one was called a Weeping Willow so she spent hours trying to cheer it up. You know, like telling it jokes and -- No, I'm sorry that was me. (silence) Would you like a tour of the house?

speaker: DEAN
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. So this is the living room where we do our living and, um, upstairs is my room and the good bathroom. And the...kitchen is right through here. You ever heard a fridge yodel before?
(Dean goes into the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: (whispers) Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: microwave for popcorn, stove for storing shoes, refrigerator, which is completely worthless.

speaker: DEAN
words: Interesting.
(The doorbell rings.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'll get that. Rory, you take over as tour guide. Make sure and show him the emergency exits.

speaker: RORY
words: That's my mom.

speaker: DEAN
words: She's got energy.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah well she's 90% water, 10% caffeine.

speaker: DEAN
words: So what's in there?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, that's my room.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really? Can I see it?
(Rory hovers in the doorway while Dean looks around her room. He picks up a CD.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Wow. Very clean. How much does it suck that they use 'Pink Moon' in a Volkswagen commercial?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I know.

speaker: DEAN
words: So you gonna come in?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. I've seen it.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean you look like you're glued to the door there.

speaker: RORY
words: No -- I'm just, uh, observing my room from a new perspective. You know, I hardly ever stand here. It's really making me rethink my throw pillows.

speaker: DEAN
words: Would you like me to get out of here?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'm fine with you looking around.
(Dean picks up a stuffed chicken and laughs.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Nice chicken

speaker: RORY
words: Or, you know, at least I was.
(Cut to the front door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: We do not need dessert, Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, everybody needs dessert. So, where is Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: With Dean.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Dean? Oh, that's right, yeah, Dean is here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, right. OK. You need to go now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Please. I just want one little peek.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (stalling) OK, fine, so, uh, how are you? How are you doing? How you doing? Are you --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm concerned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're stalling.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Am I?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: (Lorelai opens the door to let Sookie out. The pizza delivery guy is standing on the other side.
words: (Lorelai opens the door to let Sookie out. The pizza delivery guy is standing on the other side.

speaker: JOE
words: Hey, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Joe. What do I owe ya?

speaker: JOE
words: Fifteen even.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. How are you doing?

speaker: JOE
words: Awesome.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What did you get on your pizza? Did you ask for extra sauce? Because I always ask for extra sauce because sometimes --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, she's already freaked out that I invited him here. If she thinks I'm parading him around in front of all my friends, she'll kill me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But I just --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Death, bloody and slow, OK?

speaker: RORY
words: (from her room) Mom, is that the pizza?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. (to Sookie) OK, bye. Now go.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bu I just wanted --

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Bye.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye-bye.
(Lorelai ushers Sookie --with the pizza-- out the door just as Rory and Dean come in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So are you hungry?

speaker: DEAN
words: Starving.

speaker: RORY
words: Where's the pizza?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The pizza's, uh --

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Pizza!
(Sookie comes inside.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just bringing in the pizza. Hi, I'm Sookie. I'm a friend of Lorela's.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hi.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi. Nice to meet you, Dean. I mean, not that I knew you were Dean. But you do look like a Dean. Doesn't he look like a Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Of all the people in this room he looks most like a Dean. Bye Sookie. Have fun!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK.
(Sookie leaves.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Here, um, I'll take that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thanks. Great. The coffee table's fine.
(Dean goes into the living room.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (whispers) I did not invite her here.

speaker: RORY
words: (whispers) Why didn't you just set up a camera and broadcast it over the internet?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (whispers) Because I don't think that big.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thank God there's good pizza here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. Now we didn't know what kind you liked so we just got everything.

speaker: DEAN
words: Everything is fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, well, while it's hot.
(Time lapse. They are all seated on the floor eating popcorn.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who needs more?

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wow. You can eat.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I can. Oh that's bad isn't it?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, uh, most girls don't eat. It's good you eat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm all for it.

speaker: RORY
words: Let's talk about something besides my eating habits, shall we?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oooh -- Oompa Loompas!

speaker: RORY
words: My mom has a thing for the Oompa Loompas.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't think finding them amusing constitutes a thing.

speaker: RORY
words: No, but having a recurring dream about marrying one does.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't even get me started on your Prince Charming crush, OK? At least my obsessions are alive. You have a thing for a cartoon.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ooh, Prince Charming, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: It was a long time ago. And not the Cinderella one, the Sleeping Beauty one.

speaker: DEAN
words: 'Cause he could dance.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've got sisters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, come on, Dean, tell us some of your embarrassing secrets.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I have no embarrassing secrets.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, please.

speaker: RORY
words: I bet I know one.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: The theme from Ice Castles makes you cry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's a good one.

speaker: DEAN
words: That's not true.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I've got one. At the end of The Way We Were, you wanted Robert Redford to dump his wife and kid for Barbra Streisand.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've never seen The Way We Were.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh!

speaker: RORY
words: Are you kidding?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you waiting for? Heartache, laughter --

speaker: RORY
words: Communism.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All in one neat package.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll have to experience that sometime.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Next movie night.

speaker: RORY
words: It's a plan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get the popcorn.

speaker: RORY
words: Bring in the spray cheese.
(Lorelai leaves.)

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, at what point does the outsider get to suggest a movie for movie night?

speaker: RORY
words: That depends. What movie are you thinking of?

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know...Boogie Nights, maybe.

speaker: RORY
words: You'll never get that past Lorelai.

speaker: DEAN
words: Not a Marky Mark fan?

speaker: RORY
words: She had a bad reaction to Magnolia. She sat there screaming for three hours 'I want my life back!' and then we got kicked out of the theater. It was actually a pretty entertaining day.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: I guess I'll have to come up with a different movie then.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess you will.

speaker: DEAN
words: That Oompa Loompa -- right there. You know when he's dancing?
(Lorelai starts coming back to the living room, sees Rory and Dean sitting side by side, and goes back into the kitchen to read a magazine.)
(Time lapse. Rory tries to get more comfortable. Dean places a pillow behind her back.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
(Rory stares at Dean but turns away when he looks over at her.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll be right back.
(Cut to the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing in here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Trying to find the best bathing suit for my bust size.

speaker: RORY
words: Well get back in there!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? What happened? Did the bag boy try something?

speaker: RORY
words: He's sitting in there and he's watching the movie and he's perfect and he smells really good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: He smells really good and he looks amazing and I am stupid. I said 'thank you.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You said 'thank you?'

speaker: RORY
words: When he kissed me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He kissed you again? What is he just out of prison or something?

speaker: RORY
words: No, not now. Yesterday. At the store.

speaker: LORELAI
