words: Oh, all right. Strike the prison comment. He kissed you and you said 'thank you?'

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that was very polite.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it was stupid. And I don't know what I'm doing here. You're sitting in the kitchen. What kind of chaperone are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me? I'm not trying to be a chaperone. I'm trying to be a girlfriend.

speaker: RORY
words: Well switch gears, 'cause I'm freaking out here!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You really like him, don't you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LOREAI
words: Well, OK, then. Just calm down.

speaker: RORY
words: I just don't want to do or say anything else that's gonna be remotely moronic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm afraid once your heart is involved it all comes out in Moron.

speaker: RORY
words: Just please come back in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Let's go then.

speaker: RORY
words: Wait we can't go back in together though because that would be too obvious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. OK. I'll go in first and you go to the bathroom.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Good. Tell him I had to wash my face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. 'Cause of all the sugar you ate.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes! Good. Very good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.
(Lorelai sits on the floor beside Dean.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. I'm back. Rory went to wash her face.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, OK.
(They sit in silence for a minute until Lorelai turns the TV off.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean. I don't know exactly how to say this, but, um, this is a very different kind of household you walked into tonight.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See...Rory is my daughter.

speaker: DEAN
words: (rolling his eyes) Ah...here comes the talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about I talk, you listen? Rory is a smart kid. She's never been much for guys so the fact that she likes you means a lot. I don't believe she'd waste her time with some loser.

speaker: DEAN
words: But you're watching me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweetheart, the whole town is watching you. That girl in there is beloved around here. You hurt her, there's not a safe place within a hundred miles for you to hide. This is a very small, weird place you've moved to.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've noticed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So just know all eyes are on you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Anything else?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's not going on your motorcycle.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't have a motorcycle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's not going on your motorcycle.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, she won't go on my motorcycle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Curfew will be enforced. You will not detract from her schoolwork, and you're going to start handling those lemons better.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't interrupt me when I'm speaking. I reserve the right to change, alter, tweak, or add to this list of rules at any given time without any written notice. Am I clear?

speaker: DEAN
words: You're clear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: DEAN
words: My turn to speak?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, go ahead.

speaker: DEAN
words: You can lay on all the rules you want and you can have the whole town spy on me and stare at me and chase me through the streets --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I like the chase you through the streets idea.

speaker: DEAN
words: But I'm not going anywhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it's gonna be a short chase then isn't it?

speaker: DEAN
words: I need you not to hate me. If you hate me then I don't have a shot in hell with Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory has her own mind.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah but you're her best friend and what you think means everything to her and you know that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanna like you. 'Cause Rory likes you.

speaker: DEAN
words: But you don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want to and I usually get what I want.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fair enough.
(Lorelai turns the TV back on.)

speaker: DEAN
words: She's taking a long time on her face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, Rory's a perfectionist.
(Cut to the front porch. Rory and Dean are leaning against the railing.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Tell your mom thanks for inviting me.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry if this was totally weird. I mean with my mom inviting you over and --

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, no, it was good. Really.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.
(They kiss.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Thank you.
(Dean leaves.)
(Cut to Lorelai's bedroom. She's lying on the bed. Rory comes in and lies down next to her.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So that went well.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, not bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did I humiliate you?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. What did you say to him when I went to the bathroom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That you're pretty.

speaker: RORY
words: Liar.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah...well.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna go to bed.
(Rory starts to leave. Lorelai sighs.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, what's the matter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes there is. Come on, tell me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I just really wanted you to tell me about that kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm so sorry. I really wanted to, I swear. I just got scared and --

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I'm not mad. I just wanted to hear about it. That's all. It's no big deal. It's OK, I'm fine. It's one too many Caramello bars. I'm sorry. You have school, I have work, so time for bed.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, night, hon.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm?

speaker: RORY
words: I know this is lame and totally after the fact but --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Start from the beginning and you leave anything out you die! Where were you?

speaker: RORY
words: OK, I was in the aisle where the ant spray is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a good aisle.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, that's what Lane said too. But anyway, so he was working and I go into the store and I sort of walked around and was pretending to shop...

speaker: The End
words: The End
(Emily, Rory, and Lorelai are having dinner.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Your grandfather called last night and told me to let you know he's bringing you back something very special from Prague.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, Prague. How amazing is it that he's going to Prague?

speaker: EMILY
words: It's supposed to be lovely, very dramatic castles everywhere.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you know the cell that Václav Havel was held in is now a hostel? You can stay there for like $50 a night.
(Rory turns to Lorelai, who is playing with her food.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, maybe on our big trip to Europe we could go to Prague and stay in his cell.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely. And then we can go to Turkey and stay in that place from Midnight Express.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, what are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Getting rid of the avacado.

speaker: EMILY
words: Since when do you not like avacado?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since the day I said, "Gross. What is this?" and you said, "Avacado."

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Rory) I'm focusing on you now. Tell me all about the Chilton formal next week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's a formal?

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know about the formal?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, how do you know about the formal?

speaker: EMILY
words: I read my Chilton newsletter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since when do you get a Chilton newsletter?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well as a major contributor to Rory's education I figured I had the right to ask for a newsletter to be sent to my house.
(Emily goes to get her copy of the newsletter.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you serious?

speaker: EMILY
words: And it's a good thing, too, since you don't bother to read yours. One of us should be up to date on the goings-on at Rory's school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Mom, I read my newsletter.

speaker: EMILY
words: You did?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right.

speaker: EMILY
words: What was the picture on the cover?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (uncertainly) It was a picture of a really rich kid in plaid.

speaker: EMILY
words: (shows Lorelai the cover) It was a spotted owl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: In plaid.
(Rory holds back laughter.)

speaker: EMILY
words: The owls are endangered and Chilton is taking donations to help them. (to Rory) You gave a very nice one, in case you're interested.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, don't be giving donations on Rory's behalf. I'll do that.

speaker: EMILY
words: How can you do that when you don't bother to read the newsletter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I read the newsletter.

speaker: EMILY
words: You didn't know they were taking donations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a private school. They're always taking donations. They teach a class in it. I'll get them next time.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well what about the owls?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They'll live.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well apparently they won't, dear. That's why they need the donations in the first place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Rory) So, you have a formal coming up?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but I don't think I'm going to go.

speaker: EMILY
words: Nonsense. Of course you're going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, if Rory doesn't want to go she doesn't have to go.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I don't understand why she wouldn't want to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you don't.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna go get another Coke.

speaker: EMILY
words: What did you say to her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: EMILY
words: If she doesn't want to go it must be because of something you said.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I promise. All I ever said to her about dances is that you go, you dance, you have punch, you eat, you take a picture, and then you get auctioned off to a biker gang from Sausalito.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, this is serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I said nothing, OK? Rory's disdain of formals is totally her own. Let's just drop it, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.
(They both go back to their food.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What's wrong with the tomato?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was fraternizing with the enemy.
(Cut to the interior of a car. Lorelai and Rory are driving home.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why didn't you mention the dance?

speaker: RORY
words: 'Cause I'm not going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. But why aren't you going?

speaker: RORY
words: 'Cause I hate dances.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good answer. Except you've never actually been to a dance.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you really have nothing to compare it to.

speaker: RORY
words: No, but I can imagine it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's true. However, not really, since you've never actually been to one you're basing all your dance opinions on one midnight viewing of Sixteen Candles.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you should have a decent reason for hating something before you really decide you hate it.

speaker: RORY
words: Trust me, I'll hate it. It'll be stuffy and boring, the music will suck and since none of the kids at school like me, I'll be stuck in the back listening to 98° watching Tristin and Paris argue over which one of them gets to make me miserable first.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Or it'll be all sparkly and exciting and you'll be standing on the dance floor listening to Tom Waits with some great-looking guy staring at you so hard that you don't even realize that Paris and Tristin have just been eaten by bears.

speaker: RORY
words: What guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know -- maybe the guy who hangs out in our trees all day waiting for you to come home?

speaker: RORY
words: Dean does not hang out in trees.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He bashed his head on a branch last week when I came out of the house too quickly.

speaker: RORY
words: Why do you care all of sudden if I go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't care if you go. I just don't want you to miss any experience because you're too afraid.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm afraid? Of what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of asking Dean. Of him saying 'no.' Of going to a dance with a bunch of kids who haven't accepted you yet. Of dancing in public. Of finding out you should never be dancing in public.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, OK, I get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, I know you are not Miss Party Girl, and I love you for that, but sometimes I wonder -- do you not join in because you really don't want to or because you're too shy? If the reason you don't want to go is because you really don't want to go and not because you are in any way afraid, then this is the last time I'll mention it, I promise.

speaker: RORY
words: (uncertainly) I don't have a dress.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I could make you one.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. We could get some great shoes and some new earrings. You could get your hair done.

speaker: RORY
words: You won't think I'm an idiot?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Depends on what hairstyle you choose. This dance could be great for you.
(Cut to Lane and Rory walking in the snow.)

speaker: RORY
words: He's gonna say no.

speaker: LANE
words: Why would he say no.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would he say yes?

speaker: LANE
words: Rory, listen to me. There's absolutely no point in having a boyfriend if you can't get him to go to the dance with you.

speaker: RORY
words: He's not my boyfriend.

speaker: LANE
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LANE
words: What is he then?

speaker: RORY
words: He's my...gentleman caller.

speaker: LANE
words: OK, Blanche.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know what he is. But he's not my boyfriend. Do you think he's my boyfriend.

speaker: LANE
words: I think you guys spend a lot of time not kissing other people if this isn't a girlfriend/boyfriend thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Girlfriend.

speaker: LANE
words: You.

speaker: RORY
words: Boyfriend.

speaker: LANE
words: Him.

speaker: RORY
words: No. It sounds weird.

speaker: LANE
words: Look, have you had the talk yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, Lane, babies come from the stork.

speaker: LANE
words: The other talk.

speaker: RORY
words: What other other talk?

speaker: LANE
words: "We've been dating a few weeks no. Where do we stand? What are we to each other? If another girls asks you out, do you feel free to go?"

speaker: RORY
words: How is it that you know so much about this?

speaker: LANE
words: Those who can, do. Those who can't, teach.
(They look in the window of the market and see Dean with a customer.)

speaker: LANE
words: There he is.

speaker: RORY
words: I should do this later.
(Rory starts to leave. Lane stops her.)

speaker: LANE
words: No. No, you have to do this now.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: Because I have to go home soon and my mom threw out our TV when she caught me watching V.I.P. So I'm bored and I need some entertainment.

speaker: RORY
words: (takes a deep breath) OK. Here I go.

speaker: LANE
words: Good luck! Oh, and Rory, remember to enunciate. I'm reading lips out here.
(Rory goes into the market, leaving Lane with her face plastered to the window. Rory walks up to Dean.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, hey.

speaker: RORY
words: You're busy.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I just have to put the new green bean shipment on the shelves. You want to help?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, sure. I, uh, I love stocking beans.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK. Uh, follow me.

speaker: RORY
words: So do you work on Saturdays? I forget.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well it depends. Sometimes I come in if I don't have any plans. Why?

speaker: RORY
words: No reason. See, there's this thing at my school on Saturday. Well it's not really at my school, it's kind of given by my school .

speaker: DEAN
words: What is it?

speaker: RORY
words: Well it's this thing where you go and they play music and you're supposed to get all dressed up and do some kind of dance and then there's chicken.

speaker: DEAN
words: Chicken?

speaker: RORY
words: Well I don't know if there's chicken. But at these kinds of things they often serve chicken because it's probably cheaper and people eat it, so the logic behind the chicken choice really isn't that bad.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm lost

speaker: RORY
words: It's a dance.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ah.

speaker: RORY
words: And it's not like I'm dying to go or anything, but it is a new school and being a part of the social activities is really important at Chilton.

speaker: DEAN
words: So are you asking me to go to the dance with you?

speaker: RORY
words: No. Yes. I mean, if you wanted to go, I would go too.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well that would probably be good since it's your school.

speaker: RORY
words: Right. So do you want to go?

speaker: DEAN
words: Honestly?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've actually never gone to a dance before.

speaker: RORY
words: Because they're lame?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. And it's just not the way I ever wanted to spend my time. I mean, I'm not a big joiner.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, fair enough. More beans please.
(They stack beans in silence.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You want to go, don't you?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I don't. I have no desire to go at all. I was just thinking out loud, that's all.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, what would I have to wear?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: To this dance. What would I have to wear?

speaker: RORY
words: Anything you want.

speaker: DEAN
words: Come on.

speaker: RORY
words: No, really whatever you're comfortable in is fine.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory...

speaker: RORY
words: Some sort of pants would be nice.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory...

speaker: RORY
words: It's coat and tie.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh man.

speaker: RORY
words: But you could probably get away with a coat and no tie.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.
(Rory kisses Dean.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're welcome.
(Rory goes back outside where Lane is waiting.)
(Cut to Lorelai making a dress on a dressmaker's dummy. While she's bending down, she falls over, bringing the dummy down on top of her.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aaaah!
(The doorbell rings.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ow.
(Lorelai gets up and goes to answer the door.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Extra thread.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, God bless. I've been working so hard to finish Rory's dress I haven't been to get out.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jeez, you are walking funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Rory's dress made a pass at me and I think I pulled something getting up.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Here, sit, sit sit. Hey, you know what, I've got an Ace bandage in my bag. I'm not sure how we can wrap it but maybe we can do something kind of creative and --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie. Ow

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Let's see.
(Sookie pulls bottles of pills out of her purse.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK, I've got Percodan, Vicodin, Darvocet, and, uh...Take this one. It's a muscle relaxer. Very mild, I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. Maybe later.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK. I've got to go. You sure you're going to be OK?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sure.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye.
(The phone rings.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: You sound terrible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine, Mom, I just stubbed my toe.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe you should get rid of some of that clutter in your living room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe

speaker: EMILY
words: That room is a hazard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, you know, I've seen the light. Everything goes. What else have you got?

speaker: EMILY
words: I want to talk about Rory's dance. It's just killing me that she's not going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: EMILY
words: It may seem frivolous and silly to her now but belive me, these are the kind of experiences you regret missing later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.

speaker: EMILY
words: And regret can make you bitter. Do you want Rory to be bitter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, sort of.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, Mom? She can make some cash off of it. Become a crazy Oscar Levant kind of celebrity, go on talk shows, heckle Regis.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wish you would take this seriously.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Rory is going to the dance.

speaker: EMILY
words: She is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, that's wonderful. I'm thrilled.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm making her dress right now.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're making her dress?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yep.

speaker: EMILY
words: But why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so she'll look really ugly and people will point and throw rocks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don't you let me buy her a dress?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, you were thrilled five seconds ago, remember?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're not using the curtains are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I gotta go.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just one more thing. Take a picture of Rory for me, will you please?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will.

speaker: EMILY
words: On the stairs. And one by the front door. And one as she's getting ready, you know, putting her hair up, putting her makeup on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, do you want one when she's shaving her legs? You know, one leg up in the tub, waving the disposable razor in the air?

speaker: EMILY
words: This is a once in a lifetime event. You get to be there and I don't.
(Lorelai lies down on the floor, trying to get comfortable.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, boy.

speaker: EMILY
words: I figure if I got enough pictures I could at least line them up in chronological order and pretend I was there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe bind them together, make a flipbook out of them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, would you like to come over on Saturday and see Rory go to the dance?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, what a nice idea, I'd love that, thank you. I'll see you at 7.
(Emily hangs up the phone. Lorelai sighs.)
(Tristin walks up to the table where Paris is selling tickets to the Chilton Winter Formal.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Hi, Tristin.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Two, I assume.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You assume right.

speaker: PARIS
words: So, who are you taking?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why, are you free?

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm, uh...

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nah, what am I thinking? You wouldn't be free this close to the dance.
(He hands her some money and she hands him the tickets.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Here's your change.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey, is your hair shorter?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah, a quarter of an inch.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Really.

speaker: PARIS
words: I got it trimmed.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Looks good.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thanks.
(Tristin walks down the hall to where Rory is reading while waiting in line to buy tickets.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: And she's reading again. How novel.

speaker: RORY
words: Good-bye, Tristin.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Did you get the novel thing? Because...

speaker: RORY
words: I said good-bye.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: I like lines.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: The guy's supposed to buy the tickets.

speaker: RORY
words: Really. Does Susan Faludi know about this?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Unless of course there is no guy.

speaker: RORY
words: There's a guy.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: A cheap guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what can I say? I like 'em cheap. Sloppy too -- bald spot, beer gut, you know, and the pants that kind of slip down in the back, giving you that good plumber shot. That sends me through the roof.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So who is he?

speaker: RORY
words: How many languages can you say 'none of your business' in.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Does he go to this school?

speaker: RORY
words: No, he doesn't.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh-huh. Well, look, OK, I'll confess something to you. I don't have a date.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I hear Squeaky Fromme is up for parole soon. You should keep a good thought.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well I actually thought you'd like to go with me.

speaker: RORY
words: You did not.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I did too.

speaker: RORY
words: You did not because you are not stupid.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: Slimy and weasely, yes, but stupid, no. You'd have to be stupid to think that, given our history, I would ever, barring a piano or a safe falling on my head, want to go anywhere with you, ever.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: OK, fine. I'll take Cissy.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll send her a condolence card.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah. Well at least she won't be buying her own ticket.
(Tristin walks down the hall. Rory is next in line.)

speaker: RORY
words: Two, please.

speaker: PARIS
words: Idiot.

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: PARIS
words: He was totally nice to you and you couldn't be a bigger jerk.

speaker: RORY
words: You like Tristin so much, you go out with him.

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't have enough change.

speaker: RORY
words: Pay me later.

speaker: PARIS
words: What am I, your Versateller? Wait for change. (yells at the boy sitting next to her) I need change! Now! (to Rory) There's no way you're going with someone better than Tristin.

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever.

speaker: PARIS
words: You probably don't even have a date. You're probably going to come down with some very rare form of flu that only hits losers on dance night.

speaker: RORY
words: You know what? I don't want my change. Money makes people shallow.
(Rory walks away from Paris.)

speaker: PARIS
words: I've got your change. Hey! Hey! If you think I'm keepig this dollar, I'm not!

speaker: BOY
words: I'll take it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Shut up!
(Saturday night. Lorelai is sitting on the couch reading a magazine.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (calls to Rory) Come on already!

speaker: RORY
words: (from her room) I'm primping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're 16. You have skin like a baby's ass. There's nothing to primp.

speaker: RORY
words: OK, OK, here I come.
(Rory comes into the room wearing her dress for the dance.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Someone hit you with a pretty stick.

speaker: RORY
words: This dress is amazing. You outdid yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's beautiful, babe, you look beautiful. Come here.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stray hair.

speaker: RORY
words: Fix, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Hm. I think my favorite part is the shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: The heels hurt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, beauty is pain

speaker: RORY
words: I'll just throw them on on my way out

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you should put them on now and let your feet get really numb.

speaker: RORY
words: That's sick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go get me the hair spray.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.
(Rory runs to get her shoes. The doorbell rings.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's open!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's me! I got tacos!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yay!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I got extra hot sauce and a couple of extra burritos to put in the fridge in case you get hungry later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You take such good care of me.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, Sookie. Look.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (gasps) Oh my God! You're a movie star! I'm serious. Oh my -- At some point tonight, walk down a flight of stairs. Movie stars always walk down staircases.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, come on, let me spray while you try to figure out what she just said.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You, don't move. I got it.
(Sookie points the bottle in the wrong direction and ends up spraying her eyes instead of Rory's hair.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ow!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wrong way! I got it.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you OK?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, sweetie, hand that to your mother, and my eyelashes are all stuck together.

speaker: (Sookie stag
words: (Sookie stag

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, are you sure you're alright?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Rory) Shield the tacos. OK, ready?
(Rory puts the tacos under the table and covers her eyes. Lorelai sprays her hair.)

speaker: RORY
words: God!

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, that will be good for six slow dances, four medium ones, one lambada, but if you plan on doing any moshing I suggest another coat.

speaker: RORY
words: I think I'm good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Rory, sweetie, is this soap by the sink in the silver bottle?

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go in there, quick.
(The doorbell rings.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're in here!

speaker: EMILY
words: We're in here? That's how you answer the door?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I was all out of Saran Wrap.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't even want to figure that one out. I just want to see my granddaughter. Where is she?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kitchen.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, perfect. I want to be all ready for the big entrance. How's the light in here? Never mind. I'll just take one with the flash and one without to make sure we got it right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, Mom, look at you. You'd think Anne Taylor was having a sale or something.
(Emily, armed with a camera, gets into position.)

speaker: EMILY
words: OK, Rory, come in here please.
(Rory comes into the living room wearing a kitchen towel as a bib and eating a taco.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, Grandma

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Lorelai) She has lived with you too long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, lose the bib and the taco, put your shoes on, come back out, and let Grandma take the pretty picture.

speaker: RORY
words: OK.
(Sookie comes in.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm gonna get going.

speaker: LOREAI
words: You are not driving.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I walked. (to the staircase) It was nice to see you again, Mrs. Gilmore, or at least make out your shape.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call in fifteen minutes or I'm sending out a search party.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (to the wall) And you call me if I can come over and help you up the stairs or something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'll be fine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why would you need help up the stairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No reason. Rory, let's go, your public awaits!

speaker: EMILY
words: Why aren't you moving?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm comfortable, that's all.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you hurt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a little back spasm, that's it. It's no big deal.

speaker: EMILY
words: What sort of back spasm?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know, Mom, just a normal one.

speaker: EMILY
words: There is nothing normal about a back spasm. The very fact that it has the word spasm in it means it's not normal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, here she is, Mom, get your camera moving.

speaker: EMILY
words: What? Oh, my, you're gorgeous. Oh! Smile!
(Emily takes several pictures of Rory.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm so glad you decided to buy her a dress.
(Lorelai and Rory exchange a look. A car horn sounds outside.)

speaker: RORY
words: That's Dean!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, come here. Have an amazing time.
(Rory kisses Lorelai and Emily and then Rory runs for the door.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'll chronicle the whole evening for you, I promise. Bye, Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where are you going?

speaker: RORY
words: To the dance.

speaker: EMILY
words: You do not go running out the door when a boy honks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, it's fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: It certainly is not fine. This is not a drive through. She's not fried chicken.

speaker: RORY
words: But I told him to honk and I'd meet him out there. We agreed.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't care what you told him. If he wants to take you out, he will walk up to this door, and know, and say 'good evening,' and come inside for a moment like any civilized human being would know to do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, Mom, this is silly, I have met him already.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I haven't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but--

speaker: EMILY
words: We will wait until he comes to the door.

speaker: RORY
words: He doesn't know he's supposed to.

speaker: EMILY
words: He will figure it out.
(Rory sighs and crosses her arms. They wait in silence. A minute or so later, Dean honks again.)

speaker: EMILY
words: He's not a very bright boy, is he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.
(The doorbell rings. Rory starts to run to the door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't rush. A lady never rushes.
(Rory runs to the door anyway.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, uh, I thought I was supposed to honk.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, I'm sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: Young man, come in here please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Dean, meet my mother, Emily Post.

speaker: EMILY
words: Emily Gilmore

speaker: DEAN
words: Hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great rap session. Alright, you guys are out of here. Have fun.

speaker: EMILY
words: Be home by eleven
(Lorelai mouths 'twelve.')

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Mom, by Grandma.
(Rory and Dean leave.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you know about this boy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that Rory likes him and that his parole officer has high hopes for his rehabilitation.

speaker: EMILY
words: Does he drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like a fish.

speaker: EMILY
words: That's not a crazy question.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is a crazy question, Mom, because if I had knowledge of him being a drinker, he would not be with Rory now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, but--

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please relax. Dean is a good kid. Rory's gonna have a great time. You got your pictures and tomorrow I will call you and give you all the details.

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you going to do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you certainly can't be left alone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I can.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can barely move. You've been sitting on that couch since I got here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because this is a right comfy couch.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe I should stay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, Mom, you really don't have to do that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not leaving my daughter stranded on the couch. What if you need to get to the bathroom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't go anymore, Mom. I gave it up cold turkey.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm staying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom...Look -- I can stand, OK?
(Lorelai, obviously in pain, stands slowly.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: See? I'm up. OK, see? I'm fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Move. If you're fine, than move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can move. This is me moving. (nothing happens) Any second now the moving will begin. (nothing happens) Rats.
(Lorelai flops back on the couch.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll go start some tea. Please tell me you have something besides Lipton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (muttering to herself) Oh, a stroke would be so good right about now.
(Cut to Rory and Dean. They are in the car on the way to the dance.)

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we should just forget about this

speaker: DEAN
words: OK.

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, it's just a dance. What's the big deal?

speaker: DEAN
words: Beats me.

speaker: RORY
words: And these kids at my school -- awful. Have you seen The Outsiders?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I have.

speaker: RORY
words: Just call me Ponyboy. I heard this place is beautiful though -- old and historic.

speaker: DEAN
words: Huh.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we could just go in for a minute.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Or not.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine too.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Why can't I decide? This is stupid. What do you think?

speaker: DEAN
words: I think that you look amazing.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe just a couple minutes won't hurt.
(Cut to Lorela and Emily. Emily is on the phone. Lorelai is still on the couch.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Marta. Just make sure everything's locked up before you leave. (pause) No, I won't be home tonight.
(Lorelai groans.)

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Lorelai) Was that a pain?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. A big one.

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Marta) Alright. That's it. Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Mom, you really, really don't have to do this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't be silly. I couldn't possibly leave you alone like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing, Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm trying to find the candlesticks I bought you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What candlesticks?

speaker: EMILY
words: The Baccarat candlesticks I bought you last year for Christmas. I assumed you stuffed them in the back of the closet somewhere.
(Lorelai sits up and looks worried.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well, no, I did not stuff them in the back of the closet.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well then where are they? I don't see them out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (hesitantly) Well, see, we didn't actually have a...big use for the crystal candlesticks so I kind of...exchanged them.

speaker: EMILY
words: For what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A monkey lamp.

speaker: EMILY
words: Pardon me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a lamp with a bunch of monkeys on it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Baccarat candlesticks for a moneky lamp?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're really, really happy monkeys, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where is this lamp? I want to see it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's right there on the desk.
(Emily walks over to the lamp and looks closely at it.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God! They're holding coconuts and leering!

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's funny.

speaker: EMILY
words: You traded my lovely gift for for a semi-pornographic leering monkey lamp? How could you?
(Lorelai shrugs.)

speaker: EMILY
words: This is not just about the bad breeding of returning a gift. This goes right to the heart of the question of taste. You were given something of substance and you cast it off for a ridiculous, slightly sinister barroom decoration. Explain this to me, Lorelai.
(As her mother rants, Lorelai's smile turns to a frown. She sinks lower on the couch and covers herself with a blanket.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: My back hurts.
(Cut to the Chilton dance. Rory and Dean are standing near the back of the room.)

words: Well it's a very good room.

words: Looks historical.

speaker: RORY
words: I commend the person that suggested this very location.

words: Yeah?

words: I stress a little.

words: I'm bored.

words: Wow.

words: What?

words: Rory Gilmore. God, she's got good hair.

words: Who's the dish?

words: Beats me.

words: He's not of the manor born, that's for sure. Let's go.

speaker: RORY
words: So, should we dance or should we sit first?

words: Rory...you came. Oh, great dress. Who's it by?

speaker: RORY
words: Lorelai Gilmore.

words: You made it yourself?

words: No, my mom made it for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

words: So you traveling with a bodyguard now?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. This is my -- this is Dean. Dean, this is Louise and Madeline.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

words: My mom can't make anything.

words: (flirting) How tall are you?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh...

words: Soup! She can make soup!

words: You know, my whole family is really tall. The men, mostly. What are you -- 6'1", 6'2"?

speaker: RORY
words: What, does he get like a prize if he guesses?

speaker: MADELINE
words: One kind of soup, actually. It's green, lumpy.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Actually, she can't make soup either.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Six-two's a good height.

words: You think?

speaker: LOUISE
words: I think.

speaker: DEAN
words: Huh.
(Dean moves behind Rory and puts his arms around her waist.)

words: What do you think? Too tall?

speaker: RORY
words: Not in heels.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good.

words: Although the saddle shoes make it kind of difficult.

words: Well I'll just have to stoop then.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess so.

words: OK. I'm bored.

words: I like your dress.

words: Thanks.

words: Hey, you're nice.

words: Slow song.

words: Let's go.

words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

words: I see you came.

words: You sold me the ticket.

words: Hi, I'm Rory. This is Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hi.

speaker: JACOB
words: Hi.

words: Excuse us.
(Paris drags Jacob away.)

words: Those are not friends.

words: I was being polite.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well don't

words: So, that's Paris?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, it is.

words: She seems fun.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, yeah, she is.

words: OK, so, this dancing thing is not something I want you to get used to or comment on.

speaker: RORY
words: Now, that goes both ways.

words: Hey, if I kiss you is a nun gonna come out here and boot me out of here

words: It's not a Catholic school.

speaker: DEAN
words: So I can kiss you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, you can kiss me.

words: Nope.

words: Nope.

words: Yeah, alright, let's go.

words: So, Ponyboy, you happy?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I'm happy.
(Cut to Lorelai and Emily.)

words: There you go.

words: Mom, I think somebody already ate that.

speaker: EMILY
words: That is a mashed banana on toast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.

speaker: EMILY
words: I used to make this for you all the time when you were a little girl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, whenever you got sick I made this.

words: Are you sure it wasn't the other way around?

speaker: EMILY
words: You don't want it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, I want it.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll just take it back to the kitchen

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom, I said I want it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you sure? Because I can throw it away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Relinquish the banana, please. Mmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can't possibly be comfortable like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mother, please, this is the first position in 24 hours that that has not made me crazy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Alright. (pause) You're not eating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please don't make me eat this.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to eat something.

words: Well, Sookie left me a burrito in the fridge.

words: I'll go warm it up for you.

words: I can eat it cold.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh. Fine. I'll just go get it then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hot's better though.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll be right back.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, uh, I need something to drink. Do you want some punch?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.

words: Hi, Rory, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: JACOB
words: We met earlier with Paris...

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I remember.

speaker: JACOB
words: Are you having a good time?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually I am. You?

speaker: JACOB
words: It's OK. So, was that your boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. I don't know. I'm not sure.

speaker: JACOB
words: You're not sure?

speaker: RORY
words: We've only been going out a little while, so...

speaker: JACOB
words: So, there's still a little room to play?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JACOB
words: Would you like to dance?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no thanks.

words: Maybe I could get your number.

speaker: RORY
words: What for?

speaker: JACOB
words: To call you.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, aren't you here with Paris?

speaker: JACOB
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: So maybe you shouldn't be over here asking me for my number then.

speaker: JACOB
words: Why? Paris is my cousin.

speaker: RORY
words: Your cousin?

speaker: JACOB
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris is your cousin? You're related?

speaker: JACOB
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Jacob, it's been very nice to meet you. I hope you have a lovely evening.
(Cut to Lorelai and Emily watching TV.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh look -- Barbara Stanwyck. I just love Barbara Stanwyck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, she's good.

speaker: EMILY
words: She had that wonderful voice -- that husky, deep voice. I just love that voice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know Mom, you have kind of a Barbara Stanwycky voice.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh I do not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean it. You could have gotten Fred McMurray to off Dad if you'd really wanted to.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you do enjoy teasing me, don't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I really do.

speaker: EMILY
words: You know, Rory looked so lovely tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She did, didn't she?

speaker: EMILY
words: I just can't get over how she's grown up into that little woman who walked out of here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. (pause) You know what, Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Hm

speaker: LORELAI
words: I made the dress.

speaker: EMILY
words: You did a lovely job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: With Rory and the dress.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, let me get this out of your way. You really don't remember me making this for you when you were sick?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't. I'm sorry

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I did and you loved it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what? Let me give it a try.
(Lorelai bites into the toast.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's even more disgusting than I thought it was going to be.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh it is not.
(Emily takes a bite and makes a face.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God, it's horrible! What on earth was I thinking?
(Cut to the dance.)

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, you want to maybe go?

speaker: RORY
words: You're bored. I'm sorry. Yeah, let's go, right away.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not bored. I thought, you know, there's still a little time left, maybe we could get a cup of coffee somewhere, hang out a little, talk a walk. You know, just us.

speaker: RORY
words: That'd be nice.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, you stay. I'll get the coats.
(After Dean leaves, Paris walks up to Rory sitting at the table and leans into her.)

words: So. How many people have you told? Four? Five? Everybody?

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: PARIS
words: You know that Jacob is my cousin and now you finally have all the ammunition to pay me back, right?
(The people nearby are starting to stare.)

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want to pay you back. I just want to get awy from you.

speaker: PARIS
words: (voice gets increasingly louder) Now you can just go all over the school and just tell everybody that Paris Geller couldn't get a date to the dance. That she had no one and since she couldn't just not come, she had to get her mother to ask her cousin Jacob to take and then she had to give him gas money to make him do it. Go ahead! Tell them!

speaker: RORY
words: I don't have to. You just did.
(Paris and Rory look around. Everyone has stopped dancing and is listening to them. Paris walks away.)
(Dean is returning with the coats.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know, we haven't met.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, we haven't.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I'm Tristin.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ah, yes we have.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory's mentioned you.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I wouldn't get quite so excited about it.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, why, did she say something mean?

speaker: DEAN
words: She said you're a jackass.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Really?

speaker: DEAN
words: Actually, no, Rory doesn't use words like that. I embellished a little.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh so you're the big strong protector? Little princess needs a protector?

speaker: DEAN
words: What's your problem, man?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nothing. Just don't like your girlfriend, that's all.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really? Doesn't look that way to me.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I don't really care how it looks to you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey. You got in my path, not the other way around.
(Dean starts to walk away. Tristin steps in his way.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You're kiding right?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why, are you going somewhere?

speaker: DEAN
words: Get out of my way Dristan.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, aren't you clever.
(Rory steps between them.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, what's going on?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nothing. Just getting to know your boyfriend here.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's going really well, don't you think?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh yeah. We're just about to build a clubhouse.

speaker: RORY
words: OK. Well I hate to break up the party, but we should go.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, why? Little girl's got to be home?

speaker: DEAN
words: Stop.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No, I think you two make a very cute couple. Is your horse and buggy parked outside? Got to get home for the barn raising?

speaker: DEAN
words: Let's go.
(Dean and Rory start to walk away. Tristin steps in front of Rory. Dean shoves Tristin. People around them stop dancing and start watching the two guys.)

speaker: DEAN
words: What the hell do you think you're doing?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: OK, you will not push me again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you seriously trying to act tough? You're wearing a tie for God's sake.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Outside! Now!
(The music stops abruptly.)

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not fighting you. It'd be like fighting an accountant. I'll call you when I need my taxes done.
(Tristin lunges for Dean. It takes a few other boys and a man to separate them.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You don't want to fight me Tristin!

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why not?

speaker: DEAN
words: 'Cause I'll kill you, idiot! Come on, Rory, let's go.
(As Rory and Dean walk away, Tristin breaks free from the people holding him back. Dean turns around and gets in his face.)

speaker: DEAN
words: You will not come near her. Ever again.
(Dean and Rory leave.)

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow. That was good.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Whatever.
(Paris runs up to Tristin.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Are you OK?
(Tristin keeps walking.)

speaker: LOUISE
words: Did you really bring your cousin?
(Paris walks off.)
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Lorelai is sleeping on the couch. Emily is still watching TV. She reaches over for the remote control.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (sleepy) What are you doing?

speaker: EMILY
words: Go to sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The movie's not over.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll tell you how it ends.
(Emily tucks Lorelai's hair behind her ear and covers her with a blanket.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you, Mommy.
(Emily sits in a chair to read.)
(Cut to Rory and Dean walking outdoors in Stars Hollow.)

speaker: DEAN
words: That was quite a dance.

speaker: RORY
words: I seriously don't know what got into him.

speaker: DEAN
words: I do.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: No he doesn't. It's just a game to him or something.

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: He does nothing but insult me and make me miserable.

speaker: DEAN
words: He has a thing for you.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know how I feel about this whole situation.

speaker: DEAN
words: What do you mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know...having my boyfriend defend my honor. It's weird.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: You said 'boyfriend.'

speaker: RORY
words: No! I just meant boyfriend in the sense that the whole defending me thing was very boyfriendy, but only in the broadest sense of the word, which doesn't even apply at all here.

speaker: DEAN
words: You are seriously babbling.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't mean that you're my boyfriend.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think you're my boyfriend.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK.
(pause)

speaker: RORY
words: Dean?

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Are you my boyfriend?

speaker: DEAN
words: In the broadest sense of the word way?

speaker: RORY
words: No, in the real, 'hi this is Dean, my boyfriend' kind of way.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I am if you want me to be.

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK.

speaker: RORY
words: So it's settled.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yes it is.

speaker: RORY
words: You're my boyfriend.

speaker: DEAN
words: That's the consensus.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm feeling pretty good about this decision.
(The door to Miss Patty's dance studio is open.)

speaker: RORY
words: I guess Miss Patty forgot to lock up.

speaker: DEAN
words: I've never really seen in here before.
(They're inside, looking at the pictures on the walls.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Are all these women really Miss Patty?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep. She said she's done everything there is to do in show business except set fire to the hoop the dog jumps through.
(Rory drops her purse.)

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll get it. God, this weighs a ton. What do you have in here?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. A lipstick, five dollar bill. Gum, hair spray, a book.

speaker: DEAN
words: A book?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: You brought a book to the dance?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: You thought there'd be a lot of downtime?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I just take a book with me everywhere. It's just habit.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, what are you reading?

speaker: RORY
words: The Portable Dorothy Parker.
(She shows him the book.)

speaker: DEAN
words: (reading) 'There's little in taking or giving. There's little in water or wine. This living, this living, this living, Was never a project of mine.' Cheery.
(They settle into a comfortable chair together.)

speaker: RORY
words: Funny though. (pause) Hey --

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you for tonight. It was perfect.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're welcome.
(They kiss then continue to look at the book.)
(Time lapse. They've fallen asleep.)
(Time lapse. They're still asleep. Miss Patty and a large group of women come into the dance studio.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: OK, ladies. Grab your yoga mats.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I don't think I'll ever get warm again.
(The women gather around Rory and Dean.)

speaker: WOMAN
words: (shocked) Oh, my goodness! It's Lorelai's girl!

speaker: WOMAN #2
words: Patty! Rory Gilmore is here!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: What?

speaker: WOMAN
words: She's over here. Asleep with the bag boy from the market.

speaker: WOMAN #2
words: What are we supposed to do?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Rory, honey. It's Miss Patty. Rory? Rory, what are you doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: Miss Patty?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes. have you been here all night?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no! Dean wake up.

speaker: DEAN
words: What time is it?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: 30 in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God! We fell asleep. How could we have fallen asleep?

speaker: DEAN
words: Calm down, I'll explain it to your mom.

speaker: RORY
words: (hysterical) Where's my purse? Where's my purse?

speaker: DEAN
words: I got it. Relax.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go.
(Rory runs out.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory! (runs after her) Wait up!

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm going with you. We'll explain. It'll be OK.

speaker: RORY
words: No you can't come with me. You shouldn't be anywhere near my house right now.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's not our fault.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I just have to get home.

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, please, please let me come with you.

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory --

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go home.
(Rory runs down the street towards home. Dean lets her go.)
(Cut to Lorelai's house. Emily is shaking Lorelai awake.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai! Get up. Now. Right now!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory's not home!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory's what?

speaker: EMILY
words: 30 and she's not here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: EMILY
words: She's not there. Aren't you listening?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (panicked) Rory? Rory?

speaker: EMILY
words: Where's the phone? Call the police.
(Lorelai looks around.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you doing? Call the police! Call the police!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, stop it!

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm looking for the phone. What do you think I'm doing?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don't you ever clean up around here? This is an emergency and you can't even find the phone. What if there was a fire? What if Rory was choking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, stop yelling!

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory is missing!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that and your yelling is not helping me!
(They continue looking for the phone. It rings)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory? (pause) Oh, Patty. (pause) What? (pause) OK. (pause) Thanks. (pause) No, than you so much. (pause) OK Bye-bye. (hangs up) Rory's OK.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where is she? What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She and Dean were at Miss Patty's.

speaker: EMILY
words: What is that, a motel?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, it's a dance studio. That was Patty. She said that she found them asleep and woke them up and Rory's on her way home.

speaker: EMILY
words: In what state were they found in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She didn't say, OK. Let's just try to be calm until we know what happened.

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you mean 'until we know what happened'? We know what happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No we don't.

speaker: EMILY
words: They were out all night!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna make some coffee.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai Gilmore, I've watched you do a lot of stupid things in your life and I have held my tongue.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughs) You've what?

speaker: EMILY
words: But I will not stand by and let you allow that girl to ruin her life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom -- back off.

speaker: EMILY
words: She spent the night out with that boy, the one you let her run off to that dance with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, so help me God, I will not get into this with you.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's doing the same thing you did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No she's not.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's going to get pregnant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No she's not.

speaker: EMILY
words: She's gonna ruin everything just like you did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No she's not! No she's not! No she's not! Rory is a good kid, Mom! She's not me.

speaker: EMILY
words: What kind of mother are you to allow this to happen to her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know, Mom. What kind of mother were you?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're going to lose her. You're going to lose her just like I lost you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not going to lose her. Do you hear me? Even if I hadn't gotten pregnant, you still would have lost me. I had nothing in that house. I had no life. I had no air. You strangled me. I do not strangle Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you're so perfect and I was so horrible. I put you in good schools. I gave you the best of everything. I made sure you had the finest opportunities. And I am so tired of hearing about how you were suffocated and I was so controlling. Well if I was so controlling why couldn't I control you running around getting pregnant and throwing your life away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get out!

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You will not come into my house and tell me I threw my life away. Look around, Mom. This is a life. It has a little color in it so it may look a little unfamiliar to you, but it's a life. And if I hadn't gotten pregnant I wouldn't have Rory.
(Rory sneaks in the front door and hides by the stairs.)

speaker: EMILY
words: You know that's not what I meant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe I was some horrible uncontrollable child like you say, but Rory isn't. She's smart and careful and I trust her and she's gonna be fine and if you can't accept that or believe it, then I don't want you in this house!
(Emily walks out and slams the door. Rory creeps into the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, thank you for saying all those --

speaker: LORELAI
words: What were you thinking? Staying out all night! Are you insane?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. It was an accident.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're talking to the queen of staying out all night. I invented the concept! This is no accident! You can't do this! Period.

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing happened!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you have any idea what it's like to wake up with my mother here and find out that you never came home?

speaker: RORY
words: So all this is about Grandma being here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's about the feeling of complete terror when your kid isn't in her bed in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LOREAI
words: And then it's about a whole different kind of terror when you find out that she spent the night with some guy.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't spend the night with him. We fell asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are going on the pill.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're not getting pregnant.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sleeping with Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dammit!

speaker: RORY
words: What happened to all that stuff you said to Grandma What happened to trusting me? Where did all that go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think it's back on Patty's yoga mats.

speaker: RORY
words: This is crap! You know I didn't do anything. You know this is an accident. You're just mad because I screwed up and I did it in front of Grandma and she nailed you for it. Well I'm sorry. I'm sorry that I screwed up and I'm sorry that you got yelled at, but I didn't do anything and you know it!
(Rory goes into her room and slams the door. Lorelai sits at the kitchen table and cries.)

speaker: The End
words: The End
CUT TO MISS PATTY’S STUDIO

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: People please pay attention. Now, I want my before Mary over here, and my after Mary over here. Wise men, shepherd line up for the processional. I only have half a donkey? I need the rest of the donkey!
[Kirk standing on stool while Lorelai hemming]

speaker: KIRK
words: Ow!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold still Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: You stuck me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not stick you.

speaker: KIRK
words: You did to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, be quiet now. [looks at Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: Um, Taylor, the baby Jesus is missing an arm again.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I was just getting it out of the trunk and -

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Let me see that. Oh for Pete’s sake! [to everyone] Ok listen up! The arm is missing! I repeat the arm is missing!

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe it’s just time to get a new baby Jesus, you know, one that’s a boy.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It’s a doll, no one can tell.

speaker: RORY
words: Well it has a bow.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This has been the baby Jesus in every Christmas pageant since 1965. Were you here in 1965?

speaker: RORY
words: No I wasn’t.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Find the arm [Rory looks at Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

speaker: KIRK
words: Nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re flinching.

speaker: KIRK
words: You stuck me once. There’s nothing to say you won’t do it again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok you know what? You’re done.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well?

speaker: RORY
words: I swear, I’ve looked twice.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Look again.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Taylor come quickly. Our ‘before’ Mary is about to become an ‘after’. Who else in town is knocked up?
[Lorelai and Rory look at each other awkwardly then look away. Pan to them leaving]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Find the arm?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sourly]It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas. [pan to dog with doll arm in mouth]
CUT TO RORY STANDING IN A GAZEBO
[Lane runs up to her]

speaker: LANE
words: Hey, I thought we were meeting at Luke’s.

speaker: RORY
words: We were? Oh my God, I’m so sorry. I forgot.

speaker: LANE
words: Let me guess. You and Lorelai haven’t made up yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope. Things are still Miracle Worker at my house. God, how did everything get so screwed up?

speaker: LANE
words: I think you staying out all night with Dean had something to do with it.

speaker: RORY
words: And my grandmother being there to witness it didn’t help.

speaker: LANE
words: Never does.

speaker: RORY
words: It sucks. Things were good. School was good, Dean was good. Now my mother and I are barely speaking. Mom and Grandma are barely speaking. Dean’s new name is ‘Narcolepsy boy’.

speaker: LANE
words: How’s he taking it?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. I haven’t talked to him since it happened.

speaker: LANE
words: That was four days ago.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: Has he called?

speaker: RORY
words: I told him not to.

speaker: LANE
words: And he listened?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LANE
words: Good boy.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, I really need to talk about something else now.

speaker: LANE
words: You went shopping.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I did. I got a mow-ing cow shaped timer for Sookie, some cardio-salsa tapes for Michel, a book for Dean -

speaker: LANE
words: You got Dean a book?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. ‘Metamorphosis’.

speaker: LANE
words: ‘Metamorphosis.’

speaker: RORY
words: It’s Kafta.

speaker: LANE
words: Very romantic.

speaker: RORY
words: I think it is romantic.

speaker: LANE
words: I know I’ve always dreamed that some day a guy would get me a really confusing Czechoslovakian novel.

speaker: RORY
words: I think he’ll appreciate it.

speaker: LANE
words: A book sends the wrong message.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LANE
words: You have to look at what a gift says to the other person, not to you. Remember two years ago, I got my mom that perfume?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LANE
words: Ok, to me that said, ‘Hey mom, you work hard, you deserve something fancy’. Now to my mother, it said ‘Hey mom, here’s some smelly sex juice, the kind I use to lure boys with’ and resulted in me being sent to Bible camp all summer.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah but -

speaker: LANE
words: Just imaging that you actually gave Dean something really romantic, and he gave you a football. Your hypothetical romantic present is saying that you really, really like him. And his present is saying ‘Hey man, let’s just be friends’.

speaker: RORY
words: And you’re saying that this book is -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is a Czechoslovakian football, yes.

speaker: RORY
words: So then what do I get him?

speaker: LANE
words: What you should do is find out what he’s getting you and gauge your gift accordingly.

speaker: RORY
words: But doesn’t that kinda take the fun out of it?

speaker: LANE
words: Gift giving is serious business. If you don’t believe me try spending a month at Korean Bible camp.
CUT TO INN

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes right there. Now flip the elf and the fairy.

speaker: GUY
words: Which one is the fairy?

speaker: MICHEL
words: The one with the wand [Guy goes for one] What are you doing?

speaker: GUY
words: Isn’t this a wand?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, that is a staff.

speaker: GUY
words: So this isn’t a fairy?

speaker: MICHEL
words: That is Little Bo Peep.

speaker: GUY
words: And you don’t want to move her.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I would prefer that you didn’t.

speaker: GUY
words: Ok, so we’re still looking for a fairy.

speaker: MICHEL
words: The search continues.

speaker: GUY
words: No chance you’re going to help me.

speaker: MICHEL
words: None whatsoever.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Independence Inn, Lorelai speaking.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, hello.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wanted to talk to you about the Christmas dinner this Friday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, Christmas dinner.

speaker: EMILY
words: You forgot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well mom, there’s been a lot going on around here lately, your Christmas shindig’s not exactly high on my list of things to obsess about.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m sorry if the timing is bad Lorelai, but the world doesn’t always revolve around you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well thanks for the tip.

speaker: EMILY
words: Cocktails are at 6, dinner’s at 8.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I probably won’t be there for cocktails.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I have to work.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can’t leave work early?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I can’t.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it’s not in my job description.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well then don’t come.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t come. It’s obviously an enormous burden for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah but -

speaker: EMILY
words: Just send Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re telling me not to come to the Christmas party?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you’re obviously too busy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had the German measles in the 5th grade, I still had to show up to the Christmas party.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai let’s be honest here, I’m not too happy with you right now and I assume you’re not too happy with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My polka dot dress matched my face and still I had to sit through 12 courses.

speaker: EMILY
words: I am tired of forcing you to do all those terrible things that infringe upon your life and I do not have the energy to pretend that the way you treated my the other day was in any way acceptable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’re uninviting me to Christmas dinner?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, anything else?

speaker: EMILY
words: I believe that’s all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok well, great mom, it’s been swell talking to you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Bye Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Pan to Michel and guy]

speaker: GUY
words: This one?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: GUY
words: This one?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: GUY
words: This -

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.
[guy points]

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE

speaker: RORY
words: I wish you’d change your mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not my mind that needs to be changed.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t think she meant it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh she meant it.

speaker: RORY
words: Well maybe she thinks she meant it at the time, but I bet she won’t mean it later when I show up there without you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And without a map to follow that reasoning I say, ‘Take a hot it’s cold outside’.

speaker: RORY
words: You just wanna hold a grudge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it burns more calories.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s not true.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is, how do you think your grandma got those legs of hers? She’s not exactly a Stairmaster gal.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never saw her on the running track.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t remember the country club organizing a Tae-bo class.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, forget it. Should I put your name on Grandma’s present?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, sign it the inn keeper formally known as her daughter.

speaker: RORY
words: You know what I think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I think you’re acting a little immature.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not acting.

speaker: RORY
words: Well what about the apple tarts? You wait all year for those apple tarts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can live without the apple tarts.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve made up songs after eating five of them with lyrics that contradict that last statement.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you know what? You have to go, you’re late.

speaker: RORY
words: You really won’t come?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, I’m sorry, is somebody speaking? Couldn’t be Rory, she’s already half way to Hartford.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, I’m going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drive carefully. Watch out for ice. And bring me back one of those [door closes]..tarts!
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE
[Doorbell]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, come in. You look lovely.

speaker: RORY
words: This is from me and mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well aren’t you thoughtful? I’ll just put it under the tree.

speaker: RORY
words: You know mom actually picked it out.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, do you know Holland Prescott?

speaker: RORY
words: I met her last year.

speaker: EMILY
words: Holland, look who’s here.

speaker: HOLLAND
words: Hello Rory.

speaker: RICHARD
words: That’s not my proposal.

speaker: ALAN
words: Yes, I know. Henry toned it down a little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Henry did! Henry is a toddler!

speaker: ALAN
words: He thought your take was a little conservative.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And a moron!

speaker: ALAN
words: Richard, be very careful. This man may be our boss one day.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh that will never happen.

speaker: ALAN
words: Alright.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why have you heard something?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, Alan, look who’s here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: ALAN
words: Where’s your mother?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, she...

speaker: ALAN
words: Over by the apple tarts I assume.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai couldn’t come tonight.

speaker: RICHARD
words: She couldn’t?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, she had to work. [Rory looks at her]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah. Speaking of which, I’m going to give that man a call.

speaker: ALAN
words: Richard, you’re getting yourself all worked up.

speaker: RICHARD
words: As long as I’ve been with this company, it has been run by gentleman. Revising a man’s work without so much as a phone call would’ve been unheard of!

speaker: ALAN
words: It’s a new world out there Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh!

speaker: EMILY
words: Please stop all this shop talk. We are here to celebrate.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m going to call him.

speaker: ALAN
words: Richard, it’s past midnight in London.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, even better.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, could I talk to you alone please.

speaker: EMILY
words: You need something to drink.

speaker: RORY
words: I want to apologize about the other night.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory please, this is a party.

speaker: RORY
words: I messed up, it’s my fault.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is not the time or place to discuss this, your mother should have taught you that.

speaker: RORY
words: Please don’t be mad at her.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m not mad at anyone. Now go back in and join the party.

speaker: RORY
words: But -

speaker: EMILY
words: And take this to Gigi on your way back.
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes Joe, I know it’s Friday night, but I ordered my pizza an hour ago...Oh no I did not hear about the delivery van...Well I am very, very sorry to hear that. Now was it a fairly new van? Great, ok, well Joe, as with most tragedies in life there come a time when you just need to pick up and move one. So what’s the next phase of the delivery saga? Mm-hmm...Well how long until your brother’s back with the razor scooter? Ok, uh-huh, alright, just call me when it gets there. Bye Joe.

[Goes into the kitchen, grams a salad bag, pours dressing into it, shakes it and sits down to read a magazine and eat. Hears a knocking at Rory’s window. Goes into Rory’s room and sees Dean at the window. Opens window]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, hi there.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How you doing?

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good. Shouldn’t you have a squeegee with you or something?

speaker: DEAN
words: I was just -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Looking for Rory?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’s not here.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] I’ll tell her you tapped.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm-hmm [goes to close window but Dean hasn’t moved] Something else?

speaker: DEAN
words: I just wanted to say that things got all messed up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes they did.

speaker: DEAN
words: And I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: DEAN
words: But nothing happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I have to go.

speaker: DEAN
words: We sat down and we were reading this book and then we fell asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pick a more interesting book next time.

speaker: DEAN
words: So am I like public enemy #1 with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: #1? I don’t know, would you settle for top five? Because I’m still a little hot for that crazy bomber guy who’s been living in a cave for a year.

speaker: DEAN
words: Please just tell me where I stand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know where you stand ok? All I know is my 16 year old daughter didn’t come home one night and you had something to do with that.

speaker: DEAN
words: I told you - nothing happened

speaker: LORELAI
words: [overlaps Dean] Happened, I heard.

speaker: DEAN
words: Look you can hate me but you have to believe me, I would not let anything happen to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You happened to her.

speaker: DEAN
words: I won’t hurt her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I was 16 when I had Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is the same age she is now.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She wants to go to Harvard.

speaker: DEAN
words: She will go to Harvard and if she doesn’t it won’t be because of me. [sighs and stands to leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t hate you.

speaker: DEAN
words: No?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Though I did imagine 20 different ways to remove your head from your body.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah? Well which one looked the best?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hedge clippers.

speaker: DEAN
words: Huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dull ones.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I mean sure you wouldn’t want it to go quick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Exactly.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ok, uh, I’m gonna go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know we have a really nice front door. You might want to use it some times.

speaker: DEAN
words: Got it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See ya.
CUT TO STREET OUTSIDE LUKE’S
[Lorelai walking to Luke’s while people ring bells to the tune of The First Noel]

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Henry, you ring on 3.

speaker: HENRY
words: I thought I was 2.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: No, Chuck rings on 2, you ring on 3.

speaker: CHUCK
words: I’m on 1.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Are you sure?

speaker: CHUCK
words: Nope. Sorry. You’re right. I’m 2.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: From the top. [they start again] Henry!
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE’S

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
