words: Rory coming?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: She on a date?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good so you’ve forbid her to see the bag boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’d really rather not talk about it right now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just tell me you forbid her to see the bag boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not forbid her to see the bag boy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Are you crazy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he looks like he’s moving up to produce, so he’s suddenly become quite a catch.

speaker: LUKE
words: That kid is trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I order please.

speaker: LUKE
words: First time I looked at him, I thought he was trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me, I’m the one who told you I thought he was trouble and you told me you thought I was crazy.

speaker: LUKE
words: You are crazy and he is trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He is not trouble! He’s 6’2...he’s beautiful and he’s completely in love with my daughter.

speaker: LUKE
words: Trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Big time.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll get your burger.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait. Can I see a menu?

speaker: LUKE
words: You need to see a menu?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: You come here everyday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, but I usually order the same thing, and tonight I’m in the mood for something a little different.

speaker: LUKE
words: Menu.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Piece of paper, list of food offered.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, here. [gives her a menu] It’s not in Japanese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t you have any kind of holiday special? Something festive?

speaker: LUKE
words: I just got some Grey Poupon. That’s French.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tonight’s my parents big Christmas celebration. There’s good food, these amazing apple tarts, big tree. It’s the only holiday I actually enjoy going over there for and this year, I’m uninvited.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why the hell would anyone celebrate Christmas two weeks early?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you even hear the part about me being uninvited?

speaker: LUKE
words: To your parents' fake Christmas party?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: I did hear that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you care?

speaker: LUKE
words: Obviously you do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I do and I don’t know why.

speaker: LUKE
words: You liked going...

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory’s there without you...

speaker: LORELAI
words: She is.

speaker: LUKE
words: You and Rory aren’t getting along right now and you feel bad at being separated during a time you usually share together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Did I mention you come here every damn day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll have a burger.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up.
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE

speaker: GIGI
words: Emily, you’ve out done yourself yet again.

speaker: ALAN
words: Yes, I can’t imagine the hours you spent slaving over a hot stove.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re teasing me, Alan.

speaker: ALAN
words: It’s delicious Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: A compliment for my chef is a compliment for me, thank you Alan.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I for one would like to know where Henry is at this hour. Probably gallivanting around London like a bull out to stud.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard please.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well how is he supposed to negotiate the contract tomorrow morning if he’s been out at all hours with some cheap tramp.

speaker: ALAN
words: Knowing Henry, she wasn’t cheap.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is wildly inappropriate dinner conversation especially in front of a young lady.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is it unbearably hot in here?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard don’t loosen your tie at the table.

speaker: HOLLAND
words: So what are your plans for the Christmas holidays Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll probably just be hanging out with my mom.

speaker: GIGI
words: Oh it’s such a shame she couldn’t come, she’s always such a kick.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai wasn’t feeling well so I suggested she stay home.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is hot in here, I’m going to lower the thermostat [leaves].

speaker: HOLLAND
words: Poor thing, what’s wrong with her?

speaker: EMILY
words: She has a touch of the flu. Richard forget the thermostat! [Rory looks at her again]

speaker: GIGI
words: I thought you said she was working?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well she was supposed to work but then she caught the flu so one way or another she couldn’t have made it.

speaker: GIGI
words: Tell her we missed her.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard! For heaven sake [getting up to find him]. Richard!
CUT TO LUKE’S
[Slides a Santa face hamburger in front of Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What did you do?

speaker: LUKE
words: You wanted something festive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You made me a Santa burger.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s not big deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He has a hat and everything.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I just cut a piece of wonder bread, you know, poured a little ketchup, piped on a little cream cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No one has ever made me something quite this disgusting before. I thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You’re welcome.
[Cell phone rings. Luke point at the ‘no cell phone’ sign]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Outside!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you kidding? It’s like the North Pole out there.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, this sign isn’t just a decoration.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, nothing in here is a decoration.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s disturbs the other customers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh really? Maybe we should take a vote. [to customers] Who thinks we shouldn’t use cell phones in here? [all raise their hands] Well screw democracy. [goes to answer but stops ringing] Perfect, Now I have to check my voice mail.
[Taylor and carolers enter]

speaker: ALL
words: ‘...the new born king’.

speaker: LUKE
words: Whoa, what’s going on?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well we were caroling around town and we got a bit chilly and we thought maybe we could trade you a song for some hot chocolate.

speaker: LUKE
words: You want free hot chocolate?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: No no, we’ll sing for it, any tune you like.

speaker: LUKE
words: And then I give you free hot chocolate.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Tell you want, you can have your hot chocolate, and pay for it, then go next door and sing for the marshmallows.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: These are your neighbors Luke!

speaker: LUKE
words: Shut up Taylor. What’s going on? [to Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: My father’s in the hospital.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, he collapsed or something. I don’t know. I need a cab. I need to call a cab. Where’s the phone? I need - can anyone give me - I’m holding a phone.

speaker: LUKE
words: Whoa, calm down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I can’t calm down. I need a cab. What’s the numbers? God, it’s something-cabs, cabs-something-something, 1-800-cabs? Can somebody tell me the damn number of the cab guy?!

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll drive you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But there’s food and there’s people and there’s a burger with a face.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, everybody out! We’re closed, let’s go. Food’s on me. [to Lorelai] Put on your coat and get your stuff. [to Taylor] Taylor, have your hot chocolate then lock up. [to Lorelai] Come on, my truck’s out back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, I’m -

speaker: LUKE
words: I know, let’s go.
CUT TO INSIDE TRUCK

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look.

speaker: LUKE
words: Relax.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’re being passed by senior citizens.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m going as fast as I can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Grandma, bye.

speaker: LUKE
words: There’s ice on the road, those people aren’t being safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well maybe they’re not being safe but at least they’re getting somewhere.

speaker: LUKE
words: You checked it five times already, I’ve listened to it twice, it’s not changing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘Grandpa’s in the hospital, please come.’ No details, no info. Who taught her to leave a message like that?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m sure she was in a hurry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A person needs details. Why is he in the hospital? How bad is it? What are the circumstances involving him being in the hospital? These are simple questions.

speaker: LUKE
words: We’ll be there very soon and you’ll know everything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What if he’s dead?

speaker: LUKE
words: He’s not dead.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How do you know?

speaker: LUKE
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you’re psychic now? You’re suddenly getting visions while you’re driving 20 mph in the oldest truck known to man? [pause] I’m sorry, you’re killing yourself to get me there and I’m yelling at you. I don’t mean it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel like this is one of those moments when I should be remembering all the great times I had with my dad, you know. The time he took me shopping for a Barbie or to the circus or fishing and my mind is a complete blank.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I’m sure it happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No it didn’t. We never did any of that. He went to work, he came home, he read the paper, he went to bed, I snuck out the window. Simple. He was a very by the numbers guy. I was never very good with numbers.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m sure he loves you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know my dad is not a bad guy.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m sure he’s not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He lived his life the way he thought he was supposed to. He followed the rules taught to him by his non-fishing-non-Barbie-buying dad. He worked hard. He bought a nice house. He provided for my mom. All he asked in return was for his daughter to wear white dresses and go to cotillion and want the same life that he had. What a disappointment it must have been for him to get me.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can’t imagine anyone seeing you as a disappointment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I bet you’d buy a Barbie for your daughter.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, I’d probably give her the cash to buy it herself and meet her by the baseball cards.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. You’ll make a great dad.

speaker: LUKE
words: You make a great mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. It’s just the uh, daughter part I don’t have down yet.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, hold on. That Camaro is dust.
CUT TO HOSPITAL

speaker: EMILY
words: But why can’t I see him.?

speaker: NURSE
words: They’re running some test.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I would like to meet this doctor who’s testing him.

speaker: NURSE
words: You will.

speaker: EMILY
words: Some strange man is working on my husband, I have a right to meet this person.

speaker: NURSE
words: You will.

speaker: EMILY
words: And I want to see the room you’re going to put him in.

speaker: NURSE
words: You will.

speaker: EMILY
words: And stop saying ‘You will’. Put a proper sentence together for God’s sake.

speaker: NURSE
words: Ma’am, please wait here.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you find out anything?

speaker: EMILY
words: Please! They run this place like the CIA [Joshua comes up] Joshua, thank God! This place is infuriating.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: It’s alright, I’m here, I’m going to check on him right now. Have you filled out the forms yet?

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t care about the forms, I want to see my husband.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: [to Rory] Is she being obstinate?

speaker: RORY
words: Very.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Let me see what’s going on and then we’ll take it from there.

speaker: EMILY
words: And there he goes through the doors.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I should call mom again.

speaker: EMILY
words: Never mind, I’m sure she’s very busy.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s not true, I bet she’d -

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, go get your Grandfather a paper -

speaker: RORY
words: But -

speaker: EMILY
words: The Wall Street Journal or Barron’s. Whatever they have, he’ll want something to read when he gets back to his room.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, can I get you something? Maybe a coffee?

speaker: EMILY
words: No dear, I’m fine.
[Grandma goes around the corner and calls Lorelai’s house but gets the answering machine and hangs up. Goes back to the waiting area]

speaker: NURSE
words: Ms. Gilmore, uh, I need you to -

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not ‘Ms. Gilmore’, it’s Mrs. Gilmore! Mrs. Gilmore, I’m not a cosmo woman!

speaker: NURSE
words: I know this is difficult for you, but if you don’t fill out these forms -

speaker: EMILY
words: What? You’ll do what? I’d like to hear in your most condescending tone what my punishment will be for not filling out these forms in a timely manner. Are there bamboo shoots involved? Some sort of dark deep hole in the ground? Rats nibbling at my toes?
[Pan to Lorelai and Luke in the hospital]

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, we’re supposed to follow the blue line, around the corner and then we should be -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where’s the scarecrow when you need him?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, we have to ask someone else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! No! We just have to pick one.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, well can’t just wander around here aimlessly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, listen to me, somewhere in this hospital are my mother and my father. Now I know I don’t get along with them but there has to be some sort of intuition, some sort of blood bond that will somehow lead me to them.

speaker: LUKE
words: That’s crazy.
[overhear]

speaker: EMILY
words: My great uncle founded this hospital -

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that’s Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: You insensitive paper peddler! His portrait is hanging in the lobby, go look. It’s right above the sign that says ‘Founder’!!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom!

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on? How is he?

speaker: EMILY
words: You came!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well of course I came. How’s dad?

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s what I’ve been trying to find out but this woman keeps pestering me with idiotic questions like ‘What’s the number of my insurance policy and how long have we had it.’

speaker: NURSE
words: I need to get this information.

speaker: EMILY
words: You need to get sensitivity training!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, what if I fill out this information and you can go find someone who can tell us how my dad is.

speaker: NURSE
words: I’m not supposed to -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or, I could go and you can stay here and continue to discuss this with my mother
[Nurse looks at Emily]

speaker: NURSE
words: I’ll go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: You got rid of her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, so tell me what happened.

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s amazing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t know what happened. He was hot and he went to turn down the thermostat and then - [see Luke] were you on a date?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: You have an escort?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it’s Luke, Mom.

speaker: LUKE
words: Which is her way of saying we weren’t on a date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean it like that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well how am I supposed to know you weren’t on a date. It’s Friday night and you show up here with a man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: With Luke, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not insane to assume a date was involved.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re right, ok, it’s entirely possible that I was out on a date.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just not with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was eating at Luke’s when I got the message. He gave me a ride, end of story. Is Dr. Reynolds here?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Joshua got her a while ago. He was supposed to come back the minute he knew something but he hasn’t been back yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well let’s go find him.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can’t find him! You can’t find anyone! Everyone just keeps disappearing behind those doors!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well come on, let’s go [goes through doors]

speaker: EMILY
words: I didn’t know you could do that. [follows Lorelai]

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll wait here.
[Rory come up]

speaker: RORY
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: I gave your mom a ride. We weren’t on a date.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, ok.

speaker: LUKE
words: She and your grandmother just went back to see if they can find a doctor.

speaker: RORY
words: Did they find out anything else about Grandpa?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t think so, but give your mom a couple of minutes back there, I bet she finds something out.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for bringing her.

speaker: LUKE
words: You’re welcome. Hey, you ok?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want him to die.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well you tell him that when you see him ok? People like to hear that.
[Lorelai comes through doors]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you! Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: It was horrible! It happened so fast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They’re about to bring him out of the big test room any minute so just hang in there.

speaker: RORY
words: Where’s Grandma?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kicking some patient out of the room with the good view.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hope they get him unhooked fast, otherwise he’s going without the life support machine.

speaker: RORY
words: So how long before they bring him back?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very soon.

speaker: RORY
words: I’d like to do something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like rollerblade?

speaker: RORY
words: Like get some coffee or make phone calls or do something that isn’t standing here waiting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, go it. Well as partial as I am to the phone, I’m voting for the ‘get coffee’ idea.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, good. Luke tea?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, peppermint preferably.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, he’s gonna be fine.

speaker: RORY
words: I was just getting to know him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want him to -

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s not. Go get your coffee. [Rory leaves] Oh man! [sits with Luke]

speaker: LUKE
words: You’re very brave for her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well it’s my turn. God this sucks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey come on, you gotta think positive here - bright side, good thoughts. Rainbows, unicorns, clowns, little cute...furry - ok I’m out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank God.
[Grandma comes through doors]

speaker: EMILY
words: Alright, we’ve secured him the room but the pillows are completely unacceptable. I’m gonna see if I can find him some down ones and some slippers. I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll be right here [gurney passes. Luke breathes deeply, head back] Jeez are you ok?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I’m just not big on hospitals you know the smell, people being wheeled by with tubes sticking out of them, you know, drainage, fluids, gaping holes -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, listen, why don’t you go home.

speaker: LUKE
words: You want me to go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don’t look so good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not what I meant. You know you always look good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean you always look healthy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you don’t look so healthy now. Now you look...

speaker: LUKE
words: Unhealthy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh what? So I said you look good. We’re not in 5th grade. ‘You look good’, big deal. Stop staring at me.
[patient passes by]

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, jeez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See that’s what you get for being cocky.
[Grandpa wheeled out]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, how is he?

speaker: ORDERLY
words: He’s a little groggy right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on? How are the tests?

speaker: ORDERLY
words: The doctor will have to tell you that, I’m just the transport guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When is the doctor coming out?

speaker: ORDERLY
words: I’m not sure but you can go in with your dad until he gets here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Go ahead, I’m good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s ok, uh, I’m gonna go find my mom and Rory and tell them he’s back up.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can tell them when they get here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s ok, uh, I think they’d like to know now [turns around and almost knocks over her mom] Ah!

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, you almost ran me over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good thing we’re in a hospital.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where were you going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To find you, they just brought dad up.

speaker: EMILY
words: When?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well how is he? Did you talk to him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No not yet, I was coming to find you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You go ahead mom, I’m gonna go find Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine. [goes into room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know I could look for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No that’s ok, I’ll do it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I thought so. Hey look, it’s Rory. [Rory comes up to them]

speaker: RORY
words: The coffee machine was jammed so I got us some chicken soup and some Pez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was just coming to look for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Why, is everything ok?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They just brought Grandpa back up. He’s in room 202.

speaker: RORY
words: Well come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You go ahead, I just - I have to make a call.

speaker: RORY
words: Well hurry up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll meet you there.

speaker: LUKE
words: So who are you gonna go find now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop.

speaker: LUKE
words: How about Jimmy Hoffa? That’ll keep you busy for a while.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said stop.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can’t avoid going into that room forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not avoiding anything. I’m going to find coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: The machine’s jammed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well there are other machines.

speaker: LUKE
words: Admit you’re afraid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have no idea what you’re talking about.

speaker: LUKE
words: The truth hurts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you know what hurts? Having a screwdriver jammed in the side of your head [pointing behind Luke]

speaker: LUKE
words: What? [turns around] Oh my God!
CUT TO INSIDE HOSPITAL ROOM

speaker: RORY
words: ‘Year end optimism in recent earnings reports, have pushed shares of the telecommunications giant about $65’.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [weakly] Oh, rubbish.

speaker: RORY
words: ‘However, some experts say that the stock is dangerously overvalued.’

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ahh. Hmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: [Comes into room] Well how are we doing?

speaker: RORY
words: We’re done the front page of the Financial Times and all of The Wall Street Journal.

speaker: EMILY
words: Very good progress. Rory dear, why don’t you save the rest of the paper till later hmm?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. [to Grandpa] If I hug you, is it gonna hurt?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Pain is part of life. [she hugs him]

speaker: EMILY
words: This little girl likes you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she has good taste.
[Pan to Rory coming out of room and finds Luke sitting in the chairs beside the room]

speaker: RORY
words: Where’s mom?

speaker: LUKE
words: Looking for coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: Staring at my shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, carry on.
[Pan back inside room]

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I finally found you some decent pillows, they’re not down but at least they give a little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, we need to talk.

speaker: EMILY
words: Can you life your head at all?

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is serious.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just a little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There is a key in my top desk drawer.

speaker: EMILY
words: Better yes?

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is to the safe.

speaker: EMILY
words: One more time.

speaker: RICHARD
words: All of our stock information is in there, plus all of the insurance information.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now if I could just find you some different sheets.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Our will is in my lower left drawer, Denis has a copy in case there’s a problem.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe I could get Dava to bring some from home -

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, this is serious. We have to be practical.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m gonna have Dava get those -

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily listen to me, if I die -

speaker: EMILY
words: No!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard Gilmore, there may be many things happening in this hospital tonight but your dying is not one of them.

speaker: RICHARD
words: But -

speaker: EMILY
words: No! I did not sign on to your dying. And it is not going to happen. Not tonight, not for a very long time. In fact, I demand to go first. Do I make myself clear?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes Emily. You may go first.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good. I’m gonna get you those sheets. [picks up the phone as Richard takes her hand and holds it.]
[Pan to Lorelai and Rory by the coffee machine.]

speaker: RORY
words: No luck?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I’m wearing it down.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re pathetic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is the doctor back?

speaker: RORY
words: Not yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you have a visitor tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah? Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Narcolepsy boy.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean came over?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. He pulled the old ‘tapping on the window’ bit.

speaker: RORY
words: Were you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me, I am never mean.

speaker: RORY
words: You were mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He told me nothing happened.

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: You do? Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, there are only two things that I totally trust in this entire world. The fact that I will never be able to understand what Charo is saying no matter how long she lives in this country - and you.

speaker: RORY
words: Hopefully not in that order.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You just have to understand the major panic factor that went on there.

speaker: RORY
words: I do, I really do and I’m so sorry. Nothing like that will ever happen again. I swear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t swear.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you are your mother’s daughter.

speaker: RORY
words: What does that mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It means things can happen, even when you don’t really mean for them to happen.

speaker: RORY
words: They will not happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Ok

speaker: RORY
words: I hated going to that party tonight without you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hated you going to that party tonight without me. How were the apple tarts?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Grandma didn’t make them this year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s weird.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, are you lying?

speaker: RORY
words: Through my teeth.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good girl.
[pan to outside Grandpa’s room]

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, hello [sees Luke sitting there.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: If you don’t mind, I think I need to just -

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh sure. Sit, please. How is he?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you know he’s - I don’t know. [playing with Grandpa’s tie]

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s a nice tie.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s Brooks Brothers.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah.

speaker: EMILY
words: It was bothering him tonight. I told him not to loosen it. I wanted him to look nice for our guests, so he didn’t. And then well...The paramedics took it off him on the way here. I just haven’t been able to put it down yet [sniffles] I must sound crazy.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ve kept my father’s entire store just the way he left it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I turned it into a diner, but I kept all his stuff on the walls, his pictures in the office, even the ‘Hardware’ sign.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m sure he would’ve appreciated having his life’s worked being honored like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: He would’ve called me a damn fool.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, well. I don’t know what Lorelai’s told you about her father, I can certainly imagine, but he’s a very good man. He always did the right thing for his family.

speaker: LUKE
words: That’s what she told me.

speaker: EMILY
words: So what exactly is going on between the two of you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing. Really. We’re friends, that’s it.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re idiots, the both of you.
[Lorelai and Rory come back]

speaker: EMILY
words: There you are, where have you been?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coffee hunt. So what’s going on?

speaker: LUKE
words: Your mother called me an idiot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you must have sucked up good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m going to go wash my face [leaves taking Rory with her.]
[Lorelai stands in front of the door to Grandpa’s room.]

speaker: LUKE
words: So whatcha gonna do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Ok, well, I’m just gonna...

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll be here.
[Lorelai looks at Grandpa who opens his eyes. They look at each other for a couple of seconds and are about to say something when the doctor, Rory and Grandma walk into the room.]

speaker: EMILY
words: ...I’ve heard for such a long time. Richard, how are you darling?

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Well Richard, it looks like we’re gonna be stuck with you for a while longer. It was just a touch of angina.

speaker: EMILY
words: But you have to watch your diet.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: Yes, that’s going to be very important. No more red meat, heavy desserts and you’re going to have to exercise regularly.

speaker: EMILY
words: Golf doesn’t count.

speaker: RORY
words: So can he go home?

speaker: JOSHUA
words: We’d like to keep him over night though, just to be sure.

speaker: RORY
words: But he’s fine.

speaker: JOSHUA
words: As long as he does what he’s told, yes. [Lorelai sneaks out]
[Luke comes around the corner]

speaker: LUKE
words: I heard, everything’s ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. They’re going to keep him over night but - but he’s going to be fine. [cries]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. [Luke hugs her] Ok, see here’s where the guy is supposed to give the girl his handkerchief but I don’t have one...and plus I find the practice a little revolting so...

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m ok.

speaker: LUKE
words: You sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Alright. Oh hey, I got this for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, where’d you get that?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nurse’s lounge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? You’re not the only one who can flirt [Lorelai laughs] The door was open.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Anything else I can do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could you take Rory home?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah sure. What about you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m gonna stick around here for a while and make sure everything’s are settled you know. You take her and I’ll drive the jeep back.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok. [Rory comes out]

speaker: RORY
words: He’s gonna be fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. I think it was those financial papers that really did the trick. [they giggle] So, um, Luke’s gonna take you home ok, I’m gonna hang out here for a while.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll stay too.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, go, call Dean. Talk mushy to each other and then spend an hour arguing over who’s going to hang up first.

speaker: RORY
words: You are gross.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll call you later.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, well tell him good bye for me. And tell Grandpa I’ll come back tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I will, bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, walk fast and look straight ahead.
[Grandma and Joshua come out, Joshua leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: He’s almost asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where’s Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I sent her home with Luke.

speaker: EMILY
words: What about you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought I’d stick around in case anybody needed anything.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean not you. You obviously don’t need anything, but somebody somewhere in this hospital might at some point need something and I’m gonna be the person who gets it for them.

speaker: EMILY
words: Would you like to go down to the cafeteria for something to eat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Maybe somebody in the cafeteria will need something.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh dear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And won’t they feel lucky when they see me. ‘Hey I needed something and there you were’, it’s going to be a great moment.
CUT TO LUKE’S

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, how’s your dad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Better, though he says that life is not life unless it includes a steak. How come you’re not out with everybody?

speaker: LUKE
words: I had some things to do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, anyways, this is for you. [giving him a bag]

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s it for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just thank you, Christmas, whatever.

speaker: LUKE
words: Christmas isn’t for two weeks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do we really have to do this again? [he opens the present. It’s a baseball hat] I just thought, you know, God forbid something happens to that one, you might need a spare. Here [put it on forwards] Does that look wrong. [puts in on backwards] There! Oh hey turn out the lights [going to the window]

speaker: LUKE
words: For what? It’s not the real procession, it’s just the rehearsal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, it’s pretty.

speaker: LUKE
words: And why do they need to rehearse it? It’s the same thing every year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on Luke, please. [he turns out the lights and joins her by the window] It’s hard to imagine living somewhere else isn’t it?

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks for the hat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. Looks good on you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good how?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just watch the procession.
(Lorelai and Rory are walking down the street)

speaker: RORY
words: L?

speaker: LORELAI
words: L-laryngitis. M?

speaker: RORY
words: Mumps. N?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Narcolepsy! O?

speaker: RORY
words: Are we going to have to go through this every time we decide who cleans out the refrigerator?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want to go back to thumb wrestling?

speaker: RORY
words: Osteoporosis. P?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (gasps) Puppies!! (runs across the street)

speaker: RORY
words: That's not a disease. Oh boy. (runs after her)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to all the puppies) Hi! Oh hi! Hi! Oohh! Rory look at the baby! (in front of one)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, Buttercup was found cold and wet hovering under a hydrangea bush along highway 26. It's a sad highway.

speaker: RORY
words: As compare to all the other happy highways she could've been abandoned by.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her lineage includes cocker spaniel, golden retriever, bouvier des flandres -

speaker: RORY
words: Gesundheith

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you - and rottweiler.

speaker: RORY
words: Buttercup is a special dog. She's extremely skiddish and tends to react badly towards blonde haired females, brunette males, children of either sex, other animals, red clothing, cabbage or anyone in a uniform.
(Luke walks up to them)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Luke) Hey, we just found the doggy version of you.

speaker: MAN
words: Can I help you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Do not let these two anywhere near a dog. They can barely feed themselves.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shut up you! We'd be excellent pet owners, thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: You cannot be serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We could get him a pretty bowl...

speaker: RORY
words: It's a her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ...and a new name...

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ..cause this 'Buttercup' thing really has got to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Do I need to remind you of Skippy?

speaker: LUKE
words: Skippy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe you would bring up Skippy.

speaker: RORY
words: Skippy was our hamster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He doesn't care.

speaker: LUKE
words: What happened to Skippy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing happened to Skippy.

speaker: RORY
words: Every time mom would put her hand in his cage, he'd bit her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And laugh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hamster's can't laugh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh this one laughed - trust me.

speaker: RORY
words: So finally she got fed up.

speaker: LUKE
words: Of being laughed at by a hamster?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: So she stopped cleaning it's cage. Instead everyday she would stuff some Kleenex in there.

speaker: LUKE
words: You didn't?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was the quilted kind (with a small smile)

speaker: RORY
words: So this keeps going on and the cage is just a cage full of Kleenex that moves a little, and the smell? Really good.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can imagine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no you can't

speaker: RORY
words: So then she takes the cage to the place where we bought him, waits for the sales guy to go behind the desk and dumps it on the counter then bolts.

speaker: LUKE
words: You abandoned your hamster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, I know it was bad, but this was a vicious hamster. This was like a Damien hamster with little beady eyes and a big forked tail and...a cape with a...hood...and bye bye Buttercup. Bye Luke.

speaker: RORY
words: You did the right thing. (both walking away from the puppies with arms around each other)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh (in a whiny tone). I want a pet.

speaker: RORY
words: You have me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You won't bring me my slippers in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: I might if you had slippers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Will you wear a collar?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It'll be pink!

speaker: RORY
words: You're sick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey watch how you talk to me. Remember what happened to Skippy.
(Cut to Max Medina's apartment. He's cleaning while Lorelai sits on the counter eating out of a pot.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm...God this is good!

speaker: MAX
words: OK. Correct me if I'm wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Salt please.

speaker: MAX
words: Twenty minutes ago we were sitting at the dinner table were we not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we were.

speaker: MAX
words: There were candles and flowers and plates and knifes and cloth napkins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I love the little sombrero napkin holders, very ole.

speaker: MAX
words: And the whole time we were at said dinner table, you ate two maybe three bites of this amazing dinner I made for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pass the bread.

speaker: MAX
words: And yet, as soon as that dinner's over and I start cleaning up, suddenly that's when you're starving.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What can I say - watching someone work makes me hungry. If I hadn't stopped watching "This Old House" I'd be 500 lbs right now.

speaker: MAX
words: Hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

speaker: MAX
words: Passing these to you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In the dish please. Ha ha ha. (as Max puts food into pot.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So where did you learn to make osso bucco anyway?

speaker: MAX
words: Um, from this very old Italian woman...who used to live upstairs...um, s-she had lost her husband a couple of years before and she kinda looked at me as like a son.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweet!

speaker: MAX
words: She was.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So an old girlfriend huh?

speaker: MAX
words: Yep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hm.

speaker: MAX
words: So would you like some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes please. (Walks by Max and their faces come very close together)
(Lorelai walks over to his desk)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey did you read Rory's paper yet?

speaker: MAX
words: Not yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's really good.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm sure it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh and look! It's right on top.

speaker: MAX
words: Isn't that a coincidence?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughs) Wow, there are some really big words in here. I just hope you have a dictionary with you when you read it.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know I could just save you the time and uh, put an 'A' on it for you.

speaker: MAX
words: Well that really wouldn't be fair to the other students who's mothers aren't here tonight would it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you're right. (pause) Although, life isn't fair and the sooner those kids learn that the better.

speaker: MAX
words: Well I'll take that advise into account.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (giggles). (turns around to look at his books) Wow these are beautiful!. Hm, I never read Proust, I always wanted to. Every now and then, I'm seized with an overwhelming urge to say something like "As Marcel Proust would say.." but of course I have no idea what Marcel Proust would say so I don't even go there. I could do, uh, "As Micheal Crichton would say.." but it's not exactly the same you know.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, take it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no! It-it looks so valuable

speaker: MAX
words: It's a book. It's meant to be read.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You sure?

speaker: MAX
words: Take it, read it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I will.
(She takes the book and sits down and starts to read)

speaker: MAX
words: (laughing) Not now!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: I'd rather you didn't read it now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But um, what about (Max kisses her) my required reading (stands up, moving towards the bedroom, between kissing..) But I won't make the cheerleading squad! (kissing) Mr. Medina, is this my extra credit work because Missy just had to take a test!?! (laughing through kisses. Door closes.)
(Cut to Lorelai sneaking in with shoes in hand)
(Rory's waiting up on the couch)

speaker: RORY
words: Where do you think you're going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: It's one o'clock in the morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know but my watch stopped during a terrible car wreck and I had to save kittens and small children and four baby chicks.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you have a nice time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not bad. (smiling)

speaker: RORY
words: That's a very big smile for a not bad night. (Lorelai sits on the couch)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah well...Hey he loaned me a book.

speaker: RORY
words: What book?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Swann's Way'

speaker: RORY
words: Aren't we ambitious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we are.

speaker: RORY
words: You know what it means when a man loans you a book don't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That he's already read it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughs a little) How was your night?

speaker: RORY
words: Homework.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How many times did Dean call.

speaker: RORY
words: Not that many.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How many?

speaker: RORY
words: Three (Lorelai looks at her)...Five.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughs) Not an all time high but very respectable. I'm going to bed. You staying here?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I'm comfortable. I've got the pillows in a perfect mushed position.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Night mom. (kissing Rory)

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah you just go think about what you've done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (with big smile) I will.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: You look happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am kid.

speaker: RORY
words: Just checking.
(Cut to Chilton - Mr. Medina's class)

speaker: MAX
words: "There's a certain slant of light, winter afternoons that oppresses like the heft of cathedral tunes." That, my friends is the first verse of a poem by Emily Dickenson. Now read some of those tonight, and as you do, consider the fact that Emily Dickenson writes convincingly about passion and about the world in spite of the fact that she lived as a virtual recluse. It'll help you appreciate her mind. (bell rings)

speaker: MADELINE
words: I could listen to him talk about passion all day. Do you think he's dating anyone?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Of course he is.

speaker: MADELINE
words: A teacher?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Please.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Why not?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Have you seen teachers?

speaker: MADELINE
words: He's a teacher.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Male teachers are different. They can still be mysterious.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I bet his girlfriend's pretty.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I bet she's dumb.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Why?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Dumb girls crave smart men. It's that whole Marilyn Monroe - Arthur Miller syndrome.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I still think she's lucky

speaker: PARIS
words: Whoever he's dating is a loser, who doesn't care that he's a teacher in this ridiculous school making a ridiculous teacher's salary. (to Rory) What are you looking at? (walks away)

speaker: LOUISE
words: Guess someone read the paper today.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I know. Paris' parent's divorce is getting very ugly!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Her dad should've just paid her mom everything she wanted and this whole thing would've been over.

speaker: MADELINE
words: That's what my dad did. (to Rory) Hi!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Is it true Paris' mom had the entire back of her body surgically reconstructed?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Well it doesn't match the front now does it?
(Cut to Grandma's house)
(Dinner time)

speaker: GRANDMA
words: How's the squab?

speaker: RORY
words: It's good.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's the best tiny, weird bird I have ever eaten.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I'm glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you smiling like that?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're smiling.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I'm happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not your "I'm happy" smile.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well what smile is it Loerlai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's your "I've got something on Lorelai" smile.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Rory your mother must be very tired.

speaker: RORY
words: She works a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I grew up with that smile - I know that smile.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Tell me about school.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, my French final went pretty well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can change the subject. I know the smile.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Whatever you say dear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've used it a few times myself.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: So tell me about parent's day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Parent's day? Next Wednesday? When all the parents are supposed to go to the classes with their children all day long?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Chilton newsletter came out today!

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You didn't read yours?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not yet.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you knew that -

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hence the smile.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Lorelai, you're really being silly. There's no evil plan a foot here. I simply brought up a subject I thought we could all talk about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh right.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I'll try another subject - the colour blue is very pleasant isn't it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom not everybody can wait outside the mailbox for the Chilton newsletter to arrive and then instantly memorize the contents in three seconds.

speaker: RORY
words: I'd like to weigh in on the blue colour subject please.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You have your priorities far be it from me to question them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just because I don't read the newsletter doesn't mean I don't care about my daughter.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: So are you going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To what?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: To parent's day!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't we talk about it next Friday when I've actually read the newsletter. I guarantee it'll be more fun.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: We could except for the fact that parents day is next Wednesday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wednesday?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: If we talked about it on Friday then you would've missed it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wednesday huh?

speaker: RORY
words: It's ok mom, you don't have to be there.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I guess we can talk about how you missed it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm won't miss it.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom it's not a big deal, you're busy.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You know what - I'll go!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Why not? You have to work. I, as you have insinuated, have no life, therefore I will go sit with Rory at parent's day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not busy, I'm going. I will be there - that's it. End of story ok?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: So did you read on page two about the mother/daughter talent show?
(Lorelai chokes on her food)

speaker: RORY
words: You ok? (smiling)
(Cut to Gilmore house)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom I have to go! It's almost 8 o'clock!
(Lorelai running around her room getting ready)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait! Have you seen my orange suede clip thingy?

speaker: RORY
words: Top right hand drawer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not there.
(Rory huffs and goes upstairs to help)

speaker: RORY
words: Did you check in your purse?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Under your scarves?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.
(at the bedroom door)

speaker: RORY
words: In your sock drawer?
(Lorelai looks in the sock drawer and finds it.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (gasps) I love you.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye (give Rory a kiss)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey wait!

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Blue disco sequence bag?

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye! (pause) Wait-wait-wait!

speaker: RORY
words: Mom come on! Mr. Medina's going to be here any minute!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, just tell me one more thing. Where's the silver dangly bracelet?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm wearing it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you wearing it?

speaker: RORY
words: Because it's mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh...right...Hey can I borrow your silver dangly bracelet?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll leave it on the table for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
(Rory heads for the door and the doorbell rings)

speaker: LORELAI
words: What was that?

speaker: RORY
words: The door bell rang?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why did the door bell ring?

speaker: RORY
words: Because someone's at the door.
(Lorelai comes down the stairs while Max listens from outside.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's 8 o'clock. Who shows up at 8 o'clock for an 8 o'clock date?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know, maybe a Chilton teacher?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 15 tops!

speaker: RORY
words: Well obviously he was raised in a barn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I tell you, he's cute but this punctuality thing has knocked 10 points off the dream guy quotient.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom what do I do? I'm not even supposed to be here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok so go!
(Rory turns to leave)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh wa-wa-wait! You have to get the door.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, because I'm not ready.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not supposed to get the door remember, we agreed. I don't get the door when you have a date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know but...

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not even supposed to be here. That's the first rule of the 'Gilmore Dating Handbook'. (as Lorelai fiddle with her skirt zipper). Daughter shall be nowhere near house when said man materializes. It's a good rule, it 's been working.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, but he's standing out there and it's cold and my slip is now completely stuck in my skirt zipper and they'll have to bury me like this.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just this once! (as she runs upstairs)
(Rory opens the door)

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: MAX
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Come on in.

speaker: MAX
words: Thank you (clears his throat)

speaker: RORY
words: Can I get you something, I mean we don't really have anything but if you wanted something and we had it, I'd be happy to get it for you.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm fine.

speaker: RORY
words: We have water.

speaker: MAX
words: That's ok.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not bad water actually. I mean it's not a funny colour or anything.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm good. Really.

speaker: RORY
words: We have bottled water.

speaker: MAX
words: No thanks,

speaker: RORY
words: One bottle actually.

speaker: MAX
words: I-it's quite alright.

speaker: RORY
words: We really need to go to the store.

speaker: MAX
words: So..should we...

speaker: RORY
words: Sit? Right. Yeah let's sit.
(They move into living room)

speaker: MAX
words: So, uh, what are your plans tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going over to my friend Lane's house.

speaker: MAX
words: Sounds good.

speaker: RORY
words: And you guys are...?

speaker: MAX
words: Dinner, movie - the usual.

speaker: RORY
words: Right.
(Both look upstairs. Max clears his throat.)

speaker: MAX
words: This is a little uncomfortable.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: MAX
words: But the thing is, if things go well, the way I hope they're going, then we might be doing this again.

speaker: RORY
words: Sitting uncomfortably?

speaker: MAX
words: (laughs) Seeing each other outside of school.

speaker: RORY
words: That's ok. I am fine with this whole you and my mom thing.

speaker: MAX
words: Well good. I'm glad.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, better go. (gets up to leave)

speaker: MAX
words: It's good to talk to you Rory. (standing up)

speaker: RORY
words: You too Mr. Medina. (She turns to leave)

speaker: MAX
words: why don't you call me Max? Just when we're out of school.

speaker: RORY
words: (turning back) I don't think I can do that.

speaker: MAX
words: Why not?

speaker: RORY
words: It just sounds wrong - disrespectful. I mean, you're my teacher Mr. Medina, and if I start to think of you as a 'Max' - even as a part-time 'Max', it just seems lit it would get too confusing.

speaker: MAX
words: How 'bout then, we'll come up with non-Chilton names for each other. When we're not in school, I'll call you Rebecca.

speaker: RORY
words: Rebecca.

speaker: MAX
words: And you'll call me...

speaker: RORY
words: Norman?

speaker: MAX
words: Norman?

speaker: RORY
words: Well...

speaker: MAX
words: I look like a Norman to you?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, 'Psycho' was on earlier and it was just the first name that came to mind. I'll think of something else. How about Alfred?

speaker: MAX
words: You know what...Norman's fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: MAX
words: I'm positive, I love it. I might make a legal change.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. Well I better go.

speaker: MAX
words: I hope you and Lane have a good time.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. Oh, would you give this to my mom for me?

speaker: MAX
words: Absolutely.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.
(Rory starts to leave.)

speaker: RORY
words: Oh and Norman - have her home by 10.
(Max waves her off)
(Cut to Luke's)
(Rory's sitting at the counter as Sookie and Jackson enter)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can't believe you won't just sell them to me.

speaker: JACKSON
words: And I can't believe you're being so small minded.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: My stuffed fried squash blossoms are extremely popular with the customers.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: People come from all over and demand the fried stuffed squash blossoms.

speaker: JACKSON
words: That's exactly my point!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What'll you have sir? Anything that comes with the stuffed fried squash blossoms. That's what I hear day in and day out.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes, great, I know, but all I'm asking you is to try stuffing something a little different this time huh? (holds up a zucchini tush)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A zucchini tush?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Just a temporary name.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You want me to serve my customers a genetically engineered vegetable that's named after a butt?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hey this is an all natural vegetable hybrid that's perfectly safe, completely delicious, and yes it looks a little odd but you can put in on the map!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I want the blossoms.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Fine. You wanna think small, think small. I'm done. (leaves)
(Sookie sighs and sits next to Rory)

speaker: RORY
words: Jackson invented a new vegetable again?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yup.

speaker: RORY
words: It's too bad that bowling league didn't work out for him.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah.
(Lorelai enters with skates over her shoulder)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, look I found them.

speaker: RORY
words: Where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They were in that drawer with the roasting pans.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oooh skates!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory and I have a skating date.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm Nancy Kerrigan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I'm Tonya Harding. I'm gonna do the whole shoe lace coming untie - nervous break - let me start again act and everything.

speaker: LUKE
words: (laughing) When was the last time you put those things on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you are constantly trying to ruin my fun.

speaker: LUKE
words: Do they even fit anymore?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes they fit.

speaker: LUKE
words: They look rusted.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well...can I just have some coffee please?

speaker: LUKE
words: (sighs) Hand them over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm gonna clean them and tighten the blades.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really!?!

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can you make them really shiny?

speaker: LUKE
words: The skates please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe add a couple of pompoms.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just hand them over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You get really good service here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah I do.
(Sookie's pager goes off.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Gotta go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything wrong?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Too much yeast, too little bowl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Enough said.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Rory) So I think I'm just going to go for it and wear the fur-trimmed skating skirt, pride be damned.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, what if we invite Max to go skating with us?

speaker: LORELAI
words: M-max?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I thought maybe he'd want to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When did you start calling him Max?

speaker: RORY
words: Well the other night he said that I should probably call him something other than Mr. Medina when we're outside of school. Which makes sense, so I'm getting used to saying 'Max'.

speaker: LORELAI
words: W- you don't see him that much outside school.

speaker: RORY
words: No, but I probably will since you guys are obsessed with each other.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well I wouldn't say 'obsessed'.

speaker: RORY
words: No. It's ok, I mean of all the guys to have hanging around, he seems like a good choice. I like him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, well that's good.

speaker: RORY
words: So what do you think about the skating?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Mr. Medina - I'm sorry, Max? Do you think he'd wanna go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't think he skates. (to Luke) Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: Well maybe we could all do something else together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, good. Something else is good. I love something else.
(Cut to Gilmore house)
(Kettle whistles.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok, tea is ready. How are the feet?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. They stopped talking to me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What on earth were you thinking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That I could still skate.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's not like riding a bike you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now you tell me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So, (sitting at table) what are you up to tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm going to do a little line dancing, then run a 10K, then just jump up and down really hard for about an hour.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Taking a night off?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't seem him every night Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He seems like a great guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He is.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That didn't sound very convincing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, he is. He is a great guy - for someone.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: For someone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Someone else?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Someone else who is not you although you're the person spending every waking hour with him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Aha. How long have you been dating?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Two months you've been seeing him right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Point Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mmm. Just right on schedule that's all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have no idea what you're talking about.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: This is about the time you start doing you little getaway dance. Two months right on the nose - you're good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do not do a dance.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're cha-cha-cha-ing right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not cha-cha-cha-ing. I'm being practical. Rory is starting to get attached to Max and that's not good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh Rory's getting attached to Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes and since I've decided that Max is probably not the guy for me, I think it's better that we break it off before she gets hurt.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Practical

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh, can I say something here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course you can.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Cha-cha-cha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (singing) Livin' la vida loca.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Shake your bon-bon, shake your bon-bon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you will not stand there singing Ricky Martin songs to me. This is not a pattern ok? I'm not doing what I always do. This is not the same.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Actually you're right. Usually you don't get so upset and defensive during the cha-cha talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (painfully) Ah! (as Sookie pours hot water into foot basin)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You must really like this guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When did you become the relationship expert? You haven't been in a relationship in years. (Sookie looks sad as Lorelai realizes what she said). Wow! Zero to jackass in 3.2 seconds.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's alright, your feet hurt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No it isn't. It's never ever ok for me to talk to you like that. I'm so so sorry. Please honey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (sighs) I understand - really. You know it's not like I don't want a relationship.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I didn't mean anything by it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (sighs) It's just - it's hard with my hours. I'm always at the inn, or at the market or at the hospital.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please - forgive me. Do you wanna...sing some more Ricky Martin to me?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can you know - I deserver it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: (quietly) 'She's into superstition, black cats and voodoo dolls. (louder) I've got a premonition, that girl's gonna make me fall.' (imitates guitar tunes)
(Cut to Chilton)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know I heard that Paris' dad's actually got a second family in Paris.

speaker: GUY
words: Whoa.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah.
(Rory rolls her eyes as she walks by.)

speaker: MAX
words: Uh, Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Mr. Medina.

speaker: MAX
words: I enjoyed your paper on Dickenson.

speaker: RORY
words: I had fun writing it.

speaker: MAX
words: It showed.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: MAX
words: You're welcome (Rory turns to go) Um, Rory?
(Rory turns back)

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: MAX
words: No, that's it. That's all I wanted to say.

speaker: RORY
words: My name?

speaker: MAX
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: MAX
words: Actually I just wanted to see if Lore- (looks around) if your mom is coming to parent's day.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh well...

speaker: MAX
words: Cause I'm just trying to get an accurate number of parents who are coming - you know for the cookie count.
(Rory smiles at him)

speaker: MAX
words: Forget it. (sighing)

speaker: RORY
words: She's coming.

speaker: MAX
words: (relieved) I hadn't heard from her for a while about it and -

speaker: RORY
words: She'll be here.

speaker: MAX
words: Ok, good. Good.

speaker: RORY
words: But you should put us down for four.

speaker: MAX
words: Four what?

speaker: RORY
words: Four cookies.

speaker: MAX
words: Ok, good. I will.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
(Max sighs)
(Cut to Gilmore house)
(Lorelai is cleaning out the fridge.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Four slices pepperoni pizza.

speaker: RORY
words: From?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tuesday?

speaker: RORY
words: Last Tuesday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Tuesday in the not so distant past.

speaker: RORY
words: Toss it. (sits at table) So you remember Paris Geller.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your very best friend in the whole world?

speaker: RORY
words: Her parents are getting a major divorce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really.

speaker: RORY
words: Her dad's like this big wig at a huge pharmaceutical company and they're printing all the sordid details about it in the paper.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh how sordid?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it's not the Rich James incident, but Hugh Grant should be feeling pretty good about himself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If she was anyone else in the entire universe I might feel bad for her.

speaker: RORY
words: Actually I kind of do feel bad for her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because you are the nicest kid ever to walk the earth.

speaker: RORY
words: The whole school's talking about it. And the weird thing is that the whole dynamics there has changed for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? How so? (gets up to go towards fridge)

speaker: RORY
words: Well, Madeline and Louise, Paris' best friends, they said hello to me the other day.
(Both munching on cold fries)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Like a normal hello? Not like a 'Here's Johnny' kind of hello?

speaker: RORY
words: Normal, friendly, no acts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you're the new 'Heather'

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.
(Lorelai pulls out another pizza box)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey, this is the pizza from mystery Tuesday. That one's completely fine (pointing to the one in the garbage bin.)

speaker: RORY
words: Don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's in the box!

speaker: RORY
words: Oscar!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Felix!

speaker: RORY
words: Forget it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.
(Rory goes back to table.)

speaker: RORY
words: So how's 'Swann's Way' coming.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh finished.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding! It took me forever to read that. I had to renew it 10 times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The first sentence - I finished the first sentence.

speaker: RORY
words: Aha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah - it's just - I'm so swamped right now you know, it's the totally wrong time to start reading the longest book known to man. Hey maybe you could give it back to Max for me?

speaker: RORY
words: Just bring it with you tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow?

speaker: RORY
words: Parent's day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know (she didn't) I'm just - I'm not sure I'm going to be able to make it.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I have that thing at the inn and I thought I could get away and now I can't.

speaker: RORY
words: What thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The thing - the inn thing?

speaker: RORY
words: What inn thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know.

speaker: RORY
words: No I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The thing at the inn with the flags and the little men and the peanuts - the thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Little men?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forget it, it's not important - I just don't think I can go.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, if you could give this book back to Max tomorrow - that would be great.

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you just give it back to him the next time you see him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I'm not sure when that would be and he should have his book. (getting a bit upset)

speaker: RORY
words: You see him all the time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, could you just (drops book on table) give it back to him ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Are you breaking up with him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: Well he hasn't heard from you and now you're asking me to give him the book back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How do you know he hasn't heard from me?

speaker: RORY
words: He wanted to know if you were going to Parent's day and then he mentioned that you guys hadn't talked lately.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He shouldn't be asking you about me.

speaker: RORY
words: Why are you breaking up with him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it's not working out.

speaker: RORY
words: But you seemed so happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not right - that's all.

speaker: RORY
words: So that's why you're not going tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not going tomorrow because of the thing at the inn.

speaker: RORY
words: That's crap and you know it (upset)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey -

speaker: RORY
words: There is no thing at the inn, you're avoiding Mr. Medina and you're trying to lie to me and you promised you would go and - hey, do whatever you want. I don't care, just leave me out of it. And give him the book back yourself. (Rory goes to her room and slams the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine I will. (takes the pizza out of garbage.)
(Cut to Chilton)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, not so fast.

speaker: RORY
words: The bell's gonna ring.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Before you go one more step - tell me you like me?

speaker: RORY
words: You bug me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll take that as a yes. And I want you to know that I will deal with my issues with Max myself.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really.

speaker: RORY
words: I believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So where are we going?

speaker: RORY
words: To my locker to drop off some of this stuff.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great, let's do it.
(see Paris and her mother by Paris' locker arguing)

speaker: PARIS
words: You can't just leave now.

speaker: MOM
words: Paris please.

speaker: PARIS
words: At least come to my lit class.

speaker: MOM
words: This place is giving me a headache.

speaker: PARIS
words: Mom.

speaker: MOM
words: Is your face breaking out?

speaker: PARIS
words: No.

speaker: MOM
words: You have not being using that cleanser have you? Now Dr. Yanalari prescribed that cleanser for a reason - to cleanse.

speaker: PARIS
words: Just lit class.

speaker: MOM
words: Paris with everything I have going on right now the last thing I need to do is face a bunch of bored people who are gossiping about me. I'll see you later at home. Use that cover stick I got you.
(Paris sighs)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I bet I'm looking pretty good to you right now.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. So what's first? Wait don't tell me.

speaker: RORY
words: English lit with Mr. Max Medina.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok see I told you not to tell me.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mr. Medina's class huh?

speaker: RORY
words: The fancy book owner himself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How does first annual mother/daughter ditch day sound?

speaker: RORY
words: Not happening.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah yeah, ok - let's go.
(Cut to Mr. Medina's class)

speaker: MAX
words: On Monday we will start a two week of creative writing exercise, but that doesn't mean we stop reading. One of the greatest inspirations of working writers is the writing of other that they admire. Walt Whitman read Homer, Dante, Shakespeare. And the novelist Edna O'Brien has been quoted as saying 'that every writer should read some Proust every day' Now, at this point, normally I would impress the partens by pulling out a copy of Proust's 'Swann's Way' and reading a particularly difficult passage but alas, you're all saved. I have misplaced my copy. (bell rings) Oh that does is - parent's thanks for coming, students - papers on Whitman are due tomorrow and those of you who are just starting tonight - I'll be able to tell.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you go on ahead ok? I'm going to talk to Max for a second.

speaker: RORY
words: Please be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will, I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to Max) Hi.

speaker: MAX
words: Hi - it's nice to see you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I've been really busy.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh sure - I assumed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanted to give this back to you.

speaker: MAX
words: Keep it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I really liked it. I like the first 20 pages anyway, then I got busy and I can see you really need it so - (tries to give him the book)

speaker: MAX
words: What's going on Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I just don't think a book whose first sentence is 20 pages long is for me.

speaker: MAX
words: Well I left four messages

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know - I've been meaning to call.

speaker: MAX
words: What's been keeping you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know - things.

speaker: MAX
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: MAX
words: Sorry?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That I didn't call.

speaker: MAX
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So - here. (tries to give him book again)

speaker: MAX
words: Why do you keep on trying to give me the book?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it's yours.

speaker: MAX
words: Is there something going on here that I don't know about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, uh I hate Proust.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, um Rory's out there waiting for me so... (tries to give him book again)

speaker: MAX
words: Wa-wait a minute...Oh my God! I cannot believe what an idiot I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: You're breaking up with me aren't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.

speaker: MAX
words: Not only are you breaking up with me, you're doing it really badly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Am I being graded?

speaker: MAX
words: No, I'm a little disappointed. I would've expected a better dumping from you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nobody's dumping anyone.

speaker: MAX
words: Really? Then what is this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just need space.

speaker: MAX
words: Well I don't. In fact I want as little space as possible. 100 clowns crammed into a Volkswagen. That's the kind of non-space I'm talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not working.

speaker: MAX
words: It was working pretty good the other night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look it is what I've been trying to tell you all along. This is a family. Rory and I, you walked into a family, but you weren't listening and now she's getting attached and I'm afraid she's gonna get hurt.

speaker: MAX
words: So you solution to all of this is not to return my calls

speaker: LORELAI
words: It just took me a while to figure things out and it all came clear when I realized how much we could hurt Rory.

speaker: MAX
words: Don't you mean how much we could hurt Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey - I can take care of myself.

speaker: MAX
words: I don't understand this. I thought we went through this. W-we decided she could handle it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well maybe she can and maybe she can't. I'm not ready to find out.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm not going to let you off that easily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well there's nothing you can do about it.

speaker: MAX
words: There has to be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There isn't.

speaker: MAX
words: There is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well no there isn't.

speaker: MAX
words: Yes there is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are we in high school? Well I know we are in a high school.

speaker: MAX
words: This is so not you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you don't know everything about me.

speaker: MAX
words: I guess not, because I would've thought that blaming this all on Rory and giving me these lame apologies was weak, pathetic and beneath you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just take you damn book

speaker: MAX
words: You've missed me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop it.

speaker: MAX
words: I know you did, you're missing me right now aren't you?
(Lorelai sighs)

speaker: MAX
words: Answer me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look class is over -

speaker: MAX
words: Well we're back in session.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I didn't raise my hand so don't call on me! I came here to give you this book back, please take it.

speaker: MAX
words: I swear to God if you try to give me that book one more time...
(They kiss passionately. Outside the class Paris walks by and sees them kiss)
(Cut to cafeteria)
(Gets noisier and noisier as Paris walks from table to table talking to people. Tristin walks by Rory and makes a 'kiss' sound to her. Paris walks up to Rory.)

speaker: RORY
words: What's going on?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, everyone's just talking about the mom that Mr. Medina was seen kissing just now.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: And the weird thing is - she looks a lot like your mom.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: PARIS
words: Your mom - Mr. Medina, mouths open. I saw them. How's the coleslaw? Good? (walks away)
(Lorelai walks into cafeteria)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you save me some jello?
(Rory gets up and leaves)

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? (follows Rory out) Rory?! Hey where are you gong?

speaker: RORY
words: Were you kissing him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Mr. Medina, just now, were you kissing him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
