words: What the hell is wrong with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.

speaker: RORY
words: You said you were breaking up with him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was.

speaker: RORY
words: I know I told you to be nice to him but this was a little extreme don't you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It wasn't supposed to happen.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris saw you! It's all over the school!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God - oh Rory, I'm so sorry. I really am. See this is exactly why I didn't want to date him.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't want to date him so you wouldn't come to my school and kiss him and humiliate me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes that's exactly it.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you do this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I'm human, because I screwed up. I'm sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: If you like him so much then why are you breaking up with him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, I broke the rules when I brought him into our lives and I realize now that that was a very bad idea.

speaker: RORY
words: But why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?! Because we are standing in this stairwell yelling at each other that's why! Because it's affecting you, it's seeping into your life and that is the whole reason I made these rules in the first place. Is-is to protect you!

speaker: RORY
words: You know what, maybe it was a good idea that you hid your personal life from me when I was a kid but I'm not a kid anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you're right. You're a 40 year old divorcee - my mistake.

speaker: RORY
words: Ugh! I can't believe you're blaming this on me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not blaming you!

speaker: RORY
words: You made up these stupid rules years ago about the way the Gilmore women would run their lives and now you're sticking to them even though they're crazy!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh hey my crazy, stupid rules are the reason we're doing so good in our lives. They're the reason you grew up the way you did, the reason you're even in this school and the reason you're going to go to Harvard so don't you dismiss my rules.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine! Great! Well, maybe it's time for the rules to change!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well that's for me to figure out, not you!

speaker: RORY
words: Great! Fine! Well could you figure it out before French class because I'd rather you didn't start making out with Mrs. Collins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey no promises until I see what she looks like!
(Cut to front of Grandma's house)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, let's just refrain from fighting in front of the grandmother ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The last thing I need tonight is a confrontation with my mother
(rings doorbell)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi mom, boy the roads were a mess out there tonight. (entering)

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Rory go upstairs please.

speaker: RORY
words: Is everything ok?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I have to talk to your mother, please go upstairs.

speaker: RORY
words: Well -

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Now Rory.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: (walks into living room) Lorelai come here!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gee mom, did I do something wrong?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I try to understand you, I truly do. But sometimes your behaviour baffles me beyond belief.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And which behaviour is this?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Do you have no shame?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is that intended as a rhetorical question or - ?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Rory goes to school in that place, she has a reputation to protect. You're her mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did you -

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You're supposed to shield her from shame not cause it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh mom?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Kissing a teacher...in a classroom...on parent's day!!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well...they wanted us to get more involved with the school.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Are you insane?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No but you are if you think I'm discussing this with you.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: When I heard I almost fainted.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did you hear mom?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I have friends Lorelai. Headmaster Charleston's wife for one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's great.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: The entire school is talking about it. And what do I say, how do I defend this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was a mistake.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: A mistake? A mistake? Is that what you call it a mistake?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I tried to call it 'Al' but it would only answer to 'mistake'.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: A mistake is when you throw out your credit card bill - a mistake is when you forget to RSVP to a dinner party - a mistake is when the gardeners miss trash day and the barrels are full for a week. This my girl, was not a mistake! Do you even know this man?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, no, this is the first time I'd seen him and I don't know, there was just something about the way he held the chalk and -

speaker: GRANDMA
words: This is not the time for your jokes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I knew him. I've been dating him.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Why on earth would you date Rory's teacher?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's none of your business.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: It most certainly is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How do you figure that?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: When it affects my granddaughter it becomes my business.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't want to talk about this with you!

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I just want to know what you were thinking. What was the reasoning? How on earth did you justify it to yourself?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max is a great guy. An amazing guy! He's smart, he's sweet (teary) he cooks.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: So you decided to kiss him in your daughter's school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I decided to breakup with him in my daughter's school and the kissing part just happened.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You always let your emotions get in the way. That's the problem with you Lorelai - you don't think.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom - please.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: He's just a man Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No he's not.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh so what are you telling me. That this was all worth it because he was the love of you life, that this was the man for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. He might have been. Excuse me (leaves room)
(Cut to Chilton cafeteria)
(Rory sitting at a table. Paris, Louise and Madeline walk up behind her.)

speaker: LOUISE
words: See, I told you he wouldn't date a teacher.

speaker: PARIS
words: I wish my mom would sleep with my teacher, it would make midterms a lot easier.
(Rory slams her book closed, stands up and turns to face them)

speaker: RORY
words: Madeline, Louise, would you excuse us for a minute?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ooh cat fight.

speaker: RORY
words: Go.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're not going to kiss me are you? (smiling)

speaker: RORY
words: What's wrong with you?

speaker: PARIS
words: Nothing I'm great.

speaker: RORY
words: You've just spent the past two weeks with all of your family's private problems printed in the newspaper for everyone to read and talk about. I saw how you walked around here! I saw how much you hated it. And then you turn around and pull something like this? Doesn't that seem crazy to you? Do you have any idea how many people you've hurt? Forget me and my mom, what about Mr. Medina? He likes you, he encourages you. He hold up your papers and tells the class how great you are. And then you turn around and spread stories about him. (pause). Whatever, forget it. You have no idea what I'm talking about. (grabs her stuff and starts to leave)

speaker: PARIS
words: I do like Mr. Medina.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I'd take some dance lessons cause the way you express yourself needs a little work.

speaker: PARIS
words: I...probably shouldn't have told people what I saw.

speaker: RORY
words: No you shouldn't have.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm sorry...things have been...well...not good lately.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: PARIS
words: I just didn't want them talking about me anymore, that's all.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it worked.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, i-if you want to talk -

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, we are not friends.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh that I know. But if you ever do...want to talk about -

speaker: PARIS
words: I will, if I want to.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: PARIS
words: But I probably won't.

speaker: RORY
words: That's fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: But if I do -

speaker: RORY
words: I'm around.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok. I'm going now.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: PARIS
words: Bye. (Paris starts to leave and turns around)

speaker: PARIS
words: I doubt I will.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not holding my breath. (sighs and leaves)
(Cut to Independence Inn kitchen)
(Jackson drops a box of squash blossoms on the counter)

speaker: JACKSON
words: There - squash blossoms. All large enough for you to stuff and fry up and serve to the desensitize masses who just want what they know. Hurrah!! Mediocrity wins again!!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson?

speaker: JACKSON
words: You know what, I'm not even gonna charge you for these. I am not going to profit off the death of creativity. I would rather starve myself than know that my food was paid for by the lowered expectations of the American public. (starts to leave)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson?

speaker: JACKSON
words: What?!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Would you like to go to dinner sometimes...with me?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ok.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok.
(Jackson leaves, Sookie's smiling.)
(Cut to coffee shop in Hartford)
(Max sitting at the counter)

speaker: MAX
words: Thanks (to waiter)
(Lorelai walks in)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Mister, wanna buy a really nice copy of Proust?

speaker: MAX
words: How ya doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Well you know. You?

speaker: MAX
words: Well you know it also.
(Lorelai sits)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So that parent's day is fun.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, it was a big hit this year (both laugh a little)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, the other day, we were going skating, and Rory said "Why don't we invite Max to come along with us" and that was a little weird for me.

speaker: MAX
words: Me too. I don't skate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's never really referred to anyone I've dated by their first name before. I always kept her out of that part of my life, so it was like "the mustache guy", "the earring guy", "the peg leg guy".

speaker: MAX
words: Oh so you have a thing for pirates.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She never called anyone by their name before. She likes you. She likes us. So my mind instantly went to "Oh my God, what if we break up, she'll be crushed" and then my next thought was "Oh my God, what if we break up, I'll be crushed". And then as you know all hell broke loose.

speaker: MAX
words: I understand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I freaked out. I'm so sorry. I never meant to treat you like that, I'm not very good at this, ask Skippy.

speaker: MAX
words: Skippy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (shaking her head) I'm so so sorry.

speaker: MAX
words: I was called into headmaster Charleston's office today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let me guess. He put his arm around you and said "I don't understand why you crazy kids can't work this out?"

speaker: MAX
words: He said that I was jeopardizing my career and future at Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh!

speaker: MAX
words: At first I was incensed, outraged and "How dare he?!". And then I realized that he was right. What happened the other day was completely unprofessional. I never in my life would've considered pulling off something like this. He should've fired me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But he didn't.

speaker: MAX
words: Not yet, but the word 'probation' was tossed around quite a bit though.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm the one that started the kiss.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I'm the one that knocked it up to NC-17.

speaker: MAX
words: I honestly did not think that this was going to be so complicated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: MAX
words: I mean you told it would be. I didn't listen, I didn't want to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not your fault. If I hadn't acted like a two year old and tried to run away and pretend that you weren't what you are to me, then we wouldn't have fought, we wouldn't have kissed, I wouldn't have humiliated my daughter and the whole thing would've been fine.

speaker: MAX
words: (sighs) I do not know what to do here. I-I've never been in a relationship like this before. I'm not thinking straight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, me either.

speaker: MAX
words: That was a great kiss.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Beyond great.

speaker: MAX
words: Maybe we need to take a little time away from each other.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. (upset)

speaker: MAX
words: You know, just to figure out how to do this so it's not so hard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure...that makes sense.

speaker: MAX
words: I just - I don't have any other answers right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you're right. You're absolutely right. (pause) I really really like you Max Medina

speaker: MAX
words: I really really like you Lorelai Gilmore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, as long as we got that straightened out.

speaker: MAX
words: Goodbye Lorelai (gets up and leaves)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (whispers) Bye.
(Cut to Gilmore house)
(Rory comes home)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom! Mom, I'm home!
(Goes upstairs)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?
(Finds Lorelai laying on her bed crying. Rory strokes her hair in comfort and lays down with her and hugs her.)

speaker: The End
words: The End
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE
[alarm rings]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

[Lorelai comes into the kitchen, takes the coffee pot off the maker while Rory puts her coffee cup in it’s place to catch the coffee that’s still in the process of being made. Rory puts two pop tarts in the toaster, takes her coffee cup from the coffee maker while Lorelai replaces it with the pot. Lorelai puts the pop tarts on a paper towel while Rory picks up her school bag. Lorelai hands Rory a pop tart and with coffee and pop tart in hand, tries to tie her shirt. Rory hands her her coffee, puts the tart in her mouth and ties it for Lorelai. Lorelai takes the clip out of Rory’s hair, gives her a 'what were you thinking' look and tosses it aside. Rory takes her coffee back and they both leave.]
CUT TO GILMORE LIVING ROOM
[Rory and Lane are sitting on the couch]

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, you went new-cd crazy! [dumping a bag full of cd’s on the coffee table]

speaker: LANE
words: They just had an amazing selection today.

speaker: RORY
words: The best of Blondie...Kraftwerk...Young Marble Giants...Yoko Ono - really?

speaker: LANE
words: A very misunderstood artist and the Beattles would’ve broken up anyways.

speaker: RORY
words: Have you shared this theory with anyone?

speaker: LANE
words: I know it, Yoko knows it, Sean knows it. Julian’s still in denial but what can you do?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, I must listen to anyone named Claudine Longet [puts cd in player]

speaker: LANE
words: Rory...

speaker: RORY
words: Yes Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: I have a favor to ask you.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh?

speaker: LANE
words: Well you know Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: My boyfriend?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I do.

speaker: LANE
words: Ok...well remember I was telling you about his friend Todd?

speaker: RORY
words: Todd. Yes.

speaker: LANE
words: Have you met him?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LANE
words: Well he’s cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LANE
words: Really cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Good again.

speaker: LANE
words: Really, really cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Good still holds.

speaker: LANE
words: So cool in fact that it brings me to the next question [Lorelai comes into living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. I’m studying in there...

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I have like 6,000 pages of case studies to memorize and this whole big test on the Wal-Mart phenomena coming up on Friday and because I have a life and a job and business school’s not the only thing I have to concentrate on I’m behind, and I’ll probably fail and then that little 18 year old annoying knat who sits behind me will get another ‘A’ and make that ‘ I’m smart you’re dumb’ fact to me for the rest of the week and I’ll be very upset and will possibly cry.

speaker: RORY
words: The music’s too loud.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you [Lorelai turns and goes back into the kitchen as Rory turns down the volume.]

speaker: LANE
words: So anyhow, I was wondering if you could talk to Dean about maybe talking to Todd about me.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.

speaker: LANE
words: And then maybe you could ask Dean to ask him out - for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, cause I don’t think Dean would want to go out with Todd. Might screw up their friendship.

speaker: LANE
words: And then I was thinking that this date could maybe happen this weekend.

speaker: RORY
words: Huh.

speaker: LANE
words: Sunday preferably.

speaker: RORY
words: Well -

speaker: LANE
words: After church.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane -

speaker: LANE
words: But don’t mention church.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, hold on a sec -

speaker: LANE
words: Unless he’s into church.
[Lorelai comes into the living room again]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, uh, now it’s too quiet.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll turn it up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you [starts to leave]

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LANE
words: So what do you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [turning back] Who the hell is that anyways?

speaker: RORY
words: Claudine Longet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The chick who shot the skier?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, sure, why not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow - renaissance woman [turns and leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: [to Lane] You want me to set you up with Todd?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes and I was thinking that you and Dean could come out with us so that it’s not that big of a deal.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LANE
words: You don’t want to do it?

speaker: RORY
words: No I -

speaker: LANE
words: That’s ok, I understand - no big deal. Hey Grand Daddy new album used - I love a bargain.

speaker: RORY
words: I just really don’t know this Todd guy.

speaker: LANE
words: I do.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve met him twice

speaker: LANE
words: But the 3rd time’s a charm

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know this guy’s right for you?

speaker: LANE
words: I know, I’m telling you. We’re talking soul mate here.

speaker: RORY
words: The last time you met you soul mate, you ran your fingers through his hair and ended up hiding at my house for the evening.

speaker: LANE
words: Well I still have my key.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Look, I made a mistake with Rich Bloomenfeld. Everybody’s allowed one mistake. But Todd, Todd is different.

speaker: RORY
words: He is?

speaker: LANE
words: First of all his name is Todd - Different name different guy [Lorelai come back into living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok so, [turning off music] how important is this whole business school thing anyway? I mean, so what if I never run my own inn? I like my job, I like my house, I like my life. And I certainly don’t want to be one of those people who’s never satisfied with what they have you know? I mean some people don’t have legs or arms. I have legs and arms. What more could I possibly want than legs and arms? I mean, I could take all the classes in the world, that’s still not going to give me what I already have.

speaker: RORY
words: Legs and arms.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. [pause] Am I sounding completely crazy?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wal-Mart is boring!

speaker: RORY
words: Study!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aah! [leaves]

speaker: LANE
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LANE
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LANE
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, Yoko [they hug]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So [she comes and sits between the two and taps their legs] Whatcha doing?
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai is sitting at front desk studying. Michel comes up to her and stares at her]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes Michel?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I apologize for any inconvenience I might be causing your future employment but your current one is experiencing a problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And once again I say 'Yes Michel?'

speaker: MICHEL
words: Are you sure you wouldn’t like me to wait?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Michel.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Because learning the eating patterns of the average Taco Bell consumer is a vital lesson that -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel. What do you want?

speaker: MICHEL
words: We are overbooked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How are we overbooked?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well there are more people here than there are rooms to put them in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t understand this.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well I cannot describe it any simpler than I already have.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well where did the Rucker’s come from?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well judging from their clothing a town where high rubber fishing boots and spittoons would be considered formal wear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, put them in the Jefferson suite tonight, move them back to their previously booked room tomorrow and offer them dinner on the house for the inconvenience.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Very well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m gonna get some more coffee if you need me.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I’ll try and manage while you’re gone, though God knows it won’t be easy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (entering kitchen) Coffee?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Necesito las hojas grandes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! Meringue.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, I thought I’d do a variation on a baked Alaska for dessert tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What kind of variation?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: See I hadn’t thought of that yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe you could do them in the actual shape of Alaska.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or you could do little baked Alaskas and Hawaiis

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Because they joined the union last.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Exactly.
[Sookie giggles]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh [coming in the door]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie - hello.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I brought you um -

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [stuttering] Yeah, well great. Just put them down there.
[Lorelai watching the exchange]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Right. Oh, yes [puts carrots on the counter] How’s that?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That’s great, that’s just perfect. I really like them there.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah they - they do look good there don’t they?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes they do.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ok. Well I should - [turns to leave]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh, squash.

speaker: JACKSON
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I need some.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Squash.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Pattypan

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ok, tomorrow?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Same time?

speaker: JACKSON
words: If that’s good for you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It is, it’s perfect.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ok then, I-I’ll see you tomorrow with the pattypan.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Great.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes. [leaves]
[Sookie rolls her eyes]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok so...who walked in on who naked?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh God this is horrible! He comes in and - horrible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on between you two?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I asked him if he’d like to have dinner sometime.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know - weeks ago.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And he said yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But since there’s not definite plan or date attached, now the invitation is just out there floating in the universe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So make a definite plan.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Because what if he says no?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He already said yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes to the amorphous, theoretical, 'Let’s maybe sometime go out and do something not too specific' proposition. But dinner and a movie - it’s concrete. It’s real, he might say no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I doubt he will.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well why hasn’t he asked me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, maybe he thinks you’ve changed your mind since you asked.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well why would he think that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you haven’t mentioned it again.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But I mentioned it once, it’s his turn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, let’s say it is his turn, you can spend a lot of time sitting around waiting for him to realize it’s his turn, or you can just run with the wolves and make it your turn again.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t want it to be my turn again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You just wanna let this opportunity pass?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I wanna be the girl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are the girl. That’s why we’re having this very confusing conversation.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You think I should ask him out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: On Sunday.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why Sunday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because that’s your day off.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you should do it now before you lose your nerve.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well he’s not back to his office yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does he have a cell phone?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know people buy cell phones for exactly this reason - so you could get a hold of them anytime you want.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I thought people bought cell phones in case their cars broke down at night and they needed to call someone for help and there’s psycho killers -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call him.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Call him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call him Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Call him [giggles]
[They go over to the phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm, she knows his number by heart.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He is my produce guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very convenient excuse.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He - [into the phone] Oh Jackson? It’s Sookie. [picks up a wooden spoon and plays with it in her hair] I was wondering if you could call me back when you get a chance, sooner rather than later, it’s not an emergency so don’t freak out or anything. The carrots still look good. It seems like it’s almost a shame to eat them, sort of like you should put them in a vase or -

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] Sookie, hang up. Hang up.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Call me, bye. [giggles] Got his voice mail.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok good. It give you time to prepare what you’re going to say. Maybe have a few suggestions ready of places to go.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Date prep time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok good. I’m good at that. I’m good at prep. [picks up a pad of paper]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie...spoon. [takes spoon away.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Right.
CUT TO OUTSIDE STARS HOLLOW HIGH
[Rory sitting on a bench reading. Dean come out, sees her and goes and sits with her]

speaker: DEAN
words: Is there anything in there about me?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. You name wouldn’t be Lithium would it?

speaker: DEAN
words: Aren’t you supposed to be in school?

speaker: RORY
words: We had a half day today - teacher conferences. So I thought I’d come by and surprise you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you know how much I hate surprises.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I’m very sorry.
[Dean kisses her]

speaker: DEAN
words: That’s for surprising me.

speaker: RORY
words: I have learned my lesson.
[Dean kisses her again. Rory stops him after a second]

speaker: RORY
words: I have to talk to you about something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ok, I have to talk to you about something too. Come here [ kisses her again]

speaker: RORY
words: Ok stop.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sorry. [leans in to kiss her again]

speaker: RORY
words: No stay!

speaker: DEAN
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because I really need to talk to you about something.

speaker: DEAN
words: [sighs] Alright.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s about Todd.

speaker: DEAN
words: What about him?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you think of him?

speaker: DEAN
words: He’s my friend.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: DEAN
words: So that would signify a positive impression.

speaker: RORY
words: Right. Ok. Good.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yes, can I kiss you now?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not done yet.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine. Go ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: Well you know Lane.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I do.

speaker: RORY
words: She likes Todd.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: And I think that they would really hit it off.

speaker: DEAN
words: You - you don’t even know Todd.

speaker: RORY
words: No but you do. And you like him - you said so.

speaker: DEAN
words: I did.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok then. There you go.

speaker: DEAN
words: I would - I would really like to kiss you now.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah so would I.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ok, good. We agree [leans in for a kiss while she leans back]

speaker: RORY
words: I think we should set them up.

speaker: DEAN
words: Todd and Lane?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. We could all go out together - like to a movie or something on Sunday.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory -

speaker: RORY
words: It would be really casual - no big deal.

speaker: DEAN
words: I just -

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, I’m just not sure that I see them together.

speaker: RORY
words: You don’t think Todd would like Lane?

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m not sure.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane is great.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I know.

speaker: RORY
words: She’s my best friend.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I-I know that.

speaker: RORY
words: Todd should be so lucky to get a girl like her.

speaker: DEAN
words: I didn’t mean -

speaker: RORY
words: I mean I can’t believe that you don’t think that she’s good enough -

speaker: DEAN
words: [over Rory] No, no, no -

speaker: RORY
words: or I don’t know pretty enough.

speaker: DEAN
words: I didn’t say anything about her not being pretty enough -

speaker: RORY
words: Well you did -

speaker: DEAN
words: Let me finish. I just don’t know if he’ll like her because I don’t know what kind of girl he likes.

speaker: RORY
words: Well -

speaker: DEAN
words: But if you want to do this, then I’ll talk to him.

speaker: RORY
words: You will?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: And you’ll mention Sunday?

speaker: DEAN
words: I will mention Sunday.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You’re welcome. So...was that it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah that was it.

speaker: DEAN
words: Then can we...

speaker: RORY
words: Kissing. Right, let’s go.
[they kiss]
CUT TO INN
[Lorelai still studying]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [slamming book] I give up.

speaker: MICHEL
words: That’s the spirit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t remember any of this crap.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, not everyone is cut out to be their own boss. Maybe you are more of a worker bee, a follower, a ticket ripper, or the man at the concert with the orange glow stick directing you were to park.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re baiting me aren’t you?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, I seriously have no faith in your aptitude.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [rushing up to desk] He called! He called!

speaker: LORELAI
words: And?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I did what you said. I had it all worked out and I asked him if he’d like to go to dinner at Chez Fleur on Sunday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chez Fleur very nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hm, thank you. He said he would love to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh great!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He said he would love to but his cousin’s in town and he’s staying with him for the week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well then just make it next week.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, see that would’ve been a good option had I thought of it when I was on the phone, but instead - I came up with another option.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That we double date with his cousin Rune and you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, ok, not as good as your option I agree. But it seemed pretty good at the time - though I wasn’t standing here watching you make that face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie no. I hate blind dates.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know, but this isn’t a blind date. This is you keeping his cousin company while I have a date with Jackson.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lorelai please. I’ll be your best friend.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are my best friend.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you’re mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know I am.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So what are best friends for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I’ll go.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [squeals] Thank you, thank you, thank you. You will not regret this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pick another phrase.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You will not have to pay

speaker: LORELAI
words: Much better [sighs] Oh shut up [ to Michel who’s smiling. Opens up book again]
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Diva Glam.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ve got it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bring it up. [to Sookie] Hold still.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not too much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No - just enough to say ‘hey sailor’

speaker: SOOKIE
words: My stomach doesn’t feel so great. I think I’ve got the flu.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you’re nervous.
[Rory comes into room]

speaker: RORY
words: Here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: I need the sparkly hair clips

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I’ll find them in a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: [to Sookie] You look pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh. [leaves]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh thank you. [to Lorelai] I should cancel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, let’s do you lips first.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What if I’m making an idiot out of myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: By going out on a date?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: With my produce guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You like him.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But what if tonight is a disaster and them he won’t sell to me anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, you’re right.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, see!

speaker: LORELAI
words: And since all the produce in the entire world is in his possession and all the produce that will be grown in the future will be in his possession, then we will never again be able to get any produce and all our vegetarian clients will die.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m scared.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I like him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He likes you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How do you know he’s not being polite?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No I mean it. [gets up and paces] It’s like I cornered him and he felt trapped and he had to say yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did not have to say yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God. Technically I am his employer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I am, I buy his wares. His livelihood depends on my.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh! I’m a sexual harasser

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then you need some false eyelashes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: This isn’t funny. I am now desperate, lonely and a criminal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, stop talking.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But -

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you have exhausted all your talking rights by being crazy. Sit down and listen.
[Sookie sits]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tonight is a good thing. Whether you find out that you’re madly in love you or you’re not meant for each other, it’s still a good thing. And I’ll be right there. And have I done a gorgeous job on your face or what? Ooh, I’ll be right back [picking up clips]
CUT TO RORY’S ROOM
[Rory and Lane getting ready]

speaker: LANE
words: You’re sure you don’t mind?

speaker: RORY
words: What’s mine is yours.

speaker: LANE
words: I owe you forever.

speaker: RORY
words: Good to know.

speaker: LANE
words: Which one do you think Todd would like better? [holding up two jackets]

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know Todd.

speaker: LANE
words: I think the rhinestones.

speaker: RORY
words: Rhinestones it is. So what did you tell your mom?

speaker: LANE
words: I told her that I was going to spend the evening here with you guys.

speaker: RORY
words: What if she calls?

speaker: LANE
words: Well I mentioned that we might go and rent some videos or go out to eat which could explain any absence during her call.

speaker: RORY
words: Very thorough.

speaker: LANE
words: With my mom, you can leave nothing to chance. Especially when there is a non-korean involved who as far as I know has no medical aspirations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [coming into room] Hey, sparkly clips.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I like the rhinestones. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: And for a touch of glamour. [putting them in Lane’s hair]

speaker: LANE
words: So what are you going to tell Lorelai?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LANE
words: She wouldn’t tell my mom would she?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know if she’d feel good lying to another mother. It’s like this weird code thing with her.

speaker: LANE
words: So we don’t tell her?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not liking that option either.

speaker: LANE
words: No. We’ll tell her that we’re meeting Dean for a movie, and then we go to the movie and then somebody who just happens to be a friend of Dean’s, just happens to be there, for the same movie and so we figure that it would be completely rude for us to not ask said person to come sit with us.

speaker: RORY
words: I say to hell with governor, you run directly for president.

speaker: LANE
words: It’s not that bad.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s just not think about it, ok?

speaker: LANE
words: I really appreciate this.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: How do I look?

speaker: RORY
words: You look too good for him.

speaker: LANE
words: Just what I was going for. [giggles and they leave the room]

speaker: RORY
words: We’re going [to Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, where?

speaker: LANE
words: We’re going to a movie with Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing dirty, violent or French please

speaker: RORY
words: Are you going to be home late?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well there’s a bit of doubt as to whether or not we’ll ever actually get out of the house at all tonight. Sookie please!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok! I’m here, I’m down [coming down the stairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! Hey, where’s your coat?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It’s upstairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aren’t you gonna need it?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh well, it got caught around the thing, and then when I twisted around to get loose, and then the choking started. I’m free now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. I’ll get you something to wear.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I would appreciate that.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LANE
words: Bye

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye kittens [girls leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh? [with a blue shawl in hand]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh this is beautiful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It goes with the theme of the evening.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: This is a really nice thing you’re doing for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anytime Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Last looks [Does a turn while Lorelai claps]
[knock on the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll get it.
[Sookie exhales]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi,

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hi Lorelai, sorry we’re late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no problem. Just adds a little more primping time for the ladies.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi Jackson

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie, hi

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hi.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hi.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, uh do you guys wanna come in for a minute?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh sure. [they enter] Oh, uh Lorelai, this is my cousin Rune, Rune this is Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, it’s very nice to meet you [extends hand but Rune doesn’t take it]

speaker: RUNE
words: Can I talk to you a minute?

speaker: JACKSON
words: What’s the matter?

speaker: RUNE
words: I need a minute alone, please?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Excuse us. [Rune takes Jackson outside]

speaker: JACKSON
words: What are you doing?

speaker: RUNE
words: That’s Lorelai?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes.

speaker: RUNE
words: Did you see how tall she is?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No, I haven’t noticed actually.

speaker: RUNE
words: How could you not notice, she’s like a basketball player.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Rune, she’s a very nice lady!

speaker: RUNE
words: You know I cannot go out with anyone that tall. I mean God! I can’t believe you set me up with that. What, was the bearded lady busy tonight or something?
[Sookie and Lorelai, who are listening, exchange a look]

speaker: JACKSON
words: It’s just one night, a little dinner.

speaker: RUNE
words: When she came to the door it never crossed my mind that that was who I had to spend the evening with. I thought it was her East German maid or something.

speaker: JACKSON
words: You’re being ridiculous, she’s not that tall!

speaker: RUNE
words: She’s tall enough!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Would you keep it down, she’s gonna hear you!

speaker: RUNE
words: With those big ears I bet she can.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hey Rune, you come into town completely unannounced, you eat all my food, you crash on my couch and I don’t say a thing. The least you could do is go out for one night - make some conversation, be pleasant, who knows, maybe you’ll enjoy it!

speaker: RUNE
words: But why can’t we go out - just to the two of us.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Rune, please.

speaker: RUNE
words: [sighs] Ok.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Thank you [Both go back to the front door.] Ok, I think we should be going.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes that sounds good.
[Lorelai looks at Rune, who turns away. She closes the door behind her.]
CUT TO CHEZ FLEUR
[All sitting in silence looking at the menu. Rune is staring at Lorelai, she forces a smile]

speaker: RUNE
words: What size shoe do you wear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, size 9.

speaker: RUNE
words: 9? Wow.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I wonder if the mussels are fresh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, well, it does say ‘fresh mussels’ on the menu.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, but a lot of times they say ‘fresh’ and they’re not, they’re frozen but they’re just called ‘fresh’ because they were fresh when they were frozen. [Jackson nodding and smiling at her] Plus if they’re not stored with the correct drainage they just sit around in their own excretions, with is kind of like sitting around in your own -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, I beg of you, do not order the fresh mussels.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But if they’re fresh -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Even if they’re fresh.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I wonder where they get their carrots from The carrot crop this year has been really mealy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] So...Rune...

speaker: RUNE
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is that - ‘Rune’ ?

speaker: RUNE
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, where did ‘Rune’ come from?

speaker: RUNE
words: I’m from out of town, I thought Jackson told you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did tell me, I meant the name ‘Rune’. You just don’t meet a lot of ‘Runes’, right? [giggles a bit]

speaker: RUNE
words: It was my dad’s name.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, where’d he get it?

speaker: RUNE
words: [annoyed] I don’t know, from his parents I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, done with that topic [waiter approaches] Oh the waiter, thanks the Lord.

speaker: WAITER
words: What can I get you this evening?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’d like to ask about the mussels, are they fresh?

speaker: WAITER
words: Yes they are.

speaker: JACKSON
words: And where exactly are your carrots from?

speaker: WAITER
words: Well -

speaker: RUNE
words: Is there anything on this menu that isn’t French?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll just have a martini and keep’em coming. [Waiter leaves] Thanks.
[Table goes back to sitting in silence]
CUT TO OUTSIDE BOOKSTORE
[Rory and Dean are in line. She’s looking at Lane and Todd in line behind them.]

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing.

speaker: DEAN
words: They’re fine.

speaker: RORY
words: I am not looking at them. I’m looking at the world around me.

speaker: DEAN
words: The world is fine too.

speaker: RORY
words: I just want to make sure they’re having fun.

speaker: DEAN
words: They’re having fun.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know?

speaker: DEAN
words: They’re not in prison or in some sort of medieval torture chamber.

speaker: RORY
words: Well when you measure it that way -
[Pan to Lane and Todd]

speaker: LANE
words: And the amazing thing is, all these girls are screaming and none of them are getting the joke. He’s playing the character of a rock star. I mean Beck is a genius and all these stupid girls are screaming at him just because they’re buying into the rock star image. I love Beck. I understand Beck. [looks at Todd nervously who doesn’t say anything] And the Foo Fighters - Gods. I mean, have you heard the acoustic version of ‘Everlong’? I can’t even talk about it you know? Hey, you know who I’ve really gotten into lately? The velvet underground. Oh and Nico - she’s amazing - Depressing scary German chick. I have the cd if you wanna borrow it sometime. Wh-what kind of music do you like?

speaker: TODD
words: I don’t know - whatever.

speaker: LANE
words: Fugazi?

speaker: TODD
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: The band on your shirt.

speaker: TODD
words: Oh. Huh, pretty cool picture.

speaker: LANE
words: You don’t know what’s on your shirt?

speaker: TODD
words: It’s my sister’s.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh.
[Rory looks over her shoulder intently. Lane gives her a forced smile. Dean turns Rory’s face forward.]

speaker: LANE
words: Well what about books? Do you like books?

speaker: TODD
words: Mmm. [shrugging]

speaker: LANE
words: Magazines? [Todd’s silent] What about school? What are you majoring in?

speaker: TODD
words: I was thinking about gym.

speaker: LANE
words: Gym?

speaker: TODD
words: If I major in gym, I only have to take 4 classes my senior year.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, cool
[Pan to Rory and Dean]

speaker: RORY
words: Gym?

speaker: DEAN
words: We work on our bikes together. He’s got the good tools.
CUT TO CHEZ FLEUR
[Rune yawning]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [giggling] It was so funny. Oh God! Do you remember?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I remember.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What was Rory, eight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I believe she was.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh god, that mud pie fiasco haunted me for a year! I mean, hers looked just like mine. Of course I used you know, homemade chocolate cookies, bittersweet ganache and she used well, mud. You know, but they did look damn similar. Oh.
[Rune is cutting the heads off of swans with his knife]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, uh, Sookie’s been experimenting with, um, different forms of baking ever since I’ve known her.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, well, that’s very interesting.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. Hey Lorelai, remember when I decided to teach you how to make strawberry tarts [Jackson looks bored] and the entire kitchen was stained red and I had to repaint that one wall red just to make it look normal? Do you remember? Wasn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm, it was. Sookie, let’s go powder our noses.

speaker: RUNE
words: You’ll need a lot of powder.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll be right back. Come on hon.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, ok.
[They get up and leave. Jackson give Rune a ‘what are you doing?’ look]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, no matter how many beers you buy me tonight, I’m not the one going home with you, so I would concentrate on the one who might.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You haven’t said a word to Jackson all night.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I haven’t have I?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know. I’m just - Oh, I’m so nervous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re nervous? You don’t have some guy staring at you like he’s Cher and you’re the kid from ‘Mask’.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can - I can’t think of anything to say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To Jackson?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, to Jackson.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, cause to me tonight there’s been no ‘off’ button.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I-I just - ugh! This place is too fancy, my hair is too tight and this dress is all wrong. And he looks really good doesn’t he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes he does.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m being crazy, I know I’m being crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. You’re just putting too much pressure on this whole evening. Look, in five seconds I can take your hair down, we can go some place more casual and personally I think you’re wrong about the dress.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Come on. Let’s got to Luke’s. You know, have burgers, talk, relax - no pressure, no stress, unless I wind up stepping on Rune which might be fun.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That would be great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, come on.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Alright.
CUT TO BOOKSTORE
[Lane and Todd are in a theater-like seating watching the movie]

speaker: LANE
words: Ok, what about movies, you must have a favorite movie.

speaker: TODD
words: Yes I do!

speaker: LANE
words: Great! What is it?

speaker: TODD
words: Beethoven.

speaker: LANE
words: Beethoven? The one with the dog?

speaker: TODD
words: There’s this scene where this little dog is running around with a huge cabbage in it’s mouth. Oh man, it’s classic! I shot my Dr. Pepper right outta my nose! I swear!
[Lane forces another smile]
CUT TO LUKE’S
[The four enter]

speaker: RUNE
words: [sniffs] Ew.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Welcome to Luke’s.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well this is much better.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It is, isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Grab a seat, I’ll get some menus

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, four menus, a coffee and an anvil please.

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s the anvil for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For Rune?

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s a Rune.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please not that question again.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok. [gets coffee. Lorelai sighs and looks at them sitting in silence] Here you go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mind if I hang out here a sec?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why? What’s going on over there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie and Jackson are on their first date.

speaker: LUKE
words: Seems to be going well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I’d wear blue to the wedding.

speaker: LUKE
words: Who’s the other guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s Jackson’s cousin. He’s my date!

speaker: LUKE
words: Lucky girl!

speaker: LORELAI

words: [taken aback] Ok, well, I was talking symbolically...but alright, I’m with you now. Look when I was a teenager, my parents tried to keep me locked up. They tried to force me to become what they had in mind, and now I’m not talking exactly about Lane here, but in my case, it really didn’t work.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You blame your parents for getting pregnant.
