words: Ok, so rummage sale’s Sunday, today is Tuesday. At this rate, we are going to be sleeping in the yard by Thursday. We have got to start getting some of this stuff out of the living room.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go away.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I have a full set of dishes.

speaker: RORY
words: Come on in Taylor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, um, dishes in the kitchen please.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ok, but I have to explain something first.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine go ahead.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: The butter dish has a small chip in it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Safety tip - got it.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It’s fine. I filed down the chip and if you place it strategically on the table, nobody will ever know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Taylor, would you like to write out some sort of instruction manual to go with the dishes?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, could I?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Notepad’s in the kitchen.
[Lorelai looks through bags]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, that’s nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Put that back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it has rhinestones on it.

speaker: RORY
words: The point of this is to get crap out of here, not to trade it in for new crap.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, are you seeing this?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I don’t think you are, because if you were seeing this, you would see that this obviously has ‘Lorelai’ written all over it.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, we’ll just get rid of it at next year’s sale.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Sookie enters]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok, you guys are gonna love me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We already love you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, I mean you’re really gonna love me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We do.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Trust me, you guys are gonna so love me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, the love is starting to fade now Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I have here in my hand, as requested by Ms. Lorelai Gilmore, four fabulous tickets to the Bangles at the Pastorella theater on Saturday!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: No?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Do you love me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh baby do I!

speaker: LANE
words: Are these good seats? These look like good seats.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: 9th row, aisle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t believe you got me my tickets! Well, how did you score these?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Remember the Birnbaum wedding?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fiji fantasy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes. They were so thrilled with the volcano wedding cake that they wanted to do something nice for me and since Mr. Birnbaum runs a ticket agency and I knew you were dying to so, so I asked him if he could...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make four girls very happy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah and he did!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huzzah for the Birnbaums!

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Sookie, if you got four tickets and you and mom go, then that means...

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hmm, one for you and one for Lane! [Lane and Sookie hug] Oh, chickadee!

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is gonna be a very special night. And you know what a very, very special night deserves?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [pulls out a hot pink dress] A new outfit!

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What could the problem be?

speaker: RORY
words: This is the tackiest...
CUT TO CHILTON

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: As I mentioned yesterday, we will be holding a debate next week. Your subject ‘Did Charles I receive a fair trial’ The pros will represent the parliament who deemed they had sovereignty and the cons will represent the monarch and try and prove that the charge against him was not legal. What is fascinating Mr. Dugray? [catching him looking at Rory]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh, nothing Ms. Caldecott.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Nothing Mr. Dugray?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: My notes - my notes are fascinating Ms. Caldecott.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Yes they are fascinating Mr. Dugray. As I was saying, the pro and con teams will each have two minutes and 30 seconds for introductions, six minutes to debate, three minutes for conclusions and five minutes for questions from the audience. The winner shall be decided by a hand count from the rest of the class. Does that sound like fun Mr. Dugray? [again, he’s looking at Rory]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What?

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: The debate. Does it sound like fun?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yes, it does.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: It does, doesn’t it Mr. Dugray?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, it absolutely does Ms. Caldecott.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: More fun than staring at Miss Gilmore’s ear?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yes Ms. Caldecott.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Yeah, I think so too. Ok, any questions? Good, I’ll assign your teams. [Pointing] You, you, you, you - con. You, you, you, you, - pro. [in background for next two lines] You, you, you, you - con. You, you, you -

speaker: PARIS
words: [whispers] Who did she point to?

speaker: MADELINE
words: [whispers] Well I think she... [looking at Louise and Rory]

speaker: PARIS
words: [stands up] Excuse me, Ms. Caldecott?

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Miss Geller?

speaker: PARIS
words: I wasn’t sure who you pointed to just now.

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Oh, uh, let’s see. You, Miss Lynn, Miss Grant and Miss Gilmore.

speaker: PARIS
words: Are you sure?

speaker: MS. CALDECOTT
words: Yes I am, but thank you for asking. [Paris sits] Ok, you, you, you and you - pro. You and you - con.
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Paris, Louise, Madeline and Rory standing around]

speaker: RORY
words: So I guess we should make a plan.

speaker: MADELINE
words: To do what?

speaker: PARIS
words: To work out our debate Madeline.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh, yeah right.

speaker: LOUISE
words: We need a place to work.

speaker: PARIS
words: My house is out.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Why?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because it is.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You need a reason.

speaker: PARIS
words: My mother is having the entire place redone, she wants all evidence of my father out of there. So unless you want to sit on no furniture, while watching three Harvey Fierstein impersonators rip up the carpet and paint everything a ridiculous shade of white and call it ‘angel’s kiss’ then we’re going to have to find somebody else’s house to go to.

speaker: MADELINE
words: My brother has the measels.

speaker: LOUISE
words: My mom’s having an affair.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I guess we can go to my house. I mean, we’re having a town rummage sale so it’s kind of a mess, but it’s there.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Isn’t your house kind of far?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s thirty minutes away by bus.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Bus? I don’t do ‘bus’.

speaker: RORY
words: Well if you have a better suggestion -

speaker: PARIS
words: I’ll drive.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, so then tomorrow.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Tomorrow.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [walks right past Rory] Hey Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Tristin, hi.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know I was really hoping we’d be in the same group.

speaker: PARIS
words: You were?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh yeah. I mean, it would make the long hours of studying go by a lot faster. Plus, come on - you and me on the same team, we’d wipe the floor with the others. I guess we’ll just have to pair up on something else then huh?

speaker: PARIS
words: That would be good.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah it would. I’ll see you later. Bye Madeline, bye Louise.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Tristin suddenly has very big eyes for you grandma.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Lucky.

speaker: PARIS
words: Stop it, he’s just being nice.

speaker: MADELINE
words: He should be so nice to me.

speaker: LOUISE
words: And me.

speaker: PARIS
words: We need to get to class [the three of them leave. Paris is smiling.]
CUT TO RORY AND LANE WALKING TO KIM HOUSE

speaker: RORY
words: Tomorrow.

speaker: LANE
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LANE
words: All three of them huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Double, double toil and trouble.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, it should make for an interesting afternoon.

speaker: RORY
words: With the pricking of my thumb, something wicked this way comes.

speaker: LANE
words: You’re doing very well in the Shakespeare class aren’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: Not bad.

speaker: LANE
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. Ok so what’s the plan?

speaker: LANE
words: We’ll go in and ask her if I can go to a play tomorrow night with you and Lorelai.

speaker: RORY
words: A play?

speaker: LANE
words: I think that’s the safest word. Show or concert would be very bad.

speaker: RORY
words: What about saying it’s a movie?

speaker: LANE
words: Too far from the truth - almost a lie.

speaker: RORY
words: But a play is not a lie?

speaker: LANE
words: Well it’s far away from the truth that it might work but close enough to the truth that I think I can negotiate a purgatory stint if forced to.

speaker: RORY
words: Play it is.

speaker: LANE
words: Ok, we’re going in.
[pan to inside Kim household]

speaker: MAN
words: Are you sure it’s an original Queen Anne?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes - original.

speaker: MAN
words: The joints look wrong.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Joints are fine.

speaker: MAN
words: They look new.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Not new, nothing’s new - whole store is old.

speaker: MAN
words: Do you have a certificate or a letter that you write saying that it’s old.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes, I’ll write a letter.

speaker: MAN
words: Ok, well I guess if it’s really old, I’ll take it.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: We appreciate your business.

speaker: LANE
words: [whispers to Rory] She just made a sale, now is a good time. [louder] Hi mama.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: What’s wrong?

speaker: LANE
words: Nothing.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You look flushed.

speaker: LANE
words: I do?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You eat candy?

speaker: LANE
words: No.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Doughnut?

speaker: LANE
words: No.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Hostess fruit-pie?

speaker: LANE
words: No, nothing, I’m fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Hello Mrs. Kim.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Rory.

speaker: LANE
words: Mama can I talk to you for a minute?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I’m busy.

speaker: LANE
words: I know, I was just wondering if I could go somewhere tomorrow with Rory and her mom.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Tomorrow is church.

speaker: LANE
words: This would be after church.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: After church we think about what we heard in church.

speaker: LANE
words: Well I thought I could think about what I heard in church on the way to the show.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Show?

speaker: RORY
words: Play.

speaker: LANE
words: Not show, play - it’s a play mama.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Tell me about this play. What’s it about?

speaker: LANE
words: Ok, well, it’s about a group of people who own instruments and stand in front of other people holding them.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: I’m not sure what it’s about.

speaker: RORY
words: We could find out.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You find out, then we talk.

speaker: MAN
words: Excuse me, I’d really like that letter if you don’t mind.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes I’m coming. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: How’s that purgatory negotiation looking?

speaker: LANE
words: Not good.

speaker: RORY
words: What do we do now?

speaker: LANE
words: I’ll ask again later.

speaker: RORY
words: Well call me if you need anything.

speaker: LANE
words: Thanks, I will.
CUT TO LUKE’S WITH A RUMMAGE SALE SIGN IN THE WINDOW

speaker: LUKE
words: If you want coffee, you’ll have to wait.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Luke, someone put a sign for the rummage sale up in your window over there.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can have decaf right now if you’re in a hurry.

speaker: RORY
words: You should call the cops about this. I mean we all know how you feel about public displays of town affection.

speaker: LUKE
words: Your mom asked me to put it there ok?

speaker: RORY
words: And you said yes?

speaker: LUKE
words: She’s not real good with ‘no’.

speaker: RORY
words: No she’s not.

speaker: LUKE
words: For every second you laugh at me, that’s one second longer you’re waiting for coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, no laughing. [he leaves]
[Lorelai walks in with a black and brown polka dot cowboy hat on]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Margaret Atworthy just dropped off three boxes of city council pot holders and begged me to take her grandson. People are getting crazy man. What?

speaker: RORY
words: What are you wearing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, we have already argued about the sweatshirt.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes but we have not argued about the hat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What hat?

speaker: RORY
words: The one on your head, Annie Oakley.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s great isn’t it?

speaker: RORY
words: As nice as it is that you’re single handedly trying to rebuild the bridge, you have got to stop buying up other people’s junk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The money goes to charity. I look cute. Case closed. Oh finally, the coffee cavalry arrives.

speaker: LUKE
words: What the hell do you think you’re wearing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A hat.

speaker: LUKE
words: Take that off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Now that is not yours, take it off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I’ll have hat hair.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m talking about the sweatshirt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke calm down.

speaker: LUKE
words: That is not yours.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I found it in the bags of stuff for the sale.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh so you just find something and then you take it is that it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I paid for it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh so that makes it alright.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It makes it legal. What is the matter with you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing. Nothing is the matter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke...

speaker: LUKE
words: Pour your own coffee. [puts coffee pot down on the counter and leaves]
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE
[Living room is stuffed with bags/boxes of stuff to the point where you can’t see furniture]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Ok just a question. Did anyone in town keep anything?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Doesn’t look like it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m never being civic-minded again.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey, you’re doing a good thing. [falls] Ow!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wave an arm.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [Waving her arm] Here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I gotcha. [takes her hand and starts to pull her up]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hold on, something down here likes me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, I’m good. Hold on. Up, please.

speaker: RORY
words: Jeez this stuff is like tribbles.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thank God - just in time. Grab a bag and move it to the side of the room and be very careful, this pile just tried to eat Sookie.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I should sic it on Paris when she gets here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, that’s right. You’re studying here today.

speaker: RORY
words: Any minute actually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh this place is such a pit.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom don’t worry about it. They’ll come in, they’ll make a face, they’ll say something snotty, we’ll study, they’ll leave. I’m just looking forward to this whole day being over, then I can concentrate on the concert.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Lorelai, sweetheart would you come outside please? I want to know where you want me to put these.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coming Patty!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok, two very large porcelain squirrels.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Set them free.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Will do.
[Pan to outside. Patty’s standing in front of big drums.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, huh. These are great. They’ll really come in handy when we finally organize that giant marching band we’ve been talking about.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I danced on these drums at the Copacabana in 1969.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yeah, it was a great act. I wore bananas.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh please, tell me you have a picture of that.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: [chuckles] A lot of memories happened on these drums. But I guess it’s time to move on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, sure. Now you’ll finally have room for the enormous tuba you’ve hand your eyes on. [Miss Patty looks at her] Just leave - leave these here.
[Inside]

speaker: RORY
words: [on the phone] Yeah, you too. Bye. [hangs up] That was Lane [to Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh and what’s the verdict?

speaker: RORY
words: She decided to be stupid and tell her mother the truth - that she wanted to go to a rock concert with us tonight in New York.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: Stupid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m so sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m making coffee.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well this looks really familiar. [picking up Lorelai’s sweatshirt]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that’s mine. Er, I saw it first and then I bought it so it’s mine now.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Really? Who brought it in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think Luke did and judging by his very hostile reaction he obviously wasn’t done wearing it yet.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh my, I wonder if -

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: [to Sookie] I bet this was Rachel’s.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God - Rachel’s?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rachel? Who’s Rachel?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Rachel was Luke’s very serious girlfriend. It does look like her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When did Luke have a girlfriend?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh this must have been what, five, six years ago? Did she break that man’s heart. It was terrible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did I not know about this?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey, you had an 11 year old kid and you were just moving into this house. Plus Rachel traveled all the time. She was a photographer.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Archeologist.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Or a flight attendant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t believe I never even heard about it.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: At least I think so.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well Luke never talks about it. No one else likes to talk about it because he could probably kill you with that coffee pot if he wanted to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. I never pictured Luke having a girlfriend, or a broken heart.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well I would keep this hidden if I were you. Well I gotta be going. Trampoline class at two.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye, thanks for the drums.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok, these all need to be mended.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My room.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm-hmm. Ok.
[Lorelai looks out the window and sees Paris, Madeline and Louise getting out of a car]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I think your friends are here. She must be one great babysitter to earn enough money for that car.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s just get this over with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take heart my dear. Suffer today party tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [Opens front door] Hi.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hi.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come one in.

speaker: RORY
words: So did you guys find it ok?

speaker: PARIS
words: There’s no sign on this street.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, that’s why I told you to turn right at the big rooster statue.

speaker: PARIS
words: I thought you were kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, we never kid about Monty.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Monty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Monty the rooster - Monty.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Everybody this is my mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lorelai.

speaker: RORY
words: This is Louise, Madeline and Paris.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, very good girl-group names. Ok, so, um sorry about the house of horrors here. Some crazy lady volunteered to lead this charity thing and we’re trying to get her some help, so make yourselves comfortable. Rory, just yell when you guys want pizza.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. [goes upstairs]

speaker: RORY
words: So do you guys want to work in here or in the kitchen?

speaker: PARIS
words: Whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. [they sit in the livingroom]

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, so here’s how it should go. Madeline will do the introductions, I’ll handle the debate, Rory will do the onclusion and Louise will take questions.

speaker: RORY
words: Why do you automatically get to handle the debate?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because I’m the most experienced at it.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Trust me, you want her to handle the debate. She never gives up.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Le pitbull.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LOUISE
words: So what is all this stuff? [going through some bags]

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, it’s for a big town rummage sale.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Like a charity thing?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. There’s this old bridge that’s completely falling apart and the town’s trying to save it.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh cool hat.

speaker: PARIS
words: Put that down. It’s used.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Vintage dear.

speaker: PARIS
words: Filthy darling.

speaker: MADELINE
words: There’s this great store under my therapist office who has the best vintage clothes. I found an original Pucci top for practically nothing.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh Pucci is very big right now.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Is this a Pucci? [holding up a shirt]

speaker: RORY
words: No, that’s a patty.

speaker: LOUISE
words: A patty?

speaker: RORY
words: Miss Patty. She’s a dance teacher here. These are some of her old costumes.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh here Paris. Tristin might like this [holds up a pink sequence dress]

speaker: PARIS
words: Can we just work please?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ugh. I would love to have a boyfriend that looked like Tristin.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Your boyfriend’s no slouch either.

speaker: RORY
words: No he’s not.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh yes - 6’2... and fiesty. So how’s that going? Are you two still ‘Joanie loves Chachi’?

speaker: RORY
words: God, I hope not.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You are still together aren’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, we’re still together.

speaker: LOUISE
words: How long has it been?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You do too.

speaker: RORY
words: About a month.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh, lifers.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey!

speaker: MADELINE
words: Jeez.

speaker: PARIS
words: We have a debate to organize here and this conversation is quickly veering towards the subject of french kissing and glitter eye shadow - trashy or trendy? And I for one have no intention of being humiliated in front of the whole class because we were forced to study in the middle of a carnival and you two couldn’t keep your eye on the prize! I want to win and I’m going to win.

speaker: LOUISE
words: So how good of a kisser is Paul Bunyan anyway? [Louise, Madeline and Rory giggle.]
[Pan to Lorelai’s room]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok, does anyone in town have a peg leg?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh...no.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hem these.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So tell me more about this Rachel?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why are you so curious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well because apparently everybody in town knows everything about it and I don’t like to be out of the loop.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It’s old news.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes but I’m fascinated. I mean, I go to Luke’s once a day, sometimes twice - three times if Michel has talked to one of his relatives and his accent has gotten thicker. I feel I should know the whole story. What happened? Where’d she go?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, Rachel liked to move around a lot. She was very adventurous person. She loved to climb things and fling herself off of cliffs and dive into these really tiny lakes and ride big wild horses and fly planes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So she was wonder woman.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She was to Luke. I thought they were going to get married.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What happened?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The rumour is that Starts Hollow was too small for her. She wanted to live somewhere more exciting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But Luke didn’t.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm. You know Luke. He lived here all his life. He wouldn’t even go away for college. I think we’re going to bury him in that diner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. It’s sad.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. Ok, well I am done here. I’m gonna stop by the inn for a while and then I am gonna go home and I’m gonna change for the show tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We leave at 6.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I will be here, bye
[Pan to living room]

speaker: PARIS
words: We’ll need the actual quotes so learn them by heart.

speaker: MADELINE
words: What about using note cards.

speaker: PARIS
words: Note cards look sloppy. We will know our information.

speaker: MADELINE
words: But the other teams will use note cards.

speaker: PARIS
words: And the other team will lose.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye girls, Rory, see you tonight!

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Sookie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: We’ve got tickets to see the Bangles at the Pastorella theatre.

speaker: MADELINE
words: In New York?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Sounds potentially not boring.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s gonna be great actually and the seats are amazing.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Who are you going with?

speaker: RORY
words: My mom and Sookie.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You’re kidding?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LOUISE
words: You’re going to a concert with your mom?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I cannot imagine doing anything like that with my mom.

speaker: RORY
words: Actually we do stuff like this all the time.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hey, how old is your mom anyways?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Young.

speaker: LOUISE
words: So that means she had you when she was...

speaker: PARIS
words: 16. She had her when she was 16. We’ve done the math, can we just ‘ooh’ and ‘aah’ about this quickly and get back to work?

speaker: MADELINE
words: So am I.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’re all 16 ok. Everybody in this room is 16.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris is right. We should work.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I can’t imaging having a baby at 16.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well then keep your knees shut.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Very nice.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Do you think your mom is sorry she got pregnant so young?

speaker: PARIS
words: Of course she is.

speaker: RORY
words: Why thank you.

speaker: PARIS
words: I didn’t meant that. I just meant that...

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, I don’t think she would recommend it but I think she’s happy with how things turned out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, just checking. Hey, I’m starving, is it pizza time yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Are you guys hungry?

speaker: MADELINE
words: I am.

speaker: PARIS
words: I can’t eat dairy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, one with cheese, one without. Cokes?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes please.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Me too.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’re never going to finish.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I find your mother completely fascinating.

speaker: RORY
words: Funny - so does she.

speaker: LOUISE
words: It’s almost more like having a big sister.

speaker: MADELINE
words: And you like her don’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: She’s my best friend.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Truly, completely fascinating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [from the kitchen] Rory come in here a sec!

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll be right back.
[Pan to kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how’s it going in there?

speaker: RORY
words: Truly, completely fascinating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Well we’ve basically gotten no work down at all. Paris is having a meltdown, which by the way is always fun.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds it.

speaker: RORY
words: And, I don’t know, we’ve just been talking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I think you’re actually making some friends here.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s not get ahead of ourselves. They’ve basically just moved off the plan to dump the pig’s blood on me at the prom, that’s all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Talking, chatting, no work being done - there’s friend potential going on.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe - with Louise and Madeline at least.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Two out or three formerly psychotic enemies - not bad. There [handing Rory a plate]- pop-tart appetizers to tide you over till the pizza comes.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks [turns to leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I have kind of a crazy idea.

speaker: RORY
words: Those are never comforting words coming from you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just consider this ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, we have four tickets to the show tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes we do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What if I give them to you? You take them.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it just seems like you guys have kind of a bonding thing going on in there, it might be fun.

speaker: RORY
words: But what about you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no you and I have already bonded. In fact, if we bond any further, we will be permanently fused together.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve been talking about this concert since you heard about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can still go.

speaker: RORY
words: How?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie and I can buy cheap seats when we get there.

speaker: RORY
words: These tickets are 9th row aisle - dream seats.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, you don’t have to do this, but I just think you have three years of Chilton ahead of you and it might be nice to have some friendly type people to talk to there. And I don’t know, you guys seem to be getting along, it might be good. And I totally don’t mind, I just want to see the show, I don’t care from what seat.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Completely sure.

speaker: RORY
words: Because I -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh ladies! [taking plate and going into the living room] Hey what are you guys doing tonight?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well we have these really great tickets to see the Bangles at the Pastorella theater and Rory thought you might like to come along.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Are you serious?

speaker: LOUISE
words: No way.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah - I mean if you guys want to.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I would love to go.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Count me in.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, what about you?

speaker: PARIS
words: I can’t.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yes you can.

speaker: PARIS
words: No, I can’t.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Because you’re busy doing what?

speaker: PARIS
words: I have homework.

speaker: MADELINE
words: She’ll be there.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great.
CUT TO NY
[In the theater. Sookie squeals]

speaker: RORY
words: He made it [Louise and Madeline look at bracelet Dean made for her]

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh he’s handy. How great.

speaker: LOUISE
words: And you wear it all the time right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just when she’s breathing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It’s a love thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for the contributions.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok here [offers tickets but pulls them back] Ah! With these tickets you are about to enter sacred space, you will be treading on hallowed ground, you will be walking like an Egyptian.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take’em. Oh you’re going to have a great time. The Bangles are the best! They were my favorite band in high school. I almost named you Susanna. The day I found out you had no musical talent at all was the saddest day of my life.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you say that now. Here, ok, these are probably located - Hi! [to usher]

speaker: USHER
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can you tell me where these seats are?

speaker: USHER
words: Uh, those are right in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good, girls...ok, here’s the deal. Take the tickets, go to your seats, have the night of a lifetime - Bangle it up. The second the concert is over, meet us outside in front of the theater got it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good! Now go!

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. [to Sookie] Ok, let’s go make our noses bleed.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: After you.

speaker: PARIS
words: Which aisle is it?

speaker: LOUISE
words: We’re almost there.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I have never sat this close to a stage before. In fact, I’ve never even really been to a concert before so I could be sitting at the back and say the same thing.

speaker: LOUISE
words: In here.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh good.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, these are amazing seats.

speaker: LOUISE
words: [checking out the cute guys in the row behind them] Yes they are.

speaker: RORY
words: [to Paris] What are they looking at?

speaker: PARIS
words: One guess. [Rory looks behind them at the guys]

speaker: GUY
words: Check it out, we’ve got fans [seeing Rory]

speaker: PARIS
words: Was I right? [as Rory turns back]

speaker: RORY
words: You were right.

speaker: PARIS
words: And before it’s dark, they’ll have every picnic basket that’s in Jelly Stone park.
[Pan to Sookie and Lorelai climbing stairs]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Did you ever see Everest?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It’s a good movie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We must be getting close, we’re running out of rows.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And 1,000. Ok, we’re here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great. Ok, this is fine [sitting]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not bad at all. [Lorelai starts to laugh] What? What? What is so funny?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughing] These are the worst seats in the entire world!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: They are, aren’t they?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, it’s so funny. [to guy next to her] Don’t you think this is funny?

speaker: GUY
words: You know, I don’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry, I’m sorry.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, they’re starting. Do you have a lighter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughing] You mean a flame thrower? [to guy] Do you get it? A flame thrower because it’s so far.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: Ladies and gentlemen - The Bangles!!!
[Bangles play. Pan to later during the concert, Rory and Paris are watching the concert and Louise and Madeline are flirting with the guys in the row behind them. Pan to Lorelai and Sookie]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, was Rachel pretty?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m just curious, was she pretty?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She was pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like, what kind of pretty?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What do you mean ‘what kind of pretty’?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, like was she a Catherine Zeta-Jones kind of pretty or a Michelle Pfiffer-y pretty or -

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She was an Elle MacPherson kind of pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s an intense kind of pretty.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You’re not kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I never pictured Luke with an Elle MacPherson kind of pretty.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No? Pictured him more with a Lorelai Gilmore kind of pretty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, the air up here must be very thin because you’re delirious.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you’re jealous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You’re jealous of Rachel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re accusing me of being jealous of a woman who dumped a man I’m not even interested in five years ago?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you don’t think that’s crazy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh I do think that’s crazy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, I’m not jealous.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah you are.
[Lorelai scoffs. Pan to girls]

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh my God! He is so gorgeous.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Listen, there’s a massive party going on right around the corner.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LOUISE
words: So they invited us.

speaker: RORY
words: Who?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Jess and Sean, we’ve been talking to them this whole time, they’re extremely cool.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Are we going?

speaker: RORY
words: Going where?

speaker: MADELINE
words: To the party?

speaker: RORY
words: There’s a concert going on.

speaker: LOUISE
words: The band won’t miss us.

speaker: RORY
words: We can’t just leave Louise.

speaker: LOUISE
words: It’s America Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: We have to meet my mom after the show.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh come on.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean ‘Oh come on’. We have to meet my mother after the concert. The band may not miss us but Lorelai sure will.

speaker: MADELINE
words: These guys are so cute.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh that’s great but we’re not going anywhere.

speaker: LOUISE
words: What are you afraid?

speaker: RORY
words: Of going out into a strange city with two guys I don’t know? Yeah.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Rory please!

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Well we’re going.

speaker: RORY
words: No you’re not.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Paris, join please?

speaker: PARIS
words: No, thanks.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Fine, come on Madeline.

speaker: RORY
words: And just what am I supposed to tell my mother?

speaker: LOUISE
words: That you’re a very good little girl. [gets up and leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: Louise.

speaker: MADELINE
words: The party’s in a building on the corner of Waverly and First. Try to get away. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: Madeline.

speaker: MADELINE
words: We’ll be back by the time the concert’s over.

speaker: PARIS
words: You know, I really like this band.
[Pan to later. Rory and Paris waiting]

speaker: PARIS
words: Well?

speaker: RORY
words: I couldn’t find Mom or Sookie anywhere.

speaker: PARIS
words: So what do we do now?

speaker: RORY
words: I guess we just wait here for them to find us.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t believe Louise and Madeline would just leave like that.

speaker: PARIS
words: They’ve done it before.

speaker: RORY
words: Nice.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah, well.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I ask you a question?

speaker: PARIS
words: Maybe.

speaker: RORY
words: What could you possibly see in Tristin?

speaker: PARIS
words: You wouldn’t understand.

speaker: RORY
words: Is it just that he’s cute?

speaker: PARIS
words: Partly.

speaker: RORY
words: Cause there are a lot of cute guys in the world.

speaker: PARIS
words: Not like Tristin.

speaker: RORY
words: He’s just such a jerk.

speaker: PARIS
words: He’s not always a jerk.

speaker: RORY
words: No?

speaker: PARIS
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. When is not a jerk?

speaker: PARIS
words: I’ve known Tristin a really long time ok? We’ve been in the same class since kindergarten.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes...and he has things in his life that are hard. His parents - not so great. We have that in common.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: PARIS
words: He kissed me once.

speaker: RORY
words: He did?

speaker: PARIS
words: In the 6th grade - on a dare.

speaker: RORY
words: How romantic.

speaker: PARIS
words: You just don’t know him like I do ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, I believe you. I just - I think maybe you could do better.

speaker: PARIS
words: I know he’s flirting with me to get to you, but at least he’s flirting with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: There you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Think fast [throws them a t-shirt each] T-shirts for all the girls because I’m the good witch of the - hey, aren’t you missing a couple of kids?

speaker: RORY
words: They left.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: Madeline and Louise met these guys and they -

speaker: LORELAI
words: What guys?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know, they were sitting behind us and they were having a party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Unbelievable!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What’s going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They left.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let’s go, come on, move.
CUT TO APARTMENT BUILDING

speaker: LORELAI
words: I leave the house with four girls, I’m coming home with four girls. [knocks on a door] Hi, I’m looking for a couple of college boys, who might live here or have friends who live here.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I don’t talk to anyone. People annoy me. [closes door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [coming up to Sookie listening at a door] What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She found him with the blonde again.

speaker: PARIS
words: She’s gonna knock on every door in the entire building isn’t she?

speaker: RORY
words: Yep.

speaker: PARIS
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [knocks] Hello? Is anyone home?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [knocks] Hello? [dog barks] Aah! Let’s go follow your mother.

speaker: PARIS
words: I wonder if I was missing if my mom would come looking for me like that.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, you know she would.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah, or at least she’d send somebody.
[Lorelai knocks on another door. There’s music playing]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Music.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let’s go. [knocks. Guy answers]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, that’s one of the guys.

speaker: GUY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. Hi, could you move please? [enters]

speaker: GUY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you miss me?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ms. Gilmore. Put the cups down, let’s move.

speaker: GUY
words: Is there a problem?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, see those two idiots over there? They’re 16 - underage and I bet you’re not. I also bet those big fancy party cups aren’t holding lemonade. You really want to end any further conversations with me so step aside Skippy. Move your asses outside - now! [they leave apart.] Hey. I am not even going to begin to tell you how completely insane it is to take off with anyone you don’t know, or drink things that you don’t know what’s in them, or act like you have a clue when you don’t, but so help me God if you ever pull a stunt like this again, it will not be around my kid! Do you understand me?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yes.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, now let’s go. I can’t wait to meet your parents. We have some catching up to do. I think we’ll just talk and talk and talk all night long.

speaker: PARIS
words: You know what? I think this is the best night I’ve ever had.
CUT TO RUMMAGE SALE

speaker: LANE
words: I cannot believe I missed it.

speaker: RORY
words: The concert was amazing.

speaker: LANE
words: Forget about the concert. I wanted to see Lorelai pull those idiots out of that guy’s apartment.

words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you didn’t wake me up.

speaker: RORY
words: I set the clock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but see the clock stops ringing once I throw it against the wall giving me ample time to fall back to sleep, you however never stop yapping no matter how hard I throw you, thus ensuring the wake up process.

words: I’m gonna get a soda, anybody want anything?

speaker: RORY
words: Gum.

words: Yes, the night of my 14th birthday back so I can right the green-hot-pant-roller-disco outfit wrong.

speaker: LANE
words: Coming right up.

words: Bye. So, talked to anybody today?

words: You mean Madeline or Louise or Paris?

words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

words: Though I bet school tomorrow will be really interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes - stories of Rory’s Bangle’s - obsessed mother ripping open apartment doors, scaring the pointy haired boys.

speaker: RORY
words: Totally uncool, man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had to do it Rory, they could’ve gotten hurt.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I thought inviting those girls out would make things easier for you at school.

words: Yeah, well I’ve always thought ‘easy’ is completely overrated.

words: Oh, that’s my twisted girl.

speaker: RORY

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! [pause] Wait, why am I wowing?

speaker: RORY
words: Because splitting debate time with Paris is like doing that whole ‘spitting in your palm and shaking hands’ friendship oath thing.

words: But way less gross?

words: Yeah.

words: Oh, good, I’m glad then. Oh, uh, I’ll be right back.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [coming up to Luke] Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Find anything good?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, I got some refrigerator magnets shaped like sushi for a nickel, so basically I scored.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, look, about that thing that happened the other day -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh forget it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I was a jerk, I didn’t mean it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know - really

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah well, I am sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanted to give this back to you [offering Rachel’s sweatshirt]

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh no, you bought it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know but it’s yours and I didn’t know.

speaker: LUKE
words: You didn’t know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: About the former owner.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If I had, I wouldn’t have flaunted it in front of you like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, it’s not a big deal, I was having a bad day, that’s it. Now I got magnetic sushi and all is right with the world.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok good. So here. It obvious

speaker: ly means something to you.
words: ly means something to you.

speaker: LUKE
words: But you have to let things go eventually right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but sometimes you need a little something to remind you. I mean you wouldn’t want to forget everything would you?

speaker: LUKE
words: No there was some stuff that I definitely would not want to forget.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well here, so you don’t forget.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks, can I pay you for it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In coffee, absolutely.

speaker: LUKE
words: Alright. I’m not pining you know -

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know

speaker: LUKE
words: Just remembering.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Remembering is not pining.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re absolutely right.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s just like a memento, like restaurant matches.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can see the resemblance.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, well good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Bye.
(Dean walks into Lorelai's house carrying a pizza.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you come bearing pizza?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not an idiot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then get in here.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sit -- you're missing it.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are we watching?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The incomparable "Donna Reed Show."

speaker: RORY
words: What's in there?

speaker: DEAN
words: A salad.

speaker: RORY
words: Salad?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, it's a quaint dish sometimes used to precede large quantities of pizza.
(Lorelai and Rory give him strange looks.)

speaker: DEAN
words: It's for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Clearly.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, who's Donna Reed.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't know who Donna Reed is? The quintissential 50s mom with the perfect 50s family?

speaker: RORY
words: Never without a smile and high heels?

speaker: Hair, that if you hit it with a hammer, would crack?
words: Hair, that if you hit it with a hammer, would crack?

speaker: DEAN
words: So it's a show?

speaker: RORY
words: It's a lifestyle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a religion.

speaker: RORY
words: My favorite episode --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, mm...tell me, tell me.

speaker: RORY
words: -- is when their son, Jeff, comes home from school and nothing happens.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh that's a good one. One of my favorites is when Mary, the daughter, gets a part-time job and nothing happens.

speaker: RORY
words: Another classic.

speaker: DEAN
words: So what's this one about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This one is actually quite filled with intrigue. The husband, Alex, comes home late for dinner and he didn't call.

speaker: RORY
words: Might as well kick the dog too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, oh, look, she's making doughnuts.

speaker: DONNA REED
words: ...behind in the sugar department.

speaker: JEFF
words: I guess I was thinking of something else, Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: "Not that my sugary attitude wouldn't make anyone an instant diabetic."

speaker: RORY
words: Mother-daughter window washing. We should try that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, right after mother-daughter shock treatments. "You know, Daughter, there's nothing more satisfying thatn washing windows -- oh no!"

speaker: RORY
words: "What? Did I miss a spot?"

speaker: LORELAI
words: "No, I just had an impure thought about your father, Alex. Funny -- I don't know why I had it. It isn't the second Saturday of the month."

speaker: RORY
words: (in a deeper voice) "Hey, I heard you had an impure thought."

speaker: LORELAI
words: "I must now sublimate all my impure thoughts by going into the kitchen and making an endless string of perfect casseroles."

speaker: DEAN
words: You're not even listening to the dialogue.

speaker: RORY
words: Ours is better.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know -- it all seems kind of nice to me.

speaker: RORY
words: What does?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, you know, families hanging together. I mean, a wife cooking dinner for her husband. And look -- she seems really happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's medicated.

speaker: RORY
words: And acting from a script.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Written by a man.

speaker: RORY
words: Well said, Sister Suffragette.

speaker: DEAN
words: What if she likes making doughnuts and dinner for her family and keeping things nice for them and --
(Rory and Lorelai stare at him.)

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, I feel very unpopular right now.

speaker: DONNA REED
words: You, know, dear, the first ten years we were married, I was upset when you came home late for dinner.

speaker: ALEX
words: And you're not anymore?

speaker: DONNA REED
words: Nope. You are no longer late for dinner. You're just extremely early for breakfast.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, I'm not saying a word.
(Cut to Lorelai and Rory entering Luke's.)

speaker: RORY
words: Can brains hurt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it's hypochondria hour.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'm serious. Last night when I was reading my biology chapters I distinctly heard a ping in the vicinity of my brain.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your brain pinged?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. It just went like "dink."

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then, honey, your brain dinked. It didn't ping.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I don't think a dinking brain is any less worrisome than a pinging brain.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you got me there.

speaker: RORY
words: So should I go to a tumor doctor?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you don't have a tumor. You're reading too much. You're probably just losing your eyesight.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.
(Luke comes to take their order.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, can you take a little constructive criticism?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. This place could use a makeover.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. It just needs a sprucing up. Like a coat of paint.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't spruce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean you don't spruce?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What he means is he won't spruce, that's what he means.

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylor, do not start.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Me and the rest of the town beautification committee have been hounding him for years to freshen up the place -- maybe a couple of nice zinnia pots out front, some yellow awnings, a peppy little cardboard pig announcing the specials -- but he's a mule. He won't talk, he won't reason, he won't spruce. You might as well forget it, Lorelai. I'm forgetting it too.

speaker: LUKE
words: Finally a Taylor Doose position I can get behind.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Faded paint is a bad reflection on the whole town.

speaker: LUKE
words: Whatever happened to giving up?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: When standards slip, families flee and in comes the seedy crowd. You got trouble, my friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right here in River City!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This is not funny, Lorelai.

speaker: LUKE
words: Does anyone want anything?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yes, I do. I want to know why you won't paint this place.

speaker: LUKE
words: Painting's a pain. I'd have to close the place for a day -- which I can't afford -- or paint it in the middle of the night -- which I don't want to do because I hate painting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, how about this? I'll help you. I love to paint.

speaker: LUKE
words: You do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I do.

speaker: LUKE
words: You love it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want to marry it.

speaker: LUKE
words: You have strange passions.

speaker: RORY
words: She likes washing dishes too. She's mult-faceted abnormal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, come on. We'll drink a couple beers, we'll sing painting songs.

speaker: LUKE
words: Painting songs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, painting songs. Like, uh, you know, the song that goes, um...(singing) "Grab your brush and grab your rollers/All you kids and all you...bowlers/We're going paintin' today!" Say yes or there's another verse.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I guess maybe...if I had help.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Really? Oh my God! That's wonderful! Hurrah!

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylor, it's not for you. It's for me.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I can't wait to tell the rest of the committee. They're not going to believe this.

speaker: LUKE
words: I hate that he's pleased.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, you'll drop a gum wrapper on the street in front of his store later.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, good idea.
(Cut to the Gilmores' weekly Friday night dinner.)

speaker: LORELAI Mmm. Kick-ass wine.
words: LORELAI Mmm. Kick-ass wine.

speaker: EMILY
words: How poetic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: earthy, vibrant. I can taste the Italians' feet.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's a Bordeaux. It's French.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah. What's an Italian foot doing in a French wine?

speaker: RORY
words: So when do you guys leave for Martha's Vineyard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, we're not going to Martha's Vineyard this year.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? Why not?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Our usual rental wasn't available when we inquired -- late.

speaker: EMILY
words: We should have just bought a place years ago like I wanted.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It wouldn't have been prudent.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now we have no place to go next week.

speaker: RORY
words: Well you could always go somewhere else, couldn't you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: We always go to the Vineyard at this time of year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you know, you could break the chain, Dad. Go to Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, Paris!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Impressionism, poodles.

speaker: RORY
words: Creme broule.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's great!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Impossible!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Porquoi? (to Rory) French.

speaker: EMILY
words: We only go to Europe in the fall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, Mom, I heard a rumor Europe's still there in the spring.

speaker: RORY
words: I heard that too.

speaker: EMILY
words: We know that it's there in the spring but we never go in the spring because we always go in the fall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's getting a little too Lewis Carroll for me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well what is so interesting about Europe in the spring?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Spring vegetables.

speaker: EMILY
words: You want us to go to Europe to eat a vegetable?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom. I don't know. There's all kinds of stuff. There's festivals and, you know, Europe.

speaker: EMILY
words: In the fall.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It costs a fortune to travel first class in Europe. We only do it every two years.

speaker: EMILY
words: In the fall.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's just not in the budget this year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't have to fly first class.
(Emily and Richard look stunned.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause there's always coach.
(Ricahrd looks horrified.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or business class is slightly less. There's deals on the internet. (no answer) Hmm. Pass the potatoes.

speaker: RORY
words: You got it.
(Cut to Lorelai's kitchen. She's mending Rory's Chilton sweater while Rory is wearing it. Rory is using index cards to study. Occasionally she reaches across the table for another card.)

speaker: RORY
words: Catherine the Great - 1729 to '96. Empress of Russia - 1762 to '96.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, hold still please.

speaker: RORY
words: Originally named Sophie Friedricke Augustine von Anhalt-Zerbst.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But everybody called her "Kitten."

speaker: RORY
words: Married to Grand Duke Peter of Holstein in 1754.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, Rory, seriously.

speaker: RORY
words: The marriage was an unhappy one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well there were way too many names.
(Rory reaches for another card.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ow! Lady with notecards just look at lady with needle and just try to focus for one second so that I can sew the button on your sweater and not on my thumb.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.
(Knock on the door.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get it!
(Rory rushes to the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you're four years old.
(Rory lets Babette in.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, hiya, baby doll.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, Babette.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey! Do you want some coffee?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, no thanks. I just came over to ask a great big favor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ask away.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Well, see, Morey just got a call to play a gig at the Village Vanguard tonight so we got to go to New York.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh wow! Cream?

speaker: BABETTE
words: And sugar. Thanks. Anyway, yesterday Morey and I finally broke down and we got ourselves a new little baby, you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, you got a kitten! Good for you.

speaker: RORY
words: What's its name?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Apricot. He's just the cutest thing. But he's so teeny. There's no way he can go with us and I would hate for him to stay all alone in the house so I was thinking maybe Rory could come over and house-sit for the evening.

speaker: RORY
words: I'd love to.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh great! We've got a kitchen full of food and Morey just got cable so you can watch those four girls talking dirty if you want to.

speaker: RORY
words: Sounds good.

speaker: BABETTE
words: You're an angel. Both of you -- angels. You have a key, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We got it covered.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh great. All right. I'll leave ya the number where we're staying. Have a good time. We'll be back tomorrow morning. I love you crazy girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye!

speaker: BABETTE
words: Bye!
(Babette leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. I can't believe how fast you jumped at the chance to spend a night away from me.

speaker: RORY
words: You're crazy. I'm doing her a favor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm-hm, mm-hm. Sure you are.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, that's OK. Don't you worry about me. I'll be just fine.

speaker: RORY
words: I'd like to debate you on that last subject but I'm late for the bus.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, this is only like the second night we've ever spent apart. Doesn't that make you sad?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but I'll get over it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh-huh. Well, Paul and Linda McCartney only spent eleven nights apart their entire relationship. Did you know that?

speaker: RORY
words: I did not know that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well they were truly devoted to each other. Just the being apart was too painful to even talk about.

speaker: RORY
words: I understand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't think that Linda would have even considered cat-sitting without Paul.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, Mom, when I go off to college, I'm gonna be gone every night. What will you do then?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I will go with you. I will sleep on the floor in your dorm, next to your bed.

speaker: RORY
words: Well at least you've got a plan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Um, perhaps you'd like to take a picture of me with you tonight, you know, just in case you get lonely, you can talk to it.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
(Cut to a man leaning against a streelight while singing. Dean is waiting for Rory's bus.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Carry your bird, Miss?

speaker: RORY
words: Hi! I didn't expect to see you here.

speaker: DEAN
words: Just wanted to say hello.
(He kisses her.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hello.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hello.
(They kiss again.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hello.

speaker: DEAN
words: So...who's your friend?

speaker: RORY
words: Homework.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: We will be cohabitating for the next month so I can examine its every move. Jealous?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll get over it.

speaker: RORY
words: So -- hey -- I'm house-sitting tonight for Babette and I was thinking maybe if the right offer came along I might be up to some company.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I'm offering.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm accepting.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: You want to get some coffee?

speaker: DEAN
words: I can't. I have to get to work.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you go to work at five.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, four on Thursdays. For some reason Thursday is always really busy. Lots of oppressed housewives shopping for their husbands' dinners.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: That was a little pointed.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: That crack about the housewives shopping for their husbands' dinners.

speaker: DEAN
words: Come on -- it was a joke.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, well, it was a pretty weird joke to hear coming out of your mouth.

speaker: DEAN
words: You are so sensitive about the whole Donna Reed thing.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sensitive about it. I just find it ridiculous.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean why?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, so she cooked a lot.

speaker: RORY
words: A lot? She made homemade doughnuts, chocolate cake, a lamp chop-mashed potato dinner, and enough stew to feed Cambodia all in one episode.

speaker: DEAN
words: So what?

speaker: RORY
words: You really like that concept, don't you?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I -- well, yeah, sort of.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, it's a little over the top but the general idea of a wife cooking dinner for her husband and family, that's nice. Why is that not nice?

speaker: RORY
words: It's not just that. It's the having to have the dinner on the table as soon as the husband gets home and having to look perfect to do housework and the whole concept that her one point in life is to serve somebody else.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, yes, but maybe there are two points of view here.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think so.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you just feel that way becasue your mother feels that way.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh -- what -- so I have no opinions of my own?

speaker: DEAN
words: I didn't mean that.

speaker: RORY
words: Well if I have no opinions of my own then I guess I'd be just the kind of girl you like.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory, my mom used to make dinner for my dad every day before she started working. And now she even does it on the weekends. So what does that say about her?

speaker: RORY
words: It says that she has a choice and Donna Reed didn't.

speaker: DEAN
words: You do realize that Donna Reed wasn't real, don't you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I know she wasn't real, but she represented millions of women that were real and did have to dress like that and act like that.

speaker: DEAN
words: Please tell me how we got into an argument about The Donna Reed Show.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know.
(Dean sighs.)

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, look, I got to go to work.
(Dean starts to walk away.)

speaker: RORY
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Bird?

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh.
(Dean gives Rory back her chick.)
(Cut to Lorelai sitting at the kitchen table cutting out pictures from magazines. Rory enters the house.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, good. I was just about to leave.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are you going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To Luke's. We're picking out paint colors tonight so it's going to be hours of "yes," "no," "yes," "no," "yes," "no," until my world-famous perseverence wears him down and he winds up in a ball on the floor crying like a girl. Wanna come watch?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm house-sitting tonight, remember?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but you have to eat. Come have a quick burger.

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks.
(Rory sets the bird cage down in front of Lorelai.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! What is that?

speaker: RORY
words: It's for school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, he's so cute! What's his name?

speaker: RORY
words: Case Study Number Twelve.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it hyphenated? Honey, he's adorable. He should have a name.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not bonding with my midterm, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, I'll name him. (to chick) Hi! Your name is Stanley. Hi, Stanley.

speaker: RORY
words: It's a girl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. (to chick) Sorry about the Stanley thing. Your name is Stella. (to Rory) Stella's nice and Stella was married to Stanley.

speaker: RORY
words: Call it whatever you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're grumpy. What happened?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing, just a long day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what the remedy for a long day is? A ringside seat while Luke envisions strangling me with his baseball cap.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna leave the chick here for the night so the kitten doesn't get any fancy ideas.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.

speaker: RORY
words: She's already been fed and if she gets too loud just put her in my room. I'll call you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Hey...are you OK?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Just a bad afternoon. I'll fix it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. Call me if you need a wrench or something.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.
(Rory leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to chick) Stella.
(Cut to Luke's.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, this is another way to go. Sort of a French bistro kind of look.

speaker: LUKE
words: This isn't a French bistro

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Huh. It's amazing the things you learn when you bother to listen.

speaker: LUKE
words: Which you usually don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but then I don't have a lot of useless information intruding in my brain.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, if you wanted to do more warm, golden Tuscan countryside --

speaker: LUKE
words: Then I'd go to Italy. (to customer) Here, I'll wrap this up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We could also go with a pastely English country garden theme. Oh, maybe we could add a little stenciling on the ceiling.

speaker: LUKE
words: No stencling!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me -- do you even know what stenciling is?

speaker: LUKE
words: Does Martha Stewart do it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: (firmly) No stenciling.
(Taylor and Kirk come in.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ask him.

speaker: KIRK
words: I will.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, go on.

speaker: KIRK
words: Don't push. Hello, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: What do you want, Kirk?

speaker: KIRK
words: Taylor here tells me that you're thinking of painting this place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right, he is.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ha!

speaker: KIRK
words: Excuse me, I'd like to hear it from him. Luke, is--is it true?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, Kirk, it is true.

speaker: KIRK
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: KIRK
words: And that's your final decision?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm afraid it is.

speaker: KIRK
words: Because it's not too late to --

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You heard him! He's painting this place. Pay up.
(Kirk hands Taylor some money and heads for the door.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry, man.

speaker: KIRK
words: It's a little too late for that, don't you think?
(Taylor follows Kirk out, stopping to look at Lorelai's paint samples.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ooh, I like this.
(Taylor leaves. Luke rolls his eyes.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, I get it.
(Cut to Babette's. Rory is putting Apricot's food into a dish. Apricot meows.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hold on. There you go. Meow if you need anything else.
(Rory leaves Apricot with her food and and tries to study but can't concentrate. She goes the the phone and dials.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, is Dean in? This is Rory. (pause) Oh. Well, will you tell him I called? (pause) OK, thanks.
(Cut to Luke's)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You ready to talk paint?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. I've got all the choices set up and while any one of them would work, I think this combo is currently my favorite.

speaker: LUKE
words: Huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See? Imagine. This will be for the walls and this will be for the trim -- the, like, edging around the doors and the windows.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know what the trim is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. The colors are actually quite similar to what you have here now, but they're just a little richer, a little warmer. What do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, wait, wait.
(Lorelai goes to dim the lights.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little ambiance.

speaker: LUKE
words: This is a diner. We don't do ambiance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. One argument at a time. So what do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: Honestly?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yep.

speaker: LUKE
words: I have no idea. You like it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.
(Andrew bursts in with a camera and starts taking pictures.)

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: ANDREW
words: Oh -- um, the town council wanted to do a before and after poster.

speaker: LUKE
words: Out!

speaker: ANDREW
words: Bye.
(Luke flips the sign to "Closed" and locks the door.)

speaker: LUKE
words: That's it. We're closed for the night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, listen -- since you have to take everything off the walls to decide what stuff you're going to keep and what stuff you're to get rid of.

speaker: LUKE
words: Everything stays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, there's a plastic dancing pork chop that says --

speaker: LUKE
words: Everything stays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: "I lost my head over a good chop. You should too."

speaker: LUKE
words: Everything stays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Everything stays.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, this place hasn't been painted since my dad was alive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I didn't know that.

speaker: LUKE
words: He painted it before he opened it and once more when the roof caved in one winter. I think that's probably it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The paint lasted a long time. He got his money's worth.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yep. He really loved this place, you know. This store was his life. Mine too, I guess. I spent every minute I wasn't in school here. I spent a lot of minutes I was supposed to be in school in here too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come you opened a diner? Why didn't you keep it a hardware store?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know. I didn't love the hardware business the way my dad did, and, you know, I knew how to cook, so I just thought a diner would be more...fun.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (laughing) That's a hard word for you to say.

speaker: LUKE
words: (laughs) Yeah. I just always wanted to work here. Just where Dad did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God that's nice. To be so -- I don't know -- connected to your dad. That's -- I would have loved that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well you've got that with Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah...I guess so.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, I still think there's a spot on the wall somewhere where my dad took an order one day when he ran out of paper.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Where?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know. Behind the counter maybe.
(Lorelai goes behind the counter.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Next to the door. On the right side.
(Lorelai sits on the floor. Luke joins her.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: "Three hammers, Phillips-head screwdrivers --"

speaker: LUKE
words: "and three boxes of nails in assorted sizes."

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: LUKE
words: I've seen it from time to time.
(They laugh.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, I guess it is time for a little spruce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it is. But let's not spruce this particular spot.

speaker: LUKE
words: That sounds good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK.
(They look at each other then hear voices outside. Luke starts to get up.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, jeez --

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, don't get up.

speaker: LUKE
words: But if I don't get up --

speaker: LORELAI
words: They'll go away. They'll go away, trust me. Shh.
(Taylor rattles the doorknow and knocks on the window.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What are they doing? They should be in there. Just imagine it all in pastels. The whole thing.
(When they can't see anything, the crowd leaves.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (whispers) I should go.

speaker: LUKE
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, so. It's going to be great.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, I'm sure it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See ya.

speaker: LUKE
words: See ya.
(Lorelai leaves.)
(Cut to Lane's room.)

speaker: RORY
words: Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Yo.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey how's it going?

speaker: LANE
words: Very well. I have discovered that in addition to my lameness in geometry I also will not become a biologist, French translator, or Civil War buff.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I guess that just leaves bass player for the Foo Fighters.

speaker: LANE
words: I also wouldn't rule out keyboardist in the Siouxsie and the Banshees reunion tour.

speaker: RORY
words: I like that you keep an open mind.

speaker: LANE
words: So what's up?

speaker: RORY
words: I need to borrow a CD.

speaker: LANE
words: Which one?

speaker: RORY
words: The weird one.

speaker: LANE
words: I need more information.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know which one it is but I'd know it if I saw it.

speaker: LANE
words: OK, well let's have a look.
(Lane pulls up various floorboards to reveal hidden CDs.)

speaker: LANE
words: We have classic rock, progressive rock, pretty boy rock --

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LANE
words: Bon Jovi, Duran Duran, The Wallflowers, Bush.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it. Next?

speaker: LANE
words: Punk, New Wave, German metal bands. Broadway soundtracks.

speaker: RORY
words: Interesting filing systerm.

speaker: LANE
words: Anything yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, sorry.

speaker: LANE
words: OK, well over there we have jazz, jazz vocals, classical, country, rockabilly, Sinatra -- The Capitol Years. Oh wait! The miscellaneous section.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, that sounds right. William Shatner. Is this the one where he sings Tambourine Man?

speaker: LANE
words: And Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds.

speaker: RORY
words: Remind me to get this for my mom for her birthday. Oh wait. Hey, that's it. Can I?

speaker: LANE
words: Take it.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: LANE
words: So what are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I'm not completely sure yet.

speaker: LANE
words: OK. Well I want details.
(Cut to Lorelai getting home. She looks in the chick's cage -- it's empty.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (yelling) Stella!
(Lorelai starts looking all over the house for Stella.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no. No, no. OK. Stella, do something. Show yourself. Molt or chirp or something. Oh this is so not funny. Not funny, not funny. Oh this is so unbelivable. All day long, just chirps like a maniac at the top of her lungs. Now, nothing. Silence. Marcel Marceau chicken. OK, that's OK. I can fix this. We can fix this.
(Lorelai goes to the phone.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm going to make this better. I'm going to fix --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke? Stella got out and I don't know -- do I put seed on the floor? Do I make cheeping sounds? Or do I pull a Lucy Ricardo and walk like a chicken so she thinks I'm her mother?

speaker: LUKE
words: Who the hell is this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean who is this? It's Lorelai. Who else would call you looking for her baby chick?

speaker: LUKE
words: You're right. I'm the idiot. Go on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could you come over here, please, and help me?

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, yeah, OK. I'll be right over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, hurry!
(Luke knocks.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank God. Get in here.

speaker: LUKE
words: This place is a disaster. What's going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, the last sighting was here, by the InStyle magazine. But then she burrowed through the Glamour and jumped over the Cosmo and knocked over a brand new bottle of nail polish so all I can tell you is if there was any doubt that this chick was a girl, well, there isn't anymore.
(Stella cheeps.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, there she is!

speaker: LUKE
words: Jeez -- what was that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stella! Stella!

speaker: LUKE
words: You really do have a chick loose in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I told you I had a chick loose in here. There she goes by the kitchen!
(They run after Stella.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't step on her!

speaker: LUKE
words: She cut right in front of me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, well she's being graded so let's not squash her.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well then tell her to watch where she's going.
(Cut to Babette's house. The phone rings.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: DEAN
