words: Um, I wasn't sure if you still wanted me to come over.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I do. I do, I absolutely do.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you sure?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I'm totally and completely -- You're teasing me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, a little. But I did appreciate the enthusiasm.

speaker: RORY
words: So how long until you get here?

speaker: DEAN
words: Actually, not long at all.

speaker: RORY
words: Why where are you?

speaker: DEAN
words: Right outside.
(Rory goes to the door and opens it. She's wearing a Donna Reed dress.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, what the --

speaker: RORY
words: Honey, you're home.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, say something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Trick or treat?

speaker: RORY
words: What? You don't like it?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I do. It's -- uh -- it's got a large circumference.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. Now come on in. It's cold outside.
(They go inside.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh my God.

speaker: RORY
words: Here, let me take your coat.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: You're welcome.

speaker: DEAN
words: Interesting music.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm glad you like it.

speaker: DEAN
words: So what's that?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, just some appetizers before dinner.

speaker: DEAN
words: Before dinner?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are we going out?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ordering pizza?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope.

speaker: RORY
words: I made you dinner.

speaker: DEAN
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: Steak, green beans, mashed potatoes --

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait, you made me dinner?

speaker: RORY
words: That's right.

speaker: DEAN
words: You made me dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: And dessert.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, what is going on here?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, I thought it was obvious. It's Donna Reed night.
(Cut to Lorelai's.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear, she went over there.

speaker: LUKE
words: We looked over there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she went under that chair and she didn't come out.

speaker: LUKE
words: We moved the chair, we searched the floor, nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then she went under the chair and through a hole in the floor.

speaker: LUKE
words: There is no hole in the floor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well maybe there was a hole in the floor and she crawled through it and fixed it.

speaker: LUKE
words: So she's s super intelligent chick with great physical and deductive skills?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, this is not a chick I want to find.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Luke, what did you mean earlier?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: When you got here. You made some comment about me not really having a chick in the house.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, if I didn't have a chick here, why did you think I was calling?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I thought you were calling about the chick.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It didn't seem like it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well maybe it didn't seem like it but it was.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Was what?

speaker: LUKE
words: Was what I thought -- can we just keep looking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. I just still think that --

speaker: LUKE
words: There she is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where?

speaker: LUKE
words: There!
(Crash)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Careful.
(Cut to Babette's. Rory and Dean are eating dinner.)

speaker: RORY
words: Well?

speaker: DEAN
words: What can I say?

speaker: RORY
words: You can say it's perfect.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's perfect.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. How is it really?

speaker: DEAN
words: It's perfect.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: It's amazing. I mean, I've never had anyone make dinner for me before. Except my mom, and, believe me, it's not the same.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm extremely glad to hear that.
(Dean reaches for another helping.)

speaker: RORY
words: Wait, wait, you want to save room for dessert, right?

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, that's right. So...what's for dessert?

speaker: RORY
words: Lime Fantasy Supreme.

speaker: DEAN
words: Which is?
(Rory goes to the refrigerator.)

speaker: RORY
words: Green Jell-o and Cool Whip!

speaker: DEAN
words: You are insane.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no, I forgot to make the rolls.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I was going to make rolls.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well that's OK.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't belive I forgot them.
(Rory starts to open the rolls.)

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll make 'em now.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hold on, it's -- come on, we really don't need rolls.

speaker: RORY
words: Donna Reed would have never forgotten the rolls. They're gonna make me turn in my pearls.
(They kiss.)

speaker: DEAN
words: I promise I'll kick anyone's butt who comes near those pearls.
(They kiss again.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes?

speaker: DEAN
words: As amazing as this whole thing was, I mean, the music, the outfit, the dinner, I hope you know that I don't expect you to be Donna Reed. And I don't want you to be Donna Reed. That's not what I meant. This just totally got blown out of proportion. I'm actually pretty happy with you.

speaker: RORY
words: I know and I appreciate that, but aside from this actually being fun, I did a little research on Donna Reed.

speaker: DEAN
words: You did research on Donna Reed.

speaker: RORY
words: Look. See, she did do the whole milk and cookies wholesome big skirt thing, but aside from that, she was an uncredited producer and director on her television show, which made her one of the first women television executives. Which is actually pretty impressive.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I'm glad this turned out to be such a positive experience for you.

speaker: RORY
words: It has been. And even though I'll probably never get the feeling back in my left little toe, I'd do it again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Someday. But for now I'd better get these dishes cleaned up.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, well, I'll help.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, you're a man. You can't help for another fifteen years.

speaker: DEAN
words: OK, well, then, as the man I will do what the man is supposed to do.

speaker: RORY
words: Go bowling?

speaker: DEAN
words: Take out the trash.
(Cut to Lorelai's.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's never going anywhere ever again. I'm thinking of slipping some super glue on the bottom of the cage. That would be bad, right? I mean, I know staples are bad but what's the verdict on super glue?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ask Stella.
(Luke is taking out the trash, including a broken lamp.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you don't have to do that.

speaker: LUKE
words: This stuff is sharp. I want to get it out of the way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, thanks for helping.

speaker: LUKE
words: No problem. I'm going to throw this stuff outside.
(Luke goes outside just as Dean is stepping out Babette's door. On their way to the trash cans, they meet between the two house.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: DEAN
words: You first.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm looking for a chick.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, me too.

speaker: LUKE
words: You are not.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, neither are you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Luke, is there -- Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, Lorelai, hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fancy meeting you here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, uh --

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, the Jell-o is doing this weird melting thing and I -- oh, Mom, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, what the hell are you two doing?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nothing. She, uh -- well we ate dinner. You know, steak and beans --

speaker: RORY
words: Canned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Canned.

speaker: RORY
words: Not fresh.

speaker: DEAN
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: DEAN
words: And potatoes.

speaker: RORY
words: From a box.

speaker: DEAN
words: But they were still good.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're welcome.

speaker: RORY
words: So what were you guys doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Uh -- In the house...

speaker: LUKE
words: And then the lamp sorta -- I'm gonna get going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm sorry about this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forget it.

speaker: LUKE
words: OK. Bye.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I probably better go too. Thanks for dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: You're welcome.
(Luke and Dean leave.)

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, OK, you're 16. You have a whole house to yourself for the evening. I expect that you're going to have your boyfriend over. But what is with the apron?

speaker: RORY
words: It's a long story.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did it involve a sharp blow to the head?

speaker: RORY
words: I gotta go check on Apricot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God! I just saw the pearls.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going in now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what? I'm going inside too. 'Cause I have to write down all the ways I'm gonna torture you about that outfit.

speaker: RORY
words: Good night!
(Rory goes inside.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could I just get a picture though? 'Cause visual aids would really help. Oh, oh! Oh the shoes! I am dying. Oh.
(Rory rushes back outside.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom! I can't find Apricot!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? No!

speaker: RORY
words: She was on the couch when I came out, and now, nowhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it! We are not animal people! Period.
(Cut to the kitchen at the inn. Lorelai walks in.)

speaker: MICHEL
words: It was a tiny little favor.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We have had this discussion before, Michel.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You are being unreasonable.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I have my standards.

speaker: MICHEL
words: But this is a simple request.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You are asking me to compromise my artistic and my culinary values.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel wanted an egg white omelette.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Crazy man.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Why? Why am I crazy man? I didn't have time for breakfast this morning, so very nicely I asked her to make me an egg white omelette cooked very dry with some tomatoes, mushroom, maybe a little chives, and she gives me this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is this?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A three egg omelette with goat cheese cooked in a sherry olive oil.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I don't eat dairy or meat. You know this.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I am a chef, Michel. It is my job to make food that tastes good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (eating the omelette) And you do sister!

speaker: MICHEL
words: But I can't eat like that and look like her. (gestures to Lorelai)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't know what you're missing.

speaker: MICHEL
words: That will kill you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You gotta go someday.

speaker: MICHEL
words: But someday all of this will catch up with you. You will become the balloon lady, and with any luck I will be here to enjoy it.
(Michel stomps out.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you make a good egg white omelette.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah. Who wants to hear about my night?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it started with Rory's baby chick getting loose in the house and ended with Rory and I up at one in the morning looking for Morey and Babette's new kitten, who we found asleep in the piano.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow, that's very Wild Kingdom of you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I'm like the Marlin Perkins of Stars Hollow.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You want some coffe?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So how's Rory's chick?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, better than my lemon lamp.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What's the matter with your lemon lamp?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke killed it.

speaker: SOOKI
words: On purpose?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I can't prove it, but I will.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What was Luke doing there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I called him when I got home and Stella wasn't there.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Stella is the chick?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I like that name.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Streetcar Named Desire'.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Vivian Leigh or Jessica Tandy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello -- Tandy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Of course. Continue.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I evaluated the situation in my usual calm, collected manner --

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then I called Luke to help me track her down.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's when he broke the lamp?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, he's not very graceful. You know, he said the weirdest thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: 'May I break your lamp?'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well he got there and I was looking for Stella and he said, 'Oh, you really do have a baby chick loose in the house,' like I made that up, or -- I don't know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well you call someone and you say, 'Can you come over and help me look for my loose chick?' It's a little...

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It sounds a little like the code for, 'I'm not wearing any underwear.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not the code for 'I'm not wearing any underwear.'

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, you're not serious?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Look, the first time Jackson and I...you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. I called him up and I told him I had a bat in my attic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, honey, you do have a bat in your attic.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So, he came over and went in the attic and he knew there was no bat and I knew there was no bat, but we pretended to look for it, and then when we couldn't find "the bat" we went downstairs and we had a bottle of wine..

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you're saying Luke thought I made up a crazy story about a chick being loose in the house just to get him in bed?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not just to get him in bed, but maybe he thought you wanted to see him and you didn't know how to say it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's nuts.

speaker: SOOKIE A woman asking a man to come over late at night to her house. Come on.
words: SOOKIE A woman asking a man to come over late at night to her house. Come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. But this is Luke we're talking about.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh-huh. Why did you call him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I needed help.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. Why didn't you call me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I assumed you would be with Jackson.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh-huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I did.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why didn't you call Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because she would have been furious to find out that Stella was missing.

speaker: SOOKEI
words: Why didn't you call Patty? She raises chickens.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Or Andrew? He lives right around the corner, doesn't he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is your point?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: My point is that you called Luke. Out of all the people in town that you could have called that would have come over and dropped what they were doing, you called Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I had just been with him. We were picking out paint samples. He was on my mind. It was purely a timing thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Picking out samples.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: For Luke's place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So you could paint together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Once again, yes!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm-hmm. Which I believe was your idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK, so now the fact that I suggested painting Luke's diner also means that I wanted to get him in bed. All of a sudden I'm trying to get any poor, unsuspecting person in bed with me. I'm like -- I'm Michael Douglas!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lorelai. This --

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just -- thanks for the omelette.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, honey, I'm sorry. I don't want you to be mad. Don't be mad at me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not mad, I'm not mad. I'm tired.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: OK. You know, Luke is a really nice man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye, Sookie.
(Cut to Emily and Richard's. Emily answers the door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, we thought maybe the doorbell wasn't working.

speaker: EMILY
words: Come in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We were ringing it and ringing it and nobody -- I guess we'll just come in.
(Emily has gone back to the main room, where she and Richard are talking to a man on the speaker phone.)

speaker: EMILY
words: And that would be the same as what we were paying for our old place?

speaker: JOHN
words: Exactly the same.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Except for the grounds fees.

speaker: JOHN
words: Well the grounds fees are higher.

speaker: EMILY
words: But the grounds are larger, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm just trying to get all the information, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: All the information is that this is our last chance to go to Martha's Vineyard for the season. That's all the information.

speaker: JOHN
words: Emily, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I realize the position we are in, but this is a business transaction.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh for heaven's sake.

speaker: JOHN
words: Richard, Emily

speaker: RICHARD
words: As a business transaction, one in which money goes out and we receive certain goods and services --

speaker: EMILY
words: And he's patronizing me, how lovely.

speaker: JOHN
words: Emily, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I must treat this conversation with the same care and devotion to detail I would any conversation that would be considered a business transaction. Kindly allow me to do so.

speaker: JOHN
words: Richard! Emily! Please!

speaker: EMILY
words: Goodness, you startled me.

speaker: JOHN
words: I'm sorry, I just wanted to say that I'm sure we could negotiate the grounds fee.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, that will be fine.

speaker: JOHN
words: Good. I'll get into this right now and I'll get back to you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you, John.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, we'll talk to you later.

speaker: JOHN
words: Bye.

speaker: EMILY
words: Careful, Richard. That canary you ate is going to spoil your dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's going on?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, your mother and I have just secured a place on Martha's Vineyard.

speaker: RORY
words: Really, that's great!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought you lost your old place.

speaker: EMILY
words: We did. But this afternoon we found out that Arthur Roundtree had died.

speaker: RICHARD
words: He'd been drinking.

speaker: EMILY
words: So we got on the phone and snatched that place up.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, it's a fine piece of property.

speaker: EMILY
words: Much better than our usual place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The both of you are going directly to hell, I hope you know that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, at least we'll be well rested.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Touche.

speaker: EMILY
words: I am so thrilled about this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm glad.

speaker: EMILY
words: The two of you must come up for the weekend. It is so lovely. Rory would just love it.

speaker: RORY
words: Can we go for a weekend?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll see how much Valium Auntie Sookie can lend Mommy, OK?

speaker: EMILY
words: The only drawback of course, is that we had to rent the place furnished, and Arthur had dreadful taste. Remember the library, Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Pink and green! Horrible. Just horrible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well he's dead now so he got his.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, you're being morbid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm being morbid?

speaker: RORY
words: New subject please!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Joan and Melissa Rivers here think I'm being morbid.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, what's new in your life?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing. Just school, homework.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aprons.

speaker: RORY
words: Do not go there.

speaker: EMILY
words: What does she mean, aprons?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I was just teasing her.

speaker: EMILY
words: About aprons?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't understand

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not important.

speaker: EMILY
words: Then humor me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Rory just dressed up in a cute apron the other day and so I was teasing her about it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why did you get dressed up in an apron?

speaker: LORELAI
words: (pause) Well. We've decided to give up on that pesky Harvard dream and focus on something more realistic. Mom, Dad, Rory's decided to become a maid, just like I was.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is that funny? Did she think that was funny?

speaker: RICHARD
words: What would have posessed you to say such a thing?

speaker: EMILY
words: And in front of Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was kidding.

speaker: EMILY
words: God. My heart stopped.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you tell them about your bird? That seems like a safe subject.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Your bird?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it's for school. Each of us have to follow a chick through its entire growth process. Everything has to be logged. Eating habits, sleeping habits.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Houdini habits.

speaker: RORY
words: She got out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She ran far.

speaker: RORY
words: But she lived.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's a better bird for it.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank God Luke found her.

speaker: EMILY
words: Luke found her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory said that Luke found her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Paying me back for the apron thing?

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: Did the bird get loose at Luke's diner?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: No?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The bird got loose at home.

speaker: EMILY
words: Your home?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Ah.

speaker: RORY
words: So, Grandpa, when's your next trip?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, Madrid, the twelfth.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I think there's a nice addition of cervantes in it for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Gracias.

speaker: EMILY
words: What was Luke doing at your house?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look, there's no ice. I'll get some.

speaker: EMILY
words: I asked you a question.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He was helping me find the bird, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, really.

speaker: EMILY
words: And how did he know that the bird was missing? What, was he strolling by your house and he heard your plaintive cries for help?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Or the helpless cheep of a chick in trouble?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I called him, Mom. OK? I called him and asked him to come over and help me look for the bird. OK?

speaker: EMILY
words: It seems like this man is always around when you're in trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's a good friend.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do we have to discuss this?

speaker: EMILY Lorelai, I'm getting a little tired of being lied to.
words: EMILY Lorelai, I'm getting a little tired of being lied to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Apparently we do.

speaker: EMILY
words: This man was at Rory's birthday party, he came to the hospital with you, he's the male lead in every story you tell, you go to the diner every single day. I've seen the way he looks at you, the way you look at him. I'm not a fool.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why do you treat me like I don't have a clue in the world as to what is going on in your life? Now I'm asking you, as a favor, if you have any respect for me at all as your mother, just tell me. Do you have feelings for this man?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Maybe I do. I haven't given it much thought. Maybe I do.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you. I'm glad you were finally honest with me. Now we can discuss what on earth you could possibly be thinking. Don't forget the ice.
(Cut to a man playing a guitar and singing as he walks across the street.)

speaker: LUKE
words: So, you're sure we need this many cans?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, you need enough for two coats and touchups and little spots. No, I'm not sure.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well we got the paint and the brushes and the tarps and all the other stuff the paint guy said we'd need, so I guess we're ready.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we are.

speaker: LUKE
words: The only thing left to do is figure out when.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about Friday?

speaker: LUKE
words: Friday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I mean, you don't want the stuff sitting around. I don't know if paint goes bad, but judging by the smell of it when it's fresh, rotten paint would be really gross.

speaker: LUKE
words: Don't you have dinner with your folks on Friday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, yeah, but I can get out early for a special occasion.

speaker: LUKE
words: Friday it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.
(Lorelai leaves Luke and walks down the street. Rory catches her.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey, you!

speaker: RORY
words: Jeez -- you think you got enough paint?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I tried to tell him. So, dinner, thoughts?

speaker: RORY
words: Let's have some.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about Chinese?

speaker: RORY
words: Sounds good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: OK. I need to stop at the market and get some fruit.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I'm getting scurvy.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Well that or a cold, but either way, I need some fruit.
(As they get to the market, they hear a motorcycle and turn around to look.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Damn motorcycles, they're a scourge.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: They're loud, they're dangerous. We should ban them from town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe we should set up barricades and ban all unwelcome strangers from crossing the border.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well! Well, no we couldn't do that, that would be illegal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Darn laws.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, got to get away from that noise.

speaker: Taylor goes inside the market.)
words: Taylor goes inside the market.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kill me and bury me with that bike.

speaker: RORY
words: What is it? A Harley?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is a 2000 Indian, 80 horsepower, 5 speed close ratio Andrews transmission and I want to get one.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: RORY
words: You'd die.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that.
(The bike stops at the market.)

speaker: CHRISTOHPER
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Nice shirt. Take it off.
(He takes off his helmet.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher.

speaker: RORY
words: Dad!
(Rory runs to hug him.)

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey!

speaker: RORY
words: This is great! What are you doing here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'm here to see you. And your mom, who's not saying anything about as loud as a person can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A word. Maybe there's a phrase in my future. OK, why is that man staring at me?

speaker: RORY
words: That's Taylor Doose. He owns the market. He knows all and sees all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what's with the just showing up, Mr. Spontaneity Guy?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, my folks are back in Connecticut so I'm here to see them, and on the way I thought I'd stop by and surprise the Gilmore girls. Are you surprised?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, the teeniest feather could knock me in the gutter.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So where would somebody find someplace to stay around here?

speaker: RORY
words: Stay, really? You're staying?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thinking about it.

speaker: RORY
words: Stay with us!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, sweetie...

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I don't think your mom --

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's not that, I'm still surprised.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you stay with us for a couple of days?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thanks, Lor. You won't even know I'm there. (to Rory) Hey, hop on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hop off.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hop on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hop off.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lorelai...

speaker: LORELAI
words: (sighs) Hop on.
(Rory gets on the back of Christopher's motorcycle and they ride down the street.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher.

speaker: The End
words: The End
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE
[Rory’s putting blankets on the couch for Christopher]

speaker: RORY
words: He looks good don’t you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He looks good.

speaker: RORY
words: I like his hair shorter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Short is nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you think he’ll stay long?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wouldn’t bet a lot of money on it.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we can get him to stay for a couple of weeks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely - by weighting him down with blankets.

speaker: RORY
words: I just want him to be comfortable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s gonna come and go as he pleases babe, you know that.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And no amount of bedding is gonna change that.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but he’s never been to Stars Hollow before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: Well that means something’s gotta be different right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don’t you just enjoy the time you’ve got ok?

speaker: RORY
words: [pause] Yeah, ok. I still think something is different though.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [coming down the stairs] That is the worst shower I have ever had. Water pressure keeps changing every two seconds. I’m fixing it tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey you stay away from my shower.

speaker: RORY
words: We ordered chinese food. It should be here any minute.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good, I’m starving.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here [handing him a cup of coffee]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, how’s Diane?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, Diane is ancient history.

speaker: RORY
words: When I met her at Easter you said she could be the one.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: The one to be gone by Memorial Day.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re worse than mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Low blow.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Can’t keep a feller happy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I keep them happy. I keep them very happy.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, now. Don’t get gross.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah you’re upsetting us.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m gonna go study before the food gets here.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What? Tomorrow’s Saturday.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, I like to get my weekend homework done and out of the way by Saturday night so then I can do extra-credit stuff on Sunday [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t look at me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: She’s a great kid Lor. I wish I could say I see more of myself in her other than we have similar left ear lobes, but she’s all you - chip off the old....perfect block.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why the hell are you here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Behold the queen of the subtle transition.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You’re gonna force me to lawyer up officer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok look. I’ve been making some changes, especially my career and I think I finally have all my ducks lined up in a row.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re opening a shooting gallery.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’ve been tying up loose ends in my life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do they make that much string?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You know you’ve always had that verbal thing, quick mind - it’s annoying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’ve been tying up loose ends.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I don’t know how much your dad has told you but I’m on the verge of kind of a big success, it’s for real this time. I’ve got a company with an actual cash flow, I’ve got employees, I’ve got an accountant for God’s sake. He wears a tie and says words like ‘fiduciary’ and ‘ironically’. I mean it’s for real this time Lor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I would love to believe it is.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [sighs] Why does your dad have more faith in my than you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My father hit his head surfing Rincon a couple of years ago. His judgement’s a little off.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So you have zero faith?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve known you since I was six Chris. You’re the guy that crashed his Porsche two hours after his parents gave it to him for his 16th birthday.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And you were the girl in the Pinky Tuscadero t-shirt sitting right next to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Horrified.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Think again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, having a blast then horrified.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Just listen to me will you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m listening to you. Your life’s back on track, I think that’s great. And I appreciate you coming all the way out here, for the very first time might I add, to tell us that.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I didn’t come out here just to tell you that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [sighs] There’s some things I need to do....to take care of.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I haven’t been enough a part of Rory’s life. So I wanna be around more, to be a pal she can depend on. I mean I’m not crazy, I know there’s already a life going on here and God knows she doesn’t need anyone besides you but....if you give me a chance....

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve always had the door to Rory open for you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’ve hardly ever used it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well I wanna use it now. Is that ok?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course it is.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: [coming into the living room] Hey, I forgot to ask you. Tomorrow morning I’m going to a softball game, do you wanna come?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You....play softball?

speaker: RORY
words: [laughing] Uh, no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughing] You? Play softball? Good one.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well ok, who’s game is it?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s my friend Dean’s.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Dean?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, sure. It’s a date. [Rory leaves. To Lorelai] She has a Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She has a Dean.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How did this happen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well a single-celled organism crawled out of primordial ooze and that pretty much lead to Dean.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I need a beer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes dear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [chuckles] There’s a lot more than an earlobe resemblance there.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good. Hey, thanks for the door thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks for wanting it.
CUT TO SOFTBALL FIELD
[Luke’s pitching and Dean’s in the on deck circle]

speaker: DEAN
words: [to batter] You got it, you got the next one. Don’t worry about it. [batter strikes out]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So which is your Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: That’s him over there.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ok, we’ve got two outs.

speaker: RORY
words: And that’s Luke.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Luke’s the diner guy?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. We eat there practically every day.

speaker: LUKE
words: Looks like we got out number three coming to the plate guys. [as Rory and Chris sit in the bleachers in front of Kirk]

speaker: DEAN
words: I’d send your boys a little farther into the field Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why? Will they have a better view of you whiffing?

speaker: DEAN
words: You know, the only way I’m not hitting it, is if you don’t have the strength to get it over the plate.

speaker: KIRK
words: The truth of the matter is that you can’t pitch [pointing to Luke] and you can’t hit [point to Dean]. So this’ll be a terrific match up.

speaker: LUKE
words: Knock it off Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: A historic lack of action.

speaker: LUKE
words: Don’t you have anything better to do with your Saturdays?

speaker: KIRK
words: What can I say, I’m addicted to comedy. [to Rory and Chris] Half an hour they been playing and it’s tied zero - zero. [louder] Hey if you ever take this show on the road I got a name for you, zero and zero. Dean Zero and Luke Zero - get it?

speaker: LUKE
words: Doesn’t even resemble clever.

speaker: KIRK
words: I’m dumbing it down for you Alfalfa.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How long do these games last?

speaker: RORY
words: Till they get tired. And then they say the first team to get a run wins.

speaker: KIRK
words: Yeah, it’s real professional down there. Hey Luke, does your husband play softball too?

speaker: LUKE
words: Alright that’s it. [starts for the bleachers]

speaker: KIRK
words: Um....I’m getting a page. I’ve gotta go. [jumps off the bleachers and starts running.]
[Dean comes over to Rory]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey. Dean this is my dad. Dad, this is Dean.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, nice to meet you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Same here.

speaker: DEAN
words: So do you live in the area?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No I had some time so I rode my bike out from Berkley.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really? What do you got?

speaker: RORY
words: [proudly] It’s a 2000 Indian.

speaker: DEAN
words: I got an ’86 Suzuki.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Nice!

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Dean come on!

speaker: DEAN
words: I gotta go. [to Rory] I’ll see you later. [to Christopher] I was nice meeting you. [runs onto the field]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So that was a Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: That was a Dean?

speaker: DEAN
words: [to Luke] Hey, uh, next run wins alright?

speaker: LUKE
words: [sighs] Yeah alright.
CUT TO INN KITCHEN
[Michel and Sookie are laughing as Lorelai enters]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! I have never seen you two enjoy a pleasant moment together.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh come on.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh you have seen us enjoy a pleasant moment!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not ever.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh you are being absurd.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You have to admit, they are few and far between.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Through not fault of mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m just saying, it’s refreshing you know? It’s not the usual ‘Grr’ that’s all.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Through no fault of yours? I’m sorry, but you’re the one that’s so....I don’t know.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh I think you do otherwise you wouldn’t have started saying it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just yourself - caustic.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You mean obnoxious.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You’re words not mine.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Go to hell [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, I’m just saying it’s refreshing to see you two just - oh yeah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You - get in here and tell me the happenings at home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m assuming you mean ‘did we get our toaster fixed’ and no, it’s been cold pop-tarts for a week, it’s like a damn Dicken’s novel.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m not talking about the toaster, I’m talking about the man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So what’s it like having him around the house all the time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it’s, um, a little weird. We have fewer clean towels than usual.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Come on give me something. Tell me how you feel, I’m dying here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honestly, I’ve been trying to figure out how this makes me feel since he asked me to take off my shirt the other day.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it was a - kind of a ‘hello’ kind of thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow. He’s smooth.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I mean I have not seen this man since last Christmas right. We hear from him maybe once a week - maybe. And then all of a sudden he’s here in my town and Rory’s running around all excited and he’s sleeping on the couch and I’m thinking ‘should I be mad, should I send him to a hotel’ but then he smiles and it’s....Christopher.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Here. [handing her a biscotti]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean not matter how many years go by, no matter how long I don’t see him for, whenever I do, it’s always....Christopher. What do I do with this? [holding up biscotti]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Dunk. Go on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] This man knows all my secrets. All of my bad girl moments happened with him - my worst fashion choices, my big hair days, the wearing of the Bonnie-Bell lipsmackers around my neck - it was all with Christopher.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So do you think you two will -

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh well that’s convincing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know I - he wants to be involved with Rory. He wants to spend more time with her, be a pal.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It’s about time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah that’s good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah - if it’s true.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And if it’s not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then it’s [sighs] Christopher.
CUT TO STREET
[Rory’s showing Christopher around town]

speaker: RORY
words: This is the town flower shop. Um, over there is a good pizza place. That’s the stationary store and that’s Al’s Pancake world.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good pancakes?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh he doesn’t serve pancakes.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: He switched to international cuisine a couple of years ago, and dropped the pancakes. He would’ve changed the name but he had already printed like a million napkins with the original name so he just kept it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What kind of international cuisine?

speaker: RORY
words: He kind of hops around. Last month it was his salute to Paraguay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Anyone salute back?

speaker: RORY
words: Not really.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Rory! Honey! How are you sweetie?

speaker: RORY
words: Great. Miss Patty, this is my dad, Christopher.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Your dad.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: You’re Rory’s father, well, well, well. You know Christopher, we’re all like Rory’s parents around here and I’m one of her mothers. And since you’re her father, well that would make us....a couple. [laughing] A couple of what I don’t know.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, well we’ve got to be going.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes well, come back and see me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I will.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: [laughing] Bye. [As Rory and Chris cross the street she takes out her cell phone and dials]
[As Rory and Chris pass the market]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well you must be Rory’s father.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, yes I am.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Taylor Doose, grocer to Stars Hollow.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Very nice to meet you. [they keep walking. To Rory] News travels fast around here.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it does. [behind them you see Taylor dialing.]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bookstore. Good. Come on.[they enter. Jackson and Andrew are there]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hey, hey Christopher! Jackson Melville.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hello.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Boy I gotta tell you, did they get your description wrong.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh yeah, much more George Clooney than Brad Pitt. Hey Andrew.

speaker: ANDREW
words: Yup.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Don’t you think he’s much more George Clooney than Brad Pitt?

speaker: ANDREW
words: I’m going with the Billy Crudup comparison myself.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Really?

speaker: ANDREW
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I don’t see it. Well maybe from the side. Hey do you mind?
[Jackson grabs him and turns him from one side profile to the other]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What? Uh, no, not at all.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well there’s a little Crudup in there. Huh, well it’s nice to meet you, whoever you look like.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Nice to meet you. [tugs at Rory as they go down an aisle] Ok, I’m kidnapping you and getting you out of here.

speaker: RORY
words: They all mean well.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, I’m sure all lunatics have the best intentions. Ok, so I hear you like books.

speaker: RORY
words: Why yes I do.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well I would like you to pick something out and let my buy it for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Dad you don’t have to buy me anything.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Come on, what’s the book of your dreams right now?

speaker: RORY
words: Well that would definitely be the Compact Oxford English Dictionary, but dad -

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Excuse me - one Compact Oxford English Dictionary please.

speaker: ANDREW
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Dad no, it costs a fortune.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You need something to remember this visit by.

speaker: ANDREW  Here you go.
words: ANDREW [bringing a very large and heavy book] Here you go.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Holy mother. This is the monolith from 2001.

speaker: RORY
words: It has every word ever recorded in the English language plus origins and earliest usage.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You sure you wouldn’t rather have a car, they weigh about the same. Here you go. [handing over a credit card]

speaker: RORY
words: This is so nice of you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, well I’ve got a lot of things to make up for.

speaker: RORY
words: No you don’t.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes I do.

speaker: ANDREW
words: [whispering] Uh, I’m sorry Christopher, your credit card has been rejected.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Rejected? What are you talking about?

speaker: ANDREW
words: I could run it through again if you’d like.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, no. He doesn’t need to run it throug hagain.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, ok.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Could you maybe hold that for us? I’ll come back tomorrow with another card.

speaker: ANDREW
words: Sure Chris, no problem.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thanks. Come on. [they leave the bookstore. Outside] Now you’ll really remember me.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn’t want it that much anyways.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey, listen, don’t tell your mom about this ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: JACKSON
words: [standing with his back to them talking to a group of people] Yes it is her real dad. He seems very nice. Kind of a folky, poppy, urban, scruffy look to him. And obviously there’s some money mixed in there because he’s got that you know, money nose. And - [someone clears their throat. Jackson turns around and see Rory and Chris standing there. He touches his touque and runs off. ]
CUT TO LUKE’S
[Lorelai sitting at a table]

speaker: LUKE
words: So Rory was at the game today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah she was with some guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I know that punk. Some older guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that would’ve been her dad.

speaker: LUKE
words: Really? So that’s uh....

speaker: LORELAI
words: The guy who impregnated me with Rory - yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, well, he did a good job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Impregnating me with Rory?

speaker: LUKE
words: Now this has taken a very weird turn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.
[Rory and Chris enter]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh hi, where were you? [as she kisses Rory]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well we saw Al’s Paraguayan pancake house, we were stalked by several towns people and apparently I look like Billy Crudup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do not.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Take it up with Jackson. [phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, ah, ah, ah,. Hey, hey, hey, hey. [points to the no cell phone sign]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hello? Emily!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Emily?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [whispers] It’s your mother.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh-huh [pause] Well actually I’m sitting here with your girls. [pause] Sure. [to Lorelai, handing her the phone] She wants to speak to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm. Hi mom.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Lorelai, Christopher’s in town!

speaker: LORELAI
words: [gasps] What?! I didn’t know! Although coincidently I’m sitting across an amazing Christopher hologram.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well I had this wonderful idea. Christopher’s parents are in town too. You remember Straub and Francine don’t you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah yes - the Schnickelfritzes.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: The who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Hayden’s.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well I called them up and invited them to dinner. They said they are free to join us all on Friday night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Join us all?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Yes. You, Rory, Christopher, your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s quite a gathering mom.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well I should say so. We haven’t all been together since the two of you were children. And Straub and Francine haven’t seen Rory since she was a baby.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah I know but -

speaker: GRANDMA
words: It’ll be like a wonderful reunion - all of us together again. I never thought it would happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, me either.
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE
[The three of them standing in front of the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] I’ve gotta see my parents.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [sighs] I’ve gotta see my parents.

speaker: RORY
words: Ladies and gentlemen, the drama king and queen of Connecticut.
[They enter using a key]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello? Anybody home?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh my God! You’re here. Christopher, look at you!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Emily, as always perfect.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I am so glad to see you, I didn’t hear the doorbell.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We didn’t ring the doorbell.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You let yourselves in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s ok mom, look, not a rapist among us.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: You usually knock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not since you gave us a key.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: That is for emergencies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well mom, I’m starving to death. Is that enough of an emergency for you?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Well, Richard’s in the living room, come on in. He’s dying to see you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers to Chris] It’s a setup giving me that key. It’s a key, it meant to be used, it’s my parents house. Shut up.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sorry.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well here they are.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandpa.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Hello Rory. Lorelai. Christopher old boy how are you? My gosh it’s good to see you!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How are you Richard?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well I’m better than most, not as good as some.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And annoyed with all.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Aha! You speak the truth young man! I have made martini’s. So Christopher, tell me about your business.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh Richard, let the poor boy relax.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well I simply want to find out how it’s going.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s uh - it’s going great Richard. I’m almost afraid to jinx it by telling you good it’s going.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Oh, that is wonderful. I always knew you had it in you. You have a splash of greatness as my mother would say. You’ve always had that splash of greatness.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm. I’d like another splash of greatness if you don’t mind.[getting another martini]

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh Richard. Isn’t Rory the spitting image of Christopher?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I just hope you inherit your father’s business sense also my dear.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: I know one thing for sure- you certainly have your father’s musical talent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wait just a minute.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, neither of these two have any musical talent.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey, I play guitar.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know the opening lick to ‘Smoke on the Water’.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And I’ve since mastered the opening like to ‘Jumping Jack Flash’.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I’m a....Chuck Berry man myself. [Lorelai laughs almost spitting out her drink] Something wrong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I would never have guessed that that last sentence would ever come out of your mouth.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: And why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chuck Berry?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Yes, Chuck Berry. He was all the rage when I was in school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we’re talking pre-‘My-ding-aling’?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I believe I am.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Do you remember when you two were what - ten and you put on that adorable show for us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What show mom?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lucy, Schroeder, you laying on the coffee table.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You pretending it was a piano. God, why is that remembered?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Because it was such a wonderful production.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know if it was a production mom. It was just one song.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: ‘Suppertime’.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Did you write that? That was really very good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, that’s from ‘You’re a good man Charlie Brown’ It’s a famous musical.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well I thought Christopher might have written it, he’s a very talented man.
[Doorbell]

speaker: GRANDMA
words: That would be Straub and Francine. [leaves to answer the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers to Rory] Ha, ha your turn.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I haven’t seen your parents in quite a number of years. We were practically inseparable for a while. [leaves]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I remember that.

speaker: RORY
words: This is weird. These are my other grandparents. I don’t even know them. What do I call them?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Call’em what I call’em - ass-

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris....

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sorry, my tie’s too tight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just, uh, call them Straub and Francine. Call them Mr and Mrs Hayden. Sir and Ma’am? Why don’t you just avoid calling them anything.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Look who’s herre.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hello mother, pop.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Christopher.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Christopher, hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mr and Mrs Hayden, long time no see.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Lorelai. You look well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am thanks. You remember Rory. You haven’t seen her in quite a while.

speaker: STRAUB
words: No we haven’t.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: I think she was just beginning to speak in complete sentences.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So not for two years then. [Hayden’s look at her] She’s obviously been talking a long time so I was making a humorous comment sometimes referred to as a ‘joke’.

speaker: STRAUB
words: I see you haven’t changed Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not at all.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Rory, hello.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi. [she curtsy’s]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] Did you just curtsy?

speaker: RORY
words: [whispers] Shut up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] Sorry, milady.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Uh, Straub, Francine, how about a martini?

speaker: STRAUB
words: Please.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well Straub, how is retirement treating you?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Yes do tell us about the Bahamas.

speaker: STRAUB
words: You can get an entire island there for the cost of a decent house here.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Really?

speaker: STRAUB
words: How about you Richard, any thoughts of retirement crossing your mind?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh Straub, if only you could talk him into it. I’ve given up.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: We’re very pleased about Christopher’s business success out in California.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Yes, it’s taken a while but it seems to be finally coming together. Seems to be.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Christopher your tie, please.

speaker: RORY
words: [clears her throat]Straub and Fran - [clears her throat] Mr. and Mrs. um....are you enjoying your time here, um....you...two?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [to Lorelai] That she got from you.

speaker: STRAUB
words: How old are you young lady?

speaker: STRAUB
words: Dangerous age for girls [Lorelai looks at him]

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Straub.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Rory is a very special child - excellent student, very bright.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: You should have a talk with her Straub, she could give you a run for your money.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Is that so?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: That’s right.
[Straub looks at Rory, Rory looks uncomfortable unsure what to do]

speaker: STRAUB
words: Well I think my money’s safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hate president Bush.

speaker: STRAUB
words: What?

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Lorelai....

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s stupid and his face is too tiny for his head and I just want to toss him out.

speaker: STRAUB
words: That is the leader of our country young lady.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Ignore her.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: His face is too tiny for his head, what kind of thing is that to say?

speaker: STRAUB
words: I see your daughter is just as out of control as ever.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Pop please. Let’s try and keep it civil.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Tell me Lorelai, what have you been doing with your life anyway, besides hating successful businessmen. I’m just curious.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Why don’t we all go into the dining room?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well uh, Straub, I run an inn near Stars Hollow.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes really.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Dad come on.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Nice to see you found your calling.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Dinner is ready.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Christopher your tie.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Mom please.

speaker: STRAUB
words: And is your life everything you hoped it would be?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Because it seems to me you might not want to take such a haughty tone when you announce to the world that you work in a hotel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well there’s nothing wrong with where I work.

speaker: FRANCINE
words: Straub please. I’m getting a headache.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Come on Richard, lead us into the dining room, now.

speaker: STRAUB
words: If you had attended a university as your parents had planned and as we planned in vain for Christopher, you might have aspired to something more than a blue collared position.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Don’t do this.

speaker: STRAUB
words: And I wouldn’t give a damn about you derailing your life if you hadn’t swept my son along with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Rory] Honey go into the next room. Go, go.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I’m going to have to echo Christopher’s call for civility here. A mutual mistake was make many years ago by these two, but they have come a long way since.

speaker: STRAUB
words: A mutual mistake Richard? This whole evening is ridiculous. We’re supposed to sit here like one big happy family and pretend that the damage that was done is over, gone? I don’t care about how good a student you say that girl is....

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey!

speaker: STRAUB
words: Our son was bound for Princeton. Every Hayden male attended Princeton including myself, but it all stopped with Christopher. It’s a humiliation we’ve had to live with every day, all because you seduced him into ruining his life. She had that baby and ended his future.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: [grabbing Straub’s arm] You recant that Straub!

speaker: STRAUB
words: You’re spilling my drink.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: You owe my daughter an apology.

speaker: STRAUB
words: An apology, that’s rich.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: How dare you?! [grabbing Straub] How dare you?!

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Richard what are you doing?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: How dare you come into my house and insult my daughter!

speaker: STRAUB
words: Let go of me!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Whoa, whoa, what is going on here? [putting himself between them]

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Shame on you Straub, shame on you for opening all this up again.

speaker: STRAUB
words: Get your purse Francine.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: My daughter is very successful at what she does.

speaker: STRAUB
words: We’re leaving.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: You’re not leaving. I’m kicking you out. [All four leave the room. Lorelai and Christopher and standing in the middle]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And you brought up Bush because?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It seemed like a good idea at the time. Wow.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel....16.
[Pan to study. Richard sitting reading. Lorelai enters]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad? Dad....can I get you something to eat?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I’m not hungry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Well look, thank you.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Thank me? For what? [Lorelai turns back.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well for what you did in there. I’m....I’m just unbelievably touched and grateful for what you said to him, for defending me like that. I know it was hard for you because, well....but thank you. [starts to leave]

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Why do you think I did it? [Lorelai turns back.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Why do you think I did it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. Um, out of protectiveness I guess.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: You don’t need to be protected Lorelai. You’ve made it very clear that you can look after yourself and that you need nothing from anyone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm. That’s not....

speaker: GRANDPA
words: A member of my family was being attacked. The very Gilmore name was being attacked. I will not stand for that not under any circumstances.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, well it doesn’t really matter why you did it.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Yes it does matter why I did it! It matters greatly! Lorelai what are you going to take away from this? That everything that happened in the past is suddenly fine because I defended you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: That the hell that you put your mother and I through for the past 16 years is suddenly washed away? Well it’s not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ve all been through hell dad.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I had to tell my friends, my colleagues, that my only daughter, the brightest in her class, was pregnant and was leaving school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That must have been devastating.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: And then you run away and treat us like lepers. Your mother couldn’t get out of bed for a month. Did you know that? Did you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: We did nothing to deserve that. Nothing to earn that!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I get it. I’m horrible. So why don’t you disown me and adopt Christopher, you love him.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Don’t be a martyr Lorelai. And don’t be naïve. Do you think I love the boy who got my daughter pregnant? I wanted to kill him! I would have too with my bare hands. But there’s a proper procedure to be followed in a situation like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Marriage.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Christopher was willing to follow the procedure we laid out, you weren’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about what I wanted Dad? Didn’t that matter to you at all?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Sometimes one has to sacrifice something in order to do what is right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel indescribably sad for you right now, dad.

speaker: GRANDPA
words: Well save your emotions Lorelai. I’ve had my fill of them tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, um, we just end it here. Nothing....resolved?

speaker: GRANDPA
words: I’m tired.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Ok [leaves]
[Pan to kitchen]

speaker: GRANDMA
words: There you are. I was wondering where you went.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: No, it’s nothing to be sorry about. Can I get you something?

speaker: RORY
words: [holding up a pop can] I’m fine.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Oh that’s hardly dinner. Well that was quite a bit of excitement tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Not the good kind.

speaker: RORY
words: Nope.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: None of this means anything Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh I know.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Straub is actually a good man. Very smart. He was one of the top lawyers in his field - a very arcane aspect of International law. And he’s always been so active in his community. His charity work has never diminished over the years. Oh let’s face it - he’s a big ass. [Rory laughs] Rory, I know you heard a lot of talk about various disappointments this evening and I know you’ve heard a lot of talk about it in the past. But I want to make this very clear - you, young lady, your person and your existence have never ever been - not even for a second - included in that list. Do you understand me?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I do.

speaker: GRANDMA
words: Good now eat up. [hands her a plate of leftovers]
[Pan to balcony outside Lorelai’s old room. Lorelai sitting crying.]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You look great [coming out onto the balcony.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, I look the way I feel wiseguy.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: That was....that was a memorable evening.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes, it was beautiful in there. We should commemorate it with an oil painting or a severed head or something.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Next time we get this group together we’re gonna have to frisk for weapons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hand out gags.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Employ six individual cones of silence [Lorelai laughs] Boy the old balcony is still the same isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In all it’s beautiful away-from-them-ness.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Perfect hide-out - totally private. We spent a lot of time out here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sneaking dad’s telescope, scanning the sky for alien ships.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Never found any.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. And then when we were older, scanning the neighbors houses for naked people.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [laughing] Found a couple of those.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughing] Mrs. Dominski undulating in her big fat underalls is forever carved into my brain.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [laughing] And in mine. [takes out a tequila bottle] here’s to Mrs. Dominski’s underalls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, you’re holding out on me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [takes a drink] Take it. And in an effort to further chronicle this balcony’s history, we are now in the immediate vicinity of the spot upon which was Rory’s initial eminations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we are. Here’s to Rory. [takes a drink]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: The bright spot in all the darkness.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And now.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You know even if you hadn’t gotten pregnant and everything had gone as planned, I still never would have make it through Princeton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I don’t believe that.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, well that’s why you’re you and I’m not.

[Pan to Luke’s where Luke is waiting for Lorelai. He gives up and goes inside. Pan back to the balcony where Christopher and Lorelai are kissing as they take off each other’s clothes. Pan to them putting back on their clothes.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Wow, wow, wow.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You wigged?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah I’m a little wigged.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? Are you kidding me? Chris this is the next to last thing I thought would ever happen tonight. The last thing being a holy saint guy riding down on a flaming chariot from heaven to announce Armageddon.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And Hartford is the place he chooses to make his announcement? I don’t think so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok, yes, it was unexpected but it was great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God! Oh I can’t believe this.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok fine. You know what? We should go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah we should go like 30 minutes ago.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [sighs] I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh don’t apologize. It was the both of us. [they leave] God my parents have got to seal these windows up I swear to God.
CUT TO INSIDE CAR

speaker: RORY
words: So where were you guys?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nowhere.

speaker: RORY
words: Where’s nowhere?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Where we were.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm-hmm.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah.
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Night you.

speaker: RORY
words: Good night dad. [he gives her a kiss]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good night Lor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good night, yeah, uh, have a really, really good night. [he heads for the couch]

speaker: RORY
words: You got some dirt or some schmuts on your -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm?

speaker: RORY
words: Where did you -

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t - it’s been a long night so um, there’s just been a lot of schmutsing going on.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on [directing her to the kitchen] We haven’t really had a chance to talk.

speaker: RORY
words: About the schmutsing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] No, about all the warm and fuzzy family moments that went on tonight. Are you ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know all those crazy people saying those horrible things were directing them at me not you.

speaker: RORY
words: They were directing them to you because you had me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, they were directing them at me because I screwed up their big ‘Citizen Kane’ plans. That’s all.

speaker: RORY
words: They don’t even want to know me do they?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is not true. They are just so full of anger and stupid pride that stands in the way of them realizing how much they want to know you.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Their loss and it’s a pretty big one.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m going to bed now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. No regrets - from me or your dad.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I mean no regrets about you. There’s a misspelled tattoo incident that I’m sure he’d like to erase from his bio - but you that’s a no brainer.

speaker: RORY
words: Where does dad have a misspelled tattoo?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, ah, another story for another time, possibly before your first trip to Mazatlan. Good night babe.

speaker: RORY
words: Good night mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [walks by a mirror and looks at herself] Ugh.
[Pan to morning. Lorelai awake in bed]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [gasps] Oh no! Aah!
CUT TO LUKE’S
[Lorelai waiting in pj’s on the front stoop]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel horrible.

speaker: LUKE
words: Don’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I stood you up and I didn’t even call.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m a rat. We had a date and I stood you up.

speaker: LUKE
words: It wasn’t a date, it was just a paint.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m a rat, I need cheese.

speaker: LUKE
words: Forget it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, hey, let’s reschedule.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, I really didn’t even want to do it in the first place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no come on, don’t change your mind. We could do it tonight or - or right now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Was it an emergency?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. You would not believe what happened. I slipped and I busted my - it wasn’t an emergency. It was just me being a rat.

speaker: LUKE
words: Something came up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Something....someone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Am I right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, ok. Well I’m late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE
[Christopher making coffee as Lorelai comes in.]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Where were you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fruitlessly trying to rectify a ratty transgression.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh. You want some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well I know you well enough to know that when you say no to coffee, especially in the morning, all is not right in Whoville.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very astute.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So....last night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, last night was Chernobyl and the Hindenburg combined.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right, just checking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My father almost hit someone. My father has probably only hit another man in college wearing boxing gloves and one of those Fred Mertz golden gloves pullover sweaters.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Fred Mertz?

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘I Love Lucy’ - Fred Mertz.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Landlord to Ricki, husband to Ethel, I know. It’s just a weird reference.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello, pajamas.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right. Continue.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My father had a meltdown, first with your father....

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: He was asking for it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ....and then with me. And then you and me - oh boy.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Don’t say it like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stupid. Dumb.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Much better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And to top off the whole fabulous fiasco, I stood up a friend of mine, who was counting on me and, and he just stood there looking hurt with the paint and the chairs and it hurt me. And it’s not your fault but in this parade of stupid and dumb, I am the one twirling the flaming baton.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lor?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I want to marry you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And the hits just keep on coming.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Just think about it. Think about it before you make a rash -

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are out of your mind. You are completely insane. You have flipped your lid. Charlie Manson is freaked out by you right now!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Come on, we’re already a family.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who? Who is a family?!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Us! You, me and Rory!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don’t even know what a family is.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s people living together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. It’s a big commitment, it’s responsibility, it’s hard work. It’s coming home at the same time to the same place every day.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok, so what do you want, financial statements? I can be a family man, I’m responsible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, you can’t even buy a book without having your credit card declined.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh man, I told Rory not to rat me out. I can’t believe she did that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She didn’t. Andrew from the bookstore called and Jackson and the UPS guy and ooh it was the lead story on the Stars Hollow web page. And then I asked Rory and she very reluctantly confirmed it. ‘Rat me out’ what are you - 16?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And what are you doing telling my daughter to lie to me anyway?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: She’s my daughter too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: More like your playmate.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You know I don’t deserve that, I’m as mature as you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? The offspring is your favorite band.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So? You’re into Metallica.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well Metallica is way more substantial than The Offspring.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Here we go, it’s the same Black Sabbath riff all over again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! The Offspring have like one chord compression. They use it over and over. They just popped on new words and called it a single and I don’t want to talk about this anymore!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Look, I’m the immature one, I’m the irresponsible one, I’m was the one who was willing to get married when you got pregnant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We were too young, we wouldn’t have made it, you know that.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well we’re not too young now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Now I need some coffee.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What about last night. What did our having sex mean to you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] It meant that Jose Cuervo still has amazing magical powers.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You’re funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We can’t get married Christopher. We don’t know each other as adults.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So let’s get married and get to know each other as adults.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that’s very Fiddler on the Roof of you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ok, fine. Let’s get to know each other right now. What do you want to know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: How is your business really doing? [Christopher sighs]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I knew it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Look, I was going to tell you if it didn’t pick up soon. I swear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you just sat there last night, just smiling and nodding while my dad and your dad went on and on about Christopher and his great big business success in California.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, I didn’t want to upset anybody. I wanted last night to be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well it was.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh and it would have been much better if I had announced at the table ‘Hey on top of everything else you’re upset about, I just wanted to add that I’m the biggest loser in the world’. Would that have been festive?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re not a loser.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re a liar but not a loser.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Come on ,we’re arguing like an old married couple. Doesn’t that show potential?
