speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Christopher, I swear to God....

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’ve been looking for the one Lor, that elusive soul mate - I really have, I just believe it’s you, it’s always been you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris come on.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Rory might be my only child.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not true. If Tony Randall can crank one out in his seventies you have decades left to spawn.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No. I don’t know how much I miss Rory until I see her like this. It’s....it’s easier staying away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Don’t stay away. Don’t. Rory needs her dad.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Or her pal right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think she’d take a combo.
[Pan to outside house, Christopher loading up bike]

speaker: RORY
words: So call us when you get home.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I will.

speaker: RORY
words: And call more.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I will. [they hug] See ya. [ he whispers something in her ear]

speaker: RORY
words: [to Lorelai] Dad wants to know if you’ll reconsider.
[Lorelai calls Rory over and whispers in her ear]

speaker: RORY
words: She says ‘Nope. Offspring sucks and Metallica rules.’

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Fair enough. [He kisses and hugs Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drive safe. [He leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: He wanted you to marry him didn’t he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Spy.

speaker: RORY
words: You know crazier things have happened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You mean crazier than having your mom and dad married?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t think they have.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Why is that so crazy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it is. Because he wants things he is not ready for.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I know him so well. You have no idea.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe he can change.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe it’s different. He did come here this time, he’s never done that before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, stop.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I don’t want you to get yourself all worked up over this.

speaker: RORY
words: He loves you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He does love me.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you love him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey come on.

speaker: RORY
words: Answer me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honestly?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will probably always love him.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok so?

speaker: LORELAI
words: But that doesn’t change the fact that he still has a long way to go before he is ready to take us on full time. I mean you are a handful missy. And while I am pure joy and sunshine every waking hour, I still have my own set of needs that - that must be met. It just wasn’t right babe. You have to trust me on that. Mm? Talk please.

speaker: RORY
words: I still think there was a little something different.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe you’re right.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It would be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah it would

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll tell you what, uh, let’s not put all the blankets away just yet.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You never know.
CUT TO LUKE’S

speaker: LUKE
words: What the -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Taa-daa!

speaker: LUKE
words: How’d you get in here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re bread guy let me in.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m switching bread guys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: I think you shouldn’t break and enter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I gotta admit - it looks pretty good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I knew you’d like it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anytime. It’s fun.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, uh, where’s the guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh he’s gone.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, too bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll be fine. Luke?

OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
(Miss Patty narrates a story in the background as the camera pans around town as locals prepare for a festival.)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: This, boys and girls, is the story of true love. A beautiful girl from one county; a handsome boy from another. They meet and they fall in love. Separated by distance and by parents who did not approve of the union, the young couple dreamed of a day that they could be together. They wrote each other beautiful letters. Letters of longing and passion. Letters full of promises and plans for the future. Soon the separation proved too much for either one of them to bear. So, one night, cold and black with no light to guide them, they both snuck out of their homes and ran away as fast as they could. It was so dark out that they were both soon lost and it seemed as if they would never find each other. Finally, the girl dropped to her knees, tears streaming down her lovely face. 'Oh, my love. Where are you? How will I find you?' Suddenly, a band of stars appeared in the sky. These stars shone so brightly they lit up the entire countryside. The girl jumped to her feet and followed the path of the stars until finally she found herself standing right where the town gazebo is today. And there waiting for her was her one true love, who had also been led here by the blanket of friendly stars. [Camera stops on Miss Patty's dance studio, where she is telling the story to a group of children.] And that, my friends, is the story of how Stars Hollow came to be, and why we celebrate that fateful night every year at about this time. Now, we still have a little time left in our story hour. Who wants to hear about the time I danced in a cage for Tito Puente?

speaker: KIDS
words: [raising hands] Me!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: It was the summer of 66…..
(Opening Credits)

speaker: RORY

speaker: RORY

speaker: DEAN

speaker: RORY
words: Um, you tell me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, where is he taking you?

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you don't want to clash with the decor. A lady plans ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, if you must know, he's taking me to Andoloro's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well isn't that romantic?

speaker: RORY
words: I know!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, it's gonna be just like Lady and the Tramp. You'll share a plate of spaghetti, but it'll just be one long strand, but you won't realize it until you accidentally meet in the middle. And then, he'll push a meatball towards you with his nose, and you'll push it back with your nose, and then you'll bring the meatball home and you'll save it in the refrigerator for years and. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, neither. Just wear your coat.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But your flower's just a little smushed.

speaker: LANE
words: (calls from front hallway) Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: There you go, you're all set.

speaker: LANE
words: Is anyone here?

speaker: RORY
words: You all right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, you look beautiful. Go.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh my God!
CUT TO FRONT HALLWAY

speaker: LANE
words: I just can't believe it!

speaker: RORY
words: I know!

speaker: LANE
words: I mean, three months, that's like one sixty-fourth of your life!

speaker: RORY
words: I know!

speaker: LANE
words: I have to stop hanging out with you. I mean, you're just making my life seem too pathetic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Join the club.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you going to the festival? 'Cause maybe we could meet you there later.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh yeah, that would be romantic.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: Yes, I'm going to the festival. And would you like to know why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh!

speaker: LANE
words: My mother has once again set me up.

speaker: RORY
words: Another future doctor?

speaker: LANE
words: A future chiropractor. I think she's losing confidence in my prospects.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe he'll be nice.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, it's not just him. We're going with his parents, his grandparents, two sisters, three brothers and at least one maiden aunt.
(A car honks from outside)

speaker: RORY
words: That's Dean.

speaker: LANE
words: Remember, you have to tell me everything.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. You too.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh yeah. After the walking, the silence, the sitting and the 'buh bye', that's when the fun will begin.

speaker: RORY
words: I wanna know anyhow. Bye Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye honey, have fun.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't forget the meatball.

speaker: LANE
words: The meatball?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a mother-daughter thing. (Rory leaves)

speaker: LANE
words: So, think I can hang out with you for awhile?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, uh, not unless you wanna go to Hartford. Besides didn't anyone ever tell you, it's not polite to keep fifteen prospective Korean in-laws waiting.

speaker: LANE
words: You can run over me on your way out. Maybe my mother wouldn't make me go if I was in the hospital.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wouldn't count on it.

speaker: LANE
words: Yeah, you're right.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Lorelai is on the front porch finishing her coffee. Emily opens the door before Lorelai rings the doorbell.)

speaker: EMILY
words: You're late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How did you do that?

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Answer the door before I even rang the bell.

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought I heard something, I came to the door, you were there. Come in please. (Lorelai walks in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You thought you heard something?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, that door is like ten feet thick.

speaker: EMILY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so, it wasn't like I was standing out there with a band of jackals, I was just drinking coffee.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, what is it that you want to hear? That I was standing by the window, staring out at the driveway, waiting to pounce the moment you arrived.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, because believe it or not, that would be less creepy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Get yourself a drink, please.
(Lorelai walks into living room. Richard is on the couch reading the newspaper.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry I'm late. I was helping Rory get ready for her big date, and well, you know girls.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So. . . um, how's work?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, work is fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah? Good, good. My work's fine too.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God. Mom has gone a little crazy with the figurines here, huh? A little Kathy Bates. Although you probably haven't seen Misery, which is a good thing because Rory couldn't sleep alone for a week after we watched it. That wouldn't be a problem for you because you don't sleep alone anyway. I'm guessing. I don't know what your and mom's sleeping arrangement is. Now I'm wishing I hadn't brought it up because it's such a 'Wow, don't wanna go there' kind of a subject. For me, not for you, because you should definitely go there if you…uh, well anyway. Agh!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, what have you done now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I just, well, I'm putting the bunny back with his little friends and I just sort of massacred them a little bit, but that's life in the jungle isn't it?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Just sit down, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, sorry.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Just sit with your hands in your lap.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I'm trying to read, so just be quiet and try not to break anything else

speaker: EMILY
words: So are we having a nice chat?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we're having a great conversation, me and Morrie.

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Thanks, Mom, for letting Rory out of dinner tonight. She really appreciated it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she deserves to celebrate. A three-month anniversary is a landmark feat at her age. Or at any age for some people.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was gonna get a drink. I'm gonna get right on that.
(doorbell rings)

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll get that. (leaves room)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I freshen up your drink Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, thank you. One drink before dinner is quite enough.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, sorry.
(Emily returns to the room with a man.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I had no idea it was so close!

speaker: CHASE
words: Absolutely, right around the corner.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, what a small world. Oh, Lorelai, I'd like you to meet Chase Bradford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: CHASE
words: Hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: He was just telling me that he actually grew up right around the corner from here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, really?

speaker: CHASE
words: Stone house on the corner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, the one with the Dobermans.

speaker: CHASE
words: That's right. Leopold and Loeb. Though I'm afraid they passed on quite a few years ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Postmen finally got organized, huh?

speaker: EMILY
words: Uh, Chase, this is my husband, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: How do you do?

speaker: CHASE
words: Fine, Richard, just fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Uh, please sit down.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, I didn't know we were having company for dinner.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh well, it was just sort of a spur of the moment thing. Chase's mother and I are in the DAR together and he just moved back to Hatrford, and it just seemed like a nice idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, very nice.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh Chase, can I get you a drink?

speaker: CHASE
words: Scotch neat.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, Glenfiddich?

speaker: CHASE
words: Fine. So Lorelai, your mother's told me all about you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh yes. I'm just sorry your daughter couldn't join us for dinner. I adore children.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, can I talk to you for a minute?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, we have company.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It'll just take a second, really.

speaker: EMILY
words: But…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, it'll be fun. Excuse us. We're just gonna have a spur of the moment conversation. (Lorelai guides Emily out of the room.)

speaker: EMILY
words: You're pushing me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is this a setup?

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Connecticut Ken in there, is he my invited escort for the evening?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, his mother is a friend of mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And?

speaker: EMILY
words: He just moved back here and doesn't know anyone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And?

speaker: EMILY
words: And I thought he might enjoy meeting you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: AH HA!

speaker: EMILY
words: Put that finger down!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, this is why the Miss Congeniality act when Rory wanted to beg out of dinner.

speaker: EMILY
words: It just seemed like a good opportunity.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, thank you for the thought, but I can get my own men.

speaker: EMILY
words: (laughs) Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, really.

speaker: EMILY
words: I must disagree.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You must?

speaker: EMILY
words: Chase is a quality man, he has good breeding, he comes from a nice family. He makes a nice living, he's attractive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, mmm, no.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is it gonna kill you to simply keep an open mind about him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, he's not my type.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why not? Because I like him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I swear, I don't know which one, but there is a game show out there with your name on it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well that must be it because you've hardly said two words to the man. You couldn't possibly hate him already.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, it's that arcade game where the mole keeps sticking his head out and you have to pound him as many times as you can with the mallet. You would be a master at that game.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I realize that Chase may not be as controversial as your usual brand of men.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They would erect a statue of you next to it with perfect hair and pearls and a big bronze mallet.

speaker: EMILY
words: But I want you to think about something. Tonight your daughter is celebrating her three-month anniversary. What was the last relationship you had that lasted that long? [pause] I thought so.
(Lorelai and Emily return to living room.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, here we are. I'm very sorry.

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh, that's all right. I had a chance to tell Richard a little bit about what I do in the actuarial business.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, it's fascinating.

speaker: CHASE
words: Lorelai, may I fix you something to drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, gin.

speaker: CHASE
words: And?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gin.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Make that two.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about the one drink before dinner rule?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, we have guests. We're celebrating. Chase, here, let me help you with that.
CUT TO ANDOLORO'S

speaker: RORY
words: That was really good.

speaker: DEAN
words: It was?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it was.

speaker: DEAN
words: How was the salad?

speaker: RORY
words: Great.

speaker: DEAN
words: What about that cheese bread thing? Too heavy?

speaker: RORY
words: Just heavy enough.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything was perfect. Even the soda was good. I don't know how they do it but the Coke here is definitely superior to the Coke anywhere else.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, at what point during that did you start making fun of me?

speaker: RORY
words: I would never make fun of you. Especially not after you ordered three different kinds of pasta for me just because I couldn't decide.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you shouldn't have to decide. I mean, tonight, you should have everything that you want.

speaker: RORY
words: I just have to say that I'm now a very big fan of the three-month anniversary.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Definitely. I think they should have T-shirts and newsletters.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I'm glad.

speaker: RORY
words: You did all this for me.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's not over yet.

speaker: RORY
words: This is just like that Christmas when I got a full set of illustrated encyclopedias. [Dean gives a confused look] I wanted them.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, uh, good

speaker: WAITERORY
words: One tiramisu, two forks, and uh, one meatball to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You wanna explain the meatball?

speaker: RORY
words: It's a mother-daughter thing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. Well, uh ladies first.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. [takes a bite] Okay, have I mentioned how much I'm loving the three month anniversary thing?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, you did.

speaker: RORY
words: Because this tiramisu is so good that if the anniversary were completely sucking right now, this would save it. What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop it.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, you look cute.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm eating.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, you eat cute.

speaker: RORY
words: I do not eat cute. No one eats cute. Bambi maybe, but he's a cartoon.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, after we finish here we move onto phase two of the anniversary evening.

speaker: RORY
words: Phase 2. Sounds very official, are there space suits involved?

speaker: DEAN
words: With matching helmets.

speaker: RORY
words: Impressive.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Lorelai, Emily, Richard and Chase are eating dinner.)

speaker: CHASE
words: So Lorelai, are you a member of the DAR?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not. D-A-R-N. [giggles] See, uh, that's like darn 'cause it was a play on DAR. Boy, these carrots sure are tiny.

speaker: EMILY
words: Chase, I'm simply fascinated about your work situation. Tell us how you wound up back here at home. I mean, you move away to make your fortune and you end up right back here. Isn't life funny?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hilarious.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's a comedy for the masses.

speaker: CHASE
words: Well I worked hard and the company was very good to me. You know a thing or two about company loyalty I assume, Richard. Well, the company offered me a choice of East Coast locations, sort of a big vote of confidence in the job I was doing. Picking your locale, it's a very coveted position to be in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, would like to be picking my locale right now.

speaker: CHASE
words: So I sat down and made my wish list. I looked for places that offered location amenities as well as job growth, and finally after days of research, checking into traffic conditions, crime rates, the best school systems, my decision came down to just two places. One was in New York, one was in Hartford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you chose Hartford.

speaker: CHASE
words: I did at that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, is there any more roast?

speaker: CHASE
words: Hartford has all the cosmopolitan big city benefits that New York has, without actually having to live in New York. It just seemed like a no brainer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get dad some more roast.

speaker: EMILY
words: Leta will bring it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, but it's so much more personal this way.

speaker: CHASE
words: Hurry back. I just simply have to know what the allure of this Stars Hollow is I've heard so much about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Miles and miles and miles.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
(Rory and Dean walk to the festival)

speaker: DEAN
words: So, what book did you bring?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, come on, you always bring a book with you and I was just wondering, what's the three month anniversary book?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually, I brought the New Yorker.

speaker: DEAN
words: A magazine. Really?

speaker: RORY
words: It's the fiction issue.
(From the gazebo, the mayor starts the festivities)

speaker: MAYORORY
words: People of Stars Hollow, and our many friends. It gives me great pleasure to preside over our annual founders festival for the thirty-second time. Many a true love has had it start right on the spot where I stand. And I don't mind telling you that at this very festival, right by this gazebo, is where I met my own true love, Miss Dora Braythwait. We have been married for 43 years, and it all started right here.

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: (covers microphone and whispers) Ask her to wave.

speaker: MAYORORY
words: (whispers) I can't.

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: Why not?

speaker: MAYORORY
words: (To Taylor) She went to Bingo in Bridgeport. (To crowd) And now my friends, if you will join me in lighting the fire.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, take me to the surprise now.

speaker: DEAN
words: But I thought you said you wanted to see the bonfire being lit.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh I do.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait, but Mayor Porter just said. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Trust me. It's gonna be awhile before it's lit. We'll have plenty of time before they're ready.

speaker: MAYORORY
words: Every damn year.

speaker: TAYLORORY
words: It was Lenny's responsibility.

speaker: AYORORY
words: Oh for Pete's sake. Does anyone have any matches?
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Lorelai, Emily, Richard, and Chase at dinner table.)

speaker: CHASE
words: It's really fascinating stuff.

speaker: EMILY
words: It sounds it. Tell us more.

speaker: CHASE
words: Well, we're in the middle of building new statistical models that let us do a better job at predicting death than we've ever been able to do before. Richard, you might find this interesting.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I've never been one for sitting at a computer building models, Chase. I'm a client contact man myself.

speaker: CHASE
words: But these models give you a better product to sell to those clients.

speaker: EMILY
words: That does sound interesting.

speaker: CHASE
words: Oh it is. In fact, if you were to answer a few simple questions for me, I could practically pinpoint the day you're going to die.

speaker: EMILY
words: Goodness.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go ahead. Ask her the questions.

speaker: EMILY
words: I think I'll pass.

speaker: CHASE
words: No no, Lorelai! I'd have to feed the information into a computer to get the answer. I'm no Kreskin!

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, Chase, why don't you and Lorelai retire to the living room for some Brandy while I help Leta clean up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: While you do what?

speaker: CHASE
words: That sounds lovely? Shall we?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, sure. I'm just going to, um, go and powder my something. But I'll be back in a minute and I'll meet you in the living room.

speaker: CHASE
words: I'll be waiting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Super.
CUT TO UPSTAIRS
(Lorelai walks into her old bedroom, grabs her coat off the bed, and starts to climb out the window when Richard walks in.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, your mother wants to know if. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi daddy. Okay, I know this is bad. And I know this probably brings back all the horrible aspects of my childhood life for you. And see, I'm really sorry that we fought last week, and I'm really sorry that you're so disappointed in me, and I really wish there was something I can do to fix that, but there probably isn't and I can accept that because I am an adult now and I am proud of who I have become. But I am begging you, please, please do not make me go back down there because that guy is boring.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, she's not up here!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you Daddy.
CUT TO JUNKYARD
(Rory and Dean are standing in front of a fenced-in junkyard)

speaker: DEAN
words: We're here.

speaker: ORY
words: We're where?

speaker: DEAN
words: Come on.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, what is this?

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. Uh, did you ever see Christine?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, it's nothing like that. Come on.
(They go through an opening in the fence)

speaker: RORY
words: You brought me to Beirut?

speaker: DEAN
words: It's a salvage yard.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah. And yet it looks so much like Beirut.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. Uh, here we are.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's a car.

speaker: RORY
words: It is?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, it will be.

speaker: RORY
words: When it grows up?

speaker: DEAN
words: When I fix it.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Um, it's yours.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean it's mine?

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, I'm building it piece by piece for you.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I started with the frame. The seats and the windshield just went in yesterday.

speaker: RORY
words: You're building me a car?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, now it's gonna take awhile, but when I'm done, it'll be great.

speaker: RORY
words: You're building me a car. You're building me a car.

speaker: DEAN
words: That's right.

speaker: RORY
words: You're building me a car?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm building you a car.

speaker: RORY
words: This is crazy. Why would you do this?

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know. You didn't have one.

speaker: RORY
words: You're completely insane.

speaker: DEAN
words: What? I didn't want you wasting time on the bus anymore. I mean, that is very valuable time we could be arguing about your ongoing obsession with very confusing Russian authors.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe this

speaker: DEAN
words: Um, do you like it?

speaker: RORY
words: Do I like it? Are you kidding? (she kisses him)

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll take that as a yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Take it mister.

speaker: DEAN
words: Come on, get in.
(Dean tries to open the door for her, but it falls off the car.)

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, I'll fix that.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't. I like it like that. (they both get in the car) This is amazing.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm glad you like it.

speaker: RORY
words: I had no idea that three months was the car anniversary.

speaker: DEAN
words: Four months you get a plane.

speaker: RORY
words: Boy, relationships sure have changed since I was a kid. (they lean back and look at the stars) I'm having one of those moments right now.

speaker: DEAN
words: What moments?

speaker: RORY
words: One of those moments that everything is so perfect and so wonderful that you almost feel sad because nothing can ever be this good again.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, basically, I'm depressing you.

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're very weird.

speaker: RORY
words: And you're wonderful. (They kiss)

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: I love you. (pause) Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: Did you hear me?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, say something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: I love the car.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, and that's it?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I just. . . I'm surprised, I didn't expect. . .I don't. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: You don't love me.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I just have to think about it for a minute.

speaker: DEAN
words: Think about what?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, saying I love you is a really difficult thing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well I just did it.

speaker: RORY
words: And you did it really well.

speaker: DEAN
words: What the hell does that mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. Please. This totally came as a surprise. I mean, with the dinner, and the car, and then the… I just need a minute to think

speaker: DEAN
words: This is not something that you think about Rory. This is either something that you feel or you don't.

speaker: RORY
words: Please, don't be mad.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why? Because I say I love you and you wanna think about it? I mean, go home and discuss it with your mother? Make one of your pro/con lists?

speaker: RORY
words: Not fair.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm sorry. I'm an idiot. I don't even know what I was thinking.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean. Please, it's just not that easy for me. I mean, saying I love you means a lot. Think about it from my point of view. I mean, my mom and our life. I mean, my mom said that she loved my dad and then. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: You don't get pregnant saying I love you.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I'm just confused. I need to…It's a really big deal.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, come on.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, please don't be mad.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll take you home.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, tonight was amazing. It was perfect. Please, I swear, I just need a minute to. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: Whatever, it doesn't matter, all right? Let's go.
CUT TO FESTIVAL

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes Jackson?

speaker: JACKSON
words: You know what I'm thinking about right now?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That time I roasted some red peppers over the stove burner and singed off my eyebrows?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Good.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I'm just thinking, this is really nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Me too.
(Rachel takes some pictures, then walks over to a bench and sits down next to Luke.)

speaker: LUKE
words: You getting some good stuff?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh yeah, yeah, the firelight really changes people. Ya know, makes them seem happier, freer, all troubles of the world completely gone.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't think that's the firelight. I think it's the Founders Day party punch they've been selling.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh yeah, that stuff is good

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, at some point, are you gonna tell me what you're doing here?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm putting more film in my camera.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rachel.

speaker: RACHEL
words: What? I told you, I was at the airport, now I'm here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh well sure, when you put it like that.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you don't sound all that happy to see me.

speaker: LUKE
words: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you have a tendency to show up and then leave, quite suddenly. One of your more charming attributes.

speaker: RACHEL
words: So you're not happy to see me? Luke, I don't know what I'm doing here. I just missed you. I wanted to see you. I don't know what else to say.

speaker: LUKE
words: I missed you too.

speaker: RACHEL
words: So since we're both being blunt, what's the deal with Lorelai?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RACHERORY
words: I'm talking about Lorelai, the lady who runs the inn, the one you've told me absolutely nothing about, and been very careful to leave out of every story, anecdote, or gossip about the town.

speaker: LUKE
words: There is no deal with Lorelai. We're friends.

speaker: RACHEL
words: For now?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: RACHEL
words: And in the future?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, Lorelai is, she's just uh…I don't know. I mean, at time it seems like, I don't know. But I am happy to see you.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Good. I'm gonna get some of that party punch. You want some?

speaker: LUKE
words: That stuff will kill you.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh Luke, some things never change.
(Rachel walks away. After a few seconds, Lorelai sits down next to Luke.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Where the hell's the fire department when you need them?

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, aren't you supposed to be in Hartford?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Climbed out the window.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it. You're not curious why?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's what I love about you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, how long you been here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little while.

speaker: LUKE
words: Did you see Harry and Taylor get into a fist fight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! Aww! How did I miss that? I'm so bummed!

speaker: LUKE
words: It was good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So where's Rachel?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, she's a founder's party punch junkie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, even the nice girls aren't safe.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. She's been running around here taking all kinds of pictures.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's having a good time.

speaker: LUKE
words: I guess so. I hope so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what's the haps with you two?

speaker: LUKE
words: The haps? Well, lets see. What is the haps?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, like, ya know, what's going. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: I know what you meant by the haps.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well you're repeating it like a thousand times.

speaker: LUKE
words: I was pondering.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you ponder really slowly.

speaker: LUKE
words: If I did it fast it wouldn't be pondering. Pondering by nature is a slow connotation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Fine, fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is she staying?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want her to?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She seems to really like you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah she does, but she doesn't have the greatest attention span.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: But she is here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, she is.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know. You spend a lot of time debating things, ya know, is it right, is it wrong, or should I do this, should I do that. I mean, sometimes you should just jump in and take a shot. What's the worst that can happen? She left before, I lived. Maybe this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think that's really great.

speaker: LUKE
words: You do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I guess I'm gonna go check up on Rachel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That you have somebody you can go check up on. That's nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah it is. Unless she's completely drunk and throwing up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Still nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll see you tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow.
CUT TO LORELAIS HOUSE
(Lorelai walks in, picks up phone, dials, sits on the couch.)

speaker: MAX'S MACHINE
words: Hi, you've reached Max Medina. I'm not here right now so leave a message at the beep and I'll get back to you. Thanks.
(Rory walks in. Lorelai hangs up the phone.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: We just broke up.
(Lorelai walks to Rory and hugs her.)
THE END
[Lorelai and Rory hugging]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tell me what happened.

speaker: RORY
words: We broke up, we just broke up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I don’t understand.

speaker: RORY
words: We - we went to dinner and then we walked by the bonfire but it wasn’t lit so we went to this junkyard and we sat in this car and then - oh God!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I forgot your meatball in the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh honey, forget it.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh I can’t believe I left your meatball in the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, ok, come on [as they sit on the couch]

speaker: RORY
words: After I told the waiter to wrap it up and everything. And everyone was like ‘what do you want with one meatball?’ And I was like ‘It’s a mother/daughter thing.’ And I’m sure he thought I was nuts but he was so nice and he did it anyway and he uh, he brought one of those tin foil swans or duck or some kind of bird and - and then I left it in the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, forget about the meatball ok? Just tell me what happened.

speaker: RORY
words: He just broke up with me ok?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That doesn’t make sense. This is Dean we’re talking about. He’s crazy about you. He calls like 25 times a day. Have you seen the cover of his notebook? It’s one step away from stalker material.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go to bed. [gets up and heads for her room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, wait. Take me through the night step by step.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I can help decipher what happened here.

speaker: RORY
words: What happened here is we broke up. He didn’t want to be my boyfriend anymore, end of story.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so not end of story.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, he did not plan an entire romantic evening complete with dinner and a junkyard, which we’ll get back to later, and then suddenly decide to dump you for no reason.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know? [as she pulls out a box from her closet.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I have read every Nancy Drew mystery ever written. The one about the Amish country, twice. I know there’s more to the story than what you’re telling me. What are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m getting rid of all this stuff.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What stuff?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything he gave me, everything he touched, everything he looked at.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, will you just calm down for just one second.

speaker: RORY
words: He doesn’t want to be my boyfriend - fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok ,it will be fine but - [taking one of the shirts Rory was about to put in the box]

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mine.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is there someone else?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is he moving?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, is he dying? Did his football team lose a game?

speaker: RORY
words: What ?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s happened. Did he, um, try something?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, did he wanna…

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did he wanna go faster than you -

speaker: RORY
words: God no!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, ok, I’m sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Jeez..

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re just not giving me a lot to go off of here. Honey that’s your fancy dress that I made for you.

speaker: RORY
words: That I wore to a dance that I went to with him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. Sweater’s brand-new.

speaker: RORY
words: Well he saw me in it yesterday and he liked it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then he’s got good taste.

speaker: RORY
words: He said it brought out the blue in my eyes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well then he’s gay.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re not funny and it goes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m a little funny and if you throw away everything Dean ever saw you wear you’re gonna be walking around in a towel. Colonel Clucker? Are you serious? He has been with you since you were four.

speaker: RORY
words: The first time Dean came over, he picked it up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that’s the not the colonel’s fault. He was sitting there minding his own business and a guy comes in and picks him up, what’s a stuffed bird to do?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want to joke about this, not now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Here. [giving her the box] I don’t want to look at that anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I’ll, um, I’ll put it away.

speaker: RORY
words: No, take it out of the house. Throw it in a dumpster, burn it, I don’t care. Just - I want it gone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know honey, some day, when all of this is in the past, you may be sorry that you don’t have some of those things anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t care.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But Rory -

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t care!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Fine. It’s gone.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I’ll take care of this and you go to bed and get some rest. Maybe you’ll fell more like talking in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, good night.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Far, far away from the house ok?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, it sleeps with the fishes.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. [Lorelai puts the box in a closet instead and covers it with a blanket.]
[Pan to morning. Lorelai’s bedroom]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom get up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory what’s the matter?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing, I just want to get started. I made a list of all the things we say we’re going to do on the weekend but then when the weekend comes around you say they’re too boring to actually do one a weekend day, so then you say we’ll do them during the week, which of course we never do. So I think that we should get them all out of the way today once and for all. And to make it interesting, we should come up with like a reward system so once we’re done with everything on the list we could go get manicures or we could go to the Swiss place for fondue for dinner or we could stuff our purses full of sour patch kids and milk duds and go see the Stars Hollow elementary school production of ‘Who’s afraid of Virginia Woolfe.’

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: On Saturday morning.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 on Saturday morning!

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want to wear docks or sneakers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want to wear slippers.

speaker: RORY
words: Up please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, my heart. It is Saturday, the day of rest.

speaker: RORY
words: Sunday’s the day of rest.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Saturday is the day of pre-rest.

speaker: RORY
words: Pre-rest?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, so that way when you actually get to Sunday you’re rested enough to enjoy your rest.

speaker: RORY
words: That makes absolutely no sense.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 on Saturday morning. [Rory uncovers her] Oh jeez!

speaker: RORY
words: Up please!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You make a rhyme.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll see you downstairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh!
[Pan to Lorelai coming down the stairs. She turns to go into the kitchen and stops, turns back to look at the living room only to find all the furniture moved around. Heads into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello. Did you rearrange the furniture?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, cause for a minute there I thought we were having a problem with decorator elves and I was gonna have to call an exterminator and tent the place but it was just you. Great. Good. So now was there any reason that you just suddenly felt the need to move around large pieces of furniture first thing in the morning?

speaker: RORY
words: I was up, it was there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok good thought process. Great. Now I noticed you didn’t move the tv though.

speaker: RORY
words: It was too heavy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, ok. Well I like this, yeah, this is good. Now of course when the sofa actually faced the tv it made it a little easier to watch but you know this is good too. It’ll be like um, you know like radio.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you ready to go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I am, just uh, just one quick sec. Um, why don’t you - could you put the pen down?

speaker: RORY
words: Just finishing the list.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I see and as much as I love your list, let’s just finish this particular one in a little while ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I’m concerned about you. I wish you would talk to me.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want to deal with it right now. I can’t deal with it right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fair enough. But listen, I’ve had my heart broken before. It’s really hard. It’s hard for everyone, so can I give you a little advice.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think what you really need to do today is wallow.

speaker: RORY
words: Wallow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, get back in your pajamas, go to bed, eat nothing but gallons of ice cream and tons of pizza, don’t take a shower or shave your legs or put on any kind of make up at all and just sit in the dark and watch a really sad movie and have a good long cry and just wallow. You need to wallow.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, your first love is intense and your first break up even more intense. Shoving it away and ignoring it while you make lists it’s not gonna help.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want to wallow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Try it for one day.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: One day, one day of pizza and pajamas. I’ll rent ‘Love Story’ and ‘The Champ’, ’An Affair to Remember’, ‘Ishtar’.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want to be that kind of girl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: the kind of girl that watches ‘Ishtar’?

speaker: RORY
words: The kind of girl who just falls apart because she doesn’t have a boyfriend.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That description hardly applies to you.

speaker: RORY
words: It will if I wallow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not true.

speaker: RORY
words: So I used to have a boyfriend and now I don’t. Ok, that’s just the way it is. I mean sitting in the dark eating junk food and not shaving my legs isn’t gonna change that, is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, so I don’t even want to go there. I have things to do, I have school and Harvard to think about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, Harvard is like three years away.

speaker: RORY
words: But now is the time to be preparing for it. I mean Harvard is hard to get into and I don’t know why I even spend my time thinking about anything else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you have a pulse and you are not the president of the audio visual club.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m 16, I have the rest of my life to have a boyfriend. I should be keeping my eye on the prize right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I admire your attitude.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So should we rent ‘Old Yeller’ too or is that just a guy’s crying movie.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re not listening to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am listening to you, I just - I don’t agree with you.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want to wallow, and you can’t make me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So that must be the list.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: May I see it please? We do not need a garden hose.

speaker: RORY
words: We don’t have one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We don’t have a garden either.

speaker: RORY
words: But maybe if we have a hose we can grow one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I see the pen please?

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Small adjustment, small adjustment. [writes something on the list and hands the list back to Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom...

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? It’s on the list. Don’t you have to do it if it’s on the list?!

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not going to wallow [crossing it out]

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I put it after going to the recycling center.
CUT TO STREET
[Lorelai and Rory walking]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are all these people doing up? It’s Saturday morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Some people like getting up early.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You lie.

speaker: RORY
words: No they do it voluntarily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Everyday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha! Jumpback!

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

words: Kevin Bacon, Footloose, reaction to the no dancing in town rule is revealed to him by Chris Penn, brother to Sean, sage to all.

speaker: RORY
words: I shoulda known.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you should. I don’t know what they teach you in that damn school. [Rory stops walking] What?

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t go that way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why, we’re going to Luke’s.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 in the morning and then you say ‘no’ to Luke’s? Don’t you know how dangerous that is?

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t go that way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Reason please?

speaker: RORY
words: Because we’d have to go by Doose’s market.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: So we might run into -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. Um, you don’t know if he’s working?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t remember. His weekend schedule changes a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, well we’ll just take the long way.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: We’d have to go by the school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But there’s no school today.

speaker: RORY
words: But on his days off from work he plays football at the school with some of his friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well what time?

speaker: RORY
words: It varies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, well we’ll just go down Peach street, we’ll circle around, you’re shaking your head why?

speaker: RORY
words: He lives on Peach.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, honey, love of my life, you realize you’ve completely cut us from Luke’s where the happy coffee is.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it’s ok, it’s ok. Ok, we’ll just um, well, we’ll figure something out.
CUT TO ALLEY

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, this is good. This is like ‘G.I. Jane’ but we get to keep our hair.

speaker: RORY
words: I just couldn’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh honey, say no more. Think of this as an adventure. Two girls battling the elements, desperate for survival.

speaker: RORY
words: Or coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Same thing.

words: You know I bet you can tell a lot about people from their garbage.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

words: Think about it, trash is discarded aspect of people’s lives.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm.

words: It talks about their eating habits, what they read, do they go to concerts, are they responsible, do they pay bills on time?

speaker: LORELAI

words: I’m just trying to make a point.

speaker: RORY

words: And stinky and a little nuts.

words: There’s nothing nuts about wanting to know more about human nature. [picking up an article of clothing from a pile of garbage] Curiosity is how we grow.

words: Bah! [making her drop it and pulling her out of the alley] We have to get you out of this alley.
CUT TO LUKE’S
[Lorelai and Rory enter from the back.]

words: Who are all these people?

speaker: RORY
words: 00 am crowd.

words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh bless you. [she pours coffee] So Luke put you to work huh?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah well I figured if I’m going to be hanging around here for a while the least I could do is help out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’re gonna be hanging around for a while...here?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah I think so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well that’s nice.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: So where is Luke?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well we were kind of up late last night so I let him sleep in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sleep in? Luke?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh believe me it wasn’t easy to get him to agree to it, but in the end, a little sweet talk, a couple of Excedrin PM he finally caved.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey there’s a seat over there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh go, go! I’ll be over in a sec.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: I feel like everyone is staring at me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well yeah, because you’ve got a banana peel stuck to your foot.

speaker: RORY
words: I do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m kidding. Nobody’s staring at you.

speaker: RORY
words: They know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They don’t know.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s probably all around town by now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Everyone knows that I’ve been dumped.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want to go home?

speaker: RORY
words: No, we have a list.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok great. I’m gonna order us something. Any preference - eggs, french toast, key to the dumpster?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t care.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, I’ll be right back. [heads for the counter and runs into Miss Patty]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Lorelai, what a nice surprise so early in the morning. So how’s things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know don’t you?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes and I feel awful. I feel completely responsible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you should. [smiling]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well I got Dean that job and I certainly encouraged them, I felt they were so right together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Miss Patty, please don’t say anything to Rory about it, she’s a little concerned about everybody finding out.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh of course, not a peep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And spread the word ok?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Consider it done. Oh and Lorelai, would you give the angel a hug for me. I mean you don’t have to say it’s from me, just give her a hug.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Ok. [leaves. Lorelai head for the counter as Luke comes down the stairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well, uh, good morning sleeping beauty.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well you know Rachel thought I looked a little tired.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it’s good. You need a little break.

speaker: LUKE
words: I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do. So she seems pretty comfortable here huh?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah well she always could just fit in places you know. It’s a talent of hers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She looks good in your apron.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah well, can I get you anything?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, um, do you think you could make those really crazy chocolate chip pancakes and go extra heavy on the chocolate?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah sure, any special occasion?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Dean broke up with Rory.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Keep it down, she doesn’t want anybody to know about it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh I knew it, I just knew that kid was trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you did, you knew it. Pancakes please.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh God, he’s got a nerve. I mean what does he think he’s gonna do better than Rory? Is he crazy? Jeez. Alright, well forget it ok. Good riddance, adios, bienvenidos, hasta la vista.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could we get off the small world ride and start cooking please?

speaker: LUKE
words: How is she?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’s been dumped by her first boyfriend.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh man, I swear I would love to - ok, I’m gonna put some whipped cream on the pancakes too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not a word ok?

speaker: LUKE
words: I got it. [Lorelai turns around and sees Kirk talking to Rory]

speaker: KIRK
words: I never liked him. I don’t know what it was, something about the shape of his forehead or his height or the floppy hair style. Actually yes, on reflection I think it was the floppy hair style.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey good morning Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Lorelai, I want to express my apologies for not voicing my concerns about that floppy haired jerk earlier because if I had -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you know what - you need to leave now.

speaker: KIRK
words: I cannot go until you accept my apology.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I accept your apology.

speaker: KIRK
words: Alright.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: KIRK
words: It will not happen again. [Kirk leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey are you sure you don’t want to -

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t say ‘wallow’.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Swallow your coffee before you eat?

speaker: RORY
words: I am fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But if you could see the look on your face.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s the same look you had on your face when you broke up with Max. Did wallowing help you get over him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not saying wallowing will help you get over Dean. It’s part of the process. It’s the mourning period. It’s a step, an important step. The only thing that will get you over somebody is time.

speaker: RORY
words: How much time did it take you to get over Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not sure exactly.

speaker: RORY
words: Approximately?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t clock it.

speaker: RORY
words: Ballpark figure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A while.

speaker: RORY
words: Be vaguer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory come on.

speaker: LUKE
words: More coffee? Pancakes are coming right up, anything else I can get you?

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey I’ve got some strawberries back there, you like strawberries don’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah I like strawberries but -

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m getting you strawberries. [moves to the next table]

speaker: RORY
words: You told him didn’t you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Miss Patty did. [Luke sees Dean heading towards the diner and as he goes out to meet him, Rory and Lorelai keep talking.]

speaker: RORY
words: Well who told Miss Patty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, numerous sources.
[Pan to outside diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Stop right there.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Where are you going?

speaker: DEAN
words: To get coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: Wrong.

speaker: DEAN
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LUKE
words: You’re not going in there buddy.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LUKE
words: Turn around bag boy.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you serious?

speaker: LUKE
words: Do you see a smile on my face?

speaker: DEAN
words: No but what’s different about that?

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: DEAN
words: It’s just that you’re not exactly known as the town crack up.

speaker: LUKE
words: So you’re a smart guy now huh?

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: Just exercising my right not to serve you.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you talking about? I’m not even inside yet. [tries to get away but they end up wrestling] Let go of me!

speaker: LUKE
words: You first.
[Pan to inside]

speaker: RORY
words: If you tell Miss Patty, everybody in town is gonna know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey people have their own lives and their own problems. I hardly think you and Dean breaking up is the main thing on their minds. [sees Luke and Dean wrestling outside] Oh my God! Oh!

speaker: RORY
words: What? [sees them wrestling] Oh my God.
[Lorelai and Rory run outside]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, hey, hey, cut it out! Break it up! [to Luke]You back off! Come here! What do you think you’re doing?!

speaker: LUKE
words: He started it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: By doing what?

speaker: LUKE
words: He was coming in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you a lunatic! He’s 16!

speaker: LUKE
words: Well what was I supposed to do?!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well stand in the middle of the street and have a slap fight of course! Come here! [taking him inside]

speaker: RORY
words: [to Dean] Are you ok?

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh good, I don’t know what go into Luke. He’s usually so -

speaker: DEAN
words: I have to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sure, bye. [leaves as Luke follows him]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get inside now. Inside - now!

speaker: LUKE
words: He started it. [goes inside.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So where’s that list?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 again tomorrow morning. So, where do we start?

speaker: RORY
words: [pulling out list] Well we need a soap dish for the kitchen

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, a kitchen soap dish. Quite decadent but what the hell, let’s go.
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE
[Girls come in with bags]

speaker: RORY
words: Well that was a very successful outing for us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it was.

speaker: RORY
words: We got everything on the list except for the brown extension cord.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which will be in on Tuesday.

speaker: RORY
words: So I think that that qualifies as a check too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you happy?

speaker: RORY
words: I appreciate a job well done, yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t wait to try the toaster pizza. It looks so gross which is usually the mark for a great junk food.

speaker: RORY
words: Beefaroni.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘nough said.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m gonna go plug in my new wall air freshener. Give me five minutes and then come sniff my room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cheese or pepperoni?

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever. [goes into her room and closes the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Both. Good choice. [Babette enters]

speaker: BABETTE
words: Hey Sugar, I just heard. Where is she? Poor little thing. Rory sweetie!!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on. [pulling her outside]

speaker: BABETTE
words: What? Is she outside?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well yeah. [outside] Babette I appreciate you coming over like this bur Rory’s not really in a talking mood just now.

speaker: BABETTE
words: But I can help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you can.

speaker: BABETTE
words: I can tell her how you have to go through a lot of bad relationship’s to get to that really good one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it’s very good advice.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh yeah and I can tell her about all the horrible men I’ve known in my day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh that’d be great.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Really truly awful men.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Babette.

speaker: BABETTE
words: I was pushed out of a moving car once.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now that’s a peppy little anecdote. [In the house, Rory comes out of her room and overhears them.]

speaker: BABETTE
words: Let me tell her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I want you to tell her all that but just not now.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Is she really bad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’ll be fine. Really.

[Rory goes back into her room and lies on the bed. Looks at her wrist where the bracelet that Dean made her used to be. She gets mad at herself for feeling that way and picks up her books to try and study. Madeline’s party invitation slips out from some papers. She picks it up and goes out into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [coming in] Oh they had some of our mail.

speaker: RORY
words: Look [handing her the invition]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Madeline’s having a party.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m going to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re going to a Chilton party?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, why don’t you just stay home and read ‘The bell jar’? Same effect.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I’m going to be going to school there for the next two and a half years. It wouldn’t kill me to be social right? What’s wrong with that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok then it’s settled.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, can I make a suggestion?

speaker: RORY
words: Go ahead.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don’t you see if Lane can come with you? You know that way if the socializing doesn’t turn out how you planned you got a friendly face around.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, good idea. Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I take the car?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I borrow something to wear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you gonna give in to anything I say because you feel sorry for me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll make a list.
[Pan to that night. Rory and Lane getting ready.]

speaker: RORY
words: Here, hand me that blush.

speaker: LANE
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Am I all twisty back here?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, a little. Here. [fixes dress] So how are you?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m...fine.

speaker: LANE
words: How are you really?

speaker: RORY
words: Life goes on right?

speaker: LANE
words: You know I saw Dean today. I wasn’t sure if I should tell you.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not?

speaker: LANE
words: I mean I wasn’t sure you’d want to know.

speaker: RORY
words: No, that’s fine. What’d he say?

speaker: LANE
words: Nothing. He crossed the street as soon as I saw him.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LANE
words: But if it’s any consolation he looks really sad.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t want him to be sad.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory are you sure you want to go out tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: Why does everyone keep asking me that?

speaker: LANE
words: Because you just broke up. I mean I’d be perfectly fine to just hang out here and listen to music and talk, not talk, whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I am not hanging out. We are going to this party. It’s gonna be great. I don’t want to dwell on this. That’s final.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [entering room] Don’t argue with her or you’ll find yourself the proud owner of three garden weasels.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Three cause one’s just not enough. Here, turn around.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 14 hours of labor that’s why. [clicks her tongue]

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And hair. [puts a necklace on Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: What is this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought it would go with your dress and it does.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 00 you call me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, call me.

speaker: LANE
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: The cornstarch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Um the cornstarch. The first time Dean kissed me he - I forgot to put it with the other things. I’ll just throw it out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey why don’t you let me do that, you guys get going ok?

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, bye. Have fun. Ooh hey, look in somebody’s sock drawer. Rich people have hilarious sock drawers. Be good. [Rory and Lane leave. Lorelai puts the cornstarch with the rest of the stuff and pulls down her ‘Max box’]
CUT TO SOOKIE’S

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi, Lorelai, hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanted to ask you - [Sookie runs back into the house]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh-huh, sure whatever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [left at the door] Sookie? Hello? Sookie…honey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. Hi, ah! How are you? [as she tries to look into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, I’m fine, how’s that xray vision coming?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson’s inside.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is he doing something dirty?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He’s making me dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! Oh that’s so nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah it is. It really is, it’s sweet. I’m just - do you hear something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Like someone using the wrong size pan to sweat the onions in. [knocks and chuckles]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, nothing like that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ok well maybe I’m hearing things. So hi, how are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine. So I wanted to see -

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Could you peek inside the kitchen for me and tell me if the orange cruse is on the left burner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don’t you just go in there?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah well now I would but Jackson kicked me out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes and he won’t let me back in there and it’s driving me crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well maybe he just wants you to relax, I wouldn’t mind that either actually.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just take a peek for me will you? Tell him you want some water. And here. Take a picture for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Sookie. I am not spying on Jackson.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What if he’s using the wrong spoon in the wrong sauce?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then the world as we know it will end.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I have to go in there.

speaker: JACKSON
words: [bursting through the doors] You stay right where you are.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson you’re being unreasonable.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie when a person offers to make another person dinner because this person happens to be a chef and is always cooking for others, that is what happens to be a nice gesture.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes but -

speaker: JACKSON
words: And when that person accepts the first person’s offer, that means that the first person, the one who offered to cook, would actually be doing the cooking while the other person relaxed, had some wine and stayed out of the kitchen!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I wasn’t cooking, I was suggesting.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well you suggested the ladle right out of my hand four times!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I had to skim the top of the sauce or it would’ve gotten all -

speaker: JACKSON
words: Damn it Sookie, this is supposed to be romantic!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It is!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Stay outta here. I am cooking this meal alone. I am also cleaning up alone.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But you don’t know how to load my dishwasher, I have a system.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I’ll wing it. [goes back into the kitchen]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: There’s a diagram in the pantry - use it. I’m begging you![yells from the doorway]

speaker: JACKSON
words: I’m doing two loads, just because I can!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey try and sit down and relax. It’s nice what he’s doing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know you’re right. It is nice. Ok, alright...I’m sitting, I’m relaxing, I’m focusing on you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Um actually I wanted to ask you a favour.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could I take your car for a little while, Rory’s got mine and there’s something I want to do.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, yeah, yeah of course. What’s so important?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh um, I’ll tell you later.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It sounds serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll have it back to you as soon as I can.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Take your time, I’m in for the night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, bye hon.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye. [sighs. There’s a crash in the kitchen] What happened?! What did you do?
CUT TO MAX’S APARTMENT

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai what...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory and Dean broke up.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, well, I’m sorry. Rory -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, Rory and Dean broke up and um, she won’t wallow. And I told her that she should wallow you know because that’s supposed to help you get through the pain and then you can accept it and then you can get over somebody and you can move on with your life. And then she asked me how long it was before I got over you and I didn’t know what to say you know because I can’t lie to her, and I realized that if I gave her any time frame at all I would be lying because I’m not over you and I don’t know how long it will be before I am. And who am I to be teaching her about healing and moving on and breakups any how. I mean I might as well be teaching her how to eat fire or swallow a sword or put her legs behind her head you know, because at least that’s a trade. I mean the first two are, I don’t know about putting the legs um, behind your head, but the point is that I’m an idiot and I’m a hypocrite and I really miss you.

speaker: MAX
words: Do you want to come in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes please.
CUT TO MADELINE’S HOUSE

speaker: LANE
words: Wow, this is unbelievable. My wedding won’t be this big.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is amazing! People live here?

speaker: RORY
words: This is Madeline’s house.

speaker: LANE
words: Is this what your grandparents house looks like?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I mean it’s big but it’s not this Hearst castlely.

speaker: LANE
words: I mean there should be a map or a tour guide or Robin Leech or something.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for coming with me.

speaker: LANE
words: Anytime. Oh my God, there’s a pool table.

speaker: RORY
words: And a deejay.

speaker: LANE
words: It’s like a teenage Sodom and Gommarah.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You came!

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Who’s watching the farm?

speaker: RORY
words: Madeline you house is beautiful.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Thanks it’s my stepfather’s.

speaker: LOUISE
words: So where is he?

speaker: MADELINE
words: My stepfather? He’s in Japan.

speaker: LOUISE
words: No not your stepfather. Prince Charming?

speaker: RORY
words: He didn’t come.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: His white horse was in the shop.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You guys didn’t break up did you?

speaker: LANE
words: Hi, I’m Lane.

speaker: LOUISE
words: As in ‘walk down a...’?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes exactly.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hi I’m Madeline. [two guys come up and wrap their arms around Louise and Madeline.]

speaker: GUY
words: So when does the tour of the pool house start?

speaker: MADELINE
words: You’ve seen the pool house before.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yes but they haven’t seen it at night right?

speaker: GUY
words: Right.

speaker: MADELINE
words: But -

speaker: LOUISE
words: Madeline, you are not confused. Think. Process. Focus.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh! Bye!

speaker: PARIS
words: No glove no love.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Lovely.

speaker: PARIS
words: So I didn’t think you were much of a party girl.

words: Same exact people we see at school except now we get to see them dance. So where is your boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: We, um, we broke up.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh. Well at least you had a boyfriend for a while.

speaker: RORY
words: So do you know, um, which way would lead us to some soda?

words: Keep up because I’m not turning around.

words: Wow, you didn’t exaggerate.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris needs no embellishments.

speaker: LANE
words: All this soda is French.

speaker: PARIS
words: Madeline’s mother has a French fetish. She’s obsessed with all things French. French wine, French food, French water, French cellulite products.

words: Look why won’t you answer me?

speaker: SUMMER
words: Because you didn’t say ’please’.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Summer.

words: Nothing?

speaker: SUMMER
words: Yup.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No.

speaker: SUMMER
words: Well why don’t you tell me what I was doing since you seem to know everything.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey you are my girlfriend.

speaker: SUMMER
words: Ooh now he’s a caveman. What are you doing to do, know me on the back of my head with a club and then drag me back to your Porsche?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Summer please.

speaker: SUMMER
words: Ooh, good song. [turns around and dances. Tristin looks around the room then leaves.]

speaker: RORY
words: Why do you keep checking your watch?

speaker: RORY
words: Why would she care?

speaker: PARIS
words: She thinks I’m not enough of a people person. Shocking huh?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m floored.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah well, I doubt highly that Madam Curie was voted most likely to dress like Jennifer Lopez.

speaker: RORY
words: You want to be a scientist?

speaker: PARIS
words: Cancer research.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh no.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: It just figures that the only Korean boy at this party has his Korean girl radar turned on.

speaker: HENRY
words: Hi.

speaker: LANE
words: Hi.

speaker: HENRY
words: I’m Henry.

speaker: LANE
words: I’m Lane. This is Rory and Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’ve met.

speaker: HENRY
words: Paris. So would you like to dance?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh well we’re talking here.

speaker: HENRY
words: Oh yeah, but I mean one dance? You can put the conversation on hold for one dance right? Unless this is a mid-east peace talk kind of conversation.

speaker: LANE
words: One dance.

speaker: HENRY
words: A short one. No crazy dance mixes.

speaker: LANE
words: Ok.

speaker: HENRY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LANE
words: [taking off her coat and handing it to Rory whispers] If I’m not back in one dance you’re coming down with a really bad case of anything that means we had to go home.

speaker: RORY
words: Whoa is it getting warm here or is it just me?

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you.

speaker: PARIS
words: Unbelievable! She’s here five minutes she has a date. I’ve been going to this school nine years and I’m the French soda monitor.

[Rory walks around and finds a place to put her and Lane's coats. She walks around the house and sees Tristin leaning again a wall watching Summer dance with some guy. She watches him for a second then moves on.]
CUT TO MAX’S
[Lorelai and Max are kissing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just in case this comes up later, I did not come here for this.

speaker: MAX
words: Ok, go it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

words: No.

words: No?

words: No. I haven’t given it any thought at all.
