speaker: MAX
words: Oh I understand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, with all the thought you’ve been giving it, have you come up with any great solutions?

speaker: MAX
words: No. You’re still Rory’s mom and I’m still her teacher and we’re still us. I got nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: MAX
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So nothing’s changed.

speaker: MAX
words: Nothing’s changed.

speaker: LORELAI

speaker: MAX
words: Probably. [tosses table] Oh screw this. [they stand up and kiss again]
CUT TO MADELINE’S

words: Tristin stop it.

words: No.

words: No. I’m sick of fighting with you. I’m sick of hearing 20 times a day ‘You’re my girlfriend’.

words: I think we should break up.

words: Ok, I really want to go outside and talk about this.

[Lane enters the room]

speaker: LANE
words: I have a major problem.

words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: Henry, the guy I’ve been dancing with?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LANE
words: Ok so he’s really good in school, he’s going to be a doctor - pediatrician to be exact, his parents are extremely involved in their local church. He himself helps out with Sunday school. He speaks Korean fluently, he respects his parents and he’s also really cute, very funny and surprisingly interesting.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane I’m sorry, but I’m totally failing to see the problem here.

speaker: LANE
words: I’m falling for a guy my parents would approve of! They’d love him, they’d go crazy! There’d be dancing in the Kim house! Dancing!

speaker: RORY

words: But uh -

words: Hey.

words: Henry, hi.

words: Thank you.

words: [to Lane] Oh you’re going?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh well -

[Lorelai and Max in bed]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I certainly did not come over here for that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Mystery. [pause] Well this is just ridiculous. Three intelligent women sitting here in complete silence. There must be something to talk about. Do you know that every night at dinner, the Kennedy clan would sit around the table having lively debates about everything under the sun? They would quiz each other about current events, historical facts, intellectual trivia. Now the Gilmore clan is just as smart and worldly as the Kennedy’s so come on - somebody - say something.

speaker: LORELAI

words: God?

words: Lorelai.

words: Lorelai.

words: Oh that I could.

words: What?

words: You’re kidding?

words: When?

words: I’m gonna get to meet my great-grandma?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai I.

speaker: EMILY
words: When?

words: I was named after her.

speaker: RORY
words: I figured.

words: Richard when?

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re going to love her. My mother is brilliant, absolutely brilliant.

words: We share that also.

words: I’m asking a question here, does no one hear me? Am I suddenly invisible?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m sorry. What was the question?

speaker: EMILY
words: When is your mother arriving?

words: A week from today. Rory, I’m telling you, it’s going to be such a treat.

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I still can’t get over that I’m related to God. It’s gonna make getting Madonna tickets so much easier.
[Pan to basement]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom? Mom?

words: It’s just like that woman, no warnings, no discussions, then out of the blue ‘I’m coming next week’.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

words: I have to unpack these things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What things? Excuse me boys [to statue of two dogs]

speaker: EMILY

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoa! Stupid naked angel butts? What did David Manic just stop by.

speaker: EMILY
words: Leave please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom calm down.

words: I can’t calm down! That lamp shade is missing, the china is cracked and I can’t remember which table it is that she gave us for our 10 year anniversary!!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mother, Grandma is a very old woman, I highly doubt that she’s going to remember everything she ever bought you.

speaker: EMILY
words: She will remember down to the very last shrimp fork and do you know why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. [to dogs] Do you guys know why?

speaker: EMILY
words: Because she doesn’t just give you a present, she ‘gives’ you a present and she tells you where to put it, how to use it, what it costs - for insurance purposes of course - and God forbid you should have a different opinion or you don’t think it works in the space or you just get tired of waking up every morning with those horrifying animals staring at you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to dogs] She’s just upset.

speaker: EMILY
words: Stop talking to the dogs!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom! You’re freaking out. I’ve never seen you freak out before.

words: No! [sighs] Please.

speaker: RORY
words: So tell me more about her.

words: Well you know more than I do.

words: Well let’s see. She moved to London when Grandpa died but she didn’t like to travel so once a year Mom and Dad would go to visit her, usually leaving me behind, much to my relief by the way, and that’s it. The rest I know from stories just like you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is the biggest compliment that can be wrenched out of Grumpy McFarlen believe me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’ll love you.
CUT TO CHILTON
[Paris, Madeline, Louise, Tristin, Rory and two other guys sitting in a circle working]

speaker: PARIS
words: I think that the basic structure of the Elizabethan government is relatively sound. The division of power between the monarchy, the privy council and the parliament all seem to work. Agreed?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Agreed.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ditto.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, so in establishing our own government, I think duplicating a similar structure would be good, with a few alterations. Queen Elizabeth chose to remain unwed. She took on the burden of leadership all by herself at a time when possibly marrying the Prince of France or the King of Spain would solidify her thrown while expanding her empire. And though it obviously worked for her, and the concept of a woman ruling without man is certainly politically correct these days, I think we need to take a different tact. [in the background while Louise and Madeline talk] I think we need to devise a nation with a truly solidified royal alliance...

speaker: MADELINE
words: [over Paris] She does know this is a make belief government right?

speaker: LOUISE
words: [over Paris] You ask her, I’m afraid.

speaker: PARIS
words: [in foreground] So in addition to the different political branches, we’ll also need a King and Queen. Rory, Tristin, what about you?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Us?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, no.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Because..

speaker: RORY
words: I just don’t want to be queen.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Me either [pause] King - I don’t want to be king.

speaker: RORY
words: What about you? You be queen.

speaker: PARIS
words: I’m going to be head of Parliament. I can’t be queen.

speaker: RORY
words: Be both.

speaker: PARIS
words: I can’t be both.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not? It’s our government.

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s not done that way.

speaker: RORY
words: It can be though, let’s vote.

speaker: PARIS
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Henry VIII started a new church when the old one wouldn’t allow divorce.

speaker: PARIS
words: He also cut off his wife’s head. Is he still your role model?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m just saying we have the opportunity to make any kind of government we want here.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why won’t you be queen?

speaker: MADELINE
words: I’ll be queen.

speaker: RORY
words: There, make Madeline queen.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine, you’re queen, Tristin’s king.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I’ll be the lady-in-waiting. The one with the low-cut blue velvet renaissance dress.

speaker: PARIS
words: Lady-in-waiting is not a political office.

speaker: LOUISE
words: No but they get all the sex.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Watch a movie.

speaker: PARIS
words: We are talking about government class not the movies. God why can’t I get one person to care about this as much as I do?!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ok fine. I’ll be the head of the Quarter Sessions court, but I’m still wearing the dress. Happy?

speaker: PARIS
words: Out of my mind. Ok, so, I secured us the class room to work tomorrow and Sunday so that by Monday we’ll be ready.

speaker: MADELINE
words: We’re working all weekend?

speaker: LOUISE
words: You’re kidding. [Bell rings]

speaker: PARIS
words: 00 in the morning, don’t be late.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow, she designed the flag.

speaker: PARIS
words: [in the hallway] Question.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok.

speaker: PARIS
words: What’s up with you and Tristin?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: PARIS
words: You just seem weird around each other.

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, no weirder than usual.

speaker: PARIS
words: I disagree.

speaker: RORY
words: You usually do.

speaker: PARIS
words: I just think it’s strange that you don’t wanna be queen.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, not all girls want to be queen Paris. Even Barbie ended up being a stewardess.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, if you say so. Read my manifesto, I want your thoughts.

speaker: RORY
words: First thought - lose the word ‘manifesto’.

speaker: PARIS
words: Too cabin-in-the-woods?

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t open your mail.

speaker: PARIS
words: Right. How about doctrine?

speaker: RORY
words: Better.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, see you tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. [realizes she left her notebook and heads back to the classroom. She runs into Tristin]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh...you left this [handing her her notebook.]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah I did. Thanks.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Sure. [both try to go through the doorway together and backup]

speaker: RORY
words: Well, that could have been a potential Marx Brothers moment.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You go first.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. [starts to exit but then turns back] I think we need to talk.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: About what?

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin you know about what?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No I don’t.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, we have a lot of work ahead of us. We also have about two and a half years of being in the same school. I don’t want things to be weird between us. Don’t you think it’d be good to at least try to talk about this?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Good. [They both try to go through the doorway at the same time again] I’m gonna go first.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Right [chuckles]
CUT TO INN

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! It’s still not working.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well you did something wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t do anything wrong. I did the same thing I always do when I’m pulling up reservations for the upcoming month but nothing happened.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You typed in the name?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I typed in the name.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You clicked on the April 5?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I clicked on the April 5.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You double clicked on confirmation?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I double clicked.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I double clicked.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You clicked twice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I double clicked but I didn’t click twice.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Because to successfully double click you must click twice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know what double click is.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well apparently you do not or we wouldn’t be having this conversation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I’m going to pinch you so hard right now.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well I don’t know what you have done!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well - ah! [as Michel pushes her out of the way]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well I can’t fix it if you don’t move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I double clicked. [as Michel starts to type] Ooh, what’s that?

speaker: MICHEL
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That flashy red thing [speaks at the same time as Michel] with an ‘x’ through it.

speaker: MICHEL
words: [speaks at the same time as Lorelai] I do not know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, it happened when you pushed something funky.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I pushed nothing ‘funky’.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have the funk my friend. [phone rings] Independence Inn.

speaker: EMILY
words: I need the hat rack.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] The fish flies at night.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, who is this?

speaker: EMILY
words: This is your mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well hi Mom, I didn’t recognize your voice.

speaker: EMILY
words: I need the hat rack back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What hat rack?

speaker: EMILY
words: The hat rack I gave you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What hat rack?

speaker: EMILY
words: The hat rack I gave you for Christmas five years ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well...

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s large, bronze with dragons or weasels - I don’t know, some sort of lizard type animal that you hang your coats on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, yes, I remember it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank God. I need it back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You need a Christmas present back?

speaker: EMILY
words: Temporarily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: I need it back because Richard’s mother gave it to us and she’ll notice if it’s not there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You gave me a used present?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, we never used it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t believe it.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’ll get it back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You gave me a second hand present, like something you got at the junk store.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re being a little dramatic. It was still in the crate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You actually went ‘Huh, what should I get Lorelai this year. You know what, I can’t be bothered. Let’s give her something we don’t want anymore.’

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re not funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What would Miss Manners say about this?

speaker: EMILY
words: If she met your grandmother she’d understand. Now please, just bring the rack with you when you come tonight ok?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighing] Ok, sure.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. Bye.
CUT TO OUTSIDE CHILTON

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [sighs] So we’re supposed to talk.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Look about the other night.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Look, I was upset over Summer.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes and I was upset over Dean.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So, then it doesn’t mean anything right?

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So then - right, so then that’s it. We just chalk it up to a bad night.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok. I’m sorry I cried.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No problem.

speaker: RORY
words: I swear it had nothing to do with the kiss.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I kissed you, you cried. That had to do something with the kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I cried because I was confused. Because I hadn’t cried. I didn’t cry because of the kiss. It was a nice kiss.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Very nice. Not at all crying material.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Absolutely.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Wanna try it again?

speaker: RORY
words: Well I think someone’s recovering from their heartbreak just fine.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah I’m all better. [small pause] I think I’m going to swear off girls for a while.

speaker: RORY
words: Ha!

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, sorry, nothing. You said you were going to swear off girls - it’s funny.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You don’t think I can?

speaker: RORY
words: No I think you can, I just think it would be hard for you. It’d probably involve some kind of lock up facility, one of those Hannibal Lector masks.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Ok yes, it would be hard but not impossible.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe it’s not so much swearing off all girls but swearing off a certain kind of girl.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Meaning?

speaker: RORY
words: Meaning next time maybe you should pick a girl with a little more substance. You know, a girl who’s smart and is driven and has ambition. You know like Paris.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Are you serious?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah why not? Paris is smart and cute and interesting and yes she does bring her own unique set of baggage into the mix.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: A matching set.

speaker: RORY
words: But she likes you. She’s crazy about you. She thinks you’re amazing.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You want me to date Paris?

speaker: RORY
words: Just think about it.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [exhales loudly] Me and Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: Louis, I think this is the beginning of a wonderful friendship.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Who’s Louis?

speaker: RORY
words: Just think. [leaves]
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Come on, let’s go.

speaker: RORY
words: Relax, I’m almost ready.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’re gonna be late.

speaker: RORY
words: No we’re not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it’s Friday night and traffic’s bad on Friday night.

speaker: RORY
words: Since when?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Since the beginning of time. Here let me do that. [puts on necklace for Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: What’s up with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve been ready and bugging me for almost an hour. Usually I have to drag you out of here kicking and screaming to go to dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now then.

speaker: RORY
words: You whine, you complain, you act like a child.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do not.

speaker: RORY
words: I had to pay you five bucks once so you wouldn’t go in sweats.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make your point and make it fast, as we move quickly to the front door.

speaker: RORY
words: My point is that you are mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not mean.

speaker: RORY
words: You are. You want to go to dinner to see Grandma uncomfortable, that’s mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, ok, look. I will admit, I work very hard and sometimes I am a little tired come Friday night for the Gilmore family dinner. But I had a light day today and my grandmother who I have not seen for years is going to be there.

speaker: RORY
words: And it has nothing to do with the fact that Grandma hates Great-grandma?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not at all.

speaker: RORY
words: And when you see Grandma miserable and uncomfortable you’re going to be sad and sympathetic?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not at all.

speaker: RORY
words: Mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m kidding.

speaker: RORY
words: I want you to be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: And no outward reveling in someone else’s pain.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I promise, internal reveling only.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok then, we can go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok good. Oh wait [grabs a camera] So the internal reveling can continue for years to come.

speaker: RORY
words: Mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha!
CUT TO INSIDE CAR
[Lorelai starts to laugh to herself.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mean, mean, mean.
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory are carrying the hat rack]

speaker: RORY
words: God, this thing weighs like a 1000 pounds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I know. Here, put down.

speaker: RORY
words: What are we doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, in case Gran comes to the door you know.

speaker: RORY
words: Good thinking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean she’s 80. The eyes have got to be gone right?

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s just try to keep her inside the house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good thinking [knocks]

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you have it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We got it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hurry up, bring it in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah!

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: Ok, quiet, be quiet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok mom, thanks for the direction and all but, um, we need some help.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh yeah sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Rory] Careful honey.

speaker: EMILY
words: Watch it, watch your head. Get it over here. Ok yes, yeah I think that was about - no I think it was maybe a little more on the left. Oh God I should have put tape down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, you don’t think that the coat rack could’ve moved a quarter of an inch in five years?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yeah you’re right. That’s it. Ok, put your coats on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How’d you get her in here without her noticing it wasn’t there?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I brought her in through the back way then I had Stella wax the floors, also she napped so that took up about an hour.

speaker: RORY
words: Where is she now?

speaker: EMILY
words: In the living room scratching the diamond pendant I bought her against a mirror.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we shouldn’t keep her waiting huh?

speaker: EMILY
words: No you’re right, we shouldn’t. Oh, heaven help me! [they head for the living room. Lorelai chuckles.]

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: EMILY
words: Mom, look who’s here?

speaker: TRIX
words: Who?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, look.

speaker: TRIX
words: If I wanted to look, I would look. I haven’t looked therefore you must draw your own conclusions. Ah, thank you, dear boy. [Grandpa gives her a drink]

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re welcome Trix.

speaker: RORY
words: Trix?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad’s pet name for Gran.

speaker: EMILY
words: Isn’t it just darling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Gran.

speaker: TRIX
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it’s so good to see you again.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Trix, this is Rory. You haven’t met her yet.

speaker: TRIX
words: No, I don’t believe I have.

speaker: RORY
words: Hello.

speaker: TRIX
words: Come. I want to get a very good look at both of you. They’re tall.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well yes they are.

speaker: TRIX
words: How’s your health?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good.

speaker: RORY
words: Very healthy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm-hmm.

speaker: TRIX
words: Good. That means that the majority of your blood is Gilmore blood. Gilmore’s don’t get sick. Am I right Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh we wouldn’t dare Trix.

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s right. Your mother is always sick.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m hardly always sick.

speaker: TRIX
words: You’re sick right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sick now Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Headache.

speaker: TRIX
words: Gilmore’s don’t have headaches, our heads are perfect. You don’t drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well...

speaker: TRIX
words: Emily, get this woman a drink.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh I’ll do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh thanks Dad. White wine.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m going to go get the hors d’ouevres.

speaker: TRIX
words: So you’re Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes ma’am.

speaker: TRIX
words: My son speaks of you constantly. He seems very fond of you.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh well I’m very fond of him too.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This little girl is as smart as a whip Mom. I think she has a great deal of you in her.

speaker: TRIX
words: Really?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm-hmm.

speaker: TRIX
words: How nice. [Grandma enters with a tray of cheese] Is this cheese?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: TRIX
words: Am I supposed to eat that cheese?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well only if you like.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, where are those spiced nuts that Trix likes so much?

speaker: EMILY
words: I’ll get some.

speaker: TRIX
words: So Lorelai, since I’ve seen you last, you’ve grown up, gotten pregnant out of wedlock, raised a child and still haven’t bothered to get married. Have I left anything out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well sometime in between growing up and getting pregnant, I got my ears pierced.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’ve always hated a scandal. However I’ve always appreciated self-sufficiency. Tell me, how do you support this child?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I run an inn.

speaker: TRIX
words: Hard work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is.

speaker: TRIX
words: Good. Hard work is good for a woman - makes her stronger. I admire people who enjoy hard work.

speaker: EMILY
words: Here we go, spiced nuts.

speaker: TRIX
words: Thank you Emily. I suppose I can just put these nuts in my hand.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Gran, um, when was the last time I saw you?

speaker: TRIX
words: You were still in your teens, wild hair flying everywhere. I see you’ve taken care of that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I joined a support group, bought a hair brush and just taking it one day at a time.

speaker: TRIX
words: That was a joke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is.

speaker: TRIX
words: Very good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: I have dishes and napkins.

speaker: TRIX
words: Good for you. Richard, I would like to be escorted into the dining room now.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Your wish is my command.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, uh, I’m not sure that dinner is ready just yet.

speaker: EMILY
words: But it’s only five after Mom.

speaker: TRIX
words: Only five after? Richard, in the even that I am kidnapped and a ransom is demanded at a certain time, I would prefer that Emily not be in charge of the drop off. [Lorelai and Rory get up and follow. Lorelai gives Emily a ‘what can you do’ shoulder shrug]
[Pan to later that evening.]

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, this dinner’s delicious.

speaker: TRIX
words: Very good young lady, well all believe you. Now, let’s talk about your education. Where are you attending school?

speaker: RORY
words: Chilton.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory is in the top ten percent of her class.

speaker: EMILY
words: We’re very proud of our Rory. She’s going to Harvard.

speaker: TRIX
words: Harvard?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes ma’am.

speaker: TRIX
words: Richard, how can you allow this girl to go to Harvard?!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now Trix -

speaker: TRIX
words: You’re a Yale man, your father was a Yale man!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well we want Rory to be whatever kind of man she wants to be.

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s enough jokes for this evening Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: TRIX
words: Now if you don’t mind my asking, Chilton is rather an expensive institution, I’m curious how the manager of an inn can afford such a luxury?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah well...

speaker: EMILY
words: We’re helping Lorelai out a little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, we’ve seen to it that Rory’s education is taken care of.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it’s temporary. It’s a loan. I plan to pay them back every cent. They know this.

speaker: TRIX
words: That’s it, I’m done. Richard. Tomorrow, Rory, I shall plan the menu. When you’ve lived in Europe you learn a thing or two about food.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I can’t. I’m studying tomorrow. I’m in a study group and our presentation is due on Monday

speaker: TRIX
words: Oh very well, your mother can tell you all about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will, I promise.

speaker: EMILY
words: Won’t you have dessert?

speaker: TRIX
words: I once traveled to a small village in Cambodia, I did not eat dessert there either.
CUT TO CHILTON
[Louise is laying across several desks with her eyes closed]

speaker: LOUISE
words: What time is it?

speaker: MADELINE
words: It’s almost nine. Hey maybe I’ll own a magazine some day. Then I’ll get all my nail polish for free.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I’m going back to sleep. Tell Paris I hate her.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Ok.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hi.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hey Paris. Louise hates you.

speaker: PARIS
words: You’ll thank me when you get into Sarah Lawrence.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Wanna bet?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow, did you bring coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: And doughnuts in the shape of clowns.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hey they’ve got hats.

speaker: RORY
words: Well a clown just isn’t a clown without a hat. [to Paris] Here is your decaf with soy milk.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re welcome. So I read your doctrine and I thing our imaginary kingdom is off to a pretty good start.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I mean the taxes are a little high and the landowner’s power should be regulated a little more.

speaker: PARIS
words: It was a different time back then.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah but the fundamental human needs were the same.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’re supposed to set it up within -

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ding, ding, ding. No debating until I’ve had coffee.

speaker: MADELINE
words: And a clown.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Ladies.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hi Tristin.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Paris, can I talk to you for a sec?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, sure ok.

speaker: LOUISE
words: And that is about what pray tell?

speaker: MADELINE
words: I don’t know. The project - maybe?

speaker: LOUISE
words: They could’ve talked project here. It’s something else. Something private.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Scandal.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Maybe. Though it is Paris.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Scandal lite.

speaker: LOUISE
words: All the taste, but much fewer calories.

speaker: MADELINE
words: We could spy.

speaker: RORY
words: Or we could wait for her to come back in to see if she wants us to know.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Those who simply wait for information to find them, spend a lot of time sitting by the phone. Those who go out and find it themselves, have something to say when it rings.

speaker: RORY
words: Nietzsche?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Dawson.

speaker: RORY
words: My next guess. [Paris comes back in.]

speaker: LOUISE
words: So, what was with the confab in the hallway?

speaker: MADELINE
words: We’re dying here.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, Tristin, he...asked me out.

speaker: MADELINE
words: No!!

speaker: LOUISE
words: My, my, my.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow, this is amazing. God I’m jealous.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Details please. Don’t leave out anything. We want every comma, apostrophe and ampersand.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well he just asked me out.

speaker: MADELINE
words: When?

speaker: PARIS
words: Tonight.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hmm.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Nothing.

speaker: PARIS
words: No, you ‘hmm’ed. Why did you ‘hmm’?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Forget it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Louise tell me why you ‘hmm’ed.

speaker: LOUISE
words: He asked you out for tonight.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Less than 24 hours notice.

speaker: PARIS
words: So? What does that mean?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Usually that someone else cancelled.

speaker: RORY
words: Or maybe he just got up the nerve to ask her out.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Maybe.

speaker: LOUISE
words: This is so amazing. I mean you are so far from Tristin’s type.

speaker: MADELINE
words: So, so far.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Tristin usually likes his girls bad.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Looks like we’re going to have to do the Pink Ladies makeover on you.

speaker: LOUISE
words: We’ll turn you from a sweet Sandy to a sluty Sandy. Dancing at the school fair with high heels, black spandex and permed hair.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You can borrow my water bra.

speaker: PARIS
words: Excuse me?

speaker: MADELINE
words: My water bra. It’s like a padded bra but it’s filled with some sort of liquid so it moves.

speaker: PARIS
words: It moves?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Yeah.

speaker: PARIS
words: On it’s own?

speaker: MADELINE
words: It makes you look natural.

speaker: PARIS
words: Great. Thanks, but I’ll pass. Everyone come on, let’s get to work.

speaker: RORY
words: I think you’re gonna have a really good time.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah well, it’s just a date right?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, right.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, focus people.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want one? [point at the clowns]
CUT TO GILMORE HOUSE

speaker: LORELAI
words: [running into the house and upstairs] Hi! Five minute talking break while I change. [upstairs] My day - big leak third floor, lots of things going squish that should not be squishing. Michel is not help. And now I’m late for dinner which by the way I’m completely bummed you’re not coming to - [holding up shirts] which one - blue, black, good, bad?

speaker: RORY
words: Black.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok. Are you sure you can’t come?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah I’m sure. If I’m not prepared tomorrow, Paris is gonna have me sent to the Tower. Although if things go well tonight, I bet it’ll help tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, she’s going out on a date with Tristin.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How’d that happen?

speaker: RORY
words: I did a little matchmaking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [in Ricki Ricardo voice] Lucy, how many times have I told you not to butt into there people’s business?

speaker: RORY
words: Never.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [normal voice] Good going.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alright, well I want details tomorrow now how do I look?

speaker: RORY
words: Beautiful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs] Ok. My five minutes are up. [grabbing shoes] Let’s go. [going downstairs] There is money on the kitchen table and there’s really good chocolate cake that I took out and defrosted for you specially this morning and call me if you need me and I’ll be home early and what else?

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t be mean to Grandma.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah broken record. Ok, I’m gone.

speaker: RORY
words: Be good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
[Pan to later, Rory studying and eating cake. Knock]

speaker: PARIS
words: [holding clothes] I don’t know what to wear.

speaker: RORY
words: Ever?

speaker: PARIS
words: On my date with Tristin. I’m not trendy girl ok? I don’t haunt the boutiques hoping to find that one fabulous little top. I study and then I think about studying and then I study some more.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want to come in?

speaker: PARIS
words: I only have one lipstick at home ok? And it’s barely even a color. You put it on and it looks like you’re not wearing anything which is why I liked it in the first place. But to date you need the fabulous little top and you need a lipstick that you can actually tell you’re wearing.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want to put that stuff down?

speaker: PARIS
words: You said once that if I ever needed to talk to anymore I could come talk to you.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I did.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well here I am.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, can I ask you a question?

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok.

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn’t you go to Madeline or Louise about this? I mean they seem to get that ‘fabulous little top’ thing.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh yeah that they get. The whole supportive ‘You’re going to be fine and not throw up 12 times on the way to his car’ thing - that they don’t get.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, let’s just see what you got.

speaker: PARIS
words: I brought everything just in case there was some sort of hidden potential in something that I just didn’t see. So?

speaker: RORY
words: Well you’d be one well dressed widow.

speaker: PARIS
words: Forget it. I’m not going.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you are. Come on now. This is your entire wardrobe?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing’s left at home.

speaker: PARIS
words: Nothing but my Chilton uniform and my bat mitzvah dress which has menorahs on the collar.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok let’s think. Come on. [going upstairs]

speaker: PARIS
words: Where are you going?

speaker: RORY
words: to our one stop shopping store.
[Upstairs in Lorelai’s room.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Is this your mother’s room?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: PARIS
words: I can’t wear your mother’s clothes.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you can, I do it all the time. What about this? [holding up pink blouse]

speaker: PARIS
words: My mother says the color pink makes my head look small.

speaker: RORY
words: Ok, no pink.

speaker: PARIS
words: This whole thing is so insane.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: PARIS
words: Tristin asking me out? Why would he do that?

speaker: RORY
words: Why would he not do that?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because he’s gorgeous and experienced and only dates those most likely to become a trophy wife.

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin would be lucky to go out with someone like you. He’s not going to have to read the menu to you or explain that the dancing trash bins in the movie theatre previews aren’t real. It’s going to be much less stressful.

speaker: PARIS
words: All these years I’ve hoped this would happen and now it has and I feel...I don’t know. I don’t have a lot of experience in the dating department. I mean if you can’t put it on your transcript what’s the point right?

speaker: RORY
words: I know. Before Dean I’d never had a boyfriend. Or a kiss.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: I never even thought about dating.

speaker: PARIS
words: Then you met Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. And he was so special and nice and made me completely nauseous.

speaker: PARIS
words: The best ones do.

speaker: RORY
words: I couldn’t even talk around him.

speaker: PARIS
words: I saw you at the dance. You didn’t seem to have any trouble talking. Or gazing annoyingly into each others eyes.

speaker: RORY
words: But that was after we’d been dating a little. After we started going out and spending time together, I don’t know, it just kind of got easier. And then by the third date everything was perfect.

speaker: PARIS
words: Do you miss him a lot?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, a lot, a lot.

speaker: PARIS
words: Sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. But tonight is not about me. Tonight is about you going out with Tristin in this outfit. What do you think?

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s ok. [Rory gives her a look] It’s great.

speaker: RORY
words: Put it on.

speaker: PARIS
words: Are you sure?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Bathroom’s down the hall and I’ll get you a lipstick with some actual color in it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok. [throws her jacket on the bed and note cards fall out of it.]

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, Paris. What are these cards that fell out of your jacket?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh yeah. Those are notes for tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Notes?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah. Just some reference points really - you know subjects to bring up in case the conversation lags.

speaker: RORY
words: Well can I suggest that you leave this one about the Spanish Inquisition out?

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s not very romantic?

speaker: RORY
words: Not really.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, I’m dressed.

speaker: RORY
words: How’s it look?

speaker: PARIS
words: Bad.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I don’t really trust your opinion on that subject so come out here please.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine but it looks bad. [opens bathroom door]

speaker: RORY
words: You look great!

speaker: PARIS
words: I feel weird.

speaker: RORY
words: Well then weird works for you because you look amazing.

speaker: PARIS
words: Really? You’re not just saying that?

speaker: RORY
words: I swear to God.

speaker: PARIS
words: Are you atheist?

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: PARIS
words: Because that affects the validity of your swearing to God.

speaker: RORY
words: You look great. And I wouldn’t tell you you did if you didn’t.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ok, well if you think it looks ok.

speaker: RORY
words: I believe the word ‘amazing’ was used.

speaker: PARIS
words: Then I’ll wear it. Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: Anytime.

speaker: PARIS
words: I have to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Lipstick.

speaker: PARIS
words: You’re going to hold this evening over my head for the rest of my life aren’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: Probably.

speaker: PARIS
words: Bye.
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE

speaker: TRIX
words: What did you think about the rabbit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I thought it was wonderful.

speaker: TRIX
words: You know I brought it with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: TRIX
words: From London. London has the best game.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You brought it with you from London?

speaker: TRIX
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, did you get it a seat?

speaker: EMILY
words: Dry ice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! That’s inventive.

speaker: TRIX
words: Well it looks like we’re finished here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Let’s retire to the living room for a brandy.

speaker: TRIX
words: Yes. Lorelai, walk with me. I have something that I want to discuss with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’ve been thinking about something I heard the other night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What was that?

speaker: TRIX
words: That you borrowed money from your parents for Rory’s school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well if you’re worried about them getting the money back -

speaker: TRIX
words: You know Shakespeare once wrote ‘Neither a borrower nor a lender be’. Do you consider Shakespeare a wise man?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, sure, yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: We certainly don’t mind loaning Lorelai the money if that’s what you’re worried about.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Certainly not. Rory is first priority in this house.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’m not concerned about whether you mind or not. Loaning money is a dirty business. It’s distasteful and I don’t care for it. As you know, I came into town to check up on the family investments and to talk with our lawyers. I have some things to put in order, and one of them is setting up a trust fund for Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wh - that’s amazing. Really?

speaker: TRIX
words: Now normally I would set up a fund that she would have access to when she’s 25. However, considering the situation, if you like, I will arrange for her to get it now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now?!

speaker: EMILY
words: Now?!

speaker: TRIX
words: That way she can use it to pay for Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Gran, I don’t know what to say, that is so generous of you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: My mother is a very special woman isn’t she?

speaker: TRIX
words: You talk about me like I’m dead.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh you’re never going to die! You’re too stubborn!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gran this is - I don’t know what to say.

speaker: TRIX
words: Nothing now would be preferable. I have arranged for you and your mother and I to have tea tomorrow before I leave. Say it then. Good night Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good night.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I’ll just uh, walk mother upstairs and be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! That was quite a bomb she just dropped.

speaker: EMILY
words: It certainly was.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God! Um, I guess I should be going. Thanks for dinner Mom. I’ll see you tomorrow. [leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai...[follows her to foyer] You’re not honestly considering accepting that money are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um yeah, of course I’m considering it.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t think that’s very wise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: EMILY
words: Because she’s a young girl. She won’t know the first thing about managing that money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, I’ll help her.

speaker: EMILY
words: You don’t know the first thing about managing that money either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but I’ve very familiar with the second thing.

speaker: EMILY
words: How can you not see the pitfalls in accepting that money?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean you’re the one that brags about how special your relationship with Rory is. I’m stunned that you want to jeopardize it like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you know as well as I do that money is freedom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And?

speaker: EMILY
words: If Rory has that money she won’t need you anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know Mom, she’s 16. There’s still a couple of ways I might come in handy, you know buying the beer that kind of stuff.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m glad you thing losing your daughter is so funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: She’ll be self sufficient, she won’t need you to pay for anything, she won’t have to turn to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Everything in a relationship isn’t about money mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: She’ll move out as soon as she can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what.

speaker: EMILY
words: She won’t need your help to put her through college, she won’t need you to buy a car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok you know what? Say goodbye to Dad for me as soon as the voices in your head subside.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why should she wait to backpack around Europe with you? She could afford to go herself. And she could take a friend or a boyfriend or anyone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah well she wants to go with me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well now of course she does she doesn’t have options. But the minute you give her options...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, that’s it. You’re nuts and I’m going - in that order. [leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s terrible not to be needed. You’ll see!

[Pan to Gilmore house, Lorelai walks in and goes into Rory’s room to find her asleep. She takes away the books from Rory and covers her. She holds up a Harvard brochure and we see Rory’s room has posters of places from Europe up.]
CUT TO STREET
[Sookie and Lorelai at flower shop]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That is amazing!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. One minute it’s ‘pass the pot roast’ the next minute it’s ‘hey, here’s have a pile of money’. Things are never boring at the Gilmore house.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What did Rory say when you told her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I haven’t told her yet.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?!

speaker: LORELAI
words: She was asleep when I got home.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi, for that much money you wake her up! You hire a singing telegram! Women jump out of cakes! People dress up like bankers and dance around with those toasters!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well she’s been working her butt off all week on this Chilton paper, so I let her sleep and I’ll tell her tonight.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Call her now. Ooh, page her, or page her and have her call my cell phone and we can sing the money song from ‘Cabaret’. You be Liza, I’ll be Joel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey I’m Joel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t want to bother her while she’s at school. I can never decide, carnations tacky or trendy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You don’t want to tell her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah I do. I think.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh well I understand the hesitation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Absolutely. I mean who wants to be the bearer of good news. All that hugging and happiness - nightmare.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was, I was thrilled when Gran told me about it and I was going to tell Rory about it right away.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My mother...

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ...cornered me by the door saying all this stuff about how when Rory gets the money she’s not going to need me and she’s gonna move out of the house sooner.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What? That’s crazy!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know it is, it’s crazy and yet...

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey come on. The woman’s just trying to mess with your mind, you know that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She just doesn’t want to lose control of you. She wants you to be permanently obligated to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I know that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So then what? You don’t believe what she said do you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. I mean you’re right - what you’re saying about she wants to mess with my mind and make me feel obligated but I mean, what if the money does change our relationship?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Impossible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well anything’s possible.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I couldn’t stand that. I like things the way they are now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lorelai, this is Rory we’re talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She’s like the most unmaterialistic kid in the world.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not it’s not about what she would buy. I don’t care if she buys a house or a boat or the elephant man’s bones. It’s just that - you know, it’s about the freedom. I mean if I had access to all that money as a kid I would have left the house so fast.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Faster than 17?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I mean - God I know this is crazy. I have my mother’s voice stuck in my head. It’s like that annoying Cranberries song. I hate that I let her do this! I have that I let her get to me!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well then don’t let her. Call Rory and tell her about the money and you’ll see that nothing will be any different.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t want her to go to Europe without me. That was going to be our thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She’s not going to go without you. I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey - [looks at Sookie’s watch] Aw! No! I’ve got to go home.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why? What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have to change and go to tea with Gran and the cast of ‘Gaslight’.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow, I’ll see you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
CUT TO GRANDMA’S HOUSE

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re hysterical, I can’t talk to you when you’re hysterical.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well you make me hysterical.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am tired of fighting about this.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to got to get her to take that offer back.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard Gilmore I have put up with a lot from this woman over the years...

speaker: RICHARD
words: Keep your voice down.

speaker: EMILY
words: But this time she’s gone too far!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily please.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can go louder!

speaker: RICHARD
words: If I do as you ask, I’ll be insulting my mother. I will not do that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now you listen to me. I don’t care if she demeans me and looks down on me. I don’t care if she thinks I’ve tarnished the Gilmore name. I don’t care if she thinks I’m the whore of Babylon. I’ve long ago given up any hope of getting into her psychotic good graces, but that woman is horrible and selfish. And she’s not going to get away with it. I won’t let her.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is my mother you’re talking about.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes it is. Your mother, the one who stepped in without being asked and single-handedly wrecked everything!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, what is this about?

speaker: EMILY
words: She’ll never come back here you know.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Who? Mother, of course she will she -

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: If she gets that money, Lorelai will never come back here. She won’t have to.

speaker: TRIX
words: I’ve ordered a car, women shouldn’t drive. Are you ready? [heads for the door]

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes I’m ready. [looks at Richard]

speaker: TRIX
words: I shall die soon you know!
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory sitting outside classroom]

speaker: PARIS
words: Well aren’t we early. Trying to suck up to Parliament?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey how’d it go last night?

speaker: PARIS
words: It went.

speaker: RORY
words: It went well?

speaker: PARIS
words: Well he picked me up. We went to dinner and a movie. I didn’t use my note cards once and he kissed me good night.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris I’m so glad!

speaker: PARIS
words: It was a great kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: See? All that nervousness for nothing.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah. God this is so weird. I can’t stop smiling.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, then it’s a good time to talk about our over taxed peasants.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh let them eat cake.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [walking by them] Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t look at me. I didn’t kiss you.
[Paris follows him in.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Hi.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey.

speaker: PARIS
words: I just wanted to tell you again that I had so much fun last night.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, after five messages on my answering machine, I kinda got that impression.

speaker: PARIS
words: Too much, sorry.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: No forget it, it was cute.

speaker: PARIS
words: You know, maybe we could do it again sometime. I mean a different movie of course but the same basic plan.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Absolutely.

speaker: PARIS
words: Great, because it was really fun.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: It was fun and we should do it again. I mean you know - as friends.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, yeah as friends. [disappointed]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You noticed it too right? That we’re sort of more friends material than dating material?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes I did notice. I have excellent deductive skills.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: But hey, I’m glad we did it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh sure.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: When Rory first suggested us going out I thought the idea was crazy but she made some good points. We do have some history and well, you never know right?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes you never know. Ok, so we’re done here right?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh sure.

speaker: PARIS
words: Great. Excuse me. [walks over to Rory who just entered classroom]

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: It was your idea?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: So what, I get all your cast offs now?! I’m just that pathetic?! ‘Jee I don’t want them so maybe I can con the suckers into taking out Paris the loser’! Throw the dog a bone!

speaker: RORY
words: Ok let me -

speaker: PARIS
words: I am not your charity case!

speaker: RORY
words: No it’s not like that, I swear. I just thought you guys would make a good couple that’s all.

speaker: PARIS
words: We did make a good couple - for one night! But obviously we’re more suited to just being friends or at least that was what was conveyed so humiliatingly to me just five seconds ago.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, I’m sorry -

speaker: PARIS
words: I hate you! [storms out and Madeline and Louise who came in and caught the tail end follow her]

speaker: RORY
words: [goes up to Tristin] You told her?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I didn’t know it was a secret.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you tell her? What is wrong with you?!

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Rory relax, we tried ok, it didn’t work out, it’s not big deal.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s a huge deal to Paris and you didn’t try. One date isn’t trying.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Rory -

speaker: RORY
words: You said you’d try.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey, I’m sorry Paris is upset ok? But is it better that I keep dating her even thought I like somebody else?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn’t realize. So...you’re still not over Summer huh?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [semi-sarcastically] Yeah, I’m not over Summer yet. [leaves, Rory looks confused or feels bad for him]
CUT TO TEA

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where’s Gran?

speaker: EMILY
words: Torturing the bathroom attendant I suppose.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah. So um, this place seems clean.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, it’s famous for it’s cleanliness. So what did Rory say when you told her? About the money I mean. She must have been very excited.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes she was. Rose tea. That’s funny. That’s not really tea is it? It’s like rose petals in hot water. More like a bad floral arrangement.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well what did Rory say, fill me in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She was happy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Happy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah - she screamed she did that air-lasso thing over her head.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai be serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She was asleep when I got home Mom so I couldn’t tell her.

speaker: EMILY
words: She doesn’t know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well...something I said must’ve really struck a chord with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: EMILY
words: You didn’t tell her so you must have had a reason.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah she was asleep Mom, I just told you that.

speaker: EMILY
words: The only thing I can think of is that you must have reconsidered based on our conversation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t reconsider.

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean yesterday you could hardly wait to get home to announce your great fortune to her. Today all you can talk about is rose petal tea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes well, it’s a little weird.

speaker: EMILY
words: And you haven’t told her that now she has her own money to put herself through school, to go to Europe -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop right now. This is just like you to take something that should be great and twist it into something ugly. Why do you do that? What is wrong with you?

speaker: EMILY
words: There’s nothing wrong with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes there is. There’s something seriously wrong with you. You should be studied.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t understand why you’re getting so upset. I respect the decision that you made.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I made no decision.

speaker: EMILY
words: Whatever you say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, you know what? I’m going to call her and uh, tell her right now. [looks for her cell]

speaker: EMILY
words: No you’re not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes in fact I am. [moving phone around her]

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The reception sucks in here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Stop it, you look like you’re having a fit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok, well I’m gonna go find a payphone. [gets up]

speaker: EMILY
words: [stopping her] You’re grandmother will be back any second. Just have a sandwich.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have a sandwich? That’s what you have to say to me? Have a sandwich.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well what do you want me to say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want you to say that you are sorry you tried to talk me out of taking this money. That you realize that you’re just being petty and controlling and mean and that you know there’s no amount of money that can change the relationship Rory and I have. That’s what I want you to say - say that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I will not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well say it Mom, or I’m finding a payphone.

speaker: TRIX
words: Lorelai - you’re here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Gran.

speaker: TRIX
words: So have you ordered the tea yet?

speaker: EMILY
words: No not yet.

speaker: TRIX
words: Well good because I’m afraid I’m going to have to take my leave of you a little earlier than I had anticipated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, why?

speaker: TRIX
words: My train leaves tonight and I have a little last minute packing to do.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I can help you with the packing.

speaker: TRIX
words: Plus I really don’t wish to witness anymore of this ugly little fight you two seem to be having. Raising your voice during high tea, who ever heard of such a thing. It’s like Fergi all over again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Gran please, I’m so sorry. We’re done. Please don’t leave.

speaker: TRIX
words: I can see now that offering that trust fund was a bad idea. After all, taking into account the maturity level of those involved, this large amount of money would probably not be safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Gran, that isn’t true. Rory is an incredibly mature kid.

speaker: TRIX
words: Oh I’m sure she is. It’s you I’m worried about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But -

speaker: TRIX
words: . [to Emily] And I’m sure she gets it from you.

speaker: EMILY
words: But -

speaker: TRIX
words: Tell Rory goodbye for me. You two are welcome to visit me in London anytime. Emily, please get my coat. I will meet you outside. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you won.

speaker: EMILY
words: I did not win.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn’t want me to take the money and I’m not taking the money. That’s called winning.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you’re not.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well...yes I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forget it Mom, it’s not big deal.

speaker: EMILY
words: No it is a big deal. Here Rory had this wonderful opportunity and we - and I...maybe I can talk to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes that’ll work.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’ll go to your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom...

speaker: EMILY
words: He can talk to her. He can fix it. I’ll make him fix it. [takes out cell and dials] Ugh damn reception. Well I’ll go to a payphone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Mom, stay here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes but Chilton.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory can still go to Chilton unless you’re rethinking our agreement.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, not at all. I’m not rethinking anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ok then we’re good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’re good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’d better get out there before she leaves me here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sure you’ll be sorry to see her go.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh yes, I don’t know what I’ll do with my self. We’ll see you Friday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: See you Friday. [Emily turns to leave] Hey Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes? [turning back]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I ask you a favor.

speaker: EMILY
words: Anything, anything at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t make us take the coat rack back.

speaker: EMILY
words: Deal.
CUT TO BUS STOP
[Lorelai waiting, coffee in hand, as Rory gets off the bus.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here [giving her a coffee]

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. I thought you were gonna have tea today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, we did, we finished.

speaker: RORY
words: Finished early.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah well once you’re done with those little sandwiches, there’s not reason to pretend you like tea anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh I totally understand. Listen there’s something I have to tell you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I loaned Paris your black mini and there’s a good chance you may never see it again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well there’s something I have to tell you.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You lost out on $250,000 dollars today.

speaker: RORY
words: What?!
[Lorelai nods as they walk down the street.]
OPEN AT ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(It's the weekly Friday dinner. Lorelai, Rory and Emily are sitting at the dinner table eating.)

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, can I have some baby pictures of you and Grandpa?

speaker: EMILY
words: Any particular reason?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, we're doing this visual family history project for school.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh. Well, if it's for school I suppose I could dig something up.

speaker: RORY
words: And I need some of Mom too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought we already had this conversation.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but I don't believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mother tell her.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't have any baby pictures of your mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: How could you not have any baby pictures of Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Because when your mother was seven, I came downstairs and found her burning all of her baby pictures.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you do that? I'm sure you were a cute baby.

speaker: EMILY
words: She was. She was very cute.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Four, three, two, one.

speaker: EMILY
words: In most respects.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then we have lift off.

speaker: RORY
words: What does that mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't see what the problem is. You certainly grew into it.

speaker: RORY
words: Grown into what?

speaker: EMILY
words: As a child, your mother had an unusually large head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The best thing about it was that she would tell me constantly. My first complete sentence was, "Big head want dolly."

speaker: RORY
words: I can't imagine it being that bad.

speaker: EMILY
words: It wasn't. It just affected her balance a little so. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, can we please talk about something besides my formerly huge head?

speaker: RORY
words: Are these new chairs Grandma?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, yes Rory, they are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They are?

speaker: EMILY
words: I got them from a dealer up in Maine last summer. He just finished restoring them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They look exactly like the old ones.

speaker: RORY
words: They're nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure they're new?

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course I'm sure. I bought them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't see any difference at all.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, the arch in the back is higher and they have a completely different leg.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, no difference.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course I could only get ten of these, so I'm two chairs short of a set.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're telling me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, do you realize how rare these chairs are?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: I've searched for three years or them. I've combed every fine antique store on the East Coast and this is all I could find. I blame Peg Mosley.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, Peg Mosley. Evil, evil woman.

speaker: RORY
words: What did Peg Mosley do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She lured these two German children to her gingerbread house and then she tried to eat them. Pass the artichokes please.

speaker: EMILY
words: I made the mistake of telling Peg all my favorite special spots and that woman moved in and completely wiped them out. You can't find a decent Biedermayer hutch in all of Connecticut. I'm desperate for new sources.

speaker: RORY
words: What about Kim's Antiques?

speaker: EMILY
words: What's Kim's Antiques?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Didn't that burn down?

speaker: RORY
words: My best friend Lane, her parents have this great antiques store in Stars Hollow.

speaker: EMILY
words: Is that so? (To Lorelai) Why haven't you ever told me about it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know Mom. I guess it just got lost in my big head.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe you should come to Stars Hollow and I'll take you there. Like Saturday. You can come see the town.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, won't you have to study?

speaker: RORY
words: I can put off studying for one day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm working.

speaker: EMILY
words: No one is asking you to do anything Lorelai. This is between Rory and me. I accept your offer Rory. I would love to spend Saturday with you.

speaker: RORY
words: Great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm just sorry that I'm gonna miss it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Eat your artichoke Lorelai.
(Opening credits)
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Rory and Lorelai are sitting at a table. Luke brings their plates to them.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, French toast with bacon crispy. Pancakes, two eggs over easy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You put the eggs on top of the pancakes.

speaker: RORY
words: Oops.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, it's like two eyes staring at me. See, I can't eat it like this.

speaker: RORY
words: Hence the oops.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about? You always order the same thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but you usually put the eggs on the side so that my breakfast is not ogling me.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the same food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, yeah, I need the eggs put on the side.

speaker: LUKE
words: You want a brand new plate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: How about if I take this plate in the back, I take the eggs off the pancakes, I put the same eggs on the side and bring the plate back out. What happens then?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then I can eat my breakfast.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the same food just a different configuration.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I won't know that.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm gonna take the plate in the back.
(Luke picks up the plate and walks away.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what time does the judgmental express arrive?

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma gets here at noon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you sure you won't do lunch?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, I can't, lunch is bad.
(Rachel walks over to the table.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Lorelai, you're here. Good. Don't move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I won't.
(Rachel walks away)

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing at lunch?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I have very important things to do.

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, at noon I have to not have lunch with my mother.

speaker: RORY
words: Very nice.
(Rachel walks back with a pile of photographs.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: So I'm developing my pictures from the Firelight Festival. Some amazing stuff. And I'm thinking maybe there's a book here, faces of small town America. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, you should feel safe, you don't live near these people.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Exactly. And the very last shot on my roll was this.
(Rachel hands Lorelai a picture of Luke and Lorelai sitting on a bench.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. When did you take this?

speaker: RACHEL
words: When you weren't looking.
(Luke walks over with Lorelai's plate.)

speaker: LUKE
words: What's that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it's a picture of us.

speaker: LUKE
words: Us?

speaker: RORY
words: Rachel took it.

speaker: RACHEL
words: At the Firelight Festival.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, sure, yeah. (hands Lorelai the plate.) So, uh, here's your plate, no eyes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Do you wear contacts?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me? No.

speaker: RACHEL
words: God, you've got amazing eyes. Doesn't she?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, yeah. Sure, I guess. . . I mean, they're, you know, placed good. . . . symmetrical. I'm gonna get some more coffee.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah.
(Rory hands Lorelai a photo of an old building.)

speaker: RORY
words: Oh wow. Mom, look at this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is that?

speaker: RACHEL
words: It's an old abandoned inn I ran across when I was exploring the other day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is Dragonfly. I totally forgot about this place.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well, it doesn't look like it's been operational in years.

speaker: RORY
words: Look at all the trees. It's pretty. Oh, I'm buzzing. (takes her pager out of her pocket)

speaker: LORELAI
words: What have I said about buzzing in public?

speaker: RORY
words: It's Lane. 911. That's trig. Gotta go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. Take a . . . yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Rachel.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Bye. (Rory leaves.) See, that is one really not annoying kid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, she really is not.

speaker: RACHEL
words: See, I might consider doing the whole mom thing if I could be guaranteed that I could get one just like her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you can, you just have to go to Sears. God, where is this again?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Uh, it's kind of behind the mill. You go over the little footbridge with the mean duck family living under it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, the Armbrusters. Wow, it's really amazing.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Do you want to see it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RACHEL
words: The inn. I'm gonna head out that way in a little while.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well. . .

speaker: RACHEL
words: Come on, finish your breakfast. I'll drive us out there.
(Luke walks to the table carrying a coffee pot.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Drive her out where?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh, Lorelai and I are going to cruise the docks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we're gonna see how many sailors we can get to tattoo our names on their butts.

speaker: RACHEL
words: So what do you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I have to check in at the inn first.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well that's okay. Good. I'll pick you up there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Good.
(Rachel walks away.)

speaker: LUKE
words: So what was all about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh nothing. We're just gonna go check out this old inn Rachel found.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing. I didn't know you guys were friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, well we're not really friends. I mean, I don't know her that well. But we're just hanging out. She seems really great.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, she is. She's great. She's just, you know, a lot different from you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause I'm not really great?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, you're great. Just in a different way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: In a not really great way?

speaker: LUKE
words: That's not what I meant. The two of you are just completely different people. Both great, but I'm just a little surprised that, you know, you're different types of greatness are, you know, melding and you're comfortably great together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is this bothering you?

speaker: LUKE
words: This conversation, yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Um, the idea of Rachel and I hanging out together. Is there some reason that's weird for you or something?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why would it be?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No reason I can think of.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, well then it's not weird.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, well I was just checking.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, well then, you checked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. So are you gonna be pouring that coffee anytime or. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm glad it's not weird though because . . (Luke overflows her coffee cup.) . . . that would be bad.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, I'll get a rag.

(Lorelai is talking to a group from Japan, while a translator repeats everything she says in Japanese.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: 30, although our chef is an amazing overachiever and she'll be happy to prepare you anything you want any time of day. Now your itinerary for the conference will be in each of your rooms. words: Rune is in the lobby.

words: Rune is in the lobby.

words: Sookie, Rune is in the lobby.

words: Uh huh.

words: Why?

words: Your muffin's getting cold.

words: Well, he's staying with Jackson.

words: Again?

words: Still.

words: I thought he was only here for a weekend.

words: Okay. Explain Yoko, because he's out there with the normal people and he's going to scare them

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He won't leave.

words: Jackson's house?

words: Yes. Jackson's house. He won't leave and it's driving me crazy.

words: Apparently, Rune had a rough childhood. His parents don't talk to him, his brothers and sisters don't talk to him, no one talks to him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, then what's wrong with Jackson?

words: I don't know. But he's determined to stand by him and I have to respect his decision.

words: Well, that part I can understand.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Good.

words: But the part I can't understand is what is Rune doing in the lobby?

words: Jackson.

words: Okay.

words: Must be some good jam.

words: Yeah, well, it's just my way of saying thanks for helping out Rune.

words: Thanks for helping out Rune.

words: Okay, I'm waving around like an idiot here.

words: So you haven't. . .

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

words: Ah.
