words: Yeah.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So I should . . .

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Good idea.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Right. Um, enjoy the jam. (Jackson leaves)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh, would you mind explaining the thank you jam.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I was supposed to ask you something about Rune.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, he just not too long ago lost his job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, attitude problem?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Something like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.
(Lorelai starts eating the jar of jam with a spoon.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Anyway, when he lost his job, he couldn't pay his rent so then he got evicted. None of this was known to us when he came to stay with Jackson. I mean, but this is the situation. So I was thinking that if he could get another job and then he could save up some money and afford his own place and move out, and then I wouldn't end up stabbing him in the neck with a grapefruit spoon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ouch.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Its gonna happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You want me to give him a job?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nothing important.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good, 'cause I was gonna put him in charge of legal.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know it's a lot to ask, but I can't think of anything else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What can he do?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lots of things! He's always fiddling around, using screws. Once I saw him use a hammer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A hammer?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I bet he could be a handyman. You are always looking for a good handyman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I couldn't pay him very much.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, that's okay. Maybe he could just work for, uh, room and board.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You want him to live here?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No! Well, what about the old potting shed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The old potting shed? That's where Rory and I lived when she was a baby. It has memories and little rosebud wallpaper. I don't want Boo Radley touching my rosebud wallpaper.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The job is enough. You're right. He can save up money and eventually move out. I'll just have to deal with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The potting shed's fine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I love you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I swear to God Sookie, the minute the guests start complaining or disappearing, he's out of there.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: More than fair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, it's really good jam.
(Lorelai hands Sookie the jar of jam.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. It is isn't it?
(Lorelai leaves)
CUT TO OUTSIDE LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Rory is sitting on the porch. Emily pulls up the driveway. Rory walks to her car.)

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, hello. What a lovely day to. . . ugh. (Emily's heel gets caught in the grass.) I guess putting in a walkway never occurred to your mother.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh actually it occurs to her every day on the way to work. Here. (Rory helps pull her heel out of the grass.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.
(They start walking towards the house.)
CUT TO INSIDE LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Rory and Emily walk in through the front door.)

speaker: RORY
words: Are your shoes okay?

speaker: EMILY
words: They're fine. Just a little muddy that's all.

speaker: RORY
words: Here give 'em. I'll clean them for you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh you don't have to do that.
(Rory takes the shoes and walks into the kitchen. Emily follows.)

speaker: RORY
words: My mom found this great shoe cleaner. It's gets out pretty much anything. Do you want something to drink, there should be some iced tea in the fridge.

speaker: EMILY
words: Iced tea would be nice. (opens fridge) Oh my god. There's nothing in here.
(Rory pours some cleaner on a cloth and starts wiping off Emily's shoes.)

speaker: RORY
words: I know, it's a little sparse.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's the Grapes of Wrath.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't worry. We eat fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: No food, no drink. Do you at least have plates?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, we have plates.
(Emily pulls a plate out the cabinet.)

speaker: EMILY
words: There are women in bikinis on them.

speaker: RORY
words: The original Charlie's Angels. It took us years to get a complete set. You can find the Kate Jackson's and the Shelly Hack's pretty easily. Even the Cheryl Ladd's. But the Farrah Fawcett's and the Jacklyn Smith's are a little harder to come by, but still accessible. The real trick however is to find the Tanya Roberts. We have three.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have three Tanya Roberts?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: EMILY
words: And I was worried, silly me. (She puts the plate away) How are you doing with those shoes?

speaker: RORY
words: All done. (hands Emily the shoes)

speaker: EMILY
words: That's amazing. What is that you used?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. We got if off one of those late night TV ads. Apparently it also gets rust off nails and hinges, waxes your car perfectly, and weatherproofs windows and doors.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, isn't that nice?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, about today. I think I should just give you the grand tour of the town. So we can start by walking to Kim's Antiques, which takes us by all the good sites.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, uh, Rory, I don't think I wore the right shoes for the grand tour. Why don't we just drive?

speaker: RORY
words: You can borrow some of my mom's shoes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Uh, no, I don't think so. Rory hold on a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, you will be missing the true Stars Hollow experience if you don't walk. Trust me.
(Rory starts walking upstairs)

speaker: EMILY
words: All right, but I won't wear anything with rhinestones or zebra stripes or anything that has batteries or that sings or make animal noises or moves on its own.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, I got it.
CUT TO DRAGONFLY
(Lorelai and Rachel are standing in front of an old, rundown building.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Must have been something when it was all fixed up and nice.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Can I ask what the fascination with this place is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, me and my friend Sookie, we've been kind of toying with the idea of opening our own place together.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I mean someday, obviously not now. We're still saving up.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Are you close?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not at all.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well, this looks like this could be a great place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah it really does. God. A little paint, some pretty curtains, 150 thousand dollars of construction. We're open for business.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Did you always want to own an inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh no, I was still dreaming of owning a red Camaro when Rory appeared on the scene.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Ah. Right

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a new idea in the last couple years actually. How about you? Did you always want to be a photographer?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Not specifically. I just remember growing up thinking I want to be anywhere but here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, that was you in the other room.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I made sure to pick something that would keep me moving, constantly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds exciting.

speaker: RACHEL
words: It is. Tiring too. And now that I'm here, back with Luke, I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Things seem to be going pretty well for you guys.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I guess. But I tell you, these last couple weeks, it's become increasingly apparent to me that things just can't continue the way they've been.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I mean, I think it's time we get serious. I'm ready to settle down, I guess, is the creepy old fashion term for it. Pretty damn scary, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pretty damn scary.
CUT TO SIDEWALK
(Emily and Rory are walking through Stars Hollow.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I feel ridiculous.

speaker: RORY
words: You look great.

speaker: EMILY
words: I feel like a Clydesdale.

speaker: RORY
words: You look like you're comfortable.

speaker: EMILY
words: People are staring.

speaker: RORY
words: Because you look great.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, what a shame your grandfather isn't here. He'd fall in love with me all over again.
CUT TO KIM'S ANTIQUES
(Emily and Rory walk in through the front door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: I think we came in through the storeroom.

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, this is it.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is the antique store?

speaker: RORY
words: You have to dig but you can find some great stuff here.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is ridiculous. No one can run a quality business like this. This place is dusty and disorganized and you can't possibly. . . . Oh now that is gorgeous. Look at the woodwork. It's exquisite. I wonder if it has mate.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, look at this. It's got like little flowers all over it.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's very pretty.

speaker: RORY
words: Is it something special?

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you like it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: Then it's something special.
(Lane walks over.)

speaker: LANE
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, this is my grandma. Grandma, this is my friend Lane.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I've heard a lot about you.

speaker: LANE
words: It's nice to meet you. Uh, Rory can I talk to you for a sec?

speaker: EMILY
words: Go, talk. I have a lot of looking to do here.
(Rory and Lane walk to the kitchen.)

speaker: LANE
words: Problem.

speaker: RORY
words: Hit me.

speaker: LANE
words: It's been a week since that party, and still he has not called.

speaker: RORY
words: Henry.

speaker: LANE
words: He said he'd call.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe he's been busy.

speaker: LANE
words: Maybe he has a girlfriend.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: A tiny perfect Korean girl that his parents would love and approve of.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, you are a tiny perfect Korean girl that his parents would love and approve of.

speaker: LANE
words: No, they'd know.

speaker: RORY
words: Know what?

speaker: LANE
words: Know that I listen to the wrong music and wish I could go blond without looking like an idiot. Or that I'd take a whopper over kimchi in a heartbeat.

speaker: RORY
words: Now you're just going crazy.

speaker: LANE
words: So he doesn't like me, he's not gonna call. It's not the end of the world. I'll live. I'll go one. There's always college. Unless my parents get their way, and then it's 'I take thee Jesus to be my lawful wedded husband.'

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, with all due respect to your fiancé, Henry will call.

speaker: LANE
words: No he's not.

speaker: RORY
words: Well then why did he talk to you all night. .

speaker: LANE
words: Well. .

speaker: RORY
words: . . and follow you around everywhere you went. .

speaker: LANE
words: 'cause . . .

speaker: RORY
words: . .and ask you to dance six times?

speaker: LANE
words: Was it six times?

speaker: RORY
words: It was six times. And he did not ask you to dance six times because you're a good dancer, because to tell you the truth and as much as I love you, you're not.

speaker: LANE
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: You are an embarrassment to the art of dancing.

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: That's mid nineteenth century, four different kinds of wood.
(Cut to Mrs. Kim and Emily bartering over a cabinet. Lane and Rory watch them from the kitchen.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Is it missing an inlay?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought it was missing an inlay.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Perfect condition!

speaker: EMILY
words: How much?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Thirty-five hundred for the pair.

speaker: EMILY
words: You must be joking!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No. No joke.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, they're nice, but they're certainly not that nice.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Not a better pair on the East Coast.

speaker: EMILY
words: Two thousand.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You're from Hartford.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Ah.

speaker: EMILY
words: It hardly matters where I'm from. I know these pieces are overpriced.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Look on the bottom.

speaker: EMILY
words: They're not signed.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Look on the bottom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are they signed?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Look on the bottom!
(Emily leans down and looks.)

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: They're signed.

speaker: EMILY
words: How do I know that's authentic?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You have my word.

speaker: EMILY
words: And a letter of authentication?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: That too.

speaker: LANE
words: It's like watching the Williams' sisters.

speaker: RORY
words: I wish we had popcorn.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: . . .Insulting!

speaker: EMILY
words: I won't take it.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Then someone else will!

speaker: EMILY
words: Eventually, maybe.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I can wait.

speaker: EMILY
words: So can I.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: That's my last offer.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll think about it.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I'll waive the tax.

speaker: EMILY
words: And throw in delivery.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: We appreciate your business.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
(Emily and Rory walk out of Kim's Antiques)

speaker: EMILY
words: I like that woman. And you know what? I like these shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: You're becoming one of us Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: This way?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: I love this street.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
(Michel walks through the lobby as Rune walks through the front door carrying a duffel bag.)

speaker: RUNE
words: Hey.

speaker: MICHEL
words: May I help you?

speaker: RUNE
words: Yeah, I need to know where my room is.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Uh, are you sure you are in the right place? Perhaps you want the YMCA or the local bus station.

speaker: RUNE
words: You speak English?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Do you have a reservation?

speaker: RUNE
words: I work here.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Hm, I do not think so. You see, we have standards, and even if they were much much lower, you would still be poor boy out of luck.

speaker: RUNE
words: I'm the new handyman. Lorelai hired me

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, you know Lorelai?

speaker: RUNE
words: I dated her.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh you did?

speaker: RUNE
words: Yeah, but hey, don't spread it around, it's not one of my shining moments.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yeah, and you probably have so many to pick from.

speaker: RUNE
words: You're rude.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You've caught me to the quick, out of here teeny tiny man.

speaker: RUNE
words: Look I will only be pushed so far.

speaker: MICHEL
words: And obviously it's down.
(Lorelai runs over to them.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rune, you made it, great.

speaker: RUNE
words: Finally. Will you tell this guy who I am?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is Rune.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You know him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's gonna be our new handyman.

speaker: RUNE
words: See! Handyman.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Be quiet.

speaker: RUNE
words: Go build us another statue.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You hired this man?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Did you date him also?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What! No, I didn't date him. Rune, I didn't date you. It was one night. .

speaker: MICHEL
words: One night, you and him together?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll explain later.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, I cannot wait.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Listen, Rune, here, come with me, I'll show you where you're gonna stay.

speaker: RUNE
words: Can you ask your bellboy here to grab my stuff? I think I might've sprained my shoulder on the way over here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Relax. I got it. (picks up the duffel bag) Uh. Geez. Move it Rune.
(Lorelai and Rune leave. Emily and Rory walk through the front door.)

speaker: RORY
words: So, what do you think?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I think it's very nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom's office is right back there. Oh and you have to see the dining room. They got the chandeliers from one of Martha Washington's houses.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you spend a lot of time here?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I work here a couple afternoons a week, and I help out with special occasions. They have a lot of weddings here. I wonder where mom is.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, don't bother your mother. I'm sure she's busy.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no, she'd want to say hi.
(Rory and Emily walk over to Michel, who is behind the front desk.)

speaker: RORY
words: Michel, where's Mom?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Off with her boyfriend.

speaker: RORY
words: What boyfriend?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Small, dark, wanted in four states.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, do you know when she's coming back because my grandmother's here and we want to say hi.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Your grandmother?

speaker: EMILY
words: Emily Gilmore.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Michel Gerard.
(They shake hands.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Enchantée. D'où venez vous?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Paris.

speaker: EMILY
words: J'adore Paris. Nous y allons chaque printemps.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, oui, le printemps à Paris...

speaker: EMILY
words: Un cliché, mais pourtant...

speaker: MICHEL
words: C'est si vrai, c'est si vrai...

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, we better go find mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's been a pleasure meeting you.

speaker: MICHEL
words: The pleasure is all mine.
(Emily and Rory walk towards the center of the lobby.)

speaker: EMILY
words: What a charming man.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh okay. (sees Lorelai ahead) Mom, hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, it's quite a place you've got here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well it's not really my place, I just work here, so. . I thought you were gonna go antiquing.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah we did. And then we had lunch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, really? Where?

speaker: EMILY
words: Teriyaki Joe's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding.

speaker: RORY
words: She picked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did?

speaker: EMILY
words: It looked festive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't picture you at Teriyaki Joe's . . .or in jogging shoes. What's up working girl?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, Rory decided that we should take the grand tour of the town; that meant walking. I hope you don't mind, I borrowed your socks also.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't mind. I wish I had a camera, but I don't mind.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna go show her the grounds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, good. On the way back, show her the gym. Jump on the treadmill.

speaker: RORY
words: See you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make sure you stretch first.
(Lorelai walks over to the front desk.)

speaker: MICHEL
words: I just love your mother.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
(Rory and Emily are walking along the pond on the inn's grounds.)

speaker: RORY
words: So the horses are up on that hill, and the tennis courts are over there.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's certainly impressive.
(They walk towards the potting shed.)

speaker: RORY
words: And this is my favorite place.

speaker: EMILY
words: The tool shed?

speaker: RORY
words: No, this is where we used to live.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Right when mom and I moved here, this was our apartment.

speaker: EMILY
words: But. .
(Rory opens the door and walks in. Emily looks in from the doorway.)

speaker: RORY
words: I know it's looks small, but it's really pretty. Come on. See we had our bed right over there, and mom put up this really pretty curtain around the tub so that it looked like a real bathroom. And we would just sit outside at night when the Inn would have parties and we'd just listen to music and feed the ducks and. . . (Emily walks away) Grandma? Grandma wait, what's the matter?

speaker: EMILY
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Did something happen? Are you sick? Is it the teriyaki?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm fine. Its just getting late, I have to go.

speaker: RORY
words: But. . .
(Rory watches as Emily walks away. Rune walks towards the shed carrying some sheets.)

speaker: RUNE
words: Hey. Do you mind?

speaker: RORY
words: What? Oh sorry. (She moves out of the way so that Rune can go into the shed.)
CUT TO HALLWAY
(Lorelai walks down a hallway and knocks on a door that says "Williams Hardware, Office, Private". Rachel answers the door.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey! Good, you got my message.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hail the glory of the answering machine.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Come on in. (Lorelai walks inside) I just developed some shots of the Dragonfly I think you're gonna love. Maybe they can help inspire you a little more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, great! Hm, I've never been in Luke's apartment before.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Really? How long have you two known each other?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh god, years. But our relationship is strictly "Please can I have coffee?", 'No,', 'Come on!, 'No, it makes you short.' Blah blah blah.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well, then let me give you the grand tour. This, is it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's, uh, not how I pictured it. I mean, not that I've been picturing Luke's apartment. I haven't been picturing it at all.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I know what you meant.
(Lorelai walks over to the window and touches the curtains.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Nice touch.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh, those aren't mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Nope. Frankly, a little too frilly for my taste.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna give him so much crap about that.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Have a seat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. (sits down on the couch) Man, you guys are living in pretty tight quarters here.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well this was originally his dad's office, so it was never really meant for anyone to actually live in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But tell that to Luke.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Exactly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you think about moving to a bigger place?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't think so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No? Oh right. Because tight quarters, romantic. Hello Lorelai.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, well I don't think romance has a lot to do with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm not sure I'm gonna be in Stars Hollow much longer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. But I thought. . .

speaker: RACHEL
words: I know, I just, I can't seem to make Luke believe that I really want to stay this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you tell him all that stuff you told me?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Till I was blue in the face.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you just have to keep trying until he hears you.
(Rachel sits down next to Lorelai on the couch.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, I don't blame him. I've given him no reason to believe me. I just hope that magically somehow he'd, I don't know, forget that I'd skipped out on him a million times before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have you told him that you're thinking of leaving?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you going to?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't know. I mean, I feel like I've been trying so hard to make everything good. But this town, you know, it's like living under a microscope. Everyone here is just waiting for you to screw up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No that's not true.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Miss Patty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well yeah.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't know how long I can stick around here waiting for Luke when I feel like I don't have a friend in the world.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, if you can French braid hair, I'll be your friend.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, see ya.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I cannot find your pictures here. They must be in the bathroom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So do not wanna know why.
(Rachel starts walking towards the bathroom, then stops and turns around.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, I know this is not so not cool to ask. But if the situation comes up and it's not too weird, a little word of encouragement from you might help a lot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, sure. If it comes up.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Thanks
(Rachel goes into the bathroom. Luke walks in the front door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, you don't knock?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rachel invited me.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To look at some pictures.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. And go through your underwear drawer.

speaker: LUKE
words: Where is she?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Freezing your bra.

speaker: LUKE
words: Where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In the bathroom.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a nice place you have here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like the curtains.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, yeah, Rachel picked them out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, she's got good taste.
(Rachel comes out of the bathroom)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh. Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hi. I just had to put something in the safe.

speaker: RACHEL
words: We were just. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told him about the underwear drawer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: And the baseball cap fashion show?

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay. I'm gonna go now.
(Luke leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think he's going to buy a matching rug.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Lane and Rory are lying on Rory's bed)

speaker: RORY
words: I like this song. It makes me gloomy.

speaker: LANE
words: Gloom is good.

speaker: RORY
words: Really gloomy.

speaker: LANE
words: Like Joy Division Gloomy? Nick Cave gloomy? Robert Smith gloomy?

speaker: RORY
words: Johnny Cash gloomy.

speaker: LANE
words: So kind of like a San Quentin-y, it's a long road home and my horse just got shot but I've still got my girl by my side gloomy?

speaker: RORY
words: You read my mind.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm deep in a Charlie Parker gloomy.

speaker: RORY
words: Henry still hasn't called?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh no, he called.

speaker: RORY
words: He did? Why didn't you tell me?

speaker: LANE
words: Well I didn't talk to him. He left a message. I listened to it eight-and-a-half times, but then my mom came home and I had to erase it. But I was so panicked that I broke it, which is better because now all evidence that a boy called me is in the trash.

speaker: RORY
words: Eight and a half times.

speaker: LANE
words: Well it was a good message the first couple times. Then I started parsing it for subtext.

speaker: RORY
words: What did he say?

speaker: LANE
words: He said, and I quote, "Hey Lane, it's Henry." Not a good start.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you figure?

speaker: LANE
words: It's so gender neutral. It's how you start a conversation with a bowling pal.

speaker: RORY
words: He asked you bowling?

speaker: LANE
words: Then he said "It was fun meeting you the other night."

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: He didn't say which night. Like he didn't remember which night. Like he's mixing me up with another girl from another night. For all I know, he thought he was calling the hot blonde he met at a hopped up night at Balthazar's.

speaker: RORY
words: He's a 16 year old Korean boy.

speaker: LANE
words: Or so he led me to believe.

speaker: RORY
words: What's the bottom line here?

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, the bottom line is that he wants me to call him back. But if I do that then he's probably gonna ask me out on a date. And if we go out on a date then it could lead to another date, and then I'll have to introduce him to my parents. And once I do that, they're gonna like him. Because he's Korean and he's gonna be a doctor. And then once that happens, that's it. It'll be over. He'll be hideous to me. Now I'm a Lou Reed gloomy.
(phone rings. Rory answers it.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, hello. Do you have a minute?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, sure.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now I know this will probably seem silly but I was wondering what your favorite color is.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I don't really have one. Blue I guess.

speaker: EMILY
words: Okay. What about flowers? Do you like flowers?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.

speaker: EMILY
words: Which would you say you like better, roses or lilies?

speaker: RORY
words: Hmm, sunflowers.

speaker: EMILY
words: Sunflowers it is. Now, what about music? N'sync or 98 degrees?

speaker: R
words: Uh, N'sync or 98 degrees?

speaker: LANE
words: What kind of sick joke is this?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think I could choose.

speaker: EMILY
words: What about that other group? The Backside Boys?

speaker: RORY
words: You mean the Backstreet Boys?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes that's it.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I guess if I really had to choose, I'd say N'sync.

speaker: EMILY
words: Wonderful.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you writing this down?

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe.

speaker: RORY
words: What for?

speaker: EMILY
words: You'll see. I'm looking forward to dinner on Friday.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, yeah, me too.
(hangs up)

speaker: RORY
words: What was that?

speaker: LANE
words: Sounded like some sick take on the Gallup survey. I gotta go

speaker: RORY
words: Call him.

speaker: LANE
words: I already left him a message, he's probably parsing it right now.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sure.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Luke is behind the counter. Lorelai comes down the back steps and walks behind the counter.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Want some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah coffee would be great.
(Luke fills up a carryout cup and hands it to her.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Watch the lid there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Wow, it really looks, um, different from back here, ya know? All this is yours, as far as the eye can see.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, it's quite an empire I've built for myself. I'm thinking of conquering the flower shop next door and expanding the freezer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I didn't mean to kick you out of your own apartment.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, you didn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you left pretty fast.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, you guys looks like you were talking girl talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Girl talk.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's girl talk?

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, pantyhose, nail polish.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Curtains.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes. That stuff.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't like me being up there?

speaker: LUKE
words: No big deal.
(Luke walks away. Lorelai follows him.)
CUT TO STORAGE ROOM
(Luke is in the storage room unloading boxes. Lorelai walks in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, this is the fascinating storage area where fascinating acts of storage take place.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup, this is it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Some good looking pickles.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm admiring your pickles.

speaker: LUKE
words: You shouldn't be in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: LUKE
words: 'Cause my insurance covers only me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not true. You're kidding right?

speaker: LUKE
words: Its not safe, something might fall.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't like me hanging out with Rachel do you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Am I right?

speaker: LUKE
words: You can hang out with anybody you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not my question.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well that's my answer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we're eight.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just a friendly piece of advice. Don't get too attached to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rachel?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. She's got an interesting habit of getting bored and then leaving, usually without saying goodbye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: People break habits.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not often.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you're just convinced that that's what she's gonna do?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll bet you that's exactly what she does.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, let's say that is what she does. Don't you think there's the teensiest possibility that if Rachel leaves Stars Hollow this time its because she thinks you don't want her to stay?

speaker: LUKE
words: Are you guys talking about me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No . . . Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, I don't mind if you hang out with her, but you will not talk about me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? It's fun. We wear plaid, take turns not shaving.

speaker: LUKE
words: There will be no Luke talk period.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you wanna know what I think about this situation?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, if you're gonna tell me at least help me unload.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I use the fun cutter thingy?

speaker: LUKE
words: Not if you call it the fun cutter thingy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please.

speaker: LUKE
words: Cut the box, not your hand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good tip, you should teach. (cuts open the box) Ha! Fun!

speaker: LUKE
words: Talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I don't know exactly what's going on in Rachel's head because I'm not a Vulcan, but from the way she talks about you and the way she smiles when your name comes up, I'm pretty sure that she's serious about staying in Stars Hollow this time.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, let me guess. Rachel told you she wanted to put down roots, that she's serious this time, that she's tired of the road, and realizes what's lacking in her nomadic existence.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She didn't use the phrase nomadic existence, but basically yes, that's what she said.

speaker: LUKE
words: I've heard the speech. I know the speech by heart.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I think she means it this time.

speaker: LUKE
words: You don't know her like I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't. But she seems sincere.

speaker: LUKE
words: How do you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her nose didn't grow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why are you taking her side?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not taking her side.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well it sounds like you're taking her side.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, wash out your ears, I'm not taking her side.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean you're practically pushing her on me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just want you to be happy.

speaker: LUKE
words: And you know what makes me happy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I just know that you've been carrying a torch for her for a really long time.

speaker: LUKE
words: I have not been carrying a torch for her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you wanted this to happen.

speaker: LUKE
words: How do you know what I wanted to happen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Didn't you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. So here it is, right in front of you. Just take it. Take the plunge. She could be ready. Just jump in and believe her. Unless, you know, there's some other reason you don't want to.

speaker: LUKE
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like I. . . .I don't know.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's no other reason.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, fine. Then there's no other reason.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll think about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well, thanks for letting me borrow your thingy.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll see you later Luke.
(Lorelai leaves.)
CUT TO MOVIE THEATER
(Rory and Lorelai are sitting in the theater, waiting for the movie to start.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: She actually asked if you like the Backstreet Boys?

speaker: RORY
words: Except she called them Backside Boys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha! That is high comedy. What inspired that woman?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. It was weird.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sudden interest in pop music I sat her down to listen to a Prince song once, and she looked like she was having a stroke. Wait a minute. I know what she's doing.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's trying to be your pal now. Ah, that sneak. You spend one day together and she wants to know all about you. She's picturing you guys chatting about boys, and painting each other's toenails.
(Kirk, sitting behind them, clears his throat loudly. They turn around to look.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh hey Kirk. You getting a cold? You know you should try that dinametichemphemital. Knocks it right out. Don't drive a forklift though, 'cause it'll make you drowsy.
(Luke and Rachel walk in holding hands. They sit down in the front row.)

speaker: RORY
words: Oh wow, when's the last time you think Luke's been to a movie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know but I think the guy had to crank the projector by hand.

speaker: KIRK
words: Do you mind?
(Lorelai turns around)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kirk, the movie hasn't even started yet.

speaker: KIRK
words: I like to have silence in order to cleanse my mental pallet and achieve calm before enjoying a motion picture.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you got that out of a book. (Turns around. She watches Luke and Rachel talking.) Luke looks happy, doesn't he?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, he looks happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And they seem really right together, don't they?

speaker: RORY
words: Just right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good, he deserves it. So I did the right thing by butting in the way I did.

speaker: RORY
words: You butted in for all the right reasons. You were concerned about a friend.
(The lights dim and the movie starts.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So if Rachel turns out to be an evil fembot and murders Luke in his sleep, I'm not responsible am I?

speaker: RORY
words: Only in an intergalactic court.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. And Rachel seems really great. . .

speaker: KIRK
words: You are now officially disturbing not just me but every person in this theater.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kirk, you're the only one who's disturbed.
(A cell phone goes off. Lorelai looks around and discovers that it's Kirk's. He tries to answer it, but the ringing won't stop.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh! Shhh!

speaker: KIRK
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shhh! Shh! God, don't you hate that?

speaker: KIRK
words: Hello? Dammit!
(Kirk runs out of the theater. Lorelai laughs. She sees Luke looking towards her and waves.)
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Lorelai and Rory ring the doorbell. Emily answers the door.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Hello, hello, hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, Mom, hi. (to Rory) Uh, check the rubbing alcohol.

speaker: EMILY
words: How was the drive?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The drive was fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The foyer looks great.

speaker: EMILY
words: I have a surprise for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The rest of the house ran away?

speaker: EMILY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, come with me.
(Emily pulls Rory in and leads her away.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, so, I'll. . . I'll follow you then. Great.
CUT TO UPSTAIRS
(Emily, Rory and Lorelai go into a bedroom, which Emily has redecorated for Rory.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Voila.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my. Um Grandma what is this?

speaker: EMILY
words: This is your room.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Since you've been spending so much time here lately, I thought you should have a special place all your own.

speaker: RORY
words: But you didn't have to do this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you like it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it's beautiful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (whispers to Rory) Do you see the N'Sync poster?

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you Grandma. (hugs Emily)

speaker: EMILY
words: You're welcome sweetheart. Now come on, lets go downstairs and see if dinner's ready. (Rory leaves.) (To Lorelai) Are you coming?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You bought her CosmoGirl.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well the young girls enjoy the articles.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You bought boy band posters and Hello Kitty notepads.

speaker: EMILY
words: A lovely young girl at the store helped me pick them out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You filled the room with sunflowers.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory likes sunflowers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know Rory likes sunflowers.

speaker: EMILY
words: What is the matter Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I don't know. It's just a little weird that's all.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why is it weird to do something for my granddaughter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. I mean, it's not like you bought her a car. By the way, don't. It's a room and . . .you know, you're right. It's nice. I'm sorry. I'm just being silly.

speaker: EMILY
words: Maybe you don't like the fact that now she has a place away from you, some place that's just her own.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said I was fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Or maybe its because its so large and spacious and has four solid walls around the bathtub.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean, it may not be exciting or bohemian, but at least it doesn't have shovels propped up against the sofa either, now does it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. I missed the checkered flag, when did the argument start?

speaker: EMILY
words: Is it because it's not a shack in the woods? Or is it the proximity to me that's making it so uncomfortable for you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: EMILY
words: You hated us that much?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: You had to take that little girl away. That was bad enough. But to that? To live there, in a shed, like a hobo?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who uses the word hobo anymore?

speaker: EMILY
words: I saw it. I saw that horrible little pit you so proudly ran to. I saw what you chose over your own family. You would've lived in the gutter, in the street, it a cardboard box, anywhere as long as you didn't have to be near us, isn't that true?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom. .

speaker: EMILY
words: Isn't that true Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I was very young and I was very unhappy and I needed to be some place that wasn't here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me. (Emily, holding back tears, leaves. After a pause, Lorelai slowly starts to walk out.)
CUT TO STREET
(Later that night, Rory and Lorelai are walking along a sidewalk in Stars Hollow.)

speaker: RORY
words: You're awfully quiet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am.

speaker: RORY
words: You hardly said anything at dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was chewing.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't say anything on the ride home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was concentrating.

speaker: RORY
words: So. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I feel I've gotten sloppy with this whole "10 and 2" hand position thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah seriously, the other day I caught myself doing a "9 and 4."

speaker: RORY
words: Mom. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, if left uncorrected, that can only lead to a "6 and 12", or worse yet, an "8 and 11", which is not only dangerous but damn uncomfortable.

speaker: RORY
words: Talk please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just wish sometimes that certain things could be different.

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like, um, wouldn't it be great if once, just once, I could make my mother hear me. I mean really hear me even if it was just for one second.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you talking about the room?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The room, the potting shed, my entire life after age 6.

speaker: RORY
words: It's my fault.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How is it your fault?

speaker: RORY
words: I shouldn't have taken her there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I just thought if she saw how we lived and how pretty it was with the lake and the swans. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: That she'd do a happy dance?

speaker: RORY
words: That she'd feel included and then maybe . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: The whole me running away thing wouldn't be such a big deal? Oh honey, me running away from them is always gonna be a big deal. There is nothing you can do to change that.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I ask you a question?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I would date Steven Tyler.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I ask you a question whose answer wouldn't horrify me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, go ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you think you and Grandma will ever be able to talk about all the things you've gone through?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't even consider it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. . . . No.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it would just end badly.

speaker: RORY
words: It doesn't have to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It would be like the first 15 minutes of Saving Private Ryan but at least those guys got to be in France.

speaker: RORY
words: You've never tried.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, that's not true. I have tried. I have tried my whole life. But my mother and I, we speak a different language. I talk, I think I'm being clear, and all she hears is 'Blah blah blah Ginger.'

speaker: RORY
words: But if you won't talk and she won't listen, then how is anything ever gonna change?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.
(They walk into Luke's Diner.)
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE'S DINER
(Rachel and Luke are cleaning up as Rory and Lorelai walk through the door. A man holds open the door for them.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: (to man) Thanks. (to Luke) Don't tell me you're closed?

speaker: LUKE
words: Would it change the outcome if I did?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: Two coffees.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes please.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Any pie to go with that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, pie!

speaker: RORY
words: We just had cake at Grandma's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but that was crabby cake, let's have happy pie.

speaker: RORY
words: Have whatever you want as long as there's coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll put on a fresh pot.
(Luke goes to make the coffee. Rory follows him. Lorelai sits at a table. Rachel walks over to her and sits down.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, listen, I just wanna say thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, for what?

speaker: RACHEL
words: For whatever it was you said to Luke the other day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was no big deal.

speaker: RACHEL
words: It was a very big deal. I was sitting upstairs and suddenly he comes in, empties out his sock drawer and gives it to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh that's great. You got a drawer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: And a set of keys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you can put the keys in the drawer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: He's accepting it. He's believing it. And it's all because of you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, it's because of you.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm not gonna screw it up this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you won't.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Well I owe you one. (gets up and starts to walk away)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you're gonna be in Stars Hollow for awhile then?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, quite awhile.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, that's great.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah. You want any ice cream with that pie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I did get you a drawer.

speaker: RACHEL
words: If I throw in a little hot fudge, you think you can weasel me half the closet?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll see what I can do.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Thank you.
(Rachel walks to the counter. Rory returns with two cups of coffee.)

speaker: RORY
words: Here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.
(They both take sips.)

speaker: RORY
words: Huh. Does it taste different to you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. It does.
(Lorelai looks over to the counter. She watches Luke and Rachel smiling at each other.)
CUT TO DRAGONFLY INN
(Rory and Lorelai are sitting on a blanket in front of the old inn.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what do you think?

speaker: RORY
words: It's got a great view.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. And good highway access.

speaker: RORY
words: I love that window back in the . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Library? Oh no, lobby. No, uh, bathroom?

speaker: RORY
words: I'd get that decided before you open.
(Cut to Sookie is standing on the front porch.)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: There's absolutely no kitchen space here. How are we supposed to open a bed and breakfast when there's no place to cook breakfast! It's just a bed. We'll have to charge half price.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll build a new kitchen Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'll need plenty of ventilation. And an area for an outdoor fireplace for barbecues. Plus storage. Where do these people put anything? Ooh! And a pantry. And a canning room. And I'd love to smoke our own meats.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don't know if this is gonna work. I mean, I have to do some floor plans. Where is that plumbing? (Sookie walks away)

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, your own inn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cool, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: It's gonna be a really big job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Well, maybe I'll get Rune to manage the place for me.

speaker: RORY
words: How's he doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He put a tip jar on the reservation desk.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel tried to beat him senseless with the reservation book.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, how did that go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Rune got away.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well Michel can't run in new shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: So how long you think before you guys own this place?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh sweetie, it's going to be a very very very long time.

speaker: RORY
words: You think it'll still be here?
(The front screen door falls down)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think we got a shot.
THE END
OPEN AT LUKE'S DINER
(Lorelai and Rory are sitting at a table. Lorelai is in the middle of telling a story.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: So then he starts ripping my twenty dollar bill into like a million pieces. And I'm thinking to myself, there is a store full of people, why am I the one on line with the crazy magician? (Rory yawns) Okay, I'll cut to the end. So he couldn't put it back together again and he had to pay me back in quarters.

speaker: RORY
words: Very good story.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You look tired.

speaker: RORY
words: I just haven't been sleeping very well lately.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come?

speaker: RORY
words: Just have a lot on my mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything I can do?

speaker: RORY
words: Flag down the coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Arm going up now. Honey, you gotta wake up. Wanna play?

speaker: RORY
words: One, two, three?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll go first.
(They both stare out the window.)

speaker: RORY
words: And one.
(Older man walks by.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pass.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I'm not Anna Nicole Smith. Next.

speaker: RORY
words: Two.
(Teenage boy on a skateboard goes by.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, pass.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I'm not Mary Kay LeTourneau.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
(Luke comes to the table while they are staring out the window.)

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you looking for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My new husband.

speaker: RORY
words: She's already passed up two perfectly good prospects.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I'm feeling pretty good about number three.

speaker: LUKE
words: Do I want to know what you're doing?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, Luke came to the table, does that make him number three?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't even know what we're doing.

speaker: LUKE
words: The safest answer in anything involving the two of you is no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're playing one, two, three, he's yours.

speaker: LUKE
words: I didn't ask.

speaker: RORY
words: You can take the first guy that walks by, or if you decide to pass, assuming there's somebody better out there, you can take the next guy that walks by, or if you don't take him, you're automatically stuck with the third guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not playing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well of course not. Its still my turn.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, guy number 3 is crossing the street right now.
(All three of them stare out the window.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Why am I looking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it's like a train wreck.
(They see Kirk walking towards the diner.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, no!

speaker: RORY
words: Daddy!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not Kirk!

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe he'll buy me a pony.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanna go back to the old guy.
(Kirk walks in the diner. Luke walks over to him.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Congratulations man.

speaker: KIRK
words: Uh, thank you.
(Lorelai and Rory start giggling.)

speaker: KIRK
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing

speaker: KIRK
words: Okay, did somebody put the kick me sign on my back again?
(Lorelai and Rory are laughing.)

speaker: KIRK
words: It wasn't funny last week and it's not funny now! I have asthma.
(Kirk leaves the diner.)

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, quick he's leaving!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, Kirk come back, I love you! Drat. All right, your turn.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know Mom. You already got Kirk, how's a girl to top that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're right, he's yours.

speaker: RORY
words: And one.
(They stare out the window. Dean walks by. Rory gets a sad look on her face.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, so, we should order.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, ordering's good.
(Opening Credits)

speaker: INDEPENDENCE INN
words: INDEPENDENCE INN
(Lorelai is sitting at a table in the lobby organizing folders. Michel, who is behind the counter, answers the phone.)

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn, Michel speaking.

speaker: MAX
words: Yes, is Ms. Gilmore there?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I'm sorry, she's busy, how may I assist you?

speaker: MAX
words: Actually, I need to speak to Ms. Gilmore.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Is this business or personal?

speaker: MAX
words: Personal.
(Michel walks over toward Lorelai and tosses the phone on the table. Lorelai picks it up.)

speaker: MAX
words: Is anybody there? Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, Hello, hi.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max!

speaker: MAX
words: Is this a bad time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No such thing. Where are you?

speaker: MAX
words: I am in the teacher's lounge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, what are you wearing?

speaker: MAX
words: Nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You must be very popular.

speaker: MAX
words: And chilly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought we had a chat date tonight.

speaker: MAX
words: We did, but I was thinking about something and I wanted to run it by you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: MAX
words: So. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, hey, make a gorilla sound.

speaker: MAX
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want to play Wild Kingdom.

speaker: MAX
words: I am not making a gorilla sound.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll tell you what color underwear I'm wearing. (pause) Had you considering the gorilla sound, didn't I?

speaker: MAX
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm good.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, I need you to be serious now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Says the man with no pants.

speaker: MAX
words: We've been having these very successful phone calls for a couple of weeks now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we have.

speaker: MAX
words: And I think that all the talking has done us a lot of good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it has.

speaker: MAX
words: So I was thinking that maybe this weekend instead of a phone call, we should have a date. Let's have dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, at the same restaurant?

speaker: MAX
words: At the same table.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Interesting idea.

speaker: MAX
words: I think its time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what? So do I.

speaker: MAX
words: Saturday night, 8 o'clock?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, wear some pants.

speaker: MAX
words: I make no promises.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
CUT TO SIDEWALK
(Rory is sitting on the curb reading a book. Lane walks over to her and drops a small bag of chips into her lap. Rory stands up and Lane hands her a small bag from the market.)

speaker: LANE
words: Salt and vinegar.

words: Thank you.

words: Here's your gum, your soda, your New Yorker, and your dental floss.

words: Aw, they didn't have the minty kind?

speaker: LANE
words: They were out.

words: Well, this is good too.

words: He wasn't in there.

words: What?

words: Dean. He wasn't in there.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LANE
words: In case you were wondering.

words: I wasn't.

words: Okay, well I just thought you might be. So I mentioned it.

words: Well, I'm not.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

words: I was not avoiding the market.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, my mistake.

speaker: RORY
words: I wasn't.

words: Okay. So what are you doing tonight?

words: Well homework, and then homework, and if I get all that done in time, some homework. You?

words: I have to meet my science partner.

speaker: RORY
words: Fun.

words: Yes, science is fun.

words: Call you later?

speaker: LANE
words: Okay.

words: Hey Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Yeah?

words: You're sure he wasn't in there?

words: I asked.

CUT TO SIDEWALK
(Lorelai walks past a store as Luke walks out of the store.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh hey.

words: Doing a little shopping?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I just had a couple things to pick up.

words: At the cat club?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

words: You had a couple things to pick up at the cat club?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah I did, okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I just never took you for a cat lover, a 97 year old woman, or. . . Hey what'd you buy?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing.

words: You've got a little bag there.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know that.

words: It's got a cat paw stamped on it and a little cat nip bow.
(Luke hands her the bag.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wise man. (Lorelai pulls a pot holder out of the bag.) Wow, pot holders.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Little kitty pot holders. (she pushes a button that makes them meow.) They meow.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's a present.

speaker: LORELAI
words: For someone you hate?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's Rachel's birthday okay. And don't say anything, she doesn't want anybody to know. She hates birthdays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not as much as she's gonna hate these pot holders.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know how to buy gifts, okay, I don't like to buy gifts. I don't like getting gifts. I mean, this whole gift giving and getting process is completely insane.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The rant begins!

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean suddenly, on a certain date, the level of my affection for a person isn't measured by the way that I treat them or what we share.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No!

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean just because I didn't buy her furry slippers or a giant shoe tree, all of a sudden, I suck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, stop. You know you cannot give her these pot holders.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you go to the mall and walk around a little?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, no malls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: I hate malls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ladies and gentlemen, rant number two.

speaker: LUKE
words: They underpay employees and overprice merchandise, they contribute to urban sprawl, they encourage materialism, and the parking's a horror. You drive in, you pay a buck, and even if you're only there for five. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Emma Goldman, I'll tell you what. I'll go for you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're gonna shop for me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've got the day off tomorrow. I was gonna go anyway.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're serious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll go get a bunch of stuff, all returnable. I'll bring it to you. You can pick what you want and the rest I'll return. I'll do all the work; all you'll have to do is point.

speaker: LUKE
words: Point.

speaker: LORELAI
words: One finger, preferably your index.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, this is the first special occasion you and Rachel have shared since she's been back. Don't you want to give her something nice?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I am taking her out to dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I gotta get her something nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So then let me help.

speaker: LUKE
words: All right, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you're welcome.
(Luke hands her his credit card.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing too out there, okay? She's not into all that trendy stuff. She likes simple, clean nature, okay. Elephants, candles, okay. Oh hey, if you can find a candle shaped like an elephant, that would . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you know what, I've got it all under control.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. (Lorelai hands him back the bag with the pot holders in it.) Get rid of these.

words: Geez.

words: I Uh.

words: No.

words: Empty your pockets

words: Okay, I'm gonna go now.

words: Who's Dean?

words: I'm Dean.

words: How you know Dean?

words: We go to school together.

words: You do?

words: Yeah, we're science partners.

words: You don't talk!

words: Sorry.

words: You're science partners?

words: Work?

speaker: LANE
words: On our science project.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Reproduction?

words: Spores, molds and fungus.

words: Science project?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes.

words: For school?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes Mama.

words: You're not dating?

speaker: LANE
words: No Mama.

words: Okay, follow me. (leads them into the kitchen) You sit here. You sit here. I'm going over there, when I come back over here, these chairs will be in same place. No moving, you understand?

words: Yes mama.

speaker: DEAN
words: Not you, him!

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, yes, I understand.

words: I see all. (Mrs. Kim leaves the kitchen.)

words: So that's your mom?

speaker: LANE
words: That's my mom.

words: Has she seen Patton?

words: She just gets uptight about boys.

words: I sensed something like that.

speaker: LANE
words: Its nothing personal.

words: I know, I'm sure once she gets to know me she'll. . .

words: Oh no, she'll hate you forever. It's just nothing personal.

words: Uh, we should probably get started.

words: Chapter twelve?

words: Sounds good. (They both open their books and start reading.) Is this weird for you?

speaker: LANE
words: A little.

words: Me too. I didn't know if maybe Rory told you to hate me or something.

speaker: LANE
words: That's not Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah I know. How is she?

speaker: LANE
words: Good.

words: Good?

words: Good-ish.

words: Oh.

words: Less good than ish.

words: Yeah? How much less?

words: You know we're breaking our agreement.

words: Out agreement not to talk about Rory.

words: We didn't have an agreement not to talk about Rory.

speaker: LANE
words: Well it was an unspoken agreement.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well it was really unspoken 'cause nobody spoke it.

speaker: LANE
words: Well I just think that if we have to study together it would be better if we didn't discuss Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine.

speaker: LANE
words: Fine. (pause) You know, she can't go into the market.

words: Why not?

speaker: LANE
words: Already noted.

speaker: DEAN
words: [Sigh]

words: You can ask, I might not answer.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, how about we go back to the no talking about Rory agreement?

speaker: RORY
words: I should've called. I'm sorry.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory! I'm sorry I didn't tell you.

speaker: RORY
words: It doesn't matter.

speaker: LANE
words: I didn't think you'd want to know.

speaker: RORY
words: I got it.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory stop. (Rory keeps walking.) Okay, that's the opposite of stop.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, forget it. You didn't tell me, now I know. Life goes on.

speaker: LANE
words: Don't be mad.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm fine. I have to go.
CUT TO RORY'S BEDROOM
(Rory is asleep in bed. Lorelai bangs on her door, then walks in and jumps on her bed.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Time to get up. Hey, I have a huge dilemma that I need your opinion on.

speaker: RORY
words: What!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Am I more beautiful today than I was yesterday?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just not sure. I mean at first I looked in the mirror and I thought, well yes, definitely, huge improvement.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I have my pillow back?

speaker: LORELAI
words: But then I thought maybe its not that I'm more beautiful today. Maybe I was just as beautiful yesterday, only I lacked the self-esteem to recognize it.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna go take a shower.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, hurry up and I'll drive you to school.

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks. (Gets out of bed and walks over to her bureau.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why so charming this morning?

speaker: RORY
words: I had an annoying visit from the Stars Hollow wake up fairy. Where's my tie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In your drawer.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm looking in the drawer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Check the living room

speaker: RORY
words: Why would my tie be in the living room?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it's been seeing the doily on the coffee table. I'm sorry, I did not want you to find out this way.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't take this personally, but get out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you're crabby. Do you know what the perfect cure for crabbiness is? A fabulous trip to the mall. Huh? What do you say? You can blow off school and come with me. We can shop, go to the movies, maybe talk a little.

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, just this once. It might make you feel better.

speaker: RORY
words: I feel fine and I don't want to shop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, I know you've been in a funk over Dean, but you have to try not to dwell on it all the time.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna be late for school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, then just meet me in town around four, and we'll get some Indian food and spoil our dinner. What do you say to that?

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, love the enthusiasm. Hey, does "Up With People" know about you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Luke's. Yeah. Hang on. Okay. Cheeseburger. Fries well. Vanilla shake. Coke. Yes we have salad. One salad with cheese, one with ranch. Got it, 20 minutes. (hangs up the phone) What the hell is this?
