speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, so I was like, "Are you crazy? Isak Dinesen is amazing, I love her." Which is kind of crap because I'd never read the book either, but Rory told me it was amazing, so I felt pretty confident in my recommendation of "Out of Africa". (Pulls the book out of a shopping bag and hands it to Luke.)

speaker: LUKE
words: You bought her a book?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you bought her a book, to be put in her brand new camera bag. (Pulls the camera bag out of another shopping bag.)

speaker: LUKE
words: She's got a camera bag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's nylon.

speaker: LUKE
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This one's leather. Beautiful leather. Feel it, smell it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not gonna smell that bag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, don't smell it, but trust me, she's gonna love it. Her old bag is falling apart so she was gonna get a new one eventually and now you will have beaten her to it.

speaker: LUKE
words: So it's practical.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And pretty!

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, that seems right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You like?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: LUKE
words: What's all this? (gestures to the other shopping bags.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well Luke, timing is a beautiful thing.

speaker: LUKE
words: It is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is. So I'm at the mall, and I've already found Rachel's gifts, and I've had two sugar cinnamon pretzels and I'm buzzed on the sugar and jazzed about the purchases and I decide to take a victory lap through Bloomingdale's, and it just so happens that there was an amazing sale in the men's department. I mean gorgeous stuff. Look at this. (pulls a sweater out of a bag) Huh! Forty percent off! I got three different colors!

speaker: LUKE
words: For who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For you.

speaker: LUKE
words: For me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. (walks over to another bag and pulls out a pair of pants) And then of course, beautiful pants. So soft, I don't know what this fabric is but I think I wanna have its baby.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, hold on a minute here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: (walks over to another bag and pulls out a belt.) Also, I got this fabulous belt to go with the sweater and the pants. Simple. Black. But look at the buckle.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't need a belt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great buckle! Sixty percent off, can you believe it?

speaker: LUKE
words: No I cant. Look. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: (walks over to another bag and pulls out some shirts) Oh and I also picked up a couple of shirty shirts in case you didn't have a nice one to go with your suit.

speaker: LUKE
words: What suit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This one! (grabs a garment bag, holds it up, and unzips it)

speaker: LUKE
words: Did no one at that mall notice that you were going through some sort of psychotic episode?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This suit. 175 percent off.

speaker: LUKE
words: You were not supposed to be shopping for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I thought you might like a little something new to wear when you take Rachel out tonight.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well thank you but take it back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, just try them on.

speaker: LUKE
words: No way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You might like how you look.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm fine with the clothes I have.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, see this blazer? It was 175 thousand percent off.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why the sudden need to dress me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just thought you might look nice in some of these things and since they were 600 thousand percent off. .

speaker: LUKE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on Luke, just try something on. How about this sweater?

speaker: LUKE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, how about the pants? Pretty pants!

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not trying anything on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, its not like the lumberjack look will ever go out; it won't. But just once wouldn't it be nice not to be dressed like an extra from "Seven Brides for Seven Brothers"?

speaker: LUKE
words: Take it back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on. Just the jacket. Just once, be too sexy for your shirt and do a little dance on the catwalk.
(Luke walks into the back of the diner while Lorelai chases him with the suit.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Get away from me you mental patient!
CUT TO CHILTON
(Max Medina is lecturing to the class. Rory is staring out the window, not paying attention.)

speaker: MAX
words: If we read his works in order we can see his progression from a narrative of clear simplicity to one of one of rich complexity. Now this is not homework but I strongly urge you, if you have not already read "The Art of Fiction", read it. It's a remarkable manifesto that contains basic trues that still apply to fiction in any form.
(Paris notices Rory not paying attention and points it out to Louise and Madeline.)

speaker: MAX
words: All right, so Henry James, the man of the moment. Pick your book. Read it carefully. A full report on my desk one week from today. Any questions? Ms. Gilmore, any questions?
(Paris pushes her book onto the floor to get Rory's attention.)

speaker: PARIS
words: Oops.

speaker: MAX
words: Ms. Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes?

speaker: MAX
words: Did you hear the assignment?

speaker: RORY
words: Um no, I'm sorry.

speaker: MAX
words: Henry James. Pick your novel. A report on my desk in one week. You got it?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. I got it.
(Bell rings. Students get up to leave.)

speaker: MAX
words: See you tomorrow.
(Paris walks over to Rory.)

speaker: PARIS
words: You didn't take one note. You resorting to the osmosis theory of learning?

speaker: RORY
words: Why do you care?

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't, just making an observation.

speaker: RORY
words: Great, we'll build a dome over you and jam a telescope in your head.

speaker: MAX
words: Ms. Gilmore, can I talk to you for a minute?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, okay.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Tootles.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Ta.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'll get working on that dome.
(All the students leave. Max leans on his desk and talks to Rory.)

speaker: MAX
words: So, how are you?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: MAX
words: Seemed a little distracted today.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. I didn't sleep well last night.

speaker: MAX
words: You've seemed to be a little distracted for quite a while now.

speaker: RORY
words: My grades are fine.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm not concerned about your grades. I'm concerned about you. Look Rory, I know that you've been going through kind of a tough time lately and I just want you to know, if you want to talk, I'm here.

speaker: RORY
words: Tough time?

speaker: MAX
words: Breakups are really hard. We've all been there.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know about that?

speaker: MAX
words: Your mom told me.

speaker: RORY
words: She what?

speaker: MAX
words: Please, don't be upset at her. It just came out in one of our conversations. She was very concerned about you, very frustrated because. .

speaker: RORY
words: You've been talking to my mom?

speaker: MAX
words: Well yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Since when?

speaker: MAX
words: Its been a couple, 3 weeks now I guess.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you dating?

speaker: MAX
words: No, not really, I mean we were talking about possibly this weekend having dinner. You didn't know anything about this, did you? (Rory shakes head her head no) Well the look on your face makes perfect sense now. I'm sorry. I didn't mean to spring this on you like this.

speaker: RORY
words: Its fine, don't worry about it.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm sure your mom was gonna tell you soon.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sure too.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, so . .

speaker: RORY
words: Bus.

speaker: MAX
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: If I don't go I'm gonna miss it.

speaker: MAX
words: Right, go ahead.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for the talk.

speaker: MAX
words: Any time.
(Rory leaves)
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Lorelai is sitting at the counter. Clothes and bags are spread all over one of the tables.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on!

speaker: LUKE
words: I hate you, very much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Save the sweet talk for Rachel. Get out here!
(Luke walks out from the back of the diner wearing some of the new clothes.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me sir, do you know where Luke is?

speaker: LUKE
words: Very funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, Luke, is that you?

speaker: LUKE
words: I feel ridiculous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because you don't have the belt on. (Takes the belt out of the bag and walks over to him.) Here.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Its called accessorizing.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can put a belt on by myself, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, sorry. Hmm.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just have exceptional taste is all. Turn around.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just wanna make sure it all fits. Turn around. (Luke turns around.) Uh huh, uh huh.

speaker: MAN AT COUNTER
words: Hey Fabio, I need the ketchup.

speaker: LUKE
words: Can you get that guy some ketchup?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why me?

speaker: LUKE
words: Because if I spill any stuff on this I won't be able to return it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're not returning those clothes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yes I am.
(Lorelai gives the man the ketchup. She picks up Luke's suit off the table and walks over to him.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here, try on the suit again.

speaker: LUKE
words: I already tried it on twice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, but I want to see it with the black shirt.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not wearing a black suit with a black shirt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Regis does.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, you've won me over now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: At least try on the jacket again. (helps Luke put the jacket on)

speaker: LUKE
words: This is how you like your guys, all GQ'ed up huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Its not GQ'ed up, its just a little less casual.

speaker: LUKE
words: And you don't like casual.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like casual fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just not on me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it just adds variety. Its not lets make a new Luke, its lets see another side of the old one.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You missed a loop. Come here. (Starts fixing his belt) What did you do?
(Rachel walks in the diner and stares at them. Luke looks up and sees her.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh hi.
(Lorelai looks up and sees Rachel.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh hi. Uh, this is not what it looks like.

speaker: RACHEL
words: It looks like you're dressing him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then this is exactly what it looks like.

speaker: LUKE
words: There was a sale at Bloomingdale's and she. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Six trillion percent off.

speaker: LUKE
words: How can you walk away from that, huh? (pause) I'm gonna change now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, uh, I'm gonna get Rory and just enjoy the clothes.

speaker: LUKE
words: I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay good. See you later Rachel.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye (Lorelai leaves)

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm gonna change.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Okay.
CUT TO BUS STOP
(Lane is waiting by the bus stop, holding 2 cups of coffee. Rory gets off the bus and Lane walks over to her.)

speaker: LANE
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: LANE
words: I thought you might like some coffee, since you always do.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: LANE
words: So this feels very awkward.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, I'm a big girl Lane. I don't need you to protect me from things.

speaker: LANE
words: I just didn't want to make you any sadder than you already are.

speaker: RORY
words: How is you telling me that Dean is your study partner gonna make me sadder?

speaker: LANE
words: I don't even want to bring up his name around you.

speaker: RORY
words: That's crazy.

speaker: LANE
words: Have you seen your face when you mention Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: My face is fine.

speaker: LANE
words: Your face is not fine. Your face is far from fine.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get over it.

speaker: LANE
words: Well you're not over it yet.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I'd get over it a little quicker if everyone weren't so busy running around trying to protect me from all the bad scary things in the world.

speaker: LANE
words: Fine, I won't protect you anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: Great, glad to hear it.

speaker: LANE
words: Next time we're walking down the street and you're about to walk head long into oncoming traffic, I'll just give you a little push.

speaker: RORY
words: Exactly what I'm talking about.

speaker: LANE
words: And in the spirit of not protecting you anymore, I was gonna tell you that I couldn't study tonight because I had bible class, but that's not true. I have to meet Dean again.

speaker: RORY
words: Great. Thanks for the honesty.

speaker: LANE
words: And I'll probably have to see him again this weekend because the project's due on Monday.

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever. I don't care. I'll see you when I'll see you.

speaker: LANE
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LANE
words: Bye.
(Lane walks away. Rory throws her coffee into a garbage can as Lorelai walks up. Rory starts walking down the sidewalk as Lorelai follows.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, where's Lane going?

speaker: RORY
words: Away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you've been in this mood for a week now and while I love the unexpected ups and downs of motherhood, I've got to say I'm tired of Goofus and I'd like my Gallant back.

speaker: RORY
words: You can't just say a normal sentence right? Just 'Hey, lets talk' is too dull for you.
(Lorelai grabs Rory's arm to stop her from walking.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey lets talk.

speaker: RORY
words: About what? Oh wait I know. How about you and Mr. Medina?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I've heard you've gotten back together again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you talk to Max?

speaker: RORY
words: He had me stay after class today to talk about my difficult breakup situation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We are not dating. We had been talking and we just now decided to start dating.

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn't you tell me you'd been talking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because it was too much like the whole Todd and Nevina Cutler thing.

speaker: RORY
words: The what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: When I was in junior high, I had a boyfriend, Todd something or other. Not a soul mate, but I was crazy about him and he dumped me. I was completely crushed and I could do nothing except lie around and cry and listen to Air Supply, very low point in my life. Two days after the breakup my best friend Nevina Cutler got back together with her boyfriend, Randy something or other, who had dumped her days before Todd dumped me. And she was so happy and gloaty and couldn't stop talking about how great it was that she had her boyfriend back that it made me feel horrible.

speaker: RORY
words: The end. Lets go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, I didn't want to be Nevina Cutler, okay? You were so miserable about Dean. What was I supposed to do? Walk in and say, 'Sorry about you and Dean but I got Max back and aren't we happy.' Would that have been good?

speaker: RORY
words: That would've been great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was going to tell you, okay? I just wanted to give you some space and a chance to come up for air. I was trying to protect you, that's all. Hey.
(Rory walks away down the sidewalk. Lorelai follows her)

speaker: RORY
words: You know, actually, it doesn't matter whether you tell me about Max or not because you're just gonna break up again anyway.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: Well that's what you do best.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, stop right there.

speaker: RORY
words: You'll break up, cry, get back together, break up. It doesn't really matter. I'd rather not have to keep track, so tell me when you're down to the final inning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what, that is way too snotty a thing even for alternate universe Rory to say. I'd like an apology.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine. I apologize. Let's go home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, lets go home and try that apology again.
(Rory is heading home, but stops when she notices that Lorelai has stopped in front of the market.)

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We need light bulbs.

speaker: RORY
words: We're fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're in the dark. It'll take a minute. I assume you won't come in.

speaker: RORY
words: Is it Wednesday?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Well then I can't, can I?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What does Wednesday have to do with anything?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing. I'll meet you at home.
(Rory walks down the sidewalk as Lorelai goes into the market.)
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Lorelai walks in the front door carrying shopping bags.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I'm back for round two. I got some silly string in case things get really ugly. (Walks into kitchen) Rory? Where are you? (Walks into living room.) Rory? Answer please. Rory?
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Emily and Richard are in the front hallway, both dressed up. Emily is trying to tie Richard's bow tie.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is the fourth ridiculous gathering you've dragged me to this week.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm the president of the board Richard, I have to be there.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Saving the Berringiny pansy. Who ever heard of such a thing?

speaker: EMILY
words: It's a very rare flower that is rapidly disappearing from the face of this earth.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, who cares?

speaker: EMILY
words: As president of the horticultural society, I have to care.

speaker: RICHRAD
words: The last thing I need is to spend four hours being bored out of my skull by the same people I'll be bored out of my skull by tomorrow night at the symphony fund-raiser.

speaker: EMILY
words: Which reminds me, we need to get your other tux back from the cleaners tomorrow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'll be dead tomorrow. I plan on flinging myself off the roof tonight right in the middle of Pittie Salinger's opening speech.

speaker: EMILY
words: Pittie Salinger is a dear friend and you will be nice to her.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Pittie Salinger is a dipsomaniac. I'm going to bring my newspaper. (Richard goes to find the newspaper)

speaker: EMILY
words: You will do no such thing. Richard, do you hear me?
(Doorbell rings. Emily answers the door and finds Rory standing there.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory!

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, is everything okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything's fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard! Richard, pay the cab.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Cab? Who took a cab?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory did.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What's Rory doing here? Hello Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't know what she's doing here. Just pay the man and I'll find out.

speaker: RICHARD
words: For Pete's sake. (walks out to pay the cab driver)

speaker: EMILY
words: Come inside. So tell me, what is going on?

speaker: RORY
words: I had a fight with mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: You had a fight with your mother?

speaker: RORY
words: I just couldn't take it anymore. I had to get out of there.
(Emily and Rory walk into the living room and sit on the couch.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Out of your house?

speaker: RORY
words: Out of that house, that town. Everything. I just had to go.
(Richard walks into the living room)

speaker: RICHARD
words: He tacked on an extra five dollars just for waiting. Feel like I'm back in Prague. Do you want a cocktail?

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, sorry, sorry. I'm just a little confused here.

speaker: RORY
words: You're all dressed up. You were going out. I'm so sorry!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, please, don't be.

speaker: EMILY
words: It doesn't matter, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry. Please go out. I didn't mean to ruin your evening. Oh I didn't think! I should've called.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now you calm down right now. You do not need to call before you come over here. You are welcome any time.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Tonight especially.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you want to talk about what happened?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, don't pry.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not prying, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: The girl obviously needs some peace.

speaker: EMILY
words: How do you know that?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can tell.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, you're a mind reader now, how nice. We'll get you a turban and a little booth by the train station.

speaker: RORY
words: Would it be okay if I stay here tonight?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, well, of course.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You can stay here as long as you want.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Would you like some dinner? I can get Rosa to make you something.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'd just like to go to bed if that's okay.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course. Whatever you like. Your room's all ready. There are pajamas in the dresser, and a new toothbrush in the bathroom. It's pink with sparkles. I thought you'd like it.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. (Rory gives Emily a hug, then walks over to hug Richard.) Goodnight Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Goodnight Rory.
(Rory starts to walk towards the stairs.)

speaker: EMILY
words: (to Rory) Everything's going to be fine. (to Richard) Richard, say something encouraging.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh Rory, I'm sorry you're upset, but I applaud your timing.

speaker: RORY
words: See you tomorrow. (Rory goes up to her room.)

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, what is all this about?

speaker: EMILY
words: She had a fight with Lorelai. . . . . and she came here.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Lorelai is walking around the living room on the phone.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mrs. Kim? It's Lorelai. Is Lane there? Well do you know where she is? Huh. That's unbelievable, you always know where she is. Um, the one time I need you to be crazy prison guard lady you're all, hey man whatever. Um, you know what, I will never be able to explain that to your satisfaction, so um could you just ask Lane to call me please when she gets back. I'm looking for Rory. No I don't know where she is. I uh. . don't "ha" me, you don't know where Lane is either. (Lorelai hangs up the phone)
(Sookie walks in the front door)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Patty hasn't seen her but she's been working all day. She's not at the library, and she's not at Luke's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is she? Why didn't she leave a note? Dammit!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey calm down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But Rory doesn't take off. She knows it would make me crazy. She knows it would make me worry. I'm crossing over into panic now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Don't cross. Come back.
(There's a knock at the door. Max walks in.)

speaker: MAX
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: MAX
words: You find her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, nothing. No one's seen her.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, um, what about that old boyfriend of hers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean! Dean!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: On my way. (Sookie leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good suggestion. You get crisis points. Max, I'm freaking out.

speaker: MAX
words: Its gonna be okay. Sookie's here, I'm here. We will find her.
(Phone rings. Lorelai runs into the living room to answer it.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: EMILY
words: I just thought I should let you know that Rory is here with us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: She arrived a few minutes ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's there? Is she okay?

speaker: EMILY
words: She's fine. She asked to spend the night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, um, she's there with you. So how did she get there?

speaker: EMILY
words: She took a cab.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, let me talk to her.

speaker: EMILY
words: She seems quite upset. She said you'd had a fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We had a disagreement.

speaker: EMILY
words: She said fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Will you just put her on the phone please, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I think we should give her a little time to collect herself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you for your input. Can I please talk to my daughter?

speaker: EMILY
words: She went to her room Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her room is here, Mom. I'm standing here looking at her room and she's not in it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I did not come to your house and kidnap this child. She ran from you and she came here. She's tired and she's upset. Now I think we should just let her sleep and in the morning we can argue about how to best handle the situation. Maybe a little time away from each other will do both of you some good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll pick her up in the morning.

speaker: EMILY
words: She has school tomorrow and her school is ten minutes from here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll pick her up after school.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don't you just call tomorrow when she gets back from school? Make sure she wants to go. You don't want to haul her back home just to have her jump in a cab again, do you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll talk to you tomorrow.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good night Lorelai.
(Lorelai hangs up the phone.)

speaker: MAX
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's with my parents in Hartford.

speaker: MAX
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good?

speaker: MAX
words: Bad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bad, very bad.

speaker: MAX
words: She's safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's with my mother. No one is safe with my mother.

speaker: MAX
words: She needed some space.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, that house is not safe. It's like the Amityville Horror without all the good times.

speaker: MAX
words: If it's that bad maybe you should go get her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, she wanted to get away from me. She wants to be alone. Give her her space.
(Lorelai walks into the kitchen. Max follows her.)

speaker: MAX
words: Are you okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe she left me to go there. We used to always be able to work this stuff out.

speaker: MAX
words: What did you two fight about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh you.

speaker: MAX
words: Me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it started with the you and the fact that I hadn't told her we were talking again, but I know that was only part of it because she's been in such a bad place lately with this whole Dean thing and so, I don't know, I guess it was coming. I just wish she hadn't run away.

speaker: MAX
words: Hey, she will be back and you two will work everything out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're good at the comforting thing, you know?

speaker: MAX
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want some coffee?

speaker: MAX
words: Sure. Can I ask you a question?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you've earned it.

speaker: MAX
words: Why didn't you tell Rory about us?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, she was just so upset about Dean, I didn't think it was the best time to give her my happy news.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay. But you've told other people?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what other people?

speaker: MAX
words: I don't know. Friends. Sookie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, no actually, I haven't.

speaker: MAX
words: Any reason?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just hasn't come up.

speaker: MAX
words: It hasn't?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: MAX
words: You're not by any chance avoiding talking to people about it are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Max, come on.

speaker: MAX
words: It just seems a little strange to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why is it strange?

speaker: MAX
words: Well we've been talking for at least two weeks. I would've thought at some point in there it would've come up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You just don't say to people out of the blue, 'Hey, Max and I are talking again.' I mean, I was just waiting for it to come up naturally.

speaker: MAX
words: Well yes, but somehow for me it managed to come up naturally within two days at three different times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you're obviously a much better people person than I am.

speaker: MAX
words: I just want to know if there's a reason why you don't want people to know. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max!

speaker: MAX
words: . . .then we should talk about that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's no reason.

speaker: MAX
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I'm sure.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you believe me?

speaker: MAX
words: If you said there's no reason, there's no reason.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's no reason.

speaker: MAX
words: So you've said.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I mean.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right.

speaker: MAX
words: That's fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I should page Sookie and tell her that Rory's okay.

speaker: MAX
words: That's a good idea.
(Lorelai walks to the phone.)
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(Emily and Richard are at the breakfast table. Rory walks in.)

speaker: RORY
words: Good morning.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, good morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandma, any thoughts on where my skirt might be?

speaker: EMILY
words: I gave it to Rosa to press. Here sit down, have some breakfast. Your skirt will be done by the time you're finished.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now, we have eggs, fruit, toast, pancakes, blintzes.

speaker: RORY
words: Anything would be fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, what do you usually eat?

speaker: RORY
words: Mostly I just grab a Pop Tart.

speaker: EMILY
words: That sounds delicious. I'll have Rosa whip one up for you.

speaker: RORY
words: No, eggs would be great.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'll go tell her. (Emily goes into the kitchen.)

speaker: RORY
words: So Grandpa, what's new in the world today?

speaker: RICHARD
words: As usual, it's going to hell in a hand basket.

speaker: RORY
words: Its nice to have something you can always count on.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is at that. Would you like part of the paper?
: Please.
(Emily walks out of the kitchen and sits down.)

speaker: EMILY
words: Your eggs will be right out.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: EMILY
words: So did you sleep well?

speaker: RORY
words: The bed was very comfortable.

speaker: EMILY
words: But you didn't sleep well?

speaker: RORY
words: No I did, I just. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: I talked to your mother last night. I told her you were going to stay here. She said she'd call this afternoon.

speaker: RORY
words: Was she mad?

speaker: EMILY
words: She was concerned. (pause) So do you get your lunch at school or do you bring it with you? Because Rosa made a fabulous leg of lamb yesterday. I bet it'd make a wonderful sandwich.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Take her up on that. It is good. And demand a slice of strudel.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. I demand some strudel.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good. So what's going on at school today?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, I have a test in Spanish.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hmm. Are you prepared?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah. I like Spanish. Biology on the other hand . . .

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I'm still waiting for the day when my knowledge of the inner workings of a frog's intestinal system can be applied to my work in the insurance industry.

speaker: RORY
words: Perhaps if you were insuring the frog.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah.
(The maid brings out Rory's breakfast.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. This looks great.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well good.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks again for letting me stay.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's nice having you here. You got your grandfather to put down his newspaper at the breakfast table. That's a first.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Aw now, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well it is.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Luke is behind the counter. Lorelai walks in and sits at the counter.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Geez, what happened to you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A happy 'how do you do' to you too.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry, you just look bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I didn't get much sleep last night.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory and I had a fight and she ran away.

speaker: LUKE
words: What! Where! Did you. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's fine. She's at my mother's.

speaker: LUKE
words: Geesh, throw that information in with the first part. You'll scare a person to death.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I got in my car three times to go get her. I drove halfway there and drove back, drove halfway there and drove back. I actually ran of gas driving halfway there and back.

speaker: LUKE
words: She'll cool off and come home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Just breaking up with Dean has been so hard on her.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just hate that she's going through this. I mean, she's such a good kid. She's so nice to everyone, she cares about everyone. And she's walking around in this unbelievable pain and there's nothing I can do about it. She still won't talk to me. She won't tell me what happened.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll tell you what happened. That Dean kid is a jerk and he finally let her know it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wish I could just pinch his head right off.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I warned him. I warned him when I first met him, if he hurt her . . Ah. Maybe I could key his car.

speaker: LUKE
words: Or better yet, you can key Taylor's car and tell him Dean did it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. That'd be good.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can key Taylor's car, tell him Dean did it and also tell him that Dean littered and walks his dog without a leash.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He'll run him out of town.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. I should go. Rory's probably out of school by now and I want to be home in case she decides to call.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coffee's on the house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh thanks. (stands up to leave) Hey, is that the belt I bought you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah yeah yeah. The old one broke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, lucky you happened to have a spare.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. Hey. She'll be home soon.
(Lorelai nods in agreement and then leaves.)
CUT TO MARKET

(Lorelai stands in front of the market thinking about going inside, then walks away. She walks back, then walks away again. She walks back a third time and goes in. She walks over to Dean, who is stocking shelves, and taps him on the shoulder.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got a minute?

speaker: DEAN
words: Actually I'm, uh. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just want to tell you that I think you are scum.

speaker: DEAN
words: Gee thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are gonna be hard pressed to find another girl as fantastic as Rory, you know that? She is beautiful and she is smart and she did not deserve to be treated that way by you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Treated what way?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought you were a good guy. I thought you were going to make her happy. I'm such an idiot that I actually thought you were a good pick. But I was wrong and I hate to be wrong.

speaker: DEAN
words: You know, I am sick and tired of everyone blaming this thing on me. I mean, you and the whole stupid town looking at me like I'm a criminal. I say 'I love you' and she just sits there and I'm the jerk? I'm the bad guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: You know what? Fine, think what you want, I don't care. Just leave me alone.
(Lorelai leaves. Dean finishes stacking the shelf.)
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
(The doorbell rings. Emily answers the door and Lorelai walks in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is she?

speaker: EMILY
words: I thought you were gonna call.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is she mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: I haven't had any time to prepare her for this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom where is she?

speaker: EMILY
words: Upstairs in her room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
(Lorelai walks up to Rory's room. Emily follows.)

speaker: EMILY
words: She got home from school but she just went right upstairs. Now she didn't want a snack but I had Rosa make her one anyway. I haven't checked to see if she's eaten it. She had a decent breakfast this morning but she did seem a little tired and when I went into her bathroom the aspirin bottle was out so I assume she had a headache. Now I don't know if it was last night or. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me, Mr. Cosell. I appreciate the play by play but I just want to talk to my daughter now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you want me to go in there with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: More than anything.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well try and be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks for the tip.
CUT TO RORY'S BEDROOM
(Rory is lying on the bed. Lorelai walks through the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, so I thought when you said, 'I'll see you at home,' you meant our home. My mistake.
(Rory gets off the bed and walks over to hug Lorelai.)

speaker: RORY
words: I'm so sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Its okay.

speaker: RORY
words: All those things. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: And then the. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Its no big deal

speaker: RORY
words: I'm just so. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I know, I know. So last time I saw you you were headed home, you wanna fill in the blanks?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. I just snapped and I got sick of everything. I wanted to go anywhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you picked hell?

speaker: RORY
words: It was the first place that came to mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I respect that. Listen, the need to run is a feeling I am very well acquainted with. But we have to be able to talk always. No matter how mad or upset we get with each other our particular special thing only works if we agree to that, get it?

speaker: RORY
words: I get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Rory, tell me what happened with you and Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want to talk about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I do.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I had a little chat with him today.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, because I was upset and I was in the mood to do a little yelling.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There he was stacking cookies and I'm railing on him about what a great kid you are and how it sucked that he dumped you, and then he said that he told you he loved you and I started feeling a little stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: He did tell me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you didn't say anything?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that must have been rough on him.

speaker: RORY
words: He looked so hurt. I didn't know what to do. I didn't want to hurt him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: I just got scared and I sat there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I understand. You know, I'm still learning this stuff too and since I'm still learning, I think I haven't thought enough about what I'm supposed to be teaching you.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm talking about my own personal lack of commitment skills. I mean, look, I love that you have my eyes and my coffee addiction and my taste in music and movies, but when it comes to love and relationships, I don't necessarily want you to be like me. I would hate to think that I raised a kid who couldn't say I love you.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not even talking specifically about Dean. I mean just generally in life. For example, say you're dating Taylor Hanson.

speaker: RORY
words: Why am I dating Taylor Hanson?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a hypothetical scenario, go with it. So, uh, you and Taylor have been seeing each other pretty regularly. .

speaker: RORY
words: How did I meet Taylor Hanson?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You went to his concert, you got backstage, your eyes met across the crowd and you've been seeing each other ever since.

speaker: RORY
words: Hanson's still together?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're the new Bee Gees. So. .

speaker: RORY
words: And why would you not stop me from going to a Hanson concert?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, someone's trying to make a point here.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry. Go ahead.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you and Taylor have been dating for awhile, and things are great, and, um, you're happy, and you feel all those crazy mushy things that people feel when they're in love. I want you to be able to say to him, Taylor, I love you.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, can we pick a new hypothetical 'cause this one's wigging me out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My point is that it's scary to be in love, that much I know, but it's also wonderful and special and if you can't say it or fully express it then you're never gonna be able to experience it and I want you to experience everything that's great because you're so great. Are you hearing me?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I'm hearing you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not saying you say "I love you" at the drop of a hat. It has to be right and real and it has to take a lot of thought. But someday with someone it will be right. I want you to be ready for that moment when it happens.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you ready for that moment when it happens?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm working on it. I do however know what dress I'll be wearing.
CUT TO FRONT HALL
(Richard, Emily, Rory and Lorelai are standing in front of the door.)

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you guys so much.

speaker: EMILY
words: It was our pleasure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do I owe you for the cab?

words: Thanks for sharing the paper.

words: Anytime.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And thank you mom.

words: Seven o'clock.

speaker: EMILY
words: Goodbye Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI

words: Well it looks like it's just the two of us again.

words: I guess so.
CUT TO INSIDE LORELAI'S JEEP

speaker: RORY
words: I was almost tempted to see if she could make a Pop Tart.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, home cooked breakfast, homemade lunch, I'm trying to remember why I left there. Oh yeah, my parents.

speaker: RORY
words: Funny, funny girl. (They drive by Lane's house.) Hey, let me out here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh okay.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll meet you back at the house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll show up this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll have the pizza waiting.

CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE

(Lorelai walks in the front door and puts her purse on the hall table. She walks over to the phone, picks it up and dials a number. She picks up her address book and walks over and sits on the couch.)

speaker: MAX
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, I'm starting with the 'A's. So first up is Richie Andrews. He's either a second cousin on my mother's side or the guy who regrouted the bathroom. Either way, I think he's going to be thrilled to hear about us.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai. .

speaker: LORELAI
words: After I've called everyone in here, I'm going to makes sure to spread the word at the inn.

speaker: MAX
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: "Welcome to the Independence Inn. Max and Lorelai are back together."

speaker: MAX
words: Can I see you after your dinner tomorrow night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I don't know. I have a lot of phone calls to make. Ooh! The Internet! Let's go global!

speaker: MAX
words: Good night Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Goodnight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey! Richie, it's Lorelai. . .
THE END

(Lorelai is asleep in bed. She is awoken suddenly by a loud banging noise.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dear God Almighty Mr. Mirkle!

(Rory is asleep in bed. Lorelai opens the door and looks in.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey!

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are not sleeping through this.

speaker: RORY
words: Through what?
(Lorelai walks over to the bed and leans over her.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: The freaking Blue Man Group is outside our house!

speaker: RORY
words: I was sleeping through it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: It had to have woken you up.

speaker: RORY
words: No my insane mother Margot Kidder Gilmore woke me up.
CUT TO FRONT PORCH
(Lorelai walks out the door onto the front porch. Luke is hammering the porch rail.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How are you today?

speaker: LUKE
words: Good, how are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good. What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: Fixing your porch rail.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right. You are. You're fixing my porch rail. . . . At six thirty in the morning!

speaker: LUKE
words: It was the only time I could do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: It was broken. I noticed last time I was here. It could hurt somebody.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, we sleep around here. Okay, we like it. It makes us pretty and keeps us from killing our crazy friends.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're gonna wake the neighbors.

speaker: LORELAI
words: UGH! Could you pound one more thing while you're out here? Your head! And a for-sale sign on the lawn because we're moving. So that's two things. The sign and your head. And in that order 'cause otherwise you'll be too dizzy to do the sign thing.
(Lorelai tries to walk back in the house, but the door is locked.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Oh shoot. RORY!

speaker: LUKE
words: You locked out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't exist! RORY!

speaker: LUKE
words: You shouldn't have closed the door.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah! RORY!
(Babette comes out of her house in her robe.)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Lorelai, sugar, you're waking up the entire neighborhood. Please!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me!
(Rory opens the front door)

speaker: RORY
words: I am officially annoyed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! Well, don't blame me, blame Lu. . .(She points to the porch rail where Luke was, but he is gone.) He was right here.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I know. (Rory guides Lorelai back into the house)

speaker: BABETTE
words: Get her back to bed doll.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He was banging on the. . .

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was something on the porch. It was broken.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not crazy.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He was banging on something.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. (Rory pulls Lorelai back in the house and shuts the door.)
(Opening credits)

speaker: INDEPENDENCE INN
words: INDEPENDENCE INN
(The phone is ringing. Michel is leaning on the front desk. Lorelai places a large stack of folders on the desk and starts separating them into piles.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, get that please.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I cannot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, we've been over this, we all cover the phone, that includes you.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Don't misunderstand. I want to answer it, I truly did, but today, today I am suffering from ennui.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ennui?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Severe ennui. You know what ennui is, yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Um, Webster's defines ennui as a lazy soon to be out of work French concierge who won't answer the phone.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Look, I've had my peace with the fact that everyone who calls here is a notch above brain dead, and that the pennies I am thrown each week are in exchange for me dealing with these people in a nonviolent manner. And usually that is fine, but today, sorry lady, I have ennui.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you're sleepy?

speaker: MICHEL
words: It's a metaphysical angst.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you wanna go beddy bye?

speaker: MICHEL
words: You make light, it increases my ennui.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, that's it. Come on you need coffee.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
(Lorelai walks in with Michel. Sookie is at the counter looking sad.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need coffee. Extra strong. Double cafe. Triple cafe. No, forget the cafe. Throw in the whole cow and serve it to this man right here! (pause) What's wrong with you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don't know. It might sound a little weird, but I think I've got . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ennui.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You explained ennui to her.

speaker: MICHEL
words: She asked me what was wrong with me earlier, so I told her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, you know that Sookie ends up thinking she's coming down with whatever illness other people else have.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nuh uh!
(Lorelai hands Michel a cup of coffee and he leaves.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no? What was that whole conversation last week when I had to convince you you didn't have a prostate.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh. How is Al?
(Lorelai's cell phone rings. She answers it.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello?

speaker: MAX
words: Is this a bad time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the hotel industry, but not for you.

speaker: MAX
words: I've only got a second, but I wanted to say hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: MAX
words: And thank you for last night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was a good night, wasn't it?

speaker: MAX
words: Several novels will be written about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I say we do it again, and next time, I'll be the gypsy queen.

speaker: MAX
words: Do you know the more I see you the more I want to see you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Same here.

speaker: MAX
words: It's like a vicious circle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's an achy feeling.

speaker: MAX
words: Like withdrawal pains.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Totally distracting.

speaker: MAX
words: Completely wonderful. Oh I gotta go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, don't!

speaker: MAX
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I gotta go.

speaker: MAX
words: Don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: MAX
words: This would be another example of a vicious circle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we should both go.

speaker: MAX
words: We definitely should.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So. . .

speaker: MAX
words: Hang up. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you hang up!

speaker: MAX
words: Vicious circle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye! (hangs up)

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You look happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, what's the opposite of ennui?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Off-ui. Oh, hey, I'm cured!
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
(Lorelai is sitting at the table. Rory is walking around the kitchen.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had the weirdest dream last night. We were in our house, but it wasn't our house, it was a Kentucky Fried Chicken.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm hooked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had to get dressed, but my clothes were in the back. And the guy manning the giant oil vat would not let me though.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God! That's so weird. When you said oil vat, that just reminded me, I had this dream last night we were swimming in a pool, only it wasn't water, it was like oil or honey or something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You totally did the thing.

speaker: RORY
words: What thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The thing where one person is describing their dream and it reminds the other person about their dream, and suddenly it's all about their dream and the first person is just standing there like, um, hey man, what about my dream.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, the oil vat guy was being mean.
(Rory sits down at the table.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. And we knew him. He used to live in town. He was that guy who used to run the auto body shop before Maven Hughes bought it. Remember him?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, you do. He's really skinny

speaker: RORY
words: Peter Stringbean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. That was the tall circus freaky guy who worked for him. This was the owner guy. What was his name?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you do. Come on. Ugh. It's gonna bug me all day. He was short and fat and his name was. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Johnny McShort-and-Fat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now, don't mock.
(Lorelai stands up and goes out the back door.)
CUT TO LORELAI'S PORCH
(Lorelai walks out of the back door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, who was the guy who used to run the auto body shop?
(We pan up to see Luke lying on the roof with a hammer.)

speaker: LUKE
words: The Stretch Cunningham guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, the Dick Tracy guy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Big, always had a half-smoked cigar in his mouth?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, him! What was his name? It was like Jim something or other.
CUT TO LORELAI'S FRONT CLOSET
(We hear Luke and Lorelai still talking outside while we watch Rory going through the front closet. She finds the Dean box and pulls it out.)

speaker: LUKE
words: Always had an ING at the end.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Uh, Banning.

speaker: LUKE
words: Glanning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dunning.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh! Hey! (Lorelai comes back into the house to tell Rory) Jim Dunning was the Dick Tracy guy. Jim Dunning, that's the Dick Tracy guy.
(Lorelai walks into the hallway, where Rory is standing with the Dean box.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. The Dean box. Okay, I know I was supposed to throw it away, but I couldn't. I mean, you're young and your head's all weird, and you don't have any perspective because of that whole young weird headed thing, so just please listen to me before you get mad. You're gonna want that stuff one day, when you're old and married, and looking back and thinking, I certainly had an interesting life. And then you can pull out all your old boyfriend boxes. Which is good, because I threw away stuff I'd kill to have today. Look, I put it in with the Max box so they could chat and keep each other company and commiserate about how they had Gilmore girl and lost a Gilmore girl and . . .sorry.
(Rory gives Lorelai a kiss)

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.
(Rory takes the Dean box into her bedroom. She sits on her bed and starts pulling everything out and looking at it.)
CUT TO SIDEWALK
(Rory and Lane walk out of a store. Rory is carrying French fries, Lane is carrying a drink. They start walking along the sidewalk.)

speaker: LANE
words: What I wanted to say was, Janie Fertman, you are a vacuous bimbo who will be turning letters as a profession one day. And the only way you'll know which letter to turn is when it dings and lights up. And I have no desire to stop and talk to you. Ever. But what I said was 'what Janie?' And then she goes, 'You're cheerleader material.' Cheerleader material! Just like that. I couldn't believe it! I almost went full matrix on her. Have you heard a word I've said?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LANE
words: I resent that. I'm a witty conversationalist.
(They stop in front of the market. Rory is staring in.)

speaker: LANE
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going in.

speaker: LANE
words: You can't.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going in.

speaker: LANE
words: It's Thursday afternoon.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: He works on Thursday afternoons.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: We're talking you know who.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh my god!

speaker: RORY
words: Calm down.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh my god!

speaker: RORY
words: You're making a spectacle.

speaker: LANE
words: You're getting back together with Dean!

speaker: RORY
words: If you keep jumping like that I'm gonna videotape it and send it to Janie Fertman as your cheerleader audition.

speaker: LANE
words: When did this happen?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing's happened. I don't even know what I'm doing exactly. Or what he's thinking or whether he's burned all my letters and pictures or hates me or what, but I'm going in.

speaker: LANE
words: I so encourage this. I love you, but you've been mopey, dopey, and about 12 other melancholy dwarves for the past 5 weeks and I miss the old Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I miss the old me too.

speaker: LANE
words: And I've been feeling bad for the new Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Well she's staging a comeback.

speaker: LANE
words: And may it be more successful than Peter Frampton's.

speaker: RORY
words: Wish me luck.

speaker: LANE
words: Luck!
CUT TO INSIDE MARKET
(Rory walks into the market. She's looking around for Dean but is stopped by Taylor Doose.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Taylor, you scared me.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What are you doing? You're walking around like . . .

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Dare I say, like a shoplifter.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I'm not here to shoplift.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, you currently fit 4 of the 8 characteristics.

speaker: RORY
words: I do?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You're alone, you look nervous, you're meandering in an aimless fashion, and you're wearing a baggy coat.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I tend to run cold.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: So what are you here for?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm looking for your checkout boy. I had a question and I didn't want to bother you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: He's stacking on six. (calls the checkout boy) Over here please! (He walks over.) Mikey, this is Ms. Gilmore, she needs some help. Take care Rory. Watch her.

speaker: MIKEY
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Hi. Uh, I was just wondering, do you like working here?

speaker: MIKEY
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, do you enjoy the whole boxboy trade as a profession?

speaker: MIKEY
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: No, okay, good. So, I'm just gonna cross that off my list. Thank you for your time.
CUT TO OUTSIDE THE MARKET
(Lane is waiting by the door. Rory walks out the door past her. Lane follows her down the sidewalk.)

speaker: LANE
words: Well?

speaker: RORY
words: He's not there.

speaker: LANE
words: But he always works Thursday.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess he's taking Thursday afternoons off now. That's not good.

speaker: LANE
words: How is that not good?

speaker: RORY
words: Because that means he's moved on.

speaker: LANE
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: Obviously he's met one of those Thursday afternoon girls.

speaker: LANE
words: What's a Thursday afternoon girl?

speaker: RORY
words: They're those slutty girls that get guys to switch their Thursday afternoons with another checkout guy so they can go do slutty Thursday afternoon things.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, you're reading way too much into this.

speaker: RORY
words: I shouldn't have gone in.

speaker: LANE
words: No it's good to go in.

speaker: RORY
words: Taylor thinks I'm casing the place. Like I would ever shoplift there.

speaker: LANE
words: You have shoplifted there.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, I'm gonna ask you a question and I want you to be more honest with me than you've ever been before in your life. Have you ever seen him with another girl at school?

speaker: LANE
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: You'd tell me, right?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes. No, I wouldn't because it would break your heart, but I haven't.

speaker: RORY
words: You swear? On the life of the lead singer of Blur?

speaker: LANE
words: On the soul of Nico, I swear to you that I have not seen Dean with another girl.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LANE
words: He's miserable.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LANE
words: Suicidal.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LANE
words: And in desperate need of haircutting.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
CUT TO CHILTON
(A bell rings. The empty hallway fills up with kids exiting their classrooms. Pan to Rory at her locker. Tristin walks over to her.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You should decorate this thing.

speaker: RORY
words: I did.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well I mean with something other than a bunch of dead black and white women.

speaker: RORY
words: What, like curtains?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know what I mean. I did mine up.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I saw that. The naked picture of the Siamese twins is particularly classy.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know what these are? (holds up two tickets)

speaker: RORY
words: They look like tickets.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: To PJ Harvey.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, you have good taste. I'll give you that.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You're into PJ Harvey, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, how'd you know?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Why, I'm all knowing.

speaker: RORY
words: How Godlike of you.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: One of these is for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I don't think we should go to a concert together.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Reason?

speaker: RORY
words: It would seem like a date.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well it would seem like a date because it would be a date.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't date you Tristin.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well I give you permission.

speaker: RORY
words: And on that humble note.
(Rory closes her locker and walks away. She's stopped by Madeline, Louise and Paris.)

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh, Rory, favor, big one. Look at the face.

speaker: RORY
words: Sure, what?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Can I get your biology notes from Tuesday, I was out.

speaker: LOUISE
words: To lunch.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Please.

speaker: RORY
words: Sure, I have them at home. I can bring them later.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Thank you, thank you, thank you.

speaker: PARIS
words: One more and you're done.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Thank you.
(Rory walks away)

speaker: MADELINE
words: So I've decided I'm now completely into Judy Garland. Did you see the TV movie? Pretty intense.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I think they used my mother's medicine cabinet in that.

speaker: MADELINE
words: She was the Courtney Love of her day.

speaker: PARIS
words: Show me a trend and I'll show you Madeline.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Judy Garland is trendy?

speaker: PARIS
words: Completely.

speaker: LOUISE
words: She was neo-addict retro chic.

speaker: MADELINE
words: No one tells me these things.
(They stop at Paris' locker, where Tristin is standing nearby)

speaker: PARIS
words: Hi.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Ooh, what are those?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, PJ Harvey tickets.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Really?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Cool.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Who are you going with?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Rory.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Rory's going out with you?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yes, she is. (Tristin walks away)

speaker: MADELINE
words: Wow, I didn't think she liked him.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Neither did I.
(Paris slams her locker and walks away.)

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hm, do you think she's mad?

speaker: PARIS
words: What are you two waiting for, a tram? Let's move!

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh yeah, she's mad.
CUT TO OUTSIDE OF MISS PATTY'S DANCE STUDIO
(Ballerinas are practicing their routine)

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Flutter flutter, quick quick, flutter flutter, quick quick. And your hearts are broken, your prince has betrayed you, you've been shot with an arrow, and now . . you're dead.
(Lorelai walks past the dance studio)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Patty.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Rachel.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Hey, have you seen Luke around?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, he's probably at the diner.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Nope, he's supposed to be at the diner, but he's not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well . .

speaker: RACHEL
words: We were supposed to meet for lunch, but he didn't show.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I made tuna.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, yeah, he usually comes back upstairs for a break between lunch and dinner, but recently he's been other places. Uh, your place actually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, well, Rachel, he's just fixing some things.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The porch rail, a couple roof shingles, then the porch rail again after he fell off the roof onto to the porch rail.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah, yeah, he's been telling me

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Look if you see him can you tell him to just, I don't know, check in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, will do.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
(Lorelai walks by the troubadour. The troubadour stops his song when he hears whistling, he looks across the street and sees another troubadour. He gives a pout towards the other troubadour.)
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Lorelai walks in the front door. She puts the mail on the hall table, then hears a noise upstairs.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello?
(She grabs an umbrella from the front hall. She hears footsteps around the corner. She walks towards them holding out the umbrella. She jumps into the living room.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold it right there! Oh! Oh!

speaker: LUKE
words: It's only me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You scared me half to death!

speaker: LUKE
words: Who'd you think it was?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I don't know! I heard some thudding upstairs and Rory weighs like ten ounces, and it either had to be an escaped elephant, or some strange large man who should not be in the house. How did you get in here anyway?

speaker: LUKE
words: Through the back door.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The back door's locked.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, that's why I came, the back door lock was broken.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The back door lock was fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: The back door lock was cheap.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The back door lock came with the house. It's been a very fine back door lock.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the kind of lock burglars look for.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why do burglars look for that lock?

speaker: LUKE
words: Because it's easy to break into. I proved that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You proved that by . . .?

speaker: LUKE
words: Breaking in through the back door.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God!

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the only way I could get in.
(Lorelai starts walking towards the kitchen. Luke follows.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have crossed over into the dark side Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's not that big a deal.
(Lorelai walks into the kitchen and sees the broken lock)

speaker: LORELAI
words: UH! You broke into my house!

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm gonna fix it!
(Luke walks over to the door and starts fixing it. Lorelai follows him.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! Step away from that lock.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get off. Come. Sit down. (Luke and Lorelai both sit at the kitchen table) You have almost no free time with all your work at the diner, and lately every spare moment has been spent not with Rachel.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's not true.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, she was looking for you today and she didn't know where you were.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not hiding from her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't say you were hiding from her.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sounded like you were implying it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well someone's sensitive about the accusation.

speaker: LUKE
words: I think I'm hiding from her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you are too.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's just a little weird having her in my place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought that's what you wanted.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was. Is. I'm just. . I've just been living alone since forever. And I just got use to putting the milk someplace in the fridge and finding it in the exact same spot. You know what I mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, we don't even keep milk in the house.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, then cookies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cookies almost never make it out of the car.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know what I mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Well maybe you can train Rachel to use a magic marker to mark the milk exactly where you left it.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's not just about milk. I'm not used to someone expecting me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Expecting you to. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: Come home, do things, be with her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, most people would kill to have that in their lives.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know, but I'm different, I'm a loner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no. No no. I don't want to hear about the romance of being a loner.

speaker: LUKE
words: Some guys are just naturally loners.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, lonely guys.

speaker: LUKE
words: Independent guys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sad guys.

speaker: LUKE
words: Maverick guys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lee Harvey Oswald.

speaker: LUKE
words: John Muir.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The unabomber.

speaker: LUKE
words: Henry David Thoreau

speaker: LORELAI
words: Every one of these sad and lonely guys.

speaker: LUKE
words: It just not what I thought it would be like having Rachel back. You know, it's not the fantasy I was toting around all these years.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Luke, life is not a fantasy. Maybe you have to lower your expectation bar a little bit.

speaker: LUKE
words: So you're saying that life is just settling for whatever comes along?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you think having Rachel is settling?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I didn't mean that. Rachel's great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And she's crazy about you. And if her worst trait is she's a milk whore, you have it pretty good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you just need to give this situation a fair chance.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that starts with ceasing work on the Winchester mystery house here.

speaker: Luke
words: Okay. Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.
CUT TO DEAN'S HOUSE
(Rory is standing in front of Dean's house. She pauses a moment before walking up to the door and knocking. A girl answers the door.)

speaker: CLARA
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, hi. How are you today?

speaker: CLARA
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, good.

speaker: CLARA
words: Are you here to see my brother?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. No. Not at all. I'm, um, with . . the Girl Scouts.

speaker: CLARA
words: I'm gonna be a Girl Scout someday. I'm a brownie now.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well good, that's an excellent stepping stone.

speaker: CLARA
words: Where's your uniform?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh we're not doing uniforms anymore. You know, we're trying to blend in, relate better to the average person. It was a very successful strategy for the Hari Krishnas, so. . .

speaker: CLARA
words: You look like someone.

speaker: RORY
words: I do?

speaker: CLARA
words: You're the girl in the pictures.

speaker: RORY
words: What pictures?

speaker: CLARA
words: The ones Dean has in his room.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean has pictures in his room?

speaker: CLARA
words: There's a funny one of you sticking out your tongue. He had a lot.

speaker: RORY
words: Wait, wait, has or had?

speaker: CLARA
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: You went from has to had, that's a big difference.

speaker: CLARA
words: It is?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. What's your name?

speaker: CLARA
words: Clara.

speaker: RORY
words: You're a pretty girl, Clara.

speaker: CLARA
words: Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: Now was it has or had?

speaker: CLARA
words: I don't know.

speaker: RORY
words: You do know Clara. Had is past tense. Has is present. Now think.

speaker: CLARA
words: I'm trying.

speaker: RORY
words: Can you go to his room now?

speaker: CLARA
words: He doesn't like me in his room.

speaker: RORY
words: Sneak in, he'll never no.
(Clara starts to cry.)

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no no no, Clara, don't cry. Oh, I didn't mean to make you cry. I'm a nice person. I'm a Girl Scout.
(Rory hears Dean's voice inside the house)

speaker: DEAN
words: Clara?

speaker: RORY
words: Bye!
(Rory runs away from the house. Dean comes to the door where Clara is crying.)

speaker: DEAN
words: What's the matter?

speaker: CLARA
words: She sacred me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Who?

speaker: CLARA
words: The Girl Scout.
(Dean looks down the street and sees Rory running away.)
CUT TO STREET
(It's nighttime. Lorelai, Rory, and Max are walking down the street. Lorelai and Max are carrying small grocery bags.)

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, we've got food, drink, reading material, chocolate covered espresso beans. Have I left anything out?

speaker: RORY
words: I think that about covers it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're such a good provider.

speaker: MAX
words: I try my best.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure you wanna go to this thing?

speaker: MAX
words: You've been talking about these town meetings for months. I've got to see one for myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, they're never dull.

speaker: RORY
words: And if you're lucky, you'll see some crazy lady throwing French fries at the people she disagrees with like last time.

speaker: MAX
words: So were they cold?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I was just full.

speaker: Max
words: Ah. Oh, oh, I forgot. (Max pulls out 2 RingPops of the bag) One for you and one for you.

speaker: RORY
words: What are these?

speaker: MAX
words: Those are rings. And the diamond is actually candy so you can eat it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max, that's very sweet, but we're not eight.
(Lorelai and Rory excitedly switch rings behind Max's back)

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you got?

speaker: RORY
words: Grape. Yours?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Red

speaker: RORY
words: Trade you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!
CUT TO INSIDE MISS PATTY'S DANCE STUDIO
(The town meeting has already started. Taylor is at the podium in front.)

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Enough, enough of this arguing. Its time to put this to a vote. All right now, let's see a show of hands. All those in favor. . . .
(Lorelai, Max and Rory walk in. Rory notices Clara and Dean in the back.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh rats. It started already.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: All those opposed. (Lorelai raises her hand) Lorelai, you don't even know what were voting on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but I'm a-gin it!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: All right, the nays have it. Let the record reflect it. Lorelai, I hope that's not food in those bags. Food is not allowed at town meetings.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Taylor its not. Its, um, diapers for the little ones.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dorsal fins and cucamonga.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What did she say

speaker: LORELAI
words: I confuse him till he loses his train of thought and then he moves on. Hot dog?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: All right, I'd like to open the meeting up for miscellaneous issues.

speaker: TROUBADOUR
words: I have an issue.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Who are you?

speaker: TROUBADOUR
words: The town troubadour.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: The what?

speaker: BABETTE
words: You've seen him Taylor, with his guitar.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Right, the guitar.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yes, he plays on all the street corners.

speaker: LUKE
words: He loiters on street corners.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: We're two peas in a pod Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Scary thought Taylor.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Go on honey.

speaker: TROUBADOUR
words: Thank you. I've been the town troubadour for six months now, and I think I've done a pretty good job and then, he shows up (points to other troubadour).

speaker: TROUBADOUR 2
words: Hey.

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: And there's no room for a second troubadour in Stars Hollow.

speaker: MOREY
words: Clearly.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This is hands down the silliest thing I have ever heard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hear them out Taylor. It can't hurt. (Taylor looks at the bag she's holding in her hand) These are not fries. They are farfignugen sugen dugen.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I opened the floor for issues of substance. This does not qualify.

speaker: MOREY
words: Note beyond cool Taylor. Music is substance.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Watch out Morey. After that anatomically explicit epithet your wife yelled at me earlier, you're both on probation.

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: All I'm asking is that the town troubadour laws be enforced.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: There are no town troubadour laws.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: There ought to be something.

speaker: KIRK
words: I've got the town handbook right here.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I don't get this people. This man is practically a vagrant. I mean, where do you even live? What do you do for a living?

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: I don't want people to know those things!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Why not?

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: Because that's part of being a troubadour.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What is part of being a troubadour?

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: The mystique!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, this is absolutely ridiculous. Do you subscribe to this troubadour mystique?

speaker: TROUBADOUR 2
words: I run a Kinko's in Groton.

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: You see, that proves it. He doesn't respect the code. You're not supposed to talk. You're not supposed to run a Kinko's. You're supposed to speak through your music. That's the whole point.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What is your scam buddy?

speaker: TROUBADOUR 1
words: My scam?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Because if you are using the fine people of Stars Holow to make a quick buck . . .

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: No Taylor, he doesn't accept money. I know, I tried.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: He may not now, but he will. This troubadour act is a money making scheme. Why else would he be doing it?

speaker: RORY
words: Because sometimes you have something you need to say but you can't because the words won't come out or you get scared or you feel stupid, so if you could write a song and sing it then you could say what you need to say and it would be beautiful and people would listen and you wouldn't make a complete idiot out of yourself, but all of us can't be songwriters so some of us will never be able to say what we're thinking or what we want other people to know that we're thinking so we'll never get the chance to make things right again ever. (Brief pause. She puts her hand on Troubadour 1's shoulder.) So give this guy a license. (Applause)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I liked that little speech.

speaker: CLARA
words: That's the Girl Scout.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: In the interest of not talking about this subject for another second, I hereby designate 'Mystique Guy' over here the official town troubadour. And no other troubadour may usurp his territory, meaning this other guy.
(Lorelai throws a French fry at Luke. He turns around.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want some fries? We have extra.
