speaker: LUKE
words: Nah, Rachel's minding the store so I should probably get going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I agree.

speaker: LUKE
words: I knew you would.
(Luke gets up and leaves. Max pulls Lorelai closer and gives her a kiss. Rory looks to where Dean was sitting, but sees that he left.)
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Luke walks in the diner. Rachel is behind the counter.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: Oh, you're back.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, nothing much pressing at the town meeting.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Okay. Well, the bread shipment's all put away, and I sent Caesar home since it was pretty dead.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good. Good call.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Thanks.
(Rachel picks up her luggage and walks out from behind the counter.)

speaker: LUKE
words: So you're leaving huh?

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Were you even gonna tell me?

speaker: RACHEL
words: I was waiting for you to get back so I could say goodbye.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, you at least always do that. So go.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Don't you even want to know why?

speaker: LUKE
words: I know why.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I don't think you do.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's just like all the other times Rachel. You're the anywhere but here girl, you're restless, you're bored, it is what it is.

speaker: RACHEL
words: That's not it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then what is it? Is there another guy?

speaker: RACHEL
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then what?

speaker: RACHEL
words: It's another girl.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? You telling me you're. . .

speaker: RACHEL
words: The other girl isn't for me Luke, it's for you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay. Now that's crazy.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Yeah?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: RACHEL
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: You feel you need a different excuse this time to mix things up a little, fine. But you are not leaving because of me.

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm sure you tried Luke. But admit it, you're heart wasn't in it.

speaker: LUKE
words: My heart was in it. I was here, I didn't leave. . . .I don't get this.

speaker: RACHEL
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: And what are you talking about, another girl. What other girl? (Rachel stares at him) Oh Rachel, no, you don't mean. . . She and I are just friends. I told you that a thousand times.

speaker: RACHEL
words: No. You told it to me once. And you could barely get it out then.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, this is crazy. You've got it wrong here. It's not. . .She and I are. . .uh. . .

speaker: RACHEL
words: I'm gonna go. I'll miss you (she hugs him goodbye) Stay in touch.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rachel, come on.
(Rachel walks to the door and stops. She turns around to look at Luke.)

speaker: RACHEL
words: So don't wait too long okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: To what?

speaker: RACHEL
words: To tell her. (Rachel leaves.)
CUT TO CHILTON COURTYARD
(Rory is walking to catch up with Madeline and Louise.)

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Madeline. I've got the notes you wanted.

speaker: MADELINE
words: No thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: No these are the ones you asked for. The biology notes from Tuesday. The other day you said you. . .

speaker: MADELINE
words: No thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: But. . What's wrong with her?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Nothing's wrong with her Mary.

speaker: RORY
words: Mary? Oh no, not this Virgin Mary thing again.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Not virgin. Typhoid.
(Paris is walking next to Rory. Rory notices Paris staring at her.)

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: You know, when we met at the beginning of the year, I didn't like you because I thought you were some rube from the sticks and I have no patience for rubes.

speaker: RORY
words: How very enlightening.

speaker: PARIS
words: But then I discovered that you're not so dumb. You even seemed modestly interesting at times. That's when I made a very big mistake. I let my guard down. That won't happen again.

speaker: RORY
words: What is all this about?

speaker: PARIS
words: It's about using people for your own sick ends. It's about making enemies where you should have made friends.

speaker: RORY
words: How did I make you my enemy?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh I think you know.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Was it setting you up with Tristin? I'm sorry about that. I thought I was just being nice.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh sure you did.

speaker: RORY
words: I helped you get ready. I loaned you my mother's clothes, which I still haven't gotten back by the way.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh my God, you're right. I hope those weren't the ones Skippy had her puppies on. I'll check when I get home.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell me what I did. Paris!

speaker: PARIS
words: Think about it at PJ Harvey.

speaker: RORY
words: Is that what this is about? I'm not going to PJ Harvey.

speaker: PARIS
words: Tristin says you are.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, then he lied.

speaker: PARIS
words: I saw the tickets.

speaker: RORY
words: He bought those tickets on his own.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, I'm over Tristin so don't back out on my account.

speaker: RORY
words: There's nothing to back out of.

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't have time for things like concerts anyway. I'm already lining up my extracurriculars for next year. By the way, are you still going out for the school paper?

speaker: RORY
words: You know I am.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're going to need a faculty recommendation.

speaker: RORY
words: I think I can swing it.

speaker: PARIS
words: And the support of the student editor.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not worried.

speaker: PARIS
words: Worry. I just got the job.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. Congratulations.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you. And don't worry, you'll have some role. How's covering the new parking lot landscaping sound?

speaker: RORY
words: Peachy.

speaker: PARIS
words: Too bad I already filled the spot for music coverage. You know, record reviewing and such. You'd have been perfect for it. I gave the job to Louise.

speaker: RORY
words: Louise owns two CDs.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah. Well, gotta go. Have a really good summer.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
(Doorbell rings. Lorelai comes down the steps, trying to put her shoes on.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're annoyingly on time again! Ugh. Okay, stairs then shoes, stairs then shoes. (Opens front door) Oh hi.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. You're all dressed up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm going out.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh sorry. I forgot my toolbox so I just thought I'd come pick it up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. It's right over here. Rory and I couldn't lift it or we would've brought it to you and then we got used to having it here, so we named it Bert and we'd say Goodnight Bert and it'd say Goodnight girls and we spend too much time home alone.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, thanks for taking care of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Our pleasure.
(Luke places the toolbox on the hall table.)

speaker: LUKE
words: So Rachel left.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What!

speaker: LUKE
words: Last night. She left. For good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, Luke I'm so sorry. What happened?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, it's hard to explain.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe it. I thought she was really in it for the long haul this time.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah well, she had her reasons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? What?
(Max knocks lightly on the front door and pushes it open.)

speaker: MAX
words: Hello? I'd tried to be late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh and an utter failure at one minute past.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, so uh, Max Medina this is Luke Danes. Luke owns the diner. He has the greatest coffee.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh right. I saw you at the town meeting

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah I saw you too.

speaker: MAX
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: MAX
words: Mm hmm. So, we should be going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I 'm gonna get going. I just left my toolbox from when I was here earlier fixing things. I do a lot of little things around here for Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, you're very handy. So Luke, we'll talk later.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes we will.

speaker: MAX
words: Although probably not tonight. We won't be back until late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I meant not tonight.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, I misunderstood.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I meant tomorrow. So tomorrow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Absolutely. We see each other most everyday.

speaker: MAX
words: Well sure, you've got the coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: And she needs the coffee. So I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Same time as always.

speaker: MAX
words: I'd count on a little later.

speaker: LUKE
words: Doesn't matter what time it is. I'll always be around.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. (Luke leaves.)

speaker: MAX
words: So are we going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yeah. Just wanted to make sure you two were through swinging those things around. Someone's bound to lose an eye.

speaker: MAX
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I'll get my purse.
(Lorelai walks into the living room. Max follows her.)

speaker: MAX
words: So not to be blunt, but is that over?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is what over?

speaker: MAX
words: Whatever's going on that I just walked in on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Max, come on, that's Luke.

speaker: MAX
words: I kind of picked something up there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well, drop it back on the ground and kick it under the couch, because there is no there there.

speaker: MAX
words: Hey, it's okay. I mean, we were apart for quite a while. I never assumed you joined a convent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max.

speaker: MAX
words: I mean, it's not like I didn't date while we were apart.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You dated?

speaker: MAX
words: A little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little person?

speaker: MAX
words: No, I dated a little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well, I didn't expect you to join a manvent or whatever the male equivalent of that is called. Who did you date?

speaker: MAX
words: A monastery.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You dated a monastery?

speaker: MAX
words: No, a monastery is the male equivalent of a convent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you Mr. Medina. I'll make a note for the quiz on Friday.

speaker: MAX
words: I didn't know if I'd ever see you again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I get it. Yes. We were apart. And, uh, you know, I didn't exactly remain inactive.

speaker: MAX
words: So you did date Luke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I did not date Luke.

speaker: MAX
words: You can tell me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not date Luke.

speaker: MAX
words: There was a vibe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There was no vibe. What is with the questioning? You won't tell me who you dated.

speaker: MAX
words: There's no one you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, did you date like casual nothing type dating or did you date like get down, soul train kind of a dating?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I wouldn't have phrased it that way, but to be honest, it was the latter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good. Okay. Well, I like your honesty. Because I mean you could've lied and left that part out to spare my feelings which would've been unnecessary. So thank you, that was good. I slept with Rory's dad.

speaker: MAX
words: Let's change the subject.

speaker: LORELAI
words: On my parents' balcony.

speaker: MAX
words: I want to change the subject.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well you started it.

speaker: MAX
words: I did not mean for this to become a who slept with whom contest.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, how did it get that way?

speaker: MAX
words: I don't know. Why do we do this? Why do we let it get weird between us just when it's getting good again?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.

speaker: MAX
words: I don't like it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't either.

speaker: MAX
words: And I'm sick of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so am I.

speaker: MAX
words: We can't keep getting this close just to have something completely derail us again. And frankly there's only one thing I can think of that could solve it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Break up.

speaker: MAX
words: Ugh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm not interested in a murder-suicide kind of thing. .

speaker: MAX
words: We should get married.
(pause)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give me a clue as to whether you're kidding or not.

speaker: MAX
words: I am not kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good clue.

speaker: MAX
words: What do you say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Max, you did not just propose to me.

speaker: MAX
words: Yes I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. A proposal had to be something more than the desperate desire to end a bickering match.

speaker: MAX
words: It was more than that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it has to be planned. It should be magical. There should be music playing and romantic lighting and a subtle buildup to the popping of the big question. There should be a thousand yellow daisies and candles and a horse and I don't know what the horse is doing there unless you're riding it, which seems a little over the top, but it should be more than this.

speaker: MAX
words: You're right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am right.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay.

speaker: MAX
words: Let's start the evening over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ding dong.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, now I'm five minutes late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you're making good progress.

speaker: MAX
words: Let's go?
(Lorelai follows Max toward the front door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye bye Bert.
(They both leave.)
CUT TO OUTSIDE CHILTON
(Tristin is waiting against the wall for Rory. As she walks past, he walks next to her.)

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So I'm a little tired of this game.

speaker: RORY
words: What game?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Are we meeting there or what?

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: The concert's tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I hope you and the empty seat next to you have a lot of fun.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I'm started to get a little irritated here.

speaker: RORY
words: So am I.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What are you mad about?

speaker: RORY
words: You've been telling everyone that I'm going to this thing with you.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Just a couple.

speaker: RORY
words: You told Paris. Paris and I had just started getting along and now she hates me again.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, the damage is done. You might as well go to PJ Harvey with me.

speaker: RORY
words: Never never. I am never going anywhere with you ever.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know, these tickets cost me a fortune.

speaker: RORY
words: They cost your daddy a fortune.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I don't even know anybody else who's even into this stupid guy.

speaker: RORY
words: PJ Harvey's a woman.
(Tristin grabs Rory's books)

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You'll get them back when you agree to go with me.

speaker: RORY
words: You're pathetic Tristin. Keep the books. I'm leaving. (Sees Dean in the parking lot) Dean? (Walks towards him) Dean. What are you doing here?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm leaving.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't go.

speaker: DEAN
words: I shouldn't have come.

speaker: RORY
words: No wait.

speaker: DEAN
words: I feel like an idiot.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: DEAN
words: 'Cause I come all the way out here and I see you with him. That's just great.

speaker: RORY
words: No, Tristin was just . . .

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't care.

speaker: RORY
words: No listen.

speaker: DEAN
words: He's got your books Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: But he took them and wouldn't give them back. Please just tell me why you're here.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't even know.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes you do.

speaker: DEAN
words: 'Cause I thought you . . Forget it.

speaker: RORY
words: No say it.

speaker: DEAN
words: I thought you were trying to talk to me.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, you came to my house.

speaker: RORY
words: That wasn't me.

speaker: DEAN
words: It was you.

speaker: RORY
words: It must've been someone that looked like me.

speaker: DEAN
words: My sister recognized you from the pictures in my box.

speaker: RORY
words: In what box?

speaker: DEAN
words: The box of stuff I have of us. Pictures and letters and everything from you.

speaker: RORY
words: You have a Rory box?

speaker: DEAN
words: And what was going on at the town meeting, all that stuff about writing a song?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know what I was talking about.

speaker: DEAN
words: That had nothing to do with me? Well I must have imagined it all then. Your boyfriend's waiting.

speaker: RORY
words: He's not my boyfriend. I hate him.

speaker: DEAN
words: Whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: What.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why.

speaker: RORY
words: Because I love you, you idiot.
(Dean walks over to her and they kiss. Tristin puts Rory's books down on the ground and walks away.)
CUT TO FRONT OF THE INDEPENDENCE INN
(Michel is arguing with Kirk in front of the door. Lorelai comes running up to them)

speaker: MICHEL
words: Do you understand what I'm trying to explain to you? Do you speak English? Are you listening to me? Ah, what took you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, I got here as quickly as I could. Hi Kirk.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Do not address him. He's a scoundrel.

speaker: KIRK
words: I'm just doing my job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's going on?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Am I or am I not the head man in charge of floral deliveries?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and one of the few men I know who would proudly declare that fact.

speaker: KIRK
words: I'm just doing my job.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Stop saying that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This has to do with flowers we ordered?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Flowers we did not order.

speaker: KIRK
words: I'm just doing my job.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Say that one more time and I'm going to punch your nose.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It must be a mistake.

speaker: KIRK
words: There's no mistake.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I did not order these flowers.

speaker: KIRK
words: It says that you have to be here to personally accept them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That I have to be here? Well that's. . . .

speaker: MICHEL
words: I am head man in charge of flowers.

speaker: KIRK
words: I just do what I'm told.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I warned you to stop saying that.
(Lorelai walks inside the inn)
CUT TO INSIDE THE INN
(Lorelai comes through the door)

speaker: KIRK
words: That's not what I was saying before.

speaker: MICHEL
words: It is a little variation that will still lead to a punch on the nose.
(Michel and Kirk come through the door)

speaker: MICHEL
words: Daisies no less. As if I would order these pitiful little things. Foul things, these daisies. And just a notch up from weeds. And look how many. I mean, there must be at least. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: A thousand of them. A thousand yellow daisies.
(Pan around inn's lobby, which is filled with daisies. Lorelai walks into the middle and them and looks around.)

speaker: KIRK
words: That's right. There's exactly a thousand of them. The order states that there is to be exactly 1000. Not 1001, not 999, but 1000. You ask for 1000, I bring 1000. I don't question the orders. I merely fill them.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Job well done, Mr. Adolph Eichmann.
(Lorelai sits down on a table in the middle of all the daisies, pulls out her cell phone and calls Max.)

speaker: MAX
words: I couldn't find a horse.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't have to.

speaker: MAX
words: Don't say anything, okay, please. You were right last night. I shouldn't have proposed to you like that. It was stupid. It was the wrong place, and the wrong time, and I kicked myself the entire night for doing it. But you were wrong about something too. I didn't propose to you because we were fighting. I proposed because I love you. We're in a bad pattern Lorelai and we have to break it. And other than that murder suicide thing you were talking about, which would be illegal and messy, I can only think to be impetuous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max.

speaker: MAX
words: No, listen, I woke up this morning and I realized that I have studied and talked a great literature all my life and those stories are replete with characters that let opportunities slip by. But what I teach is more than just literature, its lessons in life. And if I don't follow the tenants of those lessons, I'm not the man I thought I was. The man I want to be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, you talk so good.

speaker: MAX
words: I don't want an answer now. I've thought about this. I want you to do the same. I love you Lorelai Gilmore. And I know this to be true. I'll talk to you later. (They both hang up)
(Lorelai looks around at the daisies)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my . . .
CUT TO STREET
(It's nighttime. Lorelai is walking down the sidewalk. She passes the town troubadour, who's in mid-song. Troubadour 2 walks by and the official troubadour nods for him to join in.)
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
(Luke is standing at a table pouring coffee for Kirk when Lorelai bursts through the door.)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory!

speaker: LUKE
words: Geesh, you made me spill.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry! Uh, she's not here?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, what's the matter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I sent her a message to meet me here at 7 and she's supposed to meet me here at 7, so what time is it?

speaker: LUKE
words: Seven.

speaker: KIRK
words: I'm damp. (Luke throws a towel on Kirk's table)

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is she?

speaker: LUKE
words: Calm down, is everything okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, maybe, I think so. I don't know.

speaker: LUKE
words: So what's going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Big things. Big potentially life-changing things.

speaker: LUKE
words: You get a promotion?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, they made me head salesman of the Northwest Territories. No I run an inn, there's no place to promote me too.

speaker: LUKE
words: So it's nothing to do with work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is she?

speaker: LUKE
words: Have some coffee while you wait.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I couldn't take coffee, big hole, through the roof, very bad.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're saying no to coffee. This is big. Can't tell me what it is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just really need to tell Rory first.

speaker: LUKE
words: But you're happy about this news.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I might be. Maybe. It's just kind of a, wow I can't believe this is happening to me kind of a mindblowing moment. . (pager beeps) Oh there she is! I'm gonna go (hands Luke a daisy) The whole town gets one today.
(Lorelai leaves)

speaker: LUKE
words: Bye
CUT TO OUTSIDE THE DINER
(Lorelai is outside in front of the diner. She sees Rory down the street. They smile and run towards each other. They talk at the same time.)

speaker: LORELAI/RORY
words: You first! (They laugh) You first!
(Pan back to an overhead shot of the gazebo as they jump up and down excitedly in the street.)
[OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW]
[Camera pans around the center of town, which is covered in yellow daisies. Lorelai and Rory are crossing the street.]

speaker: RORY
words: You should get married in Italy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All the way from home, same topic. There's tons of stuff going on in the world. Big stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: Like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Balkans.

speaker: RORY
words: That was ages ago. Read a paper.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. They make my hands black.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh! You should walk down the aisle to Frank Sinatra with a huge bouquet of something that smells really good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pot Roast.

speaker: RORY
words: And you should wear a long veil with your hair up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, I'll take any other subject in the world for two hundred Alex.

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you want to think about this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I haven't made my mind up about the yes or no part, so I don't want to start fantasizing about dresses and flowers or doves and tulle until I do, so please change the subject.

speaker: RORY
words: I think the bridesmaids should be able to pick their own dresses.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know how on All in the Family when Edith would be yapping about something and Archie would pretend to make a noose and hang himself or shoot himself in the head?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Something about this moment just made me think of that.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, I'm done. I'm taking these to Lane.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Meet me at Luke's.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, get me a paper please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But my hands!
[OPENING CREDITS]
[CUT TO LANE'S HOUSE]
[Rory walks in carrying flowers as Lane is arguing with her mother.]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No!

speaker: LANE
words: A time frame?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No, no more talking.

speaker: LANE
words: But Mama, please just tell me!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: It's not for you to think about. All under control.

speaker: LANE
words: Just give me a hint.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Children will know what their parents think they can handle.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm sorry, was that the hint?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I have to work. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I came to bring you some of my mom's flowers.

speaker: LANE
words: Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you okay?

speaker: LANE
words: No, I'm not okay.

speaker: RORY
words: What's wrong? Did she find your CD burner?

speaker: LANE
words: My mother and father are sending me to Korea for the summer to visit my cousins.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LANE
words: They're sending me to Korea and they won't tell me when I'm coming back.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean they won't tell you when you're coming back?

speaker: LANE
words: I mean, they bought me a one way ticket. One way! The plane goes there and stops!

speaker: RORY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LANE
words: I called the airline to confirm it, and my parents were in their room whispering all morning. And when my mother came out, she looked very happy. She was humming. I swear, they're planning to send me Korea for the rest of my life.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane, come on.

speaker: LANE
words: It's gonna be just like that Sally Field movie when her husband took them to Iran and wouldn't let them come back, except that I won't have to keep my head covered.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, calm down.

speaker: LANE
words: Calm down? Are you listening? I am being shipped off to Korea!

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I think you're freaking out a little prematurely.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I mean, let's think about this. Maybe there's some deal with the airline and that's why the ticket's one way. Or maybe they haven't worked out the plans with your cousins yet. Or there's a weather consideration or a holiday you don't know about or. . .Wow, I'm really gonna miss you.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] Lane, come here please!

speaker: LANE
words: I have to go. You've been a good friend.
[CUT TO NEWSSTAND]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Bootsy.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: So, apparently they shoot a gland from a pig's head in Ivana Trump's read end twice a month to keep her looking young.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, hope she's not Kosher.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I don't know, doesn't say here.
[Lorelai buys a paper, then stops to stare at the bridal magazines]

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [startled] Hey, what, nothing, what. . .pas?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: You a Leo?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Thank God. Those guys are screwed this week.
[Lorelai takes one of the Bridal Magazines, starts flipping through it]

speaker: RORY
words: What'cha reading?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God, do not sneak up on a person like that.

speaker: RORY
words: InStyle Weddings. Very interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not very interesting.

speaker: RORY
words: Get any ideas?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we should have cake more often.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Bootsy, I'll take this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no. I just. . .don't. . .

speaker: BOOTSY
words: It's six bucks.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Lorelai!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh geez.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: So….

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: InStyle Weddings! You said yes!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, not yet!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Yet! She said yet!

speaker: RORY
words: I know!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm right here.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: He's a good man?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, he's a great man.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh I love this! I just love this! Have you told Luke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, no, it just happened last night. Oh Patty, stop it. I'll tell him. It's not that big a deal if he just finds out.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, whatever you say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh, it just so happens we are on our way over there now to have some breakfast, and I'll tell Luke them.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Be gentle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Patty, me and Luke are just friends.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Just friends. Yes, yes, I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's true.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay lets go.
[Lorelai and Rory start walking towards Luke's. A group of townspeople follow them.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it is.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is with this place? Why will nobody believe me?

speaker: RORY
words: They believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No they don't.

speaker: RORY
words: I promise they believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are pacifying me.

speaker: RORY
words: Just a little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I don't like it

speaker: RORY
words: I'll see if I can stop.
[They turn around and see all the townspeople behind them.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't wait for the movie theater to reopen.
[CUT TO INSIDE LUKE'S DINER]
[Lorelai and Rory sit down. The townspeople press themselves up against the windows.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Let's see, what looks good. I'm so unbelievably hungry I'm gonna have to order breakfast and lunch, crazy huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, go tell him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will.

speaker: RORY
words: Now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because in five minutes somebody's about to be pushed through that window.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is crazy. Why is everybody making such a big deal about this?

speaker: RORY
words: Because everyone knows that Luke has a thing for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke does not have a thing for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, we can barely get through a single conversation without biting each other's heads off.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Everything about me repulses that man. My coffee drinking, my eating habits. Remember when I called him Ranger Bob last week, he hated that!

speaker: RORY
words: Will you get me a muffin when you're up there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. God. Fine. [walks over to Luke at the counter] Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Fresh coffee will be ready in a minute unless you wanna just roll up a dollar bill and go nuts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No thanks, I can wait.

speaker: LUKE
words: [sees the people in the window] What the hell's going on with them?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know.

speaker: LUKE
words: Crazy people. Whole town should be medicated and put in a rec room with ping pong tables and hand puppets. What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I. . . well, I have something to tell you. No I have something to share with you actually.

speaker: LUKE
words: To share with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, 'cause when exciting things happen in your life, you want to share them with the people in your life who you think will find them exciting, which I think you will.

speaker: LUKE
words: What is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it's very. . .

speaker: LUKE
words: Exciting, I've heard. I'm all prepared to jump up and down if necessary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, here it is. Um, Max has asked me to marry him.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I figured.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, it was obvious. You know, you too were getting kind of close. He was around a lot. Then last night with that life changing thing comment, you know, I put two and two together and figured it out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Congratulations by the way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You set a date?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I haven't answered him yet.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're gonna say yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How do you know?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, you're making a big deal about telling me he proposed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I don't think I'm making a big deal.

speaker: LUKE
words: And you wouldn't do that if you weren't gonna say yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'm sharing something with you. Sharing is not making a big deal, sharing is a nice gesture. Like when you're a kid and you have one of those popsicles and you break it in two and offer half to another kid. That is sharing, that is what I'm doing.

speaker: LUKE
words: You offered me half a popsicle?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Okay, so now you know.

speaker: LUKE
words: Now I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I guess I'll just have two blueberry muffins and some coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, I think it's good you're doing this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do? Good, me too. I mean, not that I'm definitely doing it, but if I do, then it'll be good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Where you gonna live?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Here? Hartford?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here. I don't know, we haven't talked about it actually.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hartford's probably good, closer to Rory's school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, I guess.

speaker: LUKE
words: Of course, it is a little far from the inn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: But who knows how long you'll work after you're married.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, but you probably already talked about that, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, no, but I do think he and my father have come to an agreement on how many goats I'm worth.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, I'm just talking here. It's great, really. You gonna have more kids?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, personal.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, he wants kids right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In the world? Yes, he wants kids.

speaker: LUKE
words: You haven't talked about that either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you know, what we have and have not discussed is none of your business.

speaker: LUKE
words: Joint checking accounts?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke!

speaker: LUKE
words: You do know his last name don't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want my popsicle back.

speaker: LUKE
words: Fine, it's your business.

speaker: ORELAI
words: Yes it is. It's my business.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, some people go their entire lives without having these kinds of conversations. My parents didn't discuss a damn thing my entire childhood. Worked fine for them. Of course, when my mom died she had to tell my dad where the coupon drawer was. Took him ten years to find it. Used a coffee can the whole time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't care what anybody says, a coupon can is not as good as a coupon drawer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How are those muffins coming?

speaker: LUKE
words: But you know what, you might like a coupon can. You never know. Here you go. Two blueberry muffins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: And congratulations again.
[Lorelai walks back to the table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now what's going on?

speaker: RORY
words: Kirk passed out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here's your muffin.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. How'd he take it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, he took it fine.
[CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE]
[Rory and Lorelai pull up out front]

speaker: RORY
words: Are you okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, I'm just tied to the emergency break.

speaker: RORY
words: How did you do that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: With a flourish and a big ending. Okay, I got it. Let's go. Oh, my coat.

speaker: RORY
words: It's pretty warm out for a coat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, it tends to cool off the minute I get in that house.

speaker: RORY
words: You good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm good. My keys.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're in the ignition. Okay, I got 'em. Let's go.

speaker: RORY
words: What is wrong with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: You got lost coming here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I took a wrong turn.

speaker: RORY
words: Six times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, my self preservational instincts at work ladies and gentlemen.

speaker: RORY
words: And then the coat and the keys and the . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got stuff on my mind.

speaker: RORY
words: Max stuff?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, stuff stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: You're lying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm being mysterious. That's what women do.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh look, doorbell. Pretty sound.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, you always make me tell you what I'm thinking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and the lesson we have learned from that is you should never become a spy.
[Emily opens the door]

speaker: EMILY
words: You're here. Richard, they're here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [from another room] Wonderful!

speaker: EMILY
words: Come in, come in, come in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, no.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you're scaring Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh stop that. Get in here. Scaring Rory, you're so silly sometimes. Let's get you a drink. Put your coat down. Oh, and are you hungry? I had Antonia make some Roqueford puffs. Antonia, bring the puffs! Come, sit down, sit down. Richard!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Say nothing until I get there.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, hurry up!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, what's going on? Ooh, the nails, the nails, the nails.

speaker: EMILY
words: So, tell me what's new with you girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandma, what about you? Did something special happen?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, as a matter of fact. Oh for goodness sake. Richard, dammit!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, why don't you just tell us what's happening now?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, all right. I can't wait for your grandfather any longer. Well, you know I'm very good friends with Bitty Charleston, the headmaster's wife.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm Hmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, we had this little arrangement where she keeps me aprised of all the goings on at Chilton. You know, she tells me all the gossip on the students and their parents, and any piece of information I might find useful. Well, this afternoon she called to tell me the class list just came out, and Rory has finished in the top three percent!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: EMILY
words: You do? Well, who do you know at Chilton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: It wasn't definite, but I had a pretty good idea.
[Richard walks in]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, wonderful news. You finished in the top three percent of your class.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, Dad, J. Edgar Hoover over here was just telling us.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What? I told you not to say anything before I got here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, you took too long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, we already knew.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's a simple request.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just hang up the phone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, good news either way. Let's all agree on that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am immensely proud of you Rory.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, we knew you could do it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, we certainly did.

speaker: EMILY
words: We have to celebrate. Next week we will have a special dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, all of your dinners are special.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, this one will be extra special. We'll make all your favorite foods, and you can invite some of your friends.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There's an excellent chance that presents might be involved.

speaker: RORY
words: You guys do not have to do this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: For the top three percent?

speaker: EMILY
words: We most certainly do.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You start late, have to catch up, and by the end of the year, you've overtaken everyone. A true Gilmore.

speaker: EMILY
words: Through and through.

speaker: ANTONIA
words: Dinner is ready.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you Antonia. Shall we?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah ah ah ah, after the top 3 percent in her class.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, thank you very much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, just go ahead and Start without me. I gotta check in at the inn. Michel's there by himself, people could die.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, hurry up.
[Lorelai dials her cell phone and walks out onto the back patio.]

speaker: MAX
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where are we gonna live?

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where are we gonna live?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your house, my house?

speaker: MAX
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, we should figure this stuff out. I have a life and a kid, and both of them require a house of some sort.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, but. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I have stuff. I have a lot of stuff. You haven't seen my closet yet, but you would not believe the amount of stuff one person can accumulate. I don't even know what this stuff is, but it's there and it's mine and it needs a place to live.

speaker: MAX
words: Well. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I want to work.

speaker: MAX
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I like my bank.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay hold on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's small and the teller's name is Margie and she can't count. And I think there's something so poetic about banking at a place where the teller can't count.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: Calm down. Talk to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's just. . . . If I die, I want you to know where the coupon drawer is.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I would like that too. I think.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we need to figure these things out before. . .

speaker: MAX
words: Before what? Are you saying yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: Are you saying yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you asking me that?

speaker: MAX
words: Because you call me, out of the blue, completely panicked about where we're gonna live and bank and coupon drawers and Margie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, these are important things to discuss.

speaker: MAX
words: I agree. They're extremely important things to discuss, especially if you're saying yes. Are you?
[CUT TO DINING ROOM]

speaker: EMILY
words: I am extremely thrilled about this. Do you think you'll get a certificate?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sure.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, they certainly should give you a certificate or a plaque or something. I'll talk to Bitty about that tomorrow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can't wait to tell Tellman McCabe about this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, he's always bragging about that simpleton grandson of his.

speaker: EMILY
words: William is a lovely boy.

speaker: RICHARD
words: His head is shaped like a football.

speaker: EMILY
words: It is not.

speaker: RICHARD
words: If he fell asleep in the park, someone would try to punt him.

speaker: EMILY
words: Tellman is a very dear friend of yours.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes he is. And one should always share wonderful news with one's very good friends.

speaker: EMILY
words: You just want to brag.
[Lorelai walks to dining room doorway. Rory looks at her.]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I think I have a right, don't you?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well goodness, you'd think you were the one who finished in the top three percent of your class.
[Lorelai smiles and nods to Rory]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well it was my genes, I get to claim a little responsibility.
[Rory screams, jumps up, and runs over to hug Lorelai]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh!

speaker: EMILY
words: Goodness.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I just spilled on my shirt. What are you doing? What are they doing Emily?

speaker: EMILY
words: I have no idea. Stop that you too!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: What is going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I'm just really jazzed about this whole three percent thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, really really jazzed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. [more screaming and hugging]

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't even try to understand Richard. Antonia, please bring some club soda for Mr. Gilmore's shirt.
[CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN'S KITCHEN]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Carlito, we're running out of clarified butter. Ooh, chop that finer. No hard boiling. Yo profiero tener los huevos suave. Ooh, that looks good. Add a little pinch of oregano, I think we've got it.

speaker: DELIVERY MAN
words: Okay, I got your lobsters.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah? Are they good? Ooh, they look good. Yes they do. Ow! It's got my hand. It's got my hand. Thanks. Okay, I'll be fine, I'll be fine. I'm a good cotter, don't worry. You are fresh, aren't you? Okay, in the back, in the back, in the back. Michel, I'm gonna need you to move.

speaker: MICHEL
words: In a minute.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What are you doing?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I am weighing my turkey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why?

speaker: MICHEL
words: A group of scientists did a study on rats where they cut their daily calories by thirty percent.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you felt left out?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, the rats lived thirty percent longer. And the scientists were so impressed that they cut their own calories just like the rats.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That was a very nice display of solidarity.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I have decided to do the same. I figure if I stay alive long enough, these scientists, they will be able to cure anything including death, therefore ensuring my indefinite existence.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So you're gonna live forever, like on Fame?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Don't speak to me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Give me back my scale.
[Lorelai walks into the kitchen.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. I have an announcement to make, and it's big and it's fabulous and you are not gonna believe it.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Goodbye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, I got news.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, well I'm sure it's very exciting. Excuse me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But. . . What's with the turkey?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, Michel thinks he's gonna live forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like on Fame?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's what I said!

speaker: MICHEL
words: Hmm, a hundred years from now I will sit around telling my fellow man of science about the two of you and we will giggle like little girls at your ignorance. Now I have work to do. [Michel leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did say "giggle like little girls" right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Forget him. Tell me about your fabulous news.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm engaged.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm getting married.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!

speaker: SOOKIES
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: God, this is amazing! Oh my God, I'm shaking! Max is a wonderful man. It is Max, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it is Max.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, good good good. Oh, I knew it. I knew you'd get engaged.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? God, I didn't.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're gonna be a sadie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A sadie. [sings] "Sadie, sadie, married lady. Meet a mortgagee."

speaker: LORELAI
words: Funny Girl!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Streisand!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Love it!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Who's catering?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, Bobby Flay?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not funny. I'm making the cake also.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, let's start a menu. Something light and romantic to start with. Something that will go wonderful with champagne. Truffles go wonderful with champagne. And scrambled eggs. [starts to cry]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie? Honey?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know scrambled eggs don't sound very festive, but when you put them in a little quail's egg shell and you put cavier on top, they are quite a crowd pleaser.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, what's with the waterworks lady?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's just. . .I don't know. You raised that little girl all alone, and she is so great, and you work your butt off here and you go to school and you put up with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, honey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You just really deserve this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Jackson walks into kitchen carrying a crate of brussel sprouts.]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Prepare yourself for the most gorgeous brussel sprouts ever. Sookie, are you okay? Are you hurt? Have you been making cutlets again?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Lorelai's getting married! Married! Uh, I love saying that! Married, married, married!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, that's great. Congratulations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks Jackson.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh, hey, do you wanna look at the brussel sprouts?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, I do. [giggles] No. Ooh, what about some nice brussel sprouts with like a garlic olive oil for the wedding? That sounds like a 'til death do us part' kind of side dish, doesn't it?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah, I wouldn't know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, what do you think is the most romantic vegetable?

speaker: JACKSON
words: You know, I'm the wrong guy to ask.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're the vegetable guy.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah, but the normal vegetable guy, not the romantic vegetable guy. I mean, I would have no idea what an appropriate vegetable would be to serve at a wedding. I've never even been to a wedding. One, my cousin BonBon. Yes, that's his real name. And I didn't stay long, and I didn't notice the vegetables, so I would not be the guy to ask about wedding vegetables. I'm not the wedding vegetable guy! [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh. Jackson's got panicked "my girlfriend wants me to get married" face on.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yup. Hey, next time he's here, tell him that you're pregnant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: With twins.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why not?
[CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE]
[Rory's in the living room on the phone with Lane, who's sitting in her closet.]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, so what's the latest?

speaker: LANE
words: I just got off the phone with the American consulate.

speaker: RORY
words: And?

speaker: LANE
words: Can you say Hyung-hyung?

speaker: RORY
words: No, and what is that?

speaker: LANE
words: My Korean name.

speaker: RORY
words: There must be something you can do.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm a minor. I've been put in the custody of family by my parents. That's it, it's over.

speaker: RORY
words: You have to at least try to talk to your family.

speaker: LANE
words: I don't know.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls from downstairs] Dinner!

speaker: LANE
words: I have to go. Last meal.

speaker: RORY
words: Call me later.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: [calls] Lanie!

speaker: LANE
words: Coming Mama!
[CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE]
[Rory walks into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want tater tots also?

speaker: RORY
words: That's a rhetorical question right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: So, what kind of dress are you thinking of?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, the one Stephanie Seymour wore in the Guns N' Roses video.

speaker: RORY
words: What about colors? Did you pick your colors yet?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Spumoni.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I am planning this wedding without you. You will have no say and I may not even let you come.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh!
[phone rings]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: MAX
words: Rory, good, it's Max.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, hey Max.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh look, I've been out ring shopping all day.

speaker: RORY
words: Ring shopping. Very interesting.

speaker: MAX
words: Now I've narrowed it down to three different rings, but I want to get her something she's really gonna like, not just something that she tells me she likes but really hates, and you know her taste in jewelry better than I do, so I thought maybe you could give me some advice.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, anything with the word "Foxy" on it is a big crowd pleaser.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, maybe for our first anniversary.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I'm listening.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay. The first ring has a gold band and sort of a square diamond. It's simple, but very classic.

speaker: RORY
words: Gold band, square diamond, simple, classic. [Lorelai shakes her head] I'm not sure that's really her.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, the next one is sort of an engagement band with small diamonds all around it, white gold, and there's a wedding band that sort of fits into it like a set.

speaker: RORY
words: White gold engagement band, small diamonds around it, with wedding band that fits into it. [Lorelai gestures that she might like it] That's a possibility. What's the third one?

speaker: MAX
words: The third one is from the twenties.

speaker: RORY
words: From the twenties, hmm.

speaker: MAX
words: Large diamond in the middle.

speaker: RORY
words: Large diamond in the middle.

speaker: MAX
words: Diamond clusters on the sides.

speaker: RORY
words: Diamond clusters on the sides.

speaker: MAX
words: A little deco.

speaker: RORY
words: A little deco. [Lorelai pants and barks like a dog] That sounds great. Uh, good going. She's gonna be ecstatic.

speaker: MAX
words: She's right there with you isn't she?

speaker: RORY
words: What? No.

speaker: MAX
words: No, I thought I heard her bark.

speaker: RORY
words: No, that's just a wild jackal that hangs out here sometimes.

speaker: MAX
words: Mm hmm. Put Cujo on the phone please.

speaker: RORY
words: One sec. [hands phone to Lorelai] Here boy.
[knock at front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hello Max, what a pleasant surprise. I just walked in.
[Rory answers door]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: DEAN
words: Am I late?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, right on time.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you coming in?

speaker: DEAN
words: In a sec. Ah, where's your mom?

speaker: RORY
words: In the kitchen on the phone.

speaker: DEAN
words: Beginning, middle, or end of a conversation?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it concerns jewelry so there may not be an end to the conversation.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good. Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi. [they kiss]

speaker: DEAN
words: I missed that.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, ya know, this whole breaking up thing, we tried it. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah we did. Didn't really work for me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Me either.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay good, so it's decided. Breaking up, not for us.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, hey, not that it's a bad thing. I'm sure some people like it.
[they walk into kitchen]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sure, Cher, Greg Allman, bet they'd give it a big thumbs up. [To Lorelai] Did you pick out your ring?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yup, he's gonna surprise me with it tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Twenties deco?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Supposedly ripped right off of Zelda Fitzgerald's cold dead hand. Hey Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: When is dinner ready?

words: Do I look like a timer?

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you might have set one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Silly rabbit.

speaker: RORY
words: Timers are for kids.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I say 10 minutes, we're there.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get us set up.

speaker: DEAN
words: So what's the movie for tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my god, a classic.

speaker: RORY
words: The Joan and Melissa Rivers Story, starring. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Joan and Melissa Rivers. A mother and daughter torn apart by tragedy.

speaker: RORY
words: Suicide.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not getting The Tonight Show.

speaker: RORY
words: Mean boyfriends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Identical noses.

speaker: RORY
words: You'll laugh, you'll cry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you're laughing so hard.

speaker: RORY
words: It'll be an evening to remember.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And in the pivotal scene where a very distraught Joan gets locked out of High Holiday Services because she's late, I will be forced to rewind it and play it over and over about four thousand times.

speaker: RORY
words: You'll never be the same. [Rory leaves the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So…

speaker: DEAN
words: So.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's nice to have you back.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks, it's nice to be back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We missed you.

speaker: DEAN
words: I missed you guys too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean we really really missed you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You need the water bottle changed, don't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Desperately.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [hands him a towel] Thank you.
[Dean walks out the back door. Rory walks back into the kitchen.]

speaker: RORY
words: Where's Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Getting water.

speaker: RORY
words: You're shameless.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He offered.

speaker: RORY
words: Please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The first thing he said to me was 'Hey Lorelai, can I change your water?' What can I do? The kid's a freak.
[Cut to back porch. Rory walks out the back door.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I'm so sorry she's got you doing chores already.

speaker: DEAN
words: Aw, I don't mind.

speaker: RORY
words: You will. She pulled out the mower this morning.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well if that movie is anything like you described, mowing might be a good alternative.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I wanted to ask you something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: My grandparents are having this special dinner for me next week. It's nothing big, but they said I could invite someone, and I thought, you've never seen my grandparents' house and I'd really like you to meet my Grandpa. What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, ah, it's just the last time I met your Grandma was the night of the dance and you know how that turned out, so...

speaker: RORY
words: The dance was a long time ago. She's over it by now. I'm sure everything would be fine.

speaker: DEAN
words: You want me to go?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I want you to go.

speaker: DEAN
words: Then I'll go.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [from inside house] Oh my, that coffee can is just so high up there, whatever will I do!

speaker: DEAN
words: Coming!
[CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE]

speaker: EMILY
words: Antonia, take this and put it in the dining room please. Oh, I like that tie!

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's rather snappy, isn't it? Oh, oh, oh.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, don't you dare get on that phone. They'll be here any second.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm not getting on the phone. I'm going to give Rory that first edition of Mencken's Chrestomathy.
[doorbell rings. Emily answers door]

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, hello there! Well, hello there.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, you remember Dean right?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes I do, nice to see you again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks. Uh, your house is great. It's huge. I've never seen a house this huge before.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well thank you. So few people bother to notice the hugeness of the house anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, it was so nice of you to tell Rory to invite a friend tonight, seeing as this is her night. That was really nice of you.

speaker: EMILY
words: It was my pleasure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, don't just stand there. We have a celebration to attend. Come in, come in.
[They walk into the living room. Emily walks over to make drinks while the others sit down.]

speaker: EMILY
words: So, what would everyone like to drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well, I'll have a white wine and Dean'll have a beer.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Corona right?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I don't want a beer! I don't drink beer. I'll have water or soda or anything. Or nothing. Not beer. Never beer. Beer is. . beer's bad.

speaker: EMILY
words: Relax Dean, that's just Lorelai's little sense of humor. You're very cruel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, yes, keeps me young.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm just gonna sit here and stare at my hands.

speaker: EMILY
words: Soda Dean?

speaker: DEAN
words: Please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I'll have a beer. [Emily and Lorelai laugh] I'm sorry Dean, we're not laughing at you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh wait, I think I was.

speaker: EMILY
words: I think I was a little too. [Richard enters] Oh Richard, there you are. Come join us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Dad.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, hi. This is Dean. Dean, this is my Grandpa.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hi. Sorry, uh, hi. [walks over to him]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello.

speaker: DEAN
words: [offers to shake his hand] It's uh. . it's nice to meet. . .

speaker: RICHARD
words: Does everyone have drinks?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh yeah, we all have drinks. Thanks.

speaker: DEAN
words: [sits down, whispers to Lorelai] Should we do the beer thing again?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I don't think so.
[CUT TO DINING ROOM]

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, I can't believe you found the recipe for Beefaroni.

speaker: EMILY
words: It wasn't easy. Antonia thought I'd gone insane.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well . . .

speaker: EMILY
words: No one needs a comment from you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I was just gonna say, what's the secret?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, let's just say it's not beef.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, okay, I'm done.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too.

speaker: EMILY
words: Dean, would you like some more?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, no. I'm fine, thanks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, then I guess it must be present time.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't have to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, Mom, you didn't have to. Unless you got something that'll fit me too, in which case, good going.

speaker: EMILY
words: [hands her a gift] Here you go, Rory. Congratulations, we're so proud.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks Grandma. Thanks Grandpa.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now go on, open it.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [opens gift]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, pens. All yours.

speaker: RORY
words: It's beautiful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think the top student deserved the top tools.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you so much. Really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, uh, well, pens are very nice, but I just bet there is a fabulous fancy dessert just sitting out there in that kitchen of yours.

speaker: EMILY
words: As a matter of fact there is. Twinkies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, Rory told me that was her favorite dessert.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Emily Gilmore, you are one classy broad.

speaker: EMILY
words: Antonia, please bring out the Twinkies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't believe I just heard you say those words.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, don't get used to it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So, Dean, where are you planning to go to college?

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, uh, well I. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Geez Dad, start off with 'what's your favorite baseball team' or something.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm talking to Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know yet.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You don't?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, not yet.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, what kind of grades do you get?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard please, don't grill the boy.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm not grilling the boy Emily. It's an easy question. A's, B's, C's?

speaker: DEAN
words: I get a mixture actually.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mixture? [laughs] What's the ratio?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm just trying to get to know the boy Emily. After all, Rory brings home a young man to dinner, the least we can do is learn something about him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He changes a mean water bottle.

speaker: DEAN
words: I get a couple A's, couple B's, few C's.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Really?

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not great in math.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, except who is really? You know, except mathematicians or the blackjack dealers, or I guess Stephen Hawking doesn't suck, but you know… You know what else is good though Mom, is a Ho-Ho. Because if you can't find a Twinkie, you know, treat yourself to a nice Ho-Ho. How long does it take to open a box?

speaker: EMILY
words: She's making them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's making the Twinkies? You're kidding.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh Richard, wasn't there a book you wanted to give Rory?

speaker: RICHARD
words: In a minute. So Dean. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, Grandpa?

speaker: RICHARD
words: You do know that Rory is going to an Ivy League school?

speaker: DEAN
words: I know.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Harvard, Princeton, Yale.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He said he knew Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You need top grades to get into a top school.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, well, Rory's really smart.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yeah, she is really smart.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, why don't we all go sit in the uh. . .

speaker: RICHARD
words: So, how are you planning to make a living once you graduate from this college you haven't thought anything about yet?

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, can we talk about something else?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm going to get that book. [leaves]

speaker: RICHARD
words: I asked you a question.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know what I want to do.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know, when I was ten years old, I knew exactly where I wanted to work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because you were always picked last for dodgeball.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I knew I wanted to go to Yale, and put on a nice suit everyday and be a very important man in a very powerful firm. And I knew I wanted to travel and see the world.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, that's great.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I wanted to see La Traviata at the La Scala Operahouse. I wanted to walk the ruins of Pompeii. I wanted to travel the far east . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: And be a ballerina or a fireman.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, this isn't funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a little funny to think of a ten-year-old kid dreaming of the La Scala Operahouse.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory does. Rory wants to travel. Rory has plans.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory's special.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes. Exactly. Rory is special

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I know that Rory is special.

speaker: EMILY
words: [returns with book] I got it.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean is special too, Grandpa.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: You don't even know him.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know enough.

speaker: RORY
words: No you don't. Dean is incredible and he's special to me and I bring him here and you attack him.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I will not be spoken to like that in my house.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard here, give her the book.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This family has standards. You live up to them, and you should expect that everyone that you spend time with live up to them also. You are a gifted girl with immense promise, and you should learn very early that certain people can hold you back.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, stop it! You cannot treat Dean this way.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm sorry, excuse me, I have to work. [leaves the table]

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa! Thank you for the dinner and the gift Grandma, but I really think we should be going. [leaves]

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks. Sorry. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Am I crazy? That's supposed to be us right?
[CUT TO LORELAI'S FRONT YARD]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, want to come in and have some dessert? You never did get your Twinkie.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, no thanks. I think I should get going.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, Dean, all I can say is that tonight, you officially became a Gilmore Girl. Feels good, huh?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See you later. [to Rory] Meet you inside.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't even know what to say.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's no big deal.

speaker: RORY
words: I had no idea…I thought he would…I am so sorry Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: It's not your fault.

speaker: RORY
words: None of those things he said were true. None of them mean anything. I don't know what made him act that way. I just. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: You know what, let's just forget it. All right?

speaker: RORY
words: Please, don't be upset.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm not.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm fine. I'm not upset. I have to go. Call you tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN]

speaker: RORY
words: That man is impossible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twinkie?

speaker: RORY
words: He just attacked Dean out of nowhere. And Dean is sitting there, being perfectly nice, and then all of a sudden. . . Ugh, God, I'm so mad. He's a snob.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: And he doesn't listen. He just wants to say horrible things and have you sit there and listen to him and then just agree with him. What is that all about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, that is about a hundred years worth of inbreeding.

speaker: RORY
words: I've never seen him be mean before. Ever, not like that. I don't know how I'll ever talk to him again. And Dean. He must be so upset right now. I hate that he did this to him, I hate it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it was bad. My father was in fine form tonight. But. . .

speaker: RORY
words: But? There's a but, from you there's a but?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twinkie. I don't think my father has ever loved anything in this world as much as he loves you. Now, that having been established, let's just consider that maybe this flipout tonight actually came from somewhere that possibly has nothing to do with Dean and very possibly has nothing to do with you.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are the great white hope of the Gilmore clan. You are their angel sent from up above. You are the daughter they didn't have.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's not a 'feel sorry for me' thing. It's just the truth. I mean, you're gonna go to college. Hell, you're gonna graduate from high school. They're gonna get to watch you walk down the aisle wearing your cap and gown and get your diploma and go to Harvard and be a Phi Beta Bimbo and graduate with honors and just set the world on fire. And that is the plan, looks like it's gonna happen.

speaker: RORY
words: It is going to happen. Except for that Phi Beta Bimbo part.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But then tonight you walk in with this beautiful boy who likes you enough to brave going to your grandparents house for dinner, and Dad looks at you and sees you with him and all of a sudden, has a terrible Lorelai flashback. He sees it all going away, the college, the cap and gown and. . .

speaker: RORY
words: But I'm not going to get pregnant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that.

speaker: RORY
words: He should know it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, he should, but you do have my eyes.

speaker: RORY
words: You do realize you just spent the last ten minutes defending your dad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I'm gonna have terrible nightmares all night long. But I'll tell you what. If you cut him a little slack, I'll wear my porn star t-shirt to dinner next week.

speaker: RORY
words: Deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.
[Phone rings. Rory answers it.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: LANE
words: I just thought you should know that my parents just brought in the suitcase that I'm supposed to take on my trip and to paint you a picture, it can fit you and me plus everything we own and still have enough room to do a little souvenir shopping. I am never coming back.
[CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE]

speaker: RICHARD
words: What is Lorelai thinking letting Rory run around with a boy like that. Well, of course, she isn't thinking! She never thinks.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, please, you're giving me a headache.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And what were you thinking inviting him over here?

speaker: EMILY
words: We told her she could invite someone. You were right there.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I did not mean him.

speaker: EMILY
words: Please calm down.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I will not calm down. Did you hear the way she talked to me?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, I heard the way she talked to you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: She sounded like her mother.

speaker: EMILY
words: You were attacking her boyfriend.

speaker: RICHARD
words: A girl that age shouldn't have a boyfriend.

speaker: EMILY
words: You truly think a sixteen year old girl isn't gonna date?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, of course she's going to date, and she should date. The proper socialization is important to a child. But she should not date one boy and she should not date him. [phone rings] Don't answer that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm going to answer it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, we are in the middle of a discussion.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm sure you will remember exactly where you were five minutes from now. Hello?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi, Mrs. Gilmore? It's Sookie St. James, Lorelai's friend. I don't know if you remember me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh yes, you're the chef at the Inn.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's right. Listen, I'm sorry to call so late, but I need to ask you a question. I'm planning a surprise wedding shower for Lorelai and Max, and it's gonna be more like a big party actually. But I've cleared the date with everybody around here, so we're all set to go, but I wanted to make sure you guys were gonna be around before I finalized everything. It's going to be Saturday the 21st.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't know, I'd have to check.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, Okay. You check, and then you call me at the inn, okay?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, I'll get back to you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay.
[CUT TO RICHARD'S OFFICE]

speaker: EMILY
words: I want you to call Rory tomorrow and apologize.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: I want you to call her and tell her you're sorry. That you weren't feeling well and you think that Dean is a lovely boy and he's welcome here anytime.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Have you gone insane? Under no circumstance will I ...

speaker: EMILY
words: Our daughter is getting married. She's getting married and she didn't tell us. When Rory decides to get married, I'd like her to tell us. Call her tomorrow. [Emily leaves, starts to cry]
[CUT TO LORELAI'S PORCH.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was awful.

speaker: MAX
words: Sounds awful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's the family you want to marry into.

speaker: MAX
words: I must be insane.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Must be.

speaker: MAX
words: Hmm, and speaking of marrying into.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes?

speaker: MAX
words: I have a little something for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let me guess. Is it gum, 'cause you know how much I like gum. How concerned I am about dental hygiene. [Max shows her the ring] Uh, oh my.

speaker: MAX
words: You like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's beautiful.
[Max puts the ring on her finger]

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, it's too big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's not.

speaker: MAX
words: Here, give it to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, what? No, you can't have it back.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I'll get it sized.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's okay.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, it's gonna fall off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll wear it on my thumb.

speaker: MAX
words: You're not gonna wear it on your thumb.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll eat a lot of salt and bloat up.

speaker: MAX
words: Just let me get it sized and I promise you'll never have to take it off again. In fact, I'm going to insist on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, just in a minute, okay?

speaker: MAX
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm getting married.
THE END
OPEN AT LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Rory is on the couch in the living room as Lorelai calls her from upstairs.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory!

speaker: RORY
words: Living room!
[Lorelai comes down the steps wearing a newspaper veil on her head.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need your advice on something. What do you think?

speaker: RORY
words: Huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not good?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not sure. Have you tried the Arts and Leisure section?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need you to be serious.

speaker: RORY
words: You are wearing a newspaper on your head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: And you need me to be serious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am trying to figure out veil lengths here.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See, I kind of like this shoulder length kind of semi-poofy thing like this.

speaker: RORY
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But there's also a longer one that might be interesting.

speaker: RORY
words: Longer, sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then there's the full on Diana.

speaker: RORY
words: Right, right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is nice but it just might be a little. . . . You're reading me.

speaker: RORY
words: Wait, don't move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, stop it.

speaker: RORY
words: This Putin arms race thing is really getting crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am trying to have a serious conversation about the most important fashion decision of my life.

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you go to a wedding dress place and try a real veil on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No way.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
