words: Too much taffeta, it gives me cotillion flashbacks.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay fine. Could you bend over so I can see what the weather's gonna be like tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, I went in one of those places yesterday.

speaker: RORY
words: You did? Which one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Marry Mimi's.

speaker: RORY
words: Ooh, I see we're going top of the line.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, it was horrible. Apparently, you're supposed to order your wedding dress the first day of junior high, and if you haven't, it's off the rack for you missy. I tried on three different dresses, one of which gave me a rash. And I gotta say, has anyone missed the bustle? 'Cause I haven't.

speaker: RORY
words: It was not that bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They all looked wrong. I'm gonna be gross and all the children will laugh and Max will realize he's made a horrible mistake and then people will walk away, exactly as you're doing now.

speaker: RORY
words: Let's go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where?

speaker: RORY
words: Wedding dress shopping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhhh, you're reading.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you need to see Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: He's playing softball.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your cure for cancer's almost finished.

speaker: RORY
words: We are going to find the perfect thing for you to walk down the aisle in your perfect wedding day, where there will be no pointing, mocking or walking out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not say pointing, why did you say pointing?

speaker: RORY
words: Keys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
CUT TO CHILTON
[Paris, Madeline, and Louise are standing next to a bulletin board.]

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ooh, spending the summer at Chilton. Happy happy, joy joy.

speaker: MADELINE
words: If I don't improve my French grades, I can kiss Vassar goodbye.

speaker: PARIS
words: You need to follow a study schedule. I've been telling you this second grade.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yes, which worries both of us.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Maybe I won't go to college.

speaker: PARIS
words: You have to go to college.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Princess Grace didn't go to college.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you for the history lesson, A.J. Benza.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Take a pill.

speaker: PARIS
words: Marry rich.
[Rory walks over to them]

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: You doing the summer school thing too?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, yeah.

speaker: MADELINE
words: What classes are you taking?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I uh…

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ahem.

speaker: MADELINE
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, you're not talking to me.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I'm not?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Tristin.

speaker: PARIS
words: PJ Harvey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm just gonna look at the bulletin board, and then you can back to your conversation.

speaker: MADELINE
words: There's a Rebuilding Together thing going on tomorrow. You know, they fix up homes for the needy. It's a total easy outdoor denim gig that looks really great on your college transcript. Sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks, I'll think about it.

speaker: PARIS
words: You wouldn't like it.

speaker: RORY
words: 'Cause you'll be there?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes, I'll be there.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll think about it.
[Rory walks away. Paris follows her.]

speaker: PARIS
words: You don't want to go.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll see.

speaker: PARIS
words: You don't, it's not you.

speaker: RORY
words: I have multiple personalities. It might be one of me.

speaker: PARIS
words: It's hours of hammering and drilling and dirt and it's horrible. You'll hate it.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know? How do you know that I don't spend hours every week hammering and drilling? And dirt, I love dirt. I collect it.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're hilarious.

speaker: RORY
words: You're pathetic.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine. Forget it.
[Paris walks back towards the bulletin board. Rory follows her.]

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you want me to go?

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't care if you go.

speaker: RORY
words: You just spent a great deal of energy trying to convince me not to.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm late for class.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you seriously going to be mad about the fact that you thought I was going out with Tristin even though I wasn't for the rest of your life?

speaker: PARIS
words: I have great commitment.

speaker: RORY
words: And you don't see how stupid that is?

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm sorry if you thought we had some kind of deep Thelma and Louise thing going here, but we didn't.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, have it your way, but I'm going tomorrow.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine. Go. See if I care.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.

speaker: PARIS
words: Great. I hate summer.
[Paris, Madeline and Louise leave. Henry walks up to Rory.]

speaker: HENRY
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Henry, hi. Nice to see you.

speaker: HENRY
words: You too. What classes are you taking?

speaker: RORY
words: Shakespeare, physics, obscure Russian poetry.

speaker: HENRY
words: Wow. I'm still trying to get through trig. But hey, third time's the charm.

speaker: RORY
words: I can help you if you want.

speaker: HENRY
words: I just may take you up on that.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: HENRY
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane's fine.

speaker: HENRY
words: Is she? Good, 'cause I haven't talked to her in awhile. I called.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: HENRY
words: Once. I called once.

speaker: RORY
words: And?

speaker: HENRY
words: Her mother answered.

speaker: RORY
words: Oops.

speaker: HENRY
words: She sounded angry.

speaker: RORY
words: No, that's just Mrs. Kim.

speaker: HENRY
words: I hung up. Twelve times. And then on the thirteenth time she said she was gonna have the FBI trace the call and have me thrown in prison. And although I know logically that the punishment for multiple hang ups probably isn't prison, she just sounded so capable of doing real damage that I. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Stopped calling?

speaker: HENRY
words: And now Lane probably thinks that I forgot about her, and. . .

speaker: RORY
words: You'd like for me to tell her that you haven't.

speaker: HENRY
words: That would be good.

speaker: RORY
words: Done.

speaker: HENRY
words: And maybe you could give her my number and she could call me.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get right on it.

speaker: HENRY
words: Aw thanks. [writes his number down, hands the paper to Rory] Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: HENRY
words: Okay. Bye

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. Uh, henry?

speaker: HENRY
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Your trig notes.

speaker: HENRY
words: Ahhh.

speaker: RORY
words: I think we may have nailed down the problem.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory pull up and walk to the front door talking.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, tomorrow I'm going to build a house.

speaker: RORY
words: Help build a house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you tell them that there's a light bulb in your closet that burned out in '97 that you still haven't changed?

speaker: RORY
words: It's for charity.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, don't those people have enough problems without having you as a contractor?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sure there will be real construction workers there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: I will be assisting, I will be helping out those less fortunate than myself, I will be getting college credit and this is the end of this particular conversation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're right. It's a good thing. Nice, keeps your halo shiny. Oh wait, wait. [takes off her engagement ring]

speaker: RORY
words: When are you going to tell them?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Soon.

speaker: RORY
words: When's soon?

speaker: LORELAI
words: When the big hand hits the "S" and the little hand hits the "OON."

speaker: RORY
words: You're getting married in three months.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ring the bell.

speaker: RORY
words: I think you should tell them now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ring the bell.

speaker: RORY
words: The longer you wait the harder it's gonna be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the love of God, will you please ring the bell.

speaker: RORY
words: You can tell them before dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will tell them when I'm ready to tell them. You have to accept that because I'm the mother and you're the daughter, and in some cultures, that means you have to do what I say.

speaker: RORY
words: If you don't tell them in two weeks, I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Though apparently not in this one.

speaker: RORY
words: Good. [rings doorbell]
[Emily answers the door]

speaker: EMILY
words: We're going to have to eat quickly, your father has a very early flight tomorrow morning. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm good. Yeah, and Rory's gonna build a house tomorrow. I know, I thought it was a little weird too.

speaker: EMILY
words: Walk as you babble please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Rory] Somebody must have scratched the silver.
[walk to dining room]

speaker: EMILY
words: [to maid] Bring the bread out too. And pour the wine please. [to L/R] Come on, hurry up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, 'cause we don't want our salad to get cold.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, dinner!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Eat eat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shouldn't we wait for Dad?

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't worry about him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's the one with the early plane. We don't have to go anywhere tomorrow. We can stay all night. Have a party, do some Jell-O shots, play light as a feather, stiff as a board. Okay, pass the bread.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, would you like some. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes please.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You started.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have a six o'clock flight.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Six o'clock, are you sure?

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you mean, am I sure? Of course I'm sure. I double-checked it three times with your secretary because I know she's an idiot and all three times she told me six o'clock. I wrote it down, I have your ticket right out on the. . . You're teasing me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Very possible.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't find that amusing, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Exactly the point of teasing, Emily. Hello Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello Father.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: May I speak with you for a moment, please?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[Richard and Rory leave the room.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, I wonder what that's all about. I guess we'll find out later, right? Hey, whatever happened to Shusha?
CUT TO BACK PATIO

speaker: RICHARD
words: I just thought we should touch base, you and I, after that unfortunate incident last week.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, you already called me about that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, I know, but I thought taking a moment to once again say to you in person, how. . .

speaker: RORY
words: I know, and I appreciate it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: We'd never had a fight.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This was our first one.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it was.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I must say, I didn't care for it.

speaker: RORY
words: Neither did I.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, all right. We should go back inside. We're find now, right?

speaker: RORY
words: We're fine. Buck up, Private.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh wait, I wanted to give you something.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Come on, come on.
[they walk past the dining room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, where you guys going?

speaker: RICHARD
words: We'll be right there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, hurry, 'cause you're missing one hell of a conversation. You know, Mom, I'm really loving this salad dressing.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lemony.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's nothing like a nice salad of lemony goodness. [pause] Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Hmm?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have something to tell you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well it's like this. Um, . . .could you put down your fork for a second? Thank you. Okay, um, you know Max?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I know you don't know him know him, but you know of him, right?

speaker: EMILY
words: I've heard rumblings.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, um, the. . .Max and I have been serious for quite awhile now, and he asked me to marry him, and I said yes. I'm getting married.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I think that's very nice. I certainly hope we'll be in town for it, but if not I promise we'll send a nice gift. Now excuse me, I'm going to check on the roast.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are walking towards Luke's.]

speaker: RORY
words: Are you okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm perfect.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have hit a level of perfection that has rarely been seen outside the Victoria's Secret catalog.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm really sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, do not be sorry. What happened tonight was inevitable.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I should've known not to tell my mother.

speaker: RORY
words: You were trying to be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Telling her I was getting married to a wonderful guy who will love me and make me happy. That, and giving her my address when I finally moved out, two worst moves I ever made.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe she'll think about it and call you and say she's sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I'm getting married. I'm an idiot. And you know, as my mouth was opening my mind was screaming, 'Don't do it, I mean it, you'll regret it!' But did my mouth listen?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! And it opened and the words came out, and Emily was Emily, and my mouth was stunned. And my mind said 'I told you so.' And then my mouth got mad because no mouth like's to have it's nose rubbed in it. And now my mind and my mouth aren't talking, and it'll be weeks before we can get the boys together again.

speaker: RORY
words: Your mouth has a nose?
[they walk into Luke's Diner]

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I'm crabby.

speaker: RORY
words: You're hungry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I'm not.

speaker: RORY
words: Well you didn't eat any of your dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, by the time I could get my jaw off the ground, Speed Racer had taken my plate.

speaker: RORY
words: Luke will cheer you up, won't you Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh sure, I'm great at spreading the joy. What'll you have?

speaker: RORY
words: We'll have two coffees and a rant meal please. Extra cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm through ranting, the rant is over. I'll have an acceptance meal and a side of fries.

speaker: RORY
words: Please, you have not accepted this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am a grown woman. I do not need my mother's permission or blessing to be happy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Must've been a good Oprah today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just a little family drama. No biggie.

speaker: RORY
words: It's a little biggie.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, what's going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told my mother about me getting married and it was slightly ugly.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yup, what?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, there's nothing like a wedding to screw up a family.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, in my case, there's nothing like a family to screw up a family.

speaker: LUKE
words: Something that's supposed to start nice, two people making promises to each other. I'll love you forever, I wanna die when you die, my life meant nothing until you used my toothbrush. And then it starts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that's not exactly. .

speaker: LUKE
words: Who do you invite, who sits where, open bar, yes or no. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Auntie Junie doesn't eat chicken, Uncle Momo's off his meds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Junie and Momo?

speaker: LUKE
words: Just an example.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of a retired circus couple?

speaker: LUKE
words: And then after all that planning, the reception will still be a disaster because no matter what you do or how carefully you plan, halfway through one of those nauseating Bette Midler ballads, someone's getting drunk, someone's sleeping with someone else's wife, and someone's chicken kiev is landing on the cake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, the Gettysburg Address was only one page long, and that was about a war.

speaker: LUKE
words: I just call them like I seem them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have officially changed my order. I'll have the 'Luke's giving Lorelai a Migraine' meal.

speaker: LUKE
words: Bleu cheese or ranch?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Both.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai is in the kitchen pouring coffee as Rory comes out of her room.]

speaker: RORY
words: Time?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold on, coffee!

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. I'll see you tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, one sec.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, I have to be there in twenty minutes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, but I made you something really cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Can't it wait 'til tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It won't be cool tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean it won't be cool tonight? What loses its cool factor in twelve hours?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This. [holds up a hammer decorated in pink]

speaker: RORY
words: What is that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A hammer.

speaker: RORY
words: It has feathers on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So the rhinestones and bows won't feel lonely.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you want me to do it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Build a really pretty house.

speaker: RORY
words: How long is it gonna take me to talk you out of giving that to me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forty minutes, an hour, tops.

speaker: RORY
words: Hand it over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call me when you get home, and please be careful.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean it Timmy, no falling down the well.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Rory opens front door. Lane is standing there with several boxes]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, geez, you scared me.

speaker: LANE
words: Sorry. Where you going?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm doing that Rebuilding Together thing today.

speaker: LANE
words: Right. I'll be fast. [brings in the boxes] Okay. Here's my CD's, my 'zines, my posters, my books, three of your sweaters, and one Diva Glam lipstick. I need to leave them here while I'm in Korea because my mother's bound to search my room and if she finds them, she'll throw them out. And then spend the rest of the summer praying for my soul.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll treat them like my own.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, now. This is the Lane Kim retrieval kit. It contains the phone number of my cousins in Korea, a map of the house I'll be staying at, a picture of me now, and a mock-up of me in 6 months.

speaker: RORY
words: You've lost some weight.

speaker: LANE
words: Now this is that name of that guy at the American Consulate, and several important Korean phrases written out phonetically, you know, 'Help', 'Have you seen this girl,' 'Comes from money', et cetera.

speaker: RORY
words: Still no return date info from the parents?

speaker: LANE
words: Nope, but they did buy me a winter coat.

speaker: RORY
words: When are you going?

speaker: LANE
words: Right after your mom's engagement par...

speaker: RORY
words: Shhhh!!

speaker: LANE
words: Do you think she heard me?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think so. No, she'd be in here grilling us for details if she had.

speaker: LANE
words: She wouldn't have pretended not to have heard so she wouldn't kill the surprise?

speaker: RORY
words: And risk clashing with the decor?

speaker: LANE
words: Right. Okay, I gotta go.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, Henry?

speaker: LANE
words: Called him.

speaker: RORY
words: And?

speaker: LANE
words: He likes me. He's perfect. I'll never see him again. You'll read about it in my novel, A Connecticut Yankee in Pusan. [leaves]
CUT TO FRONT YARD
[Rory walks out the front door as Dean walks up to the house.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: DEAN
words: Where you going?

speaker: RORY
words: I have to build a house.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, so where you going?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm serious.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're going to build a house?

speaker: RORY
words: It's for charity and I'm late, and why don't you go on inside and you and my mother can continue the 'Rory's building a house' routine and when that gets boring you can move on over to 'Who's on First?'

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, how long are you gonna be gone?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know, why?

speaker: DEAN
words: I just thought we could hang today. Maybe see a movie, get something to eat. We could go to a bookstore, I'll watch you browse for six or seven hours.

speaker: RORY
words: I would love to but I have to do this thing today.

speaker: DEAN
words: Blow it off.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't.

speaker: DEAN
words: Did I mention the bookstore for six or seven hours?

speaker: RORY
words: How about tonight? We can get a pizza and go on Amazon. You'll be just as bored watching me ordering books, I promise.

speaker: DEAN
words: Deal.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, I have to go.
CUT TO CONSTRUCTION SITE
[Rory taps on a man's shoulder while he's sawing a piece of wood.]

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me.

speaker: MAN
words: Hey, you're touching a man with a saw. You don't touch a man with a saw. What are you thinking?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: MAN
words: I could've hurt myself. I could've hurt you. There's a ton of hurt that almost happened here.

speaker: RORY
words: I really am sorry. I've never been on a job site before. It's nice.

speaker: MAN
words: Okay, where you from?

speaker: RORY
words: Chilton. My name. . .

speaker: MAN
words: Come on Chilton.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's Rory. Chilton's my school.

speaker: MAN
words: You got a hammer?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, yes, sir.

speaker: MAN
words: Where is it?
[Rory takes out the decorated hammer and shows him]

speaker: RORY
words: It's a real hammer underneath.

speaker: MAN
words: That's a hammer?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it's just dressed up a little.

speaker: MAN
words: You dressed up a hammer?

speaker: RORY
words: No, my mother did. She does that. She, um, she takes thinks that aren't pretty and makes them pretty, like a hammer, you know. One time she made individual outfits for my liquid paper bottles. A clown, a cowboy, a newscaster. She's not insane, she just sounds it.

speaker: MAN
words: Okay. Work here. Wear these. Don't look up, pay attention to your surroundings, the words duck or run mean duck or run. Wear sunscreen, drunk water, get a button on the way out.

speaker: RORY
words: That's it? That's the instructions?

speaker: MAN
words: Yup.

speaker: RORY
words: But I've never done this before.

speaker: MAN
words: Well, tomorrow you won't be able to say that.

speaker: RORY
words: But people actually have to live in these houses. They may have kids or pets or breakables.

speaker: MAN
words: If you get in trouble, ask the person next to you.

speaker: ANOTHER MAN
words: Uh look out!
[Rory jumps back as a piece of wood falls next to her.]

speaker: MAN
words: Hey, you learn fast. I didn't even mention that one. [walks away]
[Rory starts to hammer a nail.]

speaker: PARIS
words: This is my wall.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: I've been working here. I put together this entire wall. Go work someplace else.

speaker: RORY
words: You put together this wall?

speaker: PARIS
words: Go help with cement.

speaker: RORY
words: It's very impressive.

speaker: PARIS
words: I've done it a million times before. It's no big deal. Louise! What did I just tell you, use a grub axe for that!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Bite me!

speaker: RORY
words: Funny. I never pictured you as a Bob Vila kind of girl.

speaker: PARIS
words: Rebuilding Together is an extremely prestigious and respected organization. I've been volunteering for them for years.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? You just love the overalls?

speaker: PARIS
words: I don't. Harvard does.

speaker: RORY
words: What does that mean?

speaker: PARIS
words: When you apply to an ivy league school, you need more than good grades and test scores to get you in. Every person who applies to Harvard has a perfect GPA and great test scores. It's the extras that put you over the top. The clubs, charities, volunteering. You know.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah, I know.

speaker: PARIS
words: I started volunteering in fourth grade. I handed out cookies at the local children's hospital. By ten, I was leading my first study group. The youngest person in the group was twelve.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: PARIS
words: I've been a camp counselor. I organized a senior illiteracy program, I worked a suicide hotline, I manned a runaway center. I've adopted dolphins, taught sign language, trained seeing eye dogs.

speaker: RORY
words: But when did you have time to have a life?

speaker: PARIS
words: I'll have a life after I graduate from Harvard. Now if you'll excuse me, the drainage on the south side of this place sucks.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hi!

speaker: PARIS
words: Madeline!

speaker: MADELINE
words: Bye!
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW BUSSTOP
[Dean is waiting on the bench as Rory steps off the bus.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey. You look good in dirt.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, hi.

speaker: DEAN
words: So how was it?

speaker: RORY
words: Long day. Long long day.

speaker: DEAN
words: 30 showing of Barbarella, and I thought you can bring your mom's purse, you know the one with that monkey face and we'll sneak in some burgers and. . . what?

speaker: RORY
words: I can't.

speaker: DEAN
words: Get your mom's purse?

speaker: RORY
words: I can't do anything tonight.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why not?

speaker: RORY
words: Because I have a lot of planning to do.

speaker: DEAN
words: What planning?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm like ten years behind on my extracurriculars.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris has been accumulating these things since she could walk. I mean, she has a list of good deeds that could bump Mother Teresa off the Harvard list.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, I'm lost.

speaker: RORY
words: I've been studying my butt off my whole life and I really thought that that was enough, but then Paris tells me that everyone makes good grades and it's the extras that put you over the top. And I thought that she was messing with me like she always does, but she's right. I mean, it makes total sense.

speaker: DEAN
words: What does?

speaker: RORY
words: Good grades aren't enough. I need to do things. I need to volunteer. I need to work for charity, I need to help the blind, the orphans, I don't know. I just need to do something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, but what does this have to do with tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: I need to start now.

speaker: DEAN
words: Now? You have to help the blind and the orphans now?

speaker: RORY
words: Didn't I tell you that I was ten years behind?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you can't make up for ten years in one night Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I just need to get organized.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, Rory, it's summer. I mean, summer's the time to hang out and kick back.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't hang out or kick back. I need to find a retarded kid and teach him how to play softball. Oh God, listen to me. I am horrible. I am under qualified and horrible.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait a minute. I thought we were gonna spend some time together.

speaker: RORY
words: We are.

speaker: DEAN
words: When?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Tomorrow maybe?

speaker: DEAN
words: You were busy today.

speaker: RORY
words: I told you. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: So we made plans for tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes but. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: And now you're blowing me off again.

speaker: RORY
words: I am not blowing you off.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're going to summer school three days a week.

speaker: RORY
words: You knew about that.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yes, but we've been apart for awhile now and I figured you'd want to spend some time with me.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, this is about Harvard.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, well excuse me, it's about Harvard, I forgot. Okay, fine.

speaker: RORY
words: You're mad? You're mad because I want to be sure that I get into a good college?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nope, I'm mad because my girlfriend doesn't seem to have time for me anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, stop it. This is important.

speaker: DEAN
words: And it can't wait for one night?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Why are you acting like this?

speaker: DEAN
words: Like what?

speaker: RORY
words: Like you're two.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, I'm not going to Harvard, I could care less about Harvard. I just wanted to hang with you. But relax, since apparently I'm two, maybe I'll just grow out of it.
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Rory's sitting at the kitchen table as Lorelai walks into the kitchen.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'm officially way too tired to go out tonight so I'm not trusting my accessorizing instincts. Tell me what you think.

speaker: RORY
words: I have no wilderness skills.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you hate the purse?

speaker: RORY
words: How am I supposed to get into Harvard if I have no wilderness skills?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know honey. Maybe you'll have to give up your dream of majoring in logging.

speaker: RORY
words: I called the Fireflies. Do they need troop leaders? Yes. Good, I'll be a troop leader. Great. The only catch is, it's summer. Camping season. I need wilderness skills. Why did you never take me camping?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Camping? Are you kidding? I couldn't get you to step on wet grass until you were three.

speaker: RORY
words: If you had taken me camping, I'd have wilderness skills.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'll tell you what. I'll take you upstairs. I'll throw you out the window. If you manage to grab that tree, I'll be your witness.

speaker: RORY
words: I called the Sunnyside Home. Do they need any volunteers? And believe it or not, they don't, but they do need an accordion player for their Friday night polka party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come I never forced you to learn the accordion?

speaker: RORY
words: The library was closed. I can call them tomorrow, but they only have twelve books so I'm not counting on that. The tutoring program at Chilton is still taking names. I guess I can do that but…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, calm down.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not prepared. I will never catch up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You will catch up, but not in one night. You've made your lists and your calls, why don't you relax and call Dean to come over?

speaker: RORY
words: We're in a fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because you never took me camping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh boy, I am really sucking tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: We were supposed to hang out and I told him I couldn't and he got made and we're in a fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Well, listen, why don't I cancel on Max tonight and I'll hang out here with you. We can make popcorn and reminisce about how I never forced you to become a missionary.

speaker: RORY
words: No, go, I'm fine. I just need to focus on this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I can help.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I need to do this alone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, I'm not gonna be home late. And listen, I would reconsider calling Dean. It's not his fault that you're so fabulous he can't think about anything else.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, he just sits in his room, eating Froot Loops out of the box, saying your name over and over and over.

speaker: RORY
words: Time is ticking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I love you Rory. Rory, I will not be ignored Rory…

speaker: RORY
words: Leave.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'll be home early. Bye.
CUT TO RESTAURANT
[Max and Lorelai are eating dinner outside.]

speaker: MAX
words: You hate your dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No I don't.

speaker: MAX
words: You've hardly touched it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, when somebody goes to all the trouble to make your entrée look like a little tiny hat, you hate to mess it up.

speaker: MAX
words: Is something wrong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: MAX
words: You can tell me. That's what I'm here for.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought it was just for eye candy.

speaker: MAX
words: That too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine. It's just stuff, ya know. Rory's freaking out about not having enough extracurricular things to impress Harvard with.

speaker: MAX
words: I can help her with that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sure she would greatly appreciate it.

speaker: MAX
words: Is that all that's wrong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, just a lot of stuff to think about, you know, for the wedding.

speaker: MAX
words: I forget to tell you, I saw my parents today. They just wanted me to tell you how thrilled they are. My mother cried twice. She said you don't have to call her mom but you're welcome to if you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: MAX
words: And then my father took me aside and gave me a long talk about marriage and the many ways of making a wife happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, a dirty talk.

speaker: MAX
words: Then they gave me this. [holds out a check]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No they did not.

speaker: MAX
words: Yes they did too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, did you tell them that we're paying for everything ourselves?

speaker: MAX
words: I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie's doing the cake, the ceremony's at my house, Patty's supplying the chairs… thirty five dollars?

speaker: MAX
words: It's the first of four installments. That way we can't spend it all in one place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that is so cute!

speaker: MAX
words: They just want to be involved.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's sweet, that's really sweet. Can I. . .thanks.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, and my mother even offered you her wedding dress.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: MAX
words: But since three of you could fit into that dress I took the liberty of declining it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I hope she wasn't insulted.

speaker: MAX
words: No, I just told her you were wearing your mother's dress.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: MAX
words: It doesn't matter whether you are or not, she just wanted to offer something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's get dessert.

speaker: MAX
words: You okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just think it's great. I think it's great that your parents are so happy and into everything. I. .that must be nice to have that.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, why don't you think of it this way? Now they're kind of your parents too so you'll have that also.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I will think of it like that. That is exactly how I will think of it.

speaker: MAX
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because otherwise, I'd have to look at it like Max has parents who love him and care about him, and I have parents.

speaker: MAX
words: I didn't mean to upset you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not upset. It's just, I can't get that one moment out of my mind. 'That's nice, I hope we're in town.' Who, who, who reacts like that? I mean, what sort of mind forms that reaction to 'Hey mom, I'm getting married'?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, from everything you've told me about your parents, there's so much baggage between you guys…

speaker: LORELAI
words: You figure out a different way. You tap into compassion or family obligation or something. You don't react like that.

speaker: MAX
words: I agree. It's wrong. But you can't change who they are, and you won't get anywhere trying to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you know what? I don't want to talk about my parents anymore. Okay, I don't want to speculate about them, I don't want to analyze them, I don't want to think about them anymore. We should go.

speaker: MAX
words: Come on, it' still early. We'll go someplace else. Talk a little bit more?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Absolutely. Sounds good.
CUT TO INSIDE MAX'S CAR

speaker: MAX
words: Listen, I'm sorry tonight brought up all these bad feelings for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's okay. Make a right.

speaker: MAX
words: But I bet this was harder for your mother then you think it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: MAX
words: I mean, look what's happened to her over the last year. She was just getting back into your life, and suddenly, everything changes on her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, that's gotta suck. Go right.

speaker: MAX
words: You know, maybe once we get married, things will settle down, you two will be able to work it out. I mean, you never know, I might be able to help the situation, ya know, uh, act as a buffer or so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a good thought, good thought. Pull…Pull in here.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Max pull up out front and walk to the front door.]

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai, hold on, ya know, I think I know what's going on here, and I gotta tell you, it's not a good idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This'll just take a second. [rings doorbell several times]

speaker: MAX
words: I don't know, maybe you should wait until tomorrow, calm down a little, think this through, maybe you'll be able to be more objective.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are not asleep. Come on!

speaker: MAX
words: You are way too emotional for this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm just emotional enough. Now if you like you can wait in the car because I really don't plan on being here that long.
[Emily opens the front door]

speaker: EMILY
words: What on earth?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi mom, do you have a sec to chat? Super.
[Lorelai walks inside, Max waits inside by the door]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, what is this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just wanted to see how you were, that's all.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are? Oh good, good. I'm glad that you're fine. I, however, am not fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Your father and I were just about to go to bed. We can do this in the morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually Mom, no. We can't do this in the morning. We really need to do this right now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you drunk?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not drunk. I'm confused.

speaker: EMILY
words: About what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: About you.

speaker: EMILY
words: And what about me confuses you Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so many things. I mean, for example, why can't you keep a maid in this house? I mean, there must've been a thousand women who've gone through here in the thirty-two years that I've been alive, and not one of them could stick it out.

speaker: EMILY
words: And this is what we need to discuss right now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: These are women from countries that have dictatorships and civil wars and death squads and all of that they survived, but five minutes working for Emily Gilmore, and people are begging for Castro.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right, I'm going to bed now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And why is it that when your only daughter tells you that she is getting married, you can't muster up even a little enthusiasm? Even a little fake enthusiasm. Why don't you pretend that you care? I mean, this is the biggest thing to happen to me possibly for the rest of my life, and you dismissed it like I said, 'Hey, I'm thinking of getting a Honda, what do you think?'

speaker: EMILY
words: You're obviously hysterical!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you care? Why have you never cared? No matter what has happened to me my entire life, you've never been happy for me, and that hurts, Mom, it really hurts!

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not discussing this with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you know how it felt for me to tell you that I was getting married and to have you just brush it off like that? Do you know?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, I don't, I don't know! Possibly very similar to finding out from a complete stranger that my only daughter was getting married and had told every other person in the world before she bothered to tell her own mother. Possibly it felt something like that. Now if you'll excuse me, it is late, and I am going to bed. [opens the front door, Lorelai walks out]

speaker: MAX
words: Um, my parents would really like to have lunch with you and Mr. Gilmore, sometime. . . soon. Nice meeting you. [leaves]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Sookie and Michel are at the front desk.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: I don't care.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I just need a quick opinion.

speaker: MICHEL
words: It took me two seconds to tell you I don't care. That's as quick as I get.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: This Lorelai's engagement party. It is a once in a lifetime event, and I want it to be perfect.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I am working.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just pick a cookie.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I don't want to.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Michel, for the rest of their lives, Lorelai and Max are gonna think back on their engagement party and they're gonna talk about three things. They're gonna talk about the friends who came, and that special song they danced to, and the cookies that they ate.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Their world is very small, isn't it?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Macaroons or chocolate pralines?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Go back to the cooking room.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Not until you eat these and tell me what you think!

speaker: MICHEL
words: Sookie! I only eat fifteen hundred calories a day. If I eat that, I cannot have my Boca burger later.
[Lorelai walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Sookie. Is there any coffee left? I had a really lousy night.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, sorry, ya know, I've been so busy I didn't even think about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's okay. I'll make some myself.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No! I'll make it! I'll make it! I wanna make it! I wanna make it! Let me do it! I wanna make…hey, I make the coffee!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, relax, you're busy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, I'm not. Go back to the counter. Michel's stealing.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Lorelai and Sookie walk through the door. The kitchen is filled with decorated cakes and baked goods.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my god. What is this?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh, the dinner special?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The dinner special is a heart shaped pastry with Max and Lorelai written on it?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I couldn't find any good salmon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Sookie, you're throwing me a wedding shower, aren't you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It was supposed to be a surprise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, this is amazing, Sookie, even for you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wait 'til you see the ice sculptures!

speaker: LORELAI
words: When is it?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, so your yen to hit the bingo parlor in Enfield was. . .

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A vicious vicious lie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is incredible. This is really really incredible. My God, is there any pink icing left on the planet?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The whole town is in on it actually. It's gonna be quite the affair. I think you'll be sufficiently impressed with the amount of people that wanna celebrate this with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. I, I just, I can't get over this. Ugh. Hey, you didn't by any chance invite my parents, did you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Actually, I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And at first, I was really torn because I know you have issues with them, but it is your wedding and I assumed you wanted them to be there. Oh no, your mother told you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sort of.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Damn, I thought I mentioned that it was a surprise. I don't know, maybe I didn't. It would be so typical of me. Uh, the cat's already out of the bag, and I'm stuffing imported chocolate squares down my shirt so you don't see me walk into the kitchen with them. Hey, did your mother mention if they were coming? She never got back to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yeah, no, um, she's got a thing tonight.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, too bad. Hey, we can save her a piece of cake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That would be nice.
CUT TO ENGAGEMENT PARTY
[In the center of a very decorated Stars Hollow, people are celebrating as Lorelai and Max sit surrounded by presents.]

speaker: KIRK
words: [on bullhorn] Attention guests, the buffet line is clogging at sector B. I repeat, sector B is moving too slow. Keep it moving people.
[Rory walks up to the table where Lane is in charge of the party music.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Mr. DJ, put a record on.

speaker: LANE
words: How's it sound?

speaker: RORY
words: Great.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm trying to find that subtle blend between not too cliché sounding traditional tunes with out of left field, should be standard.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, the Sinatra medley was great. I'd maybe skipped playing anything else by The Damned.

speaker: LANE
words: Got it. What time is it?

speaker: RORY
words: It's eight. What time do you leave?

speaker: LANE
words: I have a 10 o'clock flight.

speaker: RORY
words: Have I told you how much I'm gonna miss you?

speaker: LANE
words: Write me. Constantly.

speaker: RORY
words: Everyday.

speaker: LANE
words: Encouraging letters full of hope and see you soons.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll be tying yellow ribbons around the old oak trees.

speaker: LANE
words: I will be back for the wedding.

speaker: RORY
words: You better be.

speaker: LANE
words: Just don't let her change the date.

speaker: RORY
words: Not going to happen. Max is teaching a summer course at the University of Toronto, so if you're back by the end of the summer, it'll be fine.

speaker: LANE
words: Don't say if.

speaker: RORY
words: Right.
[Cut to Lorelai and Max]

speaker: MAX
words: I don't know if you've realized, but every gift so far has been for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, in this town, I am the queen. You are simply my jester.

speaker: MAX
words: A position I happily accept.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, so come on then. How can you stand to leave all this for two months? Do you think Toronto's gonna make you into an ice sculpture? I don't think so.

speaker: MAX
words: I wish you'd come with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have to work.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, two months is a long time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: MAX
words: Will you still want me when I got back?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think there's a very good possibility that I will be just as infatuated with you then as I am now.

speaker: MAX
words: Maybe more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe more.
[cut to the gazebo, where young girls dressed as brides gather to perform a dance.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, come on ladies, hurry up. Love waits for no one. Lucy, get off of Jenny's train! All right, bouquets up, and music!
[the girls start dancing. Kirk watches them as Rory walks over to him.]

speaker: RORY
words: How come you're not up there Kirk?

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh, I don't tap anymore. Bum knees.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah.

speaker: KIRK
words: I have to tell you, I'm a little worried about this gazebo holding up all those hoofers. They never did a trial run like I requested.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I think it's okay. The studs are definitely sound, and the two by fours are a nice number two structural grade. Or better possibly. I built a house yesterday.

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh, for Pete's sake! [on bullhorn] No tossing of the Jordan almonds. I repeat, put the almonds down!
[Kirk walks away as Dean walks over.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: This is quite a party.

speaker: RORY
words: Elegant and understated, just like my mother.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, how are you?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm fine, how are you?

speaker: DEAN
words: Me? Uh, I'm an idiot.

speaker: RORY
words: No you're not.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm so sorry Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry too.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't even know what happened.

speaker: RORY
words: We had a fight, that's all.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean, I've just missed you and…

speaker: RORY
words: I've missed you too.

speaker: DEAN
words: I got…I don't know, I got jealous of Harvard for a minute, which is crazy 'cause I love the fact that you're gonna go to Harvard. And then you have to do something that's gonna help you get there, and I…I don't even, I don't even really understand it myself.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I didn't help. I was all wigged out when I got home.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, you had all the right to be.

speaker: RORY
words: It's just that when it comes to Harvard, I sometimes get a little tunnel vision, and it's getting closer…

speaker: DEAN
words: Whoa.

speaker: RORY
words: …and I have to think about it…

speaker: DEAN
words: You do not have to explain.

speaker: RORY
words: But I don't want you to feel unimportant, because believe me, you're not.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'm glad.

speaker: RORY
words: I mean it. The only way you could be more important to me is if you had a Kit Kat bar growing out of your head.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I can't make any promises, but I'll give it a try.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: DEAN
words: Don't be. I mean, I'm not going to a fancy school. I don't have that kind of pressure. I can't even imagine what that must feel like.

speaker: RORY
words: You could go to a fancy school if you wanted to.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't think so.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not? You're smart.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, you're smart.

speaker: RORY
words: You are too.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: And I could help you organize all of your extracurricular activities because I'm now an expert at it.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't…

speaker: RORY
words: How are your wilderness skills?

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: Do you accept my apology?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I accept your apology.
[cut to Lorelai and Max]

speaker: MAX
words: You okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. You know, I'll just um, I'll be right back.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay.
[cut to Kirk]

speaker: KIRK
words: [on bullhorn] Only three treats per person. No hogging of the treats. If caught with more than three treats on a plate, you will be faced with possible expulsion from said party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Kirk. Can I see that for a sec?

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh, sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. [walks away with bullhorn]
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai walks in. Luke is at the counter filling up ketchup bottles.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. Why aren't you at your party?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that's funny, I was about to ask you the same thing.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, well, I just got kinda busy here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yes, I can see that. Boy they keep making that ketchup slower and slower, huh?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the Heinz family's little joke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Boy, it's really pretty crazy out there.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, I can imagine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lots of people all having fun, just the kind of thing you'd hate.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sounds awful

speaker: LORELAI
words: You'd be miserable.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, yes I would.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But in spite of all that, I was kind of thinking, and you don't have to, that maybe you could pull yourself away for a second.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, well I…

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, you know, finish the ketchup tonight, but maybe leave the worchestshire sauce for tomorrow.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll see how it goes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. I mean, it's just…it's a really big night for me tonight, and I don't know, it just feels like you should be there. Anyway, I'll let you get back to your ketchup. [leaves]
[cut to Sookie and Jackson at the party]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The macaroons are going like hot cakes!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yup, everything's a big success.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Look at all this, isn't it beautiful? I know it's cliché, but it is so romantic it makes you all giddy in a really sappy kind of way, doesn't it?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh, sure, I guess.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I hope they're happy. Ugh, what am I saying? How can they not be happy? They're in love, they have each other, and everything's perfect…

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay! I get it!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, what are you…

speaker: JACKSON
words: What do you think I need a piano to fall on my head?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I don't think anybody actually needs a piano to fall on their head.

speaker: JACKSON
words: All the marriage talk, and the, 'Oh Jackson, you should see Lorelai's ring, it's so beautiful.'

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, it is.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I understand. I'm hip, okay? We've hit that point in our relationship where the little hints are starting. Which means that'll be followed by the 'where are we going' talk, and that'll only end in a big ultimatum. Suddenly all hell breaks loose.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, no more sugar for you.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So, I think I need to say this right now. I'm not ready for marriage.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay.

speaker: JACKSON
words: However, I'd be willing to move in.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Move in where?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Move in with you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [laughing] Jackson, you're hilarious!

speaker: JACKSON
words: I am?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'll move in with you. [laughs] What a riot!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Why are you laughing?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [laughing] You're face! God, you're good. You are good.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I wasn't joking.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [laughing] Come on, let's go get some punch.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie, I'm serious, I'm moving in.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [laughing] Jackson, stop, you're gonna give me a cramp!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie, get back here!

speaker: [pan around the party to
words: Miss Patty dancing with Kirk, Rory and Dean sitting on a bench, Lane leaving for the airport, Lorelai and Max dancing, Luke coming to the party. Lorelai and Luke smile and wave at each other. Luke sits down on a bench next to three little girls dressed as brides, who all stare at him.]
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Emily sits at a table writing something as the doorbell rings.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Marina, the door please.
[the maid answers the door. Lorelai walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Oh thanks. Hey mom. I was in the neighborhood, 'cause there's that wedding dress place on Willow. Elizabeth Taylor bought one of her dresses there. Anyhow, I was trying to make a decision about a veil, and I thought maybe you might have some opinion about which one would look best on me 'cause, well you know me, so um, I thought I'd stop by and ask you which one you thought would be good. On me. So, which one?

speaker: EMILY
words: You're quite capable of choosing that yourself Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right, you're sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know how to tell you things Mom. Um, I don't know if you've noticed this or not, but we don't communicate very well. When something good happens to me, I'm just afraid you're gonna make me feel bad about it. And when something bad happens to me, I'm always afraid you'll say 'I told you so.' I'm not sure if that's always fair, and I'm sure I share part of the blame for this circle we get into, but you think your words don't have any effect on me, but they do. And, I just didn't want to feel bad about this, so I waited. And I really didn't mean to hurt you. Okay, well, I will let you get back to that letter there.

speaker: EMILY
words: Your head is much too big for a veil. You might consider a tiara.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, a tiara?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's what I wore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Okay. Well, I'll think about that. [leaves]
THE END
OPEN AT A BAKERY
[Lorelai and Rory are taste-testing cakes.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, here!

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: With a crunch and a zing and a hm hm hm hm, hello!

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, our house is burning down, and you can save the cake or me. What do you choose?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that's not fair. The cake doesn't have legs.

speaker: FRAN
words: So how are we coming here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Fran, so good. This cake is amazing.

speaker: RORY
words: Beyond amazing.

speaker: FRAN
words: Well, I should hope so. We've been doing this for a 112 years.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. Well, you don't look a day over a 106.

speaker: FRAN
words: No, I meant my family's been doing it for that long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. Okay, well, I'm glad we got that cleared up.

speaker: RORY
words: The raspberry, the raspberry, the raspberry!

speaker: FRAN
words: So, when is the big day again?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Two weeks from tomorrow.

speaker: FRAN
words: Have you picked a flavor?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know. They're all so good.

speaker: FRAN
words: Well you have to try them again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no. I've already eaten so many.

speaker: FRAN
words: This is a very crucial decision, young lady. Cake is the glue of the wedding, so you will stand here and eat until you decide.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, if you insist.

speaker: FRAN
words: I do. After all, what's more important then your wedding day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it ain't Guy Fawkes day.

speaker: FRAN
words: Yes, well, I'll just go and see if there's anything else in the back. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: So how was in seeing Max last night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well…

speaker: RORY
words: No gory details.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like I've ever shared that part of my relationship with you.

speaker: RORY
words: You've alluded, you've insinuated, you have tiptoed to the brink of impropriety.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, that Chilton has taught you some big words.

speaker: RORY
words: That's kind of the point.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was really great. I'm glad he's back.

speaker: RORY
words: And he's on board with the whole smallish wedding thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. We want fun, we want simple, we want fast. We've been completely in sync, without the slightly gay boy band affiliation.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I printed up some sample invitations for you. I made them on my computer

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww.

speaker: RORY
words: All you have to do is pick out a quote for the front page, and I'll print 'em up. [shows Lorelai the sample invitations]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Um… "What is love? It is the morning and the evening star." Ugh.

speaker: RORY
words: Sinclair Lewis.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sinclair Sappy Lewis.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, next.

speaker: LORELAI
words: "And all went merry as a marriage bell. But hush! Hark! A deep sound strikes like a rising knell!" What is it with poetry?

speaker: RORY
words: Lord Byron.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Byron and Lewis, together again.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, last one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: "We have buried the putrid corpse of liberty." Perfect!

speaker: RORY
words: Mussolini it is. Um, can I ask you an ethical question?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.

speaker: RORY
words: Is it right to be sampling wedding cakes when Sookie's making ours for free?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is right anyway, you know? Who defines right? And if eating cake is wrong, I don't want to be right.

speaker: FRAN
words: [calls] I'm bringing out a mocha crunch cream.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, ethics?

speaker: RORY
words: Highly subjective and completely overrated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's my girl.
[opening credits]
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Max are in the living room talking to Kirk.]

speaker: KIRK
words: And here's a sample of some of my black and white shots.

speaker: MAX
words: Hm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow Kirk, I didn't know you were into photography.

speaker: KIRK
words: It's my passion.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have you ever shot a wedding before?

speaker: KIRK
words: Actually, this would be my first official wedding gig. Or photography gig, for that matter. But believe me, I've got the eye. And my Nikon is state of the art.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, I've got a Nikon too. It's an N64 with 3D matrix metering, 35 to 210 zoom. What have you got?

speaker: KIRK
words: It's a Nikon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I gotta tell you Kirk, these are really good for amateur shots.

speaker: KIRK
words: Thanks. That's me and my parents on vacation in the Berkshires.

speaker: MAX
words: Hm, nice looking family.

speaker: KIRK
words: And those are some self-portraits.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aahh! Kirk, you're nude!

speaker: KIRK
words: No no, I'm wearing Speedos. They're kind of flesh colored.

speaker: MAX
words: Wait a minute. I recognize this.

speaker: KIRK
words: Nice photo, huh?

speaker: MAX
words: This is VJ Day, New York, 1945.

speaker: KIRK
words: Right. I include it as an example of the excellence that I aspire to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How much for your services?

speaker: KIRK
words: How about a hundred and fifty an hour?

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about lunch and the cost of the film?

speaker: KIRK
words: You won't be sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Done.

speaker: KIRK
words: I thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. [Kirk leaves]

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, uh, what time is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ten…

speaker: MAX
words: Ten of?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Three.

speaker: MAX
words: I have to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No!

speaker: MAX
words: I have to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're always going.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, luckily that'll all change soon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it will. Two weeks from now you won't have to get going 'cause it's here you'll be going. To. Going or going to?

speaker: MAX
words: I'd add the to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. Going to. You make me smarter.

speaker: MAX
words: Hm, well, I am a teacher.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, hey, don't. Stay longer.

speaker: MAX
words: I can't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take me upstairs and see if you can get me into Mensa.

speaker: MAX
words: It's gonna take me forever to get back into the city, and I gotta get up early to let the painters in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, do you have to be there while they work?

speaker: MAX
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, isn't your apartment gonna be all paint fumey?

speaker: MAX
words: Yeah, so?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, maybe you should stay here.

speaker: MAX
words: Here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Instead of driving back and forth all weekend, sleep over. I mean, it's gonna be your place too soon enough. Look at it like a trial run.

speaker: MAX
words: A trial run.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It'll be fun.

speaker: MAX
words: You think you're ready for me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm always ready for you.

speaker: MAX
words: Full time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I insist.

speaker: MAX
words: He was not wearing Speedos.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, don't talk about the photo.

speaker: MAX
words: The man was buck naked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Offer rescinded if this line of conversation proceeds.

speaker: MAX
words: I'll be back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye hon.
CUT TO CENTER OF STARS HOLLOW
[Rory and Dean are walking around the middle of town.]

speaker: DEAN
words: So, what are we doing tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll do whatever.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, what movies haven't we seen?

speaker: RORY
words: We haven't seen just about all of them.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, they all stink this year.

speaker: RORY
words: They definitely do underestimate our intelligence.

speaker: DEAN
words: Plus they stink.

speaker: RORY
words: There are at least five of them featuring someone doing something disgusting with a cow.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah. I mean, they should at least do something disgusting with a different animal.

speaker: RORY
words: We can watch "Holy Grail" on tape again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, but I am not talking in an English accent for the rest of the evening.

speaker: RORY
words: No fun. Hey, tomorrow night?

speaker: DEAN
words: "Life of Brian?"

speaker: RORY
words: Max is staying over.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: First time. And to kind of celebrate, he and my mom wanted to go on a double date.

speaker: DEAN
words: But tomorrow's our anniversary.

speaker: RORY
words: No it's not, it's on the twenty-fourth.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, that was our old anniversary. We broke up and got back together on the sixth. So using the twenty-fourth wouldn't be an accurate account of how long we've been together.

speaker: RORY
words: Unless you consider our time apart as a temporary moratorium on our relationship. You know, like the time kept passing, and we were on a sabbatical.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, it's complicated.

speaker: RORY
words: Very.

speaker: DEAN
words: So a double date, with adults?

speaker: RORY
words: No, just with Mom and Max.

speaker: DEAN
words: What'll it be, like dinner and dancing?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, and then we'll enjoy brandy and cigars. No, we'll probably just grab a bite.

speaker: DEAN
words: All right, we can do that.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, let's have two anniversaries. We can celebrate twice a month. They're well spread apart, the sixth and the twenty-fourth.

speaker: DEAN
words: We can't do that.

speaker: RORY
words: Who's gonna stop us?

speaker: DEAN
words: Twice a month?

speaker: RORY
words: Dare to be different.

speaker: DEAN
words: Twice a month it is.
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Max is cooking dinner while Lorelai sits at the table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why won't you let me help?

speaker: MAX
words: Because you're a danger to the process.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's not true!

speaker: MAX
words: I've got numerous scars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I cut you that one…two times, and I've helped you tons of times.

speaker: MAX
words: You helped me twice and both time you cut me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I do like watching you cook.

speaker: MAX
words: I like you watching me cook.

speaker: RORY
words: [walking into kitchen] What's that weird smell?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's food!

speaker: MAX
words: It smells weird?

speaker: RORY
words: No, just weird for this house. It smells great.

speaker: MAX
words: Rory, could you get that?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: Uh, right down there. Uh, shiny handle.
[Rory opens the broiler]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! Did you know we had that?

speaker: RORY
words: Not a clue.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, it's on fire!

speaker: MAX
words: It's the broiler.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: MAX
words: What fallout shelter have you guys been living in?

speaker: RORY
words: He has much knowledge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We shall form a cult around him.

speaker: RORY
words: Build a statue many stories high.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We shall grow our hair long and stop bathing.

speaker: MAX
words: Please, don't do any of that.

speaker: RORY
words: Are we eating at the table?

speaker: MAX
words: Wherever you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: TV?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll get a tape.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I at least grab some dishes?

speaker: MAX
words: Far away from me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Alarmist.
CUT TO LIVING ROOM
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting on the floor, Max is sitting on the couch, all are watching a movie.]

speaker: TV
words: 'You don't learn very fast Injun.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: How fast do you learn Billy Jack?

speaker: TV
words: 'Fast enough.'

speaker: RORY
words: Billy Jack, I'm gonna kill you if it's the last thing I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, he so jinxed himself with that one.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, he should've said 'Billy Jack, I'm gonna kill you or buy myself a lovely chenille sweater.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, yeah, either way he wins.

speaker: MAX
words: How many times have you seen this movie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm out of digits.

speaker: RORY
words: You can't see a Billy Jack movie too many times.

speaker: MAX
words: Who's the guy Billy Jack's. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh shh shh!

speaker: TV
words: 'All right you cats. Very slowly now.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's do some jumping jacks.

speaker: TV
words: 'Spread out. One.'

speaker: RORY
words: Oh it's the counting part.

speaker: TV
words: 'He means it Daniel.' 'Two.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, here comes my favorite and my least favorite line all rolled into one.

speaker: TV
words: 'I'm gonna cut your bowels out.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ughughugh.

speaker: RORY
words: Ahh, yuck!

speaker: TV
words: 'Three.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, comeuppance time!

speaker: MAX
words: You guys talk throughout the whole movie and then when I say something, you shush me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's because you're talking through parts we talked through last time, so we haven't seen those parts in awhile.

speaker: MAX
words: Ah, well now it's clear.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max?

speaker: MAX
words: What? The phone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoever's closest answers.

speaker: RORY
words: House rule.

speaker: MAX
words: You're both closer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, but I'd have to walk around the coffee table so my path would be farther.

speaker: RORY
words: And my foot's asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Plus you're taller.

speaker: RORY
words: With longer legs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, so even if we all left for the phone at exactly the same time…

speaker: MAX
words: I got it. [goes to answer phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna like having him around.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE LATER THAT NIGHT
[Lorelai and Rory are still on the floor. Max is asleep on the couch.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You want a refill?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure, same thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We wore him out.

speaker: RORY
words: We tend to do that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we are ElectraWoman and DynaGirl.

speaker: MAX
words: ElectraWoman.

speaker: RORY
words: I think it's time to turn in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm awake.

speaker: RORY
words: You don't look it.

speaker: MAX
words: No, I am. I'm just waiting for the guy with the thing on the…

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, get him to bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, okay. Come on hon.

speaker: MAX
words: What happened to Billy Jack?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll explain it to you later.

speaker: RORY
words: Goodnight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Goodnight.

speaker: MAX
words: Goodnight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] Is this weird?

speaker: RORY
words: [shrugs]

speaker: PAN OVER LORELAI'S BEDROOM
words: PAN OVER LORELAI'S BEDROOM
[Max is asleep while Lorelai lay awake staring at the ceiling.]
CUT TO RORY'S BEDROOM
[Rory is sleeping. Lorelai walks in and sits on her bed.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: What? What is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh nothing. Whatcha doing?

speaker: RORY
words: Taking back Poland.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good luck with that.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a boy in my room

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I have a boy in my room.

speaker: RORY
words: It's Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: You like Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, uhh, yes, I do, but it's weird. We've never had a man in the house like this up there.

speaker: RORY
words: He's your fiancé.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very true.

speaker: RORY
words: So all you need to do is adjust. It's like that time you got the green stripes in your hair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hated those green stripes.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I'm tired. I can think of a better example tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, wake up, wake up. We've not properly talked about this.

speaker: RORY
words: About what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: About having Max in the house. About the effect on you. Don't cover up anything. Let's get it all out in the open.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't have anything to cover up. I like Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you do, and that's good. But you know, once we are married, nothing will ever be the same again.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It won't just be the 'me and you secret special clubhouse no boys allowed' thing anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: It will be different.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not just different. Our lives as we know them will be over.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, we're not dying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, we're not dying. But the life we had is gonna morph into this like mutation that we could never possibly have conceived.

speaker: RORY
words: Like the giant ants in "Them"?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Metaphorically speaking, yes. And I don't want it to be like giant ants, so that's why I'm talking about it now.

speaker: RORY
words: I am in no way anticipating being attacked by giant man-eating ants because Max is living here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Good.

speaker: RORY
words: Weirdo.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, you can't walk around in the buff anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't remember ever walking around in the buff.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know one time you did.

speaker: RORY
words: Was I three?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Somewhere around there.

speaker: RORY
words: Does he hog the bed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. He's a very 'stay on his side' kinda guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's cute. He wears pajama bottoms.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not funny ones. I hate funny bottoms.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna call you Funny Bottoms from now on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nuh uh!

speaker: RORY
words: Aren't you happy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. I'm happy.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, then it'll be fine. You'll get used to it, having Max there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. You're right. I will. I will get used to it. [closes her eys]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm?

speaker: RORY
words: You're falling asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: You need to be a big girl and go to your own room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. [pretends she can't get up] Uh, uh...

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, ten more minutes

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Luke is walking around serving coffee.]

speaker: LUKE
words: More?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Absotivalutely.

speaker: LUKE
words: What's up Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Up, I know of nothing up.

speaker: LUKE
words: What's up Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I'm just happy.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's what makes me nervous.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You're a paranoid man Luke. I feel very sad for you.
[Lorelai and Rory walk in.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Over there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, can you clear that one off?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause it's bigger.

speaker: LUKE
words: So.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we're three today.

speaker: LUKE
words: Three?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, Max is with us.

speaker: LUKE
words: Max, huh? So when did Max become invisible to the human eye?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's on a paper hunt.

speaker: RORY
words: Max likes his three papers in the morning. The Hartford Courant, the New York Times, and the Wall Street Journal.

speaker: LUKE
words: Three papers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He likes to be well informed.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, reading three papers all reporting the same news is a terrific use of trees.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You be nice Luke, I mean it.
[Max walks into the diner]

speaker: MAX
words: Hey there.

speaker: LUKE
words: Max, buddy, top of the morning to you! Hey, you look good today. Brown is your color, my friend.

speaker: MAX
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: MAX
words: I got two out of three.

speaker: RORY
words: Not bad

speaker: MAX
words: No one has the Wall Street Journal.

speaker: RORY
words: Well this isn't a very financially oriented town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it's more oriented to coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: I've got the blueberry pancakes this morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bring 'em.

speaker: RORY
words: Bring 'em twice.

speaker: LUKE
words: And you?

speaker: MAX
words: I'm gonna need a minute.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Well, then, hold off.

speaker: RORY
words: Same here.

speaker: LUKE
words: I might run out of the pancakes.

speaker: MAX
words: Go ahead, order. I'll just be a minute.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No that's okay. We'll wait.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm almost out and I can't make more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Set some aside.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's first come, first serve.

speaker: RORY
words: We'll take our chances.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we'll wait.

speaker: LUKE
words: Whatever. [walks away]

speaker: MAX
words: You didn't need to do that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, happy to.
[Max reads over the menu while Rory and Lorelai watch him.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, yeah, that's still eggs and all your basic breakfast stuff up there.

speaker: MAX
words: Just order.

speaker: RORY
words: We're fine.

speaker: MAX
words: I want you guys to go at your normal pace. My rhythm might not necessarily be your rhythm. [Luke walks over, hands Max another menu] What's this?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's the lunch menu. I stop serving breakfast in an hour.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: MAX
words: I'll have poached eggs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And blueberry pancakes!!

speaker: RORY
words: Did we make it?!

speaker: LUKE
words: I already set 'em aside.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Love ya!
[Luke notices a work crew outside.]

speaker: LUKE
words: What the hell they doing out there?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What? Who is that?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are they doing Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Looks like they're coning off the street.

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
