words: Well, if you must know, they are a county work crew here to install Stars Hollow's first traffic light and metered crosswalk. [Luke rushes outside] Luke!

speaker: LUKE
words: [to work crew] Hold it!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: [to work crew] Keep going. [to Luke] You have no controlling legal authority over this matter.

speaker: LUKE
words: Stuff it Taylor. Hold it!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Keep going. And I will not stuff it.

speaker: LUKE
words: What authority did you have to authorize this? You're supposed to inform local business owners of major projects per the town's rules, meaning me.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Not when it's a matter of dire public safety, where the city charter clearly states that I can function unilaterally in the town's best interest.

speaker: LUKE
words: Dire public safety! We haven't had an accident here in ten years!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You can't stop progress Luke.
[Taylor walks away. Lorelai comes out of the diner.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Traffic light, huh?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's unbelievable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it can always be taken out…with your bare hands or your teeth.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you get my invitation?

speaker: LUKE
words: The what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My wedding invitation for my wedding 'cause I'm wedding Max.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, yeah. It's in a pile upstairs somewhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, good. So are you coming?

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, I gotta make some calls about this thing before it's too late. I'll see you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Uh…
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[It's nighttime. Lorelai, Rory, Max, and Dean are walking along the sidewalk.]

speaker: MAX
words: Ugh, I can barely walk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bad shoes?

speaker: MAX
words: I ate a cow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You had a steak.

speaker: MAX
words: Plus the sides. Four people, six baked potatoes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you always exaggerate.

speaker: MAX
words: Am I exaggerating?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nope.

speaker: RORY
words: Ooh, ice cream! [runs off]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I'm right behind you! [runs off]

speaker: MAX
words: How can they possibly eat more?

speaker: DEAN
words: Kind of surprised.

speaker: MAX
words: I know. They're bottomless pits.

speaker: DEAN
words: I mean at you. You've known them long enough not to be so confused.
[They both sit on a bench.]

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, I'm not confused. I'm just . . . what do you mean?

speaker: DEAN
words: Their eating habits are just the start of what you're gonna have to get used to. There's tons of stuff you should be aware of.

speaker: MAX
words: Really?

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh yeah. Like, don't ever use the last of the parmesan cheese. And never get into a heavy discussion late at night 'cause that's when they're at their crankiest. Oh, and uh, go with their bits.

speaker: MAX
words: Their bits?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, like, if you're eating pizza with them and Lorelai decides that the pepperoni is angry at the mushrooms because the mushrooms have an attitude and then she holds up a pepperoni and the pepperoni asks for your opinion...don't just laugh. Answer the pepperoni.

speaker: MAX
words: Answer the pepperoni.

speaker: DEAN
words: And don't let them near puppies 'cause they'll want to take home every one.

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, that one I knew.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, and uh, here's a big one. If you ever think that they're doing something crazy, they're not. You see, after a while, their thinking becomes clear, but by the time it's clear, they've already done two other totally crazy things that you can't figure out. So there's no catching up.

speaker: MAX
words: You have much knowledge.

speaker: DEAN
words: You got that from Rory.

speaker: MAX
words: Right.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, and hey, does Lorelai know what kind of ice cream you like?

speaker: MAX
words: Yeah, chocolate chip. But I already told her that I…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, chocolate chip. [hands him an ice cream cone]

speaker: MAX
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.
CUT TO LORELAI'S FRONT PORCH
[Lorelai, Rory, Max, and Dean walk up to Lorelai's house.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, I'm so full. Why'd you let me eat so much?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, they'll blame you.
[Lorelai goes inside]

speaker: MAX
words: It's past eleven guys.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[Max goes inside]
CUT TO LORELAI'S BEDROOM
[Lorelai is lying on her bed. Max walks into the room.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.

speaker: MAX
words: How ya doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, I'm stable.

speaker: MAX
words: You're a lovely shade of puce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't say puce. It sounds too much like another word I don't wanna hear right now.

speaker: MAX
words: Sorry. You know they're still outside.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who?

speaker: MAX
words: Rory and Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: MAX
words: How long you think they'll be out there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.

speaker: MAX
words: So there's no time limit or anything?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. As soon as they both get tired of saying 'No, you're prettier' to each other, then the night's over.

speaker: MAX
words: Lorelai, come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I'm gonna be living here soon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that.

speaker: MAX
words: So I just thought I should know what the procedure is when stuff like this comes up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stuff like what?

speaker: MAX
words: Say you're not here, I come home, there's Rory and Dean in the dark all alone after eleven. I mean, how do I handle stuff like that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Max, Rory is very low maintenance. Kind of like that robot kid in A.I., only way less mother-obsessed. Oh my God, that kid was so annoying. I would've pushed him out of the car while it was still moving.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, what if I catch them one night making out on the couch?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Umm…well, turn off the light?

speaker: MAX
words: You're not being serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max, they're teenagers. They can kiss a little bit.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay, well, what do I do if Rory comes home drunk?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on!

speaker: MAX
words: It happens.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not to Rory it doesn't.

speaker: MAX
words: I know. But theoretically, just in a make believe world, if she did, what would I do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: MAX
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you would do nothing. I would handle it.

speaker: MAX
words: So basically, I have no role in Rory's life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max, Rory's done. She's brought up, she's Rory. You don't need a role.

speaker: MAX
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't see the problem here.

speaker: MAX
words: Clearly. So, I should do nothing around here ever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not nothing ever.

speaker: MAX
words: What then?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, making the garlic bread the other night was really good.

speaker: MAX
words: So other than making the garlic bread and answering the phone, what else is my role around here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you're my fella. You're my guy, you're my old man.

speaker: MAX
words: What does that entail?

speaker: LORELAI
words: All things dirty.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm not joking here. We're getting married Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, that means we're taking two separate lives and melding them together. I mean, how do you think that's gonna work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, have you given it any thought at all?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not really. No, I…I mean, but I will! But I…I'll start now.

speaker: MAX
words: How would you feel if I told you I haven't thought about our future at all?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Terrible, I would feel terrible, I'm sorry. I mean it, I'm sorry. Please come here. Remember, it's all those little annoying quirks that make me the fascinating woman you fell in love with. Hmm? [they kiss]

speaker: MAX
words: Really not fair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've got a lingerie drawer full of not fair, mister.

speaker: MAX
words: Okay. I mean, we didn't need to get into this tonight. I definitely broke Dean's late night cranky rule.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who's what?

speaker: MAX
words: Nothing.
CUT TO OUTSIDE LUKE'S DINER
[A crowd is standing around the new traffic light.]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Welcome townspeople! I… [crumbled up piece of paper hits him in the head] So you're gonna spoil it for all of us right off the bat, huh Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why waste time?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What about dinner?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you don't eat dinner at a bachelorette party.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You gotta eat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you gotta drink, dance, party and drink some more.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We'll all hurl before the night's half over.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This is all very fascinating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, sorry Teach. We'll keep it down.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: How about keeping it silent?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [whispers] Way down.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Or zipping it shut?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [in high voice] Little tiny mice voices.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Townspeople, we should all be proud of the new addition to our streets. I know many of you have wanted a traffic light and a crosswalk for many years…

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: …and now, your dream has come true.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's like Hitler's Germany.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Luke!

speaker: LUKE
words: You're trying to brainwash us, Taylor. Telling us we want something that we don't and not giving us any choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, shish! We're planning.

speaker: LUKE
words: I heard, and you're idiots if you don't eat first.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Everybody, let me segue into the informational portion of our gathering. If I can turn your attention to the pole here, you will see a yellow button with an instructional panel right above it.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh my God. That's the biggest yellow button I've ever seen.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Now if you'll read the panel above the button, you'll learn how the system works.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: 'To cross street, push yellow button, wait for walk signal. When signal reads walk, step into street and proceed to the other side.'

speaker: LUKE
words: It's written for morons.

speaker: BABETTE
words: In big stupid letters too!

speaker: MOREY
words: I hate being infantalized.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Does no one here care about this fate of near accidents we have suffered over the past year?

speaker: LUKE
words: Near accidents. Meaning they didn't happen.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Just because they didn't happen doesn't mean that we shouldn't ward against them.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's lots of things that don't happen that we don't ward against.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Like?

speaker: LUKE
words: Like everything.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: So that everything doesn't happen here, meaning nothing happens?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, it's not nothing happens. Stuff happens. It's that it…it's not everything that's…it's…Dammit Taylor!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ha! Now, for some interesting stats…[voice fades into background]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So let's see. That's you, me, Miss Patty, Rory, Babette. Babette, you're coming right?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Doll, I'm sorry. I'm not gonna be able to make it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Babette, no.

speaker: BABETTE
words: We're having Morey's parents over for dinner, and if you cancel on 'em last minute, they'll stick a red-hot poker up your 'you know where'.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, we'll miss you.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Yeah, well stick your hand down the front of some guy's pants for me, would ya?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hope you're talking about a stripper.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Whatever.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: …Now the length of the walk signal's duration has thoughtfully been timed to accommodate the pace of Stars Hollow's oldest living resident. So, to inaugurate the signal, our beloved Mrs. Lanahan is going to push the button and lead the first historic group across the street. Ready with the camera Kirk?

speaker: KIRK
words: Rolling. [starts taking pictures]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Uh, the cap is still on the lens, dear.

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not wearing a veil at the party.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But the bride always wears a veil at the bachelorette party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not wearing a veil at the wedding.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're not? I love veils!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nah, we're going cas Sook.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But it's a big day, you gotta have some pomp.

speaker: LUKE
words: You should elope and get it over with.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No one asked you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Believe me, eloping was not out of the question.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But you don't get a wedding over with.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why not? It's a bureaucratic civil ceremony, a pretty pointless one.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Agh! Don't listen to him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, he's just being Luke

speaker: LUKE
words: It's not biologically natural for people to mate for life. Animals don't mate for life. Well, ducks do, but who the hell cares what ducks do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, people grow and evolve their whole lives. The chances that you're gonna grow and evolve at the same rate as someone else...too slim to take. The minute you say 'I do', you're sticking yourself in a tiny little box for the rest of your life. But hey, at least you had a party first, right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, I'm tired of you now. We're gonna finish this conversation away from Crotchety Guy. [Sookie pulls Lorelai away]
CUT TO OUTSIDE NIGHT CLUB
[Lorelai, Sookie, Rory, Miss Patty, and Michel are standing in line outside a night club.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, this place looks like fun!

speaker: RORY
words: They're never gonna let me in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They will let you in.

speaker: MICHEL
words: This is a felony, you know, corrupting a minor. We'll all end up in the bookie.

speaker: RORY
words: He's right. We're all going to the bookie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweetie, don't say bookie. It's creepy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just try to look older.

speaker: RORY
words: How?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Look like you're thinking about retirements or 401Ks and stuff.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, you should've brought your fake beard and mustache.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who invited Mister Schnickelfritz?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He heard us planning and wanted to come.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I did not know the evening included babysitting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's going to get in. [cell phone rings] Sorry. Hey!

speaker: MAX
words: So my bachelor party's come to a screeching halt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? Why?

speaker: MAX
words: There's been an accident. I'm fine, but we're at the hospital.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, what happened?

speaker: MAX
words: We're coming out of the restaurant and we're heading toward our next stop when my brother decides to leap frog over a parking meter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why did he do that?

speaker: MAX
words: Middle child.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Poor Jan.

speaker: MAX
words: Anyway, he didn't make it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Ouch. How drunk was he?

speaker: MAX
words: He claims he wasn't drunk. He's saying that the parking meters in Hartford are taller then the parking meters in Deluth so he just miscalculated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: MAX
words: Yup.

speaker: MAX'S BROTHER
words: I've got a concussion. I'm good. Let's drink.

speaker: MAX
words: Hold on a second. You got a concussion?

speaker: MAX'S BROTHER
words: Yeah, it's a little one…

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is he saying?

speaker: MAX
words: It's a mild concussion. We're gonna take him home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, well take him home, and then go hit a strip club.

speaker: MAX
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am telling you, this is your last chance to look at another woman's breastage.

speaker: MAX
words: Point well taken. I'll call you tomorrow. [they hang up]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, new rule for the evening. No calls to fiancés or boyfriends or anything else like that. It's girls' night out. Plus Michel.
[They reach the club entrance]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: BOUNCER
words: It's twelve bucks. And it's eighteen and over.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, she's eighteen.

speaker: RORY
words: That's right. Last week. So it's a new eighteen, but it's eighteen, yup.

speaker: BOUNCER
words: You got some ID?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, uh, sir, make way for Rory. That's her name. And her only name. Rory. Single name, she's that important. Internationally known international supermodel and sometimes spokesperson for international products.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She's very big in Germany.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yah, yah, yah, with the Lederhosen and such.

speaker: BOUNCER
words: Twelve bucks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Danke schön, cutie.
CUT TO INSIDE CLUB

speaker: MICHEL
words: This is a drag club.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's called the Queen Victoria. What did you expect, tea and crumpets?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, you guys, I guess we're gonna have to stand.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wait, that one looks open.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.
[They walk towards the table. Emily is sitting there.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What in Lucifer's reach is my mother doing here?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, I invited her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You what?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Just a little surprise for you. I thought it would be a kick.
[They walk over to Emily.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me sir, you look just like my mother.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma. Come here often?

speaker: EMILY
words: I should say not. How did you get in?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, apparently, I'm an internationally known supermodel.

speaker: EMILY
words: Happy bachelorette party, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you Mother.

speaker: EMILY
words: And in the future, when you plan one of these things, and you tell a person to show up at eight o'clock, it is considered good manners for you to also show up at eight o'clock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I didn't exactly invite you mother, Michel did.

speaker: EMILY
words: Ah, well, I feel much better now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, let's drink.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Looks like Emily's gotten a head start. What are you drinking honey?

speaker: EMILY
words: Manhattan. Good too. Not too sweet. I ordered it from that nice fellow dressed as Joan Crawford.

speaker: MICHEL
words: So, is there no dancing here? I was hoping there'd be dancing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You need to strut Tony Minero?

speaker: MICHEL
words: It is a weekend and on the weekend I like to move, and the ladies, they like it too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Especially when you move out of town. Ba zing!

speaker: EMILY
words: Has she eaten?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. About a quart of wine.
[A waitress comes to the table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, hi Mae West.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: What can I get for you?

speaker: MICHEL
words: My dignity back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll have a rum and coke, a margarita no salt, martini with olives, a Shirley Temple…

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Love her!

speaker: RORY
words: I'll have her on the rocks please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And uh, I will have a giant Long Island iced tea.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Coming up. [leaves]

speaker: EMILY
words: So Lorelai, how are you feeling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, well, I'm tipsy, but just short of seeing pink elephants.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, I mean about you getting married. It's only a week away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine. Everything's fine. I figured once I got the shoes to match the dress, the rest was just gravy.

speaker: EMILY
words: I must say, I admire your composure. The week before my wedding, I was a wreck.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: So was I, before all of mine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How many was that?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, uh, there was Sinjin, John, Sergio, Sinjin. Three men, four times.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Do you regret any of them?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, Sinjin was a let down the second time, but he was my Burton and I was his Taylor. Just wish I could've found a little Mike Todd there in the middle.

speaker: EMILY
words: You know, I can't believe it was 34 years ago that I married Richard. I remember it so distinctly.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, this is gonna be a romantic story.

speaker: EMILY
words: My stomach was not my friend. It was full of butterflies, I couldn't eat a bite the whole week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, what a bummer.

speaker: EMILY
words: I was actually weak in the knees. Trembling all the time, can you imagine?

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: EMILY
words: When I wasn't actually with Richard, I was thinking about him. Constantly. Imagining what he was doing, was he thinking about me? Making up little scenarios in my head about how we'd run into each other accidentally at the club. And he would be playing golf and I would walk by and he would be so distracted that he'd completely miss the ball. Silly.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's sweet.

speaker: EMILY
words: I was in love

speaker: MICHEL
words: It is wonderful to be in love

speaker: EMILY
words: But the thing I remember most was that for the entire week before my wedding, I'd wait 'til my mother went to sleep, and I'd sneak out of bed and I'd put on my wedding dress and my tiara and my gloves, and I would stare at myself in the mirror and think how very safe I felt. How very right and wise and honored. This is a very good drink. I highly recommend it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, I have got to make a call.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Are you calling Jackson?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No. Well yes, but it's only because I need to pick up something I left at his house, that if it's still there, I should. . .hi honey, it's me. [leaves table]

speaker: EMILY
words: And who are you writing to?

speaker: RORY
words: I just want to see if Dean's around.

speaker: EMILY
words: And thinking about you?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh no, not you too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's just..it's…I'll be quick. [walks away from the table, dials her cell phone] Hi.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hi. Who's this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's Trixie from the other night. You never called me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you got me. Whatcha doing?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'm just hanging out. What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm at a bachelorette party.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh cool. Who's?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mine.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yours? Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. I'm still kinda 'wow' about it myself.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well who's the lucky guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you don't know him. His name's Max.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right. Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do know him?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, Rory mentioned him. She didn't mention it was serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it wasn't. We hooked up, and then it was going good, then we broke up 'cause one of us kinda freaked out…

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You freaked out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I freaked out. And then we got back together and it suddenly got very serious.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So is he worthy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is anyone?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bono, maybe? Brian Ferry?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get serious.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A young Tom Waits?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now you're talking.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So what's he like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's great.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Could you be a little more vague?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. He's Max. He's great.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, what's his CD collection like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't read into his CD collection.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Jazz, classical, what's the story?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's a kind of a general collection.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Christopher.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Are we talking a dozen soundtracks, a few Beatles, a Bob Dylan, plus a generic fifty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said don't.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Alanis Morissette?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, a lot of people knee-jerked and bought that first one of hers. Cut him some slack.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Dave Matthews?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A couple of his things are good.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Buena Vista Social Club?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Enya?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna hit you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: We're on the phone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna come over there and hit you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You're at your bachelorette party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. Right.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So why are you calling me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, because you know me really well.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I just wanted to tell someone who knows me really well that I am getting married.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, as someone who knows you really well, I say congratulations. If you found the guy, I think that's great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you can picture me married, right?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah. To the right guy, I can picture you married.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You should get back to your party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, right. He's a great guy, Max.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, I'm sure he is. I was just kidding around.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Well, I'll talk to you later.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bye. Hey, can you put Trixie back on the phone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Lorelai walks back to the table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel leave?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nope. He said he had to shake his thing. So how's your guy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How's Max doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine. Fine, everything's just fine.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Lorelai and Sookie are sitting down drinking coffee.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I know what an aneurysm feels like before you have it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Like a baseball the size of a cantaloupe in your head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [giggle] Good one.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Baseball the size of a cantaloupe.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause a baseball can only be one size, so it's a Yogi Berra type thing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yogi Bear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Forget it.
[Michel walks into the kitchen]

speaker: MICHEL
words: I feel like crap on toast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, where were you after you broke off from the group?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, I sat at a table with Janet Jackson and Celine Dion. Very nice guys. Oh, by the way, your husband-to-be is out there looking annoyingly perky. Slap him or I will.
[Lorelai walks into the lobby]

speaker: MAX
words: Hey!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ahhh.

speaker: MAX
words: So what'd I do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You spoke in a normal volume

speaker: MAX
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did nothing wrong, I'm just mad you're not more hungover.

speaker: MAX
words: I tried, I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, liar.

speaker: MAX
words: I drank copiously.

speaker: LORELAI
words: People who drank copiously the night before do not use words like copiously.

speaker: MAX
words: Ask my brother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How is Mr. McMeterHopper?

speaker: MAX
words: Ironically, he feels better than you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, it's so wrong.

speaker: MAX
words: He's fine. So I was gonna drop my printer off at the house but Rory wasn't there, and guess who doesn't possess his own set of keys yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ahh, guessing it's you.

speaker: MAX
words: Still me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max, I'm sorry, I forgot.

speaker: MAX
words: Again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Again. You're mad.

speaker: MAX
words: No. A little.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're just keys.

speaker: MAX
words: Try being without them and say that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've lost my keys before.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I haven't lost them. I never got 'em.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You'll get them.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm trying really hard not to read too much into this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: MAX
words: Like you don't want me having keys or you don't want me coming in the house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Max, that's crazy.

speaker: MAX
words: Well, I need keys.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I need an assistant.

speaker: MAX
words: No, you need to think about someone other than yourself for a few minutes a day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ouch.

speaker: MAX
words: That was too strong. Maybe I am a little hungover.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not a good day for keys or communication.

speaker: MAX
words: You know what, I'll just bring the printer by later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, bring it tomorrow.

speaker: MAX
words: I'll bring it tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. I'll have the keys.
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Lorelai is sitting at the table paying bills. Rory is at the counter.]

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe school's already starting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. I used to hate school starting. I once flipped the pages back in a calendar my mom kept in the kitchen and tried to convince her it was June and not September.

speaker: RORY
words: Didn't work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, oddly enough.

speaker: RORY
words: I got an interesting call today. [sits at the table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, who?

speaker: RORY
words: Dad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cool. How is he? I..I..I talked to him last night.

speaker: RORY
words: He mentioned that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I was about to mention it myself.

speaker: RORY
words: That's quite a coincidence.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Did I not mention it last night?

speaker: RORY
words: Huh, no, not to my knowledge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I could've sworn I did.

speaker: RORY
words: Why'd you call him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, just to check in.

speaker: RORY
words: At your bachelorette party?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seemed as good a time as any.

speaker: RORY
words: To catch up on calls?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, pretty much.

speaker: RORY
words: Seems like a weird time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did he call just to fink on me?

speaker: RORY
words: No. He wanted to see what's up with you. He thought it was weird too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Heaven forbid I ever use the phone again.

speaker: RORY
words: Was it when you told us you were calling Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Somewhere around there.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you tell us you were calling Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, someday when you're a little older you will be introduced to something that is extremely seductive but fickle. A fair-weather friend who seems benign but packs a wallop like a donkey kick, and that is the Long Island iced tea. The Long Island iced tea makes you do things that you normally wouldn't do, like lifting your skirt in public or calling someone you normally wouldn't call at really weird times.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not looking forward to meeting the Long Island iced tea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'd definitely walk the other way.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, Dad wants you to be happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: And I really want you to be happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, sweetie.

speaker: RORY
words: You are happy about all this, aren't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't I seem happy?

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay then.

speaker: RORY
words: All right. I'll be in my room if you need me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.
CUT TO FRONT YARD
[Lorelai comes out the front door and sees Luke taking a large wooden archway off the back of his truck.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is that?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, it's a chuppah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A what?

speaker: LUKE
words: A chuppah. You stand under it, you and Max. It's for your wedding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you make that?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I had some time, so…here, give me a hand, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, it's beautiful.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, I saw a picture in a book. The picture looked better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's got carvings. Birds and flowers.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, there's also a goat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A goat!

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I don't know what it stands for, but it was in the picture, and you like goats, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, goats are good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, so there you go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What on earth inspired you to do this?

speaker: LUKE
words: You're getting married. You can't just stand in the hot sun in the middle of a lawn that hasn't been mowed in weeks. I guess he doesn't mow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Max isn't a mower.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, you needed something. Here it is. I'll mow it if you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We got a guy who does that. One of the Pete's from the nursery.

speaker: LUKE
words: Big Pete?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Little Pete.

speaker: LUKE
words: He's the better of the Pete's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We've always thought so. Hey, aren't chuppahs Jewish?
[They sit on the front porch steps]

speaker: LUKE
words: Maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it okay that Max and I aren't Jewish?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's okay by me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but I mean to stand under it. God won't smite us or anything?

speaker: LUKE
words: I highly doubt it. Plus God'd probably have to get a license from Taylor to do any smiting in Stars Hollow on a weekend, so I'd say your safe. You know, I wasn't putting down Max. He seems like a really good guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He is, and you were putting him down.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, I didn't mean to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you mean all those things you said about marriage?

speaker: LUKE
words: What things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You really want me to repeat them to you?

speaker: LUKE
words: No. I mean, I guess, for some people marriage, you know, isn't the worst thing in the world. I mean, it's probably better than being hobbled or something like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And people can evolve together, don't you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: Maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yoko and John Lennon did. They just got closer and closer as the years went by. At the end, they had the same face.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, it got a little spooky.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But cool.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, they were lucky. I guess if you can find that one person, you know, who's willing to put up with all your crap, and doesn't want to change you or dress you or you know, make you eat French food, then marriage can be all right. But that's only if you find that person.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, if you find that person.
[They both get up and stand under the chuppah.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No one has ever made me a chuppah before.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, you only get married once. Theoretically.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, you only get married once.
[Shot from behind of them standing together under the chuppah.]
CUT TO RORY'S BEDROOM

words: No.

words: Where are we going?

words: Hot, cold, rocky, sandy, mountain, valley?

words: I didn't really have a particular spot.

words: Yeah, light layers.

words: Do you need a book?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, that Colette biography.

words: I lost your place in it.

words: That's okay. I have to start over anyway.

speaker: RORY
words: You got it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And hurry.

words: Are we going tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: First thing in the morning.

speaker: RORY
words: Seven-ish?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Five-ish.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It'll be more like six-ish.

speaker: RORY
words: Let's shoot for five-ish.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are crazy, and I love it.
CUT TO LORELAI'S JEEP
[Early the next morning, Lorelai and Rory are in Lorelai's jeep driving through Stars Hollow.]

words: Wow, totally deserted.

words: We're the last ones left.

words: So are we almost there?

words: We're practically gone already.

words: What is a road tip without tunes?

words: The sun is directly behind us.

words: Never been in this car for any extended period of time without playing AC/DC.

words: I have no idea which way it's going.

words: Stop complaining about our whereabouts.

words: Well, my complaint is legitimate, yours is infantile.

words: Okay, you're right. [turns on radio] Ooh, ooh, yee-haw, yes. Country music, must be my lucky day.

speaker: RORY
words: [turns off radio] We have to figure out where we're going.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No we don't.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The point of this is to be spontaneous. To drive and land someplace we've never been and never expected to be.

speaker: RORY
words: Sounds risky.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds exciting.

speaker: RORY
words: Serendipity has never been kind to us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, yes, but I talked to serendipity on the phone last night. She feels bad about how she's treated us in the past. We had a nice chat. It's all gonna be different now.

words: What did that sign say? It said "Don't" or "Death" on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Relax.

speaker: RORY
words: We're doomed!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wrong. We're being guided by fate.

words: I think we're lost.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We can't be lost. We don't know where we're going.

speaker: RORY
words: You're going to stop before we drive into the Atlantic Ocean.

words: At least we'll know where we are.

words: Unless you don't like nuts.

words: As if those people exist. You know, if I was in a rock band touring and stuff, I'd make the bus driver stop at every Haden's Nut House we pass.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, so if we continue on the way we've been going…who are you calling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [dialing her cell phone] Uh, Sookie.

speaker: RORY
words: Now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well, I didn't get a chance to call her before we left so she doesn't know about the…

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: You okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I guess. It's just, um…Hi Sookie, it's me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [at the Inn] Hi Sweetie, you on your way in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, no, not yet. Actually, I'm um, I'm gonna be out of town for a couple of days.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, Rory and I decided to hit the road.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But how can you be hitting the road? You're supposed to be getting…

speaker: LORELAI
words: The engagement is off, Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What? What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it's a long story. I don't really wanna go into all the whats and whys and gory details right now, but you should know we all still love Max, and to figure out exactly what happened, you'd have to dig up Freud himself and have him work on me full time.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Aww, honey, I'm so sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. So I hope you didn't get too far on that cake.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [looking at almost-completed 5-tier cake] No, no, no. That's one thing you can be thankful about. You caught me in plenty of time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. I know the kind of work you were gonna put into it, and I just would've killed myself if you'd gone to all that craziness for nothing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, well, I've been so busy lately, I actually forgot about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, do me a favor. Mention canceling the wedding to Miss Patty, will you? That way, by the time we get back…

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The whole town will know within the hour.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then hopefully they will all have chatted it out of their systems before we get home.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Consider it done. So where you going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We have no idea.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ah, my favorite kind of trip.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, thanks. I'll talk to you soon. Just call the cell if you need anything.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okie dokie. Buh bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. [hangs up]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You were a good cake Clyde. I never should've named you.

words: That had better not be a map.

words: Rory.

words: Hello there.

words: Hi.

words: Would you like to ring the bell?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

words: Would you like to ring the bell, you or your daughter?

words: I don't understand.

words: I'm not usually sitting here when guests arrive, so people ring the bell and they love to ring the bell, and you didn't get to ring the bell.

words: Uh. . . [rings bell]

words: Well done.

words: Uh, do you have a room available?

words: Yes, we most certainly do, you lucky pretty things you.

words: See they have a room.

words: Good.

words: Um, does Donald happen to be here?

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh no no, I bought this place from Donald last year. It's my place now. I'm LaDonn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. Oh, yes, I noticed it was a little different. Actually, very different.

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh, did you see it before?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pictures.

words: Well, it was wacky, just like Donald. It was fun, you know, but just a little too woo-woo. It was just too eclectic. I don't care for eclectic. I don't think B&B-ers do either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you wouldn't want anything out of the normal.

speaker: LADONN
words: Okay, room number 3 is all yours. Welcome to the Cheshire Cat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice name. I'm gonna consult with my daughter for just one second. [walks away from the desk] We must leave this place immediately.

speaker: RORY
words: And sleep where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, a hollow tree, a riverbank, I don't care.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, I'm tired and I'm starving.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, she's named the place after an Alice in Wonderland character. This is my worst nightmare.

speaker: RORY
words: And dying of exposure in a Jeep is mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, okay.
[They walk back to LaDonn at the desk.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, just point the way to room three.

speaker: LADONN
words: I'll take you there myself. Let me just grab your bags.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, we can do that.

speaker: LADONN
words: No no no no no, you are my guests. I won't hear of it. There you go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: LADONN
words: Do you wanna ring the bell? You haven't rung the bell.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe some other time.

speaker: LADONN
words: Follow me. [walks to staircase] Watch out for Sammy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wowsie wowza.

speaker: RORY
words: That's either Sammy or the cat that ate Sammy.
[They walk up the steps past the cat.]
CUT TO INSIDE ROOM 3
[LaDonn walks through the door carrying the bags, followed by Lorelai and Rory.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aghhh!

speaker: LADONN
words: What is it, dear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, there's just a lot…

speaker: RORY
words: A lot of flowers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, like a ton of flowers.

speaker: RORY
words: A plethora of flowers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A load of flowers.

speaker: LADONN
words: Thank you! I get so many compliments on this room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, are they moving?

speaker: LADONN
words: It looks like it, doesn't it? There's foil in the paper and it gives it that illusion. Isn't it terrific?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Unbelievable.

speaker: LADONN
words: B&B-ers love a peaceful setting so that they can unwind from their hectic lives. What business are you in, dear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, me? Uh, publishing.

speaker: LADONN
words: How interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.

speaker: LADONN
words: Now if you need anything, you just ring down or come down 'cause I love company. And, oh, I don't want to forget to give you our activity list. Never a dull moment around here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks LaDonn.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, thank you.
[LaDonn leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I think we just found the first room in the history of the world that would've made Liberace say 'Whoa. Step back. No one's that gay.'

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, look. This is a book that past guests have written in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.

speaker: RORY
words: 'This room made my soul soar.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh.

speaker: RORY
words: Ech.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, enough grossness. Let's go eat.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh food. I'm starving.
CUT TO STAIRCASE
[Lorelai and Rory start to walk down the steps, but stop when they see a bunch of people downstairs.]

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dentists. Boston dentists. Cocktail hour at the Cheshire Cat.

speaker: RORY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So our exit is blocked.

speaker: RORY
words: Let's just rush pass them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Too risky.

speaker: RORY
words: They're not assassins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, if they catch us they'll clamp onto us like leeches, and you know what that means.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chitchat. Stomach-churning, mind-numbing, soul-deadening chitchat.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, I'm starving. I'm going down there, you can stay here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're that hungry, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hungry enough to answer a hundred probing but only slightly differentiated from each other questions about Chilton, life in a small town, and your hunky hunky boyfriend?
[Rory walks back up the steps. Lorelai follows.]
CUT TO ROOM 3
[Lorelai sits on the bed looking through her purse while Rory is in the bathroom.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ohh, ahhh, I struck gold! [pulling something out of her purse]

speaker: RORY
words: What is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Certs.

speaker: RORY
words: Let me catch my breath.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I cannot for the life of me remember the last time I bought Certs.

speaker: RORY
words: Which would make those really old.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fuzzy.
[Lorelai puts it back in her purse. They both sit at the head of the bed. They hear music coming from downstairs.]

speaker: RORY
words: Perfect.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A nice capper to the day.

speaker: RORY
words: In the course of three hours, they've participated in every inane B&B group activity known to man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's just hope they finish with a mass suicide.

speaker: RORY
words: We get cranky when we're hungry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, plus we're above everyone else on the planet.

speaker: RORY
words: Clearly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.

speaker: RORY
words: So what do you want to do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. We could go to sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good Lord.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not really sleepy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me neither. We could sing.

speaker: RORY
words: Sing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we could sing "Anarchy in the UK" at the top of our lungs.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that would be good. Or, uh, we could talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I don't know. Umm, Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, no.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I don't want to.

speaker: RORY
words: You said we could talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well I thought you meant about makeup or something.

speaker: RORY
words: When have we ever talked about makeup?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never, that's why I thought now would be a good time.

speaker: RORY
words: I just need to know if…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Goodnight Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: But…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Goodnight. [turns off light]

speaker: RORY
words: [turns on light] Are you sure that you're not just running scared?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Because I think that you really love him but you're just freaked out…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Enough!! [turns out light]

speaker: RORY
words: …and you don't know what to do! [turns on light] Because you did this before. With Max, in fact.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I don't want to talk about this. I thought that by saying 'enough' and turning off the light, you would get the message. Apparently not. The skywriter will be here in a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm asking you a question.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am a grown woman.

speaker: RORY
words: Says the woman with the "Hello, Kitty" waffle iron.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have earned the right not to be quizzed about my social life by my sixteen-year-old daughter.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought I was your best friend!

speaker: LORELAI
words: When we're at a U2 concert, you are my best friend. But right now you are my sixteen-year-old daughter and I am telling you I do not want to have this conversation.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well tough.

speaker: RORY
words: Everything was planned! Everyone was excited, including you, and then all of a sudden, you're out!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I changed my mind.

speaker: RORY
words: This is our life that you just tossed off!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I didn't just toss off anything!

speaker: RORY
words: We had plans! We made space in the closet!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Rory, just because we moved a couple of boxes is not reason enough for me to get married!

speaker: RORY
words: Max was counting on this! I was counting on this!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, stop it! We are not gonna have this fight in a flowery bedroom with dentists singing "Gypsies, Tramps and Thieves" in the background. It's too David Lynch!

speaker: RORY
words: I think you love him!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, go to sleep!

speaker: RORY
words: I think you love him, and you got scared and you ran, but you're really going to regret it. And soon!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory!

speaker: RORY
words: Fine! [turns out light] Goodnight!
[They both lay in the bed staring at the ceiling.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sure. I wish I did love him. You have no idea how much.
[Rory gives Lorelai a kiss on the cheek.]
CUT TO ROOM 3
[The next morning, Lorelai sits on a trunk at the edge of the bed as Rory walks out of the bathroom.]

speaker: RORY
words: What's with the face?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, they're taller.

speaker: RORY
words: Not this again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's more of them.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, the flowers on the wallpaper are not growing or reproducing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.

speaker: RORY
words: Wait a minute. You weren't writing in this thing, were you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe some random thoughts.

speaker: RORY
words: [reading guestbook] 'Satanic forces are at work here.' Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: What? What? We cannot write that in here. [changes it] Here. 'Sat and forever am at work here.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: That doesn't make any sense.

speaker: RORY
words: And it doesn't invoke the Dark Prince so I think it's preferable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Last night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, we're good.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what isn't good?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I ate the fuzzy Certs.

speaker: RORY
words: Gross!

speaker: LORELAI
words: They tasted like keys.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, enough. I have got to eat. Do you think the coast is clear downstairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 15, bluppity blah bah bah bah. We're in luck. Breakfast just ended and the arts and crafts workshop doesn't begin for another thirteen minutes.

speaker: RORY
words: We've got a window!

speaker: LORELAI
words: It must be when they all shower.

speaker: RORY
words: Grab your bag!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go go go!
CUT TO DOWNSTAIRS
[Lorelai and Rory walk down the steps thinking there's nobody around, but are suddenly stopped by LaDonn and some guests who are standing at a window.]

speaker: LADONN
words: Hello strangers!

speaker: RORY
words: Uh!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, geez.

speaker: LADONN
words: We've all been so worried about you two.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you people doing?

speaker: LADONN
words: We're watching hummingbirds.

speaker: WOMAN
words: They're still out there if you wanna scooch in.

speaker: MAN
words: They're the darndest things. Flap their wings a hundred times a second. It's an engineering marvel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That was not on the freaking list.

speaker: LADONN
words: We don't put things like this on the freaking list, because the delights of nature aren't on any kind of time schedule.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Lordy.

speaker: WOMAN
words: So push in some chairs. We're gonna make some fresh scones.

speaker: LADONN
words: Yeah, they're for tea this afternoon. I just brought out the first test batch. Have a taste.

speaker: RORY
words: A taste would not be bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, maybe just a quick taste.
[Lorelai and Rory both sit down and take a scone. The man and woman join them at the table.]

speaker: WOMAN
words: So, LaDonn says you're in publishing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh?

speaker: WOMAN
words: Publishing, you're in publishing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes, I am.

speaker: MAN
words: Books, huh? You should find a field with less paperwork.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good one. [reaches for another scone]

speaker: RORY
words: Mmm! Hey!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have two, I still have one!

speaker: WOMAN
words: So, uh, publishing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm. Yes, I do publish. Um, it's kind of a dry line of work, not much to talk about.

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh, nonsense. It's fascinating.

speaker: WOMAN
words: So what kind of books do you publish?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Umm, mainly youth-oriented ones.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Children's books?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Oh, any that we've heard of?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Probably not.

speaker: WOMAN
words: No, wait, please. Give me some titles. I'll write them down and then when I get home, I'll look them up. Dave, do you have your space pen?

speaker: MAN
words: Do you have to ask?

speaker: WOMAN
words: Oh, he loves his space pen.

speaker: MAN
words: They write under water.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: WOMAN
words: So, what are the titles?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, there's um, 'Goodnight, Spoon' and um, 'The Horse that Wanted to Bark'.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Oh, I think I've read that to my grandson. The horse learns to bark, and then he. . . oh, what happens at the end?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He dies.

speaker: RORY
words: But he learned to bark though, so it's actually an upper.

speaker: WOMAN
words: So, where are your offices?

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're in the umm…in the building with the uhh, over on the road…would you guys excuse me for just a second? I have to make a very important call concerning publishing.

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh, well that's just fine. It'll give us a chance to get to know your lovely daughter here.

speaker: WOMAN
words: She's so quiet. But we'll change all that.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, you promised not to do any business while on vacation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, publishing waits for no man. Gotta keep the presses pressing. [walks away]

speaker: WOMAN
words: So, tell us about your school.
CUT TO STAIRCASE
[Lorelai sits on the steps next to the cat and talks on her phone.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Sookie, it's me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [sitting at Luke's counter] Hey sweetie, how's the trip going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's fine. Where are you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Luke's. Got a nice little show going on here.
[Kirk is sitting at a table with a cup of coffee. Luke is giving him his check. Sookie holds up the phone so Lorelai can hear them argue.]

speaker: LUKE
words: You're been sitting there for two hours.

speaker: KIRK
words: I just want a little more coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: You've had eight refills.

speaker: KIRK
words: You know, in France, when you sit and order, you can have the table as long as you want.

speaker: LUKE
words: I bet you know what I'm gonna say next.

speaker: KIRK
words: That we're not in France?

speaker: LUKE
words: Give or take a profanity.

speaker: KIRK
words: Fine, I'll go. Can I have my check?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, um, how's the spreading of the news going?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, it worked just like you wanted, with one notable exception.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He's just such a loner lately, the news hasn't gotten to him.

speaker: LUKE
words: Is there anyway to speed this up Kirk?

speaker: KIRK
words: Sorry. I'm trying to figure out the tip and I've always been terrible with math. What's six percent of four forty three?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Could you just tell him now Sook, so I can cross this off my list?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I…ugh, he's coming over, hang on. Hey Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Have you heard the latest news, kinda sad, Lorelai and Max?

speaker: LUKE
words: What about them?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The wedding's off.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? What happened?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You know, I don't really know. It was all kinda sudden. This is actually her now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, well, uh, tell her I'm sorry. That's tough.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He says he's sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. Talk to you later. Bye.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Buh bye. [hangs up]
[Luke walks over to Kirk's table and serves him more coffee.]

speaker: KIRK
words: What's this?

speaker: LUKE
words: Refill number nine

speaker: KIRK
words: I thought you said I had to go.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can hang a bit.

speaker: KIRK
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Welcome to France. Coffee's on the house too.

speaker: KIRK
words: Thanks. Or should I say gracias.

speaker: LUKE
words: In fact, everyone's coffee's on the house today. I like your hat.

speaker: MAN
words: Oh, thank you.
CUT TO B&B
[Rory is still sitting at the table with LaDonn and the older couple.]

speaker: WOMAN
words: We have a son just a bit older than you.

speaker: MAN
words: He's not good enough for her.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Oh, Dave. He's a freshman at Brown.

speaker: MAN
words: He majors in MTV.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Oh you're horrible!

speaker: MAN
words: Honey, we don't even know if she's on the market.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I'm not on the market. I'm definitely off the market.

speaker: LADONN
words: She has a boyfriend.

speaker: WOMAN
words: How cute!

speaker: LADONN
words: Tell us all about him.
[Lorelai returns to the table]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom! I saved you a scone, you love me right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, sorry everybody. I'm gonna have to drag her away now.

speaker: RORY
words: Aww shucks. It was so nice talking to you. [leaves]

speaker: WOMAN
words: Lovely talking to you dear. Oh, so cute.
CUT TO ANOTHER DOWNSTAIRS ROOM

speaker: RORY
words: I now have abandonment issues.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I had to make a call.

speaker: RORY
words: You left me hanging.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I owe you one.

speaker: RORY
words: Big time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. Well, you're out now, what do you wanna do?

speaker: RORY
words: Kill you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. What do you wanna do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bounce tennis balls off of Sammy?

speaker: RORY
words: Seriously?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not sure. Why don't you pull out the map you're hiding?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not hiding a map.
[Lorelai stares at her]

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I didn't want to drive around aimlessly again today. [pulls out map]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got it, I got it. So what's near?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, Concord.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is that, like look at grapes?

speaker: RORY
words: Manchester.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, been there, done that.

speaker: RORY
words: You've never been there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I feel like I have.

speaker: RORY
words: Salem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, witches and stonings! There's something there.

speaker: RORY
words: Boston, Newton, Needham…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, go go go go back.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Boston, Newton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know where we're going.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are we going?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You will love it.

speaker: RORY
words: [starts folding map] Well, if you tell me where we're going I can chart a course and I can…
[Lorelai walks over and crumbles up the map]

speaker: RORY
words: You're folding it wrong!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it smaller?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then it's not wrong. Let's go. I will get you a new one when we get there.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are we going?
CUT TO HARVARD UNIVERSITY
[Lorelai and Rory stand in front of the entrance gate for Harvard.]

speaker: RORY
words: I don't believe it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Believe it, 'cause there it is.

speaker: RORY
words: Harvard University.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's really real.

speaker: RORY
words: It looks just like the pictures.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Beautiful.

speaker: RORY
words: What are we doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We are beholding your future.

speaker: RORY
words: It's big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have a big future.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe it. I'm actually standing outside of Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on.

speaker: RORY
words: Wait. Come on where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Inside.

speaker: RORY
words: We can't go inside.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why, is there a force field or something around the place?

speaker: RORY
words: This is Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: This is Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: You can't just go inside. You need a guide.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll be your guide.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you know about Harvard?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know this. Look, there's Harvard.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, don't you want to see it? Huh? The place where you'll be living and studying and developing very naïve but pretentious world views that will come crashing down the minute you graduate?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So? Come on, you know you want to. All the other kids are doing it.

speaker: RORY
words: Harvard.
[They walk through the gate.]
CUT TO HARVARD COURTYARD
[Lorelai and Rory are walking as Lorelai reads through a guidebook.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow! Harvard is over 300 years old.

speaker: RORY
words: Founded in 1636.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That means that almost everyone who ever went to Harvard is dead now. Are you sure you still want to go here?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I'm sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They developed the pacemaker here. Also, discovered how electromagnetism and radioactivity are two manifestations of the same force and postulated existence of a charmed quark. I was wondering who did that.

speaker: RORY
words: The smarties at Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Holy smokes. They get an average of 18,000 applicants every year and only 2,000 get in. Those are not good odds.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No no no, you're different. Past graduates. Henry James…isn't that a beer?

speaker: RORY
words: And a novelist. Go on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: John Adams. That's a beer!

speaker: RORY
words: Our second president. He's very in right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: W.E.B. Du Bois, Yo-Yo Ma. Oh cool! Fred Gwynn.

speaker: RORY
words: Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Herman Munster. Now I'm impressed.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you want something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, a nice cold Henry James.

speaker: RORY
words: Or some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or some coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm ordering coffee at Harvard.
[Rory goes to order from a vendor. Lorelai starts reading a bulletin board.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, there's people looking for roommates. Tons of them. 'Wanted, girl to share a two bedroom apartment located on trial bridge, quiet street, quiet building, so quiet roomie a must.' Join a convent and cloister yourself you loser.

speaker: RORY
words: [walks back] Mom, it's gonna be two years before I go to Harvard. These people will have roommates or have graduated by them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who says these are for you?

speaker: RORY
words: Who are they for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me. If you're gonna live in a dorm, I need a room nearby so I can come visit.

speaker: RORY
words: How often are you gonna visit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know, every other day. Too much? What's too much?
[Rory walks back to the vendor. A male student walks up to the bulletin board.]

speaker: STUDENT
words: Man, there are a lot of postings here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, there sure are.

speaker: STUDENT
words: You looking for a place to live?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, maybe.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Well there's a lot of choices. Something for everybody.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah. Unless you're one of those existentialists who can't really figure out what they want.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Good point, good point. Hey, I think we have a class together. Contract Law, Professor Chefferson?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, Chef's class.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Right. I've been meaning to say hi to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: STUDENT
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hi.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: STUDENT
words: So do you like the class?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, it's not too bad.

speaker: STUDENT
words: He's kinda got a monotone voice. If I don't caf up he puts me right to sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm about to caf up right now just for the hell of it.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Okay. So I'll see you in class. And maybe at that Phi Cap party tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ginchy!

speaker: STUDENT
words: Cool. Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
[Student leaves. Rory walks back with coffee.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I'm gonna like college! Ooh, did you hear? I used existentialist in a sentence!

speaker: RORY
words: I heard!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've always wanted to do that.

speaker: RORY
words: It was very impressive.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah!
CUT TO COURTYARD
[Lorelai and Rory walking along. Rory suddenly stops to stare at a building.]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's this?

speaker: RORY
words: It's the library.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: The biggest library I've ever seen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh. Brace yourself.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is just one of the libraries.

speaker: RORY
words: One of the libraries?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This building is one component of a thirteen million volume collection housed in more than ninety different libraries. It's the oldest library in the United States and the largest academic library in the world. Breathe, breathe.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm a failure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I am stupid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh stop.

speaker: RORY
words: I am uniformed and ignorant and. . .I can't even think of a second synonym for uninformed. I suck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey.

speaker: RORY
words: Thirteen million volumes? I've read like, what, three hundred books in my entire life and I'm already sixteen? Do you know how long it would take me to read thirteen million books?

speaker: LORELAI
words: But honey, you don't have to read every one of them. "Tuesday's with Morrie?" Skip that. "Who Moved My Cheese?" Just stuff you already know.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, but every kid coming to Harvard is inevitably reading books, and different books, and I want to be able to converse intelligently with each of them and I can't do that unless I read books, at least a few from every genre and sub-genre.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, come on. I'm getting you out of here.

speaker: RORY
words: I sleep too much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you don't.

speaker: RORY
words: I've been frittering away my whole life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't fritter.

speaker: RORY
words: Did I mention I suck?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.
CUT TO RESIDENCE HALL
[Lorelai and Rory are walking past a dormitory.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is a dorm? Not bad, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Pretty, actually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, let's see what it looks like on the inside.

speaker: RORY
words: It says "Residents Only" in plain English.
CUT TO INSIDE DORM

speaker: RORY
words: We're gonna get in trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're such a worrywart. Ooh, get in character.

speaker: RORY
words: What?
[Two female students are walking down the hall.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey there!

speaker: GIRL 1
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm Angie, this is Trish.

speaker: GIRL 2
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How's it going?

speaker: GIRL 1
words: Not bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, cool. We're just kinda hanging out between classes. We got Chef next. So, we'll probably see you at the Phi Alpha Beta thing tomorrow, right?

speaker: GIRL 1
words: Maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I know, we're not sure either. They can be so totally lame. Gag me.

speaker: GIRL 1
words: Yeah. See ya. [Students leave]

speaker: RORY
words: You do realize that all of your college kid jargon comes from 'Happy Days' and the 'Valley Girls' song?
[They stop in front of a room with the door open.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Unh! Lookie lookie here.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I wanna see a room. Hello!

speaker: RORY
words: They have pictures of their rooms on their website.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I prefer reality, thank you. Hello! Coast is clear. [walks into the room]

speaker: RORY
words: The coast is not clear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Susie!

speaker: RORY
words: We're now officially breaking and entering.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Susie!

speaker: RORY
words: Why are you saying that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause it's our cover in case we get caught. Plus there's a thirty percent chance that the girl living in this room is named Susie. Wow, tiny.

speaker: RORY
words: It is tiny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your Oxford English Dictionary's gonna need a room of it's own.

speaker: RORY
words: It'll fit somewhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: One window, brick wall. You're gonna need a better view.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, this isn't my room to begin with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: At least there's two beds. Somewhere for me to sleep.

speaker: RORY
words: That would be my roommate's bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you don't want a roommate.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think I have a choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They just force someone on you?

speaker: RORY
words: It's all part of the socializing experience.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What if it's a lemon?

speaker: RORY
words: Then I'm stuck with a lemon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hari Krishna banging a tambourine all night?

speaker: RORY
words: Then I have to get earplugs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Serial murderer?

speaker: RORY
words: Then I sleep with a gat strapped to my ankle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Someone who likes Linkin Park?

speaker: RORY
words: Then I have to drop out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm. Ah, look! I had these same pants back in high school.

speaker: RORY
words: Can we just go now please?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm in again.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Just come over here and let me take a picture with you sitting at the desk.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, really get into it. Pretend like you're studying.

speaker: RORY
words: Uhh, okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What… is that…you're writing in the air?

speaker: RORY
words: Can we just take the picture?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, okay.
[They exit room as a girl is starting to enter.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey Susie.
[They hurry out down the hallway]
CUT TO INSIDE BUIDLING
[Lorelai and Rory are walking down a hallway of one of the academic buildings.]

speaker: RORY
words: God, these classrooms are huge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Better to fit those big Harvard brains.
[They stand in the doorway of one of the lecture halls and listen.]

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: . . . had given birth. Reckon on everything, expect everything. What sort of thought is this?

speaker: STUDENT
words: Depressing?

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: On the surface, maybe. But go underneath. What is he postulating beyond fatalism?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are we allowed to be hearing this?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They wouldn't charge you a hundred bucks or something just for listening to part of a class?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think Harvard would nickel and dime people like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I'm gonna find a ladies room. You know, sneak a smoke, see if anybody slipped an aspirin in my coke.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, Rizzo. I'd like to listen a little bit more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll be back.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll be here.

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: The stoics believe the greatest happiness resulted from leading a virtuous life…
[Rory drops her coffee cup, everyone turns around to see what the noise was.]

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: In or out?

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: If you're going to take the class, you have to take a seat.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, uhh, okay. Sorry. [sits down]

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: Okay, where were we?
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Lorelai walks out of the ladies room. She stops to stare at the wall of class valedictorians. A few seconds later, she hears Rory's voice from inside the classroom.]

speaker: RORY
words: That's an interesting point, Professor, but I'm not sure I agree with it.
CUT TO CLASSROOM

speaker: RORY
words: That's because stoicism was not about giving up things, of money and luxuries and stuff.

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: That's right. By the time he was in his early forties, Seneca had earned enough money to acquire villas, farms, he ate well, he loved expensive furniture, but he didn't consider that a non-philosophical way to live.
[Lorelai watches from the doorway.]

speaker: RORY
words: It's all kind of relative though.

speaker: STUDENT
words: Oh, here we go.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: STUDENT
words: We can't get through a class without debating relativism.

speaker: RORY
words: I just meant that luxury to some is not necessarily luxury to others.

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: A better subject for another time.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sorry.

speaker: PROFESSOR
words: No, no, your point is well taken, but it's different than the matter at hand. What we're talking about is Seneca's choosing the better more comfortable of two options while remaining a stoic.

speaker: RORY
words: [to student] Thanks. This was fun. [walks out]
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Lorelai and Rory walk out of the classroom.]

speaker: RORY
words: Did you see me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: I was in college.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was amazing!

speaker: RORY
words: Did I look like I belonged?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Completely. You're a natural

speaker: RORY
words: I can't even believe how it happened. I just sort of got swept up and then the teacher asked a question, and before I knew it…

speaker: LORELAI
words: You were blowing them away.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I don't know if I was blowing them away but suddenly I was talking and I couldn't stop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that feeling.

speaker: RORY
words: College is gonna be amazing. I can't wait. I love college. I love Harvard. I love fatalism.
CUT TO B&B
[LaDonn carries their bags down the stairs while Lorelai and Rory follow.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, please LaDonn, we can carry the bags.

speaker: LADONN
words: Nonsense.

speaker: RORY
words: But they're so heavy.

speaker: LADONN
words: I'll just get them down the stairs for you. Whew. Let me catch my breath here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wow! Sammy's AWOL, huh?

speaker: LADONN
words: Hmm?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Sammy. It's like the first time that she hasn't been there on the stairs.

speaker: LADONN
words: What, my Sammy?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh, she's rarely ever on the stairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, she's always right there.

speaker: LADONN
words: On the stairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LADONN
words: No, she has her favorite places, but not on the stairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There has not been one moment over our entire stay when she has not been right there.

speaker: LADONN
words: On the stairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LADONN
words: Oh, she's hardly ever on the stairs.

speaker: RORY
words: Forget it Jake, it's Chinatown.
[They walk to the front desk.]

speaker: LADONN
words: Everything's on your card. I hope you enjoyed your stay. Did you enjoy your stay?

speaker: RORY
words: Very much.

speaker: LADONN
words: Aw, very much?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I sat and forever am at work here.

speaker: LADONN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: It was great.

speaker: LADONN
words: Well, there you go. Drive safely, and tell all your friends about the Cheshire Cat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you bet we will.

speaker: LADONN
words: As soon as you leave, I'm gonna do my favorite part of the job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, what's that?

speaker: LADONN
words: I'm gonna read what you wrote in our guestbook.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give us a five minute headstart?

speaker: LADONN
words: Beg pardon?

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
[They pick up their bags and walk out the front door.]
CUT TO INSIDE JEEP
[Back in Stars Hollow, Lorelai and Rory are driving to their house.]

speaker: RORY
words: You know what I love most about Harvard?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, what?

speaker: RORY
words: They don't sell giant foam fingers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, they've got class out the wazoo. Home.
