speaker: RORY
words: Feel like we've been gone a long time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what's weird? Every time I leave town, even for just a little while, I always expect everything to look different.

speaker: RORY
words: And it never does.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It never does.
[They drive by townies offering sympathetic looks, including Miss Patty dabbing her eyes with a handkerchief, and Kirk with his arms wide open.]

speaker: KIRK
words: Need a hug?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Patty's good.
[They pull in their driveway.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what about dinner?

speaker: RORY
words: It should probably be something healthy since we've been eating junk the whole trip.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We had lettuce on our burgers last night.

speaker: RORY
words: You picked it off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it left its essence.

speaker: RORY
words: There was lettuce essence on our burgers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Definitely.

speaker: RORY
words: And that satisfied our vegetable requirement?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the week.

speaker: RORY
words: We can't argue with cold hard facts.
[Lorelai notices the chuppah in the front yard and stares at it.]

speaker: RORY
words: What? Oh, I forgot about that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me too. Well, everything's the same.
[Lorelai walks over to the chuppah and starts to cry as she stares at it.]
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai is showing slides of the road trip as Emily and Rory sit on the couch.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is Sever Hall, one of the oldest buildings in Harvard.

speaker: EMILY
words: Focus the picture Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is focused.

speaker: RORY
words: That's how it came out.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's hurting my eyes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on Mom, they're supposed to be a little arty.

speaker: RORY
words: Plus she doesn't know how to use her camera.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've only had it six years.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's like I have glaucoma. What's that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is a Harvard squirrel.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good grief.

speaker: RORY
words: Sitting on a Harvard rock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Doesn't he look smart?

speaker: EMILY
words: He looks dirty. Next.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's Rory's dorm, and part of my finger.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not my dorm yet. We just saw a dorm and figured it might be mine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why in the world do you insist on taking slides?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like slides.

speaker: EMILY
words: But prints are so much easier, and faster to get through.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's what I hate about prints. You give people this big pile of pictures that you're so proud of and they end up just flipping through them super fast without really seeing them or giving you a chance to narrate them like you can with slides.

speaker: RORY
words: I stopped her from adding music.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm eternally grateful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like the bigness of slides too. Makes you feel like you're really there.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, this one makes me feel just like I'm in your finger.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. You're just jealous that we didn't invite you to come along.

speaker: RORY
words: Next time.

speaker: EMILY
words: Next time you go to Harvard, you're going to do it properly, with a scheduled visit and a guide.

speaker: RORY
words: I told her about the guide.

speaker: EMILY
words: And why would you go out of town now so soon before your wedding? Didn't your fiancé mind?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well…

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean, you act as if this coming weekend is just going to be business as usual and not the most important day of your life.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it's about this weekend Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I should've told you before.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God, you didn't!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: You did!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did what?

speaker: EMILY
words: You eloped!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I knew it! I knew you'd do anything to keep me out of this wedding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, that's not…

speaker: EMILY
words: Well that is just cruel, Lorelai. A mother waits and plans for this day, even your mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but…

speaker: EMILY
words: I bought a new dress, I got my hair done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It looks nice.

speaker: EMILY
words: And tonight you just waltz in here, torture me for hours with these ridiculous slides, only to let me know at the last possible minute…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Max and I are not together anymore. The wedding is off.

speaker: EMILY
words: The wedding's off?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you sure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I'm sure.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Who called it off?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did. You're thinking you're not surprised.

speaker: EMILY
words: No I wasn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're thinking, 'Yes, I won that five bucks from Dad.'

speaker: EMILY
words: Who would like dessert?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What Mom? What are you thinking? Just tell me.

speaker: EMILY
words: I was thinking I guess I have to return your gift.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My gift?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You'll have to return my gift. That's…that's what you were thinking?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. So you got me a gift already?

speaker: EMILY
words: You were getting married. Gifts are expected. It's the proper thing to do. So how's ice cream sound?

speaker: RORY
words: Ice cream sounds great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what'd you get me Mom?
[Emily walks out of the room. Lorelai follows her.]

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not gonna tell you that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not? It's for me.

speaker: EMILY
words: But you're not getting it now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Iced tea spoons, right?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because nobody really needs iced tea spoons ever. I mean, you probably would use 'em if you remembered to use 'em but nobody remembers to use 'em because they're always in a different drawer than the everyday silverware. Out of sight, out of mind. So people just grab a regular old everyday spoon to stir with, and you know what, they work fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: It wasn't iced tea spoons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, uhhh…oh, oh! Corn on the cob holder thingies! Sterling silver corn on the cob holder thingies?

speaker: EMILY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hah!

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The tiny forks.

speaker: EMILY
words: What tiny forks?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The tiny forks with the tiny prongs and the tiny handles that I can only assume are used to eat the tiny food.

speaker: EMILY
words: They're for lobster tails.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you did get the tiny forks!

speaker: EMILY
words: You know what, I'm not returning the gift. I'm going to put it away in a closet and you won't know what it is until you do get married someday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tell me now!

speaker: EMILY
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on! Mom, I may never get married. I may be a free spirit my whole life or fall in love with a separated catholic guy like Katherine Hepburn did and then, and then not get to go to his funeral when he dies.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well then you'll never get to know what I got you, will you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've gotta know!

speaker: EMILY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is torture!

speaker: EMILY
words: Tough.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, fine, forget it. I'm going to the bathroom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm going to the kitchen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hm.
[They both walk away. Cut to Rory, still sitting on the couch, listening to them.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: HAH!

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh God, you scared me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, tell me!

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, get away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tell me now.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm serious, get away from me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please tell me.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is not funny.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Later that night, Lorelai and Rory get out of their Jeep across the street from Luke's.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, am I too far from the curb?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, you're within five feet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Close enough for jazz.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Pick it up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You got it.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory! [runs towards her]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God, Lane! [runs towards her]

speaker: LANE
words: I'm back!

speaker: RORY
words: I see!

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, did you ever think this day would come?

speaker: RORY
words: I had hopes, dreams.

speaker: LANE
words: I escaped from Korea, I'm home. Hi Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Welcome home, sweetie.

speaker: LANE
words: It's so amazing to be back. When I got off the plane, I kissed the tarmac.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just like the Pope.

speaker: LANE
words: It was hot and I burned my lips.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe that's why the Pope always looks so grumpy.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm back!

speaker: RORY
words: I know!

speaker: LANE
words: Did you get my letters?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, the first one was a little intense.

speaker: LANE
words: Which one was that?

speaker: RORY
words: The one that said Korea equals death with a bunch of exclamation points and your very sad face cut up plastered all over it.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, so that was a tad dramatic.

speaker: RORY
words: Was it awful?

speaker: LANE
words: You know what, it wasn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: LANE
words: Some of it was great.

speaker: RORY
words: No way.

speaker: LANE
words: Yeah, some of the food's not so bad, and then my cousins were actually pretty interesting, and the best part, Korea is bootleg heaven. I totally scored in Seoul. Elvis Costello at the Marquee in 1978. A barely coherent Nico doing Dora songs in 1974, and even more barely coherent, Iggy Pop doing David Bowie songs naked in 1981.

speaker: RORY
words: How did you get them past customs?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I strapped them to my body like in Midnight Express.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll be in Luke's. [walks towards Luke's Diner]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. So it was just an open-ended plane ticket?

speaker: LANE
words: Just to save money. I guess I kind of overreacted.

speaker: RORY
words: Kind of? You did everything but tie a string with you at one end and the Statue of Liberty at the other.
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai walks through the door.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lewis and Clark have returned.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, which one are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Which one had to paddle the canoe?

speaker: LUKE
words: Coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have to ask?

speaker: LUKE
words: So, uh, sorry about what happened…you know, the wedding thing…

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay. I'm fine. I want everyone to know that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, I've been feeling like a jerk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, the way I had to come down on Max. I don't know, I was being a…I don't know, what's that word you use, pickleschnitz?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Schnickelfritz?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, that's it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, it's okay, you already apologized for all that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I've been feeling kind of guilty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't. You are great, Luke. Just making me that chuppah alone…

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, the chuppah! I left that stupid chuppah on your lawn!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, it's okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: What an idiot!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really, it's okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just this enormous reminder, just sitting on your lawn, mocking you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't even see it mock, I promise.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll take it down in the morning. No, I'll take it down now. Hey, we're closing early. Chew it or lose it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Luke, it's okay, really. I, uh, I think I'm gonna keep it.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. It's beautiful, and you made it for me, and it doesn't have to be a wedding chuppah. It can just be a beautiful archway in our yard. I'll grow stuff on it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, okay. Um, I'll help you move it around the yard, wherever you want it to be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that'd be good.

speaker: LUKE
words: So where'd you guys go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we drove around a little, we hit a B&B, and we took a tour of Harvard.

speaker: LUKE
words: Harvard. . . interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was amazing. Seeing Rory there, in a dorm room, in a classroom. She fit.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I can see her fitting there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She was right at home.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, how you taking that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Taking what?

speaker: LUKE
words: Seeing her fit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I loved it…and I hated it.

speaker: LUKE
words: That seems about right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Man, these past few days. . .just so many thoughts about my life then, my life now, what I missed. Thoughts about what I'll never have, and what I want to have.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, that's a lot of thoughts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're not kidding. So can I ask you a question?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have you ever set up a line of credit at a bank?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you don't pay for everything with cash on hand, do you?

speaker: LUKE
words: What's all this about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think it's time to make a move.

speaker: LUKE
words: Meaning?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm diving in. Sookie and I are finally gonna open that inn.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean now. We've been talking about it and dreaming about it and it's time to finally get going on it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, if the time is right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is. Think I can hack being a business owner?

speaker: LUKE
words: I think you can hack anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. I mean, you know all the creative stuff to the job, and you can manage and uh, I've seen you try to add numbers, so I'd get an accountant first thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: So how far along are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This far.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, listen, um, you know, I'm no financial genius, but you know, we can sit down sometime, and you can pick my brain on the few things I do know about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Sure, I've been around some.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I ask you stupid questions?

speaker: LUKE
words: There's no such thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How does ink come out of pens?

speaker: LUKE
words: All right, there is such a thing. But, um, you're going to avoid that when we sit down, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. And let me know when you need help with the thing that's not a chuppah anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will. [leaves]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory and Lane are still outside talking]

speaker: LANE
words: So fill me in. What have you been up to? I've gotta know everything.

speaker: RORY
words: I've been to Harvard.

speaker: LANE
words: No way. Oh my God! How? When?
[Lorelai walks over]

speaker: RORY
words: Well, we just got back. Mom, is it okay if I go to Lane's for a bit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. I'll meet you back at the house.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[Lorelai watches as they walk away.]

speaker: LANE
words: Harvard, that is so cool! I mean, what did you see?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Harvard Yard, classrooms, where I might live next year.

speaker: LANE
words: How was it?

speaker: RORY
words: It needs a spruce.
[Lorelai takes out her cell phone and dials, then walks towards the Jeep.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, hey it's me, we're back. Good, it was good, but first things first. I wanna start moving on the inn thing. . .I mean, take serious steps. We're ready, don't you think? We're ready. . . Oh good! Well, meet me early at work tomorrow. Yeah. . . .I know, I'm excited too. [drives away]
THE END
OPEN AT LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at a table. Lorelai's eating breakfast while Rory watches her.]

speaker: RORY
words: How are the eggs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're still good.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm still glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look freak, we will not be late.

speaker: RORY
words: It's the first day of school. I wanna get there early.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We will be there early, I promise.

speaker: RORY
words: I have different classes this year, my routes aren't the same. I haven't found the quickest path around. And my locker, they moved it, so I don't even know if it'll work properly and then I'll have to get a new one and God knows how long that'll take or where it'll be and that could send the whole day into chaos. I'm just excited.
[Lane walks into the diner]

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, thank God, you haven't left yet.

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, what's up?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I found the greatest record store in the world. It's ten minutes from your school and I'm wondering how much you love me.

speaker: RORY
words: Address.

speaker: LANE
words: Record Breaker Incorporated, 2453 Berlin Turnpike.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it. Place your order now.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, Charles Mingus, "The Black Saint and the Sinner Lady."

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: LANE
words: The Sonics, Here are the Sonics.

speaker: RORY
words: Burn me a copy. Next.

speaker: LANE
words: MC5, Kick Out the Jams. Fairport Convention, Leige and Lief. BeeGees, Odessa.

speaker: RORY
words: BeeGees, really?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, Mojo says.

speaker: RORY
words: So it must be true.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, that's it. Now if I could just find a copy of Whistler, Chaucer, Detroit and Greenhill, I will finally be done with the sixties.

speaker: RORY
words: I can get there today, tomorrow at the latest.

speaker: LANE
words: I love it when you go back to school.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too. Hey!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am getting donuts for later. As soon as I do, I will take you to school and the nice men in the white coats will pick you up.
[Lorelai walks up to the counter. Taylor is standing there with a group of Boy Scouts.]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Everybody, listen up. Decide what you want, place your order, and then proceed to the end of the line.

speaker: BOY 1
words: I want a burger.

speaker: BOY 2
words: I want grilled cheese.

speaker: BOY 3
words: Me too.

speaker: BOY 2
words: And I want fries, and make them really really cripsy.

speaker: BOY 1
words: I want mine crispy too.

speaker: BOY 2
words: You didn't order fries.

speaker: BOY 1
words: So?

speaker: LUKE
words: So you can't order crispy fries without first ordering fries.

speaker: BOY 1
words: Why not?

speaker: LUKE
words: Because you can't make something crispy that doesn't exist.

speaker: BOY 1
words: Why not?

speaker: LUKE
words: Get him away from me Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Have some respect. These boys have just completed the first leg of their outdoor survival training.

speaker: LUKE
words: Meaning you had them sit under a tree and glue rocks together for two hours.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You're a very jaded man Luke. What happened to you as a child?

speaker: LUKE
words: Some creepy guy in shorts and knee socks tried to sit me under a tree and glue rocks together for two hours. Put that down!

speaker: BOY 4
words: Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: Because otherwise you're going under it.

speaker: BOY 4
words: I won't fit.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yes you will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, donuts please.

speaker: BOY 1
words: We were here first!

speaker: LORELAI
words: On the planet?

speaker: BOY 1
words: Huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You lose. Chocolate, cinnamon and sprinkles.
[phone rings; Lorelai and the kids moan as Luke goes to answer it.]

speaker: LUKE
words: All of you pipe down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Grups, huh?

speaker: LUKE
words: [on phone] Yeah, I'm working. What do you think I'm doing? Uh huh. Uh huh. Oh man, what did you do? Excuse me, are you serious? Just like that, huh?
[Lorelai goes behind the counter and gets her own donuts]

speaker: BOY 2
words: Hey Mr. Doose. She's not supposed to do that.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: That's right. She's breaking the rules, and people who break the rules end up very lonely with no friends because they have become society's outcasts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Planning on burning a little Huck Finn after lunch, Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LUKE
words: [on phone] This is unbelievable! You won't ever change, will you? . . . Okay, fine. Do what you want, make the arrangements. Now I'm working, we'll finish this later. [hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is everything okay?

speaker: LUKE
words: Do you have a sister?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, no.

speaker: BOY 1
words: I do.

speaker: LUKE
words: You have my sympathies.

speaker: BOY 1
words: Thanks. I appreciate that.
[opening credits]
CUT TO FRONT OF LUKE'S DINER
[Luke walks towards the diner carrying several shopping bags. He drops a bag on the sidewalk. Lorelai is walking by and stops to help.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, just redecorating the sidewalk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it looks nice.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah yeah yeah, you don't think too much blue?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, just enough.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, thanks for the input. You can go now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Need some help?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Need some help?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Need some help?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So do you need some help?
[Luke sighs.]
CUT TO OUTSIDE LUKE'S APARTMENT
[Luke and Lorelai walk down the hallway to Luke's apartment. Luke is carrying the shopping bags, Lorelai is carrying a box of cereal. Luke unlocks the door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Frosted Flakes? Since when do you buy Frosted Flakes? [Luke drops some bags, food spills all over.] Okay, now what is going on?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing? You just all of sudden woke up this morning and decided you were gonna buy every food item in the world that you don't actually eat?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's not for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well who's it for?

speaker: LUKE
words: Someone who's not me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like who?
[cut to inside apartment]

speaker: LUKE
words: Like my nephew.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, your nephew's coming to visit.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, he's coming to stay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're sister's moving here?
[they start picking up the spilled food in the hallway and bringing it inside]

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm sorry, I don't get it.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's nothing to get. It's just Liz. She's too busy, she can't handle him, she's sending him here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where's his dad?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh well, the great prize that my sister picked up at a Der Wienerschnitzel left her about two years ago, whereabouts unknown.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, geez.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So she's just sending him here, just like that?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh no, I'm sure she put at least five or six minutes of thought into it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But why?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, 'cause apparently he's been getting into some trouble and Liz is afraid he's heading for something bad, and rather than handle it herself, she's just giving up. She's sending him here so I can straighten him out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can straighten him out?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You, Luke Danes, the great communicator, you're going to straighten the kid out?

speaker: LUKE
words: All he needs is a change of pace, a new crowd, and to get away from the nutjob that, unfortunately, is my sister.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, how long is he staying?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know. Indefinitely.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And how old is he?

speaker: LUKE
words: Seventeen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wow. That is very generous of you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, it's family, what else can you do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right. So what kind of trouble has he gotten into?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, just kid stuff, you know, staying out late, getting rowdy. I don't know exactly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you might want to find out. Ask a couple of subtle questions, you know, has he seen The Shawshank Redemption, did the setting seem homey to him? Stuff like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, his problem is obvious, it's his mother. You never could count on Liz for anything. Our mom died when we were kids, right? It was just my dad, me and Liz. And my dad worked all the time and I worked in the store with my dad, and Liz was off doing God knows what.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I bet losing her mom so early was kind of hard on her.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was hard on all of us, but we did our part. And then the minute she graduates high school, she is outta here. Didn't matter that my dad was sick, didn't matter that the store was failing, she just took off. Married the hot dog king, had a kid, he left, now here we are. [Luke starts pumping up an air mattress]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, wow, that's…I'm sorry, what are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm blowing this up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is it?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's a bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A bed?

speaker: LUKE
words: For Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess?

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, my nephew.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, um, that's not a bed, that's a raft, which is fine if you're gonna build a moat around the diner but…

speaker: LUKE
words: It's fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, the kid needs a bed. If you want to get him something inflatable, make it a blonde.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm getting him a bed, this is just temporary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how does Jess feel about this?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You haven't talked to him about it?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't you think you should?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why? He doesn't have a choice. His mom's a flake, he's coming here, end of story.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure you're ready for this?

speaker: LUKE
words: Of course I'm sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, taking on a full time kid, that's a lot of work.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And a seventeen-year-old that's been getting into trouble and now is being shipped off without his consent, that could be even harder.

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, all he needs is to be around someone who's not a selfish basketcase, who will give him a little space, who will treat him like a man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe you should think about this.

speaker: LUKE
words: There's nothing to think about. He's family. You take care of family, period.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I respect that, but what if he turns out to be Fredo?

speaker: LUKE
words: Are you seriously telling me not to do this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not telling you not to do this.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then what are you saying?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just saying that if you need any help, I'm here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, I got a lot of things to do before he gets here so…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'm leaving. Oh, you do have an extra set of sheets, right?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, just checking. Bye. [leaves]

speaker: LUKE
words: [grabs keys] Sheets, sheets.
CUT TO CHILTON

[Rory is walking down the hallway towards a classroom. Paris, Madeline and Louise are walking towards the same room from the other direction. They stop in front of the doorway and look at each other before going inside.]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, round two.
CUT TO INSIDE CLASSROOM
[Rory walks over to Paris.]

speaker: RORY
words: Five seconds?

speaker: PARIS
words: Four.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: Now it's three.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, it does not have to be like this.

speaker: PARIS
words: No?

speaker: RORY
words: You and I are going to have to spend a lot of time in class together on The Franklin.

speaker: PARIS
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: We're gonna have to sit in the same classroom, share the same oxygen, occasionally make eye contact.

speaker: PARIS
words: I can avoid that.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, I'm not saying that we should be friends. I don't want to be friends. I'm just saying that maybe we should look at this like life.

speaker: PARIS
words: Life?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, in life there will be people that you don't like, but that you have to coexist with.

speaker: PARIS
words: I am well aware of that.

speaker: RORY
words: So I'm just suggesting that we coexist.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're just scared that I'm gonna make your life on The Franklin a living hell. Especially since I'm the editor and you're…oh, what's the word…not.

speaker: RORY
words: If you want to spend the precious energy that you'd normally spend on the paper obsessing on ways to make me miserable, then that's your choice. I'm just suggesting an alternate plan. The paper could be really great this year.

speaker: PARIS
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: So, can't we just agree on that and make all the rest of it go away?
[Louise and Madeline walk over]

speaker: LOUISE
words: Everything okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, Riff, everything's fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: We were just talking.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Talking? You two?

speaker: PARIS
words: About The Franklin.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh. Nope, still seems weird.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, look, we're all on the paper together. There's gonna be a lot of long afternoons and weekends.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Weekends?

speaker: PARIS
words: We need to coexist, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I'm sorry. Back up to the weekends.

speaker: PARIS
words: So that's what we'll do. Now the first meeting of The Franklin is today.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes it is.

speaker: PARIS
words: Four o'clock.

speaker: RORY
words: Sounds good.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Weekends were never mentioned. I need my weekends. All of this gets done on weekends.
CUT TO BUSSTOP
[Luke is waiting on the bench. The bus pulls up and Jess steps off.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, so uh… [Luke walks towards the diner, Jess follows]
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Luke and Jess walk through the door.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, this is my diner.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Belonged to your Grandpa.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.
CUT TO LUKE'S APARTMENT
[Luke and Jess walk through the door.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, here we are. It's pretty simple. You know, this is the room. That's my bed, that's your, uh, bed for now, but the sheets are new. There's the bathroom, there's the closet, there's the dresser, the phone, and over there is the kitchen. I've got Frosted Flakes.

speaker: JESS
words: Wow, that's grrrrreat.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, is that all your stuff?

speaker: JESS
words: Yup.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not much there.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, Lizzie's sending the rest later.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, you need some help?

speaker: JESS
words: Nope.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, uh, I have to get back to the diner. I'm gonna close up at ten tonight, so I thought…

speaker: JESS
words: See you at ten.

speaker: LUKE
words: But wait, you need keys.

speaker: JESS
words: No I don't. [leaves]

speaker: LUKE
words: I so don't wanna know why.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Jess walks out of the diner, looks around the town, and walks down the street.]
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory sits down on a bench to read before the newspaper meeting starts. She hears voices from inside the room and goes inside. Several students and a teacher are sitting at a table.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Pick a side people. Oh, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Nice of you to join us, Miss Gilmore.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought we were starting at four.

speaker: TEACHER
words: 15 sharp.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, we're wasting time here.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Take a seat Miss Gilmore.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay, so we were just finishing up handing out the first assignments. Now, Rory, unfortunately, since you got here so late, most everything of interest has been given out.

speaker: RORY
words: Why, I'm shocked.

speaker: PARIS
words: Wait, wait, just let me check my list here. There might be something left for you. Okay, well, here, they're paving the new parking lot tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: And?

speaker: PARIS
words: And you can cover it.

speaker: RORY
words: Cover what?

speaker: PARIS
words: The paving process.

speaker: RORY
words: You're serious?

speaker: PARIS
words: Absolutely. I'm sure there's an angle there somewhere. Is it environmentally safe? What are the financial ramifications? Should brick have been considered especially taking into account the architecture of the building?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah yeah, I get the idea.

speaker: PARIS
words: But hey, if you think this is below you, you can always wait until the next issue. You can just use this time to get a nice manicure.

speaker: RORY
words: That's okay.

speaker: PARIS
words: Maybe get a massage.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll do it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Aromatherapy. Smell like a peach for a few days.

speaker: RORY
words: I said I'll do it, okay? I'll cover the paving.

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay, good. Well then, I guess that's it.
[Everyone gets up from the table. Paris walks to a computer and starts typing. Rory walks over to her.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Problem, Miss Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, no problem at all. I love this assignment.

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm glad.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm gonna write the greatest piece on pavement you've ever read.

speaker: PARIS
words: I hope so.

speaker: RORY
words: And next week, when you give me the scoop on the new copper plumbing installation, I'm gonna be just as thrilled.

speaker: PARIS
words: I like a team player.

speaker: RORY
words: And no matter how many crappy, stupid, useless assignments you throw at me, I'm not going to quit and I'm not going to back down. So you can go home tonight and think about the fact that no matter what you do and no matter how evil you are, at the end of the year, on my high school transcript, it's going to say that I worked on The Franklin. So, if you'll excuse me, I have some reading to do on the origins of concrete.

speaker: PARIS
words: A thousand words on my desk on Tuesday.

[Rory walks out of the room and starts walking down the hallway. Max is coming from the other direction. They stop in front of each other, then both turn around and go the other way. Paris watches from the classroom window.]
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Luke is wiping a table as Lorelai walks into the diner.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.
[Luke is startled and spills coffee on the table.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh geez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I'll just…you want some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay. I'll just lick it off the table. So?

speaker: LUKE
words: So what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is he here?

speaker: LUKE
words: He's here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah? How is he? [sits at counter]

speaker: LUKE
words: He's fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did he see the bed?

speaker: LUKE
words: He saw the bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, where is he? I wanna meet him.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, he's out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Out where?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, he just went out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't ask him where he was going?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: LUKE
words: Because he's not two.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but Luke, he's new in town. He doesn't know his way around yet.

speaker: LUKE
words: Way around what? This is Stars Hollow. You take three left turns and you're back in the center of town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, when a kid goes out, you have to at least ask where he's going.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you're responsible for him now. If he goes and knocks over a liquor store, it's gonna be your fault.

speaker: LUKE
words: If I had asked him where he was going and he actually intended to knock off a liquor store, do you really think he would've told me that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: If he's dumb.

speaker: LUKE
words: He's fine. New topic.
[Jess walks into the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, hey, good. I'd like you to meet someone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Hi, I'm Lorelai. I just wanted to meet you before Luke had a chance to fill your head with all kinds of little lies about me.

speaker: JESS
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, you should meet my daughter. She's about your age. She can show you where all the good wilding goes on. . . .Okay, well, it's nice to meet you. I hope you like it here. . . . . So, class dismissed.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, are you hungry 'cause I can… [Jess goes upstairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So that's Jess?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very chatty.

speaker: LUKE
words: He's adjusting. He just got here. He probably just went out and realized there are twelve stores in this town devoted entirely to peddling porcelain unicorns. I've lived in this town my entire life, I still can't believe it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sure that's it.

speaker: LUKE
words: He'll be fine in a few days.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, listen, I have a fabulous idea. What are you doing tomorrow night?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you and Jess come over for dinner?

speaker: LUKE
words: Dinner?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie will cook, Rory will be there. It'll be a little 'Hey, welcome to Stars Hollow and see, everyone here's not straight out of a Fellini film' kind of an evening.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, that would be nice, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LUKE
words: You won't bring up the bed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, I'll definitely bring up the bed.
[Luke walks away. Rory walks in and sits at the counter next to Lorelai.]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God, I hate her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, me too.

speaker: RORY
words: You have no idea who I'm talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Solidarity sister.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Well, that I should've guessed.

speaker: RORY
words: She thinks she can torture me off the paper and she can't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, she can't.

speaker: RORY
words: I have never met anyone like her before. Her insistence on holding onto this stupid grudge that is based on nothing and will never ever end shows an amount of commitment that I would've never thought possible. I'm beginning to admire her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: First day sucked?

speaker: RORY
words: Just the paper stuff sucked, the rest of the stuff was good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, I'm glad to hear it. Did you happen to run into Max?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually, no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, our paths just didn't cross.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Isn't he your Lit teacher?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but I do have really tall people sitting in front of me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I saw him in the hallway and I walked the other way and…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. I thought that's what you'd want me to do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just because Max isn't apart of my life anymore doesn't mean he can't be apart of yours. He has to be apart of yours. You have to see him and talk to him, and that's okay. That's good. I know everything seems screwed up right now, but I don't want you to avoid him, especially not on my account. Okay?

speaker: RORY
words: All right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am sorry that I put you in this position.

speaker: RORY
words: That's okay. It's going on the list.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My God, that list is getting long.

speaker: RORY
words: You have no idea.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory and Lorelai come out of Luke's and walk down the sidewalk.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: We are having a little gathering tomorrow night.

speaker: RORY
words: What kind of gathering?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Luke's nephew's here, and I thought we could try to make him feel a little more at home.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you meet him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sort of.

speaker: RORY
words: What's he like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he's not gonna be subbing for the new dodo on the Regis show any time soon, let's put in like that.
CUT TO LUKE'S APARTMENT
[Jess is sitting on his bed smoking and shuffling cards as Luke walks in.]

speaker: LUKE
words: So you get unpacked?

speaker: JESS
words: Yup.

speaker: LUKE
words: Get enough space in the closet?

speaker: JESS
words: Plenty.

speaker: LUKE
words: You hungry?

speaker: JESS
words: Eighteen.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: Just counting how many questions 'til we hit twenty.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, never mind. [phone rings, Luke answers] Yeah? Yeah, Liz, he got here fine.

speaker: JESS
words: Got here at ten this morning.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, hang on a sec. Jess? [holds out the phone]

speaker: JESS
words: Pass.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, come on.

speaker: JESS
words: Nope.

speaker: LUKE
words: What am I supposed to tell her?

speaker: JESS
words: Tell her I gotta take another crack at that closet. You know, I think I hung my Tool T-shirt next to my Metallica T-shirt and they don't really get along.

speaker: LUKE
words: You really want me to tell her that?

speaker: JESS
words: You think a different band combo would sell it more?

speaker: LUKE
words: [on phone] Yeah, Liz, Jess is gonna have to call you back. Yeah, he's helping me out with a shelf thing and his hand are full…Yeah, I'll tell him. Okay, bye. [hangs up] She said to tell you that your stuff will be here on Friday.

speaker: JESS
words: Great, we'll have a party.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, your mom thinks this is. . .you know, for the best and for your own good and. . . Anyhow, I guess you'll just call her when you feel like it.

speaker: JESS
words: You wanna play some poker? Five bucks a hand?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: Ten?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: I can't go any higher than ten.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, fifteen

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I don't wanna play poker.

speaker: JESS
words: You sure?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm sure.

speaker: JESS
words: Okie dokie.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, listen, Lorelai - you met her today, remember? Anyhow, um, she invited us to her house tomorrow night for dinner. Her daughter Rory, who you didn't meet but you'll like 'cause she's a lot like Lorelai, but she's got a slightly tighter grasp on reality. Anyhow, she'll be there, and you know, it'd be a…I don't know, it'd be a chance for you to meet more people and so I, I said yes.
[Jess grabs his coat and walks out.]
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory is sitting alone at the table waiting for the newspaper meeting to start. Paris walks in.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, hello.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're early.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, well I felt so bad about the mix up last time, I wanted to make sure it didn't happen again. It won't.
[Other students walk in for the meeting and sit at the table.]

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hey, did you hear that Kimber Slately and Tristin are a major item?

speaker: LOUISE
words: I thought that Kimber and Shawn Asher were this year's John and Jackie.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Nope, Shawn is with Deeds McGuire now, which pushed Jeff Trainer into Dottie Lords' arms leaving Madison Maylands alone for the first weekend since he became captain of the lacrosse team.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Wow, you know so much so soon. You have a gift.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I know. Hey Paris, what do you think about me writing a gossip column for The Franklin?

speaker: PARIS
words: Huh. I don't know. That's a hard one. I mean, this is The Franklin, a newspaper that's been around for almost a hundred years. There have been at least ten former editors of The Franklin that have gone on to work at the New York Times. Six have gone onto the Washington Post. Three are contributing editors at the New Yorker. I think one even went on to win the Pullitzer Prize. But never mind them. I could be the first editor in the history of The Franklin to introduce a column exclusively devoted to who Biffy's boffing today. Quandary. You know, I'm gonna have to get back to you on that one.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Okay.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Oh good, we're all here. And prompt, lovely. Well, I've read everyone's article, and they were all extremely well done. Snappy, informative, well-researched. Paris, you should be very proud of the team you've assembled here this year.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you.

speaker: TEACHER
words: I mean, when you've got a reporter who can take an incredibly mundane and seemingly unimportant subject like the re-paving of the faculty parking lot and turn it into a bittersweet piece on how everybody and everything eventually becomes obsolete, then you've really got something. Miss Gilmore, I was touched.

speaker: RORY
words: I owe it all to Paris.

speaker: TEACHER
words: I would strongly advise that next time you give Miss Gilmore something with a little more meat to it.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, yeah, great idea.

speaker: TEACHER
words: Okay, let's get down to work here. We've got a layout to put together.
[Rory walks to a computer and sits down. Paris walks over to her.]

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, congratulations.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: PARIS
words: You must be very proud of yourself.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I'm not hiding when I pass a mirror.

speaker: PARIS
words: I guess it's part of my job as editor to make sure that our best writer's are writing our best pieces, so I'm going to give you one of our best pieces.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: PARIS
words: Front page, lead story, above the fold.

speaker: RORY
words: Get to the catch Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: No catch.

speaker: RORY
words: No catch?

speaker: PARIS
words: I'd like to start out year off with a profile on the teacher voted most popular from the year before. You know, an in-depth, no holds barred interview. Everybody wants it. You have it.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding.

speaker: PARIS
words: Nope.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, thanks.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're welcome. So go ahead and set up that interview with Mr. Medina as soon as possible.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: I know it's short notice but I'd love it to lead off the first edition.

speaker: RORY
words: Mr. Medina?

speaker: PARIS
words: He was the winner by a landslide.

speaker: RORY
words: But…

speaker: PARIS
words: I'm sorry, is there a problem? I mean, is there some reason why you wouldn't want to interview him? After all, you of all people should be able to get the most in-depth story out of him, especially since he and your mother are involved. They are still involved, aren't they?

speaker: RORY
words: Let's just leave my mother's personal life out of this, okay?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, that sounds bad.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not bad, it's just none of your business.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine. You want the interview or not?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I want the interview.

speaker: PARIS
words: Good. Get me something more than his favorite color, okay?
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Sookie and Jackson are in the kitchen cooking.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Maybe I should make grilled cheese.

speaker: JACKSON
words: But you're making pot roast.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But not everybody likes pot roast.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, then they can have the chicken wings, the mashed potatoes, the four different kinds of salad that you're making in addition to the pot roast.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, I guess you're right.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So I should start slicing the cheese?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Would you? Oh, that'd be great.
[Lorelai walks into the kitchen.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, wow, something smells good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's the garlic.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Three heads of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I want everything to be perfect. We are gonna make this kid think that he died and went to heaven.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Or Henry the Eighth's house.
[Lorelai knocks on Rory's bedroom door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Milady?

speaker: RORY
words: Come in.
[Lorelai opens the door, Rory is sitting at her computer.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you joining the festivities?

speaker: RORY
words: In a sec.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You sound crabby.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm concentrating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, don't concentrate too hard. Boys like 'em dumb, right Jackson?

speaker: JACKSON
words: If you can navigate yourself around a tree, keep on walking.
[There's a knock at the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coming!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What if he doesn't do dairy?
CUT TO FRONT HALLWAY
[Lorelai opens the front door, Luke and Jess are standing there.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, perfect timing. Sookie's about to break her own record for the most food served outside the Roman Empire.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sounds great.

speaker: JESS
words: Sure does.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, come on in.
[They walk inside. Jess goes into the living as Luke and Lorelai keep talking in the hallway.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Sorry we're a little late. We had a little misunderstanding about what time we're actually supposed to leave to come here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay. How's it going?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, well, not bad. Oh, the bed popped.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yikes. Was anyone in it?

speaker: LUKE
words: Me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I let him take the real one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that was very nice of you. Hey Jess. Wanna come on in the kitchen?
CUT TO KITCHEN

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, Jackson, I want you to meet Luke's nephew. This is Jess.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Do you eat cheese?

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh my God, this is the greatest lemon I have ever grown. I mean, this is a great lemon. Sookie, you gotta try this lemon. Isn't it a great lemon?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That is a great lemon.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Try it, it's a Meyer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jackson grows fruit and then scares people with it. Rory, they're here.

speaker: RORY
words: Coming. [sees Jess] Hey.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey. [walks into Rory's room]

speaker: RORY
words: I'm Rory.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, I figured.

speaker: RORY
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: JESS
words: [looking at bookshelf] Wow, aren't we hooked on phonics.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I read a lot. Do you read?

speaker: JESS
words: Not much. [takes a book off the shelf]

speaker: RORY
words: I could loan you that if you want. It's great.

speaker: JESS
words: No thanks. [puts it down]

speaker: RORY
words: Well, if you change your mind…

speaker: LORELAI
words: [from the doorway] Okay, we really need to get Jackson away from the lemons now, so we're moving the feast in the living room. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: Be right there.

speaker: JESS
words: So do these open? [looking at windows]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah, you just have to unlatch them and then push.

speaker: JESS
words: Great. Shall we?

speaker: RORY
words: Shall we what?

speaker: JESS
words: Bail.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because it's Tuesday night in Stars Hollow. There's nowhere to bail to. The 24-hour mini-mart just closed twenty minutes ago.

speaker: JESS
words: So we'll walk around or sit on a bench and stare at our shoes.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, Sookie just made a ton of really great food, and I'm starving and though it may not seem like it right at this moment, it's gonna be fun. Trust me.

speaker: JESS
words: I don't even know you.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, don't I look trustworthy?

speaker: JESS
words: Maybe.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, good. Let's eat. [walks into kitchen] You want a soda?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, I'll get it.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[Rory gets a soda and walks into the living room. Jess walks to the fridge, takes out a beer, and goes out the back door.]
CUT TO LIVING ROOM
[A table is set up in the living room. Everyone stands around it loading up their plates.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You know ham was originally made out of rice?

speaker: JACKSON
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie…

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey Rory, where's Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: He's getting a soda.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here. [hands Luke a plate]

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm sorry, you must've mistaken me for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, too much?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, I forgot the garlic bread.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get it.
CUT TO KITCHEN
[Lorelai walks in, takes the bread out of the oven, then looks around for Jess. She walks out the back door.]
CUT TO BACK PORCH
[Lorelai walks out and finds Jess opening the beer.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, for me, hey, thanks. [takes a sip] Refreshing. So what, you're not hungry?

speaker: JESS
words: Not really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Sookie made you some grilled cheese if you don't like pot roast.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, well, if I'd had known that…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let me guess, you don't want to be here?

speaker: JESS
words: Doesn't matter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, here in Stars Hollow.

speaker: JESS
words: Well geez, Ms. Gilmore, why would anyone not want to be here in Stars Hollow? That just sounds plum crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, Jess, let me give you a little advice. The whole 'my parents don't get me' thing, I've been there.

speaker: JESS
words: You have, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I have. I've also done the 'chip on my shoulder' bit. Ooh, and the surly, sarcastic, 'the world can bite my ass' bit, and let me tell you, I mastered them all, in heels, yet. And everything you're feeling might be totally justified, maybe you are getting screwed. But Luke is a great guy. He's very special, and he really wants to take care of you and make things right for you. You're incredibly lucky to have him. If you give this situation half a chance, you might be surprised at how good it can be, how much you like living here, and how comfortable it feels to have someone like Luke you can really depend on.

speaker: JESS
words: What are you sleeping with him or something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: JESS
words: I don't know. The whole starry eyed 'you're so much better off, just give it a chance' speech. You're either really naïve, or you're getting some.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. There have been very few moments in my life where I have actually wished I had one of those enormous cream pies you can just smash in someone's face, but this is definitely one of them.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, now, that's not very neighborly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you know what, this is my house, and I choose how I get talked to in it, ha ha.

speaker: JESS
words: You know, you don't know anything about me, or my life, or my mom, or Luke, so why don't you Doctor Laura someone else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm going inside, stay out of my fridge.
CUT TO KITCHEN
[Lorelai walks in from the back door and starts putting the garlic bread in a basket. Luke walks in.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Where's Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Outside working on his "Breakfast Club" audition. He's getting good.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, I'm sorry. That kid is way more screwed up than you think he is.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I catch him outside with a beer, I don't even bust him on it, I just…I try talking to him…

speaker: LUKE
words: What do you mean, talk to him? What did you say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said he's got a good thing going here with you and he shouldn't blow it, and then, well then he just got charming.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing talking to him about stuff like that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm trying to help you.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't need your help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yeah you do.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, here we go again with this 'I'm not prepared for this' crap.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is not crap, this is the truth. Luke, you should've heard him talking.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't need to hear him talking, he's my nephew and I know what I'm doing. And I'm getting a little tired of your condescending…

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not being condescending.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, you have a kid, so you know everything, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a kid, so yeah, I know a little more than you do.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, you ever think maybe you just got lucky with Rory? I mean, you did get pregnant at sixteen. That doesn't show the greatest decision making skills, now does it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, two pies.

speaker: LUKE
words: What the hell you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. I'm talking about nothing. And you won't have to hear my opinion on anything ever again, okay?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, don't tease.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go find Jess. [walks away]

speaker: LUKE
words: Don't tell me what to do. [goes out the back door]
CUT TO OUTSIDE LUKE'S DINER
[Rory are Lorelai are standing in front of the diner.]

speaker: RORY
words: You're being completely childish.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Am not.

speaker: RORY
words: So what, we're never gonna go into Luke's again? We're just gonna starve?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, this was a bad one, okay? This was not Nick and Nora, this was Sid and Nancy, and I'm not going in there.

speaker: RORY
words: But the coffee is in there. And it's Danish Day. Are you seriously telling me that you're gonna let a stupid fight get in the way of Danish Day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm not.

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So go in there and order two coffees and two Danishes to go.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And don't forget the napkins.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, he's gonna know what's going on. He's not stupid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He cannot prove that you're not ordering all that for yourself, can he? No, so go on. Scoot, scoot. Mommy's right here.
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE'S
[Rory walks up to Luke at the counter.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I'll have two coffees and two cherry Danishes to go, please.

speaker: LUKE
words: Two coffees and two cherry Danishes.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, and some napkins.

speaker: LUKE
words: One of these is for her isn't it?

speaker: RORY
words: Who? Oh, no no no. They're all for me. I am super hungry today. I was debating ordering three, but I'll tell you how I feel after two.

speaker: LUKE
words: Tell you what, I'll give you one Danish and one cup of coffee, you can sit over there and eat, and when you're finished them right over there where I can see you, then I'll bring you a second one.

speaker: RORY
words: You're really just gonna stand there and watch me eat a Danish?

speaker: LUKE
words: Cable's out. I'm starved for entertainment.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, this is insane. So you guys had a fight, big deal. You know you're gonna make up anyway, and what better day to make up than Danish Day, the happiest of all days. The day when we all say, 'hey, let's forgive and forget over a nice Danish and a cup coffee.'

speaker: LUKE
words: One Danish, one cup of coffee, take it or leave it.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll take it. I still think you're being silly.
[Luke hands her a cup of coffee and a paper bag.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you for sharing. Come back soon.
CUT TO FRONT OF DINER
[Rory walks out carrying the bag and the coffee and walks over to Lorelai.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well?

speaker: RORY
words: He would only sell me one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! Didn't you say they were both for you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I did, and he knew that I was lying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you do the blinky thing? You always do the blinky thing when you're lying.

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't have to do the blinky thing. He knows you well enough to know that you're not gonna go a whole day with no coffee and especially no Danish.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh!

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you go in there now and just make up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you give me half your Danish and some coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll give you the Danish but I'm keeping the coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is a Danish without coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: The eternal question springs up again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's no point in even eating a Danish without coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm going to school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sad Danish, lonely Danish, step Danish.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll see you tonight. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: But… [sees a little boy crossing the street] Hey, kid, do me a favor? Come here.
[Luke watches through the window as Lorelai tries to get the kid to buy her coffee.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please, please…
[the kid runs away, Lorelai looks at the diner and pouts. The phone rings in the diner; Luke answers]

speaker: LUKE
words: Luke's…what is it Taylor? Slow down, you're babbling. Well, how do you know it was Jess? . . . Okay, Taylor, I'll talk to him, but if he tells me he didn't do it and nobody saw him do it, then he is off the hook, understand? [hangs up]
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory walks down the hallway and stops in front of a door. She pauses a second before walking inside. Inside the classroom, Max is sitting at a desk.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hi.

speaker: MAX
words: Rory, hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Am I too early? 'Cause I can…

speaker: MAX
words: No, no.

speaker: RORY
words: …come back some other time.

speaker: MAX
words: This is fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Tomorrow maybe.

speaker: MAX
words: Now is good.

speaker: RORY
words: This is weird.

speaker: MAX
words: Yeah, it is.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't really know how to act.

speaker: MAX
words: I'm not completely sure of that myself. We could sit.

speaker: RORY
words: Sit, sure, that's good. Barbara Walters sits, or walks sometimes if the person she's talking to has a horse or a ranch or a big backyard sometimes, but usually she just sits. Okay, so I guess we should just start. [she sits across from him]

speaker: MAX
words: Good idea.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you mind if I tape this?

speaker: MAX
words: Oh, no, not at all.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [turns on tape recorder] So I guess I'll just dive in. Full name?

speaker: MAX
words: Max Arturo Medina.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding.

speaker: MAX
words: No, I'm not.

speaker: RORY
words: Where does that come from?

speaker: MAX
words: My father's butcher was named Arturo.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: MAX
words: And when my mother was pregnant with me, she went through this phase where all she would eat was lamb chops. So Arturo would cut her the extra large lamb chops and only charge her for the regular sized lamb chops, which in my family made you eligible for sainthood.

speaker: RORY
words: Hence the Arturo.

speaker: MAX
words: That's right.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I assume that you are aware that you were overwhelmingly voted the student's favorite teacher last year.

speaker: MAX
words: I teach an exceptional bunch of young people. I'm glad they seem to like me as much as I like them.

speaker: RORY
words: Have you ever thought of doing something other than teaching?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, my father wanted me to be a doctor, and my mother wanted me to be President, and I wanted to be. . . a clown.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: MAX
words: When I was a kid, I went to the circus and I saw this man who was dressed in this crazy outfit, and he could juggle and he rode on an elephant and the people loved him and I thought, 'Well, that's it. That's for me.'

speaker: RORY
words: How long did that last?

speaker: MAX
words: Junior high. And then slowly I figured out that I wanted to teach. Plus, when you told people that you wanted to be a clown they tended to get very frightened.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom took me to the circus once, when I was really little and, um, this clown knocked into me and I dropped my cotton candy, and we didn't have a lot of money back then so she couldn't buy me another one, and I started crying. So she literally chased the clown on stage, ripped off his wig and said she wouldn't give it back to him unless he bought me another cotton candy.

speaker: MAX
words: Which I bet he did.

speaker: RORY
words: It was twice as big as the first one and I threw up all the way home.

speaker: MAX
words: Yeah, that sounds like your mom.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you ever regret the fact that you didn't become a clown?

speaker: MAX
words: I don't really believe in regrets. All my experiences, even the ones that didn't turn out the way I wanted them to, I firmly believe they were all worth it.
[Rory turns off the tape recorder]

speaker: RORY
words: I just want you to know, I really wanted you to be my stepfather.

speaker: MAX
words: I just want you to know, I really wanted to be your stepfather.
[They're silent for a few seconds, then Rory turns back on tape recorder.]

speaker: RORY
words: So, what would you say are the great challenges facing high school graduates today?

speaker: MAX
words: Well, a myriad of things really…
CUT TO OUTSIDE STARS HOLLOW HIGH
[Luke is waiting out front as Jess walks out.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. How was school?

speaker: JESS
words: Great.

speaker: LUKE
words: You learn anything good?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh yeah, tons of things. I've got gold stars plastered all over my forehead.

speaker: LUKE
words: I had an interesting call today. Wanna know who it was from?

speaker: JESS
words: Not really.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was from Taylor Doose, you know he owns the market.

speaker: JESS
words: If you say so.

speaker: LUKE
words: He said you came in today.

speaker: JESS
words: He did?

speaker: LUKE
words: And he said you took some money out of a little donation cup to help repair the bridge. I told him he was crazy, you wouldn't do that, you weren't a thief, that he was just trying to start trouble, then I hung up on him. But don't get me wrong, I enjoy hanging up on Taylor, and he is crazy, but I was just wondering if maybe any of the other things he said were true.

speaker: JESS
words: What do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: I think that if you tell me that what he's saying is not true, then I'm gonna believe it's not true.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, it's not true.

speaker: LUKE
words: That doesn't sound very convincing.

speaker: JESS
words: Look, what exactly do you want from me? You bring me here to this place, you put me in a school that says the Pledge of Allegiance in six different languages, two of which I've never heard of before. You take me away from my home, my friends, and now you want what from me?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm trying to help you.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, stop trying. Stop talking to me, stop following me, and stop asking me questions. Just stop.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's what you want?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's really what you want?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Fine, you got it.

speaker: JESS
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're welcome.
[As they both walk away over a bridge, Luke pushes Jess into the lake.]
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Rory's sitting at the kitchen table doing homework as Lorelai comes home.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Kitchen.
[Lorelai walks into the kitchen and takes a bag of coffee from the fridge]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nowhere in either Stars Hollow or it's surrounding counties can you get a decent cup of coffee. I swear, it's like a big stupid coffee conspiracy.

speaker: RORY
words: Why don't you just pour the water right into the bag?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you jest, but believe me, the thought has crossed my mind. It's looking better and better all the time. Where are you going? I'm not through complaining.

speaker: RORY
words: I just have to get some more notes I need.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. What's this?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This that you're working on?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that's my interview with Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What interview with Max?

speaker: RORY
words: The paper wanted to do a piece on the student's favorite teacher from the previous year and Paris assigned it to me when she caught wind of the fact that. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, nice kid that Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. It wasn't that bad though.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No?

speaker: RORY
words: No. It was actually good. It gave us a chance to talk about some things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well good.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it was good. Well, I'm gonna buy a folder for it before the store closes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Some good writing here, missy.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really good.

speaker: RORY
words: It's not quite up to the re-paving piece yet but I'll get it there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Boy, he sounds like a hell of a guy, doesn't he?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, he does. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I sure know how to dump 'em, don't I?
[there's a knock at the back door; Lorelai opens it, Luke walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: I just pushed him in a lake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess. I got this call from Taylor that he thinks Jess stole the bridge money and I went to confront him and he was being impossible and I just pushed him in a lake. This is bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That depends, can he swim?

speaker: LUKE
words: He's fine. He's wet. I just, I lost it, you know. You were right. I am in so far over my head that I can't see my own hat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Try turning it around

speaker: LUKE
words: What was I thinking? Why did I say yes to this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you saw a kid in desperate need of some help and you thought you would throw him a line.

speaker: LUKE
words: But me, raising a kid? I don't even like kids. They're always sticky, you know, like they've got jam on their hands. Even if there's no jam in the house, somehow they've always got jam on their hands. I'm not the right guy to deal with that. I have no patience for jam hands.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, slow down. First of all, Jess is seventeen, so I think he's probably past the jam hands stage by now. And second of all, you can do this. If you want to, you are totally capable. But you can't just buy a bed and some sheets and expect the rest to take care of itself. That will not work.

speaker: LUKE
words: I swear, I'm gonna kill Liz.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Liz is not the point anymore. Liz is not here, Jess is here. Focus on him. What are you gonna do about him?
[Babette walks in the back door.]

speaker: BABETTE
words: Lorelai, sugah? I hate to bother you, but have you seen Pierpont?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um no. Why?

speaker: BABETTE
words: It's the darndest thing. I came out just now and I noticed that he was gone. Just like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm sorry, who's missing?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Pierpont, gorgeous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her gnome.

speaker: LUKE
words: Her gnome?

speaker: BABETTE
words: The one with the pipe.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh God, I hope nothing's happened to him. You get so attached to their little faces, sometimes you can hear them talk to you at night.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, I wouldn't worry Babette. I think you're gonna see Pierpont again really soon. [walks to the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, where you going?

speaker: LUKE
words: I have to take care of something. I'll see you tomorrow at the diner for your Danish, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow isn't Danish Day.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just be there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, sir.
CUT TO LUKE'S APARTMENT
[Jess is on his bed smoking; Luke walks in with a bag and starts dropping things on his bed.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, we got the patch, the gum, hypnosis tapes, Chinese herbs, self-help books, and several pictures of diseased lungs to hang on the fridge. Pretty, huh? This is done. [puts out his cigarette]

speaker: JESS
words: Hey!

speaker: LUKE
words: You will get up, you will go to school, you will come home, you will work in the diner until closing, you will do your homework and then you will go to bed. Where's the gnome?

speaker: JESS
words: The what?

speaker: LUKE
words: The weekends are for chores and selected pre-approved outings, i.e. cavalla studies, freeway beautification projects, Color Me Mine pottery painting, all discussible options. You will not steal, you will pay back Taylor Doose, you will graduate for high school, and you will return Pierpont to his yard.

speaker: JESS
words: You can't just…

speaker: LUKE
words: I can just. I am not letting you just fall off the face of the earth. You will not drift, I won't let it happen. Now I don't know if this is the right way to handle this, but this is the way it's being handled, and that my friend, is the end of this discussion. [Jess gets up and walks away] Where are you going?

speaker: JESS
words: Out. [leaves]

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, at least I asked.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Jess is walking down the street and sees Rory come out of a store. He walks over to her.]

speaker: JESS
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey yourself.

speaker: JESS
words: What are you doing out here?

speaker: RORY
words: I needed something for school. What about you?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh yeah, same thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh. So, that was quite a disappearing act you pulled the other night.

speaker: JESS
words: Potlucks and Tupperware parties aren't really my thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Too cool for school, huh?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes, that is me.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh this? Nothing. [does an illusion with a coin] Just another little disappearing act.

speaker: RORY
words: Little tip?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: If you ever want to speak to me again, don't pull that out of my ear.

speaker: JESS
words: So I assume the nose is off limits too?

speaker: RORY
words: Any place you wouldn't naturally find a coin, let's leave it that way.

speaker: JESS
words: So what are you doing now?

speaker: RORY
words: I have some homework to finish.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, then I'll leave you this last little trick. [hands her a book]

speaker: RORY
words: You bought a copy? I told you I'd lend you mine.

speaker: JESS
words: It is yours.

speaker: RORY
words: You stole my book.

speaker: JESS
words: Nope, borrowed it.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, that's not called a trick, that's called a felony.

speaker: JESS
words: I just wanted to put some notes in the margins for you.

speaker: RORY
words: What? [looks through the book] You've read this before.

speaker: JESS
words: About forty times.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you said you didn't read much.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, what is much? Goodnight Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Goodnight Dodger.

speaker: JESS
words: Dodger?

speaker: RORY
words: Figure it out.

speaker: JESS
words: Oliver Twist.
[Rory smiles and nods. They both walk away.]
THE END
OPEN AT ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[The doorbell rings, the maid answers it; Lorelai and Rory are standing there.]

speaker: MAID
words: Yes?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: MAID
words: Hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're new.

speaker: MAID
words: Uh, I started yesterday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's your name?

speaker: MAID
words: Liesl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Liesl. I'm Brigitta, this is Gretl. And, uh, Emily and Richard are expecting us.

speaker: LIESL
words: Oh, I'm sorry. Please come in.
[Lorelai and Rory walk inside; they hear Emily and Richard arguing upstairs.]

speaker: LIESL
words: Uh, can I, uh, get you a drink?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what, that's okay. I can get it. Why don't you go hide in the kitchen?

speaker: LIESL
words: Really? Thank you. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: What is going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. I think George and Martha are joining us for dinner.
[Lorelai and Rory watch Emily and Richard fighting on the steps.]

speaker: RICHARD
words: I didn't know that my every conversation needed to be reported to you. I stand corrected.

speaker: EMILY
words: I have been the co-chair of the Starlight Foundation for the last eight years.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know this, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: And the Black and White Ball is the main fundraising event of the season.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It's one year.

speaker: EMILY
words: The co-chair cannot miss the main fundraising event.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why? Won't the chair be there?

speaker: EMILY
words: Is this a joke to you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, I have too many things to take care of at work. I don't have time for frivolous parties.

speaker: EMILY
words: Frivolous parties? Friv. . . .[walks up the steps]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, where are you going? Oh, come back here. [follows her]

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, this is bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I wish we had popcorn.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh. Incoming.
