[Emily and Richard come back down the steps. Emily reads from a stack of invitations.]

speaker: EMILY
words: The Hartford Zoological Silent Auction, the Mark Twain House Restoration Fund luncheon, the Harriet Beecher Stowe Literacy Auction.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can read those myself, you know.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is the fourth event you've taken upon yourself to turn down on our behalf. And I am on the board of all of those foundations. Now how do you think that makes me look?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Like your husband is busy and has a great deal of responsibility.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I have responsibilities too.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I understand that your social engagements are important.

speaker: EMILY
words: They're not just social engagements.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Anything at which you serve tea is a social engagement.

speaker: EMILY
words: That's it. I am gonna get a tape recorder so you can hear how pompous and condescending you sound.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Wha...uh...Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, I wouldn't want you to take my word for it. I might be delirious from all that tea I've been drinking. [walks upstairs]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh stop this. [follows her]

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe we should leave.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you kidding? We've got dinner theater here.

speaker: RORY
words: But Grandma and Grandpa are obviously in a fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: One that they probably wouldn't want us to see.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, we stumbled in here completely innocently. We came for dinner as usual, per their request. We had no idea we were walking into The Lion King without the puppet heads.
[They come back downstairs. Emily follows Richard holding out a tape recorder.]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Get that thing out of my face.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just say the tea thing again.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You are behaving like a child.

speaker: EMILY
words: Turn around when you talk, would you? I'm not sure how good this microphone is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [sees Lorelai and Rory] Oh.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [claps] Brava! Encore! I'm sorry, does Terrence McNally know about you too? Get me the phone!
[opening credits]
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at the counter. Lorelai is reading Rory's homework.]

speaker: RORY
words: It sucks. I know it sucks, just tell me it sucks.

words: It's great.

words: No it's not.

words: It's an A.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't lie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A-plus.

words: You're my mom.

words: Is anything higher than an A-plus?

speaker: RORY
words: You have to say that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's an A-plus with a crown and a wand.

speaker: RORY
words: This is not how you raise a child. You don't send them out there with a false sense of pride because out there, in the real world, no one will coddle you. I'd rather know right now if I'm gonna be working at CNN or carrying a basket around it's offices with sandwiches in it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's great.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really really.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

words: Coffee…coffee. Okay, what do you want? Eggs, toast, combo?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's the rush there, Zippy?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm just swamped this morning. I was supposed to have help but I don't. So order right now or I'm bringing the both of you an egg white omelet with a side of steamed spinach.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pancakes.

speaker: RORY
words: French toast.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you. [Jess walks into the diner from the stairway] Jess, you were supposed to be down here. . . .what the hell is that?

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: That.

speaker: JESS
words: That is a shirt.

speaker: LUKE
words: Change.

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Go upstairs and change your shirt.

speaker: JESS
words: I like this shirt.

speaker: LUKE
words: How can you like that shirt?

speaker: JESS
words: It brings out my eyes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, part of the deal of you staying here is that you work here, and when you work here you will wear proper work attire, and that is not proper work attire. Now go upstairs and change into something that won't scare the hell out of my customers.

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever you say Uncle Luke. [goes upstairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gross shirt.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good band.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Emily is having tea on the back patio with three friends.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.

speaker: MAID
words: Mm hmm. [walks away]

speaker: LADY 1
words: Another new one, Emily?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes. The last one only made it through one evening. Thoroughly nervous creature.

speaker: LADY 2
words: What do you do to them, Em?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, the usual. Clean this, cook that, sacrifice a virgin on your way out.

speaker: LADY 1
words: [laughs] The things you say.

speaker: LADY 2
words: We could've done with some of that at the ball the other night.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, was it dull?

speaker: LADY 2
words: I felt as if my shoes were going out of style as I sat there.

speaker: EMILY
words: What a shame.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Now, Nattie, it wasn't all dull. Are we forgetting Truly Bishop?

speaker: NATTIE
words: Oh, that's right.

speaker: EMILY
words: What, what about Truly Bishop?

speaker: LADY 3
words: Well, you know she and Eugene split up last month.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: NATTIE
words: Oh Em! You knew about that. They had this huge fight at the. . oh that's right, you missed the Schafer's cocktail party.

speaker: EMILY
words: They broke up at the Schafer's cocktail party?

speaker: NATTIE
words: He has another family in Salisbury.

speaker: EMILY
words: No!

speaker: LADY 3
words: She's 26, with a 2 year old.

speaker: EMILY
words: How did Truly find out?

speaker: NATTIE
words: The little tart sent her a letter.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: LADY 1
words: So Truly confronted Eugene after consuming a bottle and a half of Cristal, and he admitted it. He said he was going to leave her and marry the Salisbury concubine.

speaker: EMILY
words: What did she do?

speaker: LADY 1
words: She threw an ice sculpture at his head.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't believe I missed that.

speaker: LADY 1
words: You've missed everything lately.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Yes, where have you been? Is everything all right?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, it's just, uh, Richard.

speaker: NATTIE
words: He hasn't been hanging out in Salisbury, has he?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, he's been swamped at work. Night and day, weekends. You'd think he was the only person who worked at that company. Plus, he hasn't been feeling very well. His back and knees. Very bad knees. [Sees Rory at the patio doorway] Oh Rory, what a nice surprise.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandma. Sorry to butt in like this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Nonsense, come and meet my friends. Ladies, I'd like you to meet my granddaughter Rory.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Well, hello Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: NATTIE
words: My goodness, what a pretty girl you are.

speaker: LADY 1
words: She looks just like Lorelai, doesn't she?

speaker: NATTIE
words: The eyes.

speaker: LADY 3
words: The nose.

speaker: LADY 1
words: Walk around sweetie.

speaker: EMILY
words: Sally, leave the girl alone.

speaker: LADY 1
words: I just wanna see the walk. Lorelai had such a specific walk.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Fast.

speaker: LADY 1
words: That was it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Come, sit, would you like some tea?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no. I just came to pick up a book that Grandpa was supposed to leave for me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Go check his study. It might be on his desk.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, thanks. [walks inside]

speaker: LADY 3
words: Emily, your granddaughter is just lovely. How old is she?

speaker: EMILY
words: Sixteen.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Sixteen, that's a nice age.

speaker: LADY 1
words: So, have you thought about her debut?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, uh, no, not yet.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Well you know, the Daughters of the Daughters of the American Revolution Debutante Ball is next week.

speaker: EMILY
words: It is? I hadn't realized.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Why don't you present Rory there?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh. . uh. . Well, I don't know. Isn't it a little late?

speaker: LADY 1
words: Oh please. For Emily Gilmore, I'm sure they'll bend the rules.

speaker: LADY 3
words: Oh you have to. With a girl like that Emily, you'll be the hit of the ball.

speaker: NATTIE
words: She'd definitely be the prettiest one there.

speaker: LADY 1
words: Except for Katie Heathington.

speaker: LADY 3
words: No, didn't you hear? Katie fell off her horse, has a scab on her face.

speaker: NATTIE
words: Oh, well then, if Katie Heathington has a scab on her face, Rory will definitely be the prettiest one there.

speaker: LADY 3
words: It'll be your crowning moment.
[Rory returns with the book]

speaker: RORY
words: I found it. [pause] Yay.
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Lorelai sits at the kitchen table doing homework as Rory comes home.]

speaker: RORY
words: I'm coming out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Out of what?

speaker: RORY
words: Out into society.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: I went to Grandma's house after school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, right away, bad.

speaker: RORY
words: And, um, her DAR friends are all there and they're talking about this debutante ball that's being thrown.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no.

speaker: RORY
words: And when I got back from Grandpa's office, they all invited me out onto the patio.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No no no, please tell me you did not go out onto the patio.

speaker: RORY
words: I went out onto the patio.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, Rory, that's like accepting the position as the drummer in Spinal Tap.

speaker: RORY
words: Before I knew it, Grandma was telling me how important it is for a person to be properly presented to society.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh.

speaker: RORY
words: And how every young girl dreams of this day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Agh.

speaker: RORY
words: And how there are flowers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Lord.

speaker: RORY
words: And music.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please.

speaker: RORY
words: And cake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, the cake's actually good.

speaker: RORY
words: And before I knew it, Grandma was bringing out your old dress and I was trying it on and. . . what are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm getting you out of this. [picks up phone]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, wait.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear, there is nothing in the world my mother is better at than getting someone to agree to something that in any other universe, they would never ever consider.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am still convinced she had something to do with Lily Tomlin doing that movie with John Travolta.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm doing this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because you should've seen the look on Grandma's face when she asked me. It's just really really important to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Now if it's that important to her, and it's not that important to me, then why shouldn't I do it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, do you now what a coming out party says?

speaker: RORY
words: It says I'm a woman now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. It says, 'Hi, I'm Rory. I'm of good breeding and marriageable age, and I will now parade around in front of young men of similarly good breeding and marriageable age so they can all take a good long look at me.'

speaker: RORY
words: You're exaggerating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's like animals being up for bid at the county fair, except sheep don't wear hoop skirts.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, I promised, but you don't have to be apart of it if you don't want to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, if you wanna do it, I'll help. It's just weird. This is all the stuff I ran away from. I just assumed you'd be running with me.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I would, but I heard debutantes don't run. Something about the heels.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right then. If you're sure, where do we start? Uh, let's see. Well, you have a dress. You need a dowry, I guess. There you go. And uh, you'll need shoes, hose, gloves, some mice, a dog, a pumpkin. What's wrong?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no, it just says that your father is supposed to present you at the ceremony.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Whatever, it's no big deal. I can get someone else to do it. Grandpa probably.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Or Taylor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Or the cable guy looked pretty friendly last week. Maybe he has a tux.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hand me the phone.

speaker: RORY
words: I was kidding about the cable guy. What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [dials phone] Look missy, there are plenty of things that should weird you out about coming out, but inviting your father shouldn't be one of them.

speaker: OPERATOR
words: The number you have dialed. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Umm, wra. . . gum wrapper.

speaker: RORY
words: He's not going to come.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't know until you ask.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [dials new number] Look, we call, we ask, there's no harm. Trust me. Cable guy's not going anywhere.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, hi. Where the hell are you?

speaker: CHRISTOPER
words: Boston.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Boston? [walks into living room]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, Boston. Baked Beans, cream pie, tea party, strangler.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that Boston.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Where are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Helsinki.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I finally got the girl band together and after a week opening stateside, we headed across the Atlantic and now we're huge with the Nordic set.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It's good to hear from you. We haven't talked in awhile.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You could've called too, you know. Or do you have one of those special phones that only receives calls?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I figured you had a lot going on what with the engagement and the canceling of the engagement. How's that going, by the way?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, still canceled.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. And I'm even better when I'm not talking about it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Moving on then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I have some shocking news. Rory's coming out.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Out of what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coming out. White dresses, gloves, curtsies.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Stop it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear to God.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I can't believe you're letting her do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, I wasn't about to let her use my method of getting out of it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: This is crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's doing it as a favor to my mom, there's no talking her out of it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, did you tell her about Barbara Hutton, Doris Duke, Gloria Vanderbilt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and she's perfectly willing to marry Cary Grant, get offed by her crazy butler and start designing blue jeans as soon as the ball ends.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, okay, if that's what she wants.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now comes the reason for my phone call.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: All your regular 976 numbers are busy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now I know this is totally not your thing, but as you will remember, part of the whole coming out process involves the girls being escorted around the dance floor by their Dads.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, I know you would rather sit through "Endless Love" than ever be apart of this scene again. But this is very important to your daughter and she has never asked you for anything, and although no one's keeping track, it would seem that your constant non-presence in her life and your lack of ever showing up when you say you're going to or calling when you say you're going to or basically doing anything when you say you're going to would tend to indicate that you owe her, big time. Now before you say no, I want you to take a minute and remember you have a great daughter who needs you and she has a mother who will hunt you down like a half-priced Kate Spade purse if you disappoint her.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, I'm there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: By there, do you mean the Daughters of the American Revolution Annual Debutante Ball?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Chris, please don't make this promise if you can't.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I wouldn't miss it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's next weekend.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'll clear my schedule.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You swear?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh wait, next weekend?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Christopher!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'm kidding, I will definitely be there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, and in exchange for that I will refrain from saying the ten things that came to mind for making fun of your schedule.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bye.
[Rory walks into living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Little Debbie, your dad is definitely gonna be there.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, he's gonna walk you down the stairs, and turn you in a circle, watch you curtsy, and announce that Rory Gilmore is officially open for business.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe it. And he definitely said definitely?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Definitely.

speaker: RORY
words: So there's a fifty/fifty chance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. He sounded pretty sure, I'd say sixty/forty.

[Dean, Lane and Rory are on the couch watching TV while Lorelai walks around the living room talking on the telephone.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Mom, I'm sure one crinolin will be plenty. No, she doesn't. I'm sure she doesn't. Yeah, in what scenario would I have bought Rory elbow length kidskin gloves, Mom? Oh, I'm sorry, I meant what scenario on my planet would I have bought Rory elbow length kidskin gloves?

words: No, I don't have to ask her mom 'cause I know the answer. I know the answer Mom, I know the answer. Yeah, no, okay, well I don't have to ask her Mom…Hold on. Rory, would you like Grandma's hairstylist to come and set your hair before the ball? . . Oh, I did not coach her Mom, go back to talking about gloves.

words: I think you're gonna look great in a tux.

words: Tails.

words: What?

words: Yeah, according to this it says that all escorts must be properly attired in black tails, white cumberbuns, and white gloves.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

words: I'm sure the gloves are optional.

speaker: LANE
words: Not according to this.

speaker: DEAN
words: Tails? Gloves?

speaker: RORY
words: Remember Neil Young. Remember that you love me. Remember that I'll be watching BattleBots with you for a month.

words: Show me Neil Young again.

speaker: RORY
words: Dad!
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Christopher is getting out of his car as Rory and Lorelai walk out the front door.]

speaker: RORY
words: Dad! [runs to the car]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Whoa! Hold it right there. A lady never runs out to meet a gentleman caller who hasn't been announced.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, we haven't tamed my wild ways yet.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thank God I'm here now.

speaker: RORY
words: I missed you! [hugs him]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Me too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is this?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What? Oh my God, where did this come from?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What happened to your bike?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A crazy game of key exchange at the car wash.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is a car.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It has four wheels and a roof and airbags and seat belts and my God, it smells like a forest.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I needed a little more space. Had something big to haul. I believe this belongs to you. [hands Rory a box from the trunk]

speaker: RORY
words: The Compact Oxford English Dictionary!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I promised you I'd get it. I'm just sorry it took so long.

speaker: RORY
words: That's okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: On the bright side, this is the new edition. If I'd gotten you the old one, you wouldn't have the word 'jiggy' in it.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. I love it, I'm gonna go look things up right now.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Wait wait. [hands her magnifying glass]

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Go. [Rory goes inside]

speaker: LORELAI
words: That was really great of you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thank you. So back to mocking my car?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. A Volvo sedan, are you kidding?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: This is a great car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: For driving to bingo.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, it just seemed like time. I couldn't keep showing up for work on my bike.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Work?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You've heard of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but I didn't think you had.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, it took awhile. I kept getting it mixed up with nap, but I finally figured it out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, you bought a car and got a job?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Actually, job then car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, 'cause it's more responsible that way.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Exactly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, so tell me about the job.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I show up everyday, drink bad coffee, exchange lame pleasantries in the break room with Linda from marketing, and then at the end of two weeks they give me a paycheck. It's a pretty cool system.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're serious?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, you know how us working types are. Get in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well uh. . .I'm not supposed to take rides with strangers.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Trust me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but only if you promise we won't go over 25 miles an hour on the motorway. [Lorelai gets in as Christopher blasts some music] Oh my God, George Lucas wishes he had this sound system.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I've got Alpine head units, two subs, and two twelves. In exchange, no passenger-side airbag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, so the old Christopher still lives.
[Rory leans in the car window.]

speaker: RORY
words: Could you please attenuate the cacophony out here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh?
[Rory reaches in and adjusts the volume]

speaker: RORY
words: Turn down the music. [goes back inside]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Next time instead of a dictionary, just slip her a crisp twenty.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Deal.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Emily walk through the front door carrying several shopping bags.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twelve pairs of pantyhose.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's going to be a long night. She's bound to have a run.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twelve pairs.

speaker: EMILY
words: There's the presentation, the circle, the curtsy, the fan dance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, there'd have to be a 12k run and a jujitsu demonstration for her to go through twelve pairs of pantyhose.

speaker: EMILY
words: Does it really hurt to be prepared, Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Mom, it doesn't hurt to be prepared.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And the good news is, now she is prepared for her high school graduation, her college graduation, her marriage, three to five anniversaries, a hostess gig, and jury duty, especially if she's sequestered.

speaker: EMILY
words: You make me tired.
[Richard walks down the stairs.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh Richard, I didn't know you were home.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, well, we learn something everyday.

speaker: EMILY
words: You didn't have to work?

words: I am working.

words: I'd rather not, if you don't mind.

words: Oh Richard, I got you some beautiful new cufflinks for this weekend.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I already have cufflinks.

words: I know, but these have bulldogs on them. Come look.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'll look at them later.
