words: All right, fine. Just remember to pick up your tux from the cleaners tomorrow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I won't have time.

speaker: EMILY
words: It's right around the corner from your office.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have to go in early tomorrow.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, go now.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am busy now.

speaker: EMILY
words: Doing what?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, I am not going to qualify my time with you. I am not going to pick up my tuxedo. You planned this ridiculous affair, you pick up my tuxedo. Or I simply don't have to go. Either one of these options is fine with me. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Mom, I might be reading too much into this, but um, is something going on between you and Dad?

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know, he just seems a little less jolly than usual.

speaker: EMILY
words: He's just busy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He seems upset.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, he's not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You seem upset.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I'm not. We're both fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, my mistake.

speaker: EMILY
words: I better go pick up his tux.
CUT TO MISS PATTY'S DANCE STUDIO
[Rory and Dean are practicing dancing.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Now, keep counting in your heads. Look each other in the eye. Dean, are you leading?

speaker: DEAN
words: I have no idea.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Okay okay, stop stop stop. Now remember, one of the most important things in ballroom dancing is to remember to spot, otherwise you're gonna get dizzy. So, what you wanna do is you wanna pick out something to focus on. I usually like to find a lonely seaman. Then when turning, whip your head around and find your spot again. [spins around] Hello sailor, hello sailor, hello sailor. Now you try it.

speaker: DEAN
words: You've gotta be kidding me.

speaker: RORY
words: I think you can do it without the 'hello sailor' part.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: BattleBots.

speaker: DEAN
words: For the rest of your life.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Now take it from the top.
[Rory and Dean start dancing again as Lorelai and Christopher walk in with coffee.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you guys are really improving. Now you're actually facing each other.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Anyone need a break?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Okay, take five, but don't sit down because your muscles will get cold.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So how's it going?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually, I'm not very good.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, which is really holding me back because I'm a natural.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, maybe you just need a glittery glove and a really freaky face.

speaker: RORY
words: At one point Miss Patty thought Dean was gonna get hurt, she made me sit in the corner and watch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey! Nobody puts Baby in the corner.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It's not your fault. Ballroom dancing is a wonderfully sexist thing. Any woman can do it, all she needs is a strong male lead. No offense Dean. [He pulls Lorelai towards him, but she stumbles.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, agh!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh, well, most any woman can do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wasn't ready, I wasn't ready. I want a do over.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Fine. May I have this dance?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Do you have a trust fund? Always make sure.
[Lorelai and Christopher start dancing. When they're done, Rory and Dean clap.]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I'm adopted.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I'm never gonna be able to do that.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, you guys just need some practice.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Listen to your father, Rory. Your adorable, adorable father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, let's get you out of here before you become Patty's next husband.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: See you guys later. Bye Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, the way you toy with me.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Christopher walk out of the dance studio each holding a coffee cup.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you know you still knew how to do that?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I wish I didn't. Imagine what we could do if we freed up the brain space that holds onto the Vianese Waltz.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it's right up there in between old Brady Bunch reruns and the lyrics to Rapture.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Ooh, I gotta say, this isn't like the chai lattes in Boston.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, expecting Luke to make a chai anything was completely insane.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, I'm pretty sure he just threw a cinnamon stick in some tea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm pretty sure it's not a cinnamon stick.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, throwing this out now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So chai latte, when did that happen?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I don't know. Everyone at work drinks them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. Well, since you still haven't told me what exactly it is that you do, I'm gonna go with yoga instructor or chiropractor.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, it's actually pretty interesting. I'm working for this firm that helps those overblown tech companies scale back and stay afloat now that they're facing leaner times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry, uh, what's the interesting part?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: We dress like superheroes when we do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, nice. So how long do you think you'll be able to keep this going?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I'm pretty happy there. I'd say at least 'til Tuesday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so long term.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You know, it's weird. I always hated the idea of having to be somewhere at a specific time day after day, but as it turns out, I like the stability.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah. I like that at the end of the day, I feel like I've done something. I've earned something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I think that's really great.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Only took me ten years and several failed business ventures to figure out what I wanted.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which is?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not my parents' life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Something you figured out at sixteen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, six months, but I just couldn't vocalize it yet.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, you knew what you wanted, you went out and got it. I was always a little jealous of you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you seem to be catching up. We did good.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah. Well, I did good. The fact that she can't follow a lead is all you.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Rory sits on the couch painting her toenails, Christopher helps Dean tie his bowtie, Lorelai walks around with a book on her head eating Chinese food.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: See now, only a lady can gracefully walk around a room with a book on her head while eating Kung Pao chicken. And a great lady can even spit the peanuts back into the container without anyone noticing.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, don't be intimidated. You have to practice and practice to get to my level.

speaker: RORY
words: Anyone want the last eggroll?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Heh. Where are you going?

speaker: RORY
words: To get the eggroll.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're getting the eggroll yourself?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! Ladies never get their own eggrolls. Ladies never get their own anything. They don't even get their own ideas.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They just sit helplessly and wait for some young strong man to come by and assist them. They don't step in puddles, they don't step over puddles. They can't even look at puddles. They actually need to be blindfolded and thrown in a sack and carried over puddles.

speaker: RORY
words: Isn't there a moratorium on how long ladies are supposed to talk?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, no. Now repeat after me, I am completely helpless.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, so you pull the left side through the back loop and tug a little bit on both sides, and you my friend, might just be mistaken for a gentleman. Or a waiter.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, how do you know how to do this?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Seventeen cotillions, a dozen debutante balls, and a brief but scarring experiment with the Children of the American Revolution.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where you wore nothing but the bowtie.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A good idea on conception, but the sudden snowstorm instantly dampened the effect.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, uh, do you think it's cool when Neil Young wears a tux?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, of course, but it's Neil Young.

speaker: DEAN
words: All right. I should get going. I'll see you at three.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. Oh wait. [hands him a box]

speaker: DEAN
words: What's this?

speaker: RORY
words: Your gloves.

speaker: DEAN
words: I thought you were kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No no. Ladies never kid.

speaker: DEAN
words: Bye. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: I think I'm going to bed too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you need help?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wrong! The correct answer is yes. Ladies need help with everything.

speaker: RORY
words: Goodnight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [sighs]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Night.

speaker: RORY
words: Night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know about that girl. I don't know how she's ever gonna make it in society. At this rate, she's gonna actually get a job and only marry once.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You calling your mom again?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't get it. For the last week, every five minutes she's calling me checking on shoe fittings and curtsy progress, and have I talked Rory into putting her hair up yet, and then tonight, nothing.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I'm sure they had a lot of getting ready to do for themselves tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's been acting so weird lately. They're fighting. Openly fighting. I don't think they've ever done that before. I'm not sure what to do about it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Move to California. That's what I do when my parents fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, my father doesn't even want to go tomorrow. His perfect angle granddaughter is being presented to society in front of all his friends and colleagues, something he never got to do with his bad, loser, evil daughter.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Maybe you should talk to them. I'm sorry, was that me that said that? I must've had an aneurysm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, nothing more I can do tonight. I'm gonna head up to bed. Do you want me to turn off the lights?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Actually, I have to stay up and do a little work tonight.
[Lorelai laughs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry. I keep forgetting that's not a joke anymore.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Goodnight.
CUT TO BALLROOM
[Lorelai and Rory arrive at the ballroom.]

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, this place is huge. Do I have to walk down those stairs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm afraid so. Unless you wanna make a really memorable entrance and just sliiide down the banister. Which I totally encourage, by the way.

speaker: LADY
words: You are…

speaker: RORY
words: Lorelai Gilmore.

speaker: LADY
words: Late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, my fault. Took me awhile to get pretty. Not all of us are sixteen anymore, you know what I mean? No.

speaker: LADY
words: You are to head up the stairs. The preparation room is on the right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look for the toxic cloud of Chanel and Final Net.
[Rory starts walking towards the stairs. She looks back at Lorelai.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [mouths] Sliiide.
CUT TO PREPARATION ROOM
[Rory and the lady enter the room. Other girls are walking around getting dressed and doing their makeup.]
[Rory sits down at a mirror. She talks to the girl next to her.]

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe we have an hour and a half.

speaker: LIBBY
words: I know, I am never gonna be ready in time. God only knows if the swelling on my nose is gonna go down. I had to go and inherit my father's nose. I'm Libby.

speaker: RORY
words: Rory.

speaker: LIBBY
words: Uh, which one should I wear? I've thought about this all month, and I cannot decide.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, that's a tough one.

speaker: LIBBY
words: I know. This is red red, and this is orange red. The wrong one and I will end up looking like a hooker. Or a teacher.

speaker: RORY
words: That's a lot of pressure.

speaker: LIBBY
words: The two minutes you are standing on those stairs tonight will determine the social status for the rest of your life.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, what if you trip? I mean, not that you would. You wouldn't. I might. Probably will actually. Could be a real Cirque du Soleil kind of night.

speaker: LIBBY
words: You should not even joke about stuff like that. Ow. There's a head under there, you know.
CUT TO BALLROOM
[The bartender hands Lorelai a drink.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are a wonderful, wonderful man. I have a feeling we're going to be very close tonight. [sees Emily] Hmm. Mom, you're here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where should I be, Spain?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. I tried calling you all night last night.

speaker: EMILY
words: I was very busy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then we got here before you.

speaker: EMILY
words: What is your point, Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. It's just weird.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I'm here now, so it's not weird anymore. Look at these flowers. Baby's breath. What is this, County General?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You look very nice Mom. I like your dress.

speaker: EMILY
words: Cotton tablecloths, folding chairs. It's not supposed to be like this. In my day, people sat in real chairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, what's the matter?

speaker: EMILY
words: I wanted my granddaughter to be presented to society in a beautiful elegant ballroom, not a Shakey's.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The room is beautiful Mom. You're being too critical.

speaker: EMILY
words: There's Nan. I'm going to have a little talk with her about the proper height for a taper.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.
CUT TO PREPARATION ROOM
[Rory is sitting down reading when Libby walks over to her holding a flask.]

speaker: LIBBY
words: Midori sour?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no thanks.

speaker: LIBBY
words: More for me. At my last coming out, I shared with this girl who couldn't handle her booze. Neon green puke all over her white dress.

speaker: RORY
words: Your last coming out?

speaker: LIBBY
words: Oh, this is my fifth one this year.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LIBBY
words: You know, they say four out of five debs marry their escorts.

speaker: RORY
words: Kind of like the dentists with Trident.

speaker: LIBBY
words: Well I figure, five coming out balls, five escorts, one of them has to stick, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Good logic.

speaker: LIBBY
words: So, is your escort the one?

speaker: RORY
words: The one what?

speaker: LIBBY
words: The one you're gonna marry.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well…

speaker: LIBBY
words: Is he cute?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, he is very cute but…

speaker: LIBBY
words: Where are you guys planning to live when you get married?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, hold on a second.
[Another girl walks over]

speaker: LIBBY
words: Katie, hi. Too bad about your face.

speaker: KATIE
words: Is it horrible?

speaker: LIBBY
words: No, you can hardly tell. Just walk sideways.
CUT TO BALLROOM
[Lorelai is standing with some women.]

speaker: LADY 1
words: These things will be the death of me.

speaker: LADY 2
words: Oh I know. And we've had no time to prep. Janet just got out of Rainbow Hills two days ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rehab?

speaker: LADY 1
words: Fat farm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.
[Christopher walks up to Lorelai]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hi, sorry to interrupt. Could you come with me? My cumberbun and I aren't seeing eye to eye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Men, totally helpless. Excuse me.
[They walk away from the women]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You saved me. I love you. I wanna have your baby. Oops, too late.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I saw the look. Same one you had that time you ended up on homecoming court.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, someone's idea of a sick, sick joke. Hey, by the way, Neil Young's got nothing on you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.
[Emily walks over to them]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, have you seen your father?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, no.

speaker: EMILY
words: He promised me he'd be here by now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, you didn't come together?

speaker: EMILY
words: I swear, if he misses this…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Mom, did you call him?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes I called him. Of course I called him. I wouldn't go this long without calling him.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Emily, he's here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where? [he points to him] Oh. [walks to Richard] Richard, where have you been?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Where have I been?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, where have you been?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm here, aren't I?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't look. Did she beat him with the baby's breath?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, they're just energetically practicing their sign language.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, I think this is a really good time for a martini. Hello. Thirsty people here. [Lorelai goes behind the bar] Ah, what are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Steve won't mind.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Little tip. Never a good idea to let people know you're on a first name basis with the bartender. Wow, this is really something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You and I together at a debutante ball.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, yeah.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Just like it would've been sixteen years ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fancy dress.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sneaking booze.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Parents acting crazy.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You look great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm so glad you're here.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So am I.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: All fathers please report to the debutante staging area upstairs. Fathers to the staging area.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Showtime. You gonna be all right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'll see you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Curtsy pretty.
CUT TO STAGING AREA
[Rory's waiting in line. Dean walks up to her.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey. I just wanted to see you before you became a proper lady of society.

speaker: RORY
words: So what do you think?

speaker: DEAN
words: I think you look like a cotton ball.

speaker: RORY
words: Why, thank you Jeeves.

speaker: DEAN
words: But a really cute cotton ball.
[Libby walks up to Rory.]

speaker: LIBBY
words: Oh my God, is this your escort?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it is.

speaker: LIBBY
words: You are totally getting married. [walks away]

speaker: DEAN
words: What did she say?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well...[sees Christopher] Dad, great, let's go.

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll, uh, I'll meet you downstairs. Good luck. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Last chance to shimmy down the drainpipe.

speaker: RORY
words: Do me a favor?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Anything.

speaker: RORY
words: Just don't let me fall.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right back at ya.
CUT TO BALLROOM [The ball begins as a lady addresses the audience from a podium on the staircase. Lorelai sits at a table; Emily and Richard stand near the bar.]

speaker: LADY AT PODIUM
words: Good evening. On behalf of the Daughters of the American Revolution, I would like to welcome you to our annual debutante ball. Oh this brings back so many memories. I myself came out in this very hall in nineteen…well, let's just say, a number of years ago. Now the word debutante comes from the French word debuter, which means to lead off. . .[fades into background]

speaker: EMILY
words: Just come sit down.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am going to finish my drink.

speaker: EMILY
words: You won't be happy until you've spoiled this entire evening, will you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, guys, hi, there's a lady up there with a rock the size of Neptune around her neck talking about the debutantes of ancient Greece. It's a lot easier to fall asleep if you're sitting down, trust me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I will sit down when I'm ready to sit down.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, lower your voice.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I will not lower my voice. I paid a fortune to be here, and I will speak just as loudly as I like.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're embarrassing us. You're embarrassing Rory.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Embarrassing Rory? This wasn't Rory's idea. This was your idea. This whole ridiculous evening was your idea, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: You don't want your granddaughter presented to society?

speaker: RICHARD
words: To hell with society. [people look at him] Yes, I'm talking about you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, that's it.
[Lorelai leads them into another room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you two completely out of your mind? There is a ceremony going on in there. Young girls in ugly dresses and stupid fans are parading around in circles for God knows what reason, and you two are ruining it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I didn't want to come here. You knew I didn't want to come here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, that's too bad. We have a social responsibility Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am so tired of hearing you say that.

speaker: EMILY
words: People expect us to be certain places and do certain things and we can't just withdraw from all of that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Do you know what I'm going through at work?

speaker: EMILY
words: Your whole life isn't that damn company, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have told you what I'm going through, but somehow, you just don't seem to hear it. You don't listen to me. You don't listen to anybody.

speaker: EMILY
words: That is not true.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is true. Isn't it true? Has she ever listened to a word you've said?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, hey, people listen in different ways, right? I mean, some people listen with their ears, and some people listen with not their ears, but that doesn't mean some actual listening hasn't happened in some form.

speaker: EMILY
words: I have listened to you Richard. I know exactly what is going on with you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Really, what?

speaker: EMILY
words: You lost an account.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I didn't lose an account. I was taken off an account. I was taken off an account that I personally brought into this company ten years ago.

speaker: EMILY
words: There are other accounts, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have been in charge of that account for ten years!

speaker: EMILY
words: How can you be so angry? Yes, they took you off that account, but they also gave you a promotion.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: You said they moved you upstairs to a larger office and gave you a new title and a better parking space.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, dammit, I am being phased out.

speaker: EMILY
words: You are not.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What do you mean I'm not? I know whether I'm being phased out. I invented phased out for this company. Don't you think I did the exact same thing to Alan Parker?

speaker: EMILY
words: Alan Parker retired.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Alan Parker was phased out. I now have his office, I now have his parking space. Do you know what happens from here? I lose more accounts, slowly but surely. They will put a younger man on them with me to be trained by the best. And then, one day they'll call and ask me to let that young man take a meeting without me, just to see how fast he's learning, and then suddenly that young man is given that account. And this happens again and again and again until I'm nothing, but a symbolic figurehead that they roll out for banquets and group pictures. And then one day, Emily, I will be asked to leave.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, so what?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Excuse me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, I don't think Mom meant exactly…

speaker: EMILY
words: So what if that's true?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or maybe she did.

speaker: EMILY
words: There are other options.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don't want other options. I want to get up every morning and put on my suit, and go to my office, and do my work, like I've done everyday for the past thirty years. That's what I want to do. That's the only thing I want to do.
[Rory leans into the hallway.]

speaker: RORY
words: Um, excuse me, hi, sorry to interrupt, but I'm next.
[They walk back into the ballroom]

speaker: LADY AT PODIUM
words: Elizabeth Dotie, daughter of George Edward Dotie the fourth, and Elenor Dotie. [pause] Lorelai Gilmore, daughter of Christopher Hayden and Lorelai Gilmore.
[Christopher and Rory walk down the stairs as Dean waits at the bottom. Christopher kisses Rory's hand, Rory curtsies, Christopher walks away, Dean walks Rory down the aisle.]

speaker: EMILY
words: That should've been you up there. Nothing's turning out the way it was supposed to. [walks away]
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Later that night, Lorelai, Christopher, Rory, and Dean walk down the sidewalk.]

speaker: RORY
words: So did you know that you're considered a hot Dad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hah!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Libby said that it's too bad you're my real Dad because if you were my stepdad, I could steal you away from mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: That Libby's got a good life ahead of her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I was very proud of all of you. You made it through the entire ceremony with a completely straight face. Almost all of you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'm sorry, but that fan dance was more than I could take.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I need a burger.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too. Dean?

speaker: DEAN
words: Honestly, the only thing I can think of is taking off this tux.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, watch it, you're talking to a lady now.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, how about if I do it at home?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Better.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks again for going with me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Tomorrow you start paying. Bye. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. And then there were three.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Actually, I have to get back to Boston first thing in the morning so I'm gonna call it a night too.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Not even time for fries?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I'll tell you what. I'll get up a little early and have coffee with you before I go. Deal?

speaker: RORY
words: Deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, go ahead and order for us. I'll be there in a sec.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just wanted to tell you how amazing you were tonight. Really, you completely came through for her.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: She deserves it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I haven't always given you a lot of credit in the past, but I'm giving you credit now. Big credit. Major credit. Buy yourself a sofa.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thanks. I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, um, I happened to be looking through some old maps this afternoon and I couldn't help but notice that Boston is not that far away.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Aw, you needed a map to tell you that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I also noticed that that, um, I-84 is a very good road. Solid, paved.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I put this information in my pretty little head, I was thinking, if you wanted to maybe drop by occasionally, it wouldn't be too difficult.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You realize I'll be driving the Volvo?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, I'm coming around to the Vovlo.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. I think it's sort of a Catholic schoolgirl thing, you know? It's conservative on the outside, bad on the inside.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I like that image.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've also heard the I-84 can get jammed on the weekends.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is a tempting offer, but I really have to get back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To work?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: To work…and to someone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I know I should've told you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, that's fine. That's totally your business.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, I meant to, but…Lor, it's just that you and I are so connected and...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris, please, I get it. I think it's really great, I really do.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So who is it? Ooh, let me guess. Linda from marketing got to you, didn't she?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Her name is Sherri.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sherri from marketing?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sherri from Boston.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, hence the move.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it serious?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It's getting there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seeing you in just a bowtie serious?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: We're living together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you really have changed.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, well, Sherri made it pretty clear that I was gonna lose her if I didn't start getting it together, so...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well if you find a girl who's good with dating a square in a Volvo, you do what it takes to keep her.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, uh, so I'll. . .I'll see you back home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you will.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Rory is about to bite into her burger as Lorelai walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [gasps] Hey!

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: After all you've been through tonight and I come in here and find you eating like that.
[Rory raises her pinkie]

speaker: LORELAI
words: There you go.

speaker: RORY
words: Being a lady is hard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So tonight, what's the consensus?

speaker: RORY
words: The fan dance was humiliating, I'm never doing a curtsy again, but having Dad around was great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it was.

speaker: RORY
words: He's got a new girlfriend, you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sherri.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Poor girl's named after a Journey song, that's gotta be rough.

speaker: RORY
words: He seems happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He does. He really does.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me too.

speaker: RORY
words: I feel kind of bad for Grandma though. She was so into this night and then she ended up being so miserable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't worry. She'll have more fun at the next one.

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we have you signed up for the next six balls.

speaker: RORY
words: Not funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you're doing this until you bring home a prize.

speaker: RORY
words: Ignoring you now.
[Luke brings Lorelai her burger.]

speaker: LUKE
words: So, back from the ball huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I left behind a glass slipper and a business card in case the prince is really dumb.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good and desperate thinking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. Hmm, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?
[Lorelai nods towards Jess, who is wiping down the counter dressed like Luke, complete with flannel shirt and backwards baseball cap. Luke walks over to him.]

speaker: LUKE
words: What do you think you're doing?

speaker: JESS
words: Working.

speaker: LUKE
words: So you think this is funny, huh?

speaker: JESS
words: I'm sorry. I thought this was the uniform.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, you know what, that's fine. Have your little joke, you know. It doesn't bother me at all. You just go over there and clean off that table, okay? I'm ignoring you. You do not exist.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's it, get upstairs and change.

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever you say Uncle Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's Luke, just Luke. Mister Luke. In fact, don't address me at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I'm really lucky.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have someone to complain to when life sucks or work sucks or just everything sucks. I have someone I can talk to.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Shecky, you kill me. It just must be really lonely not to have that.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you thinking about Grandma?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just. . .thinking.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Emily is gardening on the back patio as Lorelai walks out the back door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, nothing much. I had a little time before my business class and I thought, 'Hey, why don't I just go over to Mom's house and just hang.'

speaker: EMILY
words: Just what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just hang, you know. Hang out. Talk, don't talk, whatever. Just hang.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you're gardening, huh?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well, don't let me stop you. I'll just sit here and just hang.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you sure you don't need something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nope. I'm just here to hang.

speaker: EMILY
words: Hang. Well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know Mom, if there's ever anything you want to talk about with me, you can.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. So…
THE END
OPEN AT LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory walk in and sit at a table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, busy today. Has Luke been advertising or something?

speaker: RORY
words: He gets good word-of-mouth.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we have to start spreading bad word-of-mouth so we can always have a table.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, that would be wrong, but sure. Vermin?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or no potable water.

speaker: RORY
words: Or no potable vermin.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That would scare them away.

speaker: RORY
words: Or confuse them away.
[Lorelai sees Luke talking with one of the customers.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's so weird to see him talking like that.

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just all friendly. He's usually only good for a quick couple of gruff monosyllables, and then he's off.

speaker: RORY
words: He is the master of the monosyllable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He never flirts with any of the women, do you notice that?

speaker: RORY
words: He's flirted with you numerous times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't start.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, flirt with him now, we need coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Luke, we're just dying for some refreshments.

speaker: LUKE
words: Keep your pants on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. He can turn it off and turn it on so fast.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I found a CD under the front seat of our car. Did you lose one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not that I know of, but I'm kind of sloppy with them.

speaker: RORY
words: So, you didn't hide it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why would I hide a CD?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Bay City Rollers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not a Bay City Rollers CD.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I know what's not hidden under that seat.

speaker: RORY
words: Ha! Because you know that Barry Manilow is under that seat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Where's Barry Manilow?

speaker: RORY
words: Under Mom's seat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, I confess, I was hiding Barry Manilow.

speaker: RORY
words: You confess!

speaker: LORELAI
words: But he was very big when I was very small and it's the live version where he does a medley of all the commercial jingles he's written.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't worry. Everyone's allowed a guilty pleasure now and again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, very diplomatic from the girl who had the Bryan Adams poster above her bed for two years.

speaker: RORY
words: Fink.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you have a guilty pleasure Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you into music?

speaker: LUKE
words: Sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Monosyllabic man strikes again.

speaker: RORY
words: We'll have two muffins please.

speaker: LUKE
words: You got it. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you think he's dated anyone since Rachel?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Where would he meet anyone? He's either here or in his apartment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe he has a secret life. Maybe he's got a little chippy stowed away in Mount Pilot.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, we'll know eventually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I say he's a bachelor for life.

speaker: RORY
words: I say there's someone for everyone. [starts laughing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Uhh, Barry Manilow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, stop.

speaker: RORY
words: [sings] Looks like we made it…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah? Spice Girls.

speaker: RORY
words: Duran Duran.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dido.

speaker: RORY
words: Olivia Newton John.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Macarena. You and Lane for hours and hours, for weeks on end.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, we were mocking. You can't mock the mocking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. It's getting ugly. Let's stop.

speaker: RORY
words: Let's be friends again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right.

speaker: RORY
words: [giggles]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop it.
[opening credits]
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Rory is in the kitchen, Lorelai walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Agh.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The car won't start.

speaker: RORY
words: What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. It's just dead. I turned the key and it makes a horrible sound.

speaker: RORY
words: What kind of sound?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like rrrar, rrrar, rrrar. You know, but less feminine.

speaker: RORY
words: That's the battery.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, what did I ever do to make the battery mad?

speaker: RORY
words: Let's see. You've kept the radio on all night, killing the battery. You've kept the lights on all night, killing the battery. You've kept the door open, which keeps the ceiling light on, all night, killing the battery.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well then I've done multiple things to make the battery mad.

speaker: RORY
words: You gonna walk?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm wearing heels.

speaker: RORY
words: Change your shoes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'd have to change my outfit.

speaker: RORY
words: Change your outfit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'd have to walk upstairs.

speaker: RORY
words: Suddenly I'm living with Zsa Zsa Gabor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna call Michel.

speaker: RORY
words: This thing is too small.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold on Michel. That backpack is not too small.

speaker: RORY
words: It's miniscule.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just take your schoolbooks and leave some of the other books.

speaker: RORY
words: I need all of my other books.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't need all of these.

speaker: RORY
words: I think I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Edna St. Vincent Milay?

speaker: RORY
words: That's my bus book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh. What's the Faulkner?

speaker: RORY
words: My other bus book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So just take one bus book.

speaker: RORY
words: No, the Milay is a biography, and sometimes if I'm on the bus and I pull out a biography and I think to myself, 'Well, I don't really feel like reading about a person's life right now' then I'll switch to the novel, and then sometimes if I'm not into the novel, I'll switch back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Still there Michel?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold on. What is the Gore Vidal?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that's my lunch book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh. So lose the Vidal or the Faulkner. You don't need two novels.

speaker: RORY
words: Vidal's essays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh. But the Eudora Welty's not essays or a biography.

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So it's another novel, lose it!

speaker: RORY
words: Unh uh. It's short stories.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. This is a sickness. Michel.

speaker: RORY
words: I am growing very old.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come pick me up?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I am already here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Put Carol on the desk and come pick me up.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I am not speaking to Carol. She ate my low-fat cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, come pick me up and I will buy you some cheese.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Low-fat cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Low-fat cheese.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Low-fat American cheese.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Low-fat American cheese.

speaker: MICHEL
words: And a meringue cookie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just get over here.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Ha! I made it all fit. Edna, Bill, Gore and Eudora, all safe and sound.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cool. That's your French book.

speaker: RORY
words: Hmm? Oh, I know. I'm carrying my French book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm. You so thought that French book was already in there.

speaker: RORY
words: I did not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have a problem.

speaker: RORY
words: No I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're gonna tip over from the weight of that backpack.

speaker: RORY
words: No I'm not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna have to buy you a forklift. Bye.
CUT TO CHILTON CAFETERIA
[Rory walks in carrying her lunch tray. She sits down at a table, puts on her walkman, and starts reading a book. A woman suddenly taps her on the shoulder.]

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: I startled you. I didn't mean to.

speaker: RORY
words: That's okay. I'm easily startled.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: I'm Mrs. Verdinas, the guidance counselor. Your name's Rory, isn't it? Rory Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes. Hello.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Hello. I'd love to sit and talk to you. Can we do that?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure. Anytime.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: How about after you finish your lunch?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, that soon?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: I think soon would be good.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, what's this about?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: We'll talk about it then.

speaker: RORY
words: Not even a hint?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: See you in a little bit.

speaker: RORY
words: Right. Right.
CUT TO MRS. VERDINAS' OFFICE
[Mrs. Verdinas is sitting at her desk; Rory knocks at the door.]

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Come in. Hello Rory, have a seat.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: So don't worry about being late for your next class. I'll write you a note if you are.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: I know from your record you're a stickler for punctuality.

speaker: RORY
words: I am a stickler, yes. I only slipped one time last year. I hit a deer. Actually, he hit me. Or she did. Or not me, my car. But, um, then he or she ran away, and I think it turned out okay. I didn't see it again, so I can't definitively say but I did look for him or her. It's a big story for me, I'm surprised I don't tell it better.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Why don't we get to the reason I asked you here?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Headmaster Charleston brought you to my attention a few weeks ago. He's worried, and after observing you a bit, I'm worried too.

speaker: RORY
words: You've been observing me?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: We've been concerned about your social behavior here at school.

speaker: RORY
words: What about it?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: You don't seem to interact much with the other students.

speaker: RORY
words: I do sometimes. In class, all the time.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: But rarely outside of class. At lunch, you're always by yourself.

speaker: RORY
words: That's when I catch up on my reading.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: And that walkman, it makes you very unapproachable.

speaker: RORY
words: You approached me.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: And you almost jumped out of your skin. What does that tell you?

speaker: RORY
words: That I'm jumpy. On the Fourth of July, forget it, I'm a wreck. And when the Stars Hollow orchestra begins to play in the gazebo, the guy banging the cymbals, I'm. . .it drives me nuts.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Denying a problem doesn't solve a problem, Rory. Unless something changes, this could affect your future.

speaker: RORY
words: But I don't understand. I get good grades, isn't that enough?

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: You know, it's not. Rory, when we make recommendations to universities on behalf of a student, that student's social skills are a big part of it. Now, I assume you want to go to a university?

speaker: RORY
words: Absolutely.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Well, universities do not look kindly on loners.

speaker: RORY
words: But I'm not a loner.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Really? Well, what do you think a loner is?

speaker: RORY
words: Loners are those guys that you see walking around wearing, I don't know, out of date clothing, bell bottoms, and they tend to carry a duffel bag with God knows what inside. That's a loner.

speaker: MRS. VERDINAS
words: Loners come in all different shapes and sizes, even pretty girls. Just try to improve Rory. Mix it up with others. You may even enjoy it. Start with lunch.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't suppose there's a lunchtime reading/walkman-listening club I can join, is there? I guess that's no.
CUT TO LORELAI'S FRONT YARD
[Lorelai and Rory sit on the porch as Kirk fixes Lorelai's Jeep.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what does she expect you to do?

speaker: RORY
words: She said mix it up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mix it up, what does that mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I guess that means going up to strange kids at school and saying, 'Hey, mind if I awkwardly butt in where I don't belong and don't want to be?'

speaker: LORELAI
words: The whole thing's ridiculous. Chilton is a cult.

speaker: KIRK
words: Lorelai, do you know what this is? [holds up a bundle of wires]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, no.

speaker: KIRK
words: Damn.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Maybe there is something wrong with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, don't say that.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe I am a loner. I mean, you were mocking my backpack today. I might just be one step away from carrying a mysterious duffel bag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, no you don't. Don't you go doubting who you are or how you should be. How dare that woman do this to you!

speaker: RORY
words: It wasn't just her. The whole meeting was Charleston's suggestion.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good. It's time I called on old Schnickelfritz Charleston to tell him to stop messing with my kid's mind.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I'm sorry. I don't like this. Schools like Chilton try to stamp out every vestige of individuality and I'm not gonna let that happen.

speaker: KIRK
words: It's all fixed. I found a loose terminal. I reconnected the battery and jumped it, so it's set to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thanks Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: And I'm not gonna charge you for the time I spent stuck underneath the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's great Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: And I just want you to know that I overheard, and you're absolutely right. I carried a duffel bag and ate lunch by myself my entire school career, and I turned out just fine. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm still going down there.
CUT TO CHILTON
[The secretary walks Lorelai into the Headmaster's office.]

speaker: SECRETARY
words: Ms. Gilmore is here. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello Mr. Charleston.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Ms. Gilmore, so good to see you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's good to be here.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You know, I checked my records to remind myself why I asked you in only to discover that you had actually called for this meeting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I did.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I'm surprised. We don't see you often. We'd forgotten what you'd looked like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I'm pretty much the same. Rosy cheeks, strong of bone, sly of wit.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: How nice. So why did you want to see me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I wanted to talk to you about Rory and uh, this ridiculous accusation about her being a loner and how that's somehow something bad.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Well, it is bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's not bad, it's just her. I raised Rory to do what she wants as long as it doesn't hurt anyone else. And I don't see how her reading a book or listening to a walkman is hurting anyone.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: It's hurting her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I respectfully disagree.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: That doesn't surprise me, based on my research.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What research?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: When I saw your name on the appointment list, I decided to have a look at the file.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah yes, Rory's file's been of a lot of interest to you guys lately, hasn't it?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I wasn't talking about Rory's file. I was talking about yours.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have a file?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You most certainly do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's tiny.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: It's very thin.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well that's good, right? It means I haven't gotten into a lot of trouble.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: On the contrary, a thin file for a parent indicates lack of participation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now wait a minute. I've participated in stuff.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You attended the bake sale.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I sold stuff.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Then promptly left.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was busy.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Without fraternizing with the other Chilton parents at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Busy, busy, busy like a really tall bee.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Like mother, like daughter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, hold on.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Ms. Gilmore, active participation in Chilton activities for a parent is vitally important.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But…

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: This is a list of organizations sponsored by Chilton. Parent groups dedicated to certain specific tasks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, my…

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Any one of them would be honored by your participation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, my schedule is…

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: We're all tremendously busy, Ms. Gilmore. I hope you're not too busy to do what's best for you or what's best for Rory, are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Excellent. Let us know what it will be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will. [stands up to leave] Oh, may I go?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Yes, you may.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I'm glad you came in today. It was a good idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. I'm just full of good ideas.
CUT TO LORELAI'S KITCHEN
[Lorelai sits at the table going through papers as Rory comes home.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, look Fat Albert. Get me a soda, will you?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, what are you doing here? You were supposed to meet me in my Latin class after meeting with Headmaster Charleston.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God. I was. I totally forgot. Ugh, I'm so sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, come on, what happened. Did you talk to him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did. I told him that he was completely out of line with this treatment of you, that you are not a loner freak, you have plenty of friends, and you don't own a long black leather Matrix coat, and they should fall down on their kneesocks everyday that you deign to show up at that loser school.

speaker: RORY
words: And?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then he yelled at me.

speaker: RORY
words: He what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He pulled out a file and told me I was a bad Chilton mom.

speaker: RORY
words: He did not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that I don't participate in school activities.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I don't make posters.

speaker: RORY
words: You have no artistic capabilities.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I don't chaperone school dances.

speaker: RORY
words: Does he know that you got pregnant at sixteen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Basically I'm not doing my part to help further your educational future.

speaker: RORY
words: So we both got busted.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now I have to pick a group or a cause or sponsor a club or something.

speaker: RORY
words: This sucks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But hey, I've been thinking. I mean, the whole reason we did this Chilton thing is for you to get into Harvard, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And these fanatics that run your school, they're the ones that write the letters to the fancy colleges saying things like, 'Hey she's keen, look at her' or 'Have you seen the L tattooed on her forehead, 'cause it sure is a big one.'

speaker: RORY
words: So you're saying we should just go along with this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, go along with it. Talk to some kids, I'll hang out with their moms, and we'll get into Harvard, take over the world, then buy Chilton and turn it into a rave club. What do you say, deal?

speaker: RORY
words: Deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look, the Chilton Cheer Society wear matching hats. Eh? Go Harvard.
CUT TO CHILTON CAFETERIA
[Rory walks in with her tray and is about to sit down at a table by herself, but then walks over to another table.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: There's a bad draft over there where I usually sit. It's kind of like a big downward gust. It's not exactly 'Toto, we're not in Kansas anymore', but it's still pretty darn uncomfortable, especially when you're just gotten your hair to behave. So can I sit here?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Uhh, yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks. [sits down] Nice table. It's much more level than the one over there.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Your name is Lori.

speaker: RORY
words: Rory.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Right, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: What's yours?

speaker: IVY
words: Francie.

speaker: RORY
words: You're Francie?

speaker: IVY
words: No, she's Francie, I'm Ivy.

speaker: RORY
words: Francie's spokesman.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Well, I am a very important person, and everyone knows very important people never speak for themselves.

speaker: RORY
words: I did not know that, but I do now.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: That's Dijur, Lily, Seline, Lana, Asia, Anna, and Lem.

speaker: RORY
words: Lem.

speaker: LEM
words: Short for Lemon.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sure.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: We were just discussing homecoming. Thoughts?

speaker: RORY
words: Great movie. Oh wait, that was Come Home. Sorry.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: I truly believe the whole homecoming dance ritual's be put to sleep.

speaker: IVY
words: Or at least assigned a new color scheme.
[Paris walks by with her lunch tray, walks back to stare at Rory for a moment, then walks away.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Hmm. Rory, huh? Do they call you Ror?

speaker: RORY
words: Not unless provoked.

speaker: IVY
words: No nickname?

speaker: RORY
words: Actually, Rory is a nickname. My full name is Lorelai.

speaker: LEM
words: Lorelai. That's a weird name.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, Lem, what can I say?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Sounds southern. Are you a belle?
[bell rings]

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, no, but apparently I command them.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Well, see you later your highness.
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Rory walks out of the cafeteria and runs into Paris.]

speaker: RORY
words: God! You're like a pop up book from hell.

speaker: PARIS
words: You were sitting with the Puffs. How did you do it?

speaker: RORY
words: The who?

speaker: PARIS
words: The Puffs, the Chilton Puffs. You were at their table and I wanna know how.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know, I just sat down.

speaker: PARIS
words: Nobody just sits down with them, you have to be invited.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, it's not the cosa nostra.

speaker: PARIS
words: No, they're the Puffs, the most influential sorority at Chilton.

speaker: RORY
words: Chilton has sororities?

speaker: PARIS
words: Only ten worth mentioning, and the Puffs, they have been number one for at least the last fifty years. My mother was a Puff, my aunt was a Puff.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought only colleges had sororities.

speaker: PARIS
words: And the connection you make with the Puffs, they last the rest of your life. My cousin Maddie got her internship at the Supreme Court because of Sandra Day O'Connor.

speaker: RORY
words: Sandra Day O'Connor was a Puff?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes. She was puffed in 1946, became the president in '47, and in '48 she actually moved the group to the very table you sat at today.

speaker: RORY
words: God.

speaker: PARIS
words: It was quite a controversial move at the time, but she was just that powerful.

speaker: RORY
words: I had no idea.

speaker: PARIS
words: What did you say about me?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: Did you tell them you hated me?

speaker: RORY
words: I didn't mention you.

speaker: PARIS
words: Because I have been killing myself trying to get invited in. I spent all of last year sucking up to Francine Jarvis.

speaker: RORY
words: You mean Francie?

speaker: PARIS
words: You call her Francie?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no, someone else did.

speaker: PARIS
words: I have helped her with her homework, secured her a prime spot in the parking lot, organized her locker, scrunched up the plastic strands on her pom-poms to make them fluffy. I have done everything except give her a manicure, and by God, if I had any talent with an orange stick, I would've done that too.

speaker: RORY
words: I know I'm not the first one to say it to you, but you're insane.

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay, look, I know you and me, we. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Shouldn't be around each other armed.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes. But you have to understand. I have to get into that group, I just have to. My family's name and reputation, not to mention my entire future, all depend on me getting into that group.

speaker: RORY
words: It's just a clique, that's all.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, all I'm asking is please don't say anything horrible about me. Don't tell them that you hate me.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, come on, I'm not in their group. They don't care what I say.

speaker: PARIS
words: They let you sit at their table all the way through lunch, you're in.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: You know what, never mind. Do what you want, I don't care.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory get out of the car and walk to the front door.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who the hell names their kid Lemon?

speaker: RORY
words: Someone really into citrus.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, crazy crazy people.

speaker: RORY
words: It's just so weird that the one table I sit down at is home to the secret society.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. It's like waking up one day and realizing that everyone else in your family can pull their face off.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, it's exactly like that.
[The maid opens the door]

speaker: MAID
words: Your mother would like you to head out to the patio. We're barbecuing tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.
[they walk inside and head towards the patio]

speaker: RORY
words: Does Grandma have a barbecue?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Maybe she keeps it in the secret room with the paper napkins and the mismatched sheets. Wow, she really is barbecuing.
[they walk out onto the patio, where a chef is cooking on the grill]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, cool!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's up, Poppin' Fresh?

speaker: RORY
words: Ooh, corn!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice!
[They each take a corn on the cob from the pile]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[they start eating the corn]

speaker: RORY
words: Mm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm.
[Emily walks out onto the patio]

speaker: EMILY
words: What is this, a refugee camp? Come inside and eat at the table.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, the whole point of barbecuing is to eat outside.

speaker: EMILY
words: Animals eat outside. Human beings eat inside with napkins and utensils. If you want to eat outside, go hunt down a gazelle. Make your decision, I'll be inside. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are the odds of finding a gazelle around here?

speaker: RORY
words: Slim to none.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, let's go.
CUT TO DINING ROOM
[Emily is sitting at the table as Lorelai and Rory walk in]

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm extremely disappointed in you Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold on Mom. [takes off her coat, sits down at the table, puts her napkin on her lap.] Okay, go ahead.

speaker: EMILY
words: I had lunch with Bitty Charleston today and she told me what happened with you and the headmaster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? Geez, does that woman do nothing all day but hide under his desk with a tape recorder?

speaker: EMILY
words: After all we've gone through to get Rory in that school, and then you humiliate all of us by not being involved. That is just incomprehensible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, she wasn't involved either.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, just sitting here.

speaker: EMILY
words: You are a grown up, you have to set an example. If she's not involved with school, then she learned it from you.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: How hard is it to help out just once in awhile? Join a group, attend a meeting, and all for the sake of…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, stop already, please. I have joined a group, okay?

speaker: EMILY
words: You have?

speaker: RORY
words: You have?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Which one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm gonna join the Booster Club, mmkay? The Booster Club, I'm going to boost.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, the Boosters are a very fine organization.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's why I picked 'em.

speaker: EMILY
words: They do very good work for the school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All went into the picking process.

speaker: EMILY
words: And the matching sweatshirts they wear are just darling.
CUT TO CHILTON
[At the Booster Club Meeting, five women are sitting at a table in the cafeteria.]

speaker: AVA
words: Well, we're certainly not doing it like last year.

speaker: GINGER
words: God, was that awful!

speaker: MENA
words: It wasn't that bad.

speaker: AVA
words: Wasn't that bad? Mena, by the time we got finished paying for everybody's stomach to be pumped, there was no money left to buy the new bleachers.

speaker: MENA
words: But the salsa band was wonderful.

speaker: GINGER
words: This is giving me a migraine. I just…

speaker: AUBREY
words: I vote we take a break.
[Lorelai walks into the room.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. Sorry to interrupt.

speaker: AVA
words: It's all right. Can we help you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yes, actually. . . this isn't the Booster Club, is it?

speaker: AVA
words: Yes it is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thank God you're not wearing the sweatshirts.

speaker: AVA
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you know what, never mind. I'm Lorelai Gilmore, sorry I'm late.

speaker: AVA
words: Oh please, you haven't missed a thing. So far, we've had coffee, debated Carolyn Masters' nose job…

speaker: MENA
words: Too pug.

speaker: AUBREY
words: Too smushed.

speaker: GINGER
words: Who cares?

speaker: AVA
words: And we started arguing about our fall fundraiser.

speaker: AUBREY
words: I suggested we take a break.

speaker: AVA
words: I ignored the suggestion, and now here we are. You're all up to date. Have a seat.

speaker: MENA
words: Lorelai Gilmore. So you're Emily's daughter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. You know my mother?

speaker: MENA
words: Oh, very well. We're on the philharmonic committee together. She told me to keep an eye out for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, that's nice.

speaker: MENA
words: She wasn't sure you'd show up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, uh, fall fundrasier, what do we do?

speaker: AVA
words: Well, last year we had the usual luncheon with silent auction and a salsa band.

speaker: MENA
words: A terrific salsa band.

speaker: AVA
words: But every guest ended up in the hospital with food poisoning before the auction even started, and we wound up losing money.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoops.

speaker: AVA
words: Yes, it's quite a whoops, isn't it? Anyhow, this year we decided to do a fashion show.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that sounds fun.

speaker: AVA
words: Yes, well, Aubrey here works at Saks.

speaker: AUBREY
words: Uh, used to work at Saks.

speaker: AVA
words: Oh, sorry. Used to work at Saks, and she got several designers to donate their clothes, so now we're just trying to find a suitable caterer and location and someone to plan the event.

speaker: GINGER
words: Oh, it's all going very well.

speaker: MENA
words: I still say we approach Chateau Mimsy.

speaker: AVA
words: That space is too small, Mena.

speaker: AUBREY
words: How about something more young and fun? You know, my stepdaughter Kimberly...

speaker: AVA
words: Sarah.

speaker: AUBREY
words: Right, Sarah. Sarah. Anyhow, she told me about this new club called The Digs…[fades into background]

speaker: MENA
words: [whispers to Lorelai] She's been married a month and still can't remember the names of her stepchildren.

speaker: AUBREY
words: …so the booths are like in these pits, and then there's sand everywhere…

speaker: GINGER
words: Stop her.

speaker: AVA
words: I don't think that's exactly what we're looking for.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, I run an inn.

speaker: AVA
words: You do?

speaker: MENA
words: Which one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Independence Inn, it's in Stars Hollow.

speaker: AVA
words: Oh, I've been there. It's lovely.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And we have a terrific chef who's never once hospitalized an entire function. And, well, I mean, I don't know exactly what you're looking for, but we do functions there all the time.

speaker: AVA
words: Who's your function coordinator?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am, actually. And since it's for charity, I could get you a really good price.

speaker: AVA
words: I'm sorry, I forgot to ask you, are you from heaven?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You like the idea?

speaker: AVA
words: I love the idea. I love it so much, we can finally take that break Aubrey's been dying for.
[Everyone stands up and walks away. Ava walks over to Lorelai.]

speaker: AVA
words: Well, this is very exciting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: AVA
words: Would you mind if I come out there tomorrow to take a look at the place? You know, make sure it's big enough for the runway.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, sure, I'll be there all day. So, a fashion show, huh? Are we gonna get any famous models?

speaker: AVA
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, to model the clothes. Any chance I'm finally gonna get to see Kate Moss eat something?

speaker: AVA
words: Oh, no no. We're the models.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We? Who's we?

speaker: AVA
words: We, the women in this room. Me, you, we.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me?

speaker: AVA
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well…

speaker: AVA
words: By the way, welcome to the Boosters. We're thrilled to have you. [hugs Lorelai]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, ugh, thanks. That's great.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are walking down the sidewalk]

speaker: RORY
words: Ha ha, yours is worse than mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, they totally just snuck that modeling thing in.

speaker: RORY
words: Hmm, my mom's a model. Maybe you'll get to date Leonardo DiCaprio now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Plus, now I have to plan the whole stupid thing.

speaker: RORY
words: Lorelai Gilmore. Nope, doesn't sound model-y enough. You need something that stands out more. How about Waffle? We could call you Waffle and say you're from Belgium?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [dials her cell phone] Okay, I'm crabby. I need to do something about it. [on phone] Hey Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I went to my first Booster meeting last night, did Bitty tell you?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, she did not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, maybe she's still stuck under that desk. You might want to send someone out there to look.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, it's certainly nice to hear you finally getting involved.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, in fact we're planning a charity fashion show next weekend, and I volunteered to organize it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, good for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and since I know how concerned you are about how Rory's perceived at Chilton, I knew you'd want to be involved somehow, so you're gonna be one of the models.

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, so it's next Saturday, be there at four, and we'll provide hair and makeup.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, you can't be serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, and we'll need your measurements also.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is ridiculous.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom. You said you wanted me to be involved. Well, I'm involved, now don't you want to do your part to ensure Rory's future?

speaker: EMILY
words: All right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Start measuring. [hangs up]

speaker: RORY
words: You feel better now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Waffle's very happy.
CUT TO CHILTON CAFETERIA
[Rory starts to sit alone at her regular table when Francie walks over to her.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Sit with us, please. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: Um, okay.
[Francie sits down at her table.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Here she comes.
[Rory walks up the Puffs' table]

speaker: LEM
words: Welcome.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: We talked. We find you fascinating.

speaker: IVY
words: Like the monkey habitat.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: So we've decided to extend an invite to you. You can eat here anytime you like.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, that's nice of you, thanks. So can I ask about this whole sorority thing?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Pardon?

speaker: IVY
words: Sorori-what?

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you guys were…

speaker: LEM
words: We have no idea what you're talking about.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: That's right. After all, what's the point of a secret society if it's not a secret?

speaker: RORY
words: The whole school apparently knows about it.
[Paris leans against the wall behind their table and reads.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Well, no one has proof. It's just folklore.

speaker: IVY
words: Like Snow White and Rose Red.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Or Mariah Carey's crackup.

speaker: LEM
words: Have you heard her fan message recently? She's fine and is currently staring at a really beautiful rainbow.

speaker: IVY
words: Survivor, hello.
[Francie sees Paris standing behind them]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Friend of yours?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris? Oh well…

speaker: IVY
words: Too intense.

speaker: LEM
words: Way too intense.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: She comes from a long line of us though.

speaker: IVY
words: I hate nepotism.

speaker: LEM
words: It, however, does make the world go round.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, Paris, while, yes, a little intense, is also very smart.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: So I drop a box of matches on the floor, she can tell me how many there are?

speaker: RORY
words: She's editor of the paper. Amazing writer, plus funny.

speaker: IVY
words: She's funny?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah. Hilarious. I mean, the times that we have spent laughing together. I tell ya, she's a regular Gary Muledeer.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: She asked you to talk her up, didn't she?

speaker: RORY
words: No, not at all.

speaker: IVY
words: Right.

speaker: RORY
words: No, really. I think she's actually thinking of joining another non-existent group.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: What?

speaker: IVY
words: But her family's fully puffed.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know. Maybe I heard her wrong, but I think that's what I heard her say.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: A voluntary defector.

speaker: IVY
words: Francie.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: I know. [turns to Paris] Paris?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: I think the wall can hold itself up just fine, don't you?

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: You should sit.

speaker: PARIS
words: Sit?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Here.

speaker: PARIS
words: Sit there?

speaker: IVY
words: Or here.

speaker: LEM
words: Or anywhere for that matter.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well…

speaker: RORY
words: Unless you've got somewhere else to be. Another table, perhaps.

speaker: PARIS
words: Another table?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: No, you have to sit, right here. Come, come. [moves down to make room for Paris]

speaker: PARIS
words: Uh, okay. I guess I can sit, for a little while anyhow. [sits down]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Okay, so, have we discussed homecoming yet?

speaker: IVY
words: Not to my knowledge.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: I truly believe the whole homecoming dance ritual's be put to sleep.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[The day of the fashion show, Lorelai walks through the lobby over to Michel at the front desk.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, in the dining room, and don't drip water on the floor please. Michel, did the…

speaker: MICHEL
words: Five minutes ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about the…

speaker: MICHEL
words: He brought the wrong color, I sent him back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? When will he be…

speaker: MICHEL
words: Twenty minutes tops, or I told him I will hunt him down and shave his beard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, now we need the uh…

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, yes, thank you for reminding me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything…

speaker: MICHEL
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, I'm going in the dining room. Come and get me if you actually need me to finish a sentence for you.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Will do.
CUT TO DINING ROOM
[Lorelai walks in and goes over to the man fixing the runway.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how's it coming?

speaker: MAN
words: Working on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This cannot tilt.

speaker: MAN
words: I know this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Women in heels will be walking on it. Make it not tilt.
[Sookie walks out of the kitchen]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The lettuce is dry.

words: What does that mean?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How attached are you to salad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's free to see anyone it wants.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don't want to make a salad with dry lettuce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's the alternative?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can make soup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did we pay for the lettuce already?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, we did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See if you can put it in the soup.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Gotcha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.
[Luke walks in carrying his toolbox.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, thank God! You brought Bert.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My men, follow me.

speaker: LUKE
words: By the way, you do tell people that you're the one that named my toolbox, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Toolbox, dirty.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh geez.
[they walk to the man fixing the runway.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, um, move.

speaker: MAN
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want Luke to look at it.

speaker: MAN
words: Hey, I put this thing together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and I loved your work in Pisa, now get out of the way, please.
[the man walks away]

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, so what seems to be the problem?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh ha! The problem is. . .that's not funny.

speaker: LUKE
words: I like it when you're stressed. Oh man, he put this thing up all wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can you fix it?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know, I'll see.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can fix it.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can say it all you want, it doesn't make it true.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can fix it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not with you hovering, I can't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'm leaving. You can fix it. [walks away and sees Ava] Oh, Ava, hi.

speaker: AVA
words: God, the place looks wonderful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. Let me show you to the room where we're all getting ready.

speaker: AVA
words: All right.
[As they walk towards the changing room, they pass Luke]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fix it yet?

speaker: LUKE
words: The moron used the wrong supports.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please tell me you can fix it.

speaker: LUKE
words: If I told you I couldn't fix it, would you accept that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can fix it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. So we're right back here…[Ava stops to stare at Luke] Uh, Ava, the room's right back here.

speaker: AVA
words: Him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who?

speaker: AVA
words: There, man with tools, who is that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's Luke.

speaker: AVA
words: Luke, I like Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: AVA
words: Oh, he's adorable. And he looks strong, is he strong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh I don't know. I don't think he's gonna be in a sideshow anytime soon, but he can get the lid off a pickle jar.

speaker: AVA
words: Is he single?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh yeah, he is single.

speaker: AVA
words: What kind of women does he like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know, ones with heads. You know, I don't really know what Luke's taste in women is.
[Emily walks into the dining room]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, um, Ava, why don't you go on in the back, go to the right, you'll find the dressing room, I'll be there in a sec. [Ava leaves] Hi Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: The place isn't nearly done yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Mom, why don't you just go on in the back and get ready.

speaker: EMILY
words: Did you see the clothes? What am I wearing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. I just had them hang them up in the room

speaker: EMILY
