words: God, I hope they're not tasteless or zebra striped or spandex.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, one good way to find out is to go on back and take a peak.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to get ready too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll be there in a sec.

speaker: EMILY
words: If I'm doing this, you're doing this. I mean it.
[Emily walks in the back, Lorelai walks over to Luke.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh! You fixed it!

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup, for the time being, but I'm gonna stick around for awhile just to make sure nothing happens.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: You don't want me to stick around?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't say that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Is there a reason I shouldn't stick around?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you listening? It's fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: Because I'm just doing this for you. I mean, if this thing goes and someone breaks their neck…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, stick around.

speaker: LUKE
words: All right, if you insist.
CUT TO DRESSING ROOM
[Women are walking around getting ready. Lorelai walks in and over to Emily.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Why aren't you dressed yet?

speaker: EMILY
words: I was waiting for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, my God, you're a paranoid woman.
[Emily walks to the lady handing out clothes.]

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm Emily Gilmore.

speaker: LADY
words: [hands her a garment bag] Okay, here you go. Where's Lorelai Gilmore?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, right here.

speaker: LADY
words: You two are together. [hands her a garment bag]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LADY
words: You're the mother-daughter team.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no I'm…

speaker: LADY
words: I have outfits for one mother-daughter team, your names are on the outfits, you're it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [unzips the garment bag] Ugh! Oh my God!
CUT TO FASHION SHOW
[A lady at a podium begins the fashion show.]

speaker: LADY
words: I want to welcome you here to the Chilton Booster Club's Annual Fall Festival Fundrasier, where all the proceeds from the evening go directly into the refurbishing of the Chilton auditorium. But enough about the kids. Tonight is about us, and without further ado, ladies and gentlemen, Saks presents a fabulous fall fashion extravaganza.

[Music starts and ladies start walking down the runway. After a few models, Emily and Lorelai walk down the runway together wearing similar red outfits. They do several identical turns and motions, then walk off.]
CUT TO INN'S DINING ROOM
[After the fashion show, Lorelai, Emily, and 2 women are sitting at a table talking about the show.]

speaker: MENA
words: Well, I must say, this was definitely better than the salsa band.

speaker: GINGER
words: Oh, people loved it, did you hear them? God, who picked that music?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, that'd be me.

speaker: GINGER
words: It was terrific. The whole thing was terrific.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, thank you.

speaker: MENA
words: Oh, and hiring that actor to play a horrible, rude, annoying Frenchman. What a riot!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, I thought that'd be fun.

speaker: GINGER
words: You know, if you plan all these damn things, we wouldn't have to have anymore of those stupid meetings.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh come on. Don't you want to see how long it actually takes Aubrey to finally learn that kid's name?

speaker: GINGER
words: Eh, you're right. Okay, I'll see you at the next meeting. Great job, really. It's the best event we've ever had.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well thanks Ginger. Bye Mena.

speaker: MENA
words: Buh bye.
[Ginger and Mena leave.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you looking so ha-ha about?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not looking ha-ha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you are.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right. Whatever you say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on Mom, fess up.

speaker: EMILY
words: Big success tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seemed to be.

speaker: EMILY
words: The ladies were thrilled. They adore you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, that's because I'm adorable.

speaker: EMILY
words: Funny isn't it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What's funny?

speaker: EMILY
words: How nicely you seem to be fitting into the world that you ran away from. Well, goodnight Lorelai. Congratulations. [leaves]
[Lorelai looks around and gives a slightly sad look as she sees Luke talking to Ava]
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Rory is on the couch reading as Lorelai comes home from the fashion show.]

speaker: RORY
words: Is that you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nope.

speaker: RORY
words: How was it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, fine. It ran smoothly, and the food was amazing. Michel only made three people cry.

speaker: RORY
words: How was the fashion show?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you know, I walked up and down the ramp, looked pouty and sexy, now I'm ready for rehab. I brought you some Booster cake.

speaker: RORY
words: Put it in the fridge please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: How's Grandma?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, mmm, good.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm assuming that's your piece of cake and mine is safely in the fridge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, you're cute.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh. So what'd you wear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look at the time. I'm going to bed.

speaker: RORY
words: Nobody took a picture of you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, no. Can you believe that?

speaker: RORY
words: You're holding onto that purse mighty tightly there missy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, I really love this purse.

speaker: RORY
words: You have pictures in there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You calling your mother a liar?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, well, that's why I ate your cake.
[Lorelai hands Rory the purse, Rory takes out some pictures]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: You look like Nancy Reagan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now how is that nice?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't believe this. You look so completely different. Elegant, understated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well I was wearing underwear with propellers on them if that makes you feel any better. I'm going to bed.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll send the Secret Service up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, uh, by the way, I would put on your good pajamas, you know, the cute ones with the cakes on them. And brush your hair and put on a little lip gloss.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're being kidnapped tonight. [goes upstairs]

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me? [follows her]
CUT TO LORELAI'S BEDROOM
[Lorelai walks in followed by Rory.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got a call today from Francie.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, she said that she and her friends were gonna come in while you're sleeping, wake you up, kidnap you and take you out to breakfast in your pajamas.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would they do that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Apparently it's fun.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, that doesn't sound fun.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She told me to leave a key under the mat and some money on the coffee table.

speaker: RORY
words: And you said yes to this insanity?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I told you not to become a soc, but you didn't listen.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't believe that you are going to let a group of strange girls come traipsing in here and take away your only child, your precious baby girl, and off to God knows where in the middle of the night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If it's someplace with doughnuts, bring me one, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.
[Lorelai starts looking at her modeling pictures. Rory grabs them.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh! Hey!

speaker: RORY
words: Christmas Cards.

speaker: LORELAI
words: More like your grandmother every day!
CUT TO LIVING ROOM
[Rory is sitting on the couch reading when she hears a car pull up out front.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, my kidnappers are here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, have fun.
[Rory turns out the living room light, goes into her room and pretends to be sleeping in her bed. A few seconds later, several girls with flashlights walk in.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Hit the lights.

speaker: IVY
words: I can't find it.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Shh.
[lights go on]

speaker: ALL
words: Surprise!

speaker: RORY
words: What's going on?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Rise and shine.

speaker: IVY
words: You can grab shoes, but no socks.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh wow, this is totally unexpected. I'm completely surprised.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: You looked it.

speaker: IVY
words: Okay, let's move. We've still got a couple more girls to get.
[all the girls but Paris walk out]

speaker: PARIS
words: So, that's how you look when you've just woken up?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, yeah.

speaker: PARIS
words: Nothing in my life is fair.
CUT TO CHILTON
[The Puffs are leading several blindfolded girls, including Rory and Paris, through the halls.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Okay, just a little further.

speaker: GIRL
words: [bumps into lockers] Ow!

speaker: IVY
words: Shh!

speaker: GIRL
words: Sorry.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Okay, that's far enough. Ladies, here on the spot, tonight in this place, where so many others have come before you, we invite you to join us.

speaker: IVY
words: Ladies, remove your blindfolds.

speaker: RORY
words: We're at Chilton.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Keys please.

speaker: RORY
words: What are we doing at Chilton?

speaker: PARIS
words: Will you please be quiet. We are being puffed.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: What you are about to do and what you are about to say will remain forever between the members of the Puffs and only the members of the Puffs.
[She unlocks the door. Everyone goes inside except for Rory, Paris and another girl.]

speaker: RORY
words: This is the headmaster's office. How did she get the keys? I'm sure he didn't give them to her.

speaker: PARIS
words: Stop it. We are making very important social contacts here.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I'm not looking for social contacts. I have friends. I'm fine.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, how nice it must be to be you. Maybe someday I'll stumble into a Disney movie and suddenly be transported into your body, and after living there awhile, I'll finally realize the beauty of myself. But until that moment, I'm going to go in there and I'm going to become a Puff. Now get out of my way.
CUT TO HEADMASTER'S OFFICE
[The girls stand around his desk as Lem lights a candle.]

speaker: FRANCIE
words: The historical bell of Chilton, 120 years old. Every member of the Puffs has stood here under the cover of night to pledge her lifelong devotion to us. 'I pledge myself to the Puffs, loyal I'll always be, a P to start, 2 F's at the end, and a U sitting in between.'

speaker: RORY
words: Anne Sexton, right?

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Once you've finished your oath, you will ring the bell three times.

speaker: IVY
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: IVY
words: You first.
[Rory steps up to the desk.]

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I pledge myself to the Puffs…

speaker: IVY
words: You have to hold the candle.
[Rory picks up the candle]

speaker: RORY
words: I pledge myself to the Puffs, loyal I'll always be…

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Sing out Louise.

speaker: RORY
words: A P to start, 2 F's at the end, and a U sitting in between.
[Rory rings the bell twice before the office doors burst open]

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I wouldn't do that again Miss Gilmore.
CUT TO HEADMASTER'S OFFICE
[All the girls are sitting down in the office as the Headmaster lectures them.]

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Disappointment, disillusionment, frustration, astonishment. I suppose you could say I am experiencing all of these emotions. Finding some of Chilton's best and brightest acting in such a destructive, immoral and illegal manner will make all of us think long and hard about the manner in which we are educating you girls. But that is all in the future. How do we handle this now? Well, suspension will be considered, detention and extra credit to maintain your current GPA standing will be a given.

speaker: RORY
words: This is unbelievable.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: What was that, Miss Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: No, I distinctly heard you mumbling something in a rather disgruntled tone, I'd like to know what it was.

speaker: RORY
words: I said this is unbelievable.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: And why is this unbelievable Miss Gilmore?

speaker: RORY
words: Because I didn't even want to be here in the first place.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Oh, now Miss Gilmore…

speaker: RORY
words: Things were going fine, my grades were good, I joined the paper. My routine was down.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Your routine was…

speaker: RORY
words: And I have friends. I have a steady boyfriend, and my mother and I are freakishly linked, and Lane and I have been best friends since kindergarten. But you don't see that because I don't live in this town, and if you don't see it then it must not be true. And you call me in here to lecture me because I'd rather read at lunch then endlessly discuss the euthanasia of homecoming.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You're reading had…

speaker: RORY
words: You told me and you told my mother that I needed to socialize, and if I didn't, it would be frowned upon and it would hurt me getting into Harvard.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Well, yes, we did say that.

speaker: RORY
words: So, I did it. I sat down at a table, a random table.

speaker: FRANCIE
words: Random?

speaker: RORY
words: And the next thing I know, I'm being pulled out of my bed in the middle of the night and I'm blindfolded and then before I know it, I end up here with the Ya-Ya Sisterhood, reciting poetry and lighting candles, and now I'm gonna be suspended because I was trying to do what you told me? What's fair about that?

speaker: SECRETARY
words: Headmaster Charleston, the parents are starting to arrive.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Thank you Mrs. Trager. All right ladies, we'll continue this conversation tomorrow and for many days after that. You may go. Miss Gilmore, I think that maybe you and I should talk some more. [the other girls leave]

speaker: RORY
words: About what?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: About the fact that though I do feel it is important that students socialize, possibly we may have been a little hasty to judge in your case.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? So does that mean that you might reconsider my suspension?

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: You're an excellent student. You deserve to go to Harvard. I wouldn't want to stand in the way of that. We'll talk tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
CUT TO HALLWAY
[Parents are picking up their kids. Lorelai walks down the hallway over to Rory.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What happened? The reception on the phone sucked, and all I heard was 'Rory' and 'Chilton' and 'get down here.' Who's butt do I have to kick?

speaker: RORY
words: We didn't go to breakfast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: We came here. They broke into the Headmaster's office as the big initiation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, those stupid girls.

speaker: RORY
words: Mm hmm. Part of the initiation was ringing a bell. So that's what I was doing when security showed up and they called you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's what you got busted for, ringing a bell?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it? Bell ringing?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, were you at least smoking a Cuban cigar while you were doing it?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean, bad girl. How many times have I told you not to ring bells?

speaker: RORY
words: Let's go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They can dent or scratch and they make dogs crazy. Who do you think you are, the hunchback of Notre Dame? Are you French, are you circular, I don't think so.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm walking to the car now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, hold on. How much trouble are you in? Should I go talk to the Headmaster?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I think it's gonna be okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Aw, was it a big bell at least?
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai walks in and sits at the counter.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, good party yesterday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, not bad.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I like the new look. It was very high-class substitute teacher.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Exactly what I was going for.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, to go.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, uh, I feel a little weird even mentioning this to you.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yesterday I saw you talking to Ava, you know, she's in my booster club?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I know who she is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good. Well, good. So anyhow, I saw you guys talking alone and it seemed kind of private, and she mentioned earlier that you didn't make her, you know, gag, so I just figured you guys were making some sort of plans to hang out. And see, the thing is, I just think it would be a little weird if you started dating a Chilton mom. Look, I know I have no right to say anything to you, but it's just, um, if you did date her, well, I'm in the Booster Club with her, which means that I'll hear things, and I don't know, it's just, I'd like to keep that Chilton life separate from my Stars Hollow life, so if there's any way that you could not date her, that would be really great.

speaker: LUKE
words: Boy, I tell you, you've got nerve.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well, I know this is your private business.

speaker: LUKE
words: It is my private business.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't see any validity to my side at all?

speaker: LUKE
words: I am a grown man. You cannot tell me who to date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not telling you who to date, I'm telling you who not to date.

speaker: LUKE
words: You can't tell me that either.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look…

speaker: LUKE
words: I will date who I like, and if that screws with your plans, then sorry. And if you don't wanna hear things, then don't listen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But…

speaker: LUKE
words: If you don't like it, you can just deal with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'll just deal with it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just thought that if something was going to affect our friendship in some way that you might care about that, because if the situation was reversed, then I would care, but hey, that's me, and so…go ahead, date her, marry her, make her Mrs. Backwards Baseball Cap, live happily ever after, see if I care. [starts to leave]

speaker: LUKE
words: And by the way, I wasn't asking her out. I was giving her directions for the quickest way back to Hartford. It was very romantic. I said you take a right at Deerfield, and you catch the I-5 and you take it south. Oh man, hot stuff.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so typical of you.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is not the quickest way back to Hartford. Everybody knows that you take Maine to Cherry to Lynwood and then grab the I-11. Everybody knows that Luke. Everybody, apparently, but you! [leaves]
CUT TO CHILTON CAFETERIA
[Rory walks in, sits at a table alone, puts on her walkman, and starts reading her book. A girl walks over to her.]

speaker: GIRL
words: Do you mind?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no.

speaker: GIRL
words: Thanks.
[The girl sits down with her lunch and starts reading. Rory smiles and continues reading.]
THE END
OPEN AT ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai, Rory and Emily are eating dinner.]

speaker: EMILY
words: How's the meal?

speaker: RORY
words: Tasty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very tasty. New cook?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Marisella. She's introduced us to some wonderful dishes so charmingly specific to her native country.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What country is she from?

speaker: EMILY
words: One of those little ones next to Mexico.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How charmingly specific.

speaker: RORY
words: Too bad Grandpa's not here. He likes weird food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, where's he eating his weird food tonight? Argentina? Morocco?

speaker: EMILY
words: Akron.

speaker: RORY
words: Ohio?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get out of here.

speaker: EMILY
words: I will not get out of here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Mom, I didn't mean really get out of here, I mean…

speaker: RORY
words: Why is Grandpa in Akron?

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was just a saying.

speaker: EMILY
words: They sent him to deal with some problem with their local office down there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A saying, you know, like 'save me' or 'get me out of here'. Things like that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, would you like me to put a mirror in front of you so you can look at yourself while you have this conversation?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry, Dad's in Akron.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes. The amenities are atrociously lacking. He had to eat at a coffee shop last night. The whole thing's terribly insulting. He's miserable.

speaker: RORY
words: I hate that he's miserable.

speaker: EMILY
words: So do I. We really ought to do something.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I agree.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Warning, warning.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm glad to hear you say that Rory, because I thought of a wonderful way to cheer him up.

speaker: RORY
words: Cool, what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Danger, Will Robinson, danger!

speaker: EMILY
words: An oil portrait of you for his study.

speaker: RORY
words: An oil portrait.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I tried, have fun.

speaker: EMILY
words: It could hang right over his mantle. He'd just love it.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I guess that would be okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Mom, please, don't make her do this.

speaker: EMILY
words: She just said she would.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, paint the picture, but don't make her sit and pose for it. Paint it from a photo.

speaker: EMILY
words: A photo? That's what they do at malls.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll sit, it's fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: Just because your own experience sitting for a portrait was bad doesn't mean Rory's has to be.

speaker: RORY
words: What portrait? I haven't seen this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They never finished.

speaker: EMILY
words: Three painters started, and they all three quit.

speaker: RORY
words: Why did they quit?

speaker: EMILY
words: She wouldn't stop scowling.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was going for a Billy Idol thing.

speaker: EMILY
words: The one from Italy had some sort of breakdown.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, it didn't hurt Van Gogh, the guy should thank me.

speaker: EMILY
words: A year later, I swear I saw him rummaging through our recyclables.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I'm happy to sit. If it's for Grandpa, why not?

speaker: EMILY
words: Wonderful. I'll set it up first thing in the morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Psst. If you want, I can teach you the Billy Idol. Most people focus on the lip thing, but the eyes are just as import...
[Emily slams the salt shaker on the table. Lorelai stops talking.]
OPENING CREDITS
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Luke are sitting at a table talking.]

speaker: LUKE
words: So, the first thing you and Sookie would do is incorporate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Sounds so big time.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not really. It just means you're a single business entity. You'll both be officers and shareholders, and you'll get to make up a name for your company and everything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmm, I'm terrible at coming up with names. When we first bought out house, Rory and I wanted to name it, you know, like Jefferson named his place Monticello, but all we could come up with is The Crap Shack.

speaker: LUKE
words: Nice.
[Jess walks over with a coffeepot]

speaker: JESS
words: Coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, thanks. How are you Jess?

speaker: JESS
words: Well, I'm not bleeding or anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then it's gonna be a good day, huh?

speaker: LUKE
words: So?

speaker: JESS
words: So do you want me to go to school or do you want to openly defy child labor laws?

speaker: LUKE
words: Go. Stay out of trouble.

speaker: JESS
words: Guess that means calling off the chickie run down at the salt flax.

speaker: LUKE
words: Out. [Jess leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, so much love.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, you guys have a site in mind for the inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Great, where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You've seen pictures of it. The Rachel property.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just meant, Rachel took the pictures, and the pictures kind of got us into the place, so we started calling it the Rachel property 'cause it made sense at the time and then it became a habit. But now out of respect for you, I'm gonna stop repeatedly using her name and uh, think of another name to call it. Let's see, The Crap Shack's taken.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's okay. Call it what you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, who taught you about all this business stuff? Your dad?

speaker: LUKE
words: Please. My dad didn't even have a checking account until I finally got taller then he was. He bought this land with cash from working construction, built this place himself. Didn't have a bookkeeper, an accountant, or anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, so you had no one showing you the ropes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope, I figured I had to just dive in on my own, fail if that's my destiny, and forget what the experts say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is exactly my philosophy. Exactly. Except I'm not diving in on my own, I'm diving in with Sookie, and, uh, failure is not even a choice of destinies, and I'm consulting any expert who will listen to me. Otherwise, it's identical.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I should be getting going. You gonna write this meal off?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, we talked business. You gotta be thinking about these things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean, why? I'm not paying for it. [Luke sighs] Exactly.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're gonna do fine.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Lorelai and Sookie are talking in the kitchen as Michel walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It shouldn't be too flashy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: How about something historical, like 'The Paul Revere'?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that could work.

speaker: MICHEL
words: What could work?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're thinking up names for the inn we're gonna open.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I mean, if you want simple, something like 'The Country Rose'.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's pretty good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We could line the front path with multicolored roses.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or. . or 'The Inn by the Hollow'. Kind of long.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, but nice.

speaker: MICHEL
words: How about 'The Money Pit'?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Boo.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Or 'The Outhouse'. Go international.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Go back in your hole.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Or 'The Inn Heading for Bankruptcy'. Kind of long, but nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You who have no dreams rain on those who do.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I say this because I care about you. It's risky what you are doing. Most new businesses go down within two years.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I say if we go down after two years, it'll be the most exciting two years of our lives.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Same here. Boredom stinks.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Fine, proceed blindly. [hands Lorelai some papers] Here, it came in ten minutes ago. It does not involve the Independence Inn, therefore delivering it was beyond my official obligations, so I am taking an extra long lunch break. [leaves]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He's so genuine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's the title search for the Rachel property. And guess who owns it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Tell me it's not that bastard Donald Trump.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fran.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Fran from Weston's Bakery?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweet little Fran, the cupcake lady. Not some cigar-chomping, dirty dealing city slicker.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh! That's good. Hey! 'The Country Slicker.' Funny name, cutesy idea…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, it's a little much.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's way too much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll call Fran.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: 'Fran's Old Place'! It'll be like Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. People will be trying to figure out who Fran is. Or 'The In Inn'! It's like an inn that's in with the in crowd. . .I'm gonna go sit down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do that sweetie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay.
CUT TO OUTSIDE DOOSE'S MARKET
[Taylor walks down the sidewalk to his store. Right in front of it, there is a chalk outline of a body on the sidewalk surrounded by police tape.]
CUT TO BAKERY
[Lorelai is sitting at a table as Sookie walks in and sits down with her.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey, I'm so sorry. Am I late late or just late?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Two pieces of carrot cake and a rumball.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ah, I am so sorry! I swear I meant to be on time, but I was prepping the raspberry glaze for tonight's dessert special, and it struck me. I made a blueberry glaze for the soufflé I made last Tuesday, and this is Tuesday, and a lot of locals come every week on the same night every week, and I just didn't want to serve them some. . .like a similar dessert even though it's a completely different berry. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need another rumball.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ah, I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you're a perfectionist, and that attention to detail is why people call you the Maestro.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Really? Who calls me that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The people who eat the rumballs.
[Fran walks over to their table.]

speaker: FRAN
words: So ladies, how are we doing here?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, we're doing great Fran.

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh, well that's wonderful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fran, could Sookie and I talk to you for a couple minutes?

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh, of course. Marjorie can handle things. [sits down] Oooh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fran, are you okay?

speaker: FRAN
words: Aw, it's this bum hip. It needs to be replaced, again. And I have this awful angina.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, we're so sorry to hear that.

speaker: FRAN
words: So, I know you didn't come here to listen to me gripe, so tell me what's on your mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well Fran, we understand that you own the old Dragonfly Bed and Breakfast, that whole property out there.

speaker: FRAN
words: Why, yes I do. It was my parents' business.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's a beautiful place.

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh, it used to be. But it's in such disarray now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is, and that's kind of why we're here. We'd actually like to buy it.

speaker: FRAN
words: Buy the Dragonfly?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we'd like to buy it and make it beautiful again, and we're prepared to make you an offer right now.

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh my, well this is a surprise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See, Sookie and I are gonna start our own inn and we've been searching for the perfect place.

speaker: FRAN
words: Your own inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh how wonderful! You are going to be so successful.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Thanks Sweetie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That means so much, like we have your blessing.

speaker: FRAN
words: But I can't sell you the property.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come?

speaker: FRAN
words: I just couldn't. You know, I have no siblings and no children and in a ways, that place is really the only family I have. I'm the last Weston left, so I plan to own it forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Forever?

speaker: FRAN
words: Forever and ever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a very long time.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A very long time.

speaker: FRAN
words: I'm so sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fran, may I ask. . . um. . .

speaker: FRAN
words: Go ahead honey, ask me anything you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, what happens to the place if you. . .well, if forever isn't quite forever?

speaker: FRAN
words: I don't understand dear. All I know is that I can't sell the place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, I don't mean selling it. I mean, you would keep it forever, but what happens once you're no longer in the position of physically controlling the property?

speaker: FRAN
words: How could that be?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well, if you um, if you…

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Take a long vacation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, take a long vacation. Thank you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And when you're on that long vacation, the property is just left sitting there. Well, what happens then?

speaker: FRAN
words: Oh, I don't enjoy vacations. I toured the California gold country ten years ago, it was hot and the bus smelled.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I mean a longer vacation than a trip to California.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: To a different place.

speaker: FRAN
words: What kind of place?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A place out there.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Way out there Fran.

speaker: FRAN
words: Europe?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean the ultimate long vacation.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, Francie, eventually, we're all gonna take the same long vacation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And with that being the case, you might want to sell the property now and enjoy the money.

speaker: FRAN
words: I'm very sorry, but I can never sell the place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well thanks for your time Fran.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, thanks Fran.

speaker: FRAN
words: Bye now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Bye.

speaker: FRAN
words: You both look so sad. Would you like a cupcake?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah.

speaker: FRAN
words: Good.
CUT TO SIDEWALK
[Rory and Lane are walking down the sidewalk in Stars Hollow.]

speaker: LANE
words: So, Janie Fertman's trying to be my friend again.

speaker: RORY
words: Yikes. What kind of vibe are you giving her?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, my patented Keith Richards circa 1969 'don't mess with me' vibe, with a thousand-yard Asian stare thrown in.

speaker: RORY
words: That should do it.
[They see a police car and a large crowd down the street in front of Doose's market]

speaker: RORY
words: What's happening up there?
CUT TO OUTSIDE DOOSE'S MARKET
[A crowd has gathered around the chalk outline.]

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Just try to calm down Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Calm down! Why should I calm down?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Yeah, why should he calm down?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I want action not words.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Yeah, action not words.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Don't you need to get back to your newsstand, Bootsy?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: No buddy, I'm all yours.

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: We're gonna get to the bottom of this, I promise you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: A crime was committed right in front of my store.

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Now, we can't say that for sure yet.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: How come you can't say that for sure? This is a police tape. You're the police, you own the tape!

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Taylor, we've contacted everyone in the precinct. No one knows anything about this.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, what am I supposed to do? I've got a dead body right in front of my store!

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: No, you have a chalk outline of a dead body in front of your store.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Meaning that there were two crimes.

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: What?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: What do you mean what? Somebody got murdered, then somebody stole the body. It's open and shut, bing bang boom.

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Is this your son?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I should say not.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Oh.

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Look, my partner's doing a headcount to see if anyone in town is missing. Until then, just hang tight. [leaves]
[Rory and Lane walk up to Dean in the crowd.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: What's going on?

speaker: DEAN
words: I don't know. I got here and this is what I found. I mean, I told him it looked fake, but he didn't believe me.

speaker: RORY
words: And you have such an honest face.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, he must not love me as much as you do.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, you two are officially sickening. [leaves]
[The policewoman walks up to Taylor]

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Everyone's accounted for Taylor. It looks like this is just an elaborate prank.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: But it looks so real. Where'd they get the police tape?

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Kids have their ways.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Who'd be depraved enough to pull a stupid prank like this?

speaker: POLICEWOMAN
words: Hard to say.
[Rory sees Jess standing across the street smirking as he watches the crowd]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Rory is sitting at a table doing work, Lorelai is getting coffee, Sookie is cooking.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, you're not writing what you purchased on the back of any of the inn's credit cards receipts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, just put cooking spray and sponges.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. And when an auditor wants to know why you need such large amounts of cooking spray and sponges?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then I drop my pencil and I put the scoop neck sweater that I'm now making a mental note to wear to good use.

speaker: RORY
words: Well at least you've got a solid well thought out plan.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I had a dream last night about us and Fran.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, what was it?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, it was in the future and we were all old, you and me and Rory and Jackson and Michel, everyone. Gray hair, walking around with canes, we're all kind of ailing, you know? I had those big cataract glasses on. You were hard of hearing and kept going, Huh? Huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's attractive.

speaker: RORY
words: Its you kids with your rock and roll.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But wuh-ho, here walks up Fran, and guess what. She looks exactly the same, even better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! That's not fair.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That woman is gonna live forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not necessarily. Hey, did you look up angina? I forgot to.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, it's nothing major.

speaker: RORY
words: You guys have got to stop talking like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: RORY
words: We love Fran, remember? Fran is great.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, honey, of course we love Fran. We just wanna know what God's little plan is for her, that's all.
[Michel walks into the kitchen]

speaker: MICHEL
words: I would advise at least pretending to look busy, the boss is here.

speaker: RORY
words: Mia!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding! When?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I just spotted her walking in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's go.
CUT TO LOBBY
[Lorelai and Rory walk out from the kitchen over to Mia.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mia!

speaker: MIA
words: Uh! Oh my babies! Ooh! [hugs them]

speaker: RORY
words: Did we know you were coming?

speaker: MIA
words: I didn't know I was coming.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This isn't a surprise inspection is it?

speaker: MIA
words: That's exactly what this is. Ready? Oh, you're too thin as always.

speaker: RORY
words: But we eat.

speaker: MIA
words: And you're both too beautiful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, that's true. We often feel guilty monopolizing the amount of beauty we're in possession of.

speaker: MIA
words: And I don't see you enough which is my fault, so you both pass.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww.
[Michel walks over to them]

speaker: MIA
words: Ooh Michel. Ooh, how nice to see you. Uh, and look at that suit. You are quite the dandy, aren't you?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, I had a feeling that a lovely woman was going to be visiting today so I decided I must look my best for her.

speaker: MIA
words: I'm sorry honey, I didn't catch a word of that.

speaker: RORY
words: He said he missed you.

speaker: MIA
words: You've been in the U.S. quite some time Michel, your enunciation really should be better by now.

speaker: MICHEL
words: The customers seem to understand me just fine.

speaker: MIA
words: I didn't get that either. Did you get the tapes I sent you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, maybe you should hit the desk. A couple of people are looking for help.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Right away. Mia, uh, I. . . [salutes and walks behind the desk]

speaker: MIA
words: So, are you too busy to sneak out with me for a walk?

speaker: RORY
words: Not if it's okay with the boss.

speaker: MIA
words: It's a demand at this point.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's go. Michel, hold down the fort?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh, it's a little slow now, so it's no problem.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, he says that he's never liked you and that you're a problem.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I said no such thing!

speaker: MIA
words: I don't know where this hostility comes from. Can we work this out?

speaker: MICHEL
words: There's nothing to work out.

speaker: RORY
words: He told you to get out.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I did not!

speaker: MIA
words: I don't know what I did to make him hate me.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Luke is at the counter fixing a toaster as Lorelai, Rory and Mia walk in]

speaker: MIA
words: Look at this place, it's exactly the same.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, I made him paint it a few months ago.

speaker: MIA
words: Well, good for you.
[Luke walks over and hugs Mia]

speaker: LUKE
words: Mia hey!

speaker: MIA
words: Nice to see you Lucas.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're the only person in the world who can call me that, Mia.

speaker: MIA
words: I know this.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm saying it for others who plan to try it later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whatever Lucas.

speaker: LUKE
words: Mia, you know anything about toasters?

speaker: MIA
words: Not a damn thing.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, then sit down and let me get you some coffee.
[Luke goes to get coffee as they sit down at a table.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Mia, how's living in Santa Barbara?

speaker: MIA
words: Horrible. Did you know the damn sun shines all the time out there?

speaker: RORY
words: They've written songs about that.

speaker: MIA
words: Well, no one told me that's how it was. Half of my wardrobe is obsolete.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, drag. Hey, you know that vintagey blue coat?

speaker: MIA
words: You're not getting it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.
[Jess walks up to Luke, who's fixing the toaster again.]

speaker: JESS
words: You're making that worse.

speaker: LUKE
words: Big help, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke's nephew.

speaker: MIA
words: Luke, that's your nephew?
[Luke brings their coffee to the table]

speaker: LUKE
words: It's Liz's kid. Jess, this is Mia, she owns the Independence Inn.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's 'Hello, nice to meet you' in slacker.

speaker: JESS
words: You don't need me down here, do you? [leaves]

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm sorry Mia. He's just…

speaker: MIA
words: Oh please, forget it. You weren't exactly a talkative boy yourself when you were his age.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right, you knew Luke as a boy.

speaker: RORY
words: I can't imagine Luke as a boy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Can we change the subject?

speaker: MIA
words: He would help people carry groceries home.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, how very Boy Scout-y of you.

speaker: MIA
words: For a quarter a bag.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, how very John Birch Society-y of you.

speaker: MIA
words: He was never without his skateboard for a time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Were you any good?

speaker: LUKE
words: I could hold my own.

speaker: MIA
words: And there was that year you wore the same shirt everywhere you went.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't remember that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Must have been something flannel.

speaker: MIA
words: No, it was from that TV show. That famous one.

speaker: LUKE
words: It's not important.

speaker: MIA
words: Star Trek, that's it!
[Lorelai and Rory laugh]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, oh my God!

speaker: LUKE
words: Stop it.

speaker: RORY
words: You were a Trekkie?

speaker: LUKE
words: I was not a Trekkie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh uh, I do believe that denying you were a Trekkie is a violation of the prime directive.

speaker: RORY
words: Indubitably captain.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was a gift from my aunt, I wore it to make her happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I've never wanted to make any aunt of mine that happy.

speaker: MIA
words: Did I say something I shouldn't have?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no Mia, that's okay. I just have to cancel everything I have scheduled for the next three months 'cause I'll still be laughing my ass off.
[Taylor walks into the diner.]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Luke, I need to talk to you right now.

speaker: LUKE
words: What is it Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I have conducted a thorough investigation of all the people who may have inadvertently been witness to the phony murder at my store last night.

speaker: MIA
words: There was a phony murder?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, the town's too dull to work up a real murder.

speaker: RORY
words: But you're one 'beam me up Scotty' reference away from being the victim of one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Luke, are you going to listen?

speaker: LUKE
words: What's this got to do with me?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Three people have reported seeing Jess in that area late last night, skulking, lurking.

speaker: LUKE
words: There were a lot of people out late last night. I know because I fed some of them. I'll give you their names so you can add them to your suspect list.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Another person witnessed Jess walking out of an arts and crafts store two days ago with what appeared to be chalk.

speaker: LUKE
words: You appear to be bugging me Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What are you gonna do about it Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: About what?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: About the results of my investigation.

speaker: LUKE
words: Absolutely nothing, but thanks for the info.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You have to do something. People want action.

speaker: LUKE
words: People, meaning you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Not just me. I speak for the Stars Hollow Business Association, the Stars Hollow Tourist Board, the Stars Hollow Neighborhood Watch Organization, and the Stars Hollow Citizens for a Clean Stars Hollow Council.

speaker: LUKE
words: All of which are you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: So are you going to act.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes I am. I'm gonna act like you never came in here.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Fine, have it your own way. But I warn you, there's gonna be a lot of unhappy people at S.H.B.A., the S.H.T.B., the S.H.N.W.O. and the S.H.C.C.S.H.C.

speaker: LUKE
words: F-I-N-E.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, you're. . .you're impossible, you are impossible! [starts to leave] Oh, hi Mia.

speaker: MIA
words: Nice to see you Taylor. [Taylor leaves] Ah, I gotta get out of Santa Barbara. I miss the small town theater. And I miss you. Hey, do you realize it was fifteen years ago almost to the day?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it was.

speaker: RORY
words: What was?

speaker: MIA
words: To the day when this skinny little teenage girl showed up at the inn. She had this tiny little thing in her arms.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little thing named Rory. [pinches Rory's cheeks]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, no physical reenactments.

speaker: MIA
words: You marched up to me, looked me right in the eye and said, 'I'm here for a job. Any job.'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, IBM had turned me down for the CEO slot, so I was desperate.

speaker: MIA
words: Work experience none, recommendations none, skills…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Besides flawlessly applying mascara in a moving car, none.

speaker: MIA
words: Not one thing to recommend hiring her. Just that…how do I put it and remain a lady…that 'who cares' look in her eyes, so I gave her any job. The other maids hated you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well they were all so slow.

speaker: MIA
words: You were special.

speaker: RORY
words: Mia, why don't you move back here? We miss you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or at least visit more? You used to check in. You never come at all.

speaker: MIA
words: I don't have to. You've made me redundant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have not.

speaker: MIA
words: Don't be humble. The inn is beyond covered. It's never run this well or been this successful. That inn is like your place now. Without you I wouldn't know what to do, I'd be lost.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lost, yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: MIA
words: You look sad now, why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, nothing.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Sookie is cooking while Lorelai talks to her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: In all the excitement, I hadn't thought about telling Mia. What is wrong with me?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nothing is wrong with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel terrible. I should've told her before. I should've told her the day the idea occurred to us. She deserved that. [phone rings] After all she's done for me. [answers phone] Hello?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, your daughter's being impossible. She won't pose in an appropriate manner.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm trying to Grandma. It's just awkward.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let me guess how you're posing her. She's in a silly gown on a silly chair with both of her hands raised in some silly way.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, just the one hand is raised, and none of it's silly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pick a simpler pose, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: This is the simplest, and it wasn't my choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And your choice is…

speaker: EMILY
words: I wanted the swan to sit regally aside Rory's throne.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Swan? Throne?

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, now you have a problem with swans and thrones.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because swans and thrones scream one thing Mom, Siegfried and Roy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Make a change Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I suppose you'd just have her sitting in a chair reading a book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now that sounds great.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, be serious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am. That's a completely natural pose for Rory. And a painting of her reading that's gonna be hung in Dad's study seems just crazy enough to work.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, maybe it's not such a bad idea.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give it a try. And let her lower her arm.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, you can lower your arm.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.
[swan honks]

speaker: EMILY
words: I think he's just hungry. We're going to lose the swan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good going Mom. Bye. [hangs up] Ugh. So how do I do this? How..how…how do I tell Mia that I'm leaving?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Get her drunk first?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I can't believe it. I'm gonna let down the one person in my life who was there for me when I needed it the most. I'm great, aren't I?
[Mia and Michel enter the kitchen]

speaker: MIA
words: I wanted to put it on the front desk but I think it might be a tad short.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, we could get a carpenter to build up a base and raise it up two inches and then it would be perfect.

speaker: MIA
words: Great idea. Hey, I got that, every word!

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes!

speaker: MIA
words: Oh, oh, I'm so proud!
[Michel and Mia leave]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So you gonna tell her now or later?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Later, because she's so happy that she can finally understand Michel and that the lamp is fixed and that...

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [clucks like a chicken]

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that too.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai, Rory, and Mia walk down the street towards Miss Patty's]

speaker: RORY
words: We're late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're not late.

speaker: RORY
words: The last time we were late, Taylor said that there would be consequences.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did not. He said there would be severe consequences.

speaker: RORY
words: Mia, what time is it? Are we late?

speaker: MIA
words: I hope so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mia!

speaker: MIA
words: I'm sorry, but it's been two years since I've gotten to go to a town meeting and I want some controversy.
[Lorelai sees Luke in front of the diner, locking up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aha!

speaker: LUKE
words: Geez! Don't sneak up on me like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, boy, I was lucky you had your phasers on stun, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, at least we're not late. Luke's never late.

speaker: LUKE
words: Actually, we're 2 minutes early.

speaker: RORY
words: Ha! We should get a prize for being on time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, let's go back to the diner and get some pie as our reward for being on time.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then you'd be late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A funny conundrum, but I want pie.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're harassing me now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not harassing you. We're your groupies. [in high voice] Oh Luke, you're so dreamy, be my guy!

speaker: RORY
words: [in high voice] No, be my guy!

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm bringing up the need for more police protection at this thing.
[they walk into the town meeting, which has already started]

speaker: MIA
words: I think we're late.

speaker: LUKE
words: What's going on here?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Uh, nothing.

speaker: LUKE
words: Meeting was supposed to start at eight Taylor, it's a minute to eight.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well...

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, you might as well be honest with him Taylor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Be honest with him about what?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, if you must know, there was a special issue that the business community had to deal with first, so we decided to start early tonight.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm in the business community and I wasn't told about it. Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: All right, fine. You weren't invited Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: And why is that?

speaker: MIA
words: Controversy.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You weren't invited because we are dealing with the Jess situation.

speaker: LUKE
words: The Jess situation?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh. If this was the wild west, we'd be pushing the horse aside and diving into the water trough right about now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Dammit Taylor!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Luke, honey, calm down.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: After all, this is all your doing. If you hadn't so cavalierly dismissed the issue, we wouldn't have had to do this. I lost business because of what your hooligan nephew did.

speaker: LUKE
words: How was business lost Taylor? If you had to open a little late that day, your customers just came back later.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Not so. When Mrs. Lanahan couldn't buy her head of lettuce that morning for her lunch, she drove straight to Woodbury to buy lettuce from a competing market. Isn't that right Mrs. Lanahan? Mrs. Lanahan?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You really shouldn't be driving anymore.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Word has it that she was telling other Doose market shoppers that Woodbury lettuce is crisper. That's business flying out the door.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay fine. How much is a head of lettuce, a buck? Oh, let's go crazy, give me five heads.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This goes well beyond a head of lettuce, young man. The charges against your nephew are numerous. He stole the 'save the bridge' money...

speaker: LUKE
words: He gave that back.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: He stole a gnome from Babette's garden.

speaker: LUKE
words: Pierpont was also returned.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: He hooted one of my dance classes.

speaker: FRAN
words: He took a garden hose from my yard.

speaker: MAN
words: My son said he set off the fire alarms at school last week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I heard he controls the weather and wrote the screenplay to Glitter.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I think it's time for me to pipe up here.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, that'll be good.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I have every right to pipe in here Luke. I'm a local entrepreneur.

speaker: LUKE
words: You took over your father's newsstand Bootsy, it doesn't make you an entrepreneur.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: And you took over your old man's hardware store.

speaker: LUKE
words: And turned it into a diner.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Big whoop. Who can't fry an egg?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Let's keep it moving here boys, huh?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I never liked the look of that kid from the second I saw him.

speaker: LUKE
words: Unbelievable.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Excuse me, but I've got the floor.

speaker: LUKE
words: You don't have the floor.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I'm standing, aren't I?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well I was standing first which means I have the floor and I'm not giving it to you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What is with you too?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: This goes way beyond the Jess matter Taylor. Luke's been on my case since the first grade when he wrongfully accused me of sabotaging a clay imprint that he made of his hand.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh! Think hard, was he dressed like Sulu?

speaker: LUKE
words: No one cares about the stupid clay hand Bootsy. And you stomped on it while it was drying. Three kids saw you.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: No I didn't.

speaker: LUKE
words: You did too!

speaker: BOOTSY
words: No I didn't.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Boys, please. The bottom line here is that there is a consensus among townspeople who are in agreement that Stars Hollow was a better place before Jess got here.

speaker: LUKE
words: So this half of the room gets the tar, and the other half gets the feathers?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, there hasn't been any talk of tar and feathers. Although…

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, I've lived in this town my entire life, longer than most everybody here.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I beg to differ. I'm five weeks older than you, that means I've been here five weeks longer.

speaker: LUKE
words: I've never bothered anyone. I've kept to myself and I've done the best I could. I pay my taxes, and I help people when I can. I haven't pitched in on the decorative pageantry town stuff because it all seems insane to me, but I don't get in the way of that stuff either.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What's your point, Luke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: His point is…do you mind?

speaker: LUKE
words: Be my guest.

speaker: LORELAI
words: His point is, that if there's a problem…

speaker: LUKE
words: And I'm not saying there's a problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, he's not saying there is a problem, but if there it, give him time to deal with it before you storm his diner with torches and pitchforks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right. What I'm dealing with, being a problem, that I don't necessarily agree that I even have.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I didn't get that last part.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lay off him because what you're all doing stinks.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm done here. I'm done with all of you. Oh, and I was gonna stay open later in case anyone wanted to eat after the meeting. Forget that. [leaves]

speaker: BOOTSY
words: His turkey burgers are very dry.
CUT TO OUTSIDE MISS PATTY'S
[Lorelai, Rory and Mia walk out of the town meeting.]

speaker: MIA
words: Well, I must say that was quite exciting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A little disturbing. I think the whole town needs a field trip.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you think Luke's okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think he will be. He just needs to cool off a little.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I'm gonna go check on Dean. He's been scraping that outline off the cement for two days now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good idea. There's nothing like your face on his to make the cleaning process go faster.

speaker: RORY
words: She's all yours Mia.

speaker: MIA
words: I'll take her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye hon. [Rory leaves]

speaker: MIA
words: Oh, I am just having the most wonderful time. And I am so proud of you and Rory. You both have just come so far.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we have. Um, Mia, I need to talk to you about something.

speaker: MIA
words: Of course. What is it, honey?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, um, it's really hard, and uh, I should've brought it up ages ago, but Sookie and I are thinking of making a change.

speaker: MIA
words: A change?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're going to open our own inn.

speaker: MIA
words: Oh!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, we've talked about it for a long time and it seems like the time is right and…Oh Mia, I love the Independence Inn and Sookie loves it too and we both love you so much.

speaker: MIA
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it just feels like something we need to do and…you hate me.

speaker: MIA
words: No I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm letting you down. I'm walking out. I'm being ungrateful.

speaker: MIA
words: Lorelai, stop. Do you think I was naïve enough to think that you'd work for me forever? You and Sookie have more talent for this business than I do. And I'm very good. You're going to open an incredible place, and if you don't let me help you in any way I can, then I'll be very mad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course, we need your help. We'd be lost without your help.

speaker: MIA
words: Good. I was just wondering, what's the time frame for this big move?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, we're waiting for this perfect location to free up, that's all that's delaying us. But I promise you'll have plenty of notice and I'll be there to find our replacements and train them.

speaker: MIA
words: Oh yes, that's very sweet of you, but I'm wondering if you could possibly make it sooner rather than later?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MIA
words: Well, you see, your leaving gives me the perfect excuse to finally sell the place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sell the place?

speaker: MIA
words: Oh, I get offers all the time, lucrative ones, but I never even considered it because. . . oh, of course I love the inn, but I just couldn't do that to you. And now that you have this big change coming up in your life, it might be time for one in mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Good, uh, good. Then it all works out good.

speaker: MIA
words: Actually, it's very good!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Well…good.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai sits at a table in the lobby organizing placecards as Sookie walks over to her with a piece of paper]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey. So I'm working on the menu for the Duncan wedding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't read that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know. I had it all typed up nice and neat to begin with but on the drive into work, I got an inspiration. I just started crossing it out and writing in the new stuff. And it ain't easy writing and driving, and…I can't read that. What is that - cumin?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, I can't read that either.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh. I'll just get you a new one. Hey, how did your talk with Mia go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine. Good. She took it like you said she would - classy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She is classy. Good, good. That's a relief. It is a relief right? I mean, you said she took it good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes she did.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But you look upset.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's gonna sell the inn.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You're kidding.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, she said she gets offers and she thinks this might be kind of fortuitous timing for her.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, great, so everybody wins, that's good. Look happy. Okay, this does not look happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just don't understand how she can do this.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What's the big deal?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The big deal is…she's not gonna sell it to another Mia. It's gonna be a big chain, and they'll come marching in with their business models and their corporate approved architects and designers, and change everything around and remodel, and the place will lose all its personality and charm.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I hope they don't do that, but hey, our place is gonna be full of charm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you don't care what happens to this place?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Of course I do, but it's not up to me. I mean, I can't control that. The only thing we can control is what our inn's gonna be like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I guess.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You guess what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We'll see.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We'll see what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's just a little short sided to just write off this place when we haven't even bought Fran's yet and, hey, we don't know if we will.
[Lorelai walks to the dining room, Sookie follows her.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We don't? Why wouldn't we? Lorelai. Is this about Fran's life expectancy because I…

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Sookie, it's about the fact that we haven't even looked at any other places and we don't know if that's necessarily the right one and we have to be very practical about this.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But it's the perfect location. We all said so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you can't get emotionally attached to any of our decisions about the inn. This is business. You've got to stay detached.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But we are all so not detached. But…okay, do you have another location in mind?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not really.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Do you wanna look for a new location?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, like I have all this time to go looking for other locations.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I don't know. Should we try to buy this place?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aha. This place is five times what we can afford.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So what do we do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. It's on hold, I guess.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, it's been on hold for years. We were moving forward.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, I'm looking at the economy right now and I'm thinking, I don't know if the timing's good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, that's not fair because I don't know anything about the economy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well then good thing you hooked up with me because it's not looking good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, what happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean, what happened?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We had a vision, we had a plan. You're the one that got this whole ball rolling again, and I jumped on the ball, and then we were rolling on the ball together and then you hopped off the ball, and I'm still on the ball. And I'm confused, 'cause I see it, and I see our vision, and you saw it too up until today!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I know you would like things to be simple and straightforward but unfortunately things are more complicated.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, that's why we'd be partners. If something gets too heavy for the one person, the other one's there to pick up the slack.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well that's great in theory, but I gotta tell you, my back is aching from all the extra slack I'm taking up!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What did I do that's so wrong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's not get into this stuff.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, get into it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you're not the most reliable person in the world or the most punctual.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You've always known that about me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but now, getting into business, it's not so cute. It could hurt us. I mean, you were late for the Fran meeting, you're constantly changing every menu you ever set, even after you've started making it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don't believe this! Before it was kudos to me for my attention to detail. I was the maestro.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's fine for an established place like the Independence, but you do that stuff at our place, it could wipe us out. Profit margins in a new business are slim, Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Just stop. Just stop. Now you're talking down to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not talking down to you, I'm trying to explain.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes you are. Yes you are, and I don't know why you are, but I don't want to start crying in front of you because it'll just give you one more thing to point at to say, 'Look, she's too emotional and she's too weak for me to go into business with,' so I'm leaving. And I'll see you tomorrow, if I can remember to show up.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Rory and Dean are walking down the street.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, I gotta drop by the market.

speaker: RORY
words: But it's your day off.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, it's to get my paycheck. If I don't get it by four, Taylor locks it in a safe and it's on some kind of timer and then when I complain, he lectures me about promptly putting checks in the back and the theories of compound interest, and then my head hurts from all the nodding I do even though I don't listen…

speaker: RORY
words: Go, go!

speaker: DEAN
words: I'll just be a minute.
[Dean walks into the market. Rory waits outside. Jess walks up to her.]

speaker: JESS
words: Should you be standing here all alone? I hear this is a pretty dangerous corner.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm fine.

speaker: JESS
words: Feeling succinct today?

speaker: RORY
words: Pretty much.

speaker: JESS
words: Hmm. Did I do something to offend?

speaker: RORY
words: Me?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: You might want to ask that same question to Luke though.

speaker: JESS
words: Meaning?

speaker: RORY
words: You've got this whole town down on him.

speaker: JESS
words: Really? How did I do that?

speaker: RORY
words: You know how you did that.

speaker: JESS
words: I'm not really familiar with the blue book laws in this town, so you can be talking about a lot of things. Dropping a gum wrapper, strolling arm in arm with a member of the opposite sex on a Sunday. [Rory gestures to the chalk outline] Ah. What about it?

speaker: RORY
words: You did it. The whole town knows you did it. They had a meeting about it.

speaker: JESS
words: You actually went to that bizarro town meeting? Those things are so 'To Kill a Mockingbird.'

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I went. And Luke went. And when he got there, everyone ganged up on him. They all want you gone.

speaker: JESS
words: Wow, bummer.

speaker: RORY
words: And he's standing there yelling at everyone and defending you and paying Taylor back for his lettuce losses…

speaker: JESS
words: Wait, his what?

speaker: RORY
words: And now Luke's a pariah and it's all because of you! What a shock, you don't care about any of this.

speaker: JESS
words: I didn't say that.

speaker: RORY
words: Go. I'm tired of talking to you.

speaker: JESS
words: Fine. [starts to walk away]

speaker: RORY
words: You care nothing about Luke and his feelings!

speaker: JESS
words: Got a second wind, huh? [walks back over to Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: All he does is stick up for you and all you do is make his life harder. I guess that's what you have to do when you're trying to be Holden Caulfield but I think it stinks. Luke has done a lot for my mom and a lot for me, and I don't like to see him attacked. Okay, second wind over.

speaker: JESS
words: I didn't know they were coming down so hard on him.

speaker: RORY
words: Funny, I never pegged you as clueless, my mistake.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay. I get it. No, no, I do, I get it. So did you at least think it was funny?

speaker: RORY
words: That is so not the point.

speaker: JESS
words: Ah, you thought it was funny.
[Dean walks out of the market]

speaker: DEAN
words: I got it. Oh, uh, hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Um Dean, I don't think you two have met. This is Jess. This is Dean.

speaker: JESS
words: Boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: Of course.

speaker: JESS
words: Sorry, you didn't say. How ya doing?

speaker: DEAN
words: Good, good.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, see you around.

speaker: JESS
words: Seems to turn out that way, doesn't it?
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory walk up to the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: I wonder if Grandpa's still in Akron?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well for Akron's sake, I hope he's moved on to Boise. [rings doorbell; the maid answers] Hi. We're the daughter and the granddaughter.
[they walk inside]

speaker: RORY
words: You are majorly crabby.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just have a headache.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh Good! Come, come, come, it's all done, and it's great.
CUT TO STUDY
[they walk in and Emily shows them Rory's portrait]

speaker: EMILY
words: Tada.

speaker: RORY
words: Whoa.

speaker: EMILY
words: What do you think?

speaker: RORY
words: It's freaky.

speaker: EMILY
words: Freaky?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, just seeing me here, up on the wall like that, it's uh. . . I like it though. It's good, I guess. I should probably take myself out of the judging process.

speaker: EMILY
words: I think Richard's just gonna love it. It's the perfect thing, don't you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: You've got to admit, it turned out better than you thought it would.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, come on, say a little more than that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's great Mom, it's fabulous. It's just a notch below Rembrandt.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, you don't have to take that attitude.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you want from me? I'd light some sparklers and jump up and down yelling 'Yay for the painting' but I'm fresh out of sparklers and my feet hurt too much to jump. But I promise next week when I have more energy, I'll write a love song for the chandelier.
[Emily leaves the room]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.
[Lorelai follows Emily]
CUT TO KITCHEN
[Lorelai walks over to Emily]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how dare you walk away from me when I'm being a world class jerk to you. The painting's great Mom, really.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I really like it. It's so natural that she's reading which is great, and she's not sitting next to a goose or a giant tortoise, which is good, and Dad is gonna love it. It's a good thing you did here.

speaker: EMILY
words: You can be so harsh sometimes, and I just don't know where it comes from or what I've done to deserve it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did nothing.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I must've done something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I've been...it's just been a bad week. Sookie and I were moving forward with plans to open our inn, and we had huge fight. And we've never had a huge fight, let alone a fight, and awful things were said and it all started when Mia showed up for a visit and I told her about our plans and she's talking about selling the Independence Inn and it just wigged me out a little. It's stupid, I don't know, but that was our home for so long, mine and Rory's. And it's just weird to think that it wouldn't be there and Mia wouldn't be there and I wouldn't be there, and I just got very upset. Anyway, I'm rambling. The painting's really great. Will you accept my apology?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, yes I will. I've had bad days too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, we should get back to Rory.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai sits at the kitchen table as Luke walks in.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, I'm pretty much done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks for doing this. I didn't want the rain to destroy your beautiful chuppah. And I looked and looked in the yellow pages and I didn't see a chuppah waterproofer listing anywhere.
[Luke holds up a broken wooden goat]

speaker: LUKE
words: How about chuppah goat figure repairman?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gilbert.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The goat. We named him Gilbert, he's headless. Can you fix him?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I got some glue here. I can fix him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. I'll make some tea.

speaker: LUKE
words: So, Sookie stopped at the diner this morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: LUKE
words: I asked her how your plans were going with the new inn, and she very awkwardly changed the subject to women's basketball.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: She's never shown much interest in sports before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No?

speaker: LUKE
words: What's going on with that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh well, you know, women's basketball is getting super popular. That's good, I think. The tall girls need an outlet. We had a fight. A big, humongous fight. She's never going to speak to me again.

speaker: LUKE
words: What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just flat out panicked about the enormity of what we were getting into and it clobbered me, and I clobbered Sookie, and was such a jerk. Hey, if I cry, will it freak you out?

speaker: LUKE
words: Totally.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What if I whimper?

speaker: LUKE
words: How about you suck it up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, I'll try.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't get it. You're as ready as you've ever been.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Luke, do not underestimate the complete and total lack of confidence I have in my abilities.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? You're the most confident person I know. Obnoxiously so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean in a good way. You're good at what you do and you know it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no, no, no. I'm good at doing what I have to do. When I had to get a job, I got it. When I had to find a house for us and a life for us, I got it. When I had to get Rory into Chilton, I did it. But I don't have to leave the Independence Inn. I don't have to go into business for myself, I don't have to walk out on that limb and risk everything I've worked for.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Just say where you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is this, reverse psychology?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, just stay at the inn. You're happy there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so you think I can't hack it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Of course you can hack it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great, lip service, that's what I need.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, if I start to cry, will it freak you out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. I couldn't stay where I am if I wanted. Mia is selling the inn. And that hit me hard too, maybe harder than the other thing. I'm gonna be without a home.

speaker: LUKE
words: What do you mean? This is your home.

speaker: LORELAI
