words: No, I mean a home home. A memory home. The inn is where Rory took her first step. It's where I took my first step. It's more of a home to me more than my parents' house ever was.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're just scared. Just like everybody else when they're taking on something big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then what does everybody else do to get through this feeling?

speaker: LUKE
words: They run in the back, throw up, pass out and then smack their head on the floor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: That's what I did on the first morning I opened the diner. Look, there is no button to push to get you through this. You just gotta jump in and be scared and stick with it until it gets fun.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How long 'til the diner got fun?

speaker: LUKE
words: About a year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. And there's no button?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about a lever, can I pull a lever?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Turn a knob?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You just jump?

speaker: LUKE
words: You just jump.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanna do it.

speaker: LUKE
words: You should do it. Check it out. [holds up the fixed wooden goat]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gilbert. You're not worse for the wear.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll go reattach him. How'd this happen anyway?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, something must've smacked into him with a hedger.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh huh, well, no one'll ever know. Oh, and uh, women's basketball is in season. You might wanna run that news past Sookie, and maybe you can go to a game or something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Or something. Thanks.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Sookie is at the stove cooking as Lorelai walks over to her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm. Meat loaf, mashed potatoes, stuffing. Comfort food, huh?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I thought it would be good with the weather changing like this, but if you don't think it's right I can make something else. Although I'm right on schedule and on budget so a change would kinda throw things off. Your call.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, everything looks great. Hey Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry about what happened. I said stupid things, and I said them for reasons that have nothing to do with you and I hate myself for doing it and I know you do too, and I am sorry.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No it isn't. You are a brilliant chef and to think that you should do things differently from how you do them now is ridiculous. You don't tell a great violinist to hold his bow differently. You don't tell a great cymbal player to crash his cymbals differently. You just let them play.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: There are great cymbal players?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Theoretically.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, well, it's okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanna go ahead with our plans. Forget my freak out. Pretend it didn't happen. Let's move forward.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well…

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don't want to move forward?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, I do. But I need your promise you're not gonna lose it on me again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I promise.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: 'Cause I couldn't take losing a business partner and my best friend in one fail swoop. It'd be too much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, I will place my hand on whatever you want and swear that you can trust that I will not lose confidence in our dream.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's good enough 'cause I know you don't like to put your hand on things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're gonna give it our best shot.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And if we go down after two years…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it'll be the most exciting two years of our lives!
CUT TO LOBBY
[Mia is talking to a man as Emily walks into the inn.]

speaker: MAN
words: How about antiques?

speaker: MIA
words: Absolutely, it's the best place for antiques. Michel will have a map for you if you need it.

speaker: MAN
words: Thank you.
[the man walks away as Mia walks over to Emily]

speaker: MIA
words: Hello, can I help you?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, thank you. I just…

speaker: MIA
words: Yes?

speaker: EMILY
words: I just wanted to meet the woman who helped raise my daughter.

speaker: MIA
words: Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, I'm Emily Gilmore.

speaker: MIA
words: I've wanted to meet you too for a very long time.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, that's nice.

speaker: MIA
words: Would you like to sit down? Or have something to eat? Have lunch with me, won't you?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, thank you. You have a lovely place here. It's a beautiful hotel. It's not a home, but still, a beautiful hotel.

speaker: MIA
words: Sometimes home is where your hat is.

speaker: EMILY
words: Or where your family is.

speaker: MIA
words: Yes, that too. You sure you don't want some tea? Tea usually makes things like this a little less awkward. There's things to hold and stir.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't know why I came here.

speaker: MIA
words: You wanted to meet me.

speaker: EMILY
words: After all these years, it makes no sense.

speaker: MIA
words: I expected you to come eventually.

speaker: EMILY
words: Did you?

speaker: MIA
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: EMILY
words: And what did you expect to say to me when I did come?

speaker: MIA
words: When Lorelai showed up on my porch that day with a tiny baby in her arms, I thought to myself, what if this were my daughter, and she was cold and scared and needed a place to live? What would I want for her? And then I thought, I'd want her to find somebody to take her in and make her safe and help her find her way.

speaker: EMILY
words: That's funny. I would've wanted her to find someone who would send her home. I have to go. I'd appreciate if you didn't mention this to Lorelai.

speaker: MIA
words: I won't.
[Emily walks to the door, then stops]

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you have pictures, from back then?

speaker: MIA
words: I'll send you a box full tomorrow.

speaker: EMILY
words: Thank you.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory sit at a table eating]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh man, it's such a relief to have that Sookie thing fixed.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I hate fighting with friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's what enemies are for.

speaker: RORY
words: And God knows we have our share of those.

speaker: LORELAI
words: People who eat crunchy food with their mouths open.

speaker: RORY
words: People who dog ear library books.

speaker: LORELAI
words: People who spit when they talk.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh gross, you got me in the eye!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not.

speaker: RORY
words: You totally did!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're full of it.

speaker: RORY
words: Luke, where's my toast?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, it's gonna take awhile. My big toaster's broken so I got stuck with just this dinky one.
[Jess pushes down the handle on the big toaster, showing Luke that it works]

speaker: LUKE
words: How did that happen?

speaker: JESS
words: You're gonna break that.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was broken before.

speaker: JESS
words: Well it must've got better.

speaker: LUKE
words: Inanimate objects don't usually get better. Did you fix this?

speaker: JESS
words: Please.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: I have no idea what you're babbling about. I don't fix things.

speaker: LUKE
words: But yesterday…

speaker: JESS
words: I got school.
[Rory smiles at Jess as he leaves]
THE END
OPEN AT LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai walks in the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm back!

speaker: RORY
words: Kitchen!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmkay, I couldn't make up my mind so I got 'The Shining' and 'Bringing Up Baby.' Now, I know you're thinking, one's a movie about a homicidal parent and the other one's . . . .hello.
[Sookie and Rory are standing in front of the kitchen table.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What'd you break?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nothing. Well, the broiler. But this came for you and Max.
[Sookie and Rory move apart to reveal a gift on the table.]

speaker: RORY
words: We're thinking it's a wedding present.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. Mmm. Lorelai Gilmore and Max Medina. Well, I guess news doesn't always travel fast.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You gonna open it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But aren't you curious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. Just leave it there. I'll take it back tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: But there's not a return address.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well isn't there a card?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope. Maybe there's one inside.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: With the return address on it.

speaker: RORY
words: But that means you'd have to open it to find out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, give me a knife.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh! This is so exciting! Maybe not.
[Lorelai cuts open the package and they tear the paper off]

speaker: RORY
words: An ice cream maker!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: A Musso Lussino 480!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Somebody sent me a fascist ice cream maker?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Italian design, stainless steel body, chrome finish.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And no card. Perfect.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson just got in his apple crop! We can make cider ice cream!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes we can, using his ice cream maker, but Il Duce here is going back.

speaker: RORY
words: To where? Maybe it's an orphan.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's right. We'd be giving it a home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, once again, I bring up the fact that this is a wedding present, and as I am not getting married, neither God's law nor Emily Post allows me to keep this.

speaker: RORY
words: But isn't there a rule about late presents?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Like if it arrives after a certain date, the giver forfeits all rights of return.

speaker: RORY
words: Exactly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice try.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's true. I saw it on Martha Stewart. She was doing one of those double programs, and the first half was on massaging your dog, and she had this chow and she was rubbing it…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But the second half was about gifts, and she said that if it arrives after ten weeks…

speaker: RORY
words: Eight.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: …eight weeks, that you don't have to return it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, clearly this is shaping up to be one of those moments that St. Peter's gonna show on the big video screen when I die, and I for one do not wanna see the three of us staggering around with cider ice cream slathered all over our faces while my soul hangs in the balance, so until I can find out who sent this, no one goes near it. And we're watching 'The Shining.' [leaves kitchen]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I bet Max would let us keep it.
OPENING CREDITS
CUT TO CHILTON CLASSROOM

speaker: TEACHER
words: Believe it or not, Shakespeare probably never intended his plays to be read by students sitting at decks more concerned with getting A's than with the fate of Macbeth. His plays were meant to be experienced, lived. So with that in mind, together with my third period Shakespeare, you'll be split up into five groups and each group will assume responsibility for one act of Romeo and Juliet, which will be performed a week from Sunday. You will nominate the director, you will cast the scene, rehearse the scene, and interpret the scene in your own individual manner. Last year, we did Richard the Third. One group did their scene as the Mafiosi. Another set theirs during the Roman Empire. And my favorite, the climactic last scene was set during the final days of the Sonny and Cher show. Just remember, whatever interpretation you choose should highlight the themes you see in the scene. And if the love of the Bard's language still doesn't inspire you, remember this will be fifty percent of your final grade.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Act five.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Act five.

speaker: PARIS
words: Act five?

speaker: RORY
words: Act five.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why don't they just sew our sides together and rename us Chang and Eng?
CUT TO HALLWAY

speaker: HENRY
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Henry, hi.

speaker: HENRY
words: Hey. Act three, sword fight. You?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Act five, death scene.

speaker: HENRY
words: Nice. So, uh, tonight, 8 o'clock?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll tell Lane.
[Paris walks up to them]

speaker: PARIS
words: Rory, sorry to interrupt. Hi Henry. But see, we're all standing over there trying to map out a game plan and a rehearsal schedule, and I'm sure whatever the two of you are talking about over here is so much more fascinating and important and, well gosh, let's just say it, fun. But I'd really like to get an 'A' on this assignment, and in order to do that I'm afraid you're gonna have to discuss your sock hops and your clambakes some other time, okay? Thanks. [walks away]

speaker: HENRY
words: That was scary.

speaker: RORY
words: It's gonna be a lot scarier when she gets an megaphone in her hands.
[cut down the hallway to Paris, Madeline and Louise. Rory walks over to them]

speaker: PARIS
words: So, I say we meet in the cafeteria. The acoustics are very similar to the Grand Hall, and. . . oh, well look who showed up.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: PARIS
words: Save it.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Well, well, well. Look who's back from suspension.

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin got suspended again?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, like you hadn't noticed he'd been gone?

speaker: RORY
words: What did he do?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Took apart Mr. McCaffey's car and put it back together in the science building hallway.

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yeah, well he didn't do it by himself. Duncan and Bowman were there too.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Plus the mechanics that they paid to do the actual work.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, anyone stupid enough to hand out with Butch Cassidy and the Sun-dunce kid deserves whatever they get.

speaker: RORY
words: How did he fall in with those guys?

speaker: MADELINE
words: The new year started and there they were, all three of them, side by side.

speaker: LOUISE
words: And practically dressing the same.

speaker: MADELINE
words: It's very On the Town.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai is on the couch talking on the phone.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aunt Bobby, hi. It's Lorelai, Richard and Emily's girl. Um, I'm the one with. . . yeah, that's right. Wow, you don't hear the word wedlock much anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm home!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh, uh huh, really? The Bible said all that, huh? Did it, did it mention me by name? I'm just. . .okay, I'm just kidding. So, um, judging by your Billy Graham impression, I am guessing that you didn't send me an ice cream maker, so maybe you could just give me Aunt Clarissa's phone number? Oh no, I hadn't heard. That's terrible. Uh huh. Well, then I guess she had it coming, didn't she? Hey, listen, I'd love to chat about who else is the family is currently or soon to be headed for hell, but I've gotta run, so I promise to call in the next twenty years, okay? Bye bye. [hangs up] How scary is it that my parents are turning our to be the normal ones in the family?

speaker: RORY
words: No luck?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I still have the, uh, Pennsylvania Gilmores, but how was your day?

speaker: RORY
words: I have to perform Act Five of Romeo and Juliet with Paris, Madeline, and Louise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris has appointed herself as director.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice. What part are you playing?

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know yet. She's still mulling over the screen tests right now. We're gonna find out tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Screen tests?

speaker: RORY
words: 24 takes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, I so want a copy.

speaker: RORY
words: Forget it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sell it on the Internet, make a fortune. First we brought you Pamela and Tommy Lee, now prepare yourselves for the crazy antics of Rory and the Bard!

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, and I told Paris that you would make all of our costumes so she wants to have a concept meeting with you tomorrow at three.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, she needs a resume and samples of your previous work and, uh, referrals.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And my bare butt to kiss.

speaker: RORY
words: If you think that will set you apart from the other applicants, yes. Hey, I didn't know that there was someone in our family named Bunny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, cross her off the list.

speaker: RORY
words: Poor Bunny. [phone rings] Hello?

speaker: HENRY
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Henry, hi.

speaker: HENRY
words: Am I late?

speaker: RORY
words: No, right on time. Hold on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey hon, I'm heading for class. There's pizza-slash-Luke's money on the table for dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
[Rory puts Henry on hold and calls Lane; at Lane's house, Mrs. Kim answers the phone]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Kim's Antiques.

speaker: RORY
words: Hello Mrs. Kim, this is Rory. May I please speak with Lane?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane is studying.

speaker: LANE
words: Wait, Mama. Mama, is that for me?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I was just expecting a call from Rory and I thought. . .

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You do your math?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: History?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Biology?

speaker: LANE
words: No.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I'm not taking biology.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: I took it last year.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: And that's it? One year and you know all there is to know.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I. . .

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Tomorrow we look into private school.

speaker: LANE
words: Mama, please, the phone.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Five minutes. I'm counting.

speaker: LANE
words: Hello?

speaker: RORY
words: Lane. Hold on. Henry?

speaker: HENRY
words: Here.

speaker: RORY
words: Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: Here.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay guys, talk to you later. [hangs up]

speaker: LANE
words: So, Rory, how are you?

speaker: HENRY
words: I'm good, how are you doing?
[back at Lorelai's house]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I'm gone. Hey, um, do me a favor, make some of those calls for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't you think you may be going a little far with this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, I understand that you wanna return the ice cream maker, but you did make an honest effort to get in touch with the person that sent this to you, and. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's called closure, hon. I need it, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. Uncle Randolph. Oh, sorry guys. They'll be off in a sec.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, don't wait too long. I think Randolph was Bunny's older brother.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it.
CUT TO BUSINESS CLASS
[Lorelai gets a burrito from the vending machine in the break room. A man walks over to her.]

speaker: PAUL
words: One again, ladies and gentlemen, she takes the last burrito.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And hello to you too.

speaker: PAUL
words: Week after week, how do you do it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told you, correct change. You go in for that dollar bill nonsense, you'll be standing there for ten minutes watching it. Ehhh. Eh eh eh.

speaker: PAUL
words: And here I thought you had a special relationship with this vending machine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Only in the sense that it keeps me alive.

speaker: PAUL
words: I actually have theory on that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh.

speaker: PAUL
words: You know, ever since we were children, we got our nourishment from our mothers.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, are you trying to gross me out so I can't eat my burrito?

speaker: PAUL
words: And now, we're getting it from machines.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your point being?

speaker: PAUL
words: I think it's a conspiracy getting us ready for the day we're all gonna be raised by machines. No human contact whatsoever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know my mother, don't you?

speaker: PAUL
words: The, uh, Twilight Zone marathon was on all week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So all of this is a way of saying you wanna look at my notes on the reading.

speaker: PAUL
words: Such perception.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And in one so young and beautiful. Frightening, isn't it?

speaker: PAUL
words: You know, I feel bad about doing this every week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? I would've thought you would've gotten used to it by now.

speaker: PAUL
words: Come on Lorelai. I gotta pay you back somehow. How about you let me take you out to dinner one night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dinner?

speaker: PAUL
words: Yeah, maybe even somewhere that doesn't require correct change, unless you're firmly into the whole coin thing, then I know a good automat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don't know.

speaker: PAUL
words: Well, I was kidding about the whole automat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, an automat's fine. Um, it's just, uh, my schedule's kinda crazy for the next couple weeks.

speaker: PAUL
words: Okay. Well, it's just a thought. But if you suddenly get an opening, give me a call. [hands her a business card]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, great, sure, thanks. Enjoy the notes.

speaker: PAUL
words: Thank you. Enjoy the burrito.
CUT TO CHILTON CAFETERIA
[Rory walks over to the table where Madeline, Louise, and a boy are sitting.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hey.

speaker: LOUISE
words: We're the Monkees.

speaker: RORY
words: Where's Paris?

speaker: MADELINE
words: She'll be here in a minute. She said she had to get some things.

speaker: RORY
words: [to boy] Hi, I'm Rory.

speaker: BRAD
words: I'm Brad. From the third period Shakespeare.

speaker: LOUISE
words: He's the answer to our lack of boys problem. Isn't that swell?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, maybe we should start.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Without Paris?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Ooh, that could be lethal.

speaker: RORY
words: We could at least decide on what motif we want to do.
[Paris walks in carrying a box]

speaker: PARIS
words: We're doing traditional Elizabethan.

speaker: RORY
words: Elizabethan? But I thought the point of this was to . . .

speaker: PARIS
words: The point is to get an A, not to make Romeo and Juliet into a Vegas lounge act. Besides, we have the death scene. It's classic, it's famous. Who are you?

speaker: BRAD
words: I'm, uh, Brad. From the third period Shakespeare, ma'am.

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay. Now I want everyone to read the chapters on acting I photocopied out of Houseman's Memoirs tonight. Everyone will be off book by Friday, and if you plan on missing rehearsal, you better bring a coroner's note.
[Paris places a sword on the table]

speaker: RORY
words: Tell me you didn't just have that lying around.

speaker: PARIS
words: We're short on boys. That makes you Romeo. Louise, you can play the Friar.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Excuse me?
[Tristin walks in and sits down at their table]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, well, the gang's all here.

speaker: PARIS
words: This is a meeting.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, sorry I'm late.

speaker: PARIS
words: What do you think you're doing?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Uh, Professor Anderson forgot to include me when she made up the groups, so she told me to pick one.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine, you have four other acts to choose from. Take your pick.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, well Summer's in act 1, Beth and Jessica are in act 2, Kate's in act 3, and uh, Claire, Kathy, and Mary are in act 4. So this is the only one free of ex-girlfriends.

speaker: PARIS
words: So we're being punished for our good taste?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, Paris, you hurt me. Do you no longer have any need for me at all?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Yes, we have great need. You can be our Romeo.

speaker: RORY
words: Brad is Romeo!

speaker: LOUISE
words: Put in your other contact Grandma. Tristin is Romeo. Brad can be the second guard on the left.

speaker: PARIS
words: No.

speaker: MADELINE
words: She's kinda right, Paris. Tristin was born to be Romeo.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, I'm the director and I'll decide who's born to be what, and Brad is Romeo.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned.

speaker: PARIS
words: What'd you say?

speaker: LOUISE
words: Just perhaps that someone is letting her personal feeling interfere with her leadership.

speaker: PARIS
words: My only feeling is that I don't wanna give the most important part to someone who can't even manage to stay in school.

speaker: LOUISE
words: fifty percent of our final grade.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Is there gonna be any scratching involved, or is this just a verbal thing?

speaker: PARIS
words: What do you think about this?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, how are you at speaking in front of a lot of people?

speaker: BRAD
words: I tend to throw up.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine, but I swear, you flake on this and you'll pray you get suspended.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I gotta run. Are we done here?

speaker: PARIS
words: Rehearsal, tomorrow night.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Good. So now Brad can be Friar Tuck and I can be Juliet.

speaker: PARIS
words: Wrong.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Hey.

speaker: PARIS
words: Juliet's supposed to be chaste.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Oh.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Then . . .

speaker: PARIS
words: And she has more than three lines.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no.

speaker: PARIS
words: Too late.

speaker: RORY
words: It can't be too late, we haven't done anything yet.

speaker: PARIS
words: You're Juliet. You're the best public speaker here, you've definitely got that waif thing down, and you'll look great dead. Next order of business. I did some location scouting this morning, and I think the courtyard outside. . . .
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Sookie carries a plate of pancakes over to Michel]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, here we go. Low fat, whole wheat blueberry pancakes.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Are there twelve?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Twelve what?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Blueberries. I can only have twelve blueberries for breakfast.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Or what?

speaker: MICHEL
words: What do you mean, or what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What happens if you eat thirteen blueberries?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well this is a silly conversation.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Would you die?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Just hand me the plate.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Only if you don't count.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I won't count.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Swear. Raise your right hand and say, 'May Destiny's Child break up if I count these blueberries.'

speaker: MICHEL
words: Pick another group.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nope.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I hate you! Hate you!
[Michel walks out of the kitchen as Lorelai carries the ice cream maker in and puts it on the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, I gotta start getting in earlier.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey, I remember you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am donating it to the inn.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, honey, that's very thoughtful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes it is.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But we have an ice cream maker, a professional one. See, that means we can make enough ice cream for everyone in the inn, whereas this little guy…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fernando.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Fernando, try as he might, can only make enough ice cream for, well, you, so . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we don't need him here?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, we don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well can't you find some use for him? I mean, he's new and shiny, and it's not his fault that he's part of the other life that I almost had but don't have now, and kinda don't wanna be reminded of.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I guess I could put my change in him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey, can I say something?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shoot.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I'm a little concerned about you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You just seem very emotional about this ice cream maker.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am not.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You named the ice cream maker.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I name everything.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You didn't name the toaster.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Poppy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You just made that up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not. All right, but admit it, Poppy is a damn good name for a toaster.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's been quite awhile since you and Max have broken up…

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, you're fine. But are you moving on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I'm moving on.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, then how many dates have you had post-Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What does that have to do with anything?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I just feel like you're hibernating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not hibernating.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, hey, woo. Look at this skirt, huh? I'm not hibernating.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Then how many dates have you been on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was engaged Sookie, you don't just get over that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But you went through your mourning period.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you said it was over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was. . .is.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, are you at least putting the vibe out there so they'll know you're available?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, look, if it'll make you feel any better, okay, I just got asked out the other night.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What? You're kidding! Who is he?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Some guy from my business class.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, business class.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's a pretty cool guy, actually. He's cute, funny, and, um, he's a little younger, but, uh, he's very sharp. You know, we have this little bit going about me stealing his burrito.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, stealing his burrito. You kids!

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, like a real burrito.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, stolen his burrito.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, forget the burrito Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Fine. When you guys going out?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I didn't exactly say yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Why not? You've already got the skirt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because, I don't know, what if it doesn't work out? And then class will be weird, and it'll definitely screw up our burrito bit.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Aw honey, come on, every guy doesn't have to be the guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. Isn't it too soon for the transition guy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Don't think of him as the transition guy. Think of him as the pre-transition guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A pre-transition guy? You're allowed that?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Absolutely.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, I gotta read the rulebook more carefully.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: So. . . I will call him later tonight.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Great! That's so great!
[Michel comes in and tries to take the pancakes. Sookie grabs his arm.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It's all or nothing Sparky.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Damn you!
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai sits at the kitchen table sewing the costumes while Rory walks into the living room talking to Lane on the phone.]

speaker: RORY
words: She's letting you go? That's amazing. What changed her mind?

speaker: LANE
words: I let her watch the Romeo and Juliet movie with Leo and Claire Danes.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? I would've thought she'd hated it.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, she did. But trust my mom to turn one of the world's great love stories into a cautionary tale of what happens when children disobey their parents.

speaker: RORY
words: So I'm guessing that you're not any closer to telling your parents about Henry.

speaker: LANE
words: I mean, what are the options if I tell them? They hate him, and it's over. They love him, and he therefore becomes odious to me and it's over. Things are working out fine the way they are.

speaker: RORY
words: You mean calling him Rory on the phone in case your mom's listening?

speaker: LANE
words: I've grown fond of my cage Rory.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane!

speaker: LANE
words: Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. [hangs up]
[Lorelai walks into the living room wearing the Juliet headpiece.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What dost my lady think?

speaker: RORY
words: That you're going to be late for the joust?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I meant of thy lovely headdress crafted by thy mother's hand artful hand?

speaker: RORY
words: It pleaseth me mucheth, but uh, hath my beautius mother lookedeth at the time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh crap!
[Lorelai runs upstairs as the phone rings; Rory answers]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: PARIS
words: Two other groups are rehearsing at school in the Grand Hall even though I specifically reserved it for us way in advance and confirmed the reservation twice, but whatever. They're going to be there and I don't want them spying on us.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think the ending to Romeo and Juliet is exactly a secret.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hello, our interpretation?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh right.

speaker: PARIS
words: I went on the web and I found a site called MissPatty.net. It's in your town.

speaker: RORY
words: There's a MissPatty.net?

speaker: PARIS
words: Have you heard of it?

speaker: RORY
words: Well. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: Is it big enough? The site says it's 720 square feet.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, I'd rather just rehearse somewhere else.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, I've got enough to worry about without you being embarrassed of where you live.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm not embarrassed. I just want to keep my school life separate from my home life, you know?

speaker: PARIS
words: Tough. Madeline and Louise are already on their way. See you in half an hour.
[Rory hangs up as Lorelai comes down the steps]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have you seen my bag with the beads and the fur, kind of looks like Stalin's head? Aha.

speaker: RORY
words: We're rehearsing here now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Our Shakespeare group. Paris didn't want anyone spying on us so now we're rehearsing in Stars Hollow. This sucks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, at least you don't have to drive to Hartford. What's with the face?

speaker: RORY
words: It's just, Tristin is in our group.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, you told me.

speaker: RORY
words: Right, so Tristin, he's in our group, so that means he's in…well, and Dean lives here, so this sucks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you know what Vanna? I'm gonna need a few more vowels here.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to tell him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tell who?

speaker: RORY
words: Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tell Dean what?

speaker: RORY
words: That Tristin and I. . .that we kissed at that stupid party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: I have no choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well…

speaker: RORY
words: Because if Tristin sees Dean, he's gonna tell him. And then it's gonna be worse because it's gonna be like I was keeping it from him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, let's just calm down now.

speaker: RORY
words: Which I was. I was keeping it from him. I can't believe this, now I have to tell him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're right.

speaker: RORY
words: I am?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm. I think you should tell him.

speaker: RORY
words: Of course, right, I have to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Then at the play, right as Tristin enters to find you dead and pulls out the vial of poison to kill himself, Dean can leap from the audience and rip his head off, adding a level of reality few productions have ever seen before. You'll get an A. The Actors Studio will go nuts. You'll have James Lipton asking you what your favorite swear word is. It's a great plan.

speaker: RORY
words: You - not helping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To prevent a homicide? Yes I am.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to tell him. I don't have a choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, fine. Try it out on me first.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pretend I'm Dean. If you're going to tell him this, you'd better have down what you're going to say.

speaker: RORY
words: Seriously?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seriously.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory. Sorry, serious now.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, Dean, remember last year when we had broken up, and we weren't together anymore because we had broken up…

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's good, mention it three times. Keep going.

speaker: RORY
words: And uh, there was this party, and I went, and, um, Tristin was there. And somehow, I'm not really sure how, we ended up in a room together, and we kissed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You and Tristin?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: On the hand?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cheek?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He kissed you or you kissed him?

speaker: RORY
words: Kind of both.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you kissed him?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When?

speaker: RORY
words: I already told you three times, when we were broken up!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, not a good idea to yell at him right now.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When during the breakup?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, how long after we broke up did you kiss Tristin?

speaker: RORY
words: Uhh, just… the night after we broke up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You mean the night after I told you I loved you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The next night, after I told you I loved you, you kissed Tristin?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm a terrible person!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hold on.

speaker: RORY
words: He's absolutely right. He told me he loved me and the next night I go and I kiss Tristin.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, that was me, not Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: I hate myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't do anything wrong. You were hurt and confused and broken up. You did nothing wrong.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell that to Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, because we're not telling Dean anything.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen to me. I know you are Miss Honesty. I have seen the banner in the closet. But this is the kind of honesty that will only make you feel less guilty, and it's going to hurt Dean very much. It's possibly going to screw up the really good thing you guys have going now. Do you want that?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I don't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right then. Relax. Be calm. Everything will be fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I gotta go. Can I ask you one more question? Do you think my hair looks cool?

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause, you know, some days I wake up and I'm like, cool. Some days I'm like, could be cooler.

speaker: RORY
words: I won't wait up for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like today I got up and I was like, left side cool, right side not so cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
CUT TO MISS PATTY'S STUDIO
[Miss Patty instructs several older people who lay on mats on the floor]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Just listen to your breathing and let the world melt away. And in, and out. And in, and out.
[Paris walks in]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, then tell it to go outside and have a smoke. You can't rush a cool down sweetheart.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, I understand the whole Mystic Pizza, small town, 'we don't let a clock run our lives' thing, but I come from the big city where money talks and I'm paying good money for this place and I have a schedule to keep.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Be careful darling, or your face is gonna freeze like that.
[Rory, Louise, Madeline, and Brad walk in]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LOUISE
words: What's with the cast from Cocoon?

speaker: PARIS
words: Where's Tristin? He said he was coming with you.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh, he's here. He just went over to the market.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LOUISE
words: He needed cigarettes, just in case we didn't already know that he was bad.

speaker: RORY
words: Umm, I'll be right back.

speaker: PARIS
words: Where are you going?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll just be a sec. [leaves]

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay, now they're just sleeping.
CUT TO INSIDE DOOSE'S MARKET
[Dean is stocking shelves as Tristin walks over to him.]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Excuse me stockboy, could you tell me where I can find the shortneing? Now that is a fine looking apron. I mean it, I mean, really sensational.

speaker: DEAN
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, to be honest, there's something I wanted to ask you. [picks up two bags of flour] In your professional opinion, which one of these would make my cakes fluffier?

speaker: DEAN
words: You drove all the way out here just to be a jerk. There aren't enough people who can't stand you in Hartford.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh, no. I'm here for Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, the play. Romeo and Juliet.

speaker: DEAN
words: What about it?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I'm Romeo, and she's Juliet. Hey, come on, she must've told you. She did tell you, didn't she?

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, I think you better leave.
[Tristin drops a bag of flour on the floor]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oops! God I am so sorry. I am such a klutz. Here, let me. This should cover it. [drops some money on the floor]

speaker: DEAN
words: You know what, I hope for Rory's sake that you got an understudy.
[Rory runs up to them]

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, hi!

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory, what is he doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: I need to talk to you.

speaker: DEAN
words: I got something to settle with this guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Outside, please.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory and Dean walk out of the market]

speaker: DEAN
words: All right, I'm outside.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm really sorry I didn't tell you about this before, but Tristin…

speaker: DEAN
words: Is playing Romeo to your Juliet. Yeah, I heard.

speaker: RORY
words: But he wasn't even in our group at first, but then no one else wanted him, and then Paris moved the rehearsal spot to here, and she did it today and I didn't have time to tell you.

speaker: DEAN
words: You and Tristin wind up thrown together a lot at that school.

speaker: RORY
words: It's just a project, that's all, nothing more.

speaker: DEAN
words: You and Tristin playing Romeo and Juliet. Perfect. Really, really amazing.

speaker: RORY
words: I know you hate it.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I hate it. I really hate it.

speaker: RORY
words: But we do the scene on Sunday, and then it's over. And it's back to, Tristin? Who? I don't ... I don't know Tristin.

speaker: DEAN
words: You must mean that young boy who got mysteriously strangled by a Doose's market apron one night.

speaker: RORY
words: I heard about that. Awful. They say drugs were involved. Please don't be mad. I'm sorry. I'm really, really sorry.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sorry about what? You didn't. . .you didn't choose to do this with him, right?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I didn't.

speaker: DEAN
words: Then what do you have to be sorry for?

speaker: RORY
words: That. . .that I didn't tell you about the rehearsal. And that No Doubt is touring with U2. I know you're extremely disappointed in Bono.

speaker: DEAN
words: All right, so, so when's this thing over?

speaker: RORY
words: Sunday.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. I'm gonna walk around the block, just get him out of the market.

speaker: RORY
words: Right away.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Rory is sitting at a table eating as Lorelai walks in and sits with her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thank goodness, you ordered. I am starving.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing here? I thought you went out to dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I did go out to dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: Then why are you eating mine?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he took me to this darling little place called Minnie's. Very hip, very chic, very small portions.

speaker: RORY
words: So how'd it go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well…

speaker: RORY
words: Aww.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, we talked about all the things we had in common and then the salad came.

speaker: RORY
words: Not a soulmate?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's never seen Ab Fab.

speaker: RORY
words: Definitely not a soulmate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Plus, he's outdoorsy. Remember that Meryl Streep movie where she and her family take a rafting trip and then psycho Kevin Bacon forces them to take 'em down the river?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, that's his dream vacation, minus Kevin Bacon.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whereas mine is Kevin Bacon, minus the river, so...

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, moving on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. But I must say, I'm really glad I went tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I mean, it was fun to kinda get dressed up and have a freshly laundered man open the door for me. And the best part about it was, it was no big deal. I mean, we laughed a little, we hugged goodnight, I'll never date him again, but I do believe the burrito bit will live on. It was a totally casual date. I am now officially a casual dater.

speaker: RORY
words: That's great. And we can celebrate by getting you your own plate of fries.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Luke, can we get another round?

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So tell me about the big rehearsal.

speaker: RORY
words: We got off to a shaky start, and Louise acts like she's the priest in a Madonna video, but by the end, we were not half bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good good.

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin ran into Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, bad bad.

speaker: RORY
words: It's okay though because I pulled them apart without any bloodshed and I explained it all to Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You explained it all to Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: I told him that Tristin wasn't supposed to be in our group and Paris moved the rehearsal to Miss Patty's at the last minute and that's why he didn't know about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that version of all.

speaker: RORY
words: But Dean's fine now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's fine?

speaker: RORY
words: He's fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: You want a burger too?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, no, I'll just have half of hers.

speaker: RORY
words: One burger please.

speaker: LUKE
words: You look all dressed up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do I? Because I feel very casual.
[Dean walks into the diner and sits down with them]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, you just got off work?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Dean. Do you want some fries?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I'm actually going home for dinner. My mom made fried chicken tonight and she saved me some.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you have a cooking mom.

speaker: RORY
words: That's so nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she may make chicken, but is she a casual dater?

speaker: RORY
words: I hope not. She's married.

speaker: DEAN
words: Do I wanna know what either one of you is talking about?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: RORY
words: My mother casually dated tonight.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, well, congratulations.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. Thank you very much.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, I was wondering what time your rehearsal was tomorrow?

speaker: RORY
words: Five, why?

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, uh, it's my night off and I thought maybe I'd come by and watch.

speaker: RORY
words: Watch what?

speaker: DEAN
words: Watch you.

speaker: RORY
words: Watch me do what?

speaker: DEAN
words: Rehearse.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh. Um, Dean, I think you'd be really bored watching rehearsal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, I've dozed off twice just listening to her talk about rehearsal.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I won't be bored.

speaker: RORY
words: We don't even know our lines yet. You should just come on Sunday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's a good idea. After all, Sunday is the day of rest and that's what you'll be doing - resting, 'cause it's boring.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, honey, it's not your fault. You didn't write the damn thing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I'll come on Sunday too.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. But if you're gonna go on Sunday, you don't want to spoil it for yourself.

speaker: DEAN
words: What? It's not like I don't know how it ends.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, Dean, look…

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory, come on. I'll sit in the back, you'll die, and I'll walk you home. It's no big deal, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good, so I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yup, you sure will.

speaker: DEAN
words: Bye Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Dean. [Dean leaves] Oh yeah, he's fine.
CUT TO CHILTON HALLWAY
[Rory walks up to Tristin and his friends]

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me Tristin, can I talk to you for a second?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: [to his friends] I'll meet you guys later, okay? [they walk away] I'm all yours.

speaker: RORY
words: I need to talk to you about something serious.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Serious, huh? I'm intrigued.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean's coming to rehearsal tonight.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Wow, are you sure they can spare him? I mean, what if there's a run on baked beans?

speaker: RORY
words: Can you just shut up for five seconds, please? Thank you. Look, as I said, Dean is coming to rehearsal tonight, and I'd like to ask you to promise that you won't say anything to him about what happened.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: What happened?

speaker: RORY
words: At the party?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: At the party?

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin! You and me, at Madeline's party? You had just been kicked to the curb by Summer, and I found you sulking on a piano bench, and I sat down, we talked, and then…we kissed.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: That was you?

speaker: RORY
words: You know what, forget it.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Hey, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: There is no point in talking to you. I knew that, yet I tried. Won't happen again.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You don't want me to tell Dean that we kissed.

speaker: RORY
words: By George, I think he's got it.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Okay, if that's what you want.

speaker: RORY
words: It is.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Although, he's gonna find out anyway.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, come on, you know that when we kiss on stage, it's gonna be pretty obvious that it's not the first time. I'm a good actor, but I can't hide that kind of passion.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, things are really good for me and Dean right now, and I don't want anything to mess that up. Especially not something that meant nothing at all to me and I wished had never happened in the first place.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: So things are going good for you too, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, they are.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Good, that's good.

speaker: RORY
words: So what do you think? You just took those out.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, I changed my mind.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you all right?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, I think somehow I'll recover from the great romance between you and the Beave.

speaker: RORY
words: A lot of stuff's been going on with you lately, huh?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Meaning?

speaker: RORY
words: Just, you know, the car thing, the suspension thing, a lot of drama.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well I get bored easily.

speaker: RORY
words: Just doesn't really seem like you.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: And you know me now?

speaker: RORY
words: I know you don't get suspended for stupid pranks.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I pulled stuff like that before I knew Duncan and Bowman, all right?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, if you did, you didn't get caught. You're getting caught a lot.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Your point being?

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe Duncan and Bowman aren't the best people to be hanging out with. They're not as smart as you Tristin, they don't have what you have going for you. They…

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know, I'm gonna have to bail before we get to the whole hugging part. And ask your boyfriend to remind me when it's coupon day, okay?
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory sit at the counter.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Taking pity on your burger?

speaker: RORY
words: Not hungry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, you've got to eat. You're gonna kill yourself in a couple of hours, you really need your strength.

speaker: RORY
words: Ha ha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe Dean won't even come tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, he'll be there. There aren't enough monster truck rallies in the world to keep him away from Miss Patty's tonight.
[Paul and his parents walk into the diner]

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, that's it. This afternoon we are going to engage in some intensive retail therapy to bring you out of this funk.

speaker: RORY
words: No thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean it. Today is the day we finally spring for the Powerpuff girl shotglasses.

speaker: RORY
words: Hmm, I can't. I promised Lane I'd help her pick out an outfit for the play tomorrow.

speaker: PAUL
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: PAUL
words: Hey, it is you. This is Lorelai, she's the girl I told you about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Paul. I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you with the hat.

speaker: PAUL
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: PAUL
words: Well, um, getting some coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: In Stars Hollow?

speaker: PAUL
words: Well, you know, you talked so much about the town the other night and especially Luke's place, so my mom's crazy for coffee, I thought I'd bring 'em up here for breakfast.

speaker: RORY
words: [quietly] The other night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [quietly] Uh, yes. Paul's my friend from the other night, the uh, casual Wednesday.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Paul, I want you to meet my daughter Rory.

speaker: PAUL
words: Hi, nice to meet you. Hey, these are my parents, Dorie and Sid.

speaker: DORIE
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: SID
words: Pleasure, really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, me too.

speaker: LUKE
words: You ordering?

speaker: PAUL
words: Luke. Are you Luke? Is this Luke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, that's Luke.

speaker: PAUL
words: Oh man! Mom, Dad, that is Luke.

speaker: DORIE
words: We've heard so much about you.

speaker: SID
words: Darn shame about that Rachel.

speaker: LUKE
words: Who the hell are these people?

speaker: LORELAI; Uh, Paul is my friend from business school.
words: LORELAI; Uh, Paul is my friend from business school.

speaker: PAUL
words: Yeah, we went out the other night. And uh, you know, she talked about a few people in this town, and you being one of 'em, so nice to meet you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: PAUL
words: Um, okay, three coffees to go then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to Rory] Something funny?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're just smiling for no reason?

speaker: RORY
words: I'm a happy person.

speaker: PAUL
words: Hey, I've gotta run. Mom wants to go antiquing, so it was nice meeting you, and uh, I'll see you in class Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. Bye now. Bye.
[Paul and his parents leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Say it!

speaker: RORY
words: I've always wanted a little brother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He looked older the other night!

speaker: RORY
words: How much older could he possibly look?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A lot! He's usually a little scruffy, and then the baseball cap hides the funky hair thing.

speaker: RORY
words: He should've been holding a yo-yo and a lollipop and wearing a beanie with a propeller on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's in his twenties.

speaker: RORY
words: He must have been a very good boy to deserve such a happy day. I bet they let him ride a pony.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aren't you supposed to go help Lane?

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for cheering me up.
[Rory leaves as Luke walks over]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? You wanna say something too?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please don't hold back on my account.

speaker: LUKE
words: I wouldn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: LUKE
words: [to kids at the counter] Would you guys mind moving down a couple stools? Make me more comfortable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is me leaving.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, how do I know what the cutoff is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And no tip, I wonder why.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, at least if you had one of those height bars like at amusement park rides…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye now.
CUT TO MISS PATTY'S STUDIO
[Tristin and Rory are rehearsing up front, as Paris, Madeline, Louise, Brad, and Dean watch them.]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Here's to my love. Oh true apothecary, thy drugs are quick. Line?

speaker: PARIS
words: Thus with a kiss, I die. How hard is that to remember?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Thus with a kiss, I die. Right. And then I kiss he, right?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes. You say 'Thus with a kiss, I die.' Then you kiss her and die. Why are you smiling? You think this is a joke? The performance is tomorrow.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Wait, tomorrow? Oh my God. I totally missed it the first 47 times you said it.

speaker: PARIS
words: I warned you. I am not going to fail this because of you. I will replace you with Brad in a second.

speaker: BRAD
words: Oh, dear God, no.

speaker: RORY
words: Can we just get through the scene?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Please.

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine. But yell line once more and you're out. Start memorizing.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Oh true apothecary, thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss, I die.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, it's just, with this being our last kiss and all, it makes me think about our first kiss. You know, at the party.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: Lie down, you're dead.

speaker: LOUISE
words: We all are.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You remember the kiss. In Act 1 at the Capulet's masked party?

speaker: PARIS
words: What about it?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, I was just trying to think of something that would make this kiss as special as that one.

speaker: RORY
words: Tristin.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I thought she could cry.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: She's dead. You're dead, lie down.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yeah, but that's the beauty of it. No one would expect her to cry.

speaker: DEAN
words: I would.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: You know, funny you should say that…

speaker: RORY
words: I need to take five.

speaker: PARIS
words: You know what? Let's all take five. That way you can all cancel whatever plans you had tonight because we are staying here until we get this right.
[Brad pulls out his cell phone]

speaker: LOUISE
words: Who could you possibly be calling?
[Rory walks over to Dean]

speaker: DEAN
words: He is unbelievable.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, I really need you to leave.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: The play is tomorrow, and it's fifty percent of my grade, and you standing there staring at Tristin, it's like a challenge or something.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I don't like the way he's messing with you.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't like it either but we have to get through this scene and we can't get through the scene with you standing there. So, Dean, please.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine. Call me later. [leaves]

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Now I noticed you didn't cry when you kissed him. I'm starting to feel a little insecure.

speaker: RORY
words: What is wrong with you?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Whoa, I think I liked you better comatose.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you weren't going to say anything.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Did I say that?

speaker: RORY
words: You make it impossible for anyone to be nice to you. No wonder you had to join our group. Anyone who's actually suffered through the experience of going out with you would absolutely know better.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Gee, I really wish we could continue your analysis on how pathetic I am. Unfortunately, I have to meet some friends.

speaker: PARIS
words: Where are you going? Where is he going? We're not finished! Hey, I'm the director here! Tristin!

speaker: BRAD
words: Tristin, come back!
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai and Sookie sit at a table.]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh! I'm so excited! Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet, it's so romantic. Oh Romeo, blah bah blah and the blah. That's all the Shakespeare I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, you should come with us to Chilton and watch Rory perform.

speaker: LUKE
words: Can't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on. How often do you get to see teenagers speak iambic pentameter and kill themselves?

speaker: LUKE
words: No thanks. But you have a good time. Bring plenty of baseball cards to pass out your phone number on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, enough already! The horse is dead. His ashes have been sprinkled over the land. Let it rest.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Lorelai, there you are you naughty, naughty girl.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, he was not that much younger than I am. I met him a business school, not his Bar Mitzvah. Business school has to indicate some kind of maturity, right?

speaker: LUKE
words: Doogie Howser was a doctor at sixteen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Doogie Howser was not real.

speaker: LUKE
words: How sad for you. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke. This is incredible. I go on one stupid date, and suddenly I'm the female Jerry Lee Lewis.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh forget it honey. The town likes to tease. Plus, he did look really young.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You didn't even see him.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Kirk snapped pictures.
[Lorelai walks up to Luke behind the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you. What is up with you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing's up with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well we were having a perfectly nasty verbal sparring match and you suddenly walk away.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Lorelai, I hear you're dating a kid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please let something big fall on my head.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: When I was 18, I was dating an older lady. Broke my heart.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Bootsy, I'm sorry you got dumped, but I'm not dating a kid.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I didn't get dumped, she died. Heart attack. She was quite old.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm working. Us older guys do that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you being so mean to me?

speaker: LUKE
words: I'm not being mean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes you are. You're being mean.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sookie, am I being mean?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I wouldn't pay you to put on a red nose and work a birthday party right now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank God for that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are you so mad at me?

speaker: LUKE
words: I just think it's embarrassing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is so embarrassing?

speaker: LUKE
words: You running around with that kid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wasn't running, he's not a kid. We had dinner. You say Chuck E. Cheese, I'll break your nose.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, I'm not gonna say anything. You go live your life as you please. I got work to do.
CUT TO CHILTON GRAND HALL
[A group is performing Act 2 of Romeo and Juliet, interpreting it as cavemen. Lorelai, Sookie, Dean, and Lane stand in the audience and watch.]

speaker: BOY
words: Ooh, ooh. He jests at scars that never felt a wound. But, soft! What light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Are you sure this is Shakespeare?

speaker: DEAN
words: What's with all the grunting?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wish Luke was here, he could translate for us.
[Rory walks up to them]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh honey, look at you! You look like a princess! Doesn't she look like a princess?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, she looks beautiful.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom made the dress.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not to mention the girl inside it.

speaker: RORY
words: Hello, gross.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm just saying.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm getting kind of nervous.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, you're gonna be great.

speaker: RORY
words: I think act three is starting up.

speaker: LANE
words: Henry's act. Um, how do I look?

speaker: RORY
words: You might want to hold a phone up to your face so he'll recognize you.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay. [walks away]
[Paris walks up to them]

speaker: PARIS
words: I need you. [drags Rory away]
CUT TO HALLWAY

speaker: PARIS
words: He's not here.

speaker: RORY
words: Who's not here?

speaker: PARIS
words: Tristin. I've looked everywhere. I called his home, his cell, I called three girls I know he's seeing.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, calm down.

speaker: PARIS
words: Weren't you listening? He's not here. We're on in twenty minutes and we don't have a Romeo. We are going to fail.

speaker: RORY
words: We're not going to fail.

speaker: PARIS
words: Do you think Harvard accepts people who fail Shakespeare? They don't. I don't have the numbers on it or anything, but I feel pretty secure in saying, you fail Shakespeare, you don't get into Harvard.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, maybe he's just in one of the bathrooms smoking.

speaker: PARIS
words: Good idea. You check the east men's rooms, I'll check the west ones.
CUT TO GRAND HALL
[Lane watches Henry in Act 3, interpreted as businessmen with cell phones]

speaker: HENRY
words: I am hurt. A plague on both your houses! Oh, I am sped. What, is he gone and hath nothing?
CUT TO HALLWAY

speaker: PARIS
words: I knew he was going to do this, but no one wanted to listen to me. It was all, let's make Tristin Romeo, he's hot.

speaker: RORY
words: What about Brad?

speaker: PARIS
words: Brad transferred schools. [Tristin walks up to them] Where have you been? You have to get dressed, we're on in ten minutes.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Can't.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Actually, my dad had me pulled out of school. He… [Paris walks away] … and is she unhappy.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean he had you pulled out of school? What happened?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Nothing. Just ticked the old man off, that's all.

speaker: RORY
words: By doing what? Tristin, come on, tell me.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I got in some trouble.

speaker: RORY
words: Trouble involving?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Involving Duncan and Bowman, and Bowman's dad's safe.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I mean, Bowman had a key. It was supposed to be no big deal. And the crazy silent alarm kicked in.

speaker: RORY
words: You broke into Bowman's dad's safe?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Stupid.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, okay, you can apologize and you can put back the money and you can explain that, I don't know, you were going through something.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I was, I was going through his safe.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you do this?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I don't know. I guess that's something I can ponder at military school.

speaker: RORY
words: Military school?

speaker: TRISTIN
words: The police are letting our parents handle it, and in my case that means military school in North Carolina.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't know what to say.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, I imagine you're overwhelmed with the relief in knowing that soon I will be gone.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm so sorry.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: Well, I'm a big boy. I can handle it.

speaker: RORY
words: There's nothing you can…
[Tristin's dad calls him from down the hall]

speaker: MR. Dugray
words: Tristin, come on.

speaker: TRISTIN
words: I gotta go. So, I might kiss you goodbye but, uh, your boyfriend's watching. Take care of yourself, Mary.
[Tristin leaves. Paris comes back dressed as Romeo]

speaker: PARIS
words: What are you standing there for? Let's go. You better start sucking on an Altoid.
CUT TO GRAND HALL
[The group performs Act 5 with Paris as Romeo]

speaker: PARIS
words: A dateless bargain to engrossing death! Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavory guide! Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on the dashing rocks thy seasick weary bark! Here's to my love! Oh true apothecary! Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.
CUT TO CLASSROOM
[Lorelai and Sookie walk into a classroom to retrieve their coats]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wasn't that great? I mean, just watching it made me feel smarter. Don't you feel smarter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, just the opposite actually.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We should do something else good for us. Go to a museum or play chess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I promised Rory we'd go to Luke's afterwards.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, even better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Although, I gotta tell ya, I am still pretty peeved by how he acted earlier. I swear, that guy runs so hot and cold on me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, one minute he's all sweet and building me a chuppah, and the next he's being a total jerk for God knows what reason.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: For God knows what reason? Come on Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Don't you understand that Luke is so into you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, stop.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He has had to watch you go from one guy to another, and then the engagement, and then the engagement was off, and patiently he's waited. And now in walks this kid and he says, 'My God, will she date anyone else in the world before she'll date me?'

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, that…

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey, maybe it's crazy, maybe it's irrational, but it's there. Just look the guy in the eye, it's right there.
CUT TO LUKE'S DINER
[Lorelai, Rory, Sookie, and Dean walk in]

speaker: DEAN
words: So, did you and Paris actually kiss or was that like a stage thing?

speaker: RORY
words: A lady never kisses and tells.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you guys get a table. I'll be right there.
[they sit down while Lorelai walks over to Luke at the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: How'd it go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you know, I think Shakespeare will recover.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, are you good at dating?

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dating, do you have that down?

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, if this is about that kid, then…

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it's not about anything, it's just a question.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I don't know if I have it down. Considering I live with my nephew, I'd say probably not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't have it down either. I've never been very good at it really. I've never even really liked it. Too much 'what if'. I like things I can count on. I mean, uh, actually, with Max, it was the first time I was finally like 'Hey, here it is, that one person who will always be there for me.' And then, I turned around, and it's suddenly 'Oops, wrong, keep moving.'

speaker: LUKE
words: Why are you telling me this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't have very many people in my life who are in my life permanently forever. They will always be there for me. I will always be there for them, you know? There's Rory, and Sookie, and this town and ... you. I mean, at least I think I've got...

speaker: LUKE
words: You do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Just checking

speaker: LUKE
words: Tell me about Romeo and Juliet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it's so depressing because everybody dies, but the clothes were so cute.

speaker: LUKE
words: Life can be funny that way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And Rory… [scene fades out]
THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are building a snowman in the center of town.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: How do you like that mouth?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, it's not very mouthlike.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I think it works.

speaker: RORY
words: It's tilted to the side.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, no, it was intentional. It gives her a unique expression.

speaker: RORY
words: Like she had a stroke?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, I'll just use the Mrs. Potato Head lips.

speaker: RORY
words: No, forget it, leave stroke-mouth. It's not like we're gonna win this anyway.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoa, bad attitude.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, face it. That is the single most incredible snowman I have ever seen. [looks at a man working on an elaborate snow sculpture]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry, that snowman is way over the top, way too showy. It's screaming 'I'm incredible, I'm special, look at me.'

speaker: RORY
words: Kind of the point of a snowman-building contest.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, I hate this man with every fiber of my being.

speaker: RORY
words: He looks nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's a ringer.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you figure?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Someone recruited him, promised him a handsome sum, financed his theatrical snowman accoutrements, so he could snatch victory away from a deserving local in order to bag the contest prize for himself.

speaker: RORY
words: Seems a little elaborate considering that the prize is a set of new US quarters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, we're ignoring him now. So, what are we gonna do on your school break?

speaker: RORY
words: A lot of nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds good.

speaker: RORY
words: Plus some homework.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And a lot of movies.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, we have to rent Godfather 3 on DVD.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're kidding.

speaker: RORY
words: In the audio commentary, Coppola actually defends casting Sofia.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now that is fatherly love. What's all this homework you have to do?

speaker: RORY
words: Just stuff for the paper.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because Paris wants the first issue back to be a double issue, so we have to prep over break and she says the news never sleeps.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about Paris, does she ever sleep?

speaker: RORY
words: I think she periodically makes a whirring noise and then just shuts down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you can't work the whole time.

speaker: RORY
words: I won't, I promise. Oh my God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: He's power buffing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, now that is just wrong.

speaker: RORY
words: We're competing against the Michelangelo of snow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And we're Ernest Builds a Snowman.

speaker: RORY
words: We shouldn't look at him anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Heads down, stay focused.

speaker: RORY
words: We can do this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely.
[their snowman's head falls off]

speaker: RORY
words: Let's get some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right behind you.
OPENING CREDITS
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Michel is at the front desk on the phone. In the background, Rune is jumping up and down trying to dust a picture frame.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: [oh phone] Yes, you can rent a car in Manhattan and return it in Hartford. That's…that's no problem, sir. Yes. Yes, you can return it to Bradley International. That's…that's very convenient. Or you…you can…um, you - hold please. [puts phone down, walks over to Rune and grabs his arm]

speaker: RUNE
words: Ah!

speaker: MICHEL
words: Stop that.

speaker: RUNE
words: Stop what?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Stop jumping like a Mexican bean.

speaker: RUNE
words: Well, Lorelai asked me to dust the picture frames. How do you suggest that I clean the top, smartie? [Michel takes the picture off the wall] Well, I didn't know that you could do that.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, I am miraculously talented, aren't I?

speaker: RUNE
words: I thought an alarm would go off like in The Thomas Crown Affair.

speaker: MICHEL
words: That would be if this was a museum, and you were a man allowed in museums.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, no bickering in the lobby, guys.

speaker: RUNE
words: Where are we allowed to bicker?
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You've got all the mushrooms? You double checked?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I've triple checked. I've quadruple checked.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The shitake, the nameko, the chanterelle?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Once again, I've got it all.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The matsutake? The makeniya?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh wait.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I don't have makeniya.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You don't have makeniya?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I don't have makeniya.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I made it up. [giggles] You passed the test.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Don't test me.
[Lorelai walks in the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, the auditions are starting. You wanna come watch?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, yes!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Auditions for what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Musicians.

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the Bracebridge Dinner.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Geez, you guys are going crazy with this dinner.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, I told you, this dinner is not just about food. We are recreating an authentic 19th century meal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The servers are all gonna be in period clothing, they're gonna speak period English. Here, look at the costumes.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Nice.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We're talking seven courses here. Soup, fish, Peacock Pie, the Baron of Beef, the salad, then the Plum Pudding and the Wassail.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And there's gonna be a big raised platform where the Squire of Bracebridge is going to preside over the festivities.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, he tastes the foods and makes pronouncements. He's like the host of the evening, and his costume is the coolest.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: JACKSON
words: It all sounds great.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, it is, it is. By the way, you're playing Squire Bracebridge. Ready?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let's go.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah. [they leave]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Huh? What was that?
CUT TO LOBBY

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What are we looking at today?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, this is the last on our list. We've already got our trumpets, our madrigal singers…

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh, sorry to interrupt but I'm not playing Squire Bracebridge.
