speaker: LORELAI
words: We've got all our servers lined up. This is just for recorder players and harpists. Hi. Uh, lay some on us guys.
[two recorder players play]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey, you cats really know how to blow those things.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You've got the gig. I will call you later with the details. Thanks.
[the recorder players leave]

speaker: JACKSON
words: So are we clear on this? I'm not playing Squire Bracebridge. Sorry you were under the impression that I'd do this.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: When do the guests arrive?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thursday at four - on their own jet.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: After buying out the whole inn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Must be nice to have money.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh! Hey, you know what struck me today?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Was it the fact that I'm not the Squire - did that strike you?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: We are crazy for doing this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're beyond crazy. We are 'Anne Heche speaking her secret language to God and looking for the spaceship in Fresno' crazy.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh Quiness, nokka don atta.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Il ek notra doska donne.

speaker: JACKSON
words: And springing this on me at the last minute too, I mean, that's just manipulative.
[a chef comes out of the kitchen]

speaker: CHEF
words: Sookie, fire! [leaves]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I gotta get back in the kitchen. You'll handle the harp?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You got it.

speaker: JACKSON
words: All right, okay, I'll do it. I'll play Squire Bracebridge if that's what you want. Geez.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Thanks Sweetie. [walks to kitchen]

speaker: JACKSON
words: As long as it's not just because I fit the costume. It's because I fit the costume, isn't it? [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [to harpist] Go ahead.
[Lorelai's cell phone rings while the harpist is playing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [answers phone] Hi, it's Lorelai.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey Lor, it's me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hi Chris, how are you?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good, good. You, uh, got a minute?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It's not an uh oh, I just wanted to run an idea by you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Run it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Now it's totally your call and I don't want to step on any plans you've already made, but I know Rory has a break in school coming up, and I was wondering if you'd be cool with her coming to visit for a couple of days.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uhh, a couple of days? You mean she'd stay the night?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, it's totally your call. Where are you, heaven?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you even have room for someone to stay?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not just room - a room. A designated guest room. Sherry fixed it up really nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aww, good for her.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So what do you think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know. It's awfully last minute.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER

speaker: LORELAI

speaker: LORELAI

words: I don't know. The man is so sensitive. He reads so much into every little perceived slight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. I remember one time when I was a kid, Dad had put on some weight, and he bought a new suit to try to cover it up. And he wore it for us and he said, 'How do I look?' and I said, 'You look fat.' [pause] But I guess that wasn't really a perceived slight…so, I'll think of another example.

speaker: SOOKIE

words: Who me? [reads transcript] 'Whatever we can do to Kirk you're driving me crazy.' Yeah, me. Ah, sorry.

words: Yeah.

words: It's supposed to mean, do you have anything going on tonight?

speaker: PARIS
words: Here?

words: Yeah. We have a ton of food, and it's like a whole big show and everything, and if you're not doing anything…

words: I'm fine, everything's fine.

words: I also want to thank Mother Nature for snowing in the Trelling Paper Company in Chicago so I can throw this great party for all my friends instead. It's a very special night. And so, since I don't get to eat unbelievably strange food with my friends everyday, I have arranged a little surprise. Outside, as we speak, is a line of horse drawn sleighs and everybody gets a ride. So, uh, line up and keep it orderly. There's two per sleigh and no cutting in front of each other - that goes for everyone. Except me, 'cause I'll be damned if I'm gonna miss a ride in a horse drawn sleigh. Come on.

speaker: LUKE
words: Me and Jess? Great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great? Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good.

speaker: LUKE
words: It is good. I mean, it was hard at first, seemed impossible, you know, but I've learned a lot these past couple months.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like?

speaker: LUKE
words: Like last week I discovered the secret of parenting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The secret of parenting?

speaker: LUKE
words: The secret of parenting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When last week? Last Tuesday?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don't know the exact day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 15, is that when you discovered the secret of parenting?

speaker: LUKE
words: Don't mock.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, tell me. What is. . . oh wait, it's a secret, you can't tell me.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I'll tell you. You visualize the reality you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You visualize the reality you want.

speaker: LUKE
words: And then if necessary, you lie to bring it about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so much worse than I was expecting.

speaker: LUKE
words: You never lied to your kid?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ahh, to save her from great physical pain, yes. When she was little and she would play in the kitchen, I told her that the burners were the devil's hands, but I would say it in a really scary evangelist voice, you know, 'Don't touch the devil's hands!' She still doesn't go near the stove.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, exactly. You told a little white lie for your kid's protection, very similar to what I've done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which was?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, you know the winter break is coming up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I do.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, well that means Jess has some time off from school. His mom knew that and she never called.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, it makes me sick

speaker: LUKE
words: So I decided just to keep Jess with me, and I told him that his mom wanted him to come home but I thought since he just got there and was still adjusting that I thought he should stay, and his mom was really upset but I insisted. He bought it hook, line and sinker. Saved him a lot of hurt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He didn't buy it.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? Of course he did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He knows.
[cut to Richard and Emily's sleigh]

speaker: EMILY
words: I wish Lorelai had warned us about this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What? This is wonderful..

speaker: EMILY
words: It's wreaking havoc with my hair.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh this is not bad for your hair, compared to the other thing.

speaker: EMILY
words: What other thing? [Richard tousles her hair] Richard, stop it! Stop it! Suddenly you're two years old.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I'm just having fun.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not complaining.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is fun too. This is like a roller coaster.

speaker: EMILY
words: A little.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Say, when was the last time we were on a roller coaster?

speaker: EMILY
words: Never.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Didn't we ever go to Coney Island?

speaker: EMILY
words: That must've been your other wife.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Gosh, I used to love it when I was a kid. They were a lot faster then too.

speaker: EMILY
words: And less safe.

speaker: RICHARD
words: We should go on one.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: A fast one.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine. You go and I'll wait and hold your cotton candy for you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You are going.

speaker: EMILY
words: It would take a whole day.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You are going.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'd be scared.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'll hold your hand.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine. We'll go on a roller coaster.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now where is this roller coaster we're going on?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I'm not sure. I'll get Rory to look it up on the Internet for us.
[cut to Rory getting in a sleigh]

speaker: DRIVER
words: That it miss?

speaker: RORY
words: I guess I'm alone.
[The sleigh starts going. Jess jumps into the seat next to Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: JESS
words: Well, I heard it was two to a sleigh - no more, no less. You were breaking the rules.

speaker: RORY
words: You could've hurt yourself.

speaker: JESS
words: I live on the edge. I can jump out if you want.

speaker: RORY
words: Doesn't matter to me.

speaker: JESS
words: Are you mad at me or something?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you think?

speaker: JESS
words: I can't read your mind.

speaker: RORY
words: You got into a fight with Dean.

speaker: JESS
words: Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: My boyfriend.

speaker: JESS
words: Ah. He's still your boyfriend?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, you can jump out now.

speaker: JESS
words: I wasn't fighting him. I was fighting someone else. He jumped in on his own.

speaker: RORY
words: He was trying to help you.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, he should go into government service if he's so interested in helping people. But me, he can stop worrying about.

speaker: RORY
words: Why were you fighting in the first place?

speaker: JESS
words: 'Cause Chuck Presby's a jerk.

speaker: RORY
words: You were fighting Chuck Presby?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, he is a jerk.

speaker: JESS
words: This whole town is weird and full of jerks.

speaker: RORY
words: Then why are you still here?

speaker: JESS
words: What do you mean?

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, school's out and you don't like it here, so why don't you just go home?

speaker: JESS
words: My mom didn't want me to.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't believe that.

speaker: JESS
words: That's your right, I guess.

speaker: RORY
words: Did Luke say she didn't want you to?

speaker: JESS
words: Luke told me it was his idea that I should stay. It wasn't his idea. That's good.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: Your snowman. Snowwoman, actually.

speaker: RORY
words: You know which one is ours?

speaker: JESS
words: It definitely has the most personality. Kind of looks like Bjork.

speaker: RORY
words: That's what we were going for.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: But everyone thinks the one on the end is gonna be the winner.

speaker: JESS
words: Really? It's so overdone.

speaker: RORY
words: I agree.

speaker: JESS
words: You should win.

speaker: RORY
words: No argument.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey, what do you and Dean talk about?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: I mean, does he know Bjork?

speaker: RORY
words: I've played him some stuff.

speaker: JESS
words: Hm. So you got a teacher-student thing going?

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: JESS
words: No, really, I'm curious. What do you guys talk about?

speaker: RORY
words: Everything.

speaker: JESS
words: Like?

speaker: RORY
words: Just everything, tons of stuff, whatever.

speaker: JESS
words: It's just in the brief non-pugilistic time I've spent with him in class, he just doesn't seem like your kind of guy.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, he is my kind of guy. He's exactly my kind of guy.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay. I guess I don't know him that well.

speaker: RORY
words: You don't. You don't.
CUT TO INN DINING ROOM
[All of the guests are seated at a long table. Lorelai stands at the head of the table with a camera.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Quiet please, everybody. Before the, uh, button popping and the bloating can commence, say cheese.

speaker: EVERYONE
words: Cheese!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, now, ladies and gentlemen, damen und herren, um, the moment you've been waiting for, I give you the Bracebridge Dinner.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Whoa, whoa, hold it. We just need a quick minute, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which will be starting in one quick minute.

speaker: BOOTSY
words: You ever think about that? You can't have a quick minute because it's always sixty seconds.

speaker: LUKE
words: Shut up.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Lorelai darling, who is the silver fox with the tight kneesocks?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that's Claude. He's one of our regular servers, divorced and on the market.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, well the uniform is interesting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. I'll have him bathed, powdered, and sent to your room.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: What? Oh, you joke? Was that a joke?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, this is just beautiful. It's like something out of Architectural Digest. You should be very proud.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks Dad.

speaker: EMILY
words: Your dress needs pressing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks Mom.
[Lorelai sits down next to Rory]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your pod Grandpa is still happy as a clam.

speaker: RORY
words: See, I told you this would be good for him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When you're right, you're right.

speaker: RUNE
words: Welcome Lords and Ladies. I call upon these sprightly horns to commence our proceedings. [horns play] Hey Chuck Mangione, you wanna back up a step?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And we're off.

speaker: RUNE
words: And now, fair people, I present my Lord and Master, the honorable Squire Bracebridge.
[Jackson enters the room dressed as the Squire]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Lo! Now has come our joyfullest feast. Let every man be jolly.

speaker: JESS
words: We should've eaten before we came.

speaker: LUKE
words: Shh! And yeah.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Humble servant, bring us the first course to dine with pleasure. Mmm, methinks it be a butternut squash soup.

speaker: RUNE
words: Ah, methinks you're right Squire Bracebridge, thus and verily.

speaker: JACKSON
words: And verily thus.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're the Old England Abbot and Costello.

speaker: JACKSON
words: 'Tis perfection, but extremely hot.

speaker: RUNE
words: My Lord, do you need aid? Wouldst thou have thee ice thy tongue?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Ah nay, Rune, nay. To the guests thou shall serve the soup!

speaker: JESS
words: What's the white stuff?

speaker: LUKE
words: I think it's cheese - or cream.

speaker: JESS
words: And the green stuff?

speaker: LUKE
words: I think it's…best picked off.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No one says grace?

speaker: LANE
words: I think they all do Mama, uh, silently.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Did you say silent grace?

speaker: BABETTE
words: [laughs] Good one!
[Mrs. Kim stares at her. Babette quickly bows her head and nudges for Morey to do the same. Cut to Kirk serving soup to Lorelai and Rory]

speaker: KIRK
words: Soup for mi'ladies?

speaker: RORY
words: Why thank you, kind sir.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Kirk, nice blouse.

speaker: RORY
words: Don't let her make fun of you Kirk. You look great.

speaker: KIRK
words: Soup with garlands, gay and rosemary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're gonna stay in character no matter what, huh?

speaker: KIRK
words: 'Tis hot, so proceed daintily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you ever see that I Love Lucy where she goes to Buckingham Palace?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She tries to get the palace guard to break character. That was a funny one.

speaker: KIRK
words: 'Tis foreign to me good lady.

speaker: RORY
words: Hang in there, Kirk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Those ones where she was in Europe, hands down, those were the best!

speaker: KIRK
words: No way, the Hollywood ones!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha!

speaker: KIRK
words: Damn!

speaker: RORY
words: I was rooting for you boy.
[Cut to later that evening]

speaker: RUNE
words: My Lord, shall dessert be served?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Anon, humble servant.

speaker: CLARA
words: Can I eat my dessert with the horses?

speaker: DEAN
words: Sure, uh, but put your coat on.

speaker: CLARA
words: Are you okay?

speaker: BOOTSY
words: I guess so. I've lost track of how many beers I've had.

speaker: CLARA
words: Seven.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Paris, how's it going?

speaker: PARIS
words: Fine, good, thanks for having me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it was our pleasure.

speaker: PARIS
words: Did you notice the anachronisms?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The what?

speaker: PARIS
words: The period discrepancies. They were pretty blatant. I mean, forget that the nineteenth century didn't include recessed lighting or the Fossil watch that your server was wearing, but water in that period would not have been served with cubed ice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: PARIS
words: And your servers are wearing nylon blend shirts, and nylon was invented by a scientist at Dupont in the 1920's. It shattered the illusion.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Floggings will be administered.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So there we are, it's a beautiful moonlit Prague night, and we're strolling across the Charles Bridge when we come across this group of kids blasting this song by that. . .oh, that awful woman. Who is she? The tall bony one, married to the deceased mustachioed congressman.

speaker: RORY
words: Cher?

speaker: EMILY
words: That's the one!

speaker: LORELAI
words: The year of 'Do you believe in life after love?'

speaker: RORY
words: A difficult time for all of us.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I like that song.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I was appalled. Prague has played host to some of the greatest composers in history. Mozart named a symphony after it, for heaven's sake. So what did I do?

speaker: EMILY
words: I have tried so hard to forget this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I stood beside them and their boombox and I hummed Mozart's Prague Symphony as loud as I could. [starts humming]

speaker: LORELAI
words: A bizarro Battle of the Bands.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: And did it work?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, they quickly packed up and went their way.

speaker: EMILY
words: But then he kept on humming the Mozart. He wouldn't stop.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, at that point I was hoping for some gullible tourists to drop money at my feet.

speaker: EMILY
words: And two of them did.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I kept it!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You know, this might be the most interesting conversation I've ever had with an insurance man.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Aww, I'm hurt.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I'm sorry Richard. What I meant was that…

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, what you meant was that people in the insurance industry are drones. Well I agree. They are a dull, dull lot, and I am glad to be rid of them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rid of them?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, are you retired Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, uh…

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course he's not. Richard? Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Actually, I am.
CUT TO BEDROOM
[Later that evening, Lorelai and Rory are in their room at the inn getting ready for bed.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, it's always nice to end a big festive meal with a big festive pall hanging over the room.

speaker: RORY
words: Most people didn't notice anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I guess. Bootsy singing Hotel California accompanied by spoons drew people's attention away.

speaker: RORY
words: Did Grandma and Grandpa say a word to each other the rest of the night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn't he tell anyone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm sorry, are you asking me to interpret my parents' motives?

speaker: RORY
words: My mistake. So which bed do you want?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take the one by the window.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [pulls back blanket] Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What honey?

speaker: RORY
words: You put the picture of the ugly baby in my bed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't, I swear. That ugly baby is stalking us. Run away!

speaker: RORY
words: Poor baby, it's not his fault.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think it's a she.

speaker: RORY
words: Poor baby, you picked the wrong parents. Hey, have you heard from Dad recently?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What dad - your dad?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, my dad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because he's my dad, and he usually checks in this time of year and he hasn't checked in yet. I mean, I know he's probably busy with Sherry and the new apartment and...what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: There may have been a call.

speaker: RORY
words: There may have been? You don't remember?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well things have been so hectic, you know, with the Bracebridge Dinner, and um, building a snowwoman, and planning the ugly baby gag, that took time.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, he called! He called, he called, he called and invited you, and it's not too late to go. He called and invited you, so there you go. I'm sorry I didn't tell you, so there.

speaker: RORY
words: He invited me over?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, are you deaf?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'm just trying to separate the gist from the ubububububah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, the gist is he invited you, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn't he invite me himself?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because he's pretending to be considerate by running it past me first.

speaker: RORY
words: Was he maybe not pretending to be considerate, and actually being considerate?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe. But I wouldn't put it past him to be inconsiderate. The guy doesn't have the greatest track record.

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn't you tell me this? He's probably waiting for my answer, and holding off making plans.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I have dibs on this time of year with you, not him! Me! And yes, he acknowledged that, and that was cool and all, but still - it stinks! Because he put me in a very difficult position because we were supposed to watch a lot of movies and make fun of Godfather 3, and the thing that I really, really hate about this is…is the idea of you not hanging out with me because you're hanging out there with your stupid stepmother.

speaker: RORY
words: You're calling Sherry my stepmother?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she practically is.

speaker: RORY
words: You're wigging.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There is something wrong with that woman.

speaker: RORY
words: You don't even know her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You think I'm overreacting?

speaker: RORY
words: I think you're jealous of Sherry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha, I'm not jealous of Sherry.

speaker: RORY
words: But I understand - your territory has been threatened.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: But relax, there are ways to work through situations like this - compromises can be struck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, what are you saying?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you know, I can still call you Mom, and I'll call her Mommy Sherry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't be mean.

speaker: RORY
words: And we can split up holidays evenly. Like, I'll be with you on Labor Day…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: … her on Memorial Day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Enough.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll have to find out about her religion though to see how Chanukah will factor into this, unless you want to convert to Judaism and then take over Chanukah for yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I get the point. I overreacted. Please stop.

speaker: RORY
words: You totally overreacted. God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So do you think you're gonna go and stay with them?

speaker: RORY
words: I'll have to think about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you have to think about it because you know that it's killing me not to know whether you're going or not and you want to torture me like that?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, I just don't know if I want to do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: It was nice of him to ask though.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was very nice.

speaker: RORY
words: 'Cause we are rooting for Dad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We are rooting for him. It was a very nice thing that Christopher offered. I was being a little possessive.

speaker: RORY
words: And insanely jealous of his pretty girlfriend.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I wanna know if she's good enough for him.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So there was an altruistic streak to my madness.

speaker: RORY
words: We'll go with that.
[there's a knock at the door. Lorelai answers, Emily is there.]

speaker: EMILY
words: I need a new room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't stay in that room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There are no other rooms, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, then I'll go home.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, it's late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And pitch black, and the roads are icy. You can't be driving.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I'm not going back to that room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm guessing you and Dad had it out about the job thing?

speaker: EMILY
words: We haven't even spoken since dinner. I'm so upset, I wouldn't know where to begin. And I couldn't take being around him anymore. What he did is inexcusable. Not letting me know he left his job - as if it didn't affect me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw mom, try to calm down. Here, take this bed, and Rory and I will share.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm just a burden.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're not a burden, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, okay, thank you. Can I use the mirror in the bathroom for a second?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I'll use the one out here.
[Rory watches as Lorelai and Emily both apply cream to their face]

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Behold my future.

speaker: EMILY
words: How do you turn out the light?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'll get it.

speaker: EMILY
words: I still can't believe it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Try to relax Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I hope he doesn't sleep because I surely won't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: These slippers you have here are hardly one size fits all. They're too big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Goodnight.

speaker: EMILY
words: It was so irresponsible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe he had no choice.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course he had a choice. Go to sleep Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That job was killing him, Mom. It was killing him.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm going for a little walk.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma, it's late.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm not tired.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like sands through the hourglass, so are the Gilmores of our lives.
CUT TO LOBBY
[Emily walks in and finds Richard sitting on the sofa]

speaker: EMILY
words: I didn't know you were here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, don't go.

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm very tired.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I want to talk to you, please. I don't need to remind you about how I've been feeling at work, and my frustration just built to the point where…again, you know this. So, I arranged to meet the CEO yesterday just to talk about the situation and about the rumors I'd heard floating around. So I met with Floyd. We shook hands, had coffee, then I started telling him about how unhappy I'd become. I detailed all my years with the company, all the travel I'd done, all the weekends I put in, the sacrifices I'd made, including time with my family, for the firm. And the more I talked, the angrier I became, and then suddenly I heard myself resign, just like that. Floyd was stunned. I'd never seen Floyd stunned. I enjoyed seeing Floyd stunned. So I finished my coffee and I walked out of that office, and I couldn't believe what I'd just done. I'd resigned, quit. I believe I even used a little profanity in the process. But you know what Emily? I was thrilled, elated, a giant weight had been lifted off my chest

speaker: EMILY
words: And you chose not to tell me? Your own wife.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh Emily, I know I've done nothing but disappoint you these past few months, what with how isolated I've become and all the social engagements I've made you cancel, and all the friendships I've jeopardized. And you like order, you like lists, you like to know where you're going or what's coming. You like all things planned. And then suddenly I impulsively unplan our entire future in one fail swoop. Well, I couldn't face disappointing you again. I couldn't face telling you that I'd spoiled the plan. Not now, not at this time of year. I didn't want to fight, I didn't want to worry, I just wanted to keep being happy. I'm very, very sorry. Anyhow, um, I've been sitting here going over our financial situation. Now, um, we still have all of our retirement accounts, and our medical coverage is all there, By quitting though, we do forgo some of my pension and some stock options. Not a terribly significant amount, but an amount all the same.

words: Sookie, Jackson's hiding in the closet.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes he is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why didn't you say something?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, because you were upset and you were bringing Rory over and I didn't want her to feel weird or uncomfortable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you stuck Jackson in the closet?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes she did.

speaker: RORY
words: Jackson, come out.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I'm in my pajamas.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So are we.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah, but mine are humiliating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We won't laugh.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes you will.

speaker: RORY
words: I promise we won't.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I'm fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, are you gonna be fine in there all night 'cause that's how long we're staying - all night.

speaker: RORY
words: And knowing Sookie, she's gonna make a big breakfast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's right, so tonight will last until late tomorrow morning, so the bottom line for you here buddy is you're gonna be holed up in that closet a very, very long time.

speaker: JACKSON
words: If I come out, you have to understand one thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I have a cousin who owns a Xerox company that specializes in taking pictures and making them into things - calendars, coffee mugs, collector plates, and pajamas.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jackson's wearing picture pajamas?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes he is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does he do this often?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Almost every night.

speaker: RORY
words: What are the pictures of?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: During high school.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ahh!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: In his wrestling uniform.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jackson, you have to come out here right now!

speaker: JACKSON
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Because you sound too eager.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm not eager, am I eager?

speaker: RORY
words: Put your paws down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jackson, I'm not eager. I just want you to come out here and be comfortable, that's all.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, okay.
[Jackson opens the closet door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, well honey, we're making milkshakes, you wanna come in and help?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [quietly to Rory] If our house does fall down and we end up living in a hollowed out tree, this moment might make it all worth it.
CUT TO KIM'S ANTIQUES
[Rory walks through the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello? Lane?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: RORY
words: Mrs. Kim, hi. I was just - .

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Out.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Out, out, out!

speaker: RORY
words: But I wiped off my feet.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Move! Move!
[Mrs. Kim ushers Rory outside]

speaker: RORY
words: I was just looking for Lane and I thought that maybe she was - .

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Taylor says you have termites.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't have termites, my house does.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You are a carrier.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't think you can really be a termite carrier.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You'll spread it all over town.

speaker: RORY
words: Mrs. Kim, I swear, we don't control the termites. They move around on their own.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: See all the furniture in there? Wood, all wood. You must go. Go now!

speaker: RORY
words: Can you just tell me if Lane is home?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, do you know where she is?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: School.

speaker: RORY
words: Still?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes, still. She's there, she's studying. What's that moving by your foot?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I see something moving by your foot.

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, there's nothing, I swear.
[Mrs. Kim sprays the hose near Rory's feet]

speaker: RORY
words: Agh! Will you tell her I came by?
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai sits at the living room couch working on the computer. Rory walks over and sits near her.]

speaker: RORY
words: And then she chased me halfway down the street with the hose. It was like a scene from Silkwood.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, news travels way too fast around here.

speaker: RORY
words: Four people asked me when we were tenting, two people asked me if we were moving, and one person asked me if we were atheists.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See, we have to stop talking to people. We have to stay at home with the curtains drawn collecting stacks of old newspapers, muttering to each other, eating nothing but Cup of Soup and Slim Jims.
[phone rings, Rory answers]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hi Rory, it's Madeline.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, hi.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Listen, I have to ask you a little favor.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Well, see, I'm working on an article for the Franklin - totally last minute. But I thought it would be really interesting to compare Chilton's overall PSAT scores to other prep schools in the area.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: MADELINE
words: So I'm trying to compile a list of people's scores, especially the top students, and I realized I don't have yours yet.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, so you wanna know my PSAT scores?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Yes, that would be great.

speaker: RORY
words: Put Paris on the phone.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, let me talk to her.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Oh, Paris isn't here. I don't know where she is. She's probably at her house, or maybe at the library, or maybe she's buying pencils because she goes through them so fast 'cause she pushes down on them really hard and then they break and . . .

speaker: RORY
words: Madeline.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Hold on. [hands phone to Paris]

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Pathetic.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why won't you tell me?

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Tell me those scores, I have to know! Rory?
[Rory hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Paris again?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God. You know, I think if we put Paris and my mother in a room together, the world would implode.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll keep that in mind for the next science fair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Enough. Now I've got computer screens feeling sorry for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Geez, how many places is that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw honey, it's not the amount of places that turns you down that matters, it's the quality of the place that turns you down that matters. And when you've got Jacko's Loans and Stuff not wanting your business, you know it's time to hang out with the Coreys.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's okay. I won't think about it tonight. I'll think about it tomorrow - at Tara. You ready?

speaker: RORY
words: One sec. You know Mom, I hate to bring this up, but I think there's a really obvious solution to our problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know hon.

speaker: RORY
words: You do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. And frankly, I think if I sold you into white slavery, I would miss you.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, please don't go where you're going.

speaker: RORY
words: I think they would say yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course they would say yes. And that yes would be followed by, 'Okay, okay, enough already. My God, please stop. I'm a shell, I've got nothing left to give.'

speaker: RORY
words: That's not true.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is completely true.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandma and Grandpa would wanna help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I went to my parents for you for Chilton. Why? Because that was worth all the obligation. This is not.

speaker: RORY
words: This is our home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, and I'll find a way to fix it.

speaker: RORY
words: But how?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know yet.

speaker: RORY
words: Well if you don't know yet, then maybe there's not another way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There's always another way.

speaker: RORY
words: Was there another way with Chilton?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That was different.

speaker: RORY
words: Why was that different?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I said that was different and I'm the one doing the groveling and the groveling gets you judgment rights and I am judging that this is different.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, the remaining judge begs to differ.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I know you mean well, but I'm not gonna deal with my parents on this one, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: You're being stubborn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, have I shocked you?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, let's go.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting on the living room couch. Emily hands them each a drink, then sits down in the chair.]

speaker: RORY
words: So where's Grandpa tonight?

speaker: EMILY
words: He's at work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, did you explain to him that part of the quitting process means you don't go back to the job you quit?

speaker: EMILY
words: He did not quit, he resigned.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, same rules apply.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, when you resign you have to put in a certain amount of time to get things in order. He has clients to see, certain accounts to close out.

speaker: RORY
words: Is that hard for him?

speaker: EMILY
words: Actually, I think he's rather enjoying it.

speaker: RORY
words: Well good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, it is good. [sees Lorelai taking a pill] What are you taking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Roofies.

speaker: RORY
words: Aspirin.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you getting sick?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I just have a headache.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well having a headache means you're sick. You think it's normal to have a headache?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I just have a tension headache.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, what do you have to be tense about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, I can't begin to think.

speaker: EMILY
words: You should lie down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: You work too hard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I don't.

speaker: EMILY
words: If you didn't work so hard you wouldn't have a tension headache.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not a work tension headache, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: So then you are sick?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, I am, I'm sick.

speaker: EMILY
words: I knew it, what's wrong?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Consumption with a touch of the vapors. I'm going for a leeching tonight after coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: She's got a case of exterminator-itis.

speaker: EMILY
words: What's that mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: We have termites.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh that's terrible!

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not so bad.

speaker: RORY
words: They're eating our whole house.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But they always say thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: What does that mean, they're eating your whole house?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, we found out that we have all these foundation problems and it's going to be very expensive to fix and Mom can't get a loan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is not true.

speaker: RORY
words: You've been turned down by five banks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I made up Jacko's Loans and Stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, four banks.
[Emily walks over to a desk and sits down. Lorelai follows her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, uh, wait. What are you doing?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm writing you a check.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No you're not. Okay, hold on here.

speaker: EMILY
words: How much do you need?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't be ridiculous, just tell me how much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can handle this.

speaker: EMILY
words: It doesn't sound like you can handle it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I can.

speaker: EMILY
words: Fine, if you won't tell me how much, I'll leave the amount blank and you can fill it in later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, stop. [takes Emily's pen out of her hand and walks back to the couch]

speaker: EMILY
words: You took my pen!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I appreciate the thought, but I don't need your money.

speaker: EMILY
words: So you'd rather have your house fall down then let your mother help you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, the house is not gonna fall down. Let's not make this a big issue. Let's just sit down and have a drink and have dinner, okay?

speaker: EMILY
words: All right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you going to give me back my pen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, after dinner.
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory walk through the front door.]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, stop it. Talk to me. [Lorelai ignores her and goes upstairs] It's been two hours since you've even looked in my direction.
CUT TO LORELAI'S BEDROOM
[Lorelai walks in and starts cleaning off her bed. Rory walks in a few seconds later]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I get it, you're mad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, I do not want to talk about this right now.

speaker: ORY
words: You were just being stubborn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go to bed.

speaker: RORY
words: Well you didn't want to ask for help, so I did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, do you remember the conversation we had before we left this house tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, but -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told you going to my parents was not an option.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, but -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: In fact, I told you several times that asking my parents was not an option. Now yes, I might have made a few quips to lighten the subject matter, but I still think I made my point pretty damn clear.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, but we have a real problem here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you think I don't know that? You think I sit around all day swapping witticisms with Robert Benchley at the Algonquin? No! I am thinking and worrying and using the computer and I hate using the computer!

speaker: RORY
words: Which is exactly why I brought this up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You had no right to bring it up!

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I told you not to, that's why!

speaker: RORY
words: But -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, there are no buts! There will be no buts here! There's 'I'm sorry Mom', there's 'I screwed up Mom', there's 'I'll never do it again Mom', but there are no buts!

speaker: RORY
words: But -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Out!

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go to bed. We're done.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW HIGH
[Rory sits on the front steps reading. From behind, Dean throws a basketball towards her]

speaker: DEAN
words: Think fast! Very good.

speaker: RORY
words: You threw a basketball at my head.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I threw a basketball past your head.

speaker: RORY
words: What if I had turned around when you said that?

speaker: DEAN
words: Then you might've caught it, thereby completing the whole 'think fast' equation.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't catch basketballs.

speaker: DEAN
words: Duly noted.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't even like basketballs.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, I'm very sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: In fact, out of all the sporting balls in the world, the basketball is probably my least favorite.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: They're round and hard.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: And they're orange.

speaker: DEAN
words: And you do realize how insane you sound right now?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, just checking.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry, I'm in a horrible mood.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hadn't noticed.

speaker: RORY
words: It's just, we've had fights before.

speaker: DEAN
words: You and me?

speaker: RORY
words: Me and Mom.

speaker: DEAN
words: Ah.

speaker: RORY
words: But this one is particularly crazy. I mean, we have a situation here and she's being so stubborn.

speaker: DEAN
words: Huh.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: What what?

speaker: RORY
words: What was with the huh?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: No, there was a meaning behind that huh. That was a loaded huh. That was not a normal huh. You meant to say something with that huh, and now you're taking it back.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, now. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Don't use that kind of huh if you're not prepared to defend it. Why aren't you saying anything?

speaker: DEAN
words: Because words are a very dangerous thing right now.

speaker: RORY
words: You were saying that I'm stubborn just like my mother.

speaker: DEAN
words: I was saying that in addition to all of the wonderful amazing qualities that the two of you share there is possibly, on occasion, a similar tendency to dig your heels in.

speaker: RORY
words: I hate it when we fight.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: She was so mad.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well you'll make up. You wanna get a coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: All right, I'll go get my ball.
[As Dean walks away, some cheerleaders walk out of the school. Rory sees that Lane is one of them. They make eye contact and quickly look away as Dean returns with a flattened ball.]

speaker: DEAN
words: If it makes you feel any better, a car ran over it.

speaker: RORY
words: I need to get coffee now.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai walks through the lobby talking on the phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Mr. Regalsky, it's Lorelai Gilmore. Again, yes, just like the pink bunny with the drum. Uh, anyway, I was wondering if, um, you have had a chance to reconsider my loan? . . . Uh, no, I think it's Energizer. . . I know you said no, but um, you know sometimes people say no and then they wake up one morning a couple of days later and think, 'Hey, maybe I shouldn't have turned down that nice single mom with the good job and the great credentials and the references up the wazoo' . . . I do like the word wazoo. . . I understand. . .Okay, well, I'll give you a call in a couple of days then. . . Thank you. [hangs up]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Perhaps you are taking the wrong approach.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Meaning?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, you've tried to convince them of your virtue, perhaps it's time to offer them a lap dance. You didn't.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was kidding, sort of.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Oh dear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well I have to do something and I'm not sure exactly where to draw the line.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You know in Thailand, women do this trick with a Ping-Pong ball that is a big crowd pleaser.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Line drawn, thank you.
[phone rings, Michel answers]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn, Michel speaking. Ah, yes. She is right here. [hands phone to Lorelai] Your mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I called to tell you I talked to Miles Hahn today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that sounds very nice, I'm glad.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have any idea who Miles Hahn is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not a bit.

speaker: EMILY
words: He's the president of the First National Bank. We've been doing business with him for years. He's become a very dear friend of ours actually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What does that have to do with me Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I brought up your little dilemma to him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you wrangled me a meeting at your bank?

speaker: EMILY
words: I asked a friend for advice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What else did you ask him for Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I simply asked a man to talk to you. What you talk about or what comes out of that talk is strictly up to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, thanks Mom, but I'm fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: So you got a loan?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got a lead.

speaker: EMILY
words: A lead on a loan?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: How nice. Now if you could just get an actual loan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay Mom, I gotta get back to work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, tell your friend thank you, but I'm afraid I won't be able to make it.

speaker: EMILY
words: He'll be there whether you show up or not, it's up to you. All I did was make an appointment Lorelai, that's all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Great. Bye Mom. [hangs up, then dials a number] Hi, Mr. Regalsky please? It's Lorelai Gilmore. . . Oh, I just spoke to him five minutes ago. . . . When do you expect him back from France?
CUT TO OUTSIDE LUKE'S
[Rory and Dean walk out of the diner.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, so uh, I'll call you later.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks for the coffee.

speaker: DEAN
words: You're welcome. [they kiss] Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. [Rory kisses him again] That's for me not thinking fast.

speaker: DEAN
words: Please never think fast again.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll try my hardest.
[Dean walks away. Rory sees Lane across the street, and they walk towards each other.]

speaker: LANE
words: We need to talk.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, let's talk. Nice outfit.

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: So I guess this is why you've been AWOL for the past couple of weeks?

speaker: LANE
words: Pretty much.

speaker: RORY
words: So what, you just had the urge to stand on top of another girl's shoulders?

speaker: LANE
words: Don't be like that.

speaker: RORY
words: Like what?

speaker: LANE
words: Like you're being. It makes it impossible to tell you.

speaker: RORY
words: You didn't tell me.

speaker: LANE
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: Because.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, have you ever thought of being a prosecutor because I think you've got real potential.

speaker: LANE
words: I didn't tell you because I knew you'd act like this.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I'm acting like this because you didn't tell me.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, so if I'd come up to you and I'd said, 'Rory, I'm wanna become a cheerleader,' you would've said. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LANE
words: Exactly.

speaker: RORY
words: Exactly what? Lane, this is weird. I mean, we always used to make fun of cheerleaders. You and I, we would rag on Janie Fertman and hide during pep rallies and now all of a sudden, you're peppy.

speaker: LANE
words: I'm not peppy.

speaker: RORY
words: Well you look peppy.

speaker: LANE
words: Look, you're not around much anymore.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, so this is my fault?

speaker: LANE
words: And you have Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: So this is his fault?

speaker: LANE
words: It's just . . .I don't know. I don't know why. I just wanted to do it. I just wanted to try it, and I don't feel like I should have to justify it to you or explain it to you or...

speaker: RORY
words: Then don't!

speaker: LANE
words: Fine I won't.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LANE
words: All right. I forgot my pom.

speaker: RORY
words: Your what?

speaker: LANE
words: Two are pompoms, one's a pom!
CUT TO LORELAI'S HOUSE
[Out front, Luke is lying halfway under the porch as Lorelai sits nearby]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, how's it look?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's dark. Hand me the flashlight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don't you have one of those hats with the lights on them?

speaker: LUKE
words: I flip burgers for a living.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, right.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay. I think I've seen enough. [comes out from under the porch]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well how was it? Was there like a termite housing development under there? Golf courses and condos with rec rooms?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's actually not too bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well what do you know? You flip burgers for a living.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, there's definitely a little damage.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but Kirk says that the joists were totally gone.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, they are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that the foundation has lost all its structural integrity.

speaker: LUKE
words: That's true too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay great, so I'm still screwed.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not necessarily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, I need fifteen thousand dollars which I can't find, don't have, and if I don't find, the house is gonna fall down.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can help you with that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I can get a couple guys, we can get in there and do the work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can fix this?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I can help. I know a good contractor. He did some work on the diner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about the money?

speaker: LUKE
words: Um, you won't have to deal with that right away.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I won't?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, you can pay it out in installments if you want. Monthly, bimonthly, whatever - whatever you're comfortable with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, let me get this straight. Uh, you and some guys who actually know what they're doing are gonna come over and fix my house, and I can pay them back whenever I want?

speaker: LUKE
words: That's right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: 'Cause I'm Tony Soprano?

speaker: LUKE
words: Only scarier.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now Luke, when I finally do make out this installment check, uh, who should I make it out to?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, you can make it out to me if you like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so basically you would be fronting me the money?

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, yeah, but it's no big deal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, that's a loan.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, it's just a temporary exchange of money for services that will be paid back when you finally have the. . . it's a loan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Man, you suck as a liar. Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't take it.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know, but it was worth a shot.
[Rory walks up the porch steps]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, uh, Dean called twice.

speaker: RORY
words: Rah, rah, rah. [goes into the house]

speaker: LUKE
words: You two. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don't ask.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay. So what are you gonna do?
CUT TO FIRST NATIONAL BANK
[Lorelai enters the bank and walks up to a woman]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, excuse me, could you tell me where Mr. Hahn's office is?

speaker: WOMAN
words: Yeah, it's right there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thank you.
[Lorelai walks towards the office, but stops when she sees Emily]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are not seriously sitting there.

speaker: EMILY
words: No, it's a hologram. Lifelike, isn't it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, why are you here?

speaker: EMILY
words: I just wanted to see if you'd show up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did.

speaker: EMILY
words: I see.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, you said you made this appointment for me. Not you, me.

speaker: EMILY
words: I did. But I know Miles and I thought my presence in there would - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, ooh. In where?

speaker: EMILY
words: In the meeting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Bye.

speaker: EMILY
words: Where are you going? Come back here. Lorelai!
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai walks out of the bank with Emily following her]

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, stop. Will you stop already?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm leaving Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Why, because I'm here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is a business meeting. I'm not going in there with my Mommy, especially since I left my blankie at home.

speaker: EMILY
words: You're being stubborn and short sided.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call it whatever you want.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't understand why you would let your silly pride keep you from fixing your home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't understand why you can't physically stop yourself from butting in where you don't belong.

speaker: EMILY
words: I made this appointment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Against my will.

speaker: EMILY
words: You needed it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn't ask for it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, this man can solve your problems, don't you understand that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine. I'll go in, you go home.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't go home now, his assistant already knows I'm here. It would be rude.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, here's the deal. We will both go in. You will go in that room but you will not say a word.

speaker: EMILY
words: What? But I couldn't possibly just - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: You'll say hello, you'll ask how his wife is, and that's it. After that, you will say nothing, you will do nothing, you will sit in the corner and offer no opinions and pull a full-on Clarence Thomas, am I making myself perfectly clear?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's the only way I'm doing this, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right, I'll be quiet. I will, I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear, one of these days, Alice. Pow! Right to the moon.

speaker: EMILY
words: What on earth are you talking about? Who's Alice?
CUT TO INSIDE BANK
[Lorelai and Emily walk back into the bank.]

speaker: MILES
words: Oh, there you are. I thought you were here, I come out and you were gone.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, well, we left something in the car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, she left something in the car, not me. I never leave anything in the car 'cause that would be irresponsible and forgetful, two things which I am not.

speaker: EMILY
words: Miles, this is my daughter Lorelai.

speaker: MILES
words: Well hello. It's a thrill to finally meet you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Same here, thank you.

speaker: MILES
words: Would you two like some coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: EMILY
words: Coffee would be wonderful, thank you.

speaker: MILES
words: Coming right up. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, what happened to you not saying anything?

speaker: EMILY
words: Accepting coffee is merely being sociable. Besides, I haven't asked how his wife is yet.
[Miles walks back]

speaker: MILES
words: Okay, coffee's on its way. Why don't we go on in and sit down?

speaker: EMILY
words: That would be lovely.
CUT TO INSIDE OFFICE [The three of them walk in and sit down.]

speaker: MILES
words: So I understand that Richard's retiring.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, he's going to be a man of leisure.

speaker: MILES
words: Well, how nice. Any big plans?

speaker: EMILY
words: Actually, an around the world trip has been discussed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Any dates set?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, not yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just checking.
[the secretary brings in the coffee]

speaker: MILES
words: Ah, Marnie, thank you. So I guess we should probably get down to business. Lorelai, your mother tells me you're having a little trouble finding a loan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I am. Um, you know, before we talk about this - it's so funny - my mom has just been dying to ask you how your wife is doing. Right mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, how is Sheryl?

speaker: MILES
words: Why, she's fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, good, now that we got that out of the way, about my situation.

speaker: MILES
words: Well, Emily tells me that you have termites.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we do. And unfortunately they have damaged the foundation of my house.

speaker: MILES
words: That could be terrible. I remember when you and Richard had that foundation problem a couple years ago. What, you had a flood in your basement, wasn't that it?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, actually -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, Mr. Hahn, I appreciate you taking the time to meet with me today, and I know that the only reason you did is because of my mother, but she's really here today as a kind of silent participant. Uh, not even actually a participant, just a … silent. Um, so I would appreciate it if you would treat me just like any other person who was walking in off the street and asking for a loan.

speaker: MILES
words: Oh, well, of course. If that's what you'd like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is, thank you. Now, I've brought, um, all my previous loan documents and also my bank statements, numerous recommendations including a letter from my employer which just basically says that she's not gonna fire me before you get your money back.

speaker: MILES
words: Oh, you've taken out two previous loans on this house?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, yes.

speaker: MILES
words: And this is the estimated worth of the house?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh, yes.

speaker: MILES
words: And this is the amount in your savings account?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: MILES
words: Any other accounts not listed here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: MILES
words: Any other collateral not listed here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: MILES
words: Well Ms. Gilmore, I'm sorry, I can't help you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, that's it? So fast? You didn't even look at the letters of recommendation.

speaker: MILES
words: Well I'm sure you're a well liked person, Ms. Gilmore. Unfortunately being well liked is not grounds for granting a loan.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, but I am good for the money. I, uh, pay off all my debts and I work really hard. I've been the executive manager of the Independence Inn for the last four years now.

speaker: MILES
words: Ms. Gilmore, this is not a reflection of you as a person. It's simply a case where you don't have what the bank requires of every other person off the street to qualify for a loan. Therefore, there's nothing I can do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well now, just think about this because, uh, I have a kid and she's gotten awfully used to the whole concept of having a roof over her head.

speaker: MILES
words: I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can't leave without this loan.

speaker: MILES
words: Well, I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean it. I can't leave without knowing there's a way that I can save my house, so I'm just asking you to take five minutes and think of something, anything that I can do to get this money.

speaker: MILES
words: Well, you can get someone to cosign the loan with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That's it? That's my only option?

speaker: MILES
words: I'm afraid so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You knew about this, didn't you? Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Hm?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Would you be willing. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: It would be my pleasure.

speaker: MILES
words: Wonderful. I'll have the papers drawn up today. Would you like some more coffee?

speaker: EMILY
words: I would love some, thank you.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Emily walk out of the bank]

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I think that went very well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what's the new arrangement gonna be?

speaker: EMILY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you helped me pay for Chilton, I gave you Friday night dinners, so what's this, Sunday night tea?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, I did this for your own good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wednesday night bridge club?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Monday night football?

speaker: EMILY
words: Stop it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What Mom? Just please tell me, what do I owe you?

speaker: EMILY
words: You owe me nothing. I just wanted to do something nice for my daughter, that's all.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[A nighttime pep rally is being held in front of Stars Hollow High.]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It's already shaping up to be the best season ever, due in part to the recent arrival of our brand new basketball coach Lou Magillian, formerly the presiding legal counsel for the Chicago Bulls. Lou, come on up here and take a bow. Those other teams had better watch out, we've got one of the big boys on our side now, huh? Shaq who? And in addition to our new coach, we're extremely proud of our brand new uniforms, thoughtfully supplied by you, the citizens of Stars Hollow, and carefully cleaned by the good people at Tricky's Dry Cleaners. If it's sticky, try Tricky's. Let's hear it for Tricky! I'm telling you, they are terrific. Red and white, very durable, little stripes on the side - oh you know what, why don't you just see for yourselves. Come on, show 'em your uniforms.

speaker: PLAYER
words: Mr. Doose, it's freezing out here. Why don't you let 'em see it at the game?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Young man, the people in this town paid good money for those uniforms. Now you show them what they paid for.

speaker: PLAYER
words: This is crazy.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the new uniforms of the fabulous fighting Minutemen.
[cut to Rory standing in the crowd next to Bootsy]

speaker: BOOTSY
words: Oh look at them shivering up there. They're such wimps these days. When I was on the team, it was different. We were rowdy. Three of us would've been pantsed by now.
[Bootsy walks away and Lorelai walks over]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got your note.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, well pinning it to the Mallomars is always a safe bet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, um, Grandma and I went to the bank today.

speaker: RORY
words: How'd it go?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We got the loan.

speaker: RORY
words: Good. So then everything's okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well. Wow, nice uniforms.

speaker: RORY
words: I'm sorry I told Grandma about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw hon, listen, there's gonna be a time in our lives where occasionally I'm gonna make a mistake. It hasn't happened yet, but it might.

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I have earned the right to make that mistake, and I have earned the right to fix any problems without interference.

speaker: RORY
words: I just thought that they could help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I didn't want their help

speaker: RORY
words: But -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, have you ever been without food or clothes or books or book covers for that matter or anything else you ever needed?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, and see, the reason for that is me. I have a pretty good track record for keeping you alive.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, you do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So when I tell you I can handle something, you need to respect that, especially since you have no evidence proving I won't. Understand?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I understand. I'm sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I officially declare this fight over.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll drink to that.
[The cheerleaders run out and start their routine]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is that Lane?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, that's Lane.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hah.
[The cheerleaders finish their routine]
CUT TO SIDEWALK
[After the Pep Rally, Rory walks up to Lane.]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LANE
words: Hi.

speaker: RORY
words: So the music selection, yours I assume?

speaker: LANE
words: Yeah, there was a bit of an education process going on.

speaker: RORY
words: I liked it. Very John Waters.

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: I don't want you to think that you can't tell me things.

speaker: LANE
words: I don't wanna not tell you thing.

speaker: RORY
words: And this whole cheerleading thing…

speaker: LANE
words: I know it's weird.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's not that weird. I mean, if you were doing it professionally, then it would be weird. But this, it looked fun.

speaker: LANE
words: It was fun.

speaker: RORY
words: And hey, you got them to cheer to Madness, so there must be some hope left in the world.

speaker: LANE
words: I want you rest assured that I remain me. I mean, Nico-obsessed, Exene wannabe with forty Korean bibles under her bed. I just bounce a little more.

speaker: RORY
words: So can cheerleaders get coffee?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh yeah, coffee's a must.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LANE
words: Keeps you perky.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai, Rory and Emily are eating dinner]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Mom, they started work on the house yesterday.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, these guys come at like the crack of dawn and all of a sudden there's all this hammering and drilling and dust flying everywhere.

speaker: RORY
words: It's pretty impressive actually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They're a nice bunch too. And the best part is I've been out there like ten times to bring them coffee and I haven't seen a butt crack yet.

speaker: EMILY
words: How nice. They should paint that slogan on their truck. Excuse me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where you going?

speaker: EMILY
words: To get some more bread. [leaves room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I'll go help.

speaker: RORY
words: I think that would be good.
CUT TO KITCHEN

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, I want to apologize to you.

speaker: EMILY
words: For what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, for doubting your motives in this whole loan thing. I'm just not used to people doing things without strings attached, that's all.

speaker: EMILY
words: By people, you mean me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don't know what I would've done without your help. I mean it. I was out of ideas and then out of the blue you make this call and cosign the loan with me. I'm really, really grateful.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, that almost sounded sincere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I should've left off one of the reallys. That always tips it.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right, I accept your apology.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: EMILY
words: By the way, I'm going to be having my DAR meetings at the inn from now on. I hope you don't mind. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: She's good.
THE END
OPEN AT ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory have just arrived]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. Man, is it cold out there.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, I’m freezing.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, come on in and sit by the fire. I’ll make you both a drink and then we can talk.

speaker: RORY
words: About what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Antennas up.

speaker: RORY
words: Aye aye, captain.
[they walk to the living room]

speaker: EMILY
words: So Lorelai, how are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, I’m fine Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m fine too, Grandma.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How are you Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Also fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look at that. All three of us fine, just like the Judds.

speaker: EMILY
words: So Lorelai, are you dating?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, hm, no, I’m not dating.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really? There’s no one at all?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, totally single.

speaker: EMILY
words: Any chance you’d get back with Max?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Mom, there’s no chance.

speaker: EMILY
words: What about the man at the diner, the one who refuses to shave?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, he’s just a friend Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you think you’ll be single your entire life?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: EMILY
words: I mean, in terms of your finding someone, what do you think the odds are?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, what is going on?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I visited the family mausoleum today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never what you think it’s gonna be!

speaker: EMILY
words: I just wanted to check on things, make sure they were keeping it up, changing the flowers, you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: EMILY
words: So I went inside and looked around and it occurred to me that there’s a very limited space there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now of course there’s a slot open for me and Richard and you and Rory, but after the two of you – that’s it. No more room for anyone else.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes. So if you actually do meet someone someday, I don’t know where to put him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, maybe we could just dump him at the local pool hall.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t be silly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, because this is definitely not a conversation for that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I looked into expanding into the crypt next door but the family that owns it wouldn’t even discuss it with me.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m getting a little creeped out here.

speaker: EMILY
words: So I talked to the head of the cemetery and he suggested that we buy an annex.

speaker: RORY
words: An annex?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, like an outlet store, it would specialize in the irregular family members.

speaker: EMILY
words: So if we do get the annex and you do eventually someday get married…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, just say it – fat chance – will you?

speaker: EMILY
words: I just meant that we’ll have to decide who to move.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, oh. Well, uh. . .ugh, why don’t we move Aunt Cecile? She was always so annoying at parties. She loved the knock-knock jokes.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: You can’t just kick out Aunt Cecile.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Knock-knock. Who’s there? Pineapple. Pineapple who? That’s where it ended. Never fully grasped the knock-knock concept.

speaker: EMILY
words: She was a complete idiot. Okay, it’s decided – Cecile goes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: Look - put me in the annex.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Unh uh. No way. You are not leaving me alone in there with Cecile.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I’m not gonna be held responsible for somebody being kicked out of their eternal resting place.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, I have an idea. I’ll probably go first, right? So when Rory kicks, just throw her in with me.

speaker: RORY
words: I’d like my own space if you don’t mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? It’d totally be fun to be there together. Plus I plan to be buried with all the good CD’s and my rock star belt.
[Richard comes down the steps]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Sorry I’m late. What did I miss?

speaker: EMILY
words: We were just discussing who to move to the annex.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh. I vote for Cecile. Horrible woman, and those terrible jokes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’d I tell you?

speaker: RORY
words: This is a cold, cold family.
[Opening Credits]
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Later that night, Lorelai, Rory, Richard, and Emily are at the table eating dinner.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is really good.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, what is it?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, it -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, don’t tell us.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because every time in my life that I’ve tasted something great but I didn’t know what it was, it turned out to be something really disgusting that had I known what I was eating I never would’ve tried it in the first place.

speaker: RORY
words: Example?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Snails.

speaker: RORY
words: Gross.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Eat in ignorance and enjoy it, my friend.

speaker: RORY
words: Gladly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Dad, how’s the retired life treating you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, fascinating actually. I find myself noticing things, everyday things that I must’ve witnessed a hundred times before but just walked right past. Like yesterday, your mother moved a vase, the one in the hall, and she didn’t do it in front of me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, ‘cause nice girls never move vases in front of men.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And she only moved it a little but as I passed it by I noticed it had been moved.

speaker: RORY
words: Impressive.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And every day’s a new discovery. Your mother changed her hair. Or she wore shoes that didn’t match her purse.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Last Thursday.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, for heaven’s sake.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know what else I noticed?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: A first edition Flaubert, mint condition, shoved behind several of my Churchill biographies.

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Interested?

speaker: RORY
words: My life is good.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Follow me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh Dad, see if you can find a pair of the new Chanel patent leather pirate boots stuffed back behind your Churchills.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hmm.
[Richard and Rory leave the room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s up Mom?

speaker: EMILY
words: Nothing’s up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You were twitching. I saw you.

speaker: EMILY
words: You did not see me twitching.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, when Dad was talking about the vase, you were pulling a full-on Tabitha.

speaker: EMILY
words: I did not pull a Tabitha.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Something wrong?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, nothing’s wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, okay, nothing’s wrong.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s just that things are a little strange lately.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is?

speaker: EMILY
words: Having him home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: EMILY
words: We’ve never really been home at the same time. I mean, we got married, we went to Europe, we came back, he went to work, and it’s been that way ever since.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, so now it’s different.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s very different. He’s always here – watching me and noticing when I move a vase and. . .I don’t know. It’s silly. So he noticed my hair was different. Women die for that sort of thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw Mom, it’s just an adjustment. You’ve had your routine, he’s had his routine. You guys just need to figure out a new routine.

speaker: EMILY
words: I guess so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it’ll just take some time. Then you’ll find your rhythm and he’ll go back to ignoring your hair, all will be well.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, you’re probably right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm, I am right. Okay, I give. What is this?

speaker: EMILY
words: Sweetbreads.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweetbreads. So that’s uh. . .

speaker: EMILY
