words: Pancreas.
CUT TO CHILTON
[At a meeting of the Franklin, Paris is going through a stack of stories that people have submitted.]

speaker: PARIS
words: No, no, no, no, no, no, no.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: I’m not done.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: PARIS
words: No.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Glad she finished that one.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why am I the only one who cares?

speaker: RORY
words: You’re not the only one who cares.

speaker: PARIS
words: No. I know you care, but I need everyone in this stupid room to care because I can’t be the only one to care. Besides you.

speaker: LOUISE
words: It’s just a contest Paris. It’s not like you get a car or a lifetime supply of Rice a Roni.

speaker: MADELINE
words: God, I love that stuff.

speaker: PARIS
words: The Oppenheimer Award for Excellence in school journalism is not a contest. It’s a statement. It says you’re the best. The best writers, the best reporters, the best editors. It says that you have crushed all others who have dared to take you on. It says that every other single school in the United States of America is feeling nothing but shame and defeat and pain because of the people who won the Oppenheimer plaque. I wanna be those people, I wanna cause that pain.

speaker: RORY
words: Our paper is good.

speaker: PARIS
words: Not good enough.

speaker: RORY
words: Last week’s issue - .

speaker: PARIS
words: Was a fine effort by a bunch of kids.

speaker: MADELINE
words: We are a bunch of kids.

speaker: PARIS
words: Not when we’re in this room, we’re not. Flescher Prep Gazette, Broadmouth Banner, Richmond Heights Chronicle - these publications are not our competition.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Geez.

speaker: PARIS
words: The New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, the Washington Post - these publications are our competition.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Paris has gone bye-bye.

speaker: PARIS
words: We need to raise the bar. We need to be better, think harder, dig deeper. I don’t wanna just submit a good issue. I wanna submit a great issue, the best issue.

speaker: RORY
words: When’s the deadline?

speaker: PARIS
words: One week from today.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, so, then we better get brainstorming. Doe anyone have an idea for a theme?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: The one that wins.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, good, big help. All right everyone, we should get working. You’re going to give yourself a stroke one of these days, you know that.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Emily walks through the hall into the living room.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Graciela, I’m leaving the shopping list on the table here. And remember we need the low sudsing detergent. I have drawn a picture of what the box looks like, so for heaven’s sake pay attention this time.
[Richard walks in]

speaker: EMILY
words: How was your walk?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Carl Lambertson needs a new roof. I’m going to drop him a note.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good idea.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Busy day?

speaker: EMILY
words: Mm, very.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is that the same cup of coffee you had when I left?

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: When I left an hour ago, you were having a cup of coffee.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, no, this is a different cup of coffee.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So then that’s your third cup of coffee this morning?

speaker: EMILY
words: I guess.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Interesting. I just realized you have three cups of coffee in the morning.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t drink three cups of coffee every morning.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Every morning this week.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, so what?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Nothing. Just an observation, that’s all. That’s a lot of coffee to drink early in the morning.

speaker: EMILY
words: Any thoughts on what you’d like for dinner tonight?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh no, anything’s fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: All right. [writes something down in her day planner]

speaker: RICHARD
words: What are you writing down?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lamb chops.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is that for tonight?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh.

speaker: EMILY
words: Do you not want lamb chops tonight?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, no no, lamb chops is just fine for tonight. I just thought a nice roast would also be nice for a change.

speaker: EMILY
words: Roast it is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Of course, if you want lamb chops …

speaker: EMILY
words: We’re having roast, Richard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Okay, if that’s what you want.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m going by the dry cleaners, anything you want me to drop off?

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re going to the dry cleaners?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I’ll go with you.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can bring in whatever you have.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know, but it’d be nice to go together.

speaker: EMILY
words: That would be terribly romantic, but I won’t have time to get back here before my DAR meeting so it’s probably better if I go alone. You can come to the cleaners with me next week.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well yes, well I can go to the meeting with you.

speaker: EMILY
words: You want to go to my meeting of the Daughters of the American Revolution?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, well yes, I think it’d be fascinating.

speaker: EMILY
words: But I go straight from there to the symphony luncheon.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I’ll tag along there too.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, but from there I get my hair done, and you certainly don’t want to sit around while I have my hair done.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I don’t.

speaker: EMILY
words: There you go.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, you can cancel that.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can’t cancel that. I get my hair done every Wednesday at three.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, your hair looks fine.

speaker: EMILY
words: My hair looks fine because I have my hair done every Wednesday at three.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well then what am I going to do?

speaker: EMILY
words: Why don’t you go to the club?

speaker: RICHARD
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, the club! You spend a fortune to belong there and you never got to go much before. Why don’t you go there now?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Go to the club on a Wednesday afternoon?

speaker: EMILY
words: I think it would be perfect.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t even know what they do at the club on a Wednesday afternoon.

speaker: EMILY
words: No time like the present to find out.

speaker: RICHARD
words: All right, I’ll go to the club.

speaker: EMILY
words: Wonderful. [starts walking him to the front door]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Go to the club on a Wednesday afternoon. Life certainly is an interesting game of cards, isn’t it?

speaker: EMILY
words: It certainly is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, um, I’ll see you, uh, tonight.

speaker: EMILY
words: Have a good time. [closes door] Graciela, I need more coffee now!
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW VIDEO
[Rory and Lorelai walk around the video store trying to decide on a movie]

speaker: LORELAI
words: How about a triple feature? Three Days of the Condor, Shoah and The Jerk?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, Shoah’s like nine and a half hours.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But The Jerk is short.

speaker: RORY
words: Hmm, next.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The three faces of Costner – Bull Durham, Dances with Wolves, The Postman. Tom Petty playing Tom Petty, that great big speech about ‘Once upon a time there was a thing called mail.’ It’ll make you laugh, it’ll make you cry, it’ll make you wanna mail something.

speaker: RORY
words: Ooh, we could do a Ruth Gordon film festival. Harold and Maude, Rosemary’s Baby, and that really great episode of Taxi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it. The worst film festival ever. Cool as Ice, Hudson Hawk, and Electric Bugaloo.

speaker: RORY
words: Sold.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll get the Hawk.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll get the Bugaloo.
[Rory leans down to look through the shelf of videos. Two boys are sitting on the floor looking at a movie box.]

speaker: BOY 1
words: See, I told you.

speaker: BOY 2
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey guys, can I get in there?

speaker: BOY 1
words: Oh, yeah. [both boys walk away]
[Rory finds the movie and stands back up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it, plus four boxes of Red Vines.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Evening Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, I forgot my card at home but I think my number’s 6247.

speaker: KIRK
words: You forgot your card?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I might’ve lost it.

speaker: KIRK
words: You lost your card?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I might have.

speaker: KIRK
words: Was it temporary or laminated?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Laminated.

speaker: KIRK
words: That’s a permanent card. You lost a permanent card.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can just get me a new card Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Fine, but I hope you understand the gravity of the situation here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m trying to grasp it.

speaker: KIRK
words: I mean, these cards are agreements. It’s an agreement between you and the Stars Hollow Video Store stating that you will take care of your card, that you will honor your card, that you will very, very nice to your card...
[Lorelai’s cell phone is ringing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. [answers phone] Hello? Hello? [to Rory] Reception sucks in here, I’ll be right back.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello? [walks away]

speaker: KIRK
words: It’ll be ready in a minute.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Kirk, there are a couple of little kids over there and they’re, uh, looking at this tape cover that’s kind of mature. You might wanna put that stuff on a higher shelf or something.

speaker: KIRK
words: Mature? How mature?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, it’s a half-naked woman just standing there.

speaker: KIRK
words: Is she a blonde?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: KIRK
words: I’ll check it out right now. [walks away]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai walks out of the video store to talk on the phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Mom, I can hear you now. What’s up?

speaker: EMILY
words: You have to take your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Tomorrow, for the whole day, just take him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Take him where?

speaker: EMILY
words: I don't care -- the zoo, the mall, Rhode Island, just get him out of my house!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What happened?

speaker: EMILY
words: He's going to join my water aerobics class.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: He bought some new swim trunks today. He's out of control.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Mom, calm down.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can't calm down! I can't turn around without him being there, following me, staring at me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he likes you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don't be cute, do not be cute. The man is driving me insane. I am going to go insane, and if you don't help me, I will take you with me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Mom, I would like to help you but wh --.

speaker: EMILY
words: You owe me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: I pay for Rory's school!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you serious?

speaker: EMILY
words: And I cosigned your loan! You still have a house because of me!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you hearing yourself?

speaker: EMILY
words: I'm sorry but I'm desperate. I just need one day of peace and I will do anything to get it, anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay Mom, fine, uh, I’ll take him.

speaker: EMILY
words: I can’t tell you how much I appreciate this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [calls from another room] Emily! Where are you?

speaker: EMILY
words: I have to go. Tomorrow morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow morning. Bye.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Rory is in her bedroom getting ready for school as Lorelai walks in.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, the most horrible thing just happened. Headmaster Charleston’s office called, he’s been kidnapped! Two guys broke into his house and threw him in a hefty bag, used those twisty ties and carted him off. Classes have been canceled until further notice.

speaker: RORY
words: I am going to school Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, come on, it’s just one day. I’ll write you a note. ‘Dear Nazis, Rory had to miss school today on account of saving her mom from spending the entire day with her father who often looks at her like she has three heads.’

speaker: RORY
words: Out of my way please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you know the last time my father and I were alone together for any extended period of time?

speaker: RORY
words: Unh uh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was kicked out of summer class for refusing to call the camp counselor Peaches because I thought the entire concept of the counselors choosing summer fruit names was stupid. So they called my dad and he came to get me and it was just the two of us alone in the car all the way from Maine with nothing to talk about but my camp failure. Luckily I had also flashed the swim team or even that subject would’ve gotten stale.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, I have the Franklin today. I cannot miss it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, please. I can't handle the entire day with him. I can't, I can't, I caaaaan’t.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, I promise. Just make it till the afternoon, and then I promise I'll come right home and I'll take Grandpa off your hands.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right.

speaker: RORY
words: It'll be fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is not going to be fine. It's going to be horrible. It is going to be a bad, depressing Lifetime movie and Nancy McKeon will be playing me. I am Jo.
[the doorbell rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that would be him.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s not going to be that bad. Hey. Be nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Be nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, very good.
[they answer the front door, Richard is standing there]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Dad.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good morning girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you have any trouble getting here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Not at all, the directions were fine.

speaker: RORY
words: Well I have to be going, but I’ll see you this afternoon.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I look forward to it.

speaker: RORY
words: Have fun. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So good drive, huh?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Very good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, here. [takes Richard’s coat] Would you like some coffee?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m fine. Do you want coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes, God yes, thank you.
[They walk into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you sure you don’t, um. . .

speaker: RICHARD
words: Coffee? Uh, no, no, no, no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh, can I offer you anything else? Some Pop Tarts or. . .well, that’s pretty much it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You don’t have to entertain me Lorelai. I just came here to see you and your house and your town. You don’t have to do anything special for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you’re my guest.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I’m your father. Just do whatever it is you would normally do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What I would normally do.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes. Like for instance, this morning if I wasn’t here, you would wake up, obviously get some coffee and. . .then what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, um, I’d probably read the paper for a little while and then have some breakfast.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Let’s read the paper then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, let’s read the paper. [they sit down at the table] Um, what sections would you like?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, you go first. I’ll take what’s left.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, okay. Well, um, normally I read the Arts and Leisure and the Lifestyles.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Perfect. Well, that leaves Business, Sports, and World News.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. That worked out well.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes it did, didn’t it?
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai and Richard walk in]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, this is it, Luke’s.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know, when I was in college, there was this horrible little diner across from my apartment building. It was run by this terrible little couple, they were very angry. They would fight, break plates, curse, and I went in there every morning for three years and I had the most dreadful breakfast, just awful. I really miss that place.

speaker: LUKE
words: Morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey. Um, Luke, you remember my father?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh yeah, nice to see you again.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Nice to see you. This is quite a place you’ve got here.

speaker: LUKE
words: It pays the bills.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Always a plus in business.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, do you know what you want?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I already ate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You did? When?

speaker: RICHARD
words: 30 every morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Why?

speaker: RICHARD
words: 30 for as long as I can remember.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but that was when you had to work. Now you can afford to get a little crazy, get up at quarter to six.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Go ahead and order Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. I’ll have a banana, pancakes, side of bacon, and lots and lots of coffee.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up. [walks away]

speaker: RICHARD
words: You didn’t order any grapefruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I don’t really like grapefruit.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I always start my breakfast off with half a grapefruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, do the Florida people know about you? Because Anita Bryant left this huge gap that has yet to be filled.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It’s important to start the day off correctly, Lorelai. A grapefruit is brain food. It has vitamin C and folic acid and it helps with your digestion. It really is a terrific fruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I feel like you’re about to break into song.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m serious about this Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you are but I still don’t like grapefruit.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, there are many things in life that we don’t like, but the benefits they bring us far outweigh the temporary discomforts we have to endure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Hold on a sec.
[Lorelai walks up to Luke at the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I need a grapefruit.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Before my pancakes this morning I need half a grapefruit, uh, preferably one that tastes like a donut.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t have grapefruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How can you not have grapefruit?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ve never had grapefruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need a grapefr. . .Listen, I have my father with me all day, and so far there’s been no major drama or yelling or ugliness but there will be if I don’t somehow find a way to get half a grapefruit for breakfast this morning.

speaker: LUKE
words: I could go next door to Doose’s and buy a grapefruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I would be eternally grateful.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll be right back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Lorelai walks back to the table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, the grapefruit is coming.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, you won’t be sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So listen, I was thinking, um, maybe after we’re done here, you might like to walk around town a little, see the sites. And then Rory usually gets home around four. The two of you can hang out at the house until I get off work and the three of us can hook up for dinner. How does that sound?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Very sensible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well yeah, I had to make up for my shoes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is that your second cup of coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, third. Why?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No reason. That’s a lot of coffee first thing in the morning.
CUT TO CHILTON
[Rory is at her locker. She slams it shut and finds Paris standing there.]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, you have got to stop doing that.

speaker: PARIS
words: So I’ve been doing some research on the Oppenheimer Award, and I’ve noticed something. All of the winning schools had an extremely strong human interest story on page one.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: PARIS
words: And I think that’s what we need. I mean, we’ve got the teen issues down, we’ve got a decent op-ed and political page, but human interest – that’s what we’re missing.

speaker: RORY
words: Ideas?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Do tell.

speaker: PARIS
words: According to the papers, there’s been a huge increase in the number of families fleeing the major cities in favor of small towns. Hundreds of thousands of city slicking yuppies carting the trophy wife and the asthmatic kids off to small towns in search of the simple life. Milk a cow, pet a pig, find yourself, all that kind of crap.

speaker: RORY
words: Interesting.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah, and I thought about it. There’s a romantic aspect to small towns. White picket fences, low crime rate, smaller classrooms, better tomatoes. It all seems perfect.

speaker: RORY
words: But?

speaker: PARIS
words: But nothing is perfect, nothing is safe, nothing is ever what it seems. And then it hit me - our story. We are going to blow the lid off the seedy underbelly of small town life, starting with yours.

speaker: RORY
words: Stars Hollows?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: You are going to uncover the seedy underbelly of Stars Hollow?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, Stars Hollow doesn’t have a seedy underbelly. We don’t even have a meter maid.

speaker: PARIS
words: Look, you may be blind to it because you live there, but trust me, it’s there and it’s ugly and I’m going to find it. I’ll meet you out front after school.

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t today.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why not? Are you hiding something?

speaker: RORY
words: No. I promised my mom that I would help her with something.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, help her tomorrow. We have work to do.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris!

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, this could be our chance to nail this thing. Now I have a hunch that there’s a story here and a good one, and I’m going to find it. I was even going to share a byline with you on it, but if you wanna bail out, that’s fine. I’ll just do it myself.

speaker: RORY
words: But -.

speaker: PARIS
words: Am I meeting you or not?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t think you’re gonna find anything.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, then the worst that can happen is that I spend some time in your town and suddenly have an urge to enter a pie in the county fair. I’ll meet you out front, don’t be late.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Michel is at the front desk on the phone as Lorelai walks over]

speaker: MICHEL
words: As soon as I can, I will send someone up. . . Yes, I will. . .I understand. . .I understand. . .I understand. . .I understand. . .I understand. . . Okay. . .I understand. Goodbye. [hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you understand?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I have no idea. I tuned him out at the first screech.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Have we heard from Manny yet?

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, and I have paged him twice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We only have enough linen for one seating tonight. Hand me the phone.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Plus we are completely out of clean towels.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [oh phone] Hi, Sophie, it’s Lorelai. I need to talk to Manny. . . Well, when will he be back? . . . Okay, I need him to call me really, really soon, like five minutes ago. Okay, thanks. [hangs up] We need a backup plan.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call Patty’s and see if she has any party rental tablecloths we can use for tonight and then pull all the towels from the pool and call Gandolfi’s and order a case of champagne. Send a bottle to every room that’s towel-less and just page him every two minutes and oh no! [sees Richard walk into the inn]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Dad, what are you doing? Uh, I thought you were gonna tour the town.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I did, I did. I went into all the stores, the cat one twice. And then I walked around a little and then I was done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But what about the park – did you see the park?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, I saw the park.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, what about the giant slinky over on Klump? We’re mighty proud of that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I saw the slinky, yes. And the hundred-year-old oak tree and the life-size yarn person. I even stopped by your house and had Babette introduce me to all of her gnomes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And then I realized the only thing I had not seen is my daughter at work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, watching me at work is not very interesting, trust me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, you underestimate yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, um, there’s books on the shelves over there.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No no, I have my newspaper, I’m fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, I’m just gonna. . . what’s the matter?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is your jacket in the back?

speaker: LORELAI
words: My jacket?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Your work jacket?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t have a work jacket.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So that’s your working outfit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And your boss doesn’t mind?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well considering my boss is me, no, she doesn’t. I mean, she did at first but then I bought her a cup of coffee and I realized all the hostility she was expressing toward me was just jealousy and we’ve been best friends ever since. Just take a seat Dad. [walks to the front desk] Hey, will you get me an extra bottle of champagne and smack me over the head with it?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Absolutely.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [answers] Independence Inn.

speaker: RORY
words: I need you to sit down, breathe, and remember that you’re at work, so screaming and crying is not an option.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why, what are you doing?

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t meet you after school today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? You promised.

speaker: RORY
words: I know but I have to work on this story for the Franklin and I swear I tried to get out of it, but I couldn’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh great.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, school comes before Mommy’s mental health.

speaker: RORY
words: Just tell Grandpa to wander around for awhile.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He already wandered.

speaker: RORY
words: Did he see the slinky?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, he saw the slinky.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s here now.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And he hates my shirt.

speaker: RORY
words: Give him a book and have Sookie make him lunch and I swear I’ll be home by dinner and you won’t have to say a word.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, bye.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW BUS STOP
[Rory and Paris get off of the bus]

speaker: PARIS
words: I think I got rabies.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s just a bus, Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: It smelled.

speaker: RORY
words: It smelled like a bus.

speaker: PARIS
words: I’m gonna have to burn my clothes when I get home.

speaker: RORY
words: You know Paris, you have a car. We could’ve driven.

speaker: PARIS
words: We have to get the feel of the small town world. You’re not going to get the feel of a small town world in a BMW. Is there something crawling in my hair?

speaker: RORY
words: All right, so we’re here now, where do you wanna go?

speaker: PARIS
words: I don’t know, where’s the bad part of town?

speaker: RORY
words: Uhh, over there.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, people - they’re very upset with the color of that fence.

speaker: PARIS
words: Come on.

speaker: RORY
words: This is the town Paris, this is it. It’s not seedy, it’s not rundown, it’s just Stars Hollow.

speaker: PARIS
words: Well, where’s the local bar?

speaker: RORY
words: In Woodbridge.

speaker: PARIS
words: Why aren’t you helping?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m trying, you’re just looking for something that’s not here.

speaker: PARIS
words: What’s this?

speaker: RORY
words: Luke’s Diner.

speaker: PARIS
words: Diner. Okay, good, good.
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE’S
[Paris and Rory walk in and sit at the counter. Paris starts looking at a menu.]

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: PARIS
words: Trying just to blend in, fade away, observe.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey Rory. Coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Who’s your friend?

speaker: RORY
words: Angela Landsbury.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: PARIS
words: You’re the owner here?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup. You want some coffee Angela?

speaker: PARIS
words: No thanks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: PARIS
words: So, you run the diner, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh boy.

speaker: PARIS
words: You get a lot of truckers through here?

speaker: LUKE
words: Truckers?

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah. You know, guys on the road for weeks, lonely, looking for company, a little pick me up. Things like that.

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s she talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: Your guess is as good as mine.

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s pretty common knowledge that diners are breeding grounds for prostitution and drug dealers.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: Have you ever seen anything like that going down here?

speaker: LUKE
words: Have I ever. . .

speaker: PARIS
words: What about that guy over there? What’s his story?

speaker: LUKE
words: Reverend Nichols?

speaker: PARIS
words: Reverend Nichols, huh? What is that, like Dr. Feelgood?

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory, how much do you like this person?

speaker: RORY
words: Do what you gotta do, Luke.
[Jess comes down the steps into the diner]

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, where’d he come from? What’s up there? Is that where you keep the girls? You got yourself a little cathouse up there?

speaker: JESS
words: Wow, I think she got you Uncle Luke. You better give up now.

speaker: LUKE
words: Do not add to this insanity.

speaker: JESS
words: An innocent boy like me should not be raised in an atmosphere like this.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess!

speaker: JESS
words: I wanna be good, life’s just not letting me.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory, get her out of here.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, let’s go. [pulls Paris towards the door]

speaker: PARIS
words: Why do you need me to leave? What have you got to hide?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, let’s go!
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai and Michel are at the front desk, each talking on a phone]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, we’re aware of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, we’re working on it.

speaker: MICHEL
words: As soon as towels arrive, yours will be the first room we come up to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear to you, no one gets a towel before you do.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Did you get the complimentary champagne we sent you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just open the champagne and drink and relax and enjoy and before you know it – of course it’s free. Yes.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yeah, we’ll call you soon. [hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll talk to you soon. [hangs up] I’m killing Manny.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I’m helping.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m gonna strangle him with one of his own towels, I swear to God.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Do you realize there are no tablecloths in the dining room?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes I do. We’re having a problem with our linen delivery.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, it doesn’t look very professional.

speaker: MICHEL
words: [in background] Ah, it’s Manny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I have to take this dad.
[Michel hands her the phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Manny, my mysterious man, where have you been? . . . Oh, me Manny? I’m just a desperate woman. Yes. Honey, I know you’re up to your ears in problems but I have to have some towels or linens or I’m gonna be lying on the street talking about the pretty inn I used to work at and you don’t want that do you? . . . Well, just, anything you can do to get me through the night. . . Uh, Manny, I love you. You rock. I am devoted to you. I’m never gonna look at another towel without thinking of you. . . Thank you. Bye Stud. [hangs up] He’ll be here in twenty minutes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: May I speak to you for a moment please?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Someone is in trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, is something wrong Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Was that a business call I just overheard there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that was my linen delivery guy.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So it was a business call?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it was a business call.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And that’s how you handle a business call?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve known Manny for ten years, Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t care how long you’ve known him. You never talk to a business associate like that, especially not one that you employ.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: These people have to respect you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He does respect me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You were flirting with him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I said what I needed to say in order to get the linen before somebody else did. And I did, so I won.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is not about winning, this is about proper procedure. You need to listen to me Lorelai. If there is one thing I know about, it is the correct way to conduct yourself in a position of authority. Do you understand what I’m trying to tell you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Because I’m only telling you this for your own good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: All right, go back to work. I’ll be right here if you need me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okie dokie.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory and Paris are walking down the sidewalk]

speaker: PARIS
words: Nothing, not even a cigarette butt on the ground, I can’t believe it. This town would make Frank Capra wanna throw up.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, I tried to tell you.

speaker: PARIS
words: I know. I know, it’s just. . .I was just so sure.

speaker: RORY
words: We’ll think of something else to write about, I promise.

speaker: PARIS
words: We’re going to lose.

speaker: RORY
words: We’re not going to lose.
[As they walk past the video store, Taylor and Kirk walk out.]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: There she is, the girl of the moment.

speaker: RORY
words: Me?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You, young lady, are my hero.

speaker: RORY
words: Why is that Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Because in this day and age when the kids are willy nilly with their clothes and hair and morals, it is heartwarming to see a sensible girl like you still exists. A girl who has the gumption and the guts to stand up and say, ‘why are we allowing this trash out where all our children can see it?’

speaker: KIRK
words: And a few selected adults also.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, come on in and see for yourself.
CUT TO INSIDE VIDEO STORE

speaker: RORY
words: What happened? Where is everything?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, thanks to your brilliant suggestion, they are all safely stashed behind the Rory Curtain.

speaker: RORY
words: The what?

speaker: KIRK
words: We thought it was only fitting to name it after you.

speaker: RORY
words: No! I don’t want a Rory Curtain, I never asked for a Rory Curtain!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You told me to put that movie where the kids couldn’t see it.

speaker: PARIS
words: You did?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, yeah, but I just meant to put it on a higher shelf, not to get fabric involved.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, this is much better than a higher shelf. Now all the movies that we deem objectionable will be safely hidden from the eyes of the children. Plus, it’ll make the adults think twice before they go back there.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I did not mean to do this! What are you doing?

speaker: PARIS
words: This is it.

speaker: RORY
words: This is what?

speaker: PARIS
words: Our story. Censorship in a small town, it’s perfect.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, stop it. You know I don’t believe in censorship.

speaker: PARIS
words: Even better, small town minds run amok. This is genius, it’s gold. We’re going to win. Now Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Yes?

speaker: PARIS
words: On the record, how long have you been working here?
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai walks through the front door followed by Richard.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, we’re home!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Next time, stop the car completely before you get out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, for the love of God, be home!

speaker: RORY
words: I’m here, sorry! I was on the phone. How was your – [Lorelai grabs Rory and hugs her tightly] Ooh, okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t think I’ve ever loved you quite as much as I love you right now.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah, ribs cracking, organs crushing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, love hurts. [walks past Rory towards the kitchen]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, lovely to see you Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: How was your day?

speaker: RICHARD
words: It was very pleasant.

speaker: RORY
words: I heard you saw Mom in action.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yes he did.

speaker: RORY
words: She’s great, isn’t she?

speaker: RICHARD
words: She’s. . uh, spirited.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Spirited.

speaker: RORY
words: Spirited is nice. Hey, let’s talk dinner. How about Chinese?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very spirited food.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, do you like Chinese food?

speaker: RICHARD
words: If prepared properly, yes, I like it very much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll go call Al’s. [walks into kitchen]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Al’s?

speaker: RORY
words: Al’s Pancake World.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [follows Lorelai into the kitchen] I thought you said we were having Chinese food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Al’s has the best egg fu yung in Stars Hollow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is that, um, saying anything?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, come entertain your Grandpa while your spirited Mommy orders please!

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Grandpa, do you um. . .do you wanna see my room?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, I would.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[Richard walks into Rory’s room.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twenty bucks if you lock him in there.

speaker: RORY
words: Thirty if you chill.
CUT TO INSIDE RORY’S BEDROOM
[Richard is looking at Rory’s bookshelf as Rory walks in]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Interesting.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, there are some holes in your collection here and I’m just making a list to fill them.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well these aren’t all of my books.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh?
[Rory shows him several stacks of books under her bed]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh my goodness!

speaker: RORY
words: And. . . [opens two drawers filled with books]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, well possibly I should concentrate on acquiring you a bookcase first.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s okay. I kind of like my system.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, organized chaos?

speaker: RORY
words: Exactly.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Very well, carry on. Well, I’m glad not to see any death rockers on your walls.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, where did you learn the term death rockers?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I’m not entirely unfamiliar with the music world in which you live.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t exactly live in the death rock world, Grandpa.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: But if I do move there, I will send you a card.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I appreciate that. Ah, Harvard.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. We started the obsession board a few years ago. And then when we took that trip to Harvard, the student store was having a two for one flag sale, so that kind of sent us into the final stage of the psychosis. Hospitals were called, medications were prescribed, there is no cure.
[Lorelai walks in with a notepad]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I made the menu for the evening.

speaker: RICHARD
words: My God.

speaker: RORY
words: Looks good.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Who could eat all that food?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I almost added the garlic chicken.

speaker: RORY
words: Add it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There are only three of us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but we like choices.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s call, I’m starved.
[they walk into the kitchen]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai, you cannot order all of that food. You’re teaching your daughter wastefulness and gluttony.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um Dad, we do this all the time. We order way too much and then we eat like a third of it and live off the leftovers for a week and a half. It’s a finely honed system. Now please, just sit and read something or watch TV.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So I uh. . .I noticed all the Harvard paraphernalia in Rory’s room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know, you might not want to get her settled on one specific college quite so soon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she’s young. She hasn’t investigated her options.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, she wants to go to Harvard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well yes, because she thinks you want her to go to Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, there are a lot of other good schools out there. You know I went to Yale.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I do know.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yale is a very fine school, some might argue a better school than Harvard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Some meaning you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I just think Rory should explore it, and I can make some phone calls and set up an appointment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because she wants to go to Harvard.

speaker: RICHARD
words: But that’s ridiculous. Who’s going to help her get into Harvard?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Reese Witherspoon.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am a Yale alumnus. I give a great deal of money to that school. Getting her in will be a breeze.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We don’t like breezes, they mess up our hair.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Do not be petulant Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do not pick a fight with me Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is not about you, this is about Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, this is about Richard interfering.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now please, just let me handle this. I know more about the Ivy League system than you do.
[a horn honks from outside]

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is not about the - .

speaker: RORY
words: Is that the food already?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No Sweets, I haven’t ordered yet.
[Rory looks out the window]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who is it?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God!
CUT TO OUT FRONT
[They walk out the front door. Dean is standing in front of a car]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God.

speaker: RORY
words: Whatcha doin’?

speaker: DEAN
words: Just standing here.

speaker: RORY
words: Next to?

speaker: DEAN
words: A car. Your car.

speaker: RORY
words: No!

speaker: DEAN
words: Finished it yesterday.

speaker: RORY
words: No you didn’t!

speaker: DEAN
words: Do you want ‘em? [holds up the keys]

speaker: RORY
words: Ah! [Rory runs off the porch and hugs him]

speaker: DEAN
words: Now if you don’t like it, I bet I can sell it to someone else.

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t you dare!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean, that’s amazing!

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s drive, can we drive, does it drive?

speaker: DEAN
words: Does it drive?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, no, I know it drives but. . .oh my God! I can’t believe you finished it! You built me a car!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean, now that you’re done with that, will you build me a plane? One that looks like Shamu?

speaker: RICHARD
words: He made that car?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Isn’t that incredible?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she can’t accept it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh Dad, it’s okay.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It’s not okay, he’s a child. She’s not driving a car a child put together.

speaker: DEAN
words: Excuse me sir, but, uh, my father worked on cars and my grandfather worked on cars. I know what I’m doing.

speaker: RICHARD
words: A car is not a model airplane, young man.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is a complex vehicle.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know that too.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I will not have my granddaughter driving around in some contraption you put together in auto shop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, can I just say something here?

speaker: DEAN
words: I did not make this in auto shop. I am telling you this car is safe.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So, you are a certified mechanic?

speaker: DEAN
words: No.

speaker: RICHARD
words: But you had the assistance of a certified mechanic?

speaker: DEAN
words: No.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, then you drove it past a certified mechanic?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, stop it. This is a nice thing Dean did here. Remember, nice things.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m sorry, she can’t accept it. Now, if you will excuse us, we were about to order dinner.

speaker: DEAN
words: Mr. Gilmore, I understand you want Rory to be safe, but so do I. I would not give this car to her if I did not know for a fact that it was a hundred percent safe. I checked it, my father checked it, and Gypsy at Hewes Brothers checked it. It has been checked.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And I’m just supposed to take your word for it?

speaker: DEAN
words: Nope.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Agreed.

speaker: DEAN
words: Let’s go.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Go where?

speaker: DEAN
words: To check it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t think so.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’ve been working on this car for months. I’m giving it to Rory.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re a very stubborn boy.

speaker: DEAN
words: Do you wanna drive or should I?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’ll take my own car, thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine with me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And drive behind me. I don’t want that thing blowing up right in front of the Jag.

speaker: DEAN
words: No problem. Try to keep your electrical system working long enough to get there.

speaker: RICHARD
words: They worked the kinks out of this electrical system years ago, young man. I’ll be right back.

speaker: DEAN
words: So will I.
[Dean and Richard get in their cars and drive off.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t you feel like one of us should’ve been standing between them waving a flag or something?
CUT TO HEWES BROS.
[The mechanic looks under the hood of the car while Richard and Dean stand nearby.]

speaker: GYPSY
words: It looks fine to me.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Check it again.

speaker: GYPSY
words: I already checked it again. This was checking it again. I checked it earlier, that means this was checking it again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Go ahead Gypsy, check it again. I’ve got all night.

speaker: GYPSY
words: I don’t.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Check the transmission.

speaker: GYPSY
words: I did, it’s all good.

speaker: RICHARD
words: The carburetor.

speaker: GYPSY
words: All good.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Manifold pressure?

speaker: GYPSY
words: Best manifold pressure I’ve ever seen.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’ve missed something. I insist that you go over this entire car again.

speaker: GYPSY
words: But I’m telling you, there’s nothing wrong with this car.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am paying you for a service, I would like that service performed.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Okay, I look again.

speaker: DEAN
words: How many times are you gonna make her do that?

speaker: RICHARD
words: As many times as it takes.

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, I know you think I’m not good enough for Rory, but do you have to take it out on my car?

speaker: RICHARD
words: She’s my only granddaughter. I have a responsibility to protect her. She’s young, she’s naïve.

speaker: DEAN
words: She’s smart.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, she’s smart. . .about certain things.

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, I’m not about to do battle with you here. You can hate me - whatever, I don’t care.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I hardly hate you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t even know you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I’m right here. What do you wanna know? Besides what college I wanna go to or what I wanna do for a living, because I still have no answers for you on that front.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Those are not ridiculous questions to ask.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, but you could’ve waited until dessert to get to ‘em.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, well, perhaps the timing of the. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: Interrogation?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Conversation.

speaker: DEAN
words: Conversation.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Perhaps the timing was a little off. [pause] So, your father – what does he do?

speaker: DEAN
words: Stereo systems.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Installing them?

speaker: DEAN
words: Selling them. He’s got a shop a couple of blocks from here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And your mother?

speaker: DEAN
words: She works part time transcribing medical records.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Interesting, interesting. So, you. . .you like my granddaughter quite a bit?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I love your granddaughter quite a bit.

speaker: RICHARD
words: See Dean, I was beginning to feel a little better about this until you said that.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I’m not trying to make you feel better, I’m trying to be honest.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, you are. It’s an admirable quality.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thank you.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Okay, I found something wrong.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You did?

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: GYPSY
words: Windshield wipers came right off in my hand, very dangerous. Thank God I check it again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Gypsy, you broke those off yourself.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Yes I did.

speaker: DEAN
words: Put ‘em back!

speaker: GYPSY
words: I can’t look at this car anymore.

speaker: DEAN
words: Gypsy!

speaker: GYPSY
words: I miss my home.

speaker: DEAN
words: Put them back.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now I suppose the car is safe.

speaker: DEAN
words: It is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m still not sure it’s an appropriate gift.

speaker: DEAN
words: I understand that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: How tall are you?

speaker: DEAN
words: Why, you wanna dance?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, thank you. I appreciate the offer though.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory sit on the couch.]

speaker: RORY
words: How long are they going to be?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. Knowing my dad, he probably made Dean take the entire thing apart and put it back together again in front of him.

speaker: RORY
words: Poor Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Poor Dean, he has to spend one evening with him. I share chromosomes with the guy.
[Richard walks through the front door]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, we had it thoroughly checked. We found a little problem with the windshield wipers. Dean is there now adjusting them. But once that is taken care of, I don’t see any reason why, with proper insurance of course, why you can’t have that car.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? Thanks!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey hon, why don’t you run and pick up the food for us?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sure.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I’ve got this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here you go, hurry! Before the mu shu congeals.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [leaves]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why didn’t you let me pay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t think it would be, um, appropriate under the circumstances.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What circumstances are those?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The ones where I’m about to get really, really mad at you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, this is my house in my town, where I live my life.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, thank you for the geography lesson.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m - in the thirty two years we’ve known each other, have I once come to your work and criticized the way you handled your clients?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t remember you coming to my work at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, have I passed judgment on your breakfast habits or your clothing choices?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I was offering opinions.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, don’t. I don’t want your opinions, especially not in front of my employees and not in front of my friends.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I guess you can’t take constructive criticism.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing that came out of your mouth today might, in any universe visited by Kirk or Spock, be construed as constructive.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I beg to differ.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And this is absolutely the last time you come into my house and overrule my word.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m talking about Dean and the car.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I was being - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have no right being anything. Rory’s my kid and I make the rules, so if she comes home one day and says, ‘Hey, uh, I’m gonna spend the weekend with Patricia Krenwinkle’ and I say, ‘Okay, grab a sweater’, you just have to deal.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Who is Patricia Krenwinkle?

speaker: LORELAI
words: And if I tell her that she can have the car that her boyfriend made for her, then she can.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I didn’t think it looked safe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don’t have to think it looks safe! I have to think it looks safe! God, why can’t I make you hear what I’m saying?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I hear exactly what you’re saying.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You came here not as a guest but as the judgment police, you kept your uniform on the whole time, and you know what, it comes off now!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lower your voice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! I am a grown woman and you will treat me the way you treat people who have invited you to their house or you will not be invited again.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Invited?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Don’t you think I know why you invited me here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because - .

speaker: RICHARD
words: Because your mother asked you too. She called you up and said I was driving her crazy, and would you please take me off her hands for one day so she can get some peace. Isn’t that true?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You have never once invited me to your house Lorelai, never. And I can hardly point to an event that would prompt you to do so except my recent employment situation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay Dad, Mom did call me but - .

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know, I never thought about retirement. I never thought about what I would do or what I would be once I wasn’t working. I never once imagined that I would go from being a productive member of the human race to a decrepit old drone sitting at the club at three in the afternoon drinking brandy and playing cards.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am an annoyance to my wife and a burden to my daughter. Suddenly I realize what it feels like to be obsolete. I hope that you never have to learn what that feels like. Now, if you will excuse me, I’m afraid I’ll have to take a rain check on dinner. I’m not very hungry.
CUT TO SIDEWALK
[Rory walks past the video store, which her picture is in the window. As she stares at it, Jess walks over to her.]

speaker: JESS
words: Nice picture.

speaker: RORY
words: Gee, thanks.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re very popular right now. I bet if you burn a few books, they’ll probably make you mayor.

speaker: RORY
words: This is ridiculous.

speaker: JESS
words: I don’t know, bet you have a lot of supporters on this. Pat Buchanon, Jerry Falwell, Kathie Lee Gifford.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: JESS
words: Aw, come on, it’s a little funny.

speaker: RORY
words: No, being the poster girl for censorship is not a little funny. The only videos not behind that curtain are Bambi and Dumbo. I mean, they actually had a meeting earlier about whether or not Babe should be behind the curtain so as not to offend people who keep kosher.

speaker: JESS
words: It’s a crazy world we live in.

speaker: RORY
words: And where did they even find that stupid picture?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh no, the picture’s good. It’s the people who are stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m never gonna be able to leave my house again.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, at least you won’t starve.

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t look at it anymore.

speaker: JESS
words: Relax. I don’t think it’ll be around very long.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: JESS
words: Just a guess.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess!

speaker: JESS
words: Enjoy the food.

speaker: RORY
words: Come back here.

speaker: JESS
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll give you an eggroll.

speaker: JESS
words: Yes?

speaker: RORY
words: What did you do?

speaker: JESS
words: Nothing much. Just wanted to make sure whoever rented Dumbo or Bambi gets a little surprise.

speaker: RORY
words: What kind of surprise? What did you do?

speaker: JESS
words: You owe me an eggroll. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: Blech.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Richard walks in the front door.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, there you are, sneaking in like that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s nice to see you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, you seem very happy.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I had a very nice day. Would you like a drink?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, no thanks.

speaker: EMILY
words: I saw Cheeky Lennox today. She’s redoing her entire house and I have to say, it’s given me a few ideas about this place. I won’t scare you with them tonight but I’m very excited about it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well I’m glad.

speaker: EMILY
words: Then I did a little shopping and I had my nails done.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Very nice.

speaker: EMILY
words: Sugar and spice, a little crazier than I usually wear but I don’t know, I was just in that kind of a mood. So how was your day with the girls?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Wonderful.

speaker: EMILY
words: Tell me about it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I saw the town, I saw Lorelai’s work.

speaker: EMILY
words: Did you eat? Because I can have Heloise whip up something for you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No thank you, we had Chinese food.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, you love Chinese food!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes I do.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well I’m thrilled that you had such a wonderful time. It was good for you to get out like that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes it was. In fact, I’m still a little energized from the day, so I think I’m finally gonna organize all those stamps that I’ve been talking about for ages.

speaker: EMILY
words: Now?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why not?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I think that would be wonderful. Have fun.
[Richard walks into his office and sits down]
THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[We see several signs near the gazebo promoting the upcoming Stars Hollow "Bid on a Basket" Fundraiser before we see Lorelai and Rory inside Doose’s Market looking at baskets.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So I've decided I'm saving myself for William Holden.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, it's nice out here in left field.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I'm sorry. Sunset Boulevard was on last night, and I don't know…I've known him for years – Sabrina, Stalag 17 – and yet last night something snapped.

speaker: RORY
words: I'll say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think it was the monkey scene.

speaker: RORY
words: You know he's dead, don't you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The monkey?

speaker: RORY
words: William Holden!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, every great relationship has its obstacles. You'd know that if you weren't dating Andy Hardy.

speaker: RORY
words: This one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, no.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s too big, it raises expectations.

speaker: RORY
words: Like there’s actually a home-cooked lunch in there?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Instead of whatever is leftover in our refrigerator - exactly.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, going back on the pile now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it’s quaint, isn’t it? The women get to make a nice lunch basket, the men get to bid on it, and the world rotates backwards on its axis.

speaker: RORY
words: I think it’s fun.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s because you have a pretty boy to bid on your basket.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you tell him to eat lunch first?

speaker: RORY
words: Hi, I love him, of course. Hey, I’m gonna look in the back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, I’ll hit the front. [walks up front] Hey Patty. Shopping for baskets?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh please, I bought my basket weeks ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Always prepared.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, I’m getting that itch again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, Patty, you don’t actually need another husband.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, need – no, but want – that’s a different story. Listen darling, do you happen to have change for a dollar?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think so.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I don’t know where my quarters go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Down some guy’s g-string, I would expect.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh no, a quarter would be insulting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here you go.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, thank you so. . . ugh! [drops something out of her wallet]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got it. [bends down to pick it up]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh no no , that’s okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is a picture of me.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: It is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Why do you have a picture of me in your wallet?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, uh, well, it’s a very nice picture.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. Why do you have a very nice picture of me in your wallet?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I’m a stalker?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Or when, in my daily travels, I run across a nice single guy...

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh God!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I like to have a visual aid to help me with the wonderful buildup I give you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Patty, I appreciate the gesture but I don’t need you to try to set me up.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: You’re such a beautiful girl and you deserve a nice guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll have a nice guy, but let me find him, okay?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: But you’re no good at finding him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Patty.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Oh, all right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you. I’ll keep this if you don’t mind.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Stubborn girl.
[cut to Rory in the back looking at baskets. Dean walks up to her]

speaker: DEAN
words: Not that one.

speaker: RORY
words: You get no say in the basket.

speaker: DEAN
words: I have to bid on it.

speaker: RORY
words: And you have to eat what’s inside it and you get no say in that either.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: DEAN
words: Is Taylor behind me?

speaker: RORY
words: No. [they kiss; a noise interrupts them]

speaker: DEAN
words: What? Taylor? [he turns around to look] Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Sorry to intrude.

speaker: DEAN
words: Then why did you?

speaker: JESS
words: Well, you’re having your vertical From Here to Eternity moment right in front of the super glue.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: JESS
words: Not that that’s not an appropriate place to be doing it in front of but - .

speaker: DEAN
words: Here’s your glue.

speaker: JESS
words: Thanks. As you were. [walks away]

speaker: DEAN
words: I really hate that guy.

speaker: RORY
words: He didn’t do anything.

speaker: DEAN
words: He’s here, he’s breathing, that’s enough.

speaker: RORY
words: I really wish you two could start over.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because he lives here and we run into him. He goes to school here. I just think it’d be easier.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m fine with the whole hating him thing, thank you.

speaker: RORY
words: I just think it’s a waste of energy.

speaker: DEAN
words: You know, I’ll have a PowerBar.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, forget it.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, I should probably get back to work. We still on for tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. I might be baking.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’ll pick you up at seven. Get that one, it’s nice and small.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
[Dean walks away; Jess walks back over and startles Rory]

speaker: RORY
words: God!

speaker: JESS
words: Sorry. Two for one sale.
[opening credits]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai is behind the front desk on the phone.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Independence Inn, Lorelai speaking…Oh sure. Uh, what dates are you looking at? Hold on one sec. . . Um, would you like a king or a queen size bed? . . . Well, you have your choice. I’ve got a room with a king size and a room with two queens. . . Uh huh. . Oh, well, do you think you’ll make up by then? . . . Ugh. Yikes, well, I would take the room with the two queens. . . Uh huh. . . Uh huh. . . Oh God! Uh, sorry, no, nothing, nothing’s wrong. I. . everything’s . .yes, great, call me back when you know. Okay. Thank you.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN KITCHEN
[Lorelai walks through the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Patty has taken it upon herself to find me a man.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. Here in my hand I have the pictures and resumes of the top three contenders.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Anyone good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but two of them have run with the bulls. This is so humiliating. I can find my own man.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She just loves you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but . . .you know, ew!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ugh.
[Jackson walks in]

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, don’t look!

speaker: JACKSON
words: What?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Cover your eyes!

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay, okay. I’m sorry, now why am I doing this?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Because I’m baking for the picnic tomorrow and it’s supposed to be a surprise.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh sure, never see a pie before an auction, it’s bad luck.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, uh, you guys talk, I have to go call Patty and stop the forced mating process. I feel like Ling-Ling the panda bear. Oh, hey, one of them’s seen Ghostbusters 124 times. Can you say score? [leaves]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, what’s up?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well. . . I’m sorry, can I put my hand down? I need to look at you when I talk.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh, hold on. Go.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I got a call from my landlord today reminding me that my lease is up at the end of this month.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So, of course, he wanted to know whether I was gonna re-up it or not.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: JACKSON
words: But I told him that I had to talk to you first.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay. About what?

speaker: JACKSON
words: About re-upping my lease.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So what do you think?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: About re-upping your lease?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, you have a very nice kitchen.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes, I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And I like your living room. Though that house across the street has sort of that creepy Miami Beach blue, which means that during the day you really can’t look out your window, but at night it’s not so bad.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Sookie, forget about the house across the street.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, if you forget about the house across the street, I don’t see why you shouldn’t.

speaker: JACKSON
words: You don’t?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nope.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, okay, fine. Um, I just wanted to check with you first.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, I appreciate that.

speaker: JACKSON
words: So, um, I guess I’ll go re-up my lease then.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Sounds good.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah. Sounds good.
CUT TO SIDEWALK
[The day of the fundraiser, Lorelai and Rory walk down the street with their baskets]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what’s wonderful about this festival?

speaker: RORY
words: No, what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That it always falls on the day after trash day. Therefore, all the stuff that you forgot to throw out that you would normally be stuck with for another whole week, you can instead put in a pretty basket and auction off for charity.

speaker: RORY
words: That is wonderful.
[Lane runs up behind them]

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, I’ve got it all worked out.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell please.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I invited my cousin David to come and bid on my basket, you know, to keep my mother happy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LANE
words: Then when he gets it, we tell my mom we’re gonna go eat over at the park where Henry’s gonna call on the pay phone at exactly two o’clock for the ‘all is clear’ sigh. Then David, with the twenty bucks I give him, will disappear, Henry will arrive, and we’ll finally have out first official date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My head is spinning.

speaker: LANE
words: Stash this at Miss Patty’s for me, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t you need this for David to bid on?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh no, my mom packed that one. You know, homemade granola, wheat grass juice, soy chicken taco.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Suddenly our lunches are looking pretty good.

speaker: LANE
words: This is the Henry basket. I went by Gianelli’s and stopped in and picked up a couple of meatball heroes and some chips. I also packed a change of clothes, makeup, makeup remover, and three temporary tattoos.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure, ‘cause four would be trashy.

speaker: LANE
words: I gotta go. I gotta sneak back into my house. Oh, I’m so excited! [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah man. I remember the days of lying to my mother about a boy. Once I had a boy hidden in the closet and of course Mom wouldn’t leave, so I finally had to pretend to get sick to my stomach just to get her out of the room long enough for him to climb out the window and down the tree. He fell, broke his leg. Ah, to be young again.
CUT TO AUCTION
[A crowd is gathered in front of the gazebo filled with baskets. Taylor stands at a podium in front as the auctioneer]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Sold for fifteen dollars to the man in the yellow. Thank you very much. Now the next basket I have here is a lovely green wicker number that would be a charming addition to any room once the lunch is gone. Let’s start the bidding at five dollars. Do I hear five?

speaker: DAVID
words: Five dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Okay, I have five dollars. Do I hear ten?

speaker: KIRK
words: Ten dollars. [Mrs. Kim glares at him] Withdrawn.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Okay, I’m still at five, do I hear ten? Five going once, five going twice, sold to the young man for five dollars. You know what’s nice, you can put a couple of extra rolls of toilet paper in there and stick it someplace in the bathroom – decorative and convenient. Now this next one may not look like much ...

speaker: RORY
words: Mine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: ... but remember people – good things come in small packages.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How badly does he want to be hosting a game show?

speaker: RORY
words: Hm, he can taste it.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Let's start the bidding at three dollars.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey!

speaker: DEAN
words: Five dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Now that's the kind of bidding we want to hear today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He's good. He's very good.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Five dollars, do I hear ten dollars?

speaker: JESS
words: Ten dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Okay, I have ten dollars. Do I have fifteen?

speaker: JESS
words: Twenty.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Twenty dollars, do I hear twenty-five?

speaker: DEAN
words: Thirty.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Okay, see, you boys don't seem to understand the way this thing works.

speaker: JESS
words: Forty dollars.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fifty dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Excuse me, have either of you noticed how tiny this thing is?

speaker: JESS
words: Seventy-five.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Now we’re not talking cents gentlemen, we’re talking dollars remember.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh oh. Dean's hesitating.

speaker: DEAN
words: Eighty.

speaker: RORY
words: He does not have eighty dollars to spend on that basket.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Eighty? Eighty dollars?

speaker: JESS
words: Ninety.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ninety dollars, is that correct?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, I don’t think he'll have to.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Okay, we've got ninety going once, ninety dollars going twice. . . sold to the nice young hoodlum in the back for ninety dollars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm trying to think, uh, in what scenario this situation could be construed as positive.

speaker: RORY
words: Well . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, no one's head's on fire.

speaker: RORY
words: I better go talk to Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want some help?

speaker: RORY
words: No, it's okay. I’m just officially not a fan of unpredictability.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I totally understand. Good luck.
[Rory walks over to Dean as the auction goes on in the background]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Five dollars on this one, do I hear five dollars?

speaker: MAN
words: Five!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Five dollars, that's good. Thanks you, how about ten dollars?

speaker: MAN
words: I'll go ten!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ten dollars - let's keep going. Look at the size of this . . .
[cut to Rory and Dean talking behind the gazebo]

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m gonna kill him.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, he was probably just fooling around or something.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, he was messing with me.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t - .

speaker: DEAN
words: He was messing with me and it’s the last time, I swear to God.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, calm down.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why would he do this?

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe he was hungry.

speaker: DEAN
words: He’s trying to make me crazy.

speaker: RORY
words: Just don’t let him.
[Jess walks up behind them]

speaker: JESS
words: I gotta tell you, of all the nutty barn raising shindigs this town can cook up, this one wasn’t half bad.

speaker: DEAN
words: Glad you enjoyed it.

speaker: JESS
words: Yes I did. So shall we?

speaker: DEAN
words: Shall we what?

speaker: JESS
words: Shall we go?

speaker: DEAN
words: Go where?

speaker: JESS
words: Go eat.

speaker: DEAN
words: Excuse me?

speaker: JESS
words: The person who buys the basket wins the company of the person who makes the basket for lunch. Basket, basket maker, guy who didn’t bring enough money.

speaker: DEAN
words: You think this is funny.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, it’s no Lenny Bruce routine but it has its moments.

speaker: DEAN
words: Bye Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Where you going?

speaker: DEAN
words: You’re the one who’s going.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, as soon as Rory is ready.

speaker: DEAN
words: She’s not going with you.

speaker: JESS
words: Really, is that true?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yes, it’s true.

speaker: JESS
words: Excuse me Edgar Bergen, I think I’d like Charlie McCarthy to answer now.

speaker: DEAN
words: Shut up.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Well…

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh, come on!

speaker: RORY
words: It’s tradition.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don’t believe this.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s true. My mother and I have been doing this every year since we moved here.

speaker: DEAN
words: So buck tradition.

speaker: RORY
words: Are you kidding? Do you remember how mad Taylor was when I was sick and I couldn’t go to the turkey-calling contest?

speaker: DEAN
words: This isn’t school, you’re not getting graded.

speaker: RORY
words: Just don’t make this into a big thing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Don’t go.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh geez man, she’s not shipping off to ‘Nam.

speaker: DEAN
words: You SO need to shut up now.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, Dean, it’s a picnic, it’s lunch. We’ll sit, we’ll eat, it’s over.

speaker: DEAN
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: What do you think’s gonna happen?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, I think I’d like to hear this one also.

speaker: DEAN
words: I don’t want you to go.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean!

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, forget it, go. [walks away]

speaker: RORY
words: [follows him] Please don’t walk away like that.

speaker: DEAN
words: Sorry, I’d do a silly walk but I’m not feeling very John Cleese right now.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean, this isn’t my fault. I didn’t ask him to do that, I didn’t tell him to do that. Dean, you’re my boyfriend. I would never do anything to hurt you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah? You’re doing it right now. [walks away]
CUT TO AUCTION

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Going once, going twice. . .sold for twenty-five dollars! Congratulations. Thank you. Oh Lord, will you look at this? Ladies and gentlemen, now this is a basket.
[Sookie mouths to Jackson ‘That’s my basket’]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Let’s start the bidding on this delicious treat at ten dollars. Do I hear ten dollars?

speaker: KIRK
words: Ten dollars.

speaker: ANDREW
words: Fifteen dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I have fifteen dollars.

speaker: KIRK
words: Twenty dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Twenty dollars, I have twenty dollars. Is that my final offer?

speaker: KIRK
words: All right, fine, twenty-five.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Kirk, you just offered twenty, you upped your own bid.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I‘m sorry, can we stop the bidding for just a second?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Sookie, you know the rules.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes, but I – .

speaker: TAYLOR
words: We have twenty-five dollars. Do I hear thirty?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson.

speaker: ANDREW
words: Thirty, if there’s pie.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: There are no contingencies Andrew.

speaker: KIRK
words: Thirty-five.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Andrew?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson?

speaker: ANDREW
words: I’m not going any higher without the promise of pie.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Thirty-five going once, thirty-five going twice. . .sold to Kirk for thirty-five dollars.

speaker: KIRK
words: Yes, finally! You know, if it hadn’t have been for me I could’ve had it for twenty-five.
[Sookie and Jackson walk away from the crowd]

speaker: SOOKIE
