words: Hey, what is wrong with you? I gave you all the signals. The pointing, the waving, the mouthing ‘That’s my basket.’ Didn’t you see the mouthing?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes, I saw the mouthing.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, why didn’t you bid?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I don’t know. It just didn’t feel right.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What are you talking about, it didn’t feel right? I made four kinds of pesto and three different desserts. Plus the entire basket is an edible pretzel with a goat cheese filling.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, I hope Kirk enjoys it.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t understand.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, come on Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I told you that the lease was up on my apartment, and I asked you if you thought that I should renew the lease on my apartment and you said yes!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Do you not like that apartment?

speaker: JACKSON
words: No, I love that apartment. It’s perfect, the ultimate bachelor pad. It’s just big enough for one.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Only here’s the thing. You and I, we’ve been dating for awhile and I don’t know, I thought things were going pretty well.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Things are going really well.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay, so I had this crazy thought that since things were going really well that maybe it was time to take a step forward.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You wanted to move in together?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, I at least wanted to consider moving in together.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, uh, I hadn’t even thought about it.

speaker: JACKSON
words: You hadn’t?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, no.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, my mistake then. I thought we were on the same wavelength. We weren’t, no problem, enjoy your lunch.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Jackson, I lied. I have thought about it - a lot. Our bathroom’s gonna be pink. I’m sorry.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, why didn’t you say something?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I didn’t want to ruin anything. We’re doing so well, we have so much fun, it’s all working.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Why would living together mess all that up?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t know. We’d see each other every day.

speaker: JACKSON
words: We see each other every day now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you’d find out all my annoying little quirks.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hey, I’ve got annoying quirks too, you know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know.

speaker: JACKSON
words: What’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you might get sick of me.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Or you might get sick of me.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No, that’s not gonna happen.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, if that’s not gonna happen, then what’s the problem?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The problem is that Kirk is gonna eat my goat cheese basket.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Not if I have anything to say about it. [they kiss] How’s that for not getting sick of you? Now if you’ll excuse me, I got a basket to get.
[cut back to auction]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Next up – why, that looks like a Doose’s market basket. Nice, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, that’s mine.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I’d like to start the bidding at five dollars.

speaker: GUY 1
words: I bid five dollars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoa, that was quick.

speaker: GUY 2
words: Ten dollars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do they know that all that’s in there is two stale Pop Tarts and a Slim Jim?

speaker: GUY 3
words: Fifteen dollars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He looks familiar.

speaker: GUY 1
words: Twenty dollars.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Twenty dollars.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So does he.

speaker: GUY 2
words: Twenty-five.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This is going very well gentlemen, keep it up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no. [walks over to Miss Patty] Those are the guys, aren’t they?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The guys whose pictures you sent me - you brought them here! You’re setting me up!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well darling, you can’t be trusted to do it yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh geez, oh geez!

speaker: GUY 2
words: Thirty-five.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: That one’s a snorkler.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh! [runs away]
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai bursts through the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke! Where is he, where is he? I need him! Caesar, where is - agh, agh, thank God. Hey, hey, you gotta come with me.

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing? Hey hey, I got plates here!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Put the burgers down. Caeser, you're in charge.

speaker: LUKE
words: Now wait.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you have money? I need money. Which one opens this thing? Is it that one, not that one.

speaker: LUKE
words: Stop messing with that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, you gotta come out there with me. Patty gave my picture out to all these guys because she thinks I need a man.

speaker: LUKE
words: You do, one with a nice couch and a deep knowledge of Freud.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have to come out and bid on my basket.

speaker: LUKE
words: Are you serious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: I have never in my life taken part in one of these crazy group flip outs. I'm not about to start now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But - right now - out there – the -.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just buy your own basket.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I cannot buy my own basket.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because that is pathetic.

speaker: LUKE
words: And chasing me around my diner begging me to buy your basket?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Also pathetic. But that is a pathetic I can live with, where that pathetic is a truly pathetic pathetic, and only you can save me from the double pathetic! Please!

speaker: LUKE
words: I can't believe I'm doing this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha ha! Hurry up. Hurry up!
[Lorelai rushes him out the door]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Luke walk up to the crowd]

speaker: GUY 1
words: Forty-five fifty.

speaker: GUY 2
words: Forty-six.

speaker: GUY 3
words: Forty-six fifty.

speaker: GUY 1
words: Forty-seven.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go, go on.

speaker: LUKE
words: Forty-seven dollars, are you kidding?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke!

speaker: GUY 2
words: Forty-seven fifty!

speaker: LUKE
words: For what? Two stale Pop Tarts and a Slim Jim?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you're not getting the whole saving me here thing, are you?

speaker: LUKE
words: Fine. Forty-eight.

speaker: GUY 1
words: Forty-eight fifty.

speaker: LUKE
words: Forty-nine.

speaker: GUY 2
words: Forty-nine fifty.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, fifty-two fifty.

speaker: GUY 1
words: What? We're just supposed to go to fifty.

speaker: LUKE
words: I have a life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fifty-two fifty going once!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Hey, hey, that's my job! Fifty-two fifty going once, fifty-two fifty going twice . . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, please God.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Sold for fifty-two fifty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes! Ha, ha, sorry guys, don’t feel bad. I’m totally into Dungeons and Dragons. You’ve skated.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: And that, ladies and gentlemen, concludes the basket bidding for today. Victors come claim your prizes and your dates. Let the lunching begin!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You rock!

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You're welcome.

speaker: LUKE
words: So what do we do now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I guess we eat.

speaker: LUKE
words: This?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: First I have to buy it, then I have to eat it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, the basket of botulism does come with my company.

speaker: LUKE
words: Huh. You don't eat with your mouth open do you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Women don't eat at all. We just look at food and jump on the treadmill.

speaker: LUKE
words: All right, let's go.
[cut to Rory standing alone as Jess walks up to her]

speaker: JESS
words: You know, there’s nothing there.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I know.

speaker: JESS
words: You going after him?

speaker: RORY
words: Not right now.

speaker: JESS
words: So then, shall we?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, come on.
CUT TO BENCH
[Kirk is going through Sookie’s basket as Jackson walks over to him]

speaker: JACKSON
words: I’ve been looking all over for you.

speaker: KIRK
words: Any idea what this is?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh, yeah, it’s a pineapple–cranberry chutney.

speaker: KIRK
words: Ech.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Listen, I’d like to talk to you about this basket. As you know, Sookie made it and since Sookie and I are seeing each other, naturally she assumed that I would bid on it.

speaker: KIRK
words: Where are the carrot sticks? Every lunch has carrot sticks.

speaker: JACKSON
words: But see, I was a little upset about a fight we had had, and so I didn’t bid on the basket.

speaker: KIRK
words: I love carrot sticks, especially the crinkle cut kind.

speaker: JACKSON
words: However, we just made up and now I’d like to have lunch with Sookie, so. . . I need the basket.

speaker: KIRK
words: This is my basket.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes, but I’d like you to give it to me so that I can have lunch with Sookie.

speaker: KIRK
words: I bought this basket. The rules are whoever bids the highest gets to keep the basket.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah, I understand the rules but - .

speaker: KIRK
words: I bid the highest, I bought the basket, I get the basket.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay Kirk, I’ll pay you for it. I’ll give you forty-five dollars, that’s ten dollars more than you paid for it.

speaker: KIRK
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay, fifty dollars.

speaker: KIRK
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Kirk, this is insane. I’ll buy you another basket.

speaker: KIRK
words: I don’t need you to buy me another basket. I won this one. You can’t just come by and take it away. Just because you have a girlfriend and she made this basket for you doesn’t give you the right to bully those of us who don’t have girlfriends or anybody to make a basket for them.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, I wasn’t trying to bully you.

speaker: KIRK
words: Not this year, not last year, not the year before that.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: My mother didn’t even make one for me.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, that’s very sad.

speaker: KIRK
words: She made one for all my brothers and sisters but not for me.

speaker: JACKSON
words: That’s terrible, Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Twelve brothers and sisters, the only one without a basket – me.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Okay Kirk, what’s it gonna take?

speaker: KIRK
words: Two hundred and fifty dollars.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Kirk, you’re kidding me.

speaker: KIRK
words: Twelve brothers and sisters.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Will you take a check?

speaker: KIRK
words: With two forms of ID.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I swear, you better be as pathetic as you sound.

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh, trust me
CUT TO BENCH
[Lane and David sit on a bench in the park]

speaker: LANE
words: What time is it?

speaker: DAVID
words: Three o’clock.

speaker: LANE
words: I don’t understand, Henry should’ve called by now. Give me some change. [walks over to pay phone] Oh my God, it’s not working!

speaker: DAVID
words: Great, can I have his lunch now?

speaker: LANE
words: I’ll be right back.
CUT TO GAZEBO
[Lorelai and Luke sit on the bench]

speaker: LORELAI
words: We're supposed to be eating on the ground.

speaker: LUKE
words: Says who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Every picture you've ever seen of a picnic shows people eating on the ground.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, and every time I have seen a picture of people eating on the ground I've thought, what the hell are you people doing sitting on the ground? Spring for some beach chairs, you cheapskates.
[Lane runs up into the gazebo]

speaker: LANE
words: Hey Lorelai, do you have your cell phone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, is everything okay hon?

speaker: LANE
words: I just need to make a call.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here you go.

speaker: LANE
words: I'll be right back.
[Lane walks away as Luke stands up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, where are you going?

speaker: LUKE
words: I am going to the diner, I am going to get us some edible food and I’m gonna bring it back here for us to eat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so not the point of today. I made this. I am insulted. I will now proceed to pout.

speaker: LUKE
words: I'll bring back some brownies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, the pouting has left the building.
[cut to Lane on the cell phone]

speaker: HENRY
words: Hello?

speaker: LANE
words: Hello, Henry?

speaker: HENRY
words: Lane, I’ve been trying to call you.

speaker: LANE
words: I know, the pay phone is broken.

speaker: HENRY
words: I thought the number was wrong and I didn’t know what to do, so I. . .

speaker: LANE
words: What, you what?

speaker: HENRY
words: I called your house and your mother answered.

speaker: LANE
words: What did you say?

speaker: HENRY
words: I asked for you and then she asked why, and I said because and she said because why, and I got nervous and tried to sell her a subscription to the Wall Street Journal.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, were you successful?

speaker: HENRY
words: Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: Sorry, but at least she doesn’t know, right?

speaker: HENRY
words: I guess not.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, then we’re still good. Can you meet me now?

speaker: HENRY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LANE
words: I know it’s later than we planned, but we still have a little time and I saved your lunch from David.

speaker: HENRY
words: David?

speaker: LANE
words: My cousin, the decoy.

speaker: HENRY
words: Oh, right.

speaker: LANE
words: So we’ll rendezvous where I told you. Just drive by, honk twice, go around the block, and the second time you pass I’ll jump in the car.

speaker: HENRY
words: Gee, do you even want me to slow down?

speaker: LANE
words: Well yeah, of course. I mean, not to a total stop -.

speaker: HENRY
words: Lane, I don’t think this is gonna work out.

speaker: LANE
words: What

speaker: HENRY
words: This - you, me.

speaker: LANE
words: Are you breaking up with me?

speaker: HENRY
words: How can I break up with you? I’ve never been out with you.

speaker: LANE
words: Well yeah, but that’s what today was supposed to be, a date.

speaker: HENRY
words: A date where we need a secret plan and a two-honk driveby and a decoy cousin?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, yeah.

speaker: HENRY
words: Lane, I like you but I want to be able to actually pick you up, stop the car, and take you out. And I wanna be able to call you, at your house.

speaker: LANE
words: I’m gonna tell my mother, I promise.

speaker: HENRY
words: When?

speaker: LANE
words: Soon.

speaker: HENRY
words: Yeah. Look, I’ve got prom coming up and my friends and I are gonna rent a limo to take us there and I wanna go, and I wanna take a date.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, I’m sure I can figure something out. Maybe Rory can – .

speaker: HENRY
words: I asked somebody else.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh.

speaker: HENRY
words: I’m sorry, I just figured you’d never be able to go and - .

speaker: LANE
words: No, it’s okay, that’s good. You should’ve asked someone else.

speaker: HENRY
words: I do like you Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay, well, thank you, I appreciate that. I have to go.

speaker: HENRY
words: Lane.
CUT TO KIM’S ANTIQUES
[Lane walks up to the house as Mrs. Kim walks out.]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: David came by here fifteen minutes ago, said you ran off somewhere! Where did you run?

speaker: LANE
words: Nowhere.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Who is he?

speaker: LANE
words: Who?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: The boy you ran off to see! The one who calls here pretending to work for the Wall Street Journal!

speaker: LANE
words: There’s no boy.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You know the rules, no boys! Not unless I approve and I don’t approve!

speaker: LANE
words: How do you know?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I know, I know! You’re sneaking, you’re lying, that means something’s wrong with this boy!

speaker: LANE
words: There’s nothing wrong with this boy. He’s perfect and he likes me and I was so afraid to tell you about him that now he’s gonna take somebody else to the prom and I blew it!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You go upstairs right now and calm down!

speaker: LANE
words: Fine!

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Now!

speaker: LANE
words: Fine! [stomps up the stairs]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: That is not calming down!
[cut to Rory and Jess walks towards the bridge]

speaker: JESS
words: Where do you wanna eat?

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t care.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are you going?

speaker: JESS
words: Thought you didn’t care.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not jumping in the lake.

speaker: JESS
words: No underwater dining, got it.

speaker: RORY
words: Now what?

speaker: JESS
words: Now we sit.

speaker: RORY
words: Here?

speaker: JESS
words: Yup.

speaker: RORY
words: On the bridge, that’s where we’re gonna eat?

speaker: JESS
words: Yup.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, I like this place.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow. A place in Stars Hollow you actually like. I’m stunned.

speaker: JESS
words: It’s got some good memories. You see right over there?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: JESS
words: That’s where Luke pushed me in.

speaker: RORY
words: Huh.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s nice.

speaker: JESS
words: It is.

speaker: RORY
words: So why’d you do it?

speaker: JESS
words: Do what?

speaker: RORY
words: Outbid Dean like that.

speaker: JESS
words: I don’t know. I guess it started as a joke just to bug him, but then he just got so mad, you know? And he is so tall, and I just was looking at him and he’s standing there all tall and mad and I just. . .I don’t know. It was. . .it was really funny.

speaker: RORY
words: It wasn’t funny.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I didn’t intend to do it. Does that make you feel any better?

speaker: RORY
words: I just don’t wanna be in a fight with Dean.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m sorry about that. You wanna push me in the lake? It’s cathartic, I hear.

speaker: RORY
words: Hm, maybe in a little.

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever. So why don’t we open this thing?

speaker: RORY
words: Go ahead.
[Jess opens the picnic basket]

speaker: JESS
words: Wow. Not one thing in here that I would remotely consider eating.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I didn’t make it for you. I made it for Dean.

speaker: JESS
words: And Dean would’ve eaten this? [holds up a container]

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, he would have.
[Jess tastes a forkful of the food and makes a face]

speaker: JESS
words: Dean is an idiot.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean never would’ve fallen for that.

speaker: JESS
words: Ah, ha ha.
[cut to Jackson and Sookie sitting on a blanket]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can’t believe he wouldn’t take your check.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Well, apparently, I don’t look like my picture.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He’s a loon.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah. It’s okay. I’m paying him off in weekly installment in crinkle cut carrot sticks.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m glad we made up.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah, me too.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you know, if you still wanted to talk about, you know, what we were talking about, we could talk about it now.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Hmm, nah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Excuse me?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I don’t know. I’m having second thoughts.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You are?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yeah. I mean, living together - big deal, right?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh right. Big deal. Who cares? Not me. No siree, Bob. So, I’m sorry, you don’t think we should live together anymore?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Nope.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay.

speaker: JACKSON
words: I think we should get married.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I think we should get married.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But – uh, but. . .

speaker: JACKSON
words: Soon.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Are you pregnant?

speaker: JACKSON
words: What do you say? Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yes! I say yes. Oh my God, we’re getting married! You do know that this means we’ll have to live together, right?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Yes I do.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, good.
[Cut to Luke and Lorelai sitting in the gazebo]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, your burgers actually taste better outside.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good. Next time the roof in the diner’s leaking, I’ll just rip the stupid thing off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So this is nice, huh? Come on, admit it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Never.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? Admit it, you would much rather be sitting out here than inside working.

speaker: LUKE
words: The diner’s probably on fire by now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You are stubborn.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m stubborn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, you’re stubborn.

speaker: LUKE
words: You’re Miss Flexibility over here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I can be flexible.

speaker: LUKE
words: Please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can. As long as everything is exactly the way I want it, I’m totally flexible.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ah, well, my mistake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want a fry?

speaker: LUKE
words: You want a carrot?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Impossible.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right back at ya. So let me ask you something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Napkin, please.

speaker: LUKE
words: Who did you want to get your basket?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, before you knew Patty was gonna put you on the Dating Game, you did pack this disgusting lunch and bring it out here, so who did you want to get it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, last year Roy Wilkins bought it and I got my sprinklers fixed for half price.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And this year my rain gutters are completely clogged, and I thought if I could get the Collins kid to bite, I’d get that taken care of.

speaker: LUKE
words: Very practical.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought so.

speaker: LUKE
words: So the participation in this thing was purely for home improvement reasons?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. And I don’t know, it’s a nice concept.

speaker: LUKE
words: What is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just having someone who you love or have some kind of crazy crush on bid on your basket and then share a romantic lunch, it’s a nice concept.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I’m sure someday you’ll manage to find the right guy and drag him out to this thing and make him by your stupid basket and then you’ll be sitting out here with him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, someday.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: This is nice.
[Dean walks up behind them]

speaker: DEAN
words: I have to talk to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, okay. I’ll be right back.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll be right here.
[Lorelai walks out of the gazebo over to Dean]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how’re you doing?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, I’m not great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, Dean, it’s just a silly town thing.

speaker: DEAN
words: I know, and I’ve been telling myself that and I tried to go home and forget about it, but I can’t. I’m worried about Rory. I don’t think she should be hanging out with this guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I know that today was kind of a. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: It’s got nothing to do with today. I mean, yes, it has a little to do with today but it’s more than that. Ever since I’ve met him, I’ve had this feeling that he was bad news.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, Jess has a few issues.

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, one issue is that he’s a complete jerk. I mean, he’s always getting in fights at school. That is, when he bothers to show up at all. And he’s just. . . I don’t know. And now this whole thing with Rory, it’s like he’s always around.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You sound jealous.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m not jealous. He just. . . she has to be nice to everyone, you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. But hon, that’s Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, he’s gonna get her into trouble. I can feel it, I just know it. And he doesn’t care about her, he’s just using her to drive me crazy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean, you love Rory, right?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, part of love is trust. You just have to trust her.

speaker: DEAN
words: I do trust her, it’s - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Him, I know. But flying off the handle like this is not gonna get you what you want. She cares about you, she’s not gonna do anything to mess things up with you guys. I know this.

speaker: DEAN
words: I hope you’re right.
[cut to Rory and Jess on the bridge]

speaker: RORY
words: Ten.

speaker: JESS
words: Ten?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah but I didn’t understand a word of it, so I had to reread it when I was fifteen.

speaker: JESS
words: I’ve yet to make it through it.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? Try it. The Fountainhead is classic.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, but Ayn Rand is a political nut.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, but nobody could write a forty page monologue the way that she could.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, tomorrow I will try again, and you will. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Give the painful Ernest Hemingway another chance. Yes, I promise.

speaker: JESS
words: You know, Ernest only has lovely things to say about you.

speaker: RORY
words: Why are you only nice to me?

speaker: JESS
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: An hour ago you were totally screwing with Dean and now you’re totally nice to me.

speaker: JESS
words: You see, it’s the screwing with Dean - that’s an important step to getting here so that I can be nice to you.

speaker: RORY
words: So it was a plan.

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: The whole bidding on my basket, it was a plan.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, I’m officially starving.

speaker: RORY
words: And officially evasive.

speaker: JESS
words: Come on, I’ll get you a pizza.

speaker: RORY
words: Answer my question.

speaker: JESS
words: Do you like pepperoni?

speaker: RORY
words: Not going to, are you?

speaker: JESS
words: We can just get it on half if you want.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I give, let’s go.

speaker: JESS
words: If you insist.
[Rory walks away, not realizing her bracelet had fallen off. Jess picks it up and puts it in his pocket.]
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai is sitting on the couch as Rory walks in the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey. Where’ve you been? I thought Taylor auctioned you off to the highest bidder.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I just went to get some pizza and I, uh, wandered around the bookstore for a little while. Here. [hands her a book]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s this?

speaker: RORY
words: You said you wanted to read the Children’s Hour.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did?

speaker: RORY
words: The other night when we were watching Julia, and Jane Fonda was playing Lillian Hellman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, and I made the Hellmann’s mayonnaise joke.

speaker: RORY
words: Which no one ever needs to hear again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right, right. Well, thanks.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re welcome.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So who were you with?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pizza, book buying - did you have company?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: RORY
words: So, I’ll be in my room.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, good.
[Lorelai follows Rory into her room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: So how was the picnic?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Did you get the Dean issue resolved?

speaker: RORY
words: Not yet. He’s coming over later and we’re gonna smooth things over hopefully.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, yeah, well, smoothing’s good. I love the smoothing. So, how was it with Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well obviously, the pizza and the books. So good, that’s. . .I’m glad.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What what?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you look like you have something to say.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have nothing to say. I never have anything to say.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, that is your reputation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s. . .I don’t know. I’m just surprised that you’re hanging out with him, that’s all.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He doesn’t seem like the nicest kid.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you don’t know him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I guess not.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re just judging him by that one time that he came over here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Which, by the way, was not a rousing success.

speaker: RORY
words: He had just moved here. He was mad at his mom. Trust me, he’s got a really good side to him. You’ll see it eventually.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, I can’t wait.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, well, I’m sorry. It’s. . I just, uh, I don’t know. From the things I’ve seen and the things I hear. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Like what things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The vandalism, the stealing, the cutting school, the fighting.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know about the fighting?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Dean told me.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve been discussing this with Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, he discussed it with me.

speaker: RORY
words: When?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Today. Rory, he’s really upset about this.

speaker: RORY
words: So he went running to my mother?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he needed someone to talk to.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, he could’ve talked to me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, he couldn’t ‘cause you were off with Jess.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re taking his side?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not taking sides here, okay? I’m Swiss, babe.

speaker: RORY
words: I wasn’t off with Jess. I. . .Jess outbid him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, the rule is that if one person outbids someone else, then. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, this is not about the rule. I know what the rule is. This is about Dean being concerned that you’re hanging out with someone who can get you hurt.

speaker: RORY
words: How could Jess get me hurt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, hon. In the short amount of time he’s been here, he’s managed to make a lot of enemies.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry, when did I move to Salem?

speaker: LORELAI
words: People are concerned about you, you know? You’re young and naïve and you think that everyone has some good inside if you give them a chance.

speaker: RORY
words: So you’re saying that Jess is no good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve known guys like Jess. He seems cool because he’s got this dangerous vibe and this problem with authority and he’s seen a lot of Sylvester Stallone movies.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But guys like this get into trouble which, if you hang out with them, gets you into trouble and I don’t want you to get into trouble.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry, are we talking about Dean still or are we suddenly talking about you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I’ve been there, okay? You haven’t.

speaker: RORY
words: Been where? I mean, we got pizza, we looked at some books. God, I can’t even believe that I’m having this conversation with you. I mean, with you of all people. I mean. . . I don’t even want to talk about this anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I’m going for a walk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Dean is gonna be here any minute.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, he probably wants to talk to you anyhow.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai, Rory and Emily are eating dinner.]

speaker: EMILY
words: A cigar club. Can you imagine a more disgusting organization to join? Your grandfather now pays money to sit in an enclosed room with a bunch of other men and blow smoke in each other’s faces. Twice a week he comes home smelling like a flophouse. So I finally just confronted him. I said, ‘Richard, I know you’re going through a transitional period here and I encourage your trying out new things, but this seems completely out of character for you.’ I’m sorry, am I boring you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you’re not.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: So how are things at the inn?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine, the same.

speaker: EMILY
words: And Rory, how’s that boyfriend of yours?

speaker: RORY
words: Apparently very chatty.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well that’s nice. Lorelai, anything new with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, nothing. It’s been pretty quiet around the house lately.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, sometimes quiet can be nice. Soothing. You can hear yourself think. All right, what’s going on with you too?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not nothing. You’ve both been sitting here all night, not saying a word and not even looking at each other. Are you in a fight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not.

speaker: RORY
words: Please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please what? You are the one who’s been freezing me out all week.

speaker: RORY
words: I just haven’t had anything to say. [her pager goes off]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who is it?

speaker: RORY
words: No one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why won’t you tell me who?

speaker: RORY
words: ‘Cause it’s no one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: You’re kidding, right?

speaker: EMILY
words: Jess, who’s Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m not kidding.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you automatically assume that it’s Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because why won’t you tell me who it is?

speaker: EMILY
words: Who’s Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke’s nephew.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s not Jess, okay? It’s Dean. You wanna read it? Oh wait, no. Dean will probably tell you all about it later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not funny. You know, all week you’ve been - .

speaker: RORY
words: We’re not getting into this again.

speaker: EMILY
words: What? Getting into what? Is it about this Jess the thing you’re not getting into again?

speaker: RORY
words: You know, you never liked Dean at the beginning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s because I didn’t know him.

speaker: RORY
words: And now you don’t like Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s because I know him.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you dating Jess? What happened to Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not dating Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but he’s trying to weasel his way in.

speaker: RORY
words: He’s not trying to weasel his way.

speaker: EMILY
words: In where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In Rory’s world. He has his eye on her, and he’s trouble.

speaker: RORY
words: He’s not trouble.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes he is.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory, if your mother thinks this boy isn’t appropriate company for you then you need to listen to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There, thank you Mom.

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me, but I don’t feel very hungry right now. [leaves table]
CUT TO RICHARD’S STUDY
[Rory walks in and shuts the door. She sits down, then walks over to the phone and dials]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Kim’s Antiques, we’re closed, call tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Mrs. Kim, it’s Rory.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: It’s after nine.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane can’t talk after nine.

speaker: RORY
words: Mrs. Kim, I promise I will never again call Lane after nine, but can I please just talk to her now? Just this once?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Okay, just this once.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.
[Mrs. Kim walks up to Lane’s room]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane?

speaker: LANE
words: What?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Phone.

speaker: LANE
words: But it’s after nine.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: It’s okay, it’s Rory.

speaker: LANE
words: I don’t want to talk right now.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane’s not feeling well, she needs to call you tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, okay. Um, thanks anyhow.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes, goodbye. [hangs up] Lane!
[she walks into Lane’s room]

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: It’s early for you to be in bed.

speaker: LANE
words: I’m tired.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Come downstairs and have some tea.

speaker: LANE
words: No, thank you.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I know you’re upset but I have these rules for a reason. I’m your mother, I know what’s best for you.

speaker: LANE
words: Can we talk about this tomorrow please?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You see, this is exactly why I make these rules. You’re too young, too vulnerable. American boys have different values, they don’t understand respect, you get hurt. I do all of this so you don’t get hurt and now here you are hurt. I don’t like this, I don’t like this at all. Who is he, this boy who hurt you?

speaker: LANE
words: Henry Cho.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Cho?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Cho sounds Korean.

speaker: LANE
words: It is Korean.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: He was Korean?

speaker: LANE
words: Yes, and he was smart and wonderful and cute.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: And – and you’re sure he was Korean?

speaker: LANE
words: He’s gonna be a doctor, he goes to church, he’s a counselor at Bible camp, and he liked me.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: A doctor.

speaker: LANE
words: I’m so stupid. I should’ve just told you and I didn’t and now he’s gone and I’m just stupid.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Maybe I can call his mother.

speaker: LANE
words: I don’t want to talk about this anymore.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: You’re sure he was Korean?
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Emily sit at the table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear Mom, there’s just something about that kid that. . .ugh, I don’t know. And I hate it because he’s Luke’s nephew and Rory likes him but. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: You are her mother Lorelai. You must set boundaries and restrictions, it’s your job.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wanted to like him but I just couldn’t, and Rory can’t see it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she’s young.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And she won’t take my word for it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, she’s young.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know what to do. Maybe I’m overreacting.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, listen to me. Now I don’t say this to you very often, but on this matter I happen to agree with you one hundred percent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gee, thanks Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: I know Rory’s a good girl, but good girls can go bad with the wrong influences. We all know that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no no, I don’t think Rory’s actually gonna go bad.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t back down Lorelai. You took a stand and you are completely in the right here. You absolutely must keep her from that boy. If you need to change her curfew, lock her up, throw away the key, whatever it takes to make sure she doesn’t go astray - you do it. Her judgment cannot be trusted here. She’s a young girl and knows nothing. You are her eyes and her ears and her brain for as long as it takes to make sure she doesn’t make any ridiculous choices in her life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Would you excuse me for a sec?
CUT TO RICHARD’S STUDY
[Lorelai pushes open the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, can I come in?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s not my house, I can’t stop you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just listen to me for one second okay? No sighing, just let me talk.

speaker: RORY
words: Go ahead.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t wanna lock you up and throw away the key.

speaker: RORY
words: Well good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your judgment means something, especially to me. I can’t be your eyes and your ears and your brain.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m trying really hard to connect the dots here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got spooked. I know it violates the fabulous cool mom clause we’re supposed to have going but I did and I’m sorry.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now, I am concerned about Jess.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you shouldn’t be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I am. However, you are a smart girl, you’re a good judge of character, and the fact that he seems to like you gives him a couple of brownie points. You’re not a little kid. I don’t actually think you ever were a little kid.

speaker: RORY
words: I was, for about a month.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If you think he’s a decent guy, I have to respect your judgment.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But I’m asking you to be careful.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really careful.

speaker: RORY
words: I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘Boy in the plastic bubble’ kind of careful.

speaker: RORY
words: I promise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And you have to cut Dean some slack. He’s so crazy about you. He didn’t mean anything by coming to me. He just wigged.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, fight over?

speaker: RORY
words: Fight over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: RORY
words: You still don’t look okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, my mother agreed with me tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m so sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you, I appreciate that.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Later that night, Lorelai and Rory walk through the front door.]

words: Yes. Your fault, and you will pay.

words: Yeah.

THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory walk down the street towards Luke’s]

speaker: LORELAI
words: But my question is, how did that happen? How was it that suddenly everyone in the world was saying ‘music has charms to soothe the savage beast’ when it was written breast.

words: I don’t know. At some point someone misspoke and it just caught on.

words: How do things like that catch on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, did some guy like say it at a big rally of some sort and everyone went home and started saying it that way and then it just spread from there?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, exactly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, now you’re just trying to shut me up.

words: Oh my God.

words: What?

words: Look.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

words: Ugh.

words: Can we sit wherever we like?

words: Wherever you like.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

words: Such luxury I never dreamed of.

speaker: RORY
words: Where do you wanna sit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. Um, how ‘bout this table with it’s unobstructed westward view of the wide cosmopolitan expansive Klump Street?

words: Hm. Or we could sit in the corner - you know, the Mafia table so that no one can come up behind you and whack you with a cannoli.

words: Whack you with a cannoli? Oh, because he left the gun and took the cannoli.

words: You’re so my daughter.

words: Aye aye aye.

words: Hey, let’s sit at the counter.

words: Just sit at a table.

words: Oh, you’re awfully rude for a guy who only has two paying customers.

speaker: LORELAI

speaker: RORY
words: Good.

words: Cheery topic
[phone rings]

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yup.

words: But who knows we’re here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This whole morning has been a little Twilight Zone-y.

speaker: LUKE
words: Or Outer Limits-y.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Great show, just as eerie, same era, but no one ever references it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I'm sorry, I don't speak geek.

words: Yup, stepped right in it.

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: LANE
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Lane. How did you know I was here?

speaker: LANE
words: Telescope. I got a clean shot at Luke’s. I saw you and your mom go in.
[Rory walks over to the window, stretching the phone cord across the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, watch it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, duck Harvey.

speaker: RORY
words: So I guess you’re still grounded over that whole Henry thing, huh?

speaker: LANE
words: Are you kidding? It’s the mother of all groundings. My mom’s done everything but slap a Dr. Dre ankle bracelet on me. I’m not even going to school.

speaker: RORY
words: Isn’t it illegal to keep a kid out of school?

speaker: LANE
words: Well, she talked all my teachers into allowing me to be home-schooled for two weeks. I believe the words ‘highly contagious’ were batted about. I only get five minutes a day of outside phone time but unlimited time to call the Psalm a Day line. A big ripoff, by the way, because psalm 79 has been on there for three straight days. That’s not in keeping with what their name clearly implies, which is a new psalm per day, every day. Not the same tired one from the previous two days.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ve never heard anyone get so riled up about psalms before.

speaker: LANE
words: My world has become very small. Okay, I’m dying for news. Give me some headlines.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, I’ve got a debate coming up. And, um, Dean’s been working extra hours lately saving up for a new motorcycle, so I hardly see him. Mom and I haven’t done laundry in three weeks, but I have taken to jumping into the gigantic pile of dirty clothes while we play our Reader’s Digest World’s Famous Polka CD that we got used for ninety-nine cents. Sorry if that’s all boring.

speaker: LANE
words: Are you kidding? It’s the most stimulation I’ve got in a week.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Lane, come down for your snack!

speaker: LANE
words: It’s tea and melba toast time, gotta go. Don’t forget me in my solitude.

speaker: RORY
words: Never.

speaker: LANE
words: Bye. [hangs up]

speaker: RORY
words: Think fast.
[Rory tosses the phone to Luke, who catches it cleanly]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Schmitty’s over the hill, he’s washed up, put him in Cooperstown. Suit up kid!

speaker: LUKE
words: Call me if anyone sane walks in.

CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting on the living room couch watching TV]

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Can I come in?

words: I guess. So?

speaker: PARIS
words: You couldn't possibly be wondering what I'm doing here.

words: I couldn't?

words: I know we know the material but there’s issues of presentation that need to be addressed.

speaker: RORY
words: Presentation?

words: I was listening to the CD I burned of the cassettes I made of our mock debates against the make-believe team and I realized that you were not talking fast enough.

words: What?

words: You're only doing 135 wpm.

speaker: RORY
words: Wpm?

words: Words per minute.

words: Of course.

words: That's slow.

words: That's not slow.

words: It's Jimmy Bob slow.

speaker: RORY
words: I talk normally.

speaker: PARIS
words: For the average Willie Nelson roadie, yes, but not for a winning debate team member. As a comparison, I speak an average of 178 wpm.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, word speed isn't everything. Sometimes I will add a dramatic pause to prove a point, undercutting my wpm.

speaker: PARIS
words: Let's not harbor any Pinteresque fantasies here, Rory. We'll have scant minutes to make our arguments and we have to maximize our collective wpm.

words: Hey Paris. Were we expecting you?

speaker: BRAD
words: I feel sick.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: And on the Chilton team, we have Rory Gilmore and Paris Gellar.
[Sookie and Lorelai cheer loudly]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oww!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Whoo!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oww!
[Everyone else is silent]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Were we not supposed to do that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe no one noticed.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: Each team will have three minutes for their openings, three minutes for rebuttals, and two minutes for their conclusions. They will be judged on the basis of content, strategy, and style. I will be the judge, along with Mrs. Gladstone.

speaker: PARIS
words: Mrs. O’Malley is impregnable but yesterday I complemented Mrs. Gladstone’s dumpy outfit and bought her an ice cream sandwich and she practically licked my hand in gratitude.

speaker: RORY
words: Nice going.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: We choose which team will take the pro or con side with the toss of a coin. A member of Hillside will make the call.

speaker: BRAD
words: Heads. No, tails, I mean tails!

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: Uh, it’s heads. Chilton will pick pro or con.

speaker: PARIS
words: Pro assisted suicide.

speaker: BRAD
words: What a shock.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: All right. Whenever you’re ready, you may commence.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you. [to Rory] Keep it snappy.
[Rory walks to the podium]

speaker: RORY
words: There are many vantage points from which to consider doctor assisted suicide. Serious consideration draws from ethics, law, medical practices, philosophy, psychology, public policy and religion, all topics I plan to explore in the next two minutes and forty-six seconds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Geez, look at that kid, he’s shaking.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, and pale.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He looks all white and tiny.

speaker: RORY
words: ... provides either information or the actual means, such as medication or other supplies to a person who wishes to terminate his or her own life. The patient must then initiate the process. The goal is euthanasia, a term with its roots in ancient Greek. . .
[As Rory speaks in the background, Lorelai turns around and sees Christopher in the hallway. A few seconds later, Sherry joins him.]
CUT TO LATER IN THE DEBATE

speaker: PARIS
words: And referencing their last point, which erroneously cited South Carolina as a state that has neither a statute nor common law which prohibits assisted suicide when we know that North Carolina is the proper citation, their subsequent argument falls short of even a level of speciousness due to the fact that it doesn’t even have a ring of factual truth, let alone a substance. And after all, the absence of prohibition against assisted suicide is a far cry from a statute that actually legitimizes the practice, a state of affairs that exists only in Oregon, sadly enough, under the 1977 Death Without Dignity Act.
[While Paris is speaking, Sookie tries to subtly look at Sherry, who’s sitting towards the back of the audience]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, circus lady, what’s with the contortions?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m trying to sneak a peak at the girl Christopher’s with.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But you see, the entire concept behind the word sneak is not having people notice you, and what you’re doing is shouting ‘notice me.’

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Tell me you’re not curious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not curious.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You are too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll meet her in a matter of minutes. Now, come on, watch the tiny shaking boy get shorter.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: Two minutes for conclusion.
[Lorelai purposely drops her tissue.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh. [She leans over to pick it up while glancing back at Sherry]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You sneak a little peak?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh.

speaker: PARIS
words: Professor Bomar of Willamette University of Law has prepared a lengthy summary that I’d like to use in my remaining time.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: Time.

speaker: PARIS
words: What?

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: That’s it, time’s up.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, but if I could just have a few seconds to rebut their charge of the cruelty of the act.

speaker: BRAD
words: We take it back!

speaker: PARIS
words: You can’t take it back, it’s a debate.

speaker: MRS. O’MALLEY
words: Okay, that’s enough cruelty for one day, Paris. Your team has won. Congratulations.

speaker: PARIS
words: Really? Thank you. Thank you very much. [walks over to opposing team] You put up a good fight. Better luck next time.

speaker: RORY
words: You okay?

speaker: BRAD
words: I’m sweating. I’m completely soaked through. And I think I’m catching a cold.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you need a hug? Or a towel?

speaker: BRAD
words: No, thanks. I think I’m just gonna sit here quietly.
[cut to Lorelai and Sookie standing near the doorway]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh! There they are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I see them. What do you think?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: She's got good hair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Plus she's been sitting for an hour and her dress is perfect. Not a wrinkle? How does she do that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She must be a witch.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And she's doing that no-hose thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. She's a chic, good hair, wrinkle-free, no-hose-wearing witch.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You ready?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.
[they walk towards Christopher and Sherry]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi there, you two.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey Lorelai. You guys get to meet at last. This is. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sherry.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Nice to finally meet you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I recognized you from your Christmas card.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Which I’m sure you mocked mercilessly.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did not. Others, yes, but not yours. You guys were cute, and the puppy was cute. [Sookie clears her throat] Hey, this is Sookie.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Nice to meet you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Nice to meet you. You have a very smooth dress.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, well thank you. It’s the fabric.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The fabric. Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. Uh, Chris, I’ve told you about Sookie.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes you have, the famous Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The famous Christopher.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I hear you’re the greatest chef after Alan Ducass.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: After Alan Ducass? Who – who said after?

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Dad! You came.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Of course I did.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry, I’m still getting used to it. I’m glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, um, look who Dad brought.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: This is Sherry. Sherry, this is Rory.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, finally, finally, finally. I am so beyond thrilled, I can’t tell you. All he does is talk about you. I couldn’t wait to meet this amazing person.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she lives up to the hype, let me tell ya.

speaker: RORY
words: Is my face turning red?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, beet red.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, I’m sorry. I put you on the spot. I’ve just been really looking forward to this.

speaker: RORY
words: No, no, it’s okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, will you excuse us for a minute? Rory just wanted to show me something around the corner here and we’ll be right back.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So Rory was great, huh?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Brilliant. So, who said I was after Alan Ducass?
[Lorelai and Rory walk down the hall and into the auditorium]

speaker: RORY
words: He brought Sherry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: This is a little. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Did you talk to her? Is she nice?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’s a witch.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what do we do?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, come on, come on. We gotta put on our hostessing hats and set a game plan here.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah, I guess it would be impolite if we didn’t ask them to hang out with us.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So what do we do? Hit the vending machines?

speaker: RORY
words: Invite them to Luke’s?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does she look like a diner chick to you?

speaker: RORY
words: Probably not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I wish he had told me she was with him.

speaker: RORY
words: Where else can we invite them?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Al’s Pancake World.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it’s Friday. He does his prefix menu on Fridays.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh. Well, there’s always our house.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s a mess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Might be the safest?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

words: Why didn’t he mention that she was with him?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.
[they walk back towards them]

words: It’s really just more of an impression than something I probably actually heard.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: But maybe someone implied that I was after him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Sookie?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what, you are the greatest chef in the world, bar none.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Uh, thanks.

words: So, um, are you guys doing anything now?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not really.

speaker: SHERRY
words: No, we’re pretty free for the rest of the day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, why don’t you come back and see our place?

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, that would be great.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, Sherry would love that. Thanks Lor.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I was hoping we’d get a chance to see where Rory lives and her room.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, my room’s really no big deal.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, and the books. I’ve heard all about the books. I can’t wait to see the books.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, let’s go and see the books.
[They start walking down the hall as Paris walks over]

speaker: PARIS
words: Rory! So, great job. We pretty much wiped the floor with them.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, we turned them into cleaning products, definitely.

words: Listen, the verbatim transcripts of the debate will be ready in about a half hour. I thought we could wait for them and sit and talk about what we did right, what we did wrong, compare wpm’s.

words: Well, I’m actually heading with my group back to our house, so I really can’t.

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh. Okay, whatever. If you don’t want to celebrate with me, that’s just fine.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory rush through the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You get the living room, I’ll get the kitchen!

words: What about the upstairs?

words: I’ll body block the fool who tries to go upstairs.

words: Company is stressful.

words: Ugh, don’t forget about your room!

words: What?

words: Well, I’ll hit it next.

words: We have nothing.

words: You guys need some more time to clean up?

words: He knows us too well.

words: Come on in. How’d you know we were cleaning?

words: Uh, well, when you cut us off in the parking lot and sped off doing sixty, I figured you were trying to beat us home for a reason.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I hope we’re not completely ruining your day.

words: Oh no, we love company. Please come in.

words: Your house is great.

words: Thanks, we like it. Have a seat.

words: Uh, that Paris was a little intense.

words: Yeah, her approach will come in handy when she becomes a CEO or a dictator of a country or something.

words: Mm hmm. Well, you were very poised up there, very sure of yourself, just like your dad.

words: And your mom.

words: Aw shucks, Pa.

words: And your uniform is darling, really. I love the blue. Of course, I’m sure you look good in anything.

words: Oh yeah, you should see her in chaps.

words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: No, that was just my mom being funny.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh.

words: Yeah, it comes and goes. You’ll learn to notice the signs.

words: The waves get really still, the animals start to act funny.

words: You know, I went to private school too.

words: Really?

words: Except that our colors were white and bright red. I looked hideous.

words: Oh, she’s being self-deprecating. You looked cute in that outfit.

words: No no, I looked like a peppermint stick. I swear, that’s where my addiction to clothes comes from. Trying to make up for all the years of having to wear the same thing everyday.

words: Yeah, I can understand that.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Well, we should go shopping sometime for clothes or whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, we could do that.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Soon, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.

words: Hey, drinks. Who wants something to drink? I’ve got water, soda. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, just water for me

words: Me too.

words: Oh, making it easy, I love it.

words: I’ll help you.

words: No, I want to.

words: So, uh, do you want flat water or sparkling? I hope it’s flat because I don’t have sparkling. Or flat. Or ice cubes. I have cups, I think.

words: It’s a little awkward, isn’t it?

words: What?

words: Aw, no, not really.

words: But kind of, right?

words: Well, we’re just not used to having company.

words: I mean, you and Christopher were so close. I know it was years ago but these things are never simple.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, just in general, things like this are always awkward slightly, but only slightly. [opens fridge] Agh, look. Apple juice - with a perfectly respectable expiration date.

words: Look, I just want you to know that you should not feel like you need to get to know me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: SHERRY
words: At all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I mean, just because Christopher and I are close doesn’t mean that we need to be close, or friends or anything for that matter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I guess not.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I mean, except for our unexpected visit, we may never have even met.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think we probably would’ve met eventually.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Perhaps, at some function or other.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah - you, me, Martin Sheen all chained to the same tree.

speaker: SHERRY
words: But I do desperately wanna get to know Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well sure, she’s a great kid.

speaker: SHERRY
words: And that’s okay with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, that’s fine.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, I’m so glad to hear that. Because things are kind of speeding up between me and Christopher and …

words: Really?

speaker: SHERRY
words: Rory is so important to him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I know, she is.

speaker: SHERRY
words: And he told me about how he wasn’t really a presence in her life for years and how he’d like to make up for all that time that he wasted.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he’s been doing really well lately.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I know. He is obsessive about his call dates to her. I mean, it doesn’t matter where we are or what we’re doing, he’s gotta call Rory Wednesday nights at seven o’clock. I like that about him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, me too.

speaker: SHERRY
words: And he really wants me to bond with her too. It’s important with everything we have coming.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I totally understand.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Good, I’m glad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: SHERRY
words: So what are the chances of Rory and I getting together on this trip?

speaker: LORELAI
words: This trip?

words: How about tonight?

words: Rory seemed up for it.

words: Tonight huh? Well, uh, it’s kind of last minute and we’re supposed to go somewhere.

words: The Friday night dinner with your parents.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know about those?

speaker: SHERRY
words: All about them, but Christopher said that you can get her out of them if there’s a pressing need.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that’s true to a certain extent but - .

speaker: SHERRY
words: Well this is pressing. I am so forcing myself here it’s embarrassing, but that’s how important it is. I mean, who knows when this opportunity’s gonna present itself again, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: SHERRY
words: So?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, um, sure. You’ll have to ask Rory but if it’s okay with her, it’s okay with me.

speaker: SHERRY
words: You know, you’re as great as Christopher said you were.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he’s an excellent judge of character.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Okay, I’ll see you back out there? Okay.
[Sherry brings two of the glasses into the living room]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Everything okay?

speaker: SHERRY
words: Yup, she found apple juice.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [from kitchen] Hey Rory, can you get that!

speaker: RORY
words: Let the machine pick it up.

words: No, it could be important.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. [answers phone] Hello?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, it’s me.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m still in the kitchen. Um, listen, I just wanted to tell you that Sherry just asked me if she could go out with you tonight just the two of you, and she sort of trapped me into saying that I could get you out of the Friday night dinner, which she knew all about. But I told her she had to run it past you first, so I can still get you out of it. Although, it might be a good idea to get a Sherry night out of the way because it seems kind of inevitable. So if you’re okay going with her, just say, um, ‘Sorry Leonard, we’ve got company, I have to call you back.’

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry Leonard, we’ve got company, I’ll have to call you back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, okay. Bye. [walks into the living room] Okay, here’s your drink. Who was that?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, that was Leonard.

words: Oh, did you tell him we have company?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

words: Uh, who’s Leonard?

words: Oh, just a friend.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A friend of yours or a friend of Lorelai’s?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A mutual friend.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, it’s pretty much equal.

words: A mutual Leonard?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we’re constantly fighting over him.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Rory, can I run something by you?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh sure.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Your dad and I are around for another night, and he’s totally sick of me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not true.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Anyhow, I was wondering if you wanted to do something with me tonight, just the two of us.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, sure, that would be nice.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. I mean, um, if it’s okay with my mom because we do have a Grandma/Grandpa dinner tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s fine by me.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Great. Oh, of course this does leave you a sad little orphan.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh, that’s okay. I’ll have one of my patented White Castle bachelor dinners.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or you can come with me tonight. Uh, if you want.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: To your parents?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, ‘cause with Rory not there I might need a hostage.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, yes, do it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, it’s good grub. You sure they won’t be mad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi, they like you.

words: True.

words: Great. Well, we should go get cleaned up for tonight then. Thanks for having us over like this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Any time.

words: Oh, sounds good.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bye sweetie.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Dad.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Bye Leonard.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Later that night, Rory is in the living room as Lorelai walks down the stairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, hurry, they said six.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah but it’s six Dad time so it’s more like six-thirty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But Dad time is now linked to Sherry time and that Sherry seems awfully punctual.

speaker: RORY
words: That is so annoying.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: We have to learn to live with each other’s deficiencies.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, if it’s Leonard, tell him I’ll call him back.

speaker: RORY
words: He’s so needy. [answers phone] Hello?

speaker: LANE
words: Humongous snag in the CD drop plan.

speaker: RORY
words: What happened?

speaker: LANE
words: Bible class has been moved an hour later, all to accommodate the reverend’s handball schedule.

speaker: RORY
words: The reverend plays handball?

speaker: LANE
words: I’m just as appalled. So it’s at ten instead of nine.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I’ll make the necessary adjustments.

speaker: LANE
words: Thank you, thank you, thank you. So, anything new?

speaker: RORY
words: My dad brought his girlfriend to my debate.

speaker: LANE
words: The potential stepmom? Oh my God. Tell me what she’s like, what’d she say and tell me in like eleven seconds ‘cause it’s all the phone time I have left.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s too much pressure!

speaker: LANE
words: Well, then write a long descriptive letter about it all and slip it into the CD booklet. Oh, and try to include a candid Polaroid of her if you can.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll try.

speaker: LANE
words: Gotta go.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. [hangs up]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey, can we come in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, come on in. Hey.

speaker: SHERRY
words: You look great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thanks, you too.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Hi there, you ready to go?

speaker: RORY
words: All set.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Okay, so we won’t be too late, probably around ten.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, if you wanna grab a drink after the movie, Rory’s got the list of places that serve minors.

speaker: RORY
words: Nah, I got a flask in my purse.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Okay, I’m gonna have to drink a lot of coffee to keep up with you two.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Damn, our secret’s been revealed.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Bye love.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Have fun

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Sweets.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
[Rory and Sherry leave]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: There they go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, there they go.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sherry’s really excited about this. It’s such a great opportunity Lor. Thanks for making it happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s what I’m here for. Let me just get my coat and we can go.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I just ask you a quick question?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sure, what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: When I invited you to Rory’s debate, was Sherry with you?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, of course. She’s been with me the whole trip. Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s just that you gave me no indication that she was with you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What? I must have.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nope, singular pronouns all the way.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I actually don’t remember what I said.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I do. You said, ‘I’ll be there’, as in just you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I may have said that but I wasn’t making a point of saying that. It just came out that way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, whatever, I was just wondering.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s okay that I brought Sherry along, isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely. It was just a surprise, that’s all.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you weren’t trying to hide the fact?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No. I mean, obviously you were gonna find out she was with me once we arrived.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Obviously.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay then.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So what do you think of her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I don’t know her well enough to judge.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, that’s never stopped you from judging people before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey buddy, I’m trying to grow here.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, if it helps, she was saying really nice things about you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah. She said you guys had a really nice talk in the kitchen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, if that’s what she said, then I guess we did.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lorelai, come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You’re being very cryptic. Did something happen between you two?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I just. . .I thought our conversation in the kitchen was a little odd.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And this is being less cryptic?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s just that she went on and on about how we never have to be friends or get to know each other at all or try to force any kind of relationship.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really? She never mentioned that part. Huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So how come she figures she never has to see me?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I’m sure she was trying to make you feel at ease around her. Because it’s true, you guys don’t have to force anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh. Where’d she get this ‘don’t force it’ philosophy?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not from me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You sure?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes, I’m sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So she just wants to get to know Rory, not me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I did steer her toward bonding with Rory, I’ll admit that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But not with me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Rory’s my daughter Lorelai, Sherry has to get to know her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I wasn’t purposely omitting you or telling her not to interact with you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good, so you’re not having me killed or anything like that?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No. In fact, I was just going over my ‘people to kill’ list and I don’t think you were on it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because by the very fact that Rory exists, I am in the picture.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You can back off Lorelai. You’ll be in Sherry’s life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not that you thought to do the same thing when you were in my shoes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? What are you talking about?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You have a fiancé, I believe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, Max.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right, Max.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That was not the same thing.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Really? Max knew Rory, Max got close to Rory, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, he and I never met. I didn’t even know he existed until late in the game. Hell, I didn’t even know you were engaged until you called me from your bachelorette party. And I wasn’t invited to the wedding – or did my invitation get lost in the mail?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you’ve moved a lot this past year.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I was never part of that equation.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, maybe. But trust me, you would’ve been part of the equation eventually. Really Chris, you would have.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well then, trust me Lorelai, eventually you would’ve been part of this one.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Doorbell rings, Emily answers it.]

speaker: EMILY
words: Christopher!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hello Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, this is a surprise. Where’s Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, a last minute unexpected thing came up, but I brought a good substitute – half her genes in a nice nifty Christopher package.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, we’re letting the freezing air get in. Come in, come in. Is she sick? There are terrible things making the rounds these days.
[they walk to the living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, she’s not sick. Hi Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hello Lorelai. Christopher, this is a surprise!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: A nice one, I hope.

speaker: RICHARD
words: A very nice one.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How are you Richard?

speaker: RICHARD
words: You’re looking well.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So are you. You playing a lot of golf lately?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, well, more like it’s playing me. Oh, let’s not stand here. Come into the living room. Now, who wants a drink? Uh, martini, Manhattan, some scotch?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes please.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, you wanna narrow that down for me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hooch is hooch Dad.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’ll have a Manhattan.

speaker: EMILY
words: Same here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Right.

speaker: EMILY
words: So you never said where Rory is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory’s not here?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, you didn’t even notice your own granddaughter isn’t here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she’s so quiet she sometimes slips in unnoticed. She should work for the CIA. Uh, one cherry good for everybody?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Fine with me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Me too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Eight please. I’m peckish.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I noticed that Rory isn’t here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well you’ve got that eagle eye, Mom.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m afraid it’s my fault Emily. My girlfriend and I were passing through town and we dropped by Stars Hollow for a visit, and she and Rory are off doing something together.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have a girlfriend?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sherry.

speaker: EMILY
words: And she and Rory are out together?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry. I should’ve called, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, that would’ve been thoughtful. I mean, we set a place for her at the table and everything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Chris is here so it won’t go to waste.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Although normally I demand my own customized place setting.

speaker: EMILY
words: So how long have you been with this woman?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Eight months.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm, I bet she’s pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, she’s very pretty.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, something in your eye Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got it.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’ve met this woman?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, Mom, I met this woman today and she’s very nice.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, what does she do? Does she work?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, she’s the East Coast sales rep for Loreal Cosmetics.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hm, that sounds like a lot of responsibility.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Keeps her busy, involves some travel.

speaker: EMILY
words: What are they doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory and Christopher’s friend – what are they doing tonight?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dinner and a movie, something like that. It’s my fault that we didn’t call.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You work has you traveling too, I hear.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Some.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Everyone thinks that traveling on business is so glamorous but what they don’t realize is that the business traveler never gets to see the places he visits. My last trip to Rome, I spent the whole four days in a conference room by the airport. I might as well have been in French Lick, Indiana.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, my trips are mostly local, just me and my Volvo.

speaker: EMILY
words: You have a Volvo?

speaker: RICHARD
words: That’s new, isn’t it?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I just got it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Excellent choice. It’s nice and safe. That’s a good family car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s also excellent for cranking Metallica.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Cranking Metallica?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: If that’s some sort of drug reference, it isn’t funny.

speaker: EMILY
words: So you’re planning on having a family?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: With this woman?

speaker: LORELAI
