words: Her name’s Sherry, Mom, and you’re really putting Chris on the spot here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, he bought a family car, it’s a natural question.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad called it a family car. I’m sure there’s nothing in the sales contract that says you have to have a family in order to buy the car.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Although I didn’t read all the fine print.

speaker: EMILY
words: You always drove a motorcycle before, didn’t you?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I still got it.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, oh, a family man shouldn’t drive a motorcycle. The accidents I covered for the firm involving motorcycles – the worst, grisly. They use this industrial machine to scrape the victims off the road like a huge spatula.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, mouthful of cherries here.

speaker: EMILY
words: So are you living together?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, get out the interrogation lamp, why don’t you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s okay. Yeah, but we’re looking for something bigger in the Boston area.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There are a lot of nice historical places up there.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Something historical in our price range would be perfect.

speaker: EMILY
words: You know historical homes are infested with mold, don’t you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mold?

speaker: EMILY
words: It gets inside the walls and grows out of sight and shoots off spores that slowly kill you and your family.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You should get a show on the Home and Garden channel, Mom.

speaker: RICHARD
words: When did you become an expert on mold, Emily?

speaker: EMILY
words: It was in the New York Times Magazine. I’d hold off buying a place with this woman until you look into this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sherry, Sherry.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, it’s actually gonna come down to whatever we can afford. It might just be a newly built place.

speaker: EMILY
words: With their shoddy craftsmanship? Oh, you don’t want that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What does that leave them with, Mom – a teepee?

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m sorry. I just don’t think that Rory should miss our dinners for something other than sickness or emergencies. That was the agreement.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m sorry Emily, really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, Chris has apologized like a hundred times. How many more times do you wanna hear it?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Listen, I can call Sherry and have her and Rory come by after their movie, that way it won’t be a totally Rory-less evening.

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s not what I want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, we’re desperately trying to work with you here.

speaker: EMILY
words: Working with me is one thing, patronizing me is another. Excuse me. [leaves]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I feel horrible.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, don’t son. That’s just Emily.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll go see what I can do.
CUT TO KITCHEN
[Lorelai walks in as Emily pours herself a drink]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You wanna tell me what’s going on here?

speaker: EMILY
words: How can you let that horrible woman take Rory like that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay Mom, calm down. It’s only one night.

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s how it starts. She’s just getting her claws into her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Her claws?

speaker: EMILY
words: We’ll never see Rory again if that woman has her way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, hold it. Rory is my daughter, you know. I have some control over this.

speaker: EMILY
words: She’s not getting Rory on weekends, you can’t let that happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What is this about Mom? Why are you so flipped out?

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, are you blind or just that humiliated?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Humiliated?

speaker: EMILY
words: Christopher gets his life together with that woman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, that’s good.

speaker: EMILY
words: It should’ve been you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t play dumb, Lorelai. You know it too, and deep down I know you’re heartbroken.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not heartbroken.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: EMILY
words: I always had the picture in my mind of the three of you together. After all these years and after all the bad things that happened, Rory with both her parents. And now that Christopher’s got his life together, it’s with her and not you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, the timing was never right for us.

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s because you dawdled time away. You could’ve had that affect on him. You could’ve been the person to help him get his life together, but you made no effort!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so now this comes down to something I didn’t do? Don’t put that on me Mother!

speaker: EMILY
words: What other explanation is there? He’s always been crazy about you but you’ve always kept him at arms length. You keep everyone at arm’s length.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not true!

speaker: EMILY
words: It is true! Your destiny was to be with Christopher and now it’s too late!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then it wasn’t our destiny!

speaker: EMILY
words: So you’re saying that you don’t have feelings for him Lorelai, that all of this is just fine with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not important.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. What’s important is that Christopher is doing well and he’s happy and we should be happy for him.

speaker: EMILY
words: You’re impossible. I need to lie down. Tell Christopher – tell him whatever you like, I don’t care.
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai walks through the door]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: You alone this morning?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Rory’s with me. She just had to run an errand.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, take whatever table you want.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: You okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: You don’t seem your chipper self.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I brought some sparklers. I’ll light them later and do some kicks.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, if you want I can clear the counter and you can play some bagel hockey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You can’t play bagel hockey by yourself.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll play with you. You’ll have to explain the rules.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s okay. I’m just trying to recover from last night. It was one of those nights where you start off stepping in quicksand and end up with a sixteen-ton anvil landing on your head.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ve had plenty of those. I’ll bring some coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can’t hurt.
[Lorelai walks towards an empty table as Rory walks in]

speaker: RORY
words: You order?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, just coffee. God, I must’ve been sound asleep when you got home last night.

speaker: RORY
words: You were snoring like a buzz saw.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I believe that’s defined as a superfluous comment.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, you were sound asleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, I’m dying to hear about your night with Sherry. How was it? Give it to me, A to Z, beginning to end, soup to nuts.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, she is what she seems.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Details please.

speaker: RORY
words: She’s a very cautious driver. She doesn’t roll through stop signs, doesn’t speed, she always signals before she turns.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. Commendable, but not the person I want driving our getaway car.

speaker: RORY
words: What are we robbing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sephora. We had it all planned out.

speaker: RORY
words: Slipped my mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s her music taste?

speaker: RORY
words: Big Bruce Springsteen fan. Seen him like twenty times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Blue collar roots or is she just slumming?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, her father owned a shoe store and her mom taught kindergarten.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, you guys really got into some details.

speaker: RORY
words: She was definitely in bonding mode.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What else, what else?

speaker: RORY
words: She’s very touchy-feely. Hand on the shoulder, lots of hugs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She didn’t try to get fresh, did she?

speaker: RORY
words: Gross!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go on.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, she’s had one prior serious relationship in her life.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Finally, the juicy stuff.

speaker: RORY
words: And it lasted eleven years.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Eleven years? And she never got married?

speaker: RORY
words: She said she never thought about it with her career and all, but now she’s thinking about it more and more.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tick tock, tick tock.

speaker: RORY
words: And the past couple of years she hasn’t even dated anyone unless she thought that for sure it could be a lasting relationship, and she’s got some specific goals now concerning children.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, here we go.

speaker: RORY
words: She wants at least two, and before she met Dad she was seriously considering single parenthood.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s wanting kids.

speaker: RORY
words: That’s about it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, she works for Loreal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, I heard that.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m tapped. How was your night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, fine. Just took Mom a whole five minutes before she self-combusted and left the room in tears.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She freaked out that you were with Sherry, can you believe that?

speaker: RORY
words: She freaked?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Totally. She kept calling her ‘that woman’.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what did she think, that you were gonna come home and find a rabbit boiling on the stove?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it had to do with her and Christopher and . . . anyway, eventually she came down and had a pouty dinner.

speaker: RORY
words: So it ended up okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the most part.

speaker: RORY
words: Is she mad at me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, the angel child, never.

speaker: LUKE
words: Here you go. [brings their coffee]

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks. So, um, I wanna ask you something.

speaker: RORY
words: Ask.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When you’ve thought about me and your dad – what have you been thinking all these years?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, what do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, did you ever picture us potentially together, like ‘we are family’ together?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, not really.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But sort of, it crossed your mind?

speaker: RORY
words: I feel like I’m on the Ricki Lake show.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go Rory, go Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I’ll admit that I have pictured the three of us living together at various times, but in the way that all kids picture their estranged parents living together or the way they should be together, but it’s stupid.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I’ve pictured it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.

speaker: RORY
words: But I also pictured you with Pee-Wee Herman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. We lived in his playhouse and we’d be talking to Chairy and Captain Carl would be walking by.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [laughs] Fun!

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. Oh, and later I pictured you marrying Matthew Broderick, and we lived in New York in this great apartment in the village and we would talk about his Ferris Bueller days.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just think how easy Producers tickets would be to get.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, it would be fourth row center every night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry that Matthew and I couldn’t work it out, honey.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll try to get over it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So should it have been me?

speaker: RORY
words: Huh? Oops, sorry! Zero hour – I have to go. I’ll be right back. [leaves]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory stands by the gazebo and waits for Mrs. Kim and Lane to walk out of their house. When they do, Rory nods to Kirk, who walks up to them.]

speaker: KIRK
words: Excuse me Mrs. Kim, I’m Kirk.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: I know you’re Kirk. I’ve known you since you were two.

speaker: KIRK
words: That’s no guarantee that people remember me.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: We’re in a hurry.

speaker: KIRK
words: I won’t take up much of your time. I was just wondering what your store hours are.

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: For people who come to buy things, come with cash, it’s ten to six, Sunday through Friday. For people who wander around, blocking aisles, touching things with dirty hands, never buying or asking for eighty percent off, we’re closed.

speaker: KIRK
words: I should jot this down. You said ten to six, that’s ten a.m.?

speaker: MRS. KIM
words: Yes.

speaker: KIRK
words: Okay, got it, thanks for your time.
[While they’re talking, a hooded jogger runs by and slips a CD into the bag Lane’s carrying. Mrs. Kim and Lane walk away. The jogger, Michel, runs over to Rory at the gazebo, out of breath.]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God. Michel, are you okay?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I’ve been running around this stupid square for over an hour.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Why? Because the plan was to drop the CD at nine o’clock.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it got changed to ten. I told my mom and she said she’d pass it on. She didn’t pass it on, did she?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Definitely not.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well the mission was a success.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, my cardiologist will be thrilled. Ah! I’ve got a cramp, I’ve got a cramp!

speaker: RORY
words: Can I do anything for you?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Ah, get away from me evil girl!

speaker: RORY
words: But -.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Never will I do anything for you again, ever, ever, never!

speaker: RORY
words: Well if it makes you feel any better, you had really good form.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You are your mother’s child.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you!
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai sits at her table as Christopher and Sherry walk in]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey you guys.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey.

speaker: SHERRY
words: We just wanted to say a last goodbye. Rory’s not here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She went outside somewhere. You can probably find her.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Oh, okay. I think I will. We had such a great time last night. So I hear your dinner was good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, yeah, it was great.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I would love to see that house sometime, especially the portrait of Rory in the study. Any way I could get a picture?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can send you one.

speaker: SHERRY
words: That would be great! So she’s outside?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Somewhere.

speaker: SHERRY
words: I’m gonna try to corral her.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, bring her by so I can see her too.

speaker: SHERRY
words: Okay. Bye Lorelai. Thanks for everything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you’re welcome. Bye.
[Sherry walks out, Christopher sits down with Lorelai]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So, quaint evening of theater last night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah yes, the Gilmore family players rival the Barrymores for their sophisticated, dramatic productions.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I never thought she’d freak over Rory not being there like that. I never wanted to put you in that position.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you couldn’t have known.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I mean, Rory’s missed the occasional dinner before.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, this was compounded by other things.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What other things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You should know as well as I that when it comes to Emily Gilmore, it’s never simple.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Got it. Ah, looks like they found each other. You know, Sherry had a really good time last night. I hope Rory did too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, she seemed to.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good, good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So Chris, before you go, um, I have something I wanna say to you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not an uh oh.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I, um, I kind of realized something with you and Sherry visiting and God help me, because of something my mother said to me.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Wow, inspiration can come from the unlikeliest sources.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I was just thinking, you know, all these years, no matter what my relationship status has been, whether I’ve been dating or hibernating or whatever, I think I’ve always had you in the back of my mind - you know, the prospect of us being together. But this prospect was sort of indefinitely on hold while you, you know, found yourself and, uh, got your personal life together so that you could really be there for me and especially for Rory. But you and I have been so linked in my mind that I think I have unconsciously sabotaged every decent relationship I’ve had, including the one with Max, because I was waiting for you, and I shouldn’t have been. And now that I see that, and I see you settling down with Sherry, I think I can move beyond it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Good, I’m really glad this is good for you Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It is. Chris?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How dare you put that on me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m just thanking you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, don’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s wrong?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What’s wrong? Dammit Lorelai, you’re dumping fifteen years of unhappiness on me? Fifteen years of not having healthy, lasting relationships on me? You’re blaming me for breaking up with Max and not marrying him? That’s all my fault?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I just - .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I did nothing to deserve that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not saying that you did.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You’re as good as saying it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m not.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Then what did you expect to come from this divine revelation that you’ve been so kind to share with me? Did you want me to apologize to you for ruining your life or comfort you and say ‘there, there, everything’s gonna be all right’ so you can feel okay? Forget it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris, wait!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Look, if there’s anything else you feel bad about in your life that you wanna dump on my doorstep, just leave a note! [leaves]
[Lorelai glances at the counter at Luke, who quickly looks down. Through the window, Christopher hugs Rory goodbye]
THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are walking toward Luke’s]

speaker: LORELAI
words: It still hurts.

speaker: RORY
words: Do you need stitches?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Probably.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, then we should go to a doctor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no doctors. You go into a hospital, you don’t come out again.

speaker: RORY
words: Well said, Ida Morgenstern.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m starving. I need pancakes.

speaker: RORY
words: Can I just ask – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: What on earth you thought you were doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought I was being a self-sufficient woman.

speaker: RORY
words: You hate ladders, you hate heights.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We needed our rain gutters cleaned.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, well, hire somebody.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, aren’t we suddenly a Rockefeller.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it’s better than you killing yourself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I’m fine. I’m just being dramatic. It’s what I do.

speaker: RORY
words: No more ladders.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I promise.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think I have gangrene.

speaker: RORY
words: You do not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And vertigo.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And one leg suddenly feels shorter than the other.

speaker: RORY
words: This is gonna be the Vanity Fair paper cut incident all over again, isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow!

speaker: RORY
words: Leave your bandage alone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, it’s turning purple, but a really glowy purple. Look!

speaker: RORY
words: No, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm. Maybe our rain gutters are radioactive or made out of some kind of alien metal so that when I cut my hand I got infected with an extraterrestrial substance which is altering my internal makeup. Ugh, maybe I’ll turn into a superhero.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like, maybe tomorrow I’ll wake up and suddenly be able to shower really fast.

speaker: RORY
words: We’ll go pick out your cape after breakfast.
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE’S
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at a table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I’m starving. Must be from the loss of blood.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, that must be it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m getting pancakes with a side of pancakes. Where’s Luke?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. Storage room?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no.

speaker: RORY
words: Caesar’s cooking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why is Caesar cooking?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s bad.

speaker: RORY
words: His pancakes stink.

speaker: LORELAI
words: They do stink.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what do we do? Resort to doughnuts.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait here.
[Lorelai walks over to the stairway to Luke’s apartment]
CUT TO UPSTAIRS
[Lorelai knocks on Luke’s apartment door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, are you in there?

speaker: LUKE
words: Ow!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, are you okay?

speaker: LUKE
words: Stupid box! Stupid lamp!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, are you being attacked by your possessions again?
[Luke opens the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hi.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whatcha doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m looking for my supply ledger.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it going well?

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s going fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have a sock on your shoulder. Is it helping you look?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you doing up here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory and I are starving. We need you to cook us breakfast. [she walks into the apartment] Oh my God.

speaker: LUKE
words: Caesar can make you breakfast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What happened to this place?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This is what I always pictured the inside of my head to look like.

speaker: LUKE
words: See if you can find a brown leather ledger.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve never seen so much stuff. It looks like a white trash Hearst Castle in here.

speaker: LUKE
words: On second thought, I’ll find it myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where’d all this come from?

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess. Liz shipped the rest of his stuff last week. He finally unpacked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, he did a very nice job.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know it’s crazy now, but I just have to get it all organized, figure out where to put everything, buy another dresser, a portable wardrobe, some storage bins.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can of gasoline, box of matches.

speaker: LUKE
words: Did I mention that Caesar can cook you breakfast?

speaker: LORELAI
words: But he doesn’t make the good fluffy pancakes like you do.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then order eggs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No! See, I had a near death experience today.

speaker: LUKE
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. I almost fell off the roof of my house trying to clean the rain gutters, so I have to have pancakes. Please? I’ll help you shower when I become a superhero.
[Jess walks out of the bathroom]

speaker: LUKE
words: You’ve been in there for two hours.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, well my hair just ain’t bouncin’ and behavin’ today.

speaker: LUKE
words: There are other people living here too, you know.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh, learn something new everyday. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, his people skills are really improving.

speaker: LUKE
words: Go downstairs. I’ll be there as soon as I can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How long is that?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: An estimate.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ballpark figure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Off the top of your head.

speaker: LUKE
words: Will you –

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did I mention that I almost fell off my roof today?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’d lie down if I could find the bed.
[Lorelai sees the supply ledger and picks it up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, is this what you’re looking for?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, great, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not unless you make me the pancakes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Give me the book.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give me the pancake!

speaker: LUKE
words: Come on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: You sure you weren’t almost pushed off the roof of your house today?
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[That night, Lorelai and Rory are walking down the street]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I think I’m finally ready to get a tattoo.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve been saying that for the last five years.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, but I mean it this time.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, what are you getting?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mel Brooks.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean, why? The Two Thousand Year Old Man, Young Frankenstein, Silent Movie – you don’t think Mel has earned the right to have his face on my butt?

speaker: RORY
words: I am so sorry, Mel.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, he’ll love it, trust me. So, rocky road hot fudge sundaes and two cans of whipped cream to go with the movies?

speaker: RORY
words: Trying to give Mel a bigger canvas to work with?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, the man’s a legend, he deserves the best.
[As they pass the diner, Lorelai notices Luke inside sitting at a table]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: RORY
words: What’s he doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not sure. Hey, will you go get the ice cream and make sure they give us a ton of maraschino cherries?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.
CUT TO INSIDE LUKE’S
[Luke is sitting at a table watching a very small television set as Lorelai knocks on the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, what are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, uh, Rory and I just hit the video store. Now we’re on our way home to eat a large amount of something you would not approve of.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sounds good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, watching TV.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah. Wow, that’s cute. Is this the first time it’s been away from its mother?

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s a very good TV.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, black and white, coat hanger antenna, really bad reception.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t you have a fully grown TV upstairs?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well, Jess is upstairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: LUKE
words: So when Jess is upstairs, that means the stereo’s blaring and the place is a mess. I just needed a little privacy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you came downstairs.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: To sit on an uncomfortable chair in an empty diner that smells like onion rings.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Calgon, take me away.

speaker: LUKE
words: It was very peaceful until two minutes ago.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, do you ever think that, uh, maybe you should get a bigger apartment?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t need a bigger apartment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That place upstairs was your father’s office. You turned it into an apartment. It was never meant to be lived in.

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s too small for two people. It’s too small for one person if they have any kind of life.

speaker: LUKE
words: We’ll make due, we just need to organize.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you don’t need to organize. You need to move.

speaker: LUKE
words: I like my apartment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not just your apartment. Jess lives there also.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess is fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure? Because he could be pinned down under a box for a year in that place and you wouldn’t know it until the neighbors started to complain about the smell.
[Rory walks in]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory, perfect, get her out of here. Go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But, uh, okay, fine. I’m leaving. Think about what I said.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, hey, did you ever hire anybody to do that work for you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: The rain gutters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no, not yet. Are you offering?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, actually, I was thinking about Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Jess?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, he’s always looking for a little extra cash. He doesn’t make that much here, and, you know, I hate to think of where else he might try to get it, so…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: I mean, you don’t have to pay him the same as would someone else, and you save a little, he keeps busy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, well, maybe. Um, I actually have to check with a couple of people I’m supposed to hear from, but if they can’t do it, then sure.

speaker: LUKE
words: Great, just let me know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will. Bye.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Rory walk out of the diner]

speaker: RORY
words: So who are all these people you asked to clean out our gutters?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, you know.

speaker: RORY
words: I do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sh-yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Remind me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, there’s Sid.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Sid, right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then there’s Lou.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, a good man, Lou.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, and also Moose. That is, if Doris will let him out of the house again, you know, after that incident at Chicky’s bachelor party.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you said you were gonna give Jess a chance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I am.

speaker: RORY
words: Then why don’t you hire him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m just not very comfortable with him, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, try and get comfortable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I don’t know if I can.

speaker: RORY
words: But you said - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know what I said, but I can’t help it.

speaker: RORY
words: How many times do I have to tell you – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: That I don’t know the real Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: You don’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, fine, I don’t know him, but I’m not too fond of his stand in.

speaker: RORY
words: People are different once you get to know them. If you’ll remember, you weren’t too fond of Luke when you first met him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s not true.

speaker: RORY
words: You called him Duke for two years just to make him mad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And let me tell you, it worked.

speaker: RORY
words: But then you guys talked and eventually, time went by, and now you love him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well. . .

speaker: RORY
words: I’m just asking you to give Jess that same chance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, you like him. I don’t have to like him.

speaker: RORY
words: Please?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I at least call him Tess for a little while?

speaker: RORY
words: You’ll give him the job?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll give him the job.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. Tell me something.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why is it so important to you that I like him?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I just think that he’s Luke’s nephew and we like Luke and we eat at Luke’s everyday, and we see Jess when we eat there everyday, and that it just might make things nicer if you liked him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that’s the only reason?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s all about Luke and the diner?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It has nothing to do with you?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you and Jess aren’t friends?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, yeah, we’re friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: RORY
words: I mean, we’re not good friends but we’re friends. We’re friendly. But that doesn’t mean that we’re friends in the traditional Webster’s dictionary definition of friends.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: RORY
words: Friendish might be a better term.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, friendish. Got it.
[They pass by a group of walkers that Miss Patty is instructing from a golf cart.]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: And walk, and walk, and pump your arms and walk. And shoulders back, tucus in, think about that double chin and walk and walk and walk and tummies tight and walk. Match me sweetheart.
CUT TO LUKE’S APARTMENT
[Luke walks in, Jess is asleep, music is blaring.]

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess? [Luke turns the music off] How can anyone sleep through that? It’s like the Huns are attacking and you’re just – well, you’re oblivious and that’s why you can just lie there while the rest of the world is going - . [he knocks over his little television] Great! Dammit! Dammit! Dammit! Dammit!

speaker: JESS
words: Whoa, geez, what the hell?

speaker: LUKE
words: I can’t stand it, I’m going crazy. This place is awful. I can’t live like this anymore.

speaker: JESS
words: Just relax.

speaker: LUKE
words: I can’t relax. I can’t sleep. I’m having nightmares about being chased around by boxes with arms and they tackle me and pile clothing on top of my face and secure it around my head with packing tape and I’m just lying there choking while you’re sitting in the corner laughing, putting gel in your hair with a switchblade!

speaker: JESS
words: Should I be putting a tongue depressor in your mouth right about now?

speaker: LUKE
words: We’re moving.

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Tomorrow.

speaker: JESS
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m talking about you and me going out, getting a paper, and finding a new place to live.

speaker: JESS
words: But I – .

speaker: LUKE
words: No buts. Ten o’clock tomorrow morning I want you up, washed, moussed, and ready to leave, end of story. Now go back to bed. What?

speaker: JESS
words: I need the music on to sleep.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[The next day, Luke and Jess walk out of an apartment building]

speaker: JESS
words: Forget it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why, what was wrong with that one?

speaker: JESS
words: It was pink.

speaker: LUKE
words: We can paint it.

speaker: JESS
words: You mean I can paint it.

speaker: LUKE
words: We can paint it together.

speaker: JESS
words: Great, then we can hold hands and skip afterwards.

speaker: LUKE
words: Fine, which one do you like?

speaker: JESS
words: The one before.

speaker: LUKE
words: The one with the two fridges?

speaker: JESS
words: No.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, the one before was the one with two fridges.

speaker: JESS
words: No, the one we saw before was the one with the cat.

speaker: LUKE
words: I hate cats.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, I don’t think the cat came with the place.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, but it had carpeting which means it’s always gonna smell like a cat.

speaker: JESS
words: Clean the carpet.

speaker: LUKE
words: Paint the pink.

speaker: JESS
words: Fine, the one next to the bank.

speaker: LUKE
words: Too many windows.

speaker: JESS
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Six windows all on one side, three o’clock in the afternoon – we’re sitting in an oven.

speaker: JESS
words: So we get curtains.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, you’ll have to help me put them up.

speaker: JESS
words: Great, then we can hold hands and skip afterwards.

speaker: LUKE
words: Stop saying that.

speaker: JESS
words: You know what, I don’t care. Pick whichever one you want.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m not picking by myself.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re the one who wants to move.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, so you like living the way we do?

speaker: JESS
words: Fine by me.

speaker: LUKE
words: No space, no privacy.

speaker: JESS
words: I got plenty of privacy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, because I’m sitting downstairs in the dark watching a two-inch V.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey, you’re the one with the problem, you make the choice.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, come on.

speaker: JESS
words: I have to go.

speaker: LUKE
words: We got three more places to look at.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m supposed to be at Lorelai’s in twenty minutes, remember?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, yeah.

speaker: JESS
words: I mean, if you want me to bail on her, fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: Nah, you go. I’ll look at the places all alone.

speaker: JESS
words: Great idea.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’ll take some Polaroids and you can take a look at them later.

speaker: JESS
words: Take a Polaroid, paint a still picture, whatever you want.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, come on.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey, nobody asked me if I wanted to move to Stars Hollow, but I’m here. Pick whatever place you want and I’ll be there too.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai is sitting on the couch as Rory walks through the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come here, come here, come here.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m here, what’s the matter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sit, sit, sit. Okay, that should do it.

speaker: RORY
words: Do what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait.

speaker: RORY
words: What are we waiting for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Patience, grasshopper.

speaker: RORY
words: Are we close?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very close. Hm, getting closer.

speaker: RORY
words: Should I get chips?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ready, and – .
[They stare at a digital clock. When it changes, the clock starts making pig noises.]

speaker: RORY
words: The clock is grunting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: This, my friend, is a state of the art CD/clock radio that enables you to wake up to the barnyard animal of your choice.

speaker: RORY
words: That is great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have selected the perky piggies. You might choose the cheery chickens or the goofy goats.

speaker: RORY
words: That is closest to a farm that I ever wanna get.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Amen, sister friend.
[There’s a knock at the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll get it. [answers the door] Hey.

speaker: JESS
words: Here. [tosses her a CD]

speaker: RORY
words: The Shaggs?

speaker: JESS
words: Trust me

speaker: RORY
words: Okay. So you’re very punctual.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, well, it was this or continue apartment hunting with Luke.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re moving?

speaker: JESS
words: I don’t know. Luke flipped out last night and next thing I know, he’s dragging me all over town banging on pipes and measuring square footage. It’s crazy.

speaker: RORY
words: A new place might be nice. More space, maybe you’ll get your own room.

speaker: JESS
words: You change your hair?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: Your hair looks different.

speaker: RORY
words: So, segue’s not your thing, huh?

speaker: JESS
words: Is it?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, um, no, I wear it like this a lot. Why?

speaker: JESS
words: Just looks different.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, bad different?

speaker: LORELAI
words: [from living room] Hey, ducks!

speaker: RORY
words: We just got a new alarm clock.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh. Bet I know what the lead story in the Stars Hollow Gazette’s gonna be tomorrow.
[Lorelai walks to the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you hear the ducks ‘cause they’re great. Oh Jess, you’re here, terrific.

speaker: RORY
words: So, um, would you like to come in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, come on in. Sorry, it’s just. . .so excited about the ducks that, uh. . .do you want something to drink? You have good timing ‘cause we shopped yesterday, and in addition to a case of Maybelline Fresh Lash Mascara, I also bought some of that new, uh, freaky Coke with the lemon in it. It’s very addictive.

speaker: RORY
words: You can sit, you know.

speaker: JESS
words: No thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, Jess, what’s new?

speaker: JESS
words: Not much.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess and Luke are looking for an apartment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you guys see anything good yet?

speaker: JESS
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you know, there’s some really cool places over on Peach. Or on Plum. Hm, Orange. Basically, any of your fruit named streets are pretty nice. Okay, well, I guess you should get started. Um, there’s a ladder right out front and some buckets and gloves and stuff on the porch. You need anything else, just walk against the wind.

speaker: RORY
words: Come on, I’ll show you.
[Jess walks out the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m trying.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, keep it up.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory walks out of the house and over to Jess]

speaker: RORY
words: Question.

speaker: JESS
words: Yes?

speaker: RORY
words: You come over. You seem to have a very firm grasp of the English language. You put together several full sentences, even using a couple of words that contain two or more syllables, and then my mother appears and suddenly we need a thought bubble over your head to understand what you’re thinking. Can you tell me why that is?

speaker: JESS
words: The verbal thing comes and goes.

speaker: RORY
words: I would really appreciate it if you would try to get along with my mom.

speaker: JESS
words: I took the Coke.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: JESS
words: Personally, I think it’s a little crazy to put lemon in Coke but I took it anyhow.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop it.

speaker: JESS
words: Ooh, stern face.

speaker: RORY
words: Look, I went out on a limb for you trying to get my mom to give you the benefit of the doubt, okay? So I don’t think it would hurt you to try to be nice.

speaker: JESS
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, why?

speaker: RORY
words: Because she’s my mom and she’s a friend of Luke’s.

speaker: JESS
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean, so?

speaker: JESS
words: So just because she’s your mom or Luke’s friend doesn’t mean that I automatically have to get along with her.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess, my mother is a great person. She’s also my best friend in the world, so if you care about me at all, you will take that into consideration and you will be mildly polite to her.

speaker: JESS
words: What makes you think I care about you?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t mean care care, like care. I mean if you like me at all. . . not like like. I just meant that if. . . if you think of me remotely as the sort of person that you could occasionally stand to talk to then you will try to get along with my mom, that’s all.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay?

speaker: JESS
words: I can’t guarantee that it’ll work, but I’ll try.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re welcome. I should probably get to work.

speaker: RORY
words: Right. Sorry, go ahead.
CUT TO FRONT OF STARS HOLLOW LIBRARY
[Several tables and racks of books are set up for the Buy a Book Fundraiser. Dean is sitting on the steps of the library as Rory walks over with some books.]

speaker: RORY
words: Inherit the Wind, seventy-five cents.

speaker: DEAN
words: Great.

speaker: RORY
words: Now, here’s a copy of Rilke's Letters to a Young Poet – which I already have, but in hardback. This is a paperback – fits perfectly in a coat pocket and it’s only a dollar. I’m torn. Opinions?

speaker: DEAN
words: Get it.

speaker: RORY
words: You look bored.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m fine.

speaker: RORY
words: You sure you don’t wanna look around? They have great stuff here.

speaker: DEAN
words: I looked.

speaker: RORY
words: For five minutes.

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I looked for twenty minutes and then I stopped and you continued for another two hours.

speaker: RORY
words: It has not been that long. Oh, sorry.

speaker: DEAN
words: No big deal.

speaker: RORY
words: Let’s go.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you done?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup, I’ve looked enough.

speaker: DEAN
words: You’re not done.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I’m fine, really. Let’s go.

speaker: DEAN
words: Rory, stop it. You wanna keep looking, I know you.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I wanna hang out with you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Are you sure?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I’ll just pay for these and then we can go.

speaker: DEAN
words: I thought maybe we can go see The Lord of the Rings again.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, okay.

speaker: DEAN
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I thought you loved The Lord of the Rings.

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: DEAN
words: You said you wanted to see it a hundred times.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, and apparently we’re being very literal these days.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fine, we’ll see something else.

speaker: RORY
words: Lord of the Rings is fine. Can you help me with these?
[They walk to the cash register]

speaker: KIRK
words: I’ll give you fifty-five cents.

speaker: GYPSY
words: It’s sixty-five.

speaker: KIRK
words: Fifty-five cents.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Kirk, it’s for charity. There’s no haggling.

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh no, there’s always haggling. Sixty cents.

speaker: GYPSY
words: No.

speaker: KIRK
words: That’s my final offer.

speaker: GYPSY
words: I’m sorry, I can’t.

speaker: KIRK
words: Fine.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Kirk, come on.

speaker: KIRK
words: No.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Cough up another nickel.

speaker: KIRK
words: Forget it – it’s the principal of the thing. [walks away]

speaker: GYPSY
words: Wow, you made out like a bandit.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you’ve got great stuff this year.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Hey, did you see the astronomy section over there?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, yeah.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Didn’t find anything?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wait, I didn’t see you look over there.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I did.

speaker: DEAN
words: Go look.

speaker: RORY
words: I told you I’m done.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey, where. . . where’s your bracelet?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: You’re not wearing your bracelet.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh.

speaker: DEAN
words: Where is it?

speaker: RORY
words: I took it off.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, because I got this weird rash on my wrist.

speaker: DEAN
words: From the bracelet?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh no, just a fluke thing. Actually, I think my Spanish midterm gave it to me.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: But it’s getting better – it’s almost gone.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, good.

speaker: RORY
words: And as soon as it’s completely gone, that bracelet goes right back on.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, compromise.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: You go look at the astronomy section, we’ll go see Lord of the Rings, and on the way home we’ll rent Autumn in New York and mock it for the rest of the afternoon.

speaker: RORY
words: With full-on impressions?

speaker: DEAN
words: With full-on impressions.

speaker: RORY
words: Deal.

speaker: DEAN
words: Go, I’ll wait here. Smiling, not at all bored.

speaker: KIRK
words: Sixty-two cents.

speaker: GYPSY
words: Get out of here Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Damn.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai walks into the kitchen, takes several containers of Chinese food out of the refrigerator, then walks outside.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess? Hey, Jess!

speaker: JESS
words: Sorry, too loud?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no, it’s fine. Uh, it’s just. . . I got a ton of leftover Chinese food in the kitchen. I thought you might like some lunch.

speaker: JESS
words: No thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: JESS
words: Chinese sounds great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: JESS
words: If you’re sure you have enough.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There’s plenty. Rory and I decided to take on the entire chicken column last night.

speaker: JESS
words: Ambitious.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it’s all out on the table, so come in when you’re ready.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m ready now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, then I’ll see you inside.
CUT TO KITCHEN

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, um, basically everything here is chicken. You’ve got garlic chicken, Kung Pao chicken, Szechuan Chicken, chicken in brown sauce, which looks and tastes remarkably like the Szechuan Chicken except it’s got these red peppers in it and if you eat them, you die. Plate?

speaker: JESS
words: I thought I’d, uh. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, soap’s on the counter.

speaker: JESS
words: So when was the last time you had those gutters cleaned?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s been awhile.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, I found an ‘I like Ike’ bumper sticker up there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is it really bad?

speaker: JESS
words: Well, it won’t be by tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like hearing that.

speaker: JESS
words: So you guys aren’t too hot on vegetables, huh?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about? There’s green pepper in the Kung Pao.

speaker: JESS
words: My mistake.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, are you a healthy eater like Luke?

speaker: JESS
words: No. No one’s a healthy eater like Luke. Yule Gibbons wasn’t a healthy eater like Luke.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, it’s been ages since I’ve heard a good Yule Gibbons reference.

speaker: JESS
words: Many parts of a pine tree are edible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s right. God, I wonder what the research process was like to get that information.

speaker: JESS
words: I’d say fairly painful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. Here. So how’s school?

speaker: JESS
words: It’s still there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You on any teams or anything?

speaker: JESS
words: No, no, no.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not a jersey guy?

speaker: JESS
words: No, definitely not a jersey guy. Though the thought of throwing a ball at some jock’s head isn’t entirely unappealing. Look, I’m not really good at this small talk thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re doing okay. Cold egg roll?

speaker: JESS
words: Why not? [takes a bite]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bad?

speaker: JESS
words: Oh yeah.
[the front door slams and Rory yells from off camera]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here – right here! What?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!
[cut to front entryway; Rory is looking through all the coat pockets as Lorelai walks over]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know where it is!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where what is?

speaker: RORY
words: My bracelet – it’s gone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: RORY
words: How could I do this? How could I lose that bracelet?
[Rory starts looking in the living room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, tell me which bracelet – maybe I stole it from you.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean’s bracelet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The one he made you?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s gone?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know where. If I knew where then I would have it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, when did you first notice it was gone?

speaker: RORY
words: When he pointed out that I wasn’t wearing it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, not good. What did you say?

speaker: RORY
words: That I had a rash and that I had to take it off until it healed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice save, Gretzky.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s not here, it’s not here. God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, let’s retrace your steps. When was the last time you remember wearing it?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Think hard – yesterday?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The day before?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The day before that?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I don’t remember. I can’t remember. Help me move the couch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about your locker at school?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know why it would be there, I never take it off at school. I never take it off at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything?

speaker: RORY
words: Just Grandma’s pen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Leave it there.

speaker: RORY
words: Why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It makes life fun

speaker: RORY
words: I’m gonna freak out now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ll find it.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m gonna have to tell Dean that I lost his bracelet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let’s not even go there yet.

speaker: RORY
words: He made it for me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’ll make you another one.

speaker: RORY
words: But he’s gonna be mad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’ll understand.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m looking at the track record and all signs point to he’ll understand. Did you look in your room?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, I’ll check the car. And don’t worry – if worse comes to worse and we can’t find it, we’ll follow Dean to work, hide behind the cantaloupes, jump him, blind him and he’ll never find out.

speaker: RORY
words: As long as we have a plan.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Michel is standing at the front desk; Lorelai is on the floor behind the desk]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Who is Randy Mill?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, let me see. Maintenance.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Are you going to be down there long?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I just wanna to make sure Rory’s bracelet didn’t get kicked back behind something.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Hmm, and so earlier when you told me to look for the bracelet and I told you I did look and I did not find it, you…

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just decided to double check.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, though another theory is that you did not believe me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did too.

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, I believe you thought I was lying. That I did not actually get down on my hands and knees in a brand new Donna Karan suit and crawl around on a floor where people who have stepped in mud and garbage and animal waste have been traipsing all day long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not there.

speaker: MICHEL
words: No? Why, I’m shocked.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I’m sorry I doubted you, Michel.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, that means a lot, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We turned the house upside down. Rory’s having a heart attack. It’s just awful.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, well, as soon as my dry cleaning bill is paid for, you will have my sympathies.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will pay for your suit, Michel.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Mm hmm.
[phone rings]

speaker: MICHEL
words: Independence Inn, Michel speaking. Hold on please. [to Lorelai] It’s for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lorelai here.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t want a wood-burning fireplace.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: But if I take an apartment with a wood-burning fireplace, even though I could give a rat’s ass about a wood-burning fireplace, I have to pay an extra two hundred dollars a month for the wood-burning fireplace.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but - .

speaker: LUKE
words: And three of the places make you put down a five hundred dollar deposit if you have a dog. Can you believe this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You don’t have a dog.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know, but it’s wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Agreed. What else?

speaker: LUKE
words: Parking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah.

speaker: LUKE
words: How can people ask you for a monthly fee for a parking space? I mean, they’re making money off your rent, off your utilities, when you use their coin-operated washer and dryer – that’s cash directly in their pocket. And by the way, it’s not even that good a parking space. It’s out in the open under one of those trees that drops the sap on your car that eats away your paint.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Who’s gonna pay for my car, huh? Where’s my five hundred dollar, paint-killing tree sap deposit?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You haven’t found a place yet?

speaker: LUKE
words: And I’ve been looking all day.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There wasn’t one place you liked?

speaker: LUKE
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not one place that gave you a little feeling of, ‘Huh, well that has a nice vibe about it.’

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t use the word vibe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Maybe one place wasn’t so bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good, describe it to me.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know. It had walls with a kind of a floor with a light.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, hold on here, mister. If you tell me it’s got a roof, I’m stealing that baby out from under you.

speaker: LUKE
words: I just can’t tell anymore. I need a second opinion.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want me to come look at your apartment?

speaker: LUKE
words: It’s not my apartment, and yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Done.

speaker: LUKE
words: Now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Please?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, well -.

speaker: LUKE
words: I promised the woman I’d give her an answer today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, give me the address.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sixty-two and a half B Street. And that’s another thing – what’s with this half business? Why do all these apartments have this half thing going? It’s stupid. If sixty-two is taken, move on to sixty-three.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, I’ll meet you there in twenty and a half minutes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye. [hangs up] Michel, I have to go out for a little while. Cover the desk for me.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Well, I mean, I'll say I'll cover the desk, but how will you know if I'm actually doing it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I trust you, Michel.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I mean, it's just as possible I say I'll cover the desk, and the moment you've stepped away I'll put some fruit on my head and join a conga line somewhere.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I believe you looked for the bracelet.

speaker: MICHEL
words: And while I'm shaking it to the Miami Sound Machine, the phones here – they would ring and ring and ring, and no one to answer, no one to assist.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, bye Mom.
CUT TO APARTMENT BUILDING
[The real estate agent leads Luke and Lorelai through the apartment]

speaker: MARY
words: It’s a very quiet street and the owner keeps the building up beautifully. He hasn’t remodeled it at all. Plus, I bet he could be persuaded to give the floor a little spruce if you like.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, we’d like a spruce.

speaker: LUKE
words: A spruce is unnecessary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, you never turn down a spruce.

speaker: MARY
words: She’s right – listen to her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, listen to me.

speaker: LUKE
words: You rarely give me a choice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come here so I can lick your face.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: MARY
words: Now, I went over the square footage and the details of the lease with your husband this morning. Did he fill you in?

speaker: LUKE
words: What? Oh no, we’re – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, he didn’t, but you know how men are. The minute that ball game comes on, all the realities of life just go right out the window.

speaker: MARY
words: Don’t I know it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, I could answer the door wrapped in cellophane but unless I was wearing a Yankees cap. . .ugh, he wouldn’t even notice.

speaker: LUKE
words: Geez.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, don’t be embarrassed Snuffy, I’m just teasing. It’d be a Mets cap.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey Mary, could you possibly leave me and little missus alone for just a minute?

speaker: MARY
words: Why, of course.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I promise we won’t do anything dirty.

speaker: MARY
words: Oh please, if my husband and I looked anything like the two of you, we’d never get dressed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you are bad!

speaker: MARY
words: Let me just leave this rental agreement with you in case you decide to fill it out.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks.

speaker: MARY
words: Oh, I hope you take it. It’s got a great vibe for a nice couple like you two. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, thirteen different shades of red!

speaker: LUKE
words: What is wrong with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You make it too easy.

speaker: LUKE
words: By standing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, relax Snuffy. Let’s talk. What do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: She used the word vibe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: About the apartment.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay then, break it down. List your concerns.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, it’s too big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not too big. Next.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t need two bathrooms.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, you do. Next.

speaker: LUKE
words: I like being on the bottom floor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The top floor’s quieter. Next.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know, somehow I think this would be easier if you just listed your concerns first.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Um. . .I don’t have any. I think it’s great.

speaker: LUKE
words: You do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it’s light and airy. It’s got good windows but not too many so that the sun bakes you in the afternoon.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re close to work, the price seems good, you’re taking the spruce, and it’s a two-year lease. What’s two years?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know. I - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, you need to do this. You and Jess will kill each other if you stay in that place of yours.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, but who knows how long he’s gonna be here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why? Did something happen?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, but you never know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, you don’t, but I think his mom sending his stuff is a pretty good sign.

speaker: LUKE
words: And even if he does stay, it’ll be only for another year, and then he’ll go off to college or Attica or whatever, and it’ll just be me again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but - .

speaker: LUKE
words: And stuck with a new apartment, probably with neighbors I hate who are constantly cooking really strong smelling food.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, back up here. Yes, Jess may go off somewhere someday, but that doesn’t mean you will be alone forever.

speaker: LUKE
words: I am not getting a pet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I'm talking about a lady friend.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A red-hot mama.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A big, pretty dish of lovin' with a spoon made especially for you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Boy, do I not feel good now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, Rachel’s not the only woman in the world for you. You'll meet someone, someday -- probably at a Timberland store, you'll ask her out. You'll pick her up and take her on a patented Luke Danes night of romance -- juice bar followed by the batting cages -- and then you'll ask her back to your apartment.

speaker: LUKE
words: Any amount of money if you stop right now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’ll bring her back to your place, lead her upstairs to the apartment door. You pause, gaze into her eyes – the stage is set, fate is waiting. You open the door, and she sees your teeny, tiny apartment – one room and no closet space and Jess' feet sticking up in the air ‘cause you never did get rid of that body!

speaker: LUKE
words: Stop, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: the single bed.

speaker: LUKE
words: What's wrong with a single bed?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what they say.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, what do they say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never, ever date a guy who owns a single bed. It means he's not open to a commitment.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It says there's no room in this life for anybody but me.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, it says there's no room in this bed for anyone but me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, see, that's not a whole lot better.

speaker: LUKE
words: This discussion is now over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, as long as you’re in that apartment, you’re gonna have a single bed. Don’t you want the possibility of more? Come on Luke, it’s time. Make a move, take a shot, entertain the possibility of a non-unabomber existence. What do you say?

speaker: LUKE
words: You got a pen? I’m not taking the spruce.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, you are.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai arrives home and walks into the kitchen as Jess walks out of Rory’s room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did you get lost?

speaker: JESS
words: No, I was looking at Rory’s books.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: JESS
words: I wanted to see if she had Franny and Zooey. She does.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: JESS
words: I was gonna get it for her if she didn’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s very nice of you.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah. Okay, so I should probably get back to work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.
CUT TO DOOSE’S MARKET
[Luke is shopping as Taylor walks up to him]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Luke, good good goody good good. I was just on my way over to the diner to talk to you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Great. Go on over, I’ll meet you there.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, stop it, this isn’t about anything that’s gonna make you mad. I just have a couple of questions about your application.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Your application. Now I called your bank - .

speaker: LUKE
words: What application?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Your application for the apartment. Now you have two accounts here -.

speaker: LUKE
words: How did you get my application?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, Mary gave it to me, of course. Now I’m assuming that one of those accounts -.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why would Mary give you my application?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Because I own the building.

speaker: LUKE
words: What? When the hell did you buy an apartment building?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, I bought this particular one about two months ago.

speaker: LUKE
words: I look at a thousand apartments, I choose yours. How is that possible?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, count yourself lucky, you. With me as the owner, there is a level of quality control that is sorely lacking in this town. For example, at all my properties, we measure the grass before, during, and after mowing to attain a perfect inch and a half height, which is both pleasing to the eye and good for the grass.

speaker: LUKE
words: All of your properties?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ten in all.

speaker: LUKE
words: Ten properties? What are you, buying up the town?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Not yet, but someday – who knows?

speaker: LUKE
words: But why isn’t anyone stopping you?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Because, my friend, people are lazy. They don’t wanna think about the proper fabric for an awning or the correct historical color for a building. They just slap any old thing up on a wall and sleep like babies. But soon, hopefully, the city council will put an end to that.

speaker: LUKE
words: Taylor, you cannot tell people what color to paint their buildings!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, someone has to.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, they don’t. We don’t live in a fascist country.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, this isn’t about the fascists – who, by the way, had their faults but their parks were spotless.

speaker: LUKE
words: I have to get out of here. [leaves]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Hey, eh, wait a minute.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Taylor follows Luke down the sidewalk]

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Luke, hold it! I still need to talk to you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just tear up the application, Taylor. I’m not moving.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: What? Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: ‘Cause I’m the two-inch grass kind of guy.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, that’s too bad but I need to talk to you about something else.

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I’m thinking about purchasing the flower shop next to the diner, but we need to talk about that sign of yours.

speaker: LUKE
words: What about my sign?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, you have a diner but you never took down the Williams’ Hardware sign.

speaker: LUKE
words: That was my father’s sign.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I understand that you have a sentimental attachment to the sign, but it confuses the tourists.

speaker: LUKE
words: Back off the sign, Taylor.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: If I buy the building next to that sign, I run the risk of people being so busy trying to figure out if you sell hammers or burgers, that they never notice the nice collectible plate store right next door.

speaker: LUKE
words: Collectible plates?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Isn’t that a great idea? Elvis, The Beatles, Mary Poppins, all the greats. You can hang ‘em on the wall or you buy a little stand and set ‘em up on the coffee table.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, you need to get away from me now. At least a good arm swinging length away.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It’s people like you who keep this town from becoming one of great towns in America, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
words: Arm swinging length!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I wouldn’t have approved your application anyway.
CUT TO OUTSIDE LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Jess climbs down the ladder as Rory comes home and sits on the porch]

speaker: JESS
words: You look good.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m fine.

speaker: JESS
words: Talk.

speaker: RORY
words: I lost my bracelet.

speaker: JESS
words: Uh huh.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean gave it to me.

speaker: JESS
words: How thoughtful.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ve been all over town looking for it. I’ve been to Lane’s, I’ve been to Luke’s, I’ve been to the bus stop, I’ve been to Miss Patty’s, and I’ve circled Stars Hollow twice and nothing. I have no idea what I’m going to do.

speaker: JESS
words: It’s really that big a deal?

speaker: RORY
words: What do you mean?

speaker: JESS
words: I mean, I know it’s got an ‘I’ve been pinned’ Bye, Bye, Birdie kind of implication to it, but it was just a bracelet.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t think Dean will see it that way.

speaker: JESS
words: You didn’t lose it on purpose.

speaker: RORY
words: I know, but things have been a little weird between us lately and. . .you couldn’t care less.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, yes, I could.

speaker: RORY
words: I just think Dean will read something into this.

speaker: JESS
words: Should he?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: I think you should keep looking.

speaker: RORY
words: Where?

speaker: JESS
words: Anywhere. Things you lose are usually right in front of your face. Check the house again.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ve checked the house.

speaker: JESS
words: It’s probably just laying in your room somewhere.

speaker: RORY
words: No, I tore that room apart, it’s not there.

speaker: JESS
words: Fine, give up then. No biggie. Dean’ll just have to get over it.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll go look again.

speaker: JESS
words: You do that.
CUT TO INSIDE
[Lorelai is sitting on the couch reading as Rory walks in]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, where have you been?

speaker: RORY
words: Scouring the town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: Not yet. I’m gonna check my room again. [goes into room]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Haven’t you already looked in there like a thousand times.

speaker: RORY
words: [from bedroom] A thousand and one. Mom, come here, hurry!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you okay?
[cut to Rory’s bedroom]

speaker: RORY
words: I found it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: I looked under the bed and there it was. I thought I had already looked under the bed, but I don’t know, maybe I was too panicked or. . .I don’t know, who cares, I got it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, that is amazing!

speaker: RORY
words: Put it on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm.

speaker: RORY
words: Make it tight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I’m cutting off circulation here, baby.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, look at it. It looks even better than before, doesn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think the time away from home did it some good.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, when I get back, we celebrate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where are you going?

speaker: RORY
words: To tell Lane she can stop praying.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai walks out as Jess is getting ready to leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You leaving?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, all done.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You weren’t gonna come get your money?

speaker: JESS
words: Ah, I figured I’d get it eventually. It’s not like I don’t know where you guys live.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s true. You certainly do know where we live. Well here. After all, you earned it.

speaker: JESS
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You took it, didn’t you?

speaker: JESS
words: Excuse me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory’s bracelet – you had it the whole time.

speaker: JESS
words: No idea what you’re talking about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How’d you get it?

speaker: JESS
words: I didn’t get anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Impossible?

speaker: JESS
words: Actually, I came down the chimney and pulled a Santa Claus.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Very funny.

speaker: JESS
words: Thought a ridiculous accusation deserved a ridiculous response.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So it’s just a great big ol’ coincidence that I catch you coming out of Rory’s room a half an hour before she mysteriously finds the bracelet under her bed?

speaker: JESS
words: Guess so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why would you do this?

speaker: JESS
words: I gotta go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, I know you hate the world, but I thought you liked Rory.

speaker: JESS
words: I didn’t do anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bull.

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, don’t whatever me, you little jerk. You let Rory run around completely panicked, thinking she lost her boyfriend’s bracelet. She was miserable, do you understand that?

speaker: JESS
words: I didn’t take it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sure you’re jealous of Dean because he’s great and Rory’s madly in love with him, but you taking the bracelet didn’t hurt Dean, it hurt Rory. That bracelet is the most precious thing she owns. She never takes it off. It means everything to her. And you stealing it was unbelievably cruel.

speaker: JESS
words: The most precious thing she owns?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: JESS
words: If it’s the most precious thing she owns, why did it take her two weeks to figure out it was gone, huh? You might wanna reevaluate how madly in love she is. I wouldn’t start calling him son yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Get outta here.

speaker: JESS
words: You read my mind.
CUT TO INSIDE LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai walks in and sits down on the couch. There’s a knock on the front door, Lorelai answers it]

speaker: LUKE
words: I just spent a hundred thousand dollars and it’s all your fault!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good.
[They walk into the kitchen]

speaker: LUKE
words: I ran into Taylor at the market, and I found out he owns the building that apartment was in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No way.

speaker: LUKE
words: That and several others all over town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so weird.

speaker: LUKE
words: He’s systematically buying up the town. He’s gonna turn it into Taylorville where everyone’ll wear cardigans and have the same grass height.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke, do you wanna sit down?

speaker: LUKE
words: And then he told me he’s gonna buy the building next to the diner, turn it into a plate shop for freaks who don’t have enough brain power to collect stamps. I lost it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, I can’t picture that.

speaker: LUKE
words: I walked around in a blind rage. I was crazy. I bought one of those Belgian waffles with the ice cream dipped in chocolate.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You ate that?

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I didn’t eat it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course not.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m upset, not suicidal.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: LUKE
words: I knew I just had to do something, and I had your voice going round and round in my head.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it’s kinda like the Small World song.

speaker: LUKE
words: Take a chance, Luke. Make a move, Luke. Can’t have a single bed, Luke. So I bought the building!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You – you what?

speaker: LUKE
words: I went to the bank and got a cashier’s check, signed the papers and I bought the building.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow

speaker: LUKE
words: I am the building’s owner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I heard.

speaker: LUKE
words: I own the building.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, don’t worry, maybe you can still get out of it. You can go back and tell them you lost your mind.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or I bet you can sell it to Taylor.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, relax, you can still get out of this.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Unless you don’t wanna get out of it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh no, I wanna get out of this. Uh, why would I not wanna get out of this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, owning that building gives you some options.

speaker: LUKE
words: Like?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, like you could expand Luke’s if you wanted to.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or you could rent it to someone else.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Someone else who might drive Taylor crazy.

speaker: LUKE
words: Maybe I should think about this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure, sleep on it.

speaker: LUKE
words: Sleep on it, right, right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You want some tea?

speaker: LUKE
words: Tea’s good, sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, um, does Jess ever talk to you about Rory?

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, what do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. They just. . .they seem to be thrown together quite a lot lately and I was just trying to figure out if that’s a coincidence or - .

speaker: LUKE
words: Or if there’s something going on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess doesn’t exactly confide in me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: LUKE
words: Of course, if there was something going on, I think that’d be really great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You do?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah. Rory’s a great kid, she’d be really good for Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah, she would.

speaker: LUKE
words: You really think there might be something going on?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know

speaker: LUKE
words: Boy, that would be great.

speaker: LORELAI
