words: Now, the secret to a great campaign is a great idea. Now, we’ve got that, let’s move on to finances. Um, uh, do any of you have dinner plans, because we’re gonna be here for awhile. Let’s all turn to page four. Here we go. Now, the January projections. . .
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai is sitting on the couch reading as Rory walks through the front door. The phone is ringing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Agh!

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Gah!

speaker: RORY
words: Mom! [answers phone] Hello? [hangs up] That ringing is not in your head, you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, you’ve gotta read this Motley Crue book. I swear, you get to the point where Ozzy Osbourne snorts a row of ants and you think, it cannot get any grosser, and then you turn the page and oh, hello, yes it can! It’s excellent!

speaker: RORY
words: Why didn’t you answer the phone?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because I firmly believe that once you’ve experienced something five thousand times, you need to move on.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I knew who it was.

speaker: RORY
words: Who was it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The same person who’s called the machine so many times now that I actually heard it sigh.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean the determined.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh man.
[phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Five bucks says I know who that is.

speaker: RORY
words: [answers phone] Hello?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, it’s your grandfather.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, hey Grandpa.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did that on purpose.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’d like to discuss tomorrow’s meeting.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I was thinking that we should relocate.

speaker: RORY
words: Midtown?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Here.

speaker: RORY
words: Your house?

speaker: RICHARD
words: It’ll be more comfortable with infinitely better snacks.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, that sounds great.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Wonderful. I’ll call the group.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, well, then I guess I’ll see you tomorrow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Tomorrow.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. [hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’d he want?

speaker: RORY
words: He wanted to move the location of our meeting to his house tomorrow and to cost you five bucks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So that’s going well, huh, Grandpa doing that thing with you at school?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I think he’s having fun with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See? Did your brilliant mother call it or what?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, she did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re damn lucky to have that magnificent woman in your life, you know that, don’t you?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s whispered in my ear every night when I’m about to go to sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you won’t let me write it in your underwear anymore. Hey, check the machine so I can erase the messages.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Agh!

speaker: DEAN
words: [on answering machine] Hey, it’s me. Uh, it’s four o’clock, call me when you got home. [beep] Hey, uh, it’s four thirty. I’m home, call me. [beep] It’s quarter to five – where are you? I’ll try paging you. [beep] It’s five-thirty. Did you get my page? Call with the answer.

speaker: RORY
words: They are not all from him.

speaker: DEAN
words: [on answering machine] Hey, I totally forgot you were getting home at six.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And yet, oddly, even after remembering that information. . .

speaker: DEAN
words: [on answering machine] Hey, it’s five forty-five and I just thought I’d see if you got home early.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I swear, that boy would make a good drinking game.

speaker: RORY
words: This is crazy. Ten messages?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Plus the four that I took from him personally before I stopped answering the phone.

speaker: RORY
words: Right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, you gotta ease up on that love potion you’ve been giving him or he’s gonna start showing up at David Letterman’s house soon.

speaker: RORY
words: Ugh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s the matter?

speaker: RORY
words: Fourteen messages.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, so, it’s a little – .

speaker: RORY
words: It’s a little too much.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what’s up? Are you guys fighting or something?

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, did something happen to set off the phone craze?

speaker: RORY
words: No, everything’s been fine, everything’s been calm. No more incidents, I don’t get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, if I had to guess, I would say he’s feeling a little insecure about something.

speaker: RORY
words: But why?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: But I spend every free moment with him, I call him, I page him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, you’ve been good.

speaker: RORY
words: And nothing seems to be enough, nothing seems to make things normal again.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give it some time.

speaker: RORY
words: I just want things to be the way they were.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, relationships are hard. Sometimes you go through a weird patch and things get funky for a little while, but just give it a chance. Ride it out, things will calm down again.

speaker: RORY
words: I hope so. I’m gonna erase the messages.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Lorelai is at the front desk as Michel and his mother walk into the inn laughing]

speaker: GISELLE
words: Oh, stop it, stop making me laugh! You are trying to kill me! You are trying to make your mother laugh herself to death so you can get away with a grisly crime.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Your mind is evil.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Your soul is empty.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You want some coffee, Zeelee?

speaker: GISELLE
words: Yes, darling, thank you.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I’ll be right back.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Ah, hello, blue eyes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Giselle. How was lunch?

speaker: GISELLE
words: Ah, champagne, caviar, the usual.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, sure.

speaker: GISELLE
words: And then came out the pasta with terrible things in it. It was perfect.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You seem to be having a wonderful time.

speaker: GISELLE
words: I am. I will miss him so much when I go home, but thank goodness, he will have an extra five pounds to remember me by after eating all my pasta today, that dirty thieving boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel ate pasta?

speaker: GISELLE
words: Well, yes. Michel loves pasta, he eats it all the time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not around us. Here it’s all no-carb, low-cal, let me see if I can eat less than the lab rats do.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Lab rats?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Better not explained. Anyway, I’m glad you’ve got him eating pasta, he seems really happy.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Coffee, coffee, coffee.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Oh, mm, mm. This is horrible.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You will drink it and you will like it.

speaker: GISELLE
words: You are a curse.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Let’s go shop.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Oh yes, let’s go buy something completely useless and pay way too much money for it.

speaker: MICHEL
words: I love it.

speaker: GISELLE
words: Au revoir.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Au revoir.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is so wrong.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Rory, Louise, Madeline, Brad and Chip walk to the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: We should’ve waited for Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: But she could be standing outside the school right now waiting for us.

speaker: MADELINE
words: She has my cell number.

speaker: LOUISE
words: I thought you lost your phone.

speaker: MADELINE
words: I did. Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: We’ll call her when we get inside. [rings doorbell]

speaker: BRAD
words: Tell her I wanted to wait, okay?
[Paris answers the door]

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, you’re right on time. Come on in.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, okay.

speaker: RICHARD
words: In the dining room, everyone.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Welcome, everyone, to the first official board meeting of the StyleAid Corporation. Will everyone please take a seat?

speaker: CHIP
words: I feel like Ivan Bosky.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Rory, you are group leader which translates into chairman of the board, which means you sit at the head of the table.

speaker: RORY
words: But that’s where you sit.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, not today. Come on. Now, at this point, I would like to turn the meeting over to Paris who will bring us up to date on our latest developments.

speaker: PARIS
words: Thank you, Richard. First, let me say that I’m glad to see you all here today, at the beginning of what I think is going to be a very exciting experiment.

speaker: BRAD
words: She doesn’t have a baseball bat in her hands, does she?

speaker: PARIS
words: Now, I’d like everyone to turn to page one in your presentation booklets. Hey, we haven’t gotten to the pencil part yet.

speaker: BRAD
words: Oh, sorry.

speaker: PARIS
words: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the RX-2002.

speaker: LOUISE
words: Nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Very nice.

speaker: PARIS
words: Now, listed in front of you are all the contents contained in the RX-2002, plus the additional style options, twelve in all. Every one of them waterproof, fireproof, and comes with a five-year warranty.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Which is longer than most of your high school careers.

speaker: PARIS
words: He is funny.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now there is also a deluxe model with extra features designed to personalize your kit even more specifically for your needs. There will be a snap-in CD case which can hold up to ten CDs, there’s a lighted vanity mirror, and a divided compartment for makeup and knickknacks. A picture frame and a hidden mini vault for valuables which can be locked for safety.

speaker: PARIS
words: Terrific idea, Richard, really – top notch.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Thank you, Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: This is really amazing. I want one of these.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Exactly the point. Now, let’s check in with our marketing department. Uh, Madeline, Louise – what have you got for us?

speaker: MADELINE
words: Okay, well, first we go for the obvious – magazines.

speaker: LOUISE
words: You know, Teen, Young Miss, Seventeen.

speaker: MADELINE
words: Spin and Rolling Stone, especially to hit the guys.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I hear that Jane magazine also has a young, hip following.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know about Jane magazine?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have my ways, young lady.

speaker: CHIP
words: We should also check about placing them in certain mall stores.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I also think we should go straight to the source.

speaker: PARIS
words: The schools?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Why not? School bulletin boards, websites. We can set up tables at football games and pep rallies.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, how is everyone doing here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Just fine, Emily.

speaker: EMILY
words: Good. Is there enough food?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, there is plenty of food.

speaker: EMILY
words: What about ice cream? Would anyone like some ice cream?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, we’re in the middle of a business meeting.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, ah, well, I’m very sorry. Uh, go back to your business meeting.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Now, I think your projections for. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: [to Rory] He’s smiling.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: EMILY
words: He’s smiling and there’s no oil on the carpet.

speaker: RORY
words: Life is good.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, it is.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Emily, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m going, I’m going.

speaker: PARIS
words: Richard, do you have the third-year projections?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, yes, Paris, I do. I have them right here.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai pulls up to the house. Dean is washing Rory’s car.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, how’s it going?

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, just washing Rory’s car.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can see that.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I mean, I came by to see her and she wasn’t here, so I was just gonna wait on the porch but then I noticed that her car looked dirty, so I thought I’d wash it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, ‘cause sometimes things can get on your car like dirt and certain kinds of sap. It can get into your paint, makes it really hard to get off.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure.

speaker: DEAN
words: Even water spots, you know. . .after it rains, that can be a real problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Would you like a soda?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, I’m fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let’s go get a soda.

speaker: DEAN
words: But I have to wash – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Put the squirty water thing down and come on in the kitchen. Squirty thing down. . . that’s it. . .come on.
CUT TO LORELAI’S KITCHEN
[Dean and Lorelai walk through the back door]

speaker: DEAN
words: Look, I really didn’t mean to bother you. I can just wait outside until Rory gets home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, Rory’s working on her school project today.

speaker: DEAN
words: Oh yeah. I guess I forgot. I mean, she must’ve told me that she . . . I’m sorry, I forgot.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s okay.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, I’ll just go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No no, come here, just sit down for a sec, okay? Are you all right?

speaker: DEAN
words: Yeah, I’m fine. I just don’t remember Rory telling me about her studying today. I swear I wouldn’t have come over.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I maybe give you a little advice?

speaker: DEAN
words: Sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. First, I just wanna tell you I think you are a great guy. You’re so good to Rory. And even though I’d always hoped that she’d be the one girl in the world who wouldn’t look at a boy until she was thirty-eight, I’m really glad she found you.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I know things have been a little off between you two lately.

speaker: DEAN
words: Did she say that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m saying that. I can see it, and by the way, I get it. But sometimes when things are out of whack, it freaks us out a little and makes us feel like we’re losing something that’s really important and that scares us even more so we try really hard to hold onto whatever it is we think we’re losing and sometimes we hold on a little too hard.

speaker: DEAN
words: Too hard?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like calling ten times in a three hour period, too hard.

speaker: DEAN
words: Fourteen times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, now, see, I was gonna let you slide but hey – an honest man, I like that.

speaker: DEAN
words: You think I’m holding on too hard to Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t think you mean to.

speaker: DEAN
words: You think I’m losing her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you think you are.

speaker: DEAN
words: Well, I just feel like nothing I do is. . . you know, I just want things back the way they used to be.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you do, and they can be.

speaker: DEAN
words: How?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know it sounds crazy but sometimes giving people a little bit of space is actually the best thing to do.

speaker: DEAN
words: Space?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just a little.

speaker: DEAN
words: Like what? Like don’t call her, don’t see her?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, just let her breathe, let her relax, let her come to you for a change.

speaker: DEAN
words: You’re not telling me this to get rid of me, are you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Please, if I was trying to get rid of you I would’ve started this conversation with, ‘Let me tell you about my family’. I’m not telling you this to get rid of you, I’m telling you because I think it might help things between you guys. Just try it. If it doesn’t work, I promise you can wash my car, too.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you want a soda?

speaker: DEAN
words: No, thanks. I’m gonna go. Uh, don’t tell Rory I was here, okay?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, I’m just sitting here at the table talking to myself. . .again.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Dean.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Sookie is in the kitchen on the phone as Lorelai walks in]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: You know what, forget it! If that’s how you run your business, then I deserve this for picking you in the first place. I hate you! [hangs up]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, new plan for the invites. We’re getting married May fifteenth, four o’clock, front lawn – pass it on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That’s it, word of mouth. They used it for the Revolutionary War – who the hell am I to poopoo history, huh? I ask you.
[Michel enters the kitchen]

speaker: MICHEL
words: What the hell is wrong with you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: With me?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, you! Are you out of your mind?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Why in God’s name would you tell my mother that I do not eat carbs?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because you don’t.

speaker: MICHEL
words: That is private information, private about me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Michel, everybody in Stars Hollow knows you don’t eat carbs.

speaker: MICHEL
words: So what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Calm down, have some toast.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Do not talk to my mother ever again, do you understand me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I don’t understand. Michel, you and your mother seem crazy about each other. I just assumed since you gave up carbs a year ago, she knew.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, well, you know what happens when you assume.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: MICHEL
words: I don’t know. Something about a donkey – it’s a stupid American phrase.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t understand, Michel. You and your mother seem to have the perfect relationship.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Yes, because I tell her nothing. We keep all subjects light and fluffy. We talk about clothes and food and Posh Spice and David Beckham and that is all. Nothing of value, nothing of substance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Now she knows I’ve been hiding something from her. Suddenly she’s asking questions. Why did I leave France at eighteen? Where do I go at night? Who are my friends? What do they do? Where do they live? Why have I chosen this career? On and on and on and on – it never ends! I can’t stand it, she’s a complete pain. She won’t stop. I took a six hour bath last night just to escape the incessant nagging. You did this to me! You turned my Giselle into a mother, and I hate you for it! I hate you very, very much! [leaves]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: So, feel better now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I do, thanks.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Mm hmm.
CUT TO CHILTON BUSINESS FAIR
[All of the student’s projects are displayed on tables throughout the auditorium]

speaker: PARIS
words: Okay, I swept the room and I have to tell you, all sad. I think we’re a lock.

speaker: RORY
words: Really? I actually thought the locker alarm was pretty good.

speaker: PARIS
words: Please, no one even looks when a car alarm goes off. How effective do you think a locker alarm‘s going to be? Nope, I feel it, we are it. What’s the word?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Every single idea in this room is completely worthless.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: There’s a lot of wasted cardboard in here, my friend.

speaker: PARIS
words: We are going to win.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, we are.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, the two of you need to take a time out.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Richard? Richard, hello.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hanlin, good to see you.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I’m actually advising Rory on her business project – the RX-2002.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Oh, well, that’s wonderful. You look great.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I feel great.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: We don’t see you at the club that much anymore.

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I’ve been very busy lately.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Now, did I hear correctly – did you retire?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Right before Christmas.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: So it’s true. I told it to Bitty and I couldn’t believe it when we heard that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, a man can’t work forever.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: No, that’s true. I just can’t picture you retired.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It’s been wonderful lately. Best move I’ve ever made. It’s given me a lot of time to do a lot of wonderful things.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Well, that does sound nice. What kinds of things are you doing?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, this.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Well, there you go. Unfortunately, some of us aren’t living the good life quite yet. I’ve got to get back. It’s been wonderful seeing you, Richard. Let’s have dinner soon.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I would like that very much.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I’ll have Bitty give Em a call.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You do that.

speaker: PARIS
words: Did you see the brilliant hose hook idea over at table five? A hook on your belt for your garden hose. There’s a Buster Keaton routine waiting to happen.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So how are we doing?

speaker: RORY
words: Paris is practicing spiking the football then doing a backflip.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Excuse me, ladies and gentlemen, all the projects have now been reviewed.

speaker: PARIS
words: Here we go.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: And before we announce the winner, I must commend everyone for their fine work. There are many, many good ideas here today. It makes me proud.

speaker: PARIS
words: Move it along, padre.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Now I’d like to announce the winner – table 10, Miss Traster’s class with the locker alarm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t understand, how is that possible?

speaker: PARIS
words: This is so lame. That alarm doesn’t even work, I was just over there.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is the most ludicrous thing I’ve ever heard.

speaker: RORY
words: Grandpa, it doesn’t matter.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It certainly does matter. You’ve all put in an extraordinary amount of time and effort and thought into this project. It deserved to win.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yeah.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, I wanted to win too, but we didn’t.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m going to talk to the headmaster about this.

speaker: RORY
words: I wish you wouldn’t.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You were robbed, Rory, and I’m not going to sit back and simply watch it happen. [walks over to headmaster] Hanlin, good, I want a word with you.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Is something wrong?

speaker: RICHARD
words: This contest is a disgrace.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I beg your pardon?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I have been in the business world for thirty-five years.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I know this.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And in those thirty-five years, I’ve seen ideas come and I’ve seen ideas go, and I’ve learned a few things about what flies and what doesn’t.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: I’m sure you have.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am telling you that out there in the real world, there is no way that a locker alarm that doesn’t even work properly would be a viable business investment.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Richard, we’re not in the real world, we are in a school.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, a school that should be training children for the real world.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Richard, calm down.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I demand a recount.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Very well. I just recounted, the alarm still wins.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hanlin!

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Richard, your project was very good. It was definitely in the running. You should be proud.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This is not my project, this is their project, the children’s project.

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: Really?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes! This has nothing to do with me, it’s for the children!

speaker: HEADMASTER
words: But they’re not the ones who are causing the public scene right now, you are.
CUT TO ELDER GILMORE RESIDENCE
[Lorelai and Rory pull up and walk to the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: It was awful. He looked so upset. His face was turning red and he was practically shaking.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, did you notice when he gets mad he gets taller?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know how he does it but he actually grows.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The day I told him I was pregnant, twenty-four feet tall. It freaked the birds.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I’m upset here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, you did nothing. You went to your grandfather, who you greatly admire and actually like hanging out with, to ask for his help and advice. That’s lovely and thoughtful.

speaker: RORY
words: Please help me out tonight – no mention of work or Chilton or school or retirement.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing but politics and religion, got it.

speaker: EMILY
words: [opens door] Hello girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Mom.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma.

speaker: EMILY
words: Come in, come in. Dinner’s almost ready. Richard, the girls are here. Richard? He came home today, didn’t say a word, stomped off to his study, slammed the door, and he’s been holed up in there ever since.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: EMILY
words: I can’t even get him to answer me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, are you sure he’s still in there?

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course he’s still in there. The door’s right there. I would’ve seen if he came out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: Not everyone leaves this house by climbing out the window and jumping into a waiting hot rod.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe someone should go talk to him.

speaker: EMILY
words: I don’t know what to do. What on earth happened today?

speaker: RORY
words: Things didn’t go very well at the business fair.

speaker: EMILY
words: What happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was terrible – the tenth graders staged a hostile takeover of the eleventh graders.

speaker: RORY
words: Our project didn’t win and Grandpa took it badly.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I am at my wit’s end if that man is going to fall apart over a high school project.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s just a weird time for him, Mom.

speaker: RORY
words: I feel so awful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe he should go talk to somebody.

speaker: EMILY
words: Like whom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like a psychiatrist?

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, maybe it would help.

speaker: EMILY
words: We do not go to psychiatrists.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, there’s nothing wrong with getting help.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai Gilmore, are you seriously suggesting that your father go to a complete stranger and talk about his personal life?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lots of people swear by it.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, disturbed people, deviants, people with multiple personalities who see things and hear dogs talking to them and roam the streets talking to themselves and licking parking meters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Next thing you know, you’ll be suggesting I go to a psychiatrist.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Too many comebacks – I cannot pick.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, is that you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Of course it’s me. Oh Rory, you’re here, wonderful. Hello Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I am starving. What’s for dinner?

speaker: EMILY
words: What’s for dinner? What do you mean, what’s for dinner?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I thought the question was relatively clear, but I’d be glad to rephrase it for you. Eh, what sort of food products will appear on various plates this evening?

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard Gilmore, you come home in a huff and you lock yourself in that study all afternoon. . .

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I had a lot of thinking to do, a lot of thinking. I owe that to you young lady.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You should certainly not be sorry.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, what – put that roll down and explain yourself!

speaker: RICHARD
words: This whole week, this whole experience with Rory and the locker first aid kit – that is a damn good idea, by the way, no matter what those yarnheads at that school of yours say. Anyway, this whole week made me realize something – I don’t want to be retired.

speaker: EMILY
words: You what?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t like it. I hate it, as a matter of fact.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But Dad – .

speaker: RICHARD
words: It’s boring. I have absolutely no idea what to do with myself. And frankly, I am tired of trying to find something to fill up my time.

speaker: RORY
words: So what are you going to do?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I am going to work.

speaker: EMILY
words: Are you thinking about asking for your job back?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, God no! No no no no no no. I have decided to go into business for myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Cool.

speaker: RICHARD
words: It is cool, isn’t it?

speaker: EMILY
words: But what are you going to do?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I’m not sure yet. Perhaps I’ll consult, maybe take on a partner, maybe I’ll even teach.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, you don’t have to say it like that.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry. What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I think thirty five years of experience will qualify me to teach a course or two at that local business college of yours.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God. It’s Who’s the Boss, the later years.

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, are you serious about this?

speaker: RICHARD
words: As a heart attack.

speaker: EMILY
words: But, but – .

speaker: RICHARD
words: I haven’t felt this good in a very long time, Emily. I have the buzz, and I owe it all to you.

speaker: RORY
words: Glad to be of service.

speaker: EMILY
words: He’s going to teach.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or consult.

speaker: EMILY
words: Or consult.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So licking a parking meter is just around the corner.
CUT TO INSIDE JEEP
[That night, Lorelai and Rory are driving home]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, that dinner was good.

speaker: RORY
words: All of Grandma’s dinners are good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, but this one had the rolls.

speaker: RORY
words: Aw, those were excellent rolls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Weren’t they? Hot and buttery with that split top thing going on. I miss the rolls.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, she can make more next week.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s okay. I got four in my purse.

speaker: RORY
words: You do not.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go ahead and check.

speaker: RORY
words: Have you no shame?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ha!
[Rory’s pager goes off]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, who’s that?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? How many pages does that make for today?

speaker: RORY
words: Just one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re kidding.

speaker: RORY
words: In two days.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow!

speaker: RORY
words: I know. He hasn’t called or mysteriously appeared by my side or anything.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm, maybe he’s calming down.

speaker: RORY
words: I hope so. I actually got a chance to miss him today.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That sounds good.

speaker: RORY
words: It is good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you wanna grab my cell phone and give him a call?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, no, tomorrow’s fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure? It’s still early. You guys could hook up for a little while.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m hanging out with Lane tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lane?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, we have some serious CD listening to do. We’re way behind on all the Elvis Costello reissues coming out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t think Lane could hang out past nine.

speaker: RORY
words: Her mom’s at an antique fair in Woodbury until Sunday, and her grandmother’s staying with her but she’s asleep by six so we thought we’d be really bad and sneak out to Luke’s.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re going to Luke’s?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, why go to Luke’s? Um, I mean, you just had ten rolls.

speaker: RORY
words: No, you had ten rolls, and I don’t even know if we’ll go to Luke’s. It’s just a maybe.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, okay. Well, you guys have fun.
[they pull up to Lane’s house and Rory gets out of the car]

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, see you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure you don’t wanna call Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope, tomorrow’s fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, tomorrow’s fine.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai pulls up to the house and finds Dean sitting on her front porch]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean.

speaker: DEAN
words: She likes Jess, doesn’t she?
THE END
OPEN IN DOOSE’S MARKET
[Lorelai and Rory are standing in the checkout line. Lorelai flips through a crossword puzzle book]

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hate crossword puzzles. They make me feel stupid.

speaker: RORY
words: Then don’t do ‘em.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, but if you don’t do them, you’re not only stupid, you’re also a coward.

speaker: RORY
words: Or you have better things to do with your time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You think people will buy that?

speaker: RORY
words: The people who line up on a daily basis and ask you if you do crossword puzzles and then, when you say no, challenge you as to why? Yes, I think they will buy it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, hey, look, new bag boy.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah, that’s Marty. He’s subbing for Dean while he’s out of town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, Marty does the jar twirl before putting the salsa in the bag. Impressive, very Cocktail.

speaker: RORY
words: Marty’s a nice guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Marty’s an ambitious snake in the grass.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The jar twirl, the double bagging, the ‘have a nice day, ma’am’ after every customer. . .that guy’s got an agenda.

speaker: RORY
words: Which is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s out to take Dean’s job!

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t think so.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yes, he is. I’m telling you, he wants that position. Dean better hurry back from his grandmother’s house or he can kiss his job goodbye.

speaker: RORY
words: They’re not going to fire Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really, why not?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, for starter’s, someone stole Taylor’s ladder last week and Dean is the only one who can reach the top shelves.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, interesting.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just as Marty, aka Eve Harrington, shows up trying to take Dean’s job, Taylor’s ladder mysteriously disappears, suddenly making Dean invaluable no matter what fancy tricks Lon Chaney Junior over there pulls. Good thinking, Dean – smart thinking, my friend.

speaker: RORY
words: You need to start napping in the afternoons.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Taylor, pulling double duty today?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, I like to fill in behind the register every now and then. It keeps me in contact with the clientele. Also, it allows me to keep an eye on the ‘take a penny’ pot here, make sure people aren’t pocketing those pennies for their own personal gain but are legitimately using them to make exact change.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh cool. Mom, look.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah, it’s Movie in the Square night again, great.

speaker: RORY
words: We’ll be there.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ah, excellent. There you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s the movie this year?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, it’s going to be something really great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really, what?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: A real winner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s it called?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, show up and be surprised.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why don’t you tell me what the movie is?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why not?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Because.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because why? What is the. . .oh no.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: There is a line behind you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You chose The Yearling again?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: It is a fine, wholesome motion picture. Moving story, lovely scenes of nature.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’ve shown The Yearling the last three years in a row!

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You know something, I’m getting a little tired of hearing you complain about this every single year.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m tired, too. Pick another movie.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: A lot of hard work and careful planning go into those nights. You never help plan, you never volunteer, you have never once been a ticket ripper as long as I have been involved in that function. Personally, missy, if you can’t participate with a smile and a hug, then you shouldn’t participate at all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I shouldn’t, but I am. Pick another movie.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: No!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Taylor, there’s millions of great movies out there. Any one of them would be better than The Yearling for the fourth time.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Fine, you do it!

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You pick the movie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seriously?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: I’ve had it. You have such strong opinions about everything, you go out and try to find a movie that everybody will enjoy. It’s all yours. I relinquish my movie picking crown to you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He relinquished his crown.

speaker: RORY
words: I heard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I got his crown.

speaker: RORY
words: And it looks great on you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cool, this is gonna be fun! Let’s go home and make popcorn and pick which movie we’re gonna show.

speaker: RORY
words: I get to help?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, and can I borrow the crown?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, honey. We’ll have to see.
[opening credits]
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[In Rory’s bedroom, Lorelai is sitting on Rory’s bed putting on makeup as Rory stands in front of the mirror]

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Wizard of Oz.

speaker: RORY
words: The Sting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rocky.

speaker: RORY
words: Crimes and Misdemeanors.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The Singing Detective.

speaker: RORY
words: That was a miniseries.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So?

speaker: RORY
words: So it’s like six hours long.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good point. Ooh, I got it! Arthur.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Or Sophie’s Choice.

speaker: RORY
words: Very similar.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh man, I can’t choose, there’s too many great movies. The burden is overwhelming. I’m sinking under the pressure. My grasp on reality is slipping. I can’t do it, I can’t hold on, I just can’t, I just. . .ooh, hey, how about Cabin Boy?
[phone rings]

speaker: RORY
words: Will you get that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: On?

speaker: RORY
words: Wednesday. Ooh! [answers phone] Dad, hi!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey kiddo, what’s going on?

speaker: RORY
words: Not much. Just getting ready for school and trying to think up movies.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Movies for what?

speaker: RORY
words: Our town does this big movie festival outdoors every year and this year Mom gets to pick the movie.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh yeah? How’d she get that gig?

speaker: RORY
words: She ticked off the guy that usually does it and he quit.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sounds about right.

speaker: RORY
words: So how are things there? How’s Sherry?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh, uh, nothing much is going on here. Same ol’, same ol’. Hey, listen, uh, I’ve gotta cut this talk short but I sent you an email, so read it and add an extra forty minutes onto my time for next week’s call, deal?

speaker: RORY
words: Deal. Do you wanna say hello to Mom before you go?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, no, I can’t, I really need to run. You say hello for me.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, I’ll talk to you Wednesday. Bye Sweetie.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye Dad. [hangs up] He says hello.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He does not.

speaker: RORY
words: So, are you gonna tell me what it is you two are fighting about?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not fighting.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, are you gonna tell me what it is you’re not fighting about that keeps you from talking to each other ever again?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What about Desperately Seeking Susan?

speaker: RORY
words: What about, my mother is two?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never saw it – Angie Dickinson?

speaker: RORY
words: You’re impossible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re right. You’re Impossible was the one with Angie Dickinson.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, forget it, I give. Stay in a fight, I don’t care. I’m late for school. We’ll finish the list later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: After school, Luke’s?

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll be there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye hon.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW HIGH CLASSROOM
[Students are taking a test.]

speaker: TEACHER
words: Fifteen minutes left.
[Jess sneaks in and sits behind Lane]

speaker: JESS
words: Lane. . .Lane.

speaker: LANE
words: Sh.

speaker: JESS
words: I need a pencil.

speaker: LANE
words: I don’t have one.

speaker: JESS
words: Then I need a pen.

speaker: LANE
words: You only have fifteen minutes left.

speaker: JESS
words: Then I need the answers.

speaker: LANE
words: There’s a pen in my bag.

speaker: JESS
words: I can’t go through your bag.

speaker: LANE
words: Yes, you can.

speaker: JESS
words: My mother told me never go through a lady’s bag. . .at least, not until you’re a couple blocks away. I’m just kidding, she never said that. Though it sounds like pretty good advice, doesn’t it?

speaker: LANE
words: Take it and shut up. [hands him a pen]

speaker: JESS
words: Well, I tell you, it’s true – small towns sure are friendly.
CUT TO PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE
[There’s a knock at the door.]

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Come in.
[Luke walks in]

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I got a call you wanted to see me. I’m, uh, Luke Danes – Jess Mariano’s uncle.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Jess Mariano. Ah yes, come in.

speaker: LUKE
words: Thanks. So is everything okay? I didn’t see any cop cars or fire trucks out front so. . .

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Mr. Danes, please have a seat.

speaker: LUKE
words: A seat? So this is a seat thing. Okay, what’s he done?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Why do you assume he’s done something?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, I don’t know. You’re staring at a folder that’s looking a little thick there. I get a call to come right over here and talk to you, so why don’t you just tell me what he’s done?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Nothing.

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: No homework, no class participation, his attendance record is erratic at best. His attitude towards his teachers, it ranges from indifferent to hostile. He shows no interest in school activities or other students, and there is the issue of the disappearing baseballs.

speaker: LUKE
words: The what?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Every baseball on campus seems to have disappeared.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, come on, you don’t think Jess seriously. . . I’ll check when I get home.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: I appreciate that. Now, I don’t suspect we’ll solve every problem in one meeting, so let’s focus on the most important one – his grades.

speaker: LUKE
words: Not good?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Not good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I’ll have a talk with him about that.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: You’re gonna have to do a lot more than talk to him. You’re gonna have to help him.

speaker: LUKE
words: Me? Oh, no, I’m not the one you want helping him. I went to this school – I’m sure there’s still a note stuffed in there about me with the words ‘trade school’ stamped in really big letters.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Well, if you can’t help him, you’re gonna have to find someone who can.

speaker: LUKE
words: Like who?

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: A relative.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t think so. Believe me, I’m the Einstein of the clan.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Well, maybe you need to hire a tutor.

speaker: LUKE
words: A tutor? Oh geez.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Mr. Danes, Jess is flunking out. He’s not going to make it. Now, if something it not done about that right now, he’s going to repeat this year. I’m sorry, but that’s where we are.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, well, if that’s where we are, then I’ll just have to figure something out.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Good. And let’s not forget about those baseballs.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Been using tennis balls for a couple of weeks.

speaker: LUKE
words: Wow.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
words: Very different results.

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m sure it is.
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at the counter going through a list of movies]

speaker: LORELAI
words: If we take off Fletch and Urban Cowboy, we still have seventy-five possibilities.

speaker: RORY
words: How are we gonna pick just one?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. Maybe we should do like a movie marathon weekend. You know, just show one movie after the other for three days and charge everyone a fortune, gauge ‘em of bottled water, have those really little disgusting bathrooms – it’d be like our own Woodstock.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Ah, good, there you are. I have something for you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: This. [puts a large binder on the counter]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Geez.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Now, when you get through this and make your decision, the number of the man you need to contact is inside on the first page.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What man? What is this?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: That is the list of titles that are available for you to pick from for the movie night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The list of titles? I’m sorry, can’t we just pick our own movie?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You’re not serious?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not often, but just there – yeah, I had some serious going.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: My dear girl, movies are expensive and we get fabulous deals with this particular place. They have a wide selection and they’re very friendly and since it all goes to charity, they agree to give us anything on that list for free.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So we have to pick a movie off this list?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, it’s fun. They put the movie title over here and a brief description of the storyline over here and believe me, there are some excellent movies on that list. Really, top notch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Arctic Flight – man with plane flies charter to Alaska, hired by bear hunter who turns out to be Russian spy, love story develops with pilot and school teachers, Eskimos do tribal dance. You made this up.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Don’t I wish. Okay, well, I can’t wait to see what you come up with. Bye girls.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Killer Shark.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Shark fisherman on ocean, Mexican cantina with tequila and Mariachi music, has good scene of catching and cleaning shark.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where Are Your Children? Hip music and singing about kids getting into trouble, sneaking booze into clubs, stealing car, fight between girls, romance starts then guy goes in the Navy.

speaker: RORY
words: Huh. Sudden Danger – mom dies of gas asphyxiation, son blamed, good kiss scene.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Suspense – ice skater falls in love with hired help. Well, at least now I know how Snow Dogs got made.
[Luke walks into the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey. Listen, have you seen Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: I think I saw him go upstairs earlier.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, great, thanks.
CUT TO LUKE’S APARTMENT
[Luke walks in as Jess is going through his CDs]

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, good, you’re here. So, you file those under the band names?

speaker: JESS
words: Genre.

speaker: LUKE
words: Right, genre, that makes sense, makes a lot of sense. Oh, what is that? Something for school?

speaker: JESS
words: Nope.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, well, shouldn’t you be reading something for school?

speaker: JESS
words: Why?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know. I mean, I know you like reading and since you like reading, you might as well read something you’re gonna get graded on so you can get graded on something you like because you like reading.

speaker: JESS
words: What are you babbling about?

speaker: LUKE
words: I went to see your principal today.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: He says you’re flunking out. He says you’re not showing up for class. He says you stole their baseballs. You stole their baseballs? Why would you do that? What could you possibly need five hundred baseballs for?

speaker: JESS
words: Can we talk about this later?

speaker: LUKE
words: Why, you got a big Frisbee heist going down at six? Jess, Mr. Mertin said if you don’t start doing better, they’re not gonna let you be a senior.

speaker: JESS
words: Bummer.

speaker: LUKE
words: They’re gonna hold you back.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, at least I’ll know where my classes are.

speaker: LUKE
words: Jess, this is serious. You’re flunking out. You’re looking at being in the eleventh grade for the rest of your life. You’re gonna be the kid in the back of the room with a beard and a racing form babbling incoherently about Steely Dan.

speaker: JESS
words: Steely Dan?

speaker: LUKE
words: The group may change, the freak in the back never does.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m going out.

speaker: LUKE
words: Don’t you wanna go to college?

speaker: JESS
words: Don’t wait up.

speaker: LUKE
words: What do you wanna be when you grow up?

speaker: JESS
words: About twenty miles south of wherever you are.

speaker: LUKE
words: You have to think about the future. If you don’t get through high school, who’s gonna hire you? You’re not gonna have any skills.

speaker: JESS
words: Stop.

speaker: LUKE
words: How you gonna work, huh? How you gonna eat? How you gonna pay rent? What are you gonna do, Jess?

speaker: JESS
words: Geez, I don’t know, maybe I’ll work in a diner.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai is sitting at the kitchen table going through the book of movie titles as Rory walks in]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Marshmallow?

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I have now finished going through every single one of these movies. I’ve read them, reviewed their merits, and I’m proud to announce that I have chosen our movie. How does The Yearling sound to you?

speaker: RORY
words: Perfect.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And buh-bye.
[there’s a knock at the front door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, that must be Pauline Kale rising from the dead.

speaker: RORY
words: Tell her hey.
[Lorelai goes to answer the door, Luke is standing on the porch with a box]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pauline!

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never mind. What are you doing here?

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, I made some brownies, I thought you might like some.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, gee, since I just ate half a bag of marshmallows, six Pop Tarts, four bagel dogs and a really stale Cheese Nip – yup, it’s brownie time, thanks. Hey, here’s a question for you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you probably have a diner full of people who would love these brownies – plus, I bet they’d pay you for ‘em.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, I accidentally dropped triple the amount of cocoa powder in the batter so I either had to dump the batch or find someone with some sort of superhuman chocolate tolerance – only one name came to mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: God, I love being special. What?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nothing. I just. . .hey, uh, is Rory here by any chance?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, she’s in her room.

speaker: LUKE
words: Can I talk to her for a sec?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure, go right ahead.

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, thanks. [knocks on Rory’s door] Rory, it’s Luke. Can I come in for a minute?

speaker: RORY
words: [opens door] Hey, what’s up?

speaker: LUKE
words: Not much. Can I . . .

speaker: RORY
words: Uh, yeah, come on in.

speaker: LUKE
words: So I see you’re studying.

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LUKE
words: That’s good. Studying is very, very good. What you’re doing right there with the books, very good.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, look, I wanted to ask you a favor. Oh. Uh. I was wondering if you could tutor Jess.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LUKE
words: He’s not doing too well in school. The principal said he’s not gonna let him move on unless something changes. I was wondering if you could help.

speaker: RORY
words: That doesn’t make any sense, he’s smart enough to pass any subject.

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t think it’s his lack of smarts, more like his lack of proximity to the actual classes that’s the problem.

speaker: RORY
words: Ah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, what subject does he need help in?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’d say all of them, probably.

speaker: RORY
words: Huh.

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, I don’t expect you to work miracles and it doesn’t have to be a full time everyday thing. If you could just get him through a couple of his next tests, maybe make the school see that he can do it, that would probably help out a lot.

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.

speaker: LUKE
words: Great, tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: Tonight.

speaker: LUKE
words: I really appreciate this. Ah, okay, you should get back to your studying, otherwise you’re completely useless to me. [walks into kitchen] Okay, so I’ll see you guys at dinner probably.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, hold on – what was that all about?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, Rory’s gonna tutor Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She is?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, just for a little while, help get him on the right track.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, I should be getting back. Enjoy the brownies, I’ll see if I can screw up a cake for you later on.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds great.
[Luke leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm.
[Lorelai follows Luke out into the front yard]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Luke, hang on just a sec.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, listen, about Rory doing this tutoring thing.

speaker: LUKE
words: I really appreciate it, by the way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you do. I just. . .Rory’s so sweet and she would never say no to anyone ‘cause she loves to help, but I’m not sure if it’s the best idea.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why not?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, she’s got her own studies to worry about.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know, and I promise this is not gonna take up all her time. It’s just for a little while.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, but - .

speaker: LUKE
words: Plus, Rory’s pretty serious about school. I don’t think she’d say she had the time if she didn’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, Rory is a great student, but she’s just a kid. Don’t you need like a professional tutor to help with Jess? You know, somebody with a degree and a pipe and one of those coats with the elbow patches on it?

speaker: LUKE
words: I need someone Jess is gonna listen to, someone he’s gonna. . .I don’t know, look up to. That sure isn’t me and it sure isn’t some tutor. He likes Rory and Rory’s on the path that I’d like to see Jess on – school and college. He needs to see somebody he respects doing what he should be doing and Rory’s the only person I can think of who fits that description.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but you don’t know for sure that he’ll listen to Rory.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, but I gotta do something, don’t I? I mean, what would you do if you were me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nuh. Okay, just make sure it’s not too much time, okay?

speaker: LUKE
words: I will.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: Enjoy the brownie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.
[Luke leaves; Lorelai tries the brownie and makes a face]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God. Mmm, that’s good.
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at a table as Kirk walks up to them]

speaker: KIRK
words: Ah, Lorelai, good. I need one minute of your time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll give you two because you scare me.

speaker: KIRK
words: I hear through the grapevine that you are the one in charge of selecting the movie for this year’s movie night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I am.

speaker: KIRK
words: Okay, well, I don’t know if you know this about me, but I have great creative ambitions.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did not know that about you, Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: It’s true. Don’t get me wrong, I love the blue collar work. I enjoy the plight of the every man. But as much as the mail letter delivered and the DSL line installed and the latest J. Lo flick rented fills me with a deep sense of pride, in my soul I am Akira Kurosawa.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seven Samurai, great movie.

speaker: KIRK
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seven Samurai.

speaker: KIRK
words: I’m sorry, I don’t – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Akira Kurosawa directed Seven Samurai. It’s a great Japanese movie.

speaker: KIRK
words: Japanese movie? No, I’m sorry, I have the wrong person. Who’s the guy who directed all those Facts of Life’s?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t – .

speaker: KIRK
words: Asaad Kelada, sorry. In my soul I know I am Asaad Kelada.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you need from me, Kirk?

speaker: KIRK
words: I’ve made a short film that I’ve been working on for about five years now and if I rush, I can have done my Thursday night. I’m very proud of it, and I was wondering if you would consider screening it before the movie tomorrow. It would mean a great deal to my career.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, uh, what kind of movie is it?

speaker: KIRK
words: Oh, you mean is it blue? No, perfectly PG.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: KIRK
words: It’s not exactly Babe, it’s more like Babe 2.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Got it.

speaker: KIRK
words: Same pig, harder edge.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Kirk, I hear you. I wanna help you. Let me think about it and I’ll get back to you.

speaker: KIRK
words: Here’s a copy of the film. Take a look and call me. And remember, I can edit out two of the hells but I need to keep all the damns. It’s a street cred thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Kirk.
[Kirk leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, at least now I have something fun to do tonight.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re not watching that without me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, I’ll wait. So, um. . .ooh, do you wanna get some pie?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I’m full.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coffee? How ‘bout some coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hot chocolate?

speaker: RORY
words: No, thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Egg cream? Now, I never had an egg cream but it sounds just disgusting enough to be fabulous.

speaker: RORY
words: We’re just going to study.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: And we’ll be right here doing it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: So all this stalling is completely unnecessary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: So go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will. Just finishing up the coffee that I paid for already. All right, that’s enough, I’m going. Goodbye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye. Um, Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: Listen, just in case, and I don’t think he will, but if Dean calls, will you tell him I’m with Lane?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought you said this was nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: It is nothing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That you guys were just studying.

speaker: RORY
words: We are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then how come I have to lie to Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you know as well as I do that it’s not gonna be okay with Dean if I’m studying with Jess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then maybe you shouldn’t be. I mean, if you feel weird enough about it that I have to lie to Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not asking you to lie to Dean.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You told me to tell him that you’re with Lane.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, that was just because – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t see Lane here – sounds like a lie to me.

speaker: RORY
words: Fine, forget it. Just don’t answer the phone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello, I get calls there, too. I’m not ‘whatever happened to Baby Jane?’ yet, thank you very much.

speaker: RORY
words: Just tell him that I’m studying, which is what I am doing, so you will not be lying, okay?
[Jess walks over to them]

speaker: JESS
words: Hey Teach.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: JESS
words: You guys done yet?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just not yet.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, well, I’ll be right over there when you are. I just can’t wait for that learning to begin. Hey, are we gonna do some of those Schoolhouse Rocks songs?

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll be right there, Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: ‘Cause they say if you just make learning fun. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Give us a minute, okay?

speaker: JESS
words: Well, hurry – a mind is a terrible thing to waste.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll be home early.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine. Bye.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Ma’am.
[Lorelai leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: So, are you ready to start?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes, I am.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are your books?

speaker: JESS
words: Huh, I don’t know.

speaker: RORY
words: How are we gonna study without your books?

speaker: JESS
words: I guess we can’t. Too bad. So, what now – movie?

speaker: RORY
words: Get your books.

speaker: JESS
words: The cat ate ‘em.

speaker: RORY
words: Get your books or I’m going home.

speaker: JESS
words: Wait there. [does magic trick]
CUT TO THE DINER LATER THAT NIGHT
[Rory and Jess are sitting at a table. Rory is going through a book as Jess plays with a deck of cards.]

speaker: RORY
words: Explain to me the political ramifications of the Marshall Plan.

speaker: JESS
words: Pick a card. [Rory throws the whole deck on the floor] Huh, well, that just made the trick a little bit harder.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess, focus.

speaker: JESS
words: Where’s Dean tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: We just went over this. There’s no way you already forgot it.

speaker: JESS
words: Work?

speaker: RORY
words: I will make you write it out fifty times on the specials board if that’s what it takes.

speaker: JESS
words: ‘Cause if he’s not at work, he must be free, so he doesn’t care that you’re here?

speaker: RORY
words: No, he doesn’t. He’s visiting his grandmother.

speaker: JESS
words: Where?

speaker: RORY
words: Chicago.

speaker: JESS
words: So he doesn’t know.

speaker: RORY
words: It wouldn’t matter.

speaker: JESS
words: So you’ll tell him when he gets back?

speaker: RORY
words: We’re studying.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re studying, I’m prying into your personal life.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess, why won’t you at least try to remember the Marshall Plan?

speaker: JESS
words: Have you ever read "Please Kill Me"?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: JESS
words: Oral history of the punk movement. You’d like it – you can borrow it if you want.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m here to help you study. Now, if you want me to go, I’ll go, but if I’m going to stay, then you will stop distracting me and start paying attention, understand?

speaker: JESS
words: I understand.

speaker: RORY
words: Good. And yes, I would like to borrow it, thank you very much. Now open your book.
CUT TO DINER LATER THAT NIGHT
[Jess finishes writing something on a notepad, then hands it to Rory]

speaker: JESS
words: Done.

speaker: RORY
words: This isn’t Shakespeare.

speaker: JESS
words: It’s not?

speaker: RORY
words: It’s the words to a Clash song.

speaker: JESS
words: Ah, now, but which Clash song?

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, I’m not the one being tested right now.

speaker: JESS
words: Ten seconds.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: Nine, eight, seven.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop it.

speaker: JESS
words: Six, five, four.

speaker: RORY
words: You know you’re really starting to. . .

speaker: JESS
words: Three.

speaker: RORY
words: Ooh, ooh, Guns of Brixton!

speaker: JESS
words: A plus.

speaker: RORY
words: Why would you even agree to this studying thing in the first place?

speaker: JESS
words: Because Luke said I had to.

speaker: RORY
words: You’ve never done anything because someone said you had to.

speaker: JESS
words: I moved here because someone said I had to.

speaker: RORY
words: Very different.

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, well. . .hey, do you wanna get outta here?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: I’m sick of studying.

speaker: RORY
words: How can you be sick of studying? You haven’t done any studying. You’ve done card tricks, you’ve made coffee, you’ve tried to explain to me how on earth Coldplay could be considered an alternative band, but as of yet, no studying.

speaker: JESS
words: That’s your car?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, it is.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, tell you what. Let’s go get some ice cream, and then when we get back, I’ll study.

speaker: RORY
words: This is a diner, there’s ice cream here.

speaker: JESS
words: Yes, but we don’t have any cones.

speaker: RORY
words: Cones?

speaker: JESS
words: I need cones.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, so, if we go get ice cream. . .

speaker: JESS
words: In cones.

speaker: RORY
words: Then you will be a perfect student for the rest of the night?

speaker: JESS
words: That’s right.

speaker: RORY
words: I could not believe you less. Here, you drive, I’ll read you Othello. Won’t that be fun?

speaker: JESS
words: You have no idea how much.
CUT TO INSIDE RORY’S CAR
[Jess and Rory are each eating an ice cream cone]

speaker: JESS
words: Admit it, it’s always better in a cone.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s always better in a cone.

speaker: JESS
words: Putting ice cream in a dish, eating it with a spoon?

speaker: RORY
words: What is wrong with people?

speaker: JESS
words: Hold the wheel.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: I’m dripping here, hold the wheel.

speaker: RORY
words: I can’t hold the wheel, you’re driving. The person who’s driving has to hold the wheel. That’s the first thing they teach you in driver’s ed.

speaker: JESS
words: Huh, I gotta take that class one of those days. Take the wheel.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m letting go.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop! Take it back. Okay, you are taking this wheel back and when you do, I’m going to kill you. I’m just letting you know that.

speaker: JESS
words: I appreciate the warning.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess!

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, I got it. Geez, you look pale. Are you okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Death, and it’s going to be painful.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re not gonna kill me. Think how dull your life would be without me.

speaker: RORY
words: Serious question?

speaker: JESS
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: You know you’re smarter than most everybody at your school. It takes you like five minutes to finish a book. You read everything, you remember everything, you could ace those classes easily. Why don’t you? You don’t need a tutor. It’s crazy that they’re talking about leaving you back.

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: You can do anything you wanted, you can be anything you wanted.

speaker: JESS
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I. . .is it like a cool thing?

speaker: JESS
words: I could care less about being cool.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, inform me, please.

speaker: JESS
words: I’m never going to college, why waste the time in high school?

speaker: RORY
words: And why aren’t you going to college?

speaker: JESS
words: Please.

speaker: RORY
words: What? Please what – why is it so crazy?

speaker: JESS
words: Ask my mother, she could give you a couple reasons. Oh, and I’m sure Principal Mertin can chime in with a few good ones. In fact, ask your mother. She doesn’t know me all that well but I’m sure she could improvise a few things.

speaker: RORY
words: Do not give me that whole ‘I’m so misunderstood, Kurt Cobainy’ thing. You are way stronger than that and I don’t even wanna hear it. You have to go to college.

speaker: JESS
words: No, you have to go to college.

speaker: RORY
words: But don’t you have any plans?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes, I plan to get out of Stars Hollow.

speaker: RORY
words: And go where?

speaker: JESS
words: Wherever.

speaker: RORY
words: And do what?

speaker: JESS
words: Whatever.

speaker: RORY
words: Wherever, whatever.

speaker: JESS
words: I’ll live where I live, I’ll work when I need money, and I’ll see where I end up.

speaker: RORY
words: You could do more.

speaker: JESS
words: Oh, here come the pompoms.

speaker: RORY
words: No, no pompoms, just me saying you could do more.

speaker: JESS
words: So, Courtney, what about you?

speaker: RORY
words: What about me?

speaker: JESS
words: What are your big ambitions?

speaker: RORY
words: Harvard.

speaker: JESS
words: And after Harvard?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m gonna be a journalist.

speaker: JESS
words: Paula Zahn?

speaker: RORY
words: Christiane Amapour

speaker: JESS
words: You’re gonna be an overseas correspondent?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, I am.

speaker: JESS
words: You’re gonna crawl around in trenches and stand on top of buildings and have bombs going off in the background and some wars raging all around you?

speaker: RORY
words: What, you don’t think I can do it?

speaker: JESS
words: No, I do. Just sounds a little too – .

speaker: RORY
words: A little what?

speaker: JESS
words: Just sounds a little too rough for you.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, it’s not a little too rough for me. I hope it’s not a little too rough for me, I’ve been talking about this forever. I mean, I don’t even know what I would do if – .

speaker: JESS
words: Hey, I didn’t mean to freak you out. I’m sorry. I’m sure you’ll do it. You will, I promise. I’ll help you practice, okay? Tomorrow, you’ll stand in the middle of the street and I will drive straight at you screaming in a foreign language.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you’re gonna have to learn a foreign language first.

speaker: JESS
words: Well, it’s lucky I’ve got me a tutor, isn’t it? Okay, so I guess we should be getting back. I did promise to study if you went on this ice cream run with me.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, you did.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay, so I just go straight and we’ll be back at Luke’s.

speaker: RORY
words: Good sense of direction.

speaker: JESS
words: Of course, I could turn right and then we’d just be driving around in circles for awhile.

speaker: RORY
words: Turn right.

speaker: JESS
words: As you wish.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Lorelai is standing at the kitchen table as the phone rings]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hello?

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Rory, great. Tell me, was it the China Ball, the China Doll, or the China Wall that had the really good shrimp balls?

speaker: RORY
words: I think it was the China Doll.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, these can go. You’ll be so proud of me, I’m organizing the takeout drawer. I’m weeding out all the dogs and I’m putting happy face stickers on the dishes that have been huge successes to make our ordering more efficient. Where are you?

speaker: RORY
words: I need you to be calm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Calm about what?

speaker: RORY
words: Calm about what I have to tell you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What – where are you?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m all right.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, of course you’re all right – why wouldn’t you be all right?

speaker: RORY
words: Because. . .I got in an accident.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? What accident? What do you mean you got in an accident?

speaker: RORY
words: Jess and I went for ice cream and we were just driving and it was dark and this dog or cat or possum, I don’t know – it was small and furry, and it ran out into the middle of the road and Jess swerved and – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess swerved?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess was driving?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess was driving your car and you got in an accident?

speaker: RORY
words: But I’m fine and he’s fine and the furry thing is fine. The car’s a little messed up, but there’s nothing for you to be worried about.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where are you?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m in the hospital.
CUT TO HOSPITAL
[Lorelai walks up to the nurse’s station]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, hi, hi, excuse me, uh, my daughter’s here, she was in a car accident. Her name is Rory Gilmore.

speaker: NURSE
words: Okay, just take a seat.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t wanna take a seat.

speaker: NURSE
words: It’ll be one minute.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, do you remember in Terms of Endearment, that scene where Shirley MacLaine is in the hospital and freaks out because they won’t give her daughter a shot? She got that from me and she toned it down a little. So, once again, I’m looking for my daughter, Rory Gilmore?

speaker: NURSE
words: First door on your left.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.
[Lorelai walks into the room – a doctor is wrapping Rory’s arm]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, good. Are you okay?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: RORY
words: Please tell her that I’m fine.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: She’s fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then, what’s with the wrapping?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Well - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: If she’s fine, there’d be no wrapping. There’s no wrapping if she’s fine.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Her arm hit the dashboard. She sustained a minor hairline fracture to her wrist.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So she broke her wrist?

speaker: RORY
words: No, it’s just a fracture.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, let George Clooney talk here, okay?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: It’s a tiny fracture, absolutely nothing serious. I’m gonna put a cast on it. She’ll wear it for a couple weeks, that’s it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: A cast?

speaker: RORY
words: It barely hurts, I swear.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And that’s it – just the wrist, everything else is fine?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: She seems perfectly healthy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She seems healthy? Did you check everything out?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Well, we checked almost everything that could’ve been affected, yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Almost everything?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Miss Gilmore, I assure you, we were very thorough.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m sure you were, I just would like some extra thorough. Uh, anything that could’ve possibly, in any scenario, affected this body, I want it checked out.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: I’ll run a few more x-rays if that’ll make you feel better.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It will, thank you.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: And then we’ll put the cast on her, so it’s gonna be a little while before she’s out of here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can wait.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Okay. Rory, I’ll be right back. You sit still for a minute, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[doctor leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw.

speaker: RORY
words: The car’s not so good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, nobody cares about the car.

speaker: RORY
words: Jess made sure that he called the ambulance and that I was okay before he even talked to the police and – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Let’s just hear about the details later, okay? I just want you to relax now.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re not mad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m not mad. So they, they uh, brought you in the ambulance?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did they use the siren?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I hope Taylor was in bed already.

speaker: RORY
words: It was after nine so there’s a good chance he was.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nice.
[the doctor returns]

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Okay, Rory, I’m gonna have the nurse take you down to x-ray now.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, can I go with her?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: I’m sorry, you have to wait outside. It’ll be about an hour if you wanna go grab some coffee or something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, thanks. Smile pretty for the camera.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thanks.
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Lorelai bangs on the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke! Luke!
[Luke opens the door and Lorelai rushes into the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, I was – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where is he?

speaker: LUKE
words: Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess! Where’s Jess, Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: I don’t know, I just got back. What’s going on? I got here and they weren’t here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess!

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, talk to me!
[cut to the upstairs hallway]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess, answer me right now!

speaker: LUKE
words: What’s wrong, what happened?

speaker: LORELAI
words: There was an accident.
[they walk inside the apartment and Lorelai looks around for Jess]

speaker: LUKE
words: What - what accident?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess!

speaker: LUKE
words: What accident?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess was driving Rory’s car and he crashed it.

speaker: LUKE
words: What, when?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do you mean, when? Tonight, tonight – he crashed it tonight! Jess, dammit!
[Lorelai walks out of the apartment]

speaker: LUKE
words: What happened? Is anyone hurt? Lorelai!
[Luke follows her down into the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, I’m talking to you here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Where would he be? Where would he go?

speaker: LUKE
words: I asked you if anyone was hurt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, was anyone hurt? Well, let’s see. Uh, Rory’s in the emergency room now with a fractured wrist, so yeah, I’d say someone was hurt.

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory fractured her wrist?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, she has to wear a cast for two weeks, she’s getting x-rays and tests.

speaker: LUKE
words: What about Jess – is he hurt?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, Luke – Jess did the hurting. That little punk nephew of yours almost killed my kid tonight.

speaker: LUKE
words: Look, I’m sure it was an accident. Accidents happen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Not with my kid in the car, they don’t.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, you just need to calm down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why did you do this?

speaker: LUKE
words: What are you talking about? Why did I do what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why did you bring him here?

speaker: LUKE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: If you hadn’t brought him here, none of this would’ve happened.

speaker: LUKE
words: This is my fault?
