speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, it is your fault! You told him to come, you let him stay. Everybody hated him, everybody knew he was trouble but you wouldn’t listen and you wouldn’t send him home and now my daughter is in the hospital!
[Luke walks out of the diner and Lorelai follows him]

speaker: LORELAI
words: You kept pushing them together. You asked her to help him study, you knew she’d never say no. I told you it made me nervous, I told you I didn’t like it and I should’ve stopped it right there. But you thought Rory would be good for Jess, never mind what he’d be for her. That wasn’t important at all, was it?

speaker: LUKE
words: Of course it was important.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why didn’t you put a stop to it at the first sign of trouble? Why didn’t you make him leave?

speaker: LUKE
words: He’s my nephew. I had an obligation to take him in, I had an obligation to care for him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You had an obligation to this town and to me and to Rory. Where are you going?

speaker: LUKE
words: I have to find out where Jess is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I’ll tell you where he’s not – he’s not in the emergency room having him arm plastered up!

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey, I am sorry about Rory. You know I care more about her than I do myself, but at least you know where Rory is and at least you know that she’s okay. Now, I have to find Jess and I have to make sure that he’s okay, and if that cuts into your screaming time, well that’s just too damn bad!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go to hell!

speaker: LUKE
words: Right back at ya!
[Luke walks away. Lorelai sees Rory’s car being towed away and starts to cry, then pulls out her cell phone]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris?
CUT TO BRIDGE
[Jess is sitting on the bridge as Luke walks up to him]

speaker: JESS
words: I made sure she was okay.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know you did.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Rory is lying in bed, Lorelai stands next to her near a small table of items]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, you’ve got your TV, you’ve got your books, your magazines, your refreshments, you have your CD player, your assorted CDs. Stan Freberg, Ash, you have your Sinead O’Connor – because when life really gets you down, Sinead’s really the one to teach you some perspective. You have a pad of paper in case you decide to write the great American novel. And over here you have a tiny but annoying bell in case there’s something here that you need but you don’t have and you want to summon the common but lovely house wench who will promptly leave her talking mice and come to fetch the Contessa whatever she may require.

speaker: RORY
words: I think what Contessa requires right now is sleep.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Is your arm hurting you?

speaker: RORY
words: Unh uh, but the stuff they gave me at the hospital made me a little dopey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My little Marianne Faithful. Scooch down now and go to sleep.
[Lorelai moves Rory’s armchair]

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just a little feng shui, go to sleep.
[Lorelai brings in a pillow and blanket]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, you don’t have to sleep in here tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, I just think the chair looks nice here.

speaker: RORY
words: And what’s the blanket for?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In case the chair gets cold.

speaker: RORY
words: And the pillow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To keep the blanket company.

speaker: RORY
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, everything’s in its place. Chair seems warm, blanket seems happy, just one thing missing. . .oh, yeah. [sits down in chair] Goodnight.

speaker: RORY
words: Freak of sideshow proportions.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I love you, too.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh, the chair is trying to sleep.
CUT TO LATER THAT NIGHT
[Rory is asleep in her bed, Lorelai is asleep in the chair. Lorelai wakes up and finds Christopher sleeping in a chair next to her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: [wakes up] What? Lor. . . is everything. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh. Come on.
[they walk into the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, what are you doing here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, I have a really crappy mattress at home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I drove here as fast as I could and I went to the hospital but you guys had already left so I tried your cell phone but all I got was the voice mail so I came here but the place looked dark so I got the key out of the turtle and came in but you guys were already asleep so I just grabbed a chair and. . . and apparently my evil plan worked exactly as I anticipated.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m so glad you’re here.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Me too. How’s she doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: She’s in a cast.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: The doctor said she’ll be fine, he’ll take it off in a couple of weeks. The car is totally gone and I have to call the insurance guy tomorrow and. . .I don’t know.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Did you find that kid?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Jess?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Jess, dead meat, whatever his name is.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, the little ferret’s hiding out somewhere, I’m sure.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, well, I’m gonna deal with the car tomorrow and I still wanna talk to the doctor, if that’s okay, and I’m gonna need a picture of this Jess so I don’t accidentally rip the head off the wrong kid ‘cause that would be bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look at you all springin’ into action.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: About time, don’t ya think?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I like the superhero you.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Just trying to keep up.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, are you staying here tonight or do you have to rush back?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, I wanna spend some time with Rory tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And Sherry’s cool with you staying here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Rory comes first.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay. Do you want some coffee?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’ll get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you know how to make coffee?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes, I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: My coffee?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: One bag of coffee per cup of water, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Perfect. Oh my God. When Rory called me tonight and said the word hospital, I just legitimately thought I was having a heart attack, and let me tell you, it was not fun. I’m joining a gym tomorrow, that’s how not fun it was.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: See if you can get a two for one membership.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Anything could’ve happened. It could’ve been so much worse.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: But it wasn’t.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it wasn’t, but it could’ve been.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It wasn’t. It’s okay, everything’s gonna be okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, about the fight we had the last time you were here. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Oh, yes, that was a doozy, wasn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just, I didn’t mean to. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, I shouldn’t have. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, but if I implied that. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You didn’t. . .I just snapped. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: I understand.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me too. Hey, did I mention I’m really glad you’re here?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I believe you did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, good for me, then.
CUT TO TOWN SQUARE
[On Movie in the Square night, rows of chairs are set up in front of a large movie screen near the gazebo. Lorelai, Christopher, Rory, and Sookie walk toward the seats]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: The Yearling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh huh.

speaker: RORY
words: Great movie.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Boy, you think they could’ve gotten the genius in charge of this to come up with something other than The Yearling.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, picking a movie that will appeal to a large group of people is hard.

speaker: LANE
words: Rory!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: We’ll get seats.
[Lorelai, Sookie, and Christopher walk away]

speaker: LANE
words: Oh my God! Let me see. Oh, that sucks, that so sucks. Does it hurt?

speaker: RORY
words: Only when I remember how I got it.

speaker: LANE
words: Okay. Here – angry girl for an angry arm.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, cool! Thank you.

speaker: LANE
words: You’re welcome. [Lane puts a sticker on Rory’s cast] So, tell me what happened.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, Lane, it was horrible. I have never been involved in anything so horrible in my life.

speaker: LANE
words: But what happened?

speaker: RORY
words: An animal ran out into the road and we swerved and we hit a pole, and my car – my beautiful car. . .

speaker: LANE
words: How bad?

speaker: RORY
words: Bad.

speaker: LANE
words: Have you talked to Dean?

speaker: RORY
words: No, he gets home tomorrow.

speaker: LANE
words: What are you gonna say?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LANE
words: He’s gonna freak.

speaker: RORY
words: I know.

speaker: LANE
words: And Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: Not since last night.

speaker: LANE
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, everyone is so upset right now. And my dad’s in town and something happened between Mom and Luke and she won’t tell me what. I don’t know, they just need time to cool off and then everything will be fine. Everyone just needs time. Maybe I’ll try to call him tomorrow.

speaker: LANE
words: Tomorrow. Oh yeah, that’s plenty of time. No one will still be mad then.

speaker: RORY
words: Sarcasm does not become you.

speaker: LANE
words: Maybe not, but it does sustain me.
[cut to Lorelai, Sookie and Christopher finding seats]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, why isn’t Jackson here?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, he’s singing to his persimmons tonight. They’ve been a little sour lately.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, right.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Right? You just accept that explanation?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, why shouldn’t I?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Because she just told you the man isn’t here because he’s singing to fruit.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s better than dancing with it. Remember last year’s watermelon crop?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh, yeah – threw his back out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m facing the screen now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: The movie’s already starting? I thought it started at eight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, this is a little pre-movie treat.
[On the screen, the words "a film by kirk" appear. Kirk and a woman walk up to a house]

speaker: KIRK
words: I can’t wait to meet your family.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I’m very close to my family.

speaker: KIRK
words: I know this. That’s why I can’t wait to meet your family.

speaker: WOMAN
words: Remember, Daddy is quite protective. I’m his favorite daughter.

speaker: KIRK
words: He has good taste. I intend to tell him that.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I love you.
[They knock on the door and a man answers]

speaker: WOMAN
words: Daddy.

speaker: DAD
words: You are with my favorite daughter.

speaker: KIRK
words: You have good taste.

speaker: DAD
words: Come in the house.

speaker: WOMAN
words: I love you.
[inside the house, Kirk, the woman, and her parents sit in chairs in the living room just staring at each other. Finally, Kirk stands up]

speaker: KIRK
words: I love your daughter.

speaker: DAD
words: Who are you to love my daughter? What can you offer her?

speaker: KIRK
words: Nothing. Only this. [starts dancing]
[cut to the audience]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Wow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He raps later.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, Jackson needs to see this. Hey, if I can’t get him here quick enough. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, we are so playing this again after the movie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Great, I’ll be back. [leaves]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: This town is like one big outpatient mental institution.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Glad you could join us.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, me too.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s so nice you decided to stay for the movie. I mean, it’s really fun being able to say, ‘hey, look, I know that person. I talk to him everyday and so far, he’s never bitten me.’

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: That’s it, I’m definitely coming around more often. You need protection.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coming around more sounds good.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I wish I could stay longer.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you gotta get back to Sherry. Don’t worry, we understand.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, well, I wish I could stay.
[Rory sits down with them]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, where did Sookie go? Oh my Lord.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Quick, cover her eyes. She’s just a child, she shouldn’t have to see this.

speaker: RORY
words: He’s taking his shirt off.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I shouldn’t have to see this either. I’m going for popcorn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Me please.

speaker: RORY
words: Me too.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Got it, be right back. [leaves]

speaker: RORY
words: I like it when he’s here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, me too.
[on the screen, Kirk finishes dancing and the dad stands up.]

speaker: DAD
words: Let’s eat.
[the movie ends and the audience claps. Patty walks up to Lorelai and Rory]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I did the choreography.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mm.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Patty, doll, come here!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I’ll see you later.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye Patty. [to Rory] So, how are you feeling?

speaker: RORY
words: Haunted by the sight of Kirk’s bare chest.
[pan over to Babette and Miss Patty talking]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: No!

speaker: BABETTE
words: I swear to God!

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: When?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Last night, not long after the accident happened, Luke walked him straight to the bus station, stuck the kid on a bus, sent him home to his mom.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: I can’t believe Luke would send him off like that.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Well, I heard the kid wanted to go. I don’t know. All I know is that Jess is gone.

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, well, well. What will we do for entertainment around here?

speaker: BABETTE
words: Beats the hell outta me.
[pan over to Lorelai and Rory, who heard the conversation]
THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are walking past the gazebo toward Luke’s]

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nothing. Are you tilting?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I think you’re tilting.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not tilting.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you wanna hold onto my purse? It might even you out.

speaker: RORY
words: Stop anytime you like. What are you doing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I’m gonna get a pen and put it on top of your head and see if it rolls off.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, see, this is not how you console the injured.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re right, I’m sorry. [pulls a book out of her purse] How about this?

speaker: RORY
words: The Little Locksmith!

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I got it at the bookstore, paid full price.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you!

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome – feel better?

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. . .now can I put a pen on top of your head?

speaker: RORY
words: No. Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh good, hold still.

speaker: RORY
words: Forget the pen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Drat!

speaker: RORY
words: When are you gonna tell me what happened between you and Luke? Was it bad? I mean, I’m sure it was bad, but how bad is bad?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It was nothing.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look, I was upset, he was upset, we had a thing. It’s over, we’re fine.

speaker: RORY
words: A thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A tiny thing.

speaker: RORY
words: A tiny thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: A thinglet, if you will.

speaker: RORY
words: You and Luke don’t have thinglets very often.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh no, Rory, everybody has thinglets, it’s part of being a grown up.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, what did he say? What did you say?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, please.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, okay, fine, just answer me this – we are on our way to Luke’s, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Right.

speaker: RORY
words: And when we get there, will we get in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Of course we’ll get in.

speaker: RORY
words: Will we get served?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Will we get coffee?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe.

speaker: RORY
words: Refills?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Eventually.

speaker: RORY
words: Free refills?

speaker: LORELAI
words: In about a month.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, the thinglet has grown into a thing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, Luke and I have fought before, God knows we’ll fight again, but it’s over, it’s history. We’ll go in, he’ll be crabby, I’ll be adorable, he’ll forget everything and that, as they say, will be that.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.
[They reach Luke’s Diner – there is a crowd out front]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, is there a line?

speaker: KIRK
words: Closed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: KIRK
words: It's closed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke's is closed?

speaker: RORY
words: Luke's is never closed.

speaker: KIRK
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure it's closed?

speaker: KIRK
words: Well, first I read the sign and then I tried the door in case it was some sort of elaborate ruse.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Designed to keep only you out?

speaker: KIRK
words: There's precedent.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Luke's gone fishing. I think that's great.

speaker: RORY
words: It is?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. He works hard, he needed a break, he took it. I think it's good, healthy.

speaker: KIRK
words: For who? I have blood sugar issues.

speaker: RORY
words: Mom -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t.

speaker: RORY
words: It's because -.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it isn't.

speaker: RORY
words: But he never --.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, now he did.

speaker: RORY
words: But --.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, he took a trip. Don't read anything into it.

speaker: RORY
words: It's because of the other night.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it isn't. And even if it is, it'll go away. Everything’ll be fine.

speaker: KIRK
words: Speak for yourself. I left my wallet in there yesterday.
[opening credits]
CUT TO THE HUNGRY DINER
[Lorelai and Rory are in another restaurant, standing near the door]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why are we standing here?

speaker: RORY
words: Because the sign says ‘wait to be seated’.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, but we’re not automatons, we are rule breakers, and there are like fifty open tables.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re exaggerating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: One, two, three, four, fifty – no I’m not.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sure someone will help us soon.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We should be eating, I’m hungry, this is crazy. Don’t they want us eating? Isn’t that what the point of The Hungry Diner is – to feed the hungry diner? Or is the point of The Hungry Diner to keep the hungry diner hungry, in which case they should call it The Eternally Hungry Diner ‘cause you’re not gonna get any food here, loser.

speaker: RORY
words: That would be quite a sign.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, I’m giving one of these paper-topped turkey heads three seconds to seat us or I swear, I’m gonna start to just – .

speaker: WAITRESS
words: [walks up to them] Two?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, please.
[they follow the waitress toward a table]

speaker: RORY
words: You’re gonna what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: Well, you said you were gonna do something if somebody didn’t help us in three seconds.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I did?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, you did, and then the waitress came over and you never finished saying what you were gonna do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, we gotta get some food into you, you’re imagining things.

speaker: RORY
words: What were you gonna do?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Shh! You’re getting screwy!

speaker: RORY
words: Mom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom? I’m not your mom. Do you need help little girl?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: How’s this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s, uh, perfect, thanks.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Can I bring you some coffee to start?

speaker: LORELAI
words: To start and finish.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Need a little pick me up?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do I!

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Back in a jif! [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, when she comes back, we’re gonna grab her and hold her down and you tell her really ugly things about the world.

speaker: RORY
words: Why don’t you get your daughter to help you out with your evil plan?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, now, make nice. [opens menu] Oh, how convenient. They have pictures of all the food in case you’ve been living in a cave for the last fifty years and you have no idea what a stack of pancakes looks like.
[waitress brings them their coffee]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, excuse me, I’m sorry.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: Yes, Sweetie?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are the tiny cups for?

speaker: WAITRESS
words: They’re coffee cups, they’re for coffee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, are you running out or something?

speaker: WAITRESS
words: I’m sorry?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Never mind. Listen, we are very sleepy this morning, so would you happen to have something in a larger size, say a mug, a tureen, a small bowl of some kind?

speaker: WAITRESS
words: A coffee bowl?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, a coffee bowl.

speaker: RORY
words: Bring two, please.

speaker: WAITRESS
words: We don’t have coffee bowls, I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, then would you mind bringing. . .what do you think – two, three?

speaker: RORY
words: Three’s good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, three of these cute little cuppy things? Oh, and could you leave the pot in the meantime?
[waitress walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, looks like coffee, smells like coffee. . .

speaker: RORY
words: [takes a sip and makes a face] The comparison stops there!

speaker: LORELAI
words: This sucks.

speaker: RORY
words: Just put a lot of stuff in there so you can’t taste it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How am I gonna fit my three sugars into Barbie’s Malibu dream cup here? It’ll be all sugar and no coffee.

speaker: RORY
words: You may prefer it that way.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Man. [glances over and sees Michel at another table] Well, well, well.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ll be right back. [walks over to Michel, who is reading a magazine] So, what’s new for Fall? I hear the sailor suit is hot, hot, hot.

speaker: MICHEL
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Luke’s is closed this morning.

speaker: MICHEL
words: By the health inspector, no doubt.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So. . . this is where you have your breakfast, huh?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Until this morning, yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How’s the grub?

speaker: MICHEL
words: They make an excellent egg white omelet, no oil.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really?

speaker: MICHEL
words: They use the spray. Can you leave now?

speaker: LORELAI
words: How come you never told me about this place?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Because then you might actually eat here and there would be no corner of my life which would be free of your incessant scrutiny. What are you doing with the fork?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can I have a bite?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Can you what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just a taste.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Get away from me. [stands up to leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, Michel, don’t go. Come eat with us.

speaker: MICHEL
words: You’d like that, wouldn’t you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, not really.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Good, it’s a date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You, me, here tomorrow?

speaker: MICHEL
words: Never. [leaves]
[Lorelai walks back to Rory and sits down]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, know what? I’m beginning to like this place.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m glad. Mom, I need to ask you a favor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ask away.

speaker: RORY
words: I need you to get me out of dinner tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Dean’s coming home and he doesn’t know about the accident and if I’m not there the second he gets home then someone else is gonna tell him about it and then that would be – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Horrible.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I agree.

speaker: RORY
words: I really hate to ask you this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, forget about it.

speaker: RORY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, absolutely. Make things right with Dean.

speaker: RORY
words: I really appreciate this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No problem. In fact, it gives me a little extra time to work on my ‘why Rory’s wearing a cast’ story for your grandparents.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah? What do you got so far?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really big bees.

speaker: RORY
words: Huh. Well, it’s good you’ve got the time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it is.
CUT TO FRIDAY NIGHT DINNER
[Lorelai and Emily are walking toward the living room]

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m so sorry Rory isn’t feeling well. Is it that flu that’s been going around?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yes, it is.

speaker: EMILY
words: Horrible strain. Bunny Carlington-Munchausen has been bedridden for two straight weeks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh. Well, it must wipe her out just toting that name around.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wonder if I should take a drink into Richard. I hate to disturb him while he’s working.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s working, like work working?

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s right. His articles of incorporation arrived last week. He’s rented an office. Your father is now the president and CEO of the Gilmore Group, an international insurance consulting firm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, that’s great. So, um, what’s the. . .like, how does. . . what’s his job?

speaker: EMILY
words: He’s a consultant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Meaning?

speaker: EMILY
words: Your father is an international insurance consultant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, yeah, but what exactly does that mean?

speaker: EMILY
words: He consults on matters relating to international insurance.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wait, wait – when Dad goes to his new office, he sits down and he. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: Consults with international clients on insurance matters.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know why we’re not opening for Rickles.

speaker: RICHARD
words: [from hallway] Dammit!

speaker: EMILY
words: Richard, are you all right?

speaker: RICHARD
words: [walks into the living room] No, I am not all right. That was Margie just now on the phone.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh, how is she?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Who is she?

speaker: EMILY
words: You know very well who Margie is. She’s been your father’s secretary since you were a child.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Largie Margie. . .very clever when you’re six.

speaker: RICHARD
words: In answer to your question Emily, Margie is well. So well, in fact, that she has decided not to join me in my new business.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: RICHARD
words: She’s staying with the old firm.

speaker: EMILY
words: But how could she? You were the only reason she even had a job at that firm.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I went to great pains to remind her of just that.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, this is simply unacceptable. You and that rotund ingrate had an agreement.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There was an agreement, in writing?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, not in writing per se, but she helped me procure my new office, she arranged to have all my things sent over, all that was left was for her to accept my formal offer, a very generous one, if I may say so.

speaker: EMILY
words: And she just turned you down?

speaker: RICHARD
words: She had the gall to counteroffer. She kept insisting that I match her current salary.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, Dad, you weren’t even offering to match the poor woman’s salary?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, Lorelai, the Gilmore Group is a fledgling enterprise. I can’t afford to pay Margie her full salary right away.

speaker: EMILY
words: But after twenty years, where is the woman’s sense of loyalty?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, gee, I don’t know. . .maybe with the company that’s keeping her from having to stand in line for government cheese.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m afraid, at this point, I don’t know how to proceed.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, of course you don’t.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I had counted on this.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course you had.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Perhaps I should reconsider going forward.

speaker: EMILY
words: That may be best.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can’t very well do it without Margie.

speaker: EMILY
words: No one would expect you to.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Guys, you can’t be serious.

speaker: EMILY
words: I wonder if it’s too late to get out of my lease.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: EMILY
words: You should look into that immediately, Richard.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Whoa, whoa, whoa! There is a baby here desperately in need of some bath water.

speaker: RICHARD
words: What is she saying Emily?

speaker: EMILY
words: What are you saying Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m just saying there are other options to consider.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Like what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like hire another secretary.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh no. Your father’s had other secretaries.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Three in fact, each one worse than the previous one.

speaker: EMILY
words: Until Margie.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Margie was a gem.

speaker: EMILY
words: Margie did everything for him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, but Dad, there are plenty of other Margie’s out there dying to be in that kind of codependent relationship with you. You will find one, trust me. Now she might not be named Margie but if you pay her enough you can probably call her whatever you want.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t have time to find someone new. The office is a disaster. Everything is in boxes. I don’t know where anything is or how anything works. . . the computers, the phones, even my office chair.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, Dad, I’ll tell you what. Tomorrow afternoon after my business class, I will come to your office and we’ll get you unpacked, we’ll get you settled, and we’ll find you someone as good as Margie, or at least cheaper.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I hate to see you waste your time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I’ll blindfold you then.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I don’t know, I – .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, there’s another Margie out there, honest. Just give it a chance.

speaker: RICHARD
words: An office without Margie. . .

speaker: EMILY
words: Seems inconceivable.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dream with me here folks.
CUT TO DEAN’S HOUSE
[Rory is sitting on the porch as Dean and his dad pull up in an SUV]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: DEAN’S DAD
words: Hi Rory. [goes into the house]

speaker: DEAN
words: What happened? What’d you do to your arm?

speaker: RORY
words: [hands him an envelope] Here.

speaker: DEAN
words: What is this?

speaker: RORY
words: Just read it.

speaker: DEAN
words: What – Rory, what’s going on? Tell me how you hurt your arm.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s all in the letter.

speaker: DEAN
words: But – .

speaker: RORY
words: Read.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh. . .[starts reading] Well, I love you, too.

speaker: RORY
words: Good – now just hold onto that feeling for a minute.

speaker: DEAN
words: Why?

speaker: RORY
words: Just – .

speaker: DEAN
words: Read, all right, I’m reading. [reads some more] What?

speaker: RORY
words: Keep going.

speaker: DEAN
words: [reads some more] What?

speaker: RORY
words: Turn it over.

speaker: DEAN
words: [reads some more] What!

speaker: RORY
words: Go on, you have like three more whats ahead of you.
[Dean kicks his duffel bag and reads some more]

speaker: RORY
words: It gets better at the end. I’ll just stand here until you get there.

speaker: DEAN
words: [reads some more] Is he really gone?

speaker: RORY
words: Yes.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay. You wanna come in?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: DEAN
words: You can stay for dinner, my mom’s making a roast. You like roast, right?

speaker: RORY
words: Um, yeah, I like roast.

speaker: DEAN
words: Okay, come on.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Later that night, Lorelai and Rory are sitting at the kitchen table. Lorelai is covering Rory’s cast with a plastic bag]

speaker: RORY
words: And then we just watched TV.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you mean you ‘watched TV.’ Use the air quotes, Sweetie.

speaker: RORY
words: His little sister was there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so you watched TV. . .go on.

speaker: RORY
words: And then he walked me home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s it?

speaker: RORY
words: That’s it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Did he kiss you goodnight?

speaker: RORY
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But he didn’t ask about the other night at all?

speaker: RORY
words: Nope.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Didn’t ask about the car?

speaker: RORY
words: Not once.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: He just asked if he was really gone and that was it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought he would yell and scream. I though he would wanna break up – instead, he gave me his corn.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He did? When?

speaker: RORY
words: At dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, so you were already eating. It wasn’t just an out of the blue, ‘And I give you my corn.’ Okay, got it.

speaker: RORY
words: Maybe it just hasn’t sunk in yet, maybe he’ll be mad tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe Dean is even more terrific than we thought he was.

speaker: RORY
words: It’s not covering the whole cast.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Relax, I’m not done. [gets a box of Saran wrap]

speaker: RORY
words: Do you really think he’s okay with it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sounds like it.

speaker: RORY
words: If the situation were reversed, I don’t think I’d be okay with it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: If the situation was reversed, I don’t think Dean would’ve let Jess drive his car.

speaker: RORY
words: I guess I should just be grateful then?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Grateful, absolutely.

speaker: RORY
words: [points to a stack of papers] What are these?

speaker: LORELAI
words: These are resumes for your Grandpa’s new secretary.

speaker: RORY
words: There are like a hundred of them.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, well, the world is full of eager young people just waiting to have the life sucked out of them by Richard Gilmore. Okay, I’m finished – what do you think of that?

speaker: RORY
words: If we were gazelles, we’d be the first ones eaten at the watering hole.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, be thankful we’re not gazelles. Now go take your shower. You’re starting to look like you’re starring in an independent film.
[Rory starts to leave the kitchen]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dean knows ya, hon. He knows you wouldn’t do anything to hurt him, he gets it. So, you’re lucky, just focus on that. Jess is gone, now you guys can start over.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And, uh, hey, even though the box says it’s safe, I want you to keep your arm out of the microwave for at least a week.
CUT TO RICHARD’S OFFICE
[Lorelai walks into an office crowded with boxes]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, come in, come in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, let me guess, the Wu Tang Clan had the office before you?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yeah, it’s a bit disheveled, I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, it’s freezing in here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, yes, it has been since I moved in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, did you try adjusting the thermostat?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, that only seemed to make it angry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’ve been just Nanooking it this whole time, just sending out for whale blubber and mukluks? [adjusts thermostat]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I wouldn’t touch that if I were you, Lorelai. You don’t know what you’re do– .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, the wind done gone.

speaker: RICHARD
words: So it would seem, for the moment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, no, I turned it off. Here, let me show you. [the phone rings] Do you wanna get that?

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, no, they’ve already hung up.
[phone stops ringing]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, next time hold an envelope up to your head before you do that.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, it’s been doing it all day. The phone rings once, and then poof, they’re gone.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [walks over to the phone] Oh, that’s because your messages are being forwarded to your voice mail. See where it says voice mail.

speaker: RICHARD
words: How could that happen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, where’s your manual?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, manual. . manual. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, came with the phone, probably has a picture of a phone on it. Aha, look what I found under your copper ball glued to the wood thing here.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, it’s brass. One of the firm’s parting gifts as they nudged me into retirement.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, in addition to being heavy and ugly, it’s also insulting.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Quite.

speaker: LORELAI
words: There you go, that should work. You wanna call me from your office?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, this is my office.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, whose office is that? [points toward an adjoining room]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, yes, excellent idea. [walks toward the other office as the phone rings] That isn’t me calling.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Didn’t think so. Should I get that?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [answers phone] Um, hello, the Gilmore Group. Mr. Hensen. . . why, yes, he...

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ooh! [gestures that he doesn’t want to talk]

speaker: LORELAI
words: ...just walked out. May I take a message? Uh huh. . . [looks through the drawers for a pen] Um, how are you spelling, uh, Larry? [Richard hands her a pen] Oh, traditionally, great. Okay, uh, thank you for calling. . .bye bye. [hangs up] Where the hell are your pens?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, watch your language, young lady. What did Larry want?

speaker: LORELAI
words: He wanted to know where the hell your pens are.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: He just wants you to call him, Dad. Where are all the office supplies?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I haven’t gotten around to that yet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Before anything else can happen, you need pens, you need paper, you need. . . everything else, don’t you? Especially since I might be tempted to wash my hand at some point.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, where does one get these things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Dad, where did you used to get ‘em?

speaker: RICHARD
words: From Margie.

speaker: LORELAI
words: From Margie. . .I saw that coming. All right, well, let’s go.
CUT TO OFFICE SUPPLY STORE
[Lorelai pushes a cart down an aisle as Richard follows behind her]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good Lord, this place goes on forever.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, it goes on until chair mats and floor mats but if you’re not careful, you’ll loop back around into inks and toners and be here all day. Stay close. Hey, there’s a seat in the cart if you want a ride.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’ll pass. Look at the scale of this place. I mean, no one needs all these options, it’s oppressive. Hundreds of paper clips in every conceivable color and size. Now, who on Earth would buy these things?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We would. [puts them in the cart] All right, now, what’s the first thing you do when you get to the office in the morning?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, well, let’s see, I return the calls from Asia first.
[walk over to a row of coffee makers]

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s right, you make coffee, so you’ll need a coffee maker. Let’s see. Ugly, crappy, German, ooh - pretty!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, well, as long as it’s pretty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Why is everything worth having just out of reach?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Is there no one here whose job it is to actually assist paying customers?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, that’s how they can afford to sell this baby for forty percent off.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Forty percent off, I had no idea. [grabs the box from the top shelf and puts it in the cart]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Nicely done, Dad. You won’t be sorry.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You know, it’s suddenly becoming clear to me that I’m an old man. I don’t recognize half the whats-its and dodads in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, Dad, here we have an assortment of magic sticks and when you press down on paper, writing comes out.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know what pens are, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good, you pick out your favorites and I’ll try to figure out how to explain Liquid Paper to you.
[Richard picks up a couple of pens]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, you’re cute.
[Lorelai picks up several boxes of pens]

speaker: RICHARD
words: I can’t possibly use all of those.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You won’t. You’ll lose half of them, then you’ll be really happy to have the ones you have left. Now, paper.

speaker: RICHARD
words: All right. This oughta do nicely for now. [picks out a small package of paper]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What, are you going into business for two weeks? You are building an empire for crying out loud. Think big, Gilmore! Plus, if you get the box, it’s cheaper. [puts huge box of paper into the cart]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Say, how do you happen to know all of this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s how we do it at the inn. You have to spend money to make money, my friend. It’s a little tip from me to you.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Good point. What else?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’d strongly recommend a stapler.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Stapler.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Some extra staples.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, I’m way ahead of you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good man. Post-Its.

speaker: RICHARD
words: My goodness, look at all the Post-Its. I had no idea they came in so many shapes and colors. I’m gonna get a twelve pack for myself in various hues.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wise move.

speaker: RICHARD
words: And one for Emily. I have seen her post notes on her vanity mirror to remind her of various activities.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, she’ll think it’s Christmas.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Done. Now, what else is on the hit parade?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, it might be controversial, but I was thinking of something in the way of a three-hole punch if we can find one.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I think we’re both up to the challenge. Shall we?
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Rory and Lane are walking down the street.]

speaker: LANE
words: Dawn Powell? I’ve never heard of her.

speaker: RORY
words: Nobody has, which is a shame because she wrote sixteen amazing novels, nine plays, and there are some who actually claim that it was Powell who made the jokes that Dorothy Parker got credit for.

speaker: LANE
words: Blasphemy.

speaker: RORY
words: I know. I’m trying not to hold it against Dawn though, until I have proof that she was involved with the whole smear campaign.
[they walk past an empty shop]

speaker: LANE
words: Hey, look! They finally took the boards off the windows.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, I wonder what it’s going to be.

speaker: LANE
words: I don’t know.
[they look through a window]

speaker: RORY
words: What’s that in the corner?

speaker: LANE
words: I think it’s. . .a bass. It’s a bass! And look, there are guitars on the wall! Oh my God, it’s a music shop!

speaker: RORY
words: Wow, that is much better than the ceramic circus store we thought was going in there.

speaker: LANE
words: I can’t believe it. Stars Hollow has taken its first steps toward being cool. I wonder how soon it’s going to open.

speaker: RORY
words: If you keep pushing on the glass like that, much sooner than anticipated. Hey, hold on a sec?

speaker: LANE
words: Why, what’s wrong?

speaker: RORY
words: Nothing, I’ll be right back. [walks across the street to Taylor] Taylor?

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Rory, hello!

speaker: RORY
words: Hi. Listen, I just wanted to – .

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh no, just look at that arm!

speaker: RORY
words: It’s fine, really.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Does it hurt?

speaker: RORY
words: No, not much.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Well, I hope you’re not getting addicted to painkillers like those Hollywood people do.

speaker: RORY
words: Um, I’m not, don’t worry.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Good, because pain is your body’s way of saying ‘I’m not okay now, but I will be soon.’

speaker: RORY
words: I will remember that.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: You don’t wanna shut your body up too soon. That’s called death.

speaker: RORY
words: Right. Um, Taylor, listen, I just wanted to apologize to you.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: About what?

speaker: RORY
words: About the other night. You know, my car hit the bench that had your brand new Doose’s Market sign on it and I know how much that sign meant to you and I’m just so, so sorry that it was ruined.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Oh, well, it wasn’t your fault.

speaker: RORY
words: But my car hit the bench.

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Your car hit the bench because that Jess was driving.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, well, yeah, but – .

speaker: TAYLOR
words: That boy is a walking natural disaster, they should name a tornado after him.

speaker: RORY
words: But he didn’t cause it Taylor, there was –

speaker: TAYLOR
words: Rory, you don’t have to explain a thing to me. I know that there is absolutely no way that you would be involved in something like that if it weren’t for that Sal Mineo wannabe, believe me. Chachi, and Chachi alone, will be held responsible for that incident, okay? Good. Now take a peach.

speaker: RORY
words: Thanks.
[Taylor walks away as Lane walks over]

speaker: LANE
words: So, is he mad?

speaker: RORY
words: No, not at me.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, that’s good.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, that’s good.
CUT TO SOPHIE’S MUSIC
[Lane walks into the new music store. Kirk is standing at the counter talking to the owner]

speaker: KIRK
words: That’s my home phone number, my pager number, my cell number, and there’s a partial list of references.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Yeah, okay, I’ll hang onto this, but as I said before, we just opened, so I’m not really looking to hire anybody right now.

speaker: KIRK
words: I am licensed to carry a gun, if that’ll help.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: You have no idea how much.
[Lane walks over to a wall of guitars and starts to touch one]

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Can I help you?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, no thank you. I was just looking.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: We like the looking, it’s the touching we’re a little iffy on.

speaker: LANE
words: Actually, I was just going. . .[almost bumps into a cello] That probably would’ve been construed as touching, huh?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Yes.

speaker: LANE
words: Right. [stops to look at a drum set] Oh my.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: That’s a DW drum set with Zildjian cymbals.

speaker: LANE
words: It’s beautiful

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Do you play?

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, no. I wish.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Sit.

speaker: LANE
words: What?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Sit down, see how it feels.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, I couldn’t.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Why, your legs don’t bend?

speaker: LANE
words: No, they bend.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Okay, if they bend then bend them.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, okay. [sits down] This is a good stool.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Yes, it is. Here, you can’t sit down at a drum set without your sticks.

speaker: LANE
words: Right – ‘cause that would be stupid.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: And remember – no touching.

speaker: LANE
words: Right. [pretends to play the drums]

speaker: SOPHIE
words: You look good.

speaker: LANE
words: Thanks.
CUT TO RICHARD’S OFFICE
[Richard is on the phone while Lorelai stacks his bookshelves]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, granted the European insurance market still needs some restructuring but it’s growing at a remarkable rate. What am I basing it on? Well, Clive, surely you’ve seen the latest EuroStat. Yes, I’ve got it right in front of me. [whispers to Lorelai] EuroStat!
[Lorelai hands him a booklet]

speaker: RICHARD
words: Ah, yes, here it is. Let’s see. Uh, the highest contributions in absolute terms were reached in the United Kingdom, Germany, and the Netherlands. Uh huh. Well, yes, I would have to look up those specific coding and reference numbers. [Lorelai brings over some books for him] Uh huh, yes, I’ve got ‘em right here. Mm hmm. For the year, uh, 2001. . . uh, here they are. Uh, yes, are you interested in the Netherlands? I think that’s a market that’s gonna go through the roof.
[the phone rings in the other office, Lorelai goes to answer it]

speaker: LORELAI
words: 05, so. . . well, thank you, that’s great. Okay, bye bye. [hangs up] They’ll be here in twenty minutes.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I must say, I’m impressed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I’m no Margie.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, who needs here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Speaking of which. [hands him a stack of papers]

speaker: RICHARD
words: What’s all this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: The secretarial candidates for tomorrow’s interviews. I’ve looked through them pretty carefully, and I think somewhere in there is a Margie for the new millennium.
[phone rings]

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’ll get it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, get to know your new secretary, I don’t mind. [answers phone] Gilmore Group, may I help you?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, Richard Gilmore, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [in high voice] Oh, um, uh, certainly, may I ask who’s calling?

speaker: EMILY
words: Emily Gilmore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And does he know what this is about?

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I hope so, I’m his wife.

speaker: LORELAI
words: [giggles] Oh, but Richard didn’t say anything about being married.

speaker: EMILY
words: What!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, relax, it’s me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, you’re crude and unprofessional.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, I’d like that on my tombstone, please. Now what can I do for you?

speaker: EMILY
words: I’m throwing a little cocktail party at the office on Friday to help launch the new business. Now, the caterers will be arriving at three o’clock sharp to set up, so – are you writing this down? You should be writing this down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m scribbling furiously.

speaker: EMILY
words: Margie always wrote everything down.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So does this mean no Friday night dinner?

speaker: EMILY
words: It means we’ll see you both at the party.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bye.
CUT TO LORELAI’S FRONT YARD
[Rory walks across the yard as Babette rushes over to her]

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh! Rory, Sweetie, hold on there, baby!

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Babette. Is everything okay?

speaker: BABETTE
words: I should be asking you that question. Come here, let me see that arm. Oh, you poor little thing. How you doing, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m doing fine.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Aw, look at ya, being brave like that after all you’ve been through. Geez, it’s so hard being a woman, isn’t it?

speaker: RORY
words: I guess.

speaker: BABETTE
words: I mean, you’ve got your morals and your standards and your good common sense and then bam! You meet some guy and all that goes right out the window.

speaker: RORY
words: But – .

speaker: BABETTE
words: For every good woman there’s a dirty little wolf just ready to lead her astray. You can’t help it, he’s got the eyes, the chin, the chest hair you could carpet your dining room with. . .I mean, what’s a woman to do? We’re not made of steel for God’s sake.

speaker: RORY
words: Babette –

speaker: BABETTE
words: I was in a cult once, did I tell you that?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: BABETTE
words: I met this guy once – gorgeous, tan, looked just like Mickey Holiday. We had coffee, he gave me a pamphlet. Next thing you know, I’m wearing a muumuu, playing a tambourine, jumping up and down at the airport.

speaker: RORY
words: Okay, I really have to get inside.

speaker: BABETTE
words: Oh, sure, honey, sure, you go take good care of yourself. And don’t be embarrassed tutz, this has happened to all of us.
CUT TO INSIDE LORELAI’S HOUSE
[Rory walks through the front door]

speaker: RORY
words: Mom, you here? [walks over to answering machine and plays a message]

speaker: LORELAI
words: [on answering machine] Hey you, it’s me. I’m gonna be home a little late today – still trying to find Grandpa a Margie. So order pizza, money’s under the rabbi, hope your arm’s feeling okay, Sweets. Buh-bye.
[Rory gets some from money under a rabbi doll on the desk, then walks to the kitchen and gets a soda from the refrigerator. The phone rings]

speaker: RORY
words: Hello?

speaker: LANE
words: I have found my calling.

speaker: RORY
words: What are you talking about?

speaker: LANE
words: I am talking about my future, my path, my destiny, my thing, my scene, my bag. I'm talking about the number one item on my cosmic to-do list.

speaker: RORY
words: Which is?

speaker: LANE
words: I'm gonna be a drummer!

speaker: RORY
words: You're kidding.

speaker: LANE
words: I went into that new music store today -- I don't know why I went in, I just had to. Something told me, ‘Lane Kim, there's something in there that you need to see’, and there it was, and it was red and shiny and I'm so excited I can't breathe.

speaker: RORY
words: That's amazing.

speaker: LANE
words: I know.

speaker: RORY
words: But how are you gonna do this?

speaker: LANE
words: I don't know.

speaker: RORY
words: How are you gonna buy a drum set?

speaker: LANE
words: I don't know.

speaker: RORY
words: And even if you do buy a drum set, where are you gonna play it?

speaker: LANE
words: I don't know, I don't know any of this. But I will figure something out, because I am Keith Moon, I am Neil Peart, I am Rick Allen, with and without the arm, because I am rock 'n' roll, baby! I'll call you later.
CUT TO RICHARD’S OFFICE
[Lorelai and Richard are interviewing a secretarial candidate]

speaker: KAREN
words: So when she opened her own office, she asked me to come along as her executive assistant and office manager, which was a terrific opportunity.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I bet! How so?

speaker: KAREN
words: In that I was able to build that office and its staff from the ground up and develop a system from scratch.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, so you have a system.

speaker: KAREN
words: Which helped double productivity and billing hours, but then she got pregnant, and well, here we are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, story of my life – literally.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, uh, thank you for coming in, uh. . .uh, Karen. Uh, we’ll let you know once we make our decision.

speaker: KAREN
words: Thank you, Mr. Gilmore. It was a pleasure meeting you both.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here, I’ll walk you out. I love what’s going on with your shoes, by the way. [walks Karen out, then returns with a bag] Hey, look what I found.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, good, lunch, I’m starving. Uh, do you wanna eat in here today?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sure, why not?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, good, they threw in pickles like I asked. It’s great having this place just across the street, isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’ll never starve.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Hm, maybe we should start a tab with them so we don’t have to pay cash everyday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Already done.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Amazing. You’re like the tiny fellow on that Mash program, always anticipating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, what do we think?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm, that’s tasty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I mean about Karen.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Who?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Karen, the woman who was just here, the one with the system.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm, rather inexperienced, I thought.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, she worked as an executive assistant for six years.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she’s young, and young women tend to be flighty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She worked for the same woman for five of those six years.

speaker: RICHARD
words: This roast beef is delicious. It’s lean, it’s tender. What’d you get?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Cheeseburger.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm, I may get one of those myself if we order from the same place tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tomorrow?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mm hmm.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You mean for more secretary interviews?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, whatever’s on the agenda.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, you’ve already seen like three people who would be absolutely perfect for the job.

speaker: RICHARD
words: You can’t rush these things, Lorelai. A man’s secretary sets the tone for the entire enterprise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know that, but –

speaker: RICHARD
words: It has to do with chemistry as much as anything else, which cannot be manufactured out of sheer necessity. Besides, you and I seem to be doing just fine for the moment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, for the moment, but the moment is coming to a rapid end.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, what do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I can’t work here ‘cause I have my own job.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know that, Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And I need you to find an assistant soon, like now because I don’t even know when I’m gonna be able to come back.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, I need to see more resumes. In the meantime, –

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, I cannot come back here tomorrow.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I see.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t mean that to sound so harsh. I just. . .I meant –

speaker: RICHARD
words: I know exactly what you meant to say, Lorelai. I got the message. Well, I won’t keep you any longer, I know how busy you are.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, I didn’t mean I have to go right now. We can finish our lunch.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, I’m finished. Will you leave the phone number of the sandwich shop for me, please? I’ll need it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All the numbers you need are right there on your desk.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Oh, good. Now, if you will excuse me, I have some of my own work to attend to. Thank you for all your help.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, Dad, if it makes any difference, I thought that Karen was –

speaker: RICHARD
words: Thank you.
CUT TO STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai gets some food from a takeout window]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Here.

speaker: RORY
words: You know, there will be food there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Finger food, aka snooty little balls of attitude.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh boy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I need real food, peasant food. Hearty bread, meat, cheese, a little pickle chips, a sauce, a special sauce. This is the food that sustains me, this is the food of my –

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God, just eat the burger already!

speaker: LORELAI
words: How crabby.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m not crabby.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I didn’t even get through my special sauce speech. That’s crabby.

speaker: RORY
words: Sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does your arm hurt?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I’m just tired, I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right. We won’t stay very long. Just long enough to get five or six withering stares from my dad, and be taken down three or four notches by my mother, then we’re outta there. [takes a bite of her burger] Ugh.

speaker: RORY
words: Not good?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really not good! I swear, Luke better come back soon or I’m gonna starve to death.

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: For what?

speaker: RORY
words: Luke’s gone because of me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, honey, he is not.

speaker: RORY
words: Yes, he is. I got into an accident and then you guys had a fight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, it isn’t your fault. If it’s anyone’s fault. . .

speaker: RORY
words: It’s Jess’ fault.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Why does everyone in this town think that it is all Jess’ fault?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, let’s not talk about this, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: I was there too, you know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory, everyone here loves you. They know you’re not the ‘get in an accident and knock over a bench’ girl.

speaker: RORY
words: I know that, and I appreciate that, but –

speaker: LORELAI
words: I want you to stop beating yourself up about this. It’s over, Jess is gone. Let’s forget about this, okay, please?

speaker: RORY
words: Fine.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. Hey, hand me that burger again.

speaker: RORY
words: I thought you said it was bad.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, that burger may be a disgusting burger but at least it considers me its equal. Ugh.
CUT TO RICHARD’S OFFICE
[Lorelai and Rory walk into the crowded office]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh geez. This is worse than the clowns in the Volkswagen.

speaker: RORY
words: A lot of people.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, do you want something to drink? I think we’re three martinis behind everyone else.

speaker: RORY
words: Just water, I guess.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Coming up. [walks toward the drinks] Oh boy, I should’ve brought bread crumbs. Excuse me.

speaker: EMILY
words: Lorelai, there you are. You’re late.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you scheduled this beer bash during rush hour.

speaker: EMILY
words: When traffic is leaving Hartford.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Apparently not when Emily Gilmore is throwing a party.

speaker: EMILY
words: It’s wonderful, isn’t it? Everyone showing up for your father.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, Mom, but don’t you ever think about scaling back a little?

speaker: EMILY
words: I scaled back a lot. I cut two appetizers, I canceled the champagne fountain, and I reduced the catering staff to six servers, not counting the pointman.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, you can’t not have a pointman ‘cause then what’s the point?

speaker: EMILY
words: If you make it look cheap, people will think you’re unsuccessful.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely right. Better to deprive them of oxygen so they don’t have to think at all.

speaker: EMILY
words: It is rather warm in here, isn’t it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, do you want me to get the air going?

speaker: EMILY
words: No, no, Karen knows how to do it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Karen?

speaker: EMILY
words: Your father’s new secretary. She’s wonderful, very professional. [walks over to Karen] Karen, darling, would you mind turning on the air conditioning?
[pan over to Richard and a man talking]

speaker: RICHARD
words: No, I’ll have Karen draw up the contracts today. That’ll be in the morning.
[The man walks away, Lorelai walks over]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi Dad.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Swell party.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, yes, it’s mostly your mother’s doing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So, um, what just went down there?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Down where?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just now, the handshake with the man in the gray flannel suit – did you score a deal?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, one doesn’t score deals in the insurance business, Lorelai. One builds relationships based on trust and fulfilling the client’s needs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sorry.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Mr. Lundquist and I, uh, just were -

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, Mr. Lundquist?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Lundquist from Aero International?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You bagged the Swede?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, just as I didn’t score the deal, I also haven’t bagged the Swede. We simply talked, we came to an agreement, we shook hands.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You shook hands, that means –

speaker: RICHARD
words: I’m sending him the contracts in the morning.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Dad, that’s big!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Yes, I suppose it is big.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s gigantic! It’s a whole new market for you. It opens up all of Scandinavia, doesn’t it?

speaker: RICHARD
words: Beyond that. Lundquist is his company’s rep for Russia as well.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Russia!

speaker: RICHARD
words: Da!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Look who’s taking over the world.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I suppose that would be me.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I see that you hired Karen.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Uh, yes, well, I had to get someone in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: She seems to be working out well.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, she’s no. . .Margie, but we’ll see. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have several more deals to score now that I have finished bagging the Swede.
[Richard walks away and Emily walks over]

speaker: LORELAI
words: He’s really in his element, isn’t it?

speaker: EMILY
words: And happier than he’s been in years. Oh, there’s Rory. I was wondering where she’s – what’s that on her arm?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, I was gonna tell you about that.

speaker: RORY
words: Hi Grandma.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That is a cast. She hurt her arm.

speaker: EMILY
words: When? How bad is it?

speaker: RORY
words: I fractured my wrist.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s just a hairline fracture. . .it’s just tiny.

speaker: EMILY
words: When did this happen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, last week.

speaker: EMILY
words: Last week? Why didn’t you call me? Last week, I can’t believe you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, well, I meant to.

speaker: EMILY
words: How did this happen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bees.

speaker: RORY
words: I got in a car accident.

speaker: EMILY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I got in a car accident.

speaker: EMILY
words: Oh my God, how could you not tell us that she got into a car accident? Is this why she missed dinner? You said she had the flu.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just didn’t want you to worry, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, well, clearly there was nothing to worry about. It was that car, wasn’t it? The one her boyfriend made. Richard was dead set against letting her drive that death mobile.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, it wasn’t the car, Mom.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, then what was it?

speaker: RORY
words: A friend of mine and I went to get ice cream

speaker: EMILY
words: A friend? Which friend – Lane?

speaker: RORY
words: Jess.

speaker: EMILY
words: Jess?

speaker: RORY
words: Luke’s nephew.

speaker: EMILY
words: Him? I thought you were going to keep that boy away from her.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, do we have to talk about this now?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, we have to talk about this now. The child has a cast on her arm. I don’t understand how you could’ve been so irresponsible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mom, please.

speaker: EMILY
words: Don’t ‘Mom, please’ me. It was your responsibility to stop this, it was your responsibility to make sure that he did not –

speaker: RORY
words: I gave him the keys. I told him to drive. He wanted to drive back to Luke’s and I said no. I wanted to keep on driving and that’s when we got into the car accident. This is just as much my fault as it is his, maybe more.

speaker: EMILY
words: Rory.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’ve got this, Mom. Can I see you in the hall for a second? [they walk into the hallway] Hey, what the hell was that?

speaker: RORY
words: I’m sick of this. I’m sick of everyone treating me like I’m some kind of mindless idiot being led around by a guy.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No one is treating you like that.

speaker: RORY
words: Everyone is, the whole town is. . . Taylor, Babette, Dean. Everyone in my life, including you, is refusing to believe that I was just as responsible for what happened that night as Jess was.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? Were you driving the car?

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Then you weren’t as responsible.

speaker: RORY
words: What if it’d been Dean, huh? What if Dean had been driving? Would everyone be assuming that it was his fault?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, because if Dean had been driving there wouldn’t have been an accident because Dean is a much more responsible kid who loves you and would’ve been driving more responsibly.

speaker: RORY
words: How do you know that Jess wasn’t?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hi. . .it’s Jess.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, right, Jess is the antichrist, I forgot. He wanted to get into an accident. He was looking for something to hit because he’s a murderer with a death wish and he wanted to kill us both, right?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know you think that Jess is your friend, but he’s not. He is a completely out of control, really angry kid who has no respect for Luke, who has no respect for me. . .

speaker: RORY
words: It was an accident!

speaker: LORELAI
words: And he was driving!

speaker: RORY
words: So, what, no matter what I say, you’re just gonna choose to blame Jess?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, I choose to blame Jess.

speaker: RORY
words: Just because you hate him?

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s right! I’m sorry, but when my daughter comes home broken I get to hate the guy who broke her. That’s how it works. He’s gone, I win. You are wearing a cast and I get to hate him forever!

speaker: RORY
words: Fine!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Fine!

speaker: RORY
words: Fine!

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just had this image of thirty-five businessmen, six servers, one pointman all leaning up against that wall with glasses to their ears.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t think they needed the glasses.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We’ve got good lungs, you and I.

speaker: RORY
words: We’re never gonna agree on this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have to understand -

speaker: RORY
words: I do.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t wanna fight about this anymore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Neither do I. Do you wanna go back inside?

speaker: RORY
words: No, I wanna go home. My wrist hurts and I’m grumpy and I just made a total idiot of myself in there so I just wanna go home.

speaker: LORELAI
words: All right, well, I’ll tell Mom, I’ll drive you.

speaker: RORY
words: No, it’s okay. It’s still early. I can catch my regular bus and. . .you go back in.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: I just want some alone time now.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Are you sure?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah, I’ll see you back at home.
CUT TO SOPHIE’S MUSIC
[Lane is staring at the drum set]

speaker: SOPHIE
words: It’s after six, we’re closed.

speaker: LANE
words: Five more minutes?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Nope, now.

speaker: LANE
words: So, you’re from New York, huh?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Yes, I am.

speaker: LANE
words: I wanna go to New York someday.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Good for you.

speaker: LANE
words: Did you like it there?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: It was all right.

speaker: LANE
words: What part of New York did you live in?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Okay, look, what’s your name?

speaker: LANE
words: Lane Kim.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Very nice to meet you, Lane Kim. Now you have got to get out of here because I am going to close and you are not going to schmooze me into forgetting that I am going to close.

speaker: LANE
words: Wait?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: What?

speaker: LANE
words: I have to have those drums.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Great – cash or credit?

speaker: LANE
words: No, see, I have no money. Plus, even if I did have money there’s no way I could take those home with me because my mother would never stop crying, so I have a proposal.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Uh huh.

speaker: LANE
words: Twice a week, on Wednesday and Friday nights at six o’clock, I could come and practice here.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Wow, that sounds great.

speaker: LANE
words: Now, I’m not expecting you to let me do this for free or anything. I’ll clean or do inventory or stock stuff or whatever it is that you need done.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: I don’t need that much done.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, then, I can do other things also, like, uh. . .oh, hey, do you know Korean?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: No.

speaker: LANE
words: Well, then I could teach you.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Why would I wanna learn Korean?

speaker: LANE
words: Why wouldn’t you? It’s an interesting language, and being bilingual in this day and age can only be a plus.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Please, go home.

speaker: LANE
words: I can’t. I can’t go home until you say yes. I have to rock, I have to! Please, I’m so begging you – let me rock!

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Why Wednesdays and Fridays?

speaker: LANE
words: Because that’s when my mom has her Bible group.

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Okay, let’s see what you got.

speaker: LANE
words: Really? Oh my God, thank you! [sits down at the drum set] Can I hit them this time?

speaker: SOPHIE
words: Go ahead.

speaker: LANE
words: Yes! A one, two, three, four! [starts to play]

speaker: SOPHIE
words: I’ll be in the back in case the cops come.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh, hey, do you mind turning off the lights on your way out? My mom sometimes walks home this way.
[Sophie turns out the lights, and Lane starts playing again]
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Rory walks down the street and sees Luke in front of the diner]

speaker: RORY
words: Hey

speaker: LUKE
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: You’re back?

speaker: LUKE
words: I’m back.

speaker: RORY
words: You catch anything?

speaker: LUKE
words: Nah. Apparently the fish went fishing also.

speaker: RORY
words: Too bad.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, well. So that’s the, uh. . .

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Does it hurt?

speaker: RORY
words: No, not really. Just itches a little.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, I can imagine. Make sure you don’t use a pencil.

speaker: RORY
words: Excuse me?

speaker: LUKE
words: Your arm. . . you know, when it itches. I broke my arm once – itching drove me crazy. Grabbed a pencil, shoved it down the cast to scratch, ya know...

speaker: RORY
words: Bad results?

speaker: LUKE
words: Bad results.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it. No pencils, I promise.

speaker: LUKE
words: Good. So, you want some coffee?

speaker: RORY
words: Sure.
[they walk into the diner]

speaker: LUKE
words: Where’s your mom tonight?

speaker: RORY
words: At a party for my Grandpa.

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, sounds nice. Grab yourself a donut.

speaker: RORY
words: So, have you heard from him?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, no. I talked to his mom, though. He got home okay.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, that’s good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah, good.

speaker: RORY
words: What about his stuff?

speaker: LUKE
words: Oh, I’m gonna send it.

speaker: RORY
words: Right, makes sense. Luke?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yeah?

speaker: RORY
words: It wasn’t his fault.

speaker: LUKE
words: I know it wasn’t.
THE END
OPEN IN STARS HOLLOW
[Lorelai and Rory are walking down the sidewalk]

speaker: RORY
words: Where is this place?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It’s not too far.

speaker: RORY
words: You've been saying that for miles.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It has not been miles.

speaker: RORY
words: My feet are sore.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, Tonto, when did you become older than me?

speaker: RORY
words: Just tell me what this new breakfast place is and then I'll be quiet.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's an amazing new mystery place that I found and that's all I'm telling ya.

speaker: RORY
words: Just tell me if it's in this town or the next.

speaker: LORELAI
words: We don't patronize the next town.

speaker: RORY
words: Since when?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, didn't they feed lead to our jumping frog or something?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah, right after they stoned the woman who won the lottery.

speaker: LORELAI
words: See, so the boycott’s legit.

speaker: LANE
words: [runs up behind them] Hey, wait, stop!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh look, it's Michael Landon.

speaker: LANE
words: Oh my God, you guys walk fast. I've been chasing you for the past two blocks.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey, we were being followed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I told you I wasn't just being paranoid. Maybe next time you’ll take me seriously when I tell you furniture moved itself.

speaker: LANE
words: Where are you guys going?

speaker: RORY
words: Mystery breakfast.

speaker: LANE
words: Out of town?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Does no one remember the definition of the word mystery?

speaker: LANE
words: Sorry, I was just wondering if it's okay to practice on your pots and pans again this morning?

speaker: LORELAI
words: It's not like they have any other use.

speaker: LANE
words: Thanks. I've almost nailed the fill in the Ramble On. I just have to stop hitting my face with the sticks when I pull my arms back.

speaker: RORY
words: John Bonham had that same problem.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Key’s in the turtle.

speaker: LANE
words: Enjoy your mystery breakfast. [walks away]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Come on, it's not much farther.

speaker: RORY
words: We're not heading toward any businesses of any kind. [Lorelai stops walking] What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: We have arrived.

speaker: RORY
words: Arrived where? [looks up] Aw, you are without shame.
CUT TO INSIDE SOOKIE’S HOUSE
[Lorelai and Rory are sitting at the table as Sookie serves them breakfast]

speaker: RORY
words: Sookie, you do not have to do this.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What do you mean? Feeding my girls, making them happy, I love doing this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, so feel the love and pass the salt.

speaker: RORY
words: It makes me feel guilty.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Eating can help drown that.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yeah, yeah, eat, eat. I'm gonna eat.

speaker: RORY
words: Gee, can the help sit at the table too?

speaker: LORELAI
words: As long as they don't sing folk songs or tell bawdy stories. Hey, what's with Narcoleptic Nate over there?
[Jackson, who is leaning against the counter with his eyes closed, moans]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He's not much of a morning person.
[Jackson moans]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now say, ‘I can't believe I ate the whole thing.’

speaker: SOOKIE
words: It takes him about an hour to become Jackson.
[Jackson moans]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ooh, hey, I had a good idea for the wedding.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Cool.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Instead of those little wrapped things with Jordan Almonds at every place setting, what if we wrap up a few aspirin?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Aspirin?

speaker: LORELAI
words: For the morning after hangovers.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That's funny.

speaker: LORELAI
words: ‘Cause Jordan Almonds are so done. Huh, Jackson what do you think – aspirin over almonds?
[Jackson moans.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Can we take that as a yes?

speaker: SOOKIE
