speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What time?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Seven thirty.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: That’s great. I’ll tell her.
CUT TO SOOKIE’S HOUSE
[The house is full of people for the rehearsal dinner. Kirk starts tapping on his glass]

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Ooh, ooh, a toast, everybody, a toast!

speaker: KIRK
words: Ladies, gentlemen, honored guests. Who owns the silver Volvo ‘cause you’re blocking me in?

speaker: MISS PATTY
words: Well, it’s better than the toast he made at the Ubromowitz wedding.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How long before I move the car?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, give it another ten minutes.

speaker: KIRK
words: Come on, I’ve gotta go. My mom is waiting. This isn’t funny!
[Jackson walks up to Sookie in the kitchen]

speaker: JACKSON
words: We need to talk.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What’s the matter?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Uh, the bedroom, please.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Honey, I’m melting chocolate here.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, the chocolate can wait. My father just took me aside and handed me this. [holds up a kilt]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He handed you a skirt?

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, it’s not a skirt, it’s a kilt.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh. Why did he hand this to you?

speaker: JACKSON
words: He gave this to me to wear on my wedding day.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: No.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Oh, yes. He wore it on his wedding day, my grandfather wore it on his wedding day. Apparently, there’s a long-standing tradition where the men in my family get very airy on the big day.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, honey, if it means that much to him.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Are you crazy?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, he’s your father.

speaker: JACKSON
words: You won’t let me wear shorts in public and you’re gonna let me get married in this?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, what’re you gonna do?

speaker: JACKSON
words: I’m gonna wear pants. If he doesn’t like it, he doesn’t have to come.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He has to come, he’s the best man.

speaker: JACKSON
words: Too bad! [walks away]

speaker: SOOKIE
words: [follows him] Jackson, come on. Shorts are different, they cut you funny!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay, that’s it, I need some air. Grab the bottle.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bossy. I like it.
CUT TO OUTSIDE
[Lorelai and Christopher walk out and sit on the front porch]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Wow. I hope the second act’s as good as the first one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, well, it’s a wedding. Things are supposed to be horrible.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: When Jackson came out holding that kilt – man, I felt for him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know, so did I.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Please, I saw what your face was doing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What? What was my face doing?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It was counting up how many Brigadoon references you could come up with to torture him with at a later date.

speaker: LORELAI
words: How dare you accuse my face of that! My face is calling Gloria Alred when we get home.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How many references?

speaker: LORELAI
words: None.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: How many?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Twelve, including a few bars of I’ll Go Home with Bonnie Jean.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I’m begging you, take plenty of pictures of this wedding because I have a feeling it’s gonna be a classic.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, if you’re gonna be in town for the day, you should just come with us and. . .thanks. . .see all the fireworks for yourself.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Okay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just like that, okay?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, if Sookie doesn’t mind.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What’s going on with you?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What do you mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I mean, mister ‘suddenly I’m everywhere’. How come you can just agree to come to the wedding?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Because I can.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t you have to check your appointment book?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s on a Sunday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Don’t you have to check with Sherry? Chris, what’s up?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Nothing. Sherry’s not in town.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And even if she was, I still don’t think she’d mind if I went.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Because she’s the coolest chick in the world?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Because things aren’t going too well for us lately.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, no.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: She had this big business trip planned and before she left, we had a talk.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yikes.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah. We tried to come up with some answers but we couldn’t think of anything, so she left and we said we’d take this time apart to think.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What have you been thinking?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: About finding an apartment.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow, um, that’s so weird. Last time I saw you two, you were. . .well, nauseating, actually.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Believe me, we made ourselves sick a few times.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know what to say.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: No, there’s nothing to say. It’s nobody’s fault. It just isn’t it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You okay?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah, I’m okay. Thanks.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, then, it’s decided. You’ll come with me to Sookie’s wedding and you’ll make sure I stop one or two Brigadoon-isms shy of Jackson taking me out with a bagpipe.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It would be my pleasure.
CUT TO LORELAI’S HOUSE
[The next morning, Rory is sitting in the living room as Lorelai walks down the stairs]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh my God, I’m so tired.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey Mom?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, angel?

speaker: RORY
words: Do you happen to know where the almonds I made for table five went?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: RORY
words: ‘Cause they were here last night before Sookie’s dinner.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Really? How odd?

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah. And this morning, I found some tulle on the staircase leading up to your bedroom.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hmm. Ghosts?

speaker: RORY
words: It took me six hours to make those almond bundles, Mother.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, see if you can beat that next time.

speaker: RORY
words: So you got home late from Sookie’s?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I stayed to help her clean up a little. Hey, guess what?

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know something you don’t know.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, just remember, it’s really wrong to gossip, unless it’s true or just way too good not to tell everyone you see, whether you know them or not.

speaker: RORY
words: Got it, what is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well – [phone rings] Aw, if that’s my conscience calling, tell it enough already, I heard it the first time.

speaker: RORY
words: [answers phone] Hello?

speaker: PARIS
words: How’s this sound for a template? I have done my best. I have lost. Mr. Nixon has won. The democratic process has worked its will, so now let's get on with the urgent task of uniting this country.

speaker: RORY
words: What is that?

speaker: PARIS
words: Hubert Humphrey’s concession speech. Now, other than the part about Nixon, parts of it really seem to apply here.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hey, I’m not going to steal it. I’ll paraphrase and I’ll give him credit.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris.

speaker: PARIS
words: Not that the person who actually wins will even know who Hubert Humphrey is, but hey, I bet they’ll organize one boffo senior ditch day.

speaker: RORY
words: Where are you?

speaker: PARIS
words: In the auditorium. I wanted to be here for one last meet and greet, get them right before they walk in the booth.

speaker: RORY
words: Leave that place right now.

speaker: PARIS
words: But – .

speaker: RORY
words: People will think that you’re insane and generally people are scared of the insane, so see where I’m going here?

speaker: PARIS
words: I’m going to lose.

speaker: RORY
words: You don’t know that.

speaker: PARIS
words: Yes, I do. Because even if I win, I only won because of you. Therefore, either way I lose.

speaker: RORY
words: Come on. Go get a cup of coffee, relax. You deserve this job, I swear. Put away the concession speech.

speaker: PARIS
words: Hubert Humphrey must not have been considered very fun either.

speaker: RORY
words: I’ll see you at school. [hangs up] God, she wants to win so badly, and me, not so badly. I feel terrible.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, come on. You know you wanna win so you can spend your whole summer in Washington far away from me.

speaker: RORY
words: Please, don’t even talk about Washington. It gives me a stomachache.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It might be wonderful.

speaker: RORY
words: Good, then you and I will go someday.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, look at you, trying to make Mommy feel like you don’t spend every night tunneling out of here with a spoon.

speaker: RORY
words: Get back to the gossip, please.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh yeah. Okay. So, guess who’s in the process of breaking up?

speaker: RORY
words: Brad and Jen?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Bite your tongue.

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sherry and your dad.

speaker: RORY
words: No.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes.

speaker: RORY
words: Dad told you that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Last night.

speaker: RORY
words: Wow. But they were so together.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know. Well, now they’re not.

speaker: RORY
words: Well, is he – oh, look at you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: You’re totally gloating.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not gloating.

speaker: RORY
words: Then why are you smiling?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not smiling. I had a little stroke.

speaker: RORY
words: Smiling.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, look, if he was all broken up about it then I would be sad, but he’s not, so ha ha.

speaker: RORY
words: Fourth rung of hell, party of one.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, at least my feet won’t get cold.
[Lorelai pulls something out of her pocket and puts it in her mouth]

speaker: RORY
words: Where’d you get that?

speaker: LORELAI
words: What?

speaker: RORY
words: That. The Jordan almond that you pulled out of your pajama top and ate – where did you get it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hm, Santa Claus.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN LOBBY
[Michel pulls on his coat and walks up to Lorelai near the front desk]

speaker: MICHEL
words: All right, the piano movers will be here at eight and the chairs will be set up at nine. All the rooms are made up and ready. I will be in at ten. Now I am going home unless you would like me to stay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Actually, I would, thanks.

speaker: MICHEL
words: No, I’m sorry, I think I said that wrong. I am going home now unless you would like me to stay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I would love you to stay, thanks for offering.

speaker: MICHEL
words: Okay, see, once again, my English not so good. One more time. I am going home now after working six hours longer than I usually work and performing tasks I despise and am ashamed of, and now I am going home to wash off the stench of this horrifying day, that is, unless, for some unknown Godforsaken reason, you need me to stay.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, actually – .

speaker: MICHEL
words: Goodbye. [leaves]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, can I grab my bag? I’m gonna go in the back and change.

speaker: EMPLOYEE
words: [hands her the bag] Sure.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Thank you.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Hey, I went with the sugared daffodils for the top tier. Let me tell you, they look great. Ooh, I’ve outdone myself this time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you still doing here?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I just wanted to double check everything for tomorrow. Don’t worry, I’m done, everything’s fine. I’m now going straight to bed.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Your last night as a single woman.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Yup.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You still look good.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I still feel good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just think of it. As of tomorrow, you can start wearing cold cream to bed and stop shaving your legs.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That’s right, ‘cause I already got me a man.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Go to sleep.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Okay, see you tomorrow?

speaker: LORELAI
words: See you tomorrow.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Later that night, Lorelai is decorating the lobby as Christopher walks down the steps.]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, look who’s got Martha Stewart locked in a basement. Did you do all this?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, I did. How’s it look?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It looks great.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Good. What are you doing up?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Couldn’t sleep. I sweet-talked the maid into leaving me about ten thousand pillow mints and then I proceeded to eat them all.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Serves you right. Oh God, I’m so exhausted.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Need some help?
[they sit down on the couch]

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m almost done. I got up and went back to work just now, didn’t I?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yes, you did.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good, ‘cause this is not the time to loaf. I’m so happy for Sookie. I mean, it’s like a real live love story, and I saw it all happen. I mean, I hired Jackson. I watched them meet. I watched them have several bizarrely intense arguments over mustard greens. I watched them fall in love. I got to see it all. It was a nice show. Hi.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hi.
[they kiss]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What was that?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I have no idea.
[they kiss again]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: One more time and maybe I’ll have an explanation.
[they kiss again]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, this is not happening.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I hope to God you’re wrong.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But it’s us. I mean, you and I, we. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Have never been in the same place at the same time.

speaker: LORELAI
words: But now. . . [they kiss] My head is spinning.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It’s all the plants in here, too much oxygen.

speaker: LORELAI
words: What do we do now?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You know, I’ve got a room upstairs.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You were that sure you’d get lucky?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I never dreamed I’d get this lucky.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Aw, that’s good.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So what do you say?
[They walk toward the staircase]
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Later that night, Lorelai walks down the stairs and into the kitchen. Sookie is working on her wedding cake while wearing her wedding dress and veil.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: What are you doing?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Daffodils. Am I insane? You can’t have daffodils on your wedding cake. What was I thinking?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop what you’re doing right now.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: There’s too much pink.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sweetie, there’s not too much pink.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Pink is for girls. Jackson’s not a girl. Jackson doesn’t like pink. I have all this pink, it’s like saying, ‘Hey, screw you. You want a say in this? Well, grow some ovaries.’

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey, whoa, honey, hey! Put the pastry bag down.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I can’t, I have to fix this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, down. Now step away from all things edible. Hey, what happened?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: When I left you, you were fine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know. And when I went home, I was fine. And when I went to bed, I was fine. And then I had this dream where suddenly my dress is really, really short in back, you know? So I bolt out of bed and I put my dress on, and it looks okay. But then I panic – what if I’m remembering the dream wrong? What if my dress isn’t really screwed up, what if it’s my veil? So I put on the veil, then I remember I’m serving salmon puffs. Salmon puffs! Okay, completely wrong, so I had to rush over here and try to find another first course, and then I walk in and these daffodils just. . .something snapped and that’s when you walked in here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Honey, you’re nervous. It’s natural.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, I wasn’t nervous until tonight.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Well, that’s okay.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I’m scared.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t wanna get divorced.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t wanna fight all the time and end up bitter.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t wanna be one of those women sitting around making jokes about husband number two. I want number one to last.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I want a guarantee.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Sookie, you’re gonna be fine.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I know. No, I don’t. Okay, I need to stop obsessing on this. Tell me something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Like what?

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I don’t know. Anything. Tell me something to make me stop thinking about this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I just slept with Christopher.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: That’ll work.

speaker: LORELAI
words: It just happened.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: When?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Tonight, in his room.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God! Was it. . .?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Wow, what does this mean?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I mean, is this a good thing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know. I think it is.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Oh my God, can you imagine if you and Christopher got together after all these years?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, hold on. We haven’t even talked about that ourselves yet.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ah, ooh God! Oh God.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know!

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Well, when are you gonna talk about it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Probably when I go back up there with the snacks I promised.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: He’s waiting for you?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, he is.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: Ooh, you’ve gotta get back up there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You have to get some sleep.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I wanna hear all the details tomorrow.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Mmkay, I’ll grab you in between the walking down the aisle and the getting married.
[Sookie starts to leave]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey Sookie.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re in your wedding dress.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: I am.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re beautiful.
[Lorelai walks over and hugs her]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Now you go get some sleep.

speaker: SOOKIE
words: And you go get some.
CUT TO UPSTAIRS
[Lorelai walks into Christopher’s room with a plate of food.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Room service.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I do like this hotel. Oh my God, that’s good. What is it?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I have no idea, but if Sookie asks, Michel ate it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So, should we avoid the subject for awhile or just dive right in?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Call me Greg Louganis.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Greg. What just happened here – amazing.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I’m not arguing.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, does that mean there’s a chance for a repeat amazing?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Do you mean right now or just in general?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Both. Let’s start with in general.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I don’t know, Chris. It’s weird, isn’t it? We just found this great balance, I’ve been seeing you more, we’ve been getting along so well.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And this thing with Sherry is so recent.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I know.

speaker: LORELAI
words: And then there’s Rory to think about. I mean, we can’t just go changing everything on her now. Not unless. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Not unless it’s gonna be a pretty permanent change.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And you’re so sure it can’t be?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, I’m not so sure.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: The timing seems right, Lor.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know it does.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Maybe all this stuff we went through – that’s the journey we needed to take to end up here.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Maybe.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Being a family – Mom, Dad, kid, Volvo.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ugh, the Volvo will have to go.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: It has a nice ring to it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, it does. I guess. . .

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: What?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I guess we’ll never know until we try.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So, we try?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, we try.
CUT TO LUKE’S DINER
[Kirk walks through the door]

speaker: KIRK
words: Luke, I've only got ten minutes. How quickly can you make me a ham on rye?

speaker: LUKE
words: I've never clocked it, Kirk.

speaker: KIRK
words: Well, you think it could be fast?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, Kirk. Of all the sandwiches, I do believe the ham on rye is one of the faster ones to assemble.

speaker: KIRK
words: What about a patty melt? Same time frame?

speaker: LUKE
words: Probably a little longer.

speaker: KIRK
words: Really?

speaker: LUKE
words: Yes, I have to grill a hamburger whereas with the other one I just put the ham on the bread.

speaker: KIRK
words: What if I wanted the bread on the ham on rye toasted? Are we talking somewhere in between the patty melt and the untoasted?

speaker: LUKE
words: Probably.

speaker: KIRK
words: Closer to the melt or closer to the - .

speaker: LUKE
words: Kirk!

speaker: KIRK
words: Peanut butter and jelly to go.

speaker: LUKE
words: Coming right up.

speaker: KIRK
words: What do you think of this suit?

speaker: LUKE
words: It's fine.

speaker: KIRK
words: I got it for Sookie's wedding. I read an article in the paper recently that said that weddings are an excellent place to meet women.

speaker: LUKE
words: Well, if it was in the paper, it must be true.

speaker: KIRK
words: I hope so, 'cause I'm so damn lonely not even Animal Planet does it for me anymore.

speaker: LUKE
words: Your sandwich is coming right up. Caesar, I’m going upstairs for a minute.
CUT TO LUKE’S APARTMENT
[Luke walks through the door and finds Jess inside]

speaker: LUKE
words: Hey.

speaker: JESS
words: Hey.

speaker: LUKE
words: How’d you get in here?

speaker: JESS
words: The door was open.

speaker: LUKE
words: No, I mean, I was in the diner. I would’ve seen you come up the stairs. . . you know what, forget it, I don’t wanna know. So, how’s everything back home?

speaker: JESS
words: Fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: Your mom?

speaker: JESS
words: Fine.

speaker: LUKE
words: You in trouble?

speaker: JESS
words: Nah.

speaker: LUKE
words: Then what the hell you doing here, Jess? You know, I, uh, I called you six times. Now I didn’t expect you to call me back so we could sit on the phone in bed and watch Sleepless in Seattle together. I just expected you to call me back, say you got home, say no one mugged me on the bus, say you were okay. Say. . .you know what, never mind. Just tell me what it is you want. I got work to do.

speaker: JESS
words: I wanna come back.

speaker: LUKE
words: You what?

speaker: JESS
words: I want to come back.

speaker: LUKE
words: Come back here?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Here to Stars Hollow?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: To live in this apartment with me?

speaker: JESS
words: I said yes a million times already.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know what, you’re the one asking for something so you don’t get to be James Dean this time, okay? Now, one more time, you wanna come back?

speaker: JESS
words: Yes.

speaker: LUKE
words: Why?

speaker: JESS
words: I just, I. . . I just wanna come back.

speaker: LUKE
words: You know what people told me when I said you were coming here to live with me? They told me I was crazy, they told me I was insane, they told me to start writing letters to Jodie Foster – but I ignored them. I was so sure that I knew what I was doing and then you showed up and you know what happened? You proved them right. I was crazy, and now after all that has happened, after all the chaos and havoc that you have wreaked, you’re seriously standing there wearing a T-shirt with a picture of a butt with hands that are flipping me off, telling me you wanna come back?

speaker: JESS
words: You didn’t pack up my stuff yet.

speaker: LUKE
words: Uh, no, I’ve been a little busy.

speaker: JESS
words: When were you planning on sending it back to me?

speaker: LUKE
words: What, hey, am I wearing a little brown uniform with UPS stamped on it?

speaker: JESS
words: So, what do you think?

speaker: LUKE
words: Things are gonna have to be different, Jess.

speaker: JESS
words: I know.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay.

speaker: JESS
words: Okay?

speaker: LUKE
words: So you’re staying?

speaker: JESS
words: I’m staying.

speaker: LUKE
words: Okay, then. Stay. I gotta get back to the diner.

speaker: JESS
words: I’ll help you close up later, all right?

speaker: LUKE
words: Sure. She’s not home.

speaker: JESS
words: Who?

speaker: LUKE
words: She’s at Sookie’s wedding with Dean, they’re still together. They seem to have gotten through the whole car incident. They’re doing really good, Dean and Rory.

speaker: JESS
words: Good.

speaker: LUKE
words: Just leave it alone, Jess. She’s got a boyfriend. Just let it go.

speaker: JESS
words: I don’t know what you’re talking about. I’m just going out for a walk.

speaker: LUKE
words: You heard what I said?

speaker: JESS
words: Yeah, I heard what you said.
CUT TO INDEPENDENCE INN
[Before the wedding, people are mingling in the yard.]

speaker: MICHEL
words: The linen closet’s the third door on the right.
[Rory watches Babette and Patty sing at the piano.]

speaker: DEAN
words: Hey you.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey. You look nice.

speaker: DEAN
words: Thank you. You look beautiful.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you.

speaker: DEAN
words: So, uh, how many cocktails caused that?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, they haven’t had any cocktails yet.

speaker: DEAN
words: Really?

speaker: RORY
words: Oh yeah. When they start having cocktails, we’re gonna have to hide you.

speaker: DEAN
words: I’m looking forward to that. [his cell phone rings] Huh, I’m not sure who’d be calling me now. Hello?

speaker: PARIS
words: Dean?

speaker: DEAN
words: Who is this?

speaker: PARIS
words: It’s Paris. I need to talk to Rory.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, sure, hold on. [hands phone to Rory] It’s Paris.

speaker: RORY
words: What? [on phone] Hello?

speaker: PARIS
words: We’ve got the band!

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: PARIS
words: We got the band! I knew we had most of the academic clubs tied up, but band – they were the wild card ‘cause believe me, if anybody’s going to be truly scared of me, it’s some artsy loser with a tuba wrapped around his neck.

speaker: RORY
words: Paris, how did you get this number?

speaker: PARIS
words: Oh, relax. I won’t call you on Prince William’s precious phone again. I just wanted you to know that we did it, we’re in, welcome to the show. [hangs up]

speaker: RORY
words: I think we won.

speaker: DEAN
words: Wow. Uh, that’s great.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah.

speaker: DEAN
words: So I guess this means you’ll be spending the summer in Washington.

speaker: RORY
words: Oh, nothing’s decided yet, believe me. Let me do a little research and then I’ll figure something out.

speaker: DEAN
words: Good.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Hey.

speaker: RORY
words: Hey.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know what’s really great about being a grown up? This. [holds up drink]

speaker: RORY
words: Well, thanks for the life lesson.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You’re welcome. Dean, you clean up really nicely.

speaker: DEAN
words: Uh, thank you.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You know, we’re gonna have to hide him from Patty and Babette once they hit the hooch.

speaker: RORY
words: Already told him.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Okay, well, I gotta check on some things. See you guys later.

speaker: RORY
words: Bye.
[Lorelai turns around and walked toward the porch. Christopher is walking toward her.]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop it.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Stop what?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Stop looking at me like that or everyone here will think we did it. [they kiss] There, that’ll throw ‘em off the track.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So this morning you woke up and felt sorry about last night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Embarrassed about last night?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Eager and willing to repeat last night?
[Lorelai sees her parents walking toward them]

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, Mom, Dad, hi.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Richard, Emily.

speaker: RICHARD
words: Well, hello Christopher. What a pleasant surprise.

speaker: LORELAI
words: You came.

speaker: EMILY
words: Of course we came, we were invited. Hello Christopher. I mean, why did you think we would not come?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I thought you thought the invitation was rude.

speaker: EMILY
words: It was rude. However, it would’ve been equally rude for us not to attend the wedding when we were perfectly capable of doing so, so we came. That’s called rising above it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I see. Do you wanna come back down here long enough to get a drink?

speaker: EMILY
words: Yes, that would be nice.

speaker: CHRSTOPHER
words: I’ll get it for you.

speaker: EMILY
words: Champagne, please.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Should I make that two?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Absolutely.

speaker: RICHARD
words: I believe I’ll join you, see what sort of scotch they’re serving here.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: When I get back, you’re gonna have to answer my last question.
[Christopher and Richard walk away]

speaker: EMILY
words: What on earth is Christopher doing here?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Um, well, he’s visiting his daughter.

speaker: EMILY
words: That’s very nice.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah. Actually, he’s been visiting his daughter quite a bit lately.

speaker: EMILY
words: Really?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes. In fact, Mom, you might be seeing a lot more of Christopher from now on.

speaker: EMILY
words: Because he’ll be visiting his daughter?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yes, he’ll be visiting his daughter.

speaker: EMILY
words: Well, I’ll be damned.
CUT TO WALKWAY
[Christopher and Rory are walking along a pathway]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So I’m guessing your mom talked to you?

speaker: RORY
words: She talks to me all the time, frequently when I’m begging her not to.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And she told you what we discussed?

speaker: RORY
words: She mentioned something about it, yes.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And what do you think about all this?

speaker: RORY
words: I don’t know. What exactly are your intentions?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Excuse me?

speaker: RORY
words: Your intentions – are they honorable?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Completely honorable.

speaker: RORY
words: Yeah? Because we have been waiting for this for a really long time and we take disappointment extremely hard. I mean it, property damage is often involved.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Well, I better follow through on this, huh?

speaker: RORY
words: I think that’s an excellent idea.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Come here, you. [they hug, his cell phone rings.] It’s probably work.

speaker: RORY
words: On a Sunday?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Hey lady, I’ve got a lot of responsibility now, okay?

speaker: RORY
words: Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Be right back.
[Christopher walks away. Rory sees Jess and walks over to him]

speaker: RORY
words: What are you doing here?

speaker: JESS
words: Hello to you, too.

speaker: RORY
words: Is everything okay?

speaker: JESS
words: You look nice.

speaker: RORY
words: Thank you. What are you doing here?

speaker: JESS
words: I moved back.

speaker: RORY
words: What?

speaker: JESS
words: I moved back.

speaker: RORY
words: But – what – why?

speaker: JESS
words: Just wanted to.
[Rory kisses him]

speaker: RORY
words: Oh my God! Oh my God!

speaker: JESS
words: Rory.

speaker: RORY
words: Don’t say a word!

speaker: JESS
words: Okay.

speaker: RORY
words: I have to go. [runs away] Oh, welcome home!
CUT TO BRIDGE
[Lorelai is standing on the bridge as Christopher walks up to her]

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lor!

speaker: LORELAI
words: Ah, hey there. We’re starting any minute. Have you seen Rory?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Uh, yeah, I just left her over there.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, good, okay, I’ll find her. Go get a good seat. The wind’s kicking up so this might be a really good show.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I have to go.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Huh, what, why?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I have to take care of something.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Chris!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m sorry, really. I’ll call you later to see how it went.

speaker: LORELAI
words: No, oh, whoa, whoa, whoa, wait a minute. What – tell me why you’re leaving? What – what’s going on?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sherry called. She’s back.

speaker: LORELAI
words: So you’re going home. Gonna tell her you’re moving out? No? Okay.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I can’t believe this. I mean, I really can’t believe this.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Uh, okay, I don’t know. Um, just, uh, drive safe.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Drive safe?

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah, drive safe. I mean, you know, you’re still Rory’s dad, right? So whatever happens or doesn’t happen between us, I still need you to drive safe.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Lorelai.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Just go, Chris!

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Sherry’s pregnant.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Oh my.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: She just found out and she called me as soon as she found out, and that was her calling to tell me that she found out.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Pregnant.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Yeah.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Wow. Well, uh, women all over the world will line up to see that tiny woman fat.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I don’t know what to do. I was so happy last night and now. . .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Yeah.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I missed it before with Rory. I wasn’t there, I wasn’t apart of it.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: And I never forgave myself.

speaker: LORELAI
words: I know.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: So, what, I’m just. . .I’m gonna do that again? I’m just gonna take off, disappear?

speaker: LORELAI
words: No. You’re gonna go home.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: This is absolutely unbelievable. I’ve waited years for this, Lor. You, Rory, the whole perfect picture and now - .

speaker: LORELAI
words: Listen, I have to walk down the aisle in a minute and be really happy for Sookie and right now I’m having a little trouble standing, so maybe it would be better if you would just go.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: I’m so sorry.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh, yeah. Me, too.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: You’ll tell Rory?

speaker: LORELAI
words: I will. Hey, congratulations.

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
words: Thanks.
CUT TO WEDDING
[The wedding ceremony is about to begin. Lorelai is waiting to walk down the aisle. Rory runs over and stands next to her, Lorelai gives her a bouquet.]

speaker: RORY
words: I think I’m going to Washington.

speaker: LORELAI
words: Oh. Okay.
THE END
